p-NMbaRmbHfj8e2soR1BIA.text: Wow just wow I wish they had this place where I live. Every time I come to Vegas I will come here even if I have to uber here I will do it. So worth it for the quality and tasty food. Even my parents loved it that we had to go two days in a row to confirm it was good.  Come in and was seated right away. Service is nice and friendly. They leave the pitcher of coffee on the table which is nice to. First time here the waiter offered us there famous banana nut muffin. We don't really eat muffins but we finished this in no time it was that good. I haven't had anything like it to be honest. Same goes for my parents they never eat that stuff but boy did they love it. I ordered scrambled eggs with mushrooms tomatoes and spinach. My dad ordered the Mexican omelette and my mom ordered scrambled eggs and potatoes. The potatoes are to die for. The best I've had. Must be the seasoning but damn it was that good. The eggs were good the toast was good so I need to say more. I couldn't finish it good portions. All around we left satisfied, full and not heavy. We were able to stay full for the rest of the day till night time. Overall highly recommended because I don't really rave about breakfast but this place was that good

Qup8tK70Ri7gjBKUKbpwfQ.text: Omg! Best breakfast I had since I moved to USA! I had the Santa Cruz skillet and my boyfriend the steak Benedict ! Simply deliciousssss. Our server Sy gave us an amazing service and she was very nice !

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_-gj5vg7WO3UbWR2CGEGjQ.text: If you love eggs this is one crazy place. So many options and so many flavors that you wont get enough of it. I had their benny's and mexican omelette and we(2guys) could not finish it(pretty nice serving size).  Our server OSCAR was amazing and very nice.

jlGQAttaaH8tIZur1SZwzQ.text: This my go to spot when I want a good breakfast when I'm in LV. Not too pricey and always hits the spot exactly (never too full after leaving). Wish more places used the markers on the table to call attention, it's much better than hunting down your wait staffer.

Jaw1yyHcZsWoEaszcXgiGQ.text: The Egg and I is a good place to get a good meal to start your day.  I had the Country Fried Steak and Eggs with the Habla Diablo Potatoes. Everything was excellent. The meat was cut with a fork tender and the Potatoes were really good with the seasoning that they use on them. They sell the seasoning at the counter if you would like to take some home. The only gripe that I have is that they don't get the butter to the edges on their toast. This is one of my pet peaves that really bothers me.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak and Eggs!

Xq2TQgRlecGp9tuf3RoTaA.text: Saw the reviews so we decided to check it out. We had a 25 minute wait on a Sunday morning - pretty reasonable. We loved the fact that we could be texted when our table was ready! We were also given a link showing our wait progress including how many were in front as well as after us. The place was packed but our table felt very roomy. Our waiter, Patrick was excellent! We were served great cup of coffee followed by an excellent breakfast! Well worth the wait!! We will definitely visit again on our next trip to Vegas.

0zPjASZA1DZ4Vu4_Sf7EOw.text: This is the type of breakfast i love. Delicious simple foods. I got the egg scramble and it was huge for the price. The taste was great as well. I did make one small mistake and i guess i should have ordered the banana bread but grabbed fruit instead.   Overall this hot everything i love about diners, great food, good price, and good dark coffee. Also our waiter was extremely friendly and helpful. Will visit again in the future.

gFgOoTIOol1fjL4LqRKiTw.text: The food is good really good they have wide variety in the menu. Staff is very nice and polite i love their banana muffin its very fresh. Will definitely recommend it.

5iplAHKQp0KXDdmyJXCLZw.text: Every trip to Vegas, it is a MUST for us to stop here and eat! This place is AMAZING, everything on the menu is worth trying....  Now, the service.... if I could offer Carol Anne 20 stars, I WOULD! She is super sweet, always with a smile. We are a large family....11 of us!!! Some waiters/waitresses don't like or fear a large crowd...but she took us all with the biggest smile ever!!!!  it's service like that, that makes this delicious experience....PERFECT!!!

LaCdKV1tIbhms8VnO1kzvQ.text: Food was great! Banana muffin, Mexican omelette, three pigs omelette were great! Home fries were good, but a bit salty. Karla, our server, was great!!

Ph_caPMu8O_k4xchYO9zqg.text: I love the egg and eye it's a fantastic place to just drop in anytime for a little bit of breakfast section they have a plenty of stuff to eat variety of choices and daily specials. They also have a selection of hot sauce is on the checkout at home when you can't make it in to the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1tNGw39aHL3L_Ul6aiynTQ.text: Was in Vegas last weekend and It was great to get off the strip and sight see. Stopped in for breakfast. I always love to see a place with turkey bacon or sausage on the menu so that was def a plus for me. Ordered the Sunrise Mountain which is funny because I love a butter croissant it came with home fries turkey bacon eggs n cheese and I should have shared with my boyfriend he ordered stuffed french toast & he didn't finish his food either.   Both dishes were great, service was great and fast which is always a plus.

1wE3rWuXmB5Vq-lzFia3gw.text: The Best Breakfast in Las Vegas, I love coming to eat at this place every time I come into town

uOh7x22bBoxdehTBLGdn6Q.text: There were four of us that went here for lunch/breakfast. The menu is printed as a newspaper which is cute and they have a LOT of options for food. If you haven't been here before it is worth a try but it isn't die hard must have breakfast/brunch/lunch cuisine. The menu, although extensive, had a lot of repeated ingredients that were just served differently. I'd like a smaller menu with a little more creativity.   Their biscuits and gravy are delicious though.  All around, it's a good casual place to eat with friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Skillet

HIhuYRHVcv28IUk5pJ9Idg.text: Egg and I, how I love your warm, moist banana muffins. I drool just thinking of the muffin split in half with butter melting into the tender crumb. Yum! I am also a big fan of your corned beef hash, tasty. I know you're a part of the Egg Works chain, I can't get myself to try the other locations. I'm hopelessly devoted to you.

KuV0jImrgqqYa78cFvoS5w.text: The Egg and I has been a staple breakfast restaurant in Las Vegas for almost 30 years, and for good reason. The breakfast is always consistent and good. Although I've never had lunch here I can tell you I have been having breakfast here for a very long time. My favorite thing to order for breakfast is Chorizo & Eggs. From time to time I also like to order the Patriot Belgian Waffle which is very good. I also like the Viva La France French Toast two pieces of brioche bread dipped in homemade batter and griddled golden brown. If you like omelettes I would recommend two, first the Egg-Ceptional Omelette (Sausage, Smoked Ham, Crisp Bacon, House-Roasted Onions, Tomatoes and Crimini Mushrooms with melted Jack and Cheddar) topped with sour cream and fresh herbs. Served with dressed greens and an English muffin. It's very good and possibly their most popular Omelette. My personal favorite is the Mexican Omelette (Chorizo, Chiles, House-Roasted Onions, Jack and Cheddar) topped with salsa or pork green chili, sour cream and fresh herbs. Served with seasoned ranch potatoes and a flour tortilla. It's delicious. If you happen to be a breakfast person this place is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4qK1itfJBxAoqvwCzQhOng.text: Love their banana nut muffin! Love their hot sauces! Be sure to buy some before going home. All of their dishes are great.

xr6BTuyB3Av4TtK6SaEuMQ.text: Awesome place! Came here in October w family. There is a little bit of a wait (20mins for a table), but completely worth it! About 15mins from the Las Vegas strip, this is the best breakfast spot we found during our vacay! Awesome food, BIG portions! Best banana-but muffin we have ever tried! Decent prices.  *Try this place out! You will not be disappointed!*

HpHC_Dpq-trbUumKdW-oJw.text: I love the food the people but only the one across from SS Office. I can't remember the place or street is on but they are awesome. Great food great people.They are franchised so I think that makes a difference.

XMOXyAZbK7tpAgkINzpGzA.text: The 3 stars is just based off of the food that I ordered at Egg & I. If I could rate just my sever or the customer service, he/they would get 5 stars!!!  I was in Vegas for the weekend and got referred to Egg & I by a local. After reading all of their yelp reviews I was excited to try them out! The staff here are really friendly and really quick to try and seat all of their customers. Our waiter was Patrick, and he was so friendly and attentive. I ordered the Eggs Benedict and my boyfriend had one of their scrambles. My boyfriend LOVED his food however, mine was not the best. The sauce was really "oily" which upset my stomach, and the rest of the food was extremely bland.  They do have their own branded hot sauces which are really great. I'm not too sure if I ordered one of items that is not so popular, or I just came in on an off day.

HzaTuKXoFW3S2Bhaw4TF3Q.text: The best breakfast spot. Pricy but worth every penny. Highly recommend it. The waitress gave us these amazing fresh made muffins which they sell complementary since it was our first time there. Amazing service amazing breakfast

sAsk3SC0f_mfydYZ29-wdQ.text: Best place in town for breakfast! Period! Lacey took good care of us today. She's not lazy at all!

nxEcSu61gaMgbbYPYsme1Q.text: I was so excited about trying this place out... I had went on Yelp read some reviews and look at all this pictures of others who been... So I was hungry and ready! I ordered the corn beef hash with home fries and egg whites.... The has was seasoned good but was not cooked well! I asked for extra extra crsipy and it was so far from that...the home fries were on point and the BANANA NUT MUFFIN gave me life!! The only reason I'm giving this three stars is because of that damn BANANA NUT MUFFIN!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dog food (corned beef hash) on a plare
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BANANA NUT muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BANANA NUT MUFFIN! SOOO GOOD

se8iB26g9lkQpm7wFn1Jgw.text: I was seriously surprised by how tasty this place was. It's not that they have anything that's unique but they make normal/ordinary stuff great.   I had a bite of the corn beef hash and it was very tasty. I ordered the country fried steak which was very good. I for some reason had some very bad luck when it comes to the white gravy with country fried steak but this gravy was awesome and the fried steak was great. I ordered the fruits(yes I know) but it kinda went better for me as I thought everything was very heavy so the fruits at the end of the meal helped me. Also, I really loved their salsa. It was super good that I actually considering buying a bottle but I don't think I would add salsa to any chinese food at all so I didn't get it.  Regardless, I think Egg & I is great. They make simple/homey food great and that's why it deserves a 4 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DGJRhufOUfzDnQpg1F7Hww.text: Love this place. My boyfriend lives for the country fried steak here. Service is quick and food is always consistently good. My go to is the veggie skillet- with avocado added.

LmKqhz9uVk2Hll9nquMBzg.text: Looking for a place to eat breakfast/lunch/dinner away from the strip this is the place! Reminds me of a black bear diner but even better if you've been. There own unique seasoning is delicious. Definitely recommend if in Vegas

FBNWadlDtnjkFIqlvbQjIA.text: Yay breakfast! Unfortunately everyone thought the same thing too. It was bumpin' in here but the waitresses were hauling ASS to get everyone in. Jaime and I waited about 10 minutes before being seated, but it was well worth the wait.   First off: check in offer is a banana nut muffin. When it came to the table it was warm and oh my god, so good.  It's gotta be made with some sort of whole wheat or bran flour cuz it's a dark looking muffin.  It's so moist (sorry, had to do it) and dense yet light, sweet but not too much, and just literally the perfect muffin.    I asked our waitress, Karla, for some coffee and I was treated to my own thermos of it, score! There's a little egg symbol on the table that once it's switched to the other color it signifies that the table needs attending to. Jaime wanted an ice tea refill and flipped the egg over. Within seconds another waitress (Karla was busy) was at our table to help.  What a great team!  I ordered the Veggie Eggs Benny and was so pleased with it! It's two poached eggs on top of a split english muffin, with grilled tomatoes, avocado, and spinach.  The best though was dipping those seasoned potatoes into the hollandaise sauce. They're fried and perfect to dip into a yolk too.   You won't leave here hungry, that's for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie eggs benny, yaaaassssss

nEB_iHUAtRh_DsrKBKoHJQ.text: First, I loved named " The Egg & I". Waiting 10mins to get a table but good to do it!  Big portions and good meals! Service lady "Karla" was a great and easy to asked her any menus. Thanks    We ordered Traditional Egg Bunny and plain waffle with ham.  You'll get a free Banana walnut muffin from Yelp and another free muffin on table for everyone  It was a good!   I'm so full and happy !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside sign
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting customers
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taking waiting list....

BH3HiLLx9q-lKwXyHOZsjA.text: Food: Cold. Must have been left in the window for too long. Didn't end up sending anything back because we waited about 30 minutes for the dishes to be served and were too hungry to bother.   Atmosphere: Dirty and chaotic. Clearly disorganized. Ketchup bottle was covered in icing (?) and the table felt sticky. Unsure if anything had been wiped down before we were seated. Observed a server tossing a drink out to the bushes as she was cleaning up. Left under the impression that the staff doesn't care much for the guest experience.   Service: Inconsistent. Our server was friendly, however the young girl who took our payment at the counter was pushy and clearly unhappy to be at work. I get that it was New Year's Eve, but it was at 2:30 in the afternoon -- no reason to be so miserable and inhospitable. Perhaps she could use some coaching around how important the final interaction is with the guest, as it should always be positive in order to leave a lasting impression on their experience.   I had a similar experience at their sister restaurant Eggworks. Needless to say, I will not be returning to either place.

Qbk8jE1un3ZJ306r87NY1Q.text: This place was packed when we walked in and rightfully so. For as busy as it was, the service was very good and the food was equally as delicious. I had their stuffed French toast and I was very satisfied and full afterwards. No complaints here. I would definitely return to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French toast. I asked what they&#39;re known for - they introduced me to this
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kBAVd7xqKsc-D7HY8ynflg.text: short wait time on a busy weekend.   This place is straight up an Hawaiian-mexican breakfast place.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco

n8LNOCOEwueyrX65plO_NQ.text: Tamara was our Sever today and she was awesome. Very friendly and authentic. Our food was very good and generous portions. Thanks Tamara for making us feel welcomed and for your patience. God bless you!!

ZQI--zkIC1prRMFvFVZoCw.text: Having breakfast in Las Vegas was not my thing for the 3 days.  This time I met a business contact at Egg & I.  Service was very good and place was packed for a Thursday at 8am.  I ordered the following:  Corned Beef Hash ($11): It came with two eggs, toast and potatoes.  The potatoes, eggs and toast was good but the Corned beef was mushy, wet and very salty.  Everything else was good.   I noticed that they have a Hawaiian menu so when I go back, I'm going to try the Loco Moco.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin. Free when you check in.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin.  Free when you check in.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash.   Salty and mushy

C78JRlF2l87HOQUSgim7EQ.text: portions are ginormous! i love brunch related this and the menu is huge. so many things i want to try so i know for sure i will be back to try more things! good food & good service, cant ask for anything better than that. i like that they have the sign that lets you know if you need something from your waitress or to just have them ignore you because you are fine [:

a4LBks_DJfZbWPRUgImZnQ.text: Best breakfast away from the strip.  Muffins are delicious  Free muffin if it's your first time  Expect for a long wait after 8am   Great for early birds

5mHz9EIPq_5sqa038LTk0Q.text: Nice place, food was not bad but not amazing. Interesting choices. Had Hawaiian french toast, waffles, pancakes, bacon avocado omelet (which was good), and a veggie skillet (also good). Ordered a carafe of "fresh squeezed" orange juice but it tasted like tropicana with pulp. That was disappointing. Otherwise good selection for breakfast.

rHNgwIfX6sAthAHo3VtCvw.text: Amazing Service!   I have been meaning to write this review for a few weeks. I brought my parents over here to have breakfast, and I have been here many times before. Egg & I has always had excellent service in the morning, until my last time there. The service was beyond exceptional, we had a server named Manuela, she made sure that we were well taken care of, always made sure that we were satisfied. My father and I who work in customer service for well over 40 combined years, were both extremely pleased with the level of customer service that was given to us. Not only was the customer service amazing, the food was great as well. They could have served us the worst possible food, and we probably still would have gone back there. My father always told me, you can't fix customer service with good food, but you can good food with excellent customer service. I highly recommend coming here. I ordered my usual eggs benedict, and it was just amazing, and a banana nut muffin, and the taste was so perfect, even Gordon Ramsay would have complimented the chef. We ended up walking out of Egg & I, tipping 75% just because we enjoyed the customer service and the food.

Rqqf6V2mtc9vUoiv2Je16A.text: This place is a breakfast gem.  Located a few minutes away from the strip.   They serve all American breakfast and a few Hawaiian breakfast in their menu.   We had their huevos rancheros (no meat), plain pancakes, corner beef hash with a side of rice.  They were all delish.  The cool thing about this place is that you get a moist banana nut muffin with Yelp Check in.   I will definitely go back for more breakfast goodness the next time I visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash with plain white  rice
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatless Huevos rancheros with flour tortillas

z6MBT4eIJKiRGVZ76e89ag.text: The food was very delicious, good price with great service. I'm from LA and this spot will be my go to breakfast from now on when I'm in Vegas..

JsCCYyeBfYzYMEqwLH8sAA.text: Go before 9 am on weekends or you'll be waiting. Had traditional Benedict hubby had chicken fried steak skillet. Both great. Diablo potatoes are signature. Plenty of food. Go hungry!!

6--w3W7y2zZgDbpUZqsKmQ.text: i am never in Vegas as I live in San Diego, but this place is definitely worth drive if you want some good breakfast food off of the strip. The service is amazing as is the food.

7CcACOJsKup-m64gKFVrmw.text: When the Hash House was packed on Saturday we decided to give this place a try and woo-wee it was worth it! No wait, breakfast until 3pm, and huge portions of delicious foods!!! The service was great and they have cute menus that look like newspapers. Their burritos are kick- ass waffles topped with fresh fruits are amazing and I highly recommend the corned beef hash. One of the best I've had. They also have fresh OJ and the best tasting homefries Ive ever had! I cant wait to go back to this  place next time Im in town.

1m1VjlRBI0r6aDjh7CGduQ.text: I've been back a few times since my last review and my opinion is the same. It's average food with a local spin on Denny's breakfast menu. Someone compared it to the Pork Store in SF and I'd have to say that's a pretty close comparison. They also mentioned Mama's in SF and I'd have to say The Egg and I is not as nice and not as tasty. One things for sure, I'd choose Hash House a Go Go in Vegas any day over this place.

kGW7MuCEx3VGAS3WszOSzA.text: I was impressed with both my breakfast, Kay's Special, and my husbands, huevos rancheros. Kay's special is an omlette with artichokes, spinach, parmesan cheese, cream cheese topped with fresh tomatoes and feta cheese. I was looking for something different and not what I would usually order, which is 2 eggs with toast and pancakes. I was pleasantly surprised! It was flavorful, and delicious. The feta cheese on top which I was concerned about was fantastic. I think that might have actually been the best part. I really really enjoyed it. My husband's dish was equally delicious. I was worried there would be too much salsa, but not at all. The side of potatoes were a touch salty. I would have preferred just a little less seasoning however, everything was really really good. They serve a muffin of the day before they serve your order. Todays' was banana nut muffin. It was good. I was happy that the wait was rather quick, especially for a Saturday morning. The menu has many offerings so really, no matter what you like for breakfast, I'm sure you can find it there. Our server was also very nice and quick.

4yjBfrcMdy12jK3lf-AymQ.text: Got in fairly quick. Order placed and meal delivered in a very speedy fashion. Omelette bigger than my head? Plus. Found this place accidently...pleasantly surprised. Will probably go back.

SAwy_Y5LOwc5UNC6QndpEg.text: Service is always awesome!! Generous portions and down home feel.  Bomb greasy hangover food thats cheap.  They are not skimpy with the CHEESE or the AVOCADO which I love... And i like their cheesy nicknames.  I always try to go when I'm in da big LV.  Be careful if you are staying on the strip and catching a cab there.  They will take some EXTRA long roads.  Its actually easy to take the bus there if you are riding the deuce its free to get on bus.

zO4EzybZe7aKLgtT_eWm7A.text: I came across this place when the bf wanted to find a "local place" for a recent Vegas trip, and I must say it is definitely worth the trip away from the strip!  From the outside, the place looks very unassuming. Not even busy. But right when we opened the door, crowds poured out, and we had to wait nearly 20 minutes for a table for two. The wall decor by the waiting place was cute. There were cartoons as well as sayings about eggs. Finally, we were led to our table by a super friendly and bubbly waitress.  The menu is printed like a newspaper - cool!! I've never seen that before!! (Yes I took a picture with it.) The selection is pretty extensive considering that every single item on the menu are made with eggs (like skillet items, omelettes, etc), so it took us a while to decide. I forget what we ended up getting - it was a while ago, pardon me - but I remember it being soooo good! They also customize your order so that you can have whole eggs vs egg substitutes vs egg whites, etc... Definitely get the fresh banana nut bread!! We almost got a loaf to take home back to LA even though we weren't leaving for LA yet.  The service was superb. Our waitress kept coming by to check up on us. When the busboy accidentally tossed our leftovers, the waitress felt so bad that she went back to the kitchen and got us some other foods to take with us. This was one place where I seriously went in not expecting much and left completely satisfied with the full intention of coming back next time I am in Vegas.

OuGWj2L6jGkELph8un-scA.text: The chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes are to die for!!! This has to hands down be one of my fave places to eat in Vegas. I also loooove to get chocolate chip blueberry pancakes...I make up this combo every time I go (when then pumpkin pancakes aren't on the menu!) Best Breakfast in town and great service.

qlp7MR9gvp2dluvFScTymw.text: Once again I am hard on Breakfast spots. This place was pretty good they are not trying to reinvent the wheel. Coffee was good, food was good, service was above average. I will go back again but Hash House A Go Go is still my favorite outside a casino.

324B0EvpZM9L1uvuRN4YVQ.text: The first time I was here I got coffee and the banana nut muffin.  They are an awesome combination.  I've gone back since. 'Nuff said.

XKpHmeJAahMGt3phZCQGZg.text: This is a great place for a late breakfast. Their egg dishes are incredibly good. Their pancake and waffles are on the list too. My favorite is the Kay's special with the banana nut muffin. If you have a sweet tooth, you should definitely go for the muffin instead of the toast. It's fresh and moist.  This place is not on the cheap side (you know it's LV) but the food quality and service sure deserve it.

K65Q19VwgEs0r74eZ7lRSg.text: this place is fun and with very tasty food and they offered Aloha Shouyu with rice, in Vegas.

QhTnuyoksPvJgYrTO4s5tA.text: I love the Egg and I and so does everyone else I know. It is simply the best locals oriented breakfast place in Las Vegas. Please don't let the name fool you this is not the chain "The Egg and I" it is independent and shows it. The quality is top notch. The portions are huge and the service is great. My personal favorite menu item is the Cincinnati chili. The have it as a omelet, a burrito ad as the traditional 3, 4, or 5 way. The best I have found outside of Cincy. As to the breakfasts the potatoes they include with almost every item are outstanding but if you ask for fruit they give you a huge plate of fruit that most places would call a fruit salad and charge 6-7 bucks for. This place is simply the best in Vegas

1etAz4OkXQQ1IKe4PxzomQ.text: 4.5 . Got seated immediately for a party of 3 at 12:30 on a Sunday. Awesome service, unlimited coffee, attentive waitress, yummy eggs, warm toast. Exactly what you need for breakfast! I'm a fan!!

s0OzMCEKQypn6U_OMmZ2zw.text: We wanted to get off the LV strip and eat at a local place for breakfast so after reading the reviews I chose the Egg & I. I was not disappointed as the food was fresh and the menu selection for breakfast was excellent. I ordered the veggie omelette and it was served with a huge portion of home fires. As others have commented the home fries are highly seasoned with seasoning salt so I enjoyed them. The veggie omelette had a generous amount of chopped veggies inside and they melt jack and cheddar cheese over the top. The meal is served with toast or their famous banana nut muffin and the muffin is light and packed with flavor. I was very hungry today but I left very full and satisfied. The prices are very reasonable and my breakfast inlcuding a drink came to a toal of $10.00. I will definitely be back on my next trip to LV.

H21svoWuKCRm6dZNyD6BhQ.text: Incredible eggs and potatoes. They store has recently changed bacon, to a thin cheap brand. I would avoid the bacon at all cost. I had batter bacon on a Jack in the Box burger the other day.  Overall, a good breakfast place

lB1LTi4VpmEVawF5MGTlog.text: Overall my expereince with Egg and I has been pretty good. They have a good selection of Omelets and their potato browns are enjoyable. I'm not completely blown away by this place, but if you can find an entertainment book, you can get a coupon for Egg and I at a buy one get one free rate.

Sz62nZisDTHjb8J-LrvrHA.text: This place had a good breakfast reasonably priced.  Thermos of coffee on the table, good service, nothing fancy just a good breakfast.

eHfAuO0vtXTrbRzAyHwVaw.text: I love Leaving Las Vegas.. with Stuffed French Toast in the stomach!

BljZvY8uPSI9ejup8V_7-w.text: Quaint and homey looking restaurant.  I kind of felt like I was getting a weird look at time, but it was probably in my head.  The food was delicious though as well as great portions.  The price was also affordable.  The breakfast burrito was quite tasty along with the turkey salad my girlfriend had.  The bran muffin was nice and hot.  The service was good.  I felt kind of pushed to get out though since they were closing soon.  However, it was still a nice and clean place with friendly service and good food.  Not much to complain about here.

Y6oJ5S7JXSzOyDzXv8ieKg.text: I came here yeaaarrrrs ago with a group of girlfriends and made sure to come back after we were leaving Vegas. The food is amazing! The potatoes are to die for. I got the onion and bacon skillet YUM. My husband got the stuffed French toast, which was ridiculous. Coffee was great, as was service. Always friendly and quick. Just try to get there early as the line does get long if you're there around 10 or 11ish.

wEajt1ZzHMrL49b9HhRfZw.text: Second time here, and the food is worth the wait! Service is amazing, food is delicious, and the varieties are endless. Wish I had the time and stomach to eat everything on the menu. SoCal need a location.(hint hint)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kr7ryij1uazXozhV6bkuZQ.text: Great breakfast and extremely friendly staff. I would definitely recommend this place.   P.S There french toast is awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NaTUZlnPcefV8tbJ-h3XsA.text: Great food & excellent service. Laney was awesome! This was our first visit & we will be back.

Qwn87QPBX5hW9SlesS3idw.text: Quick service, friendly staff and good food. Large portions so you'll be sure to leave here stuffed. I would recommend the Spinach Benny and the Biscuits and Gravy. The potatoes were the only underwhelming portion of the meal. Sitting outside was refreshing however birds do fly into the area so be cautious about dropping food. Overall a good experience and would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7w2No8z10_AOrbG_KgYG5A.text: This place was great for breakfast/brunch. Similar to a place like Black Bear Diner except excellent customer service and little bit better food. But the feel of the restaurant was very similar. Our server was very attentive. We ordered the Sundance Omlette and the Traditional Benny and added avocado.   I thought everything was fine, the only reason I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 is because there is nothing special about it. Just another breakfast place. However, I do love that it is family-owned and has multiple locations around the city. I don't regret stopping by. Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xJtQLN5N3b6lP3ATbn9nAQ.text: Always delicious you can nitpick but it's been there for so many years for a reason ,,enjoy and happy breakfast to you

3f1s7Ngv1eh07kS3Jl0qkw.text: I can tell this is a local favorite!  You have all the makings of a good diner; big menu, happy ambiance, good service and fair prices with BIG portions!  I highly recommend: -bacon and avocado omelette -the works omlette -chicken enchilada omelette -banana nut muffins.  If they ask you whether you want fruit, potatoes or fries GO WITH THE POTATOES! They are soo well seasoned, crispy and delicious! :) Price point: $ Ambiance and service: Clean interior and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LFRWKHVzBRxw6JlnKDnubg.text: Simply amazing! If you want a off the strip diner like restaurant experience with some good food and pleasant service at cheap prices come here!

McWGMqSIcDaBL4NEOjBOJg.text: Great friendly staff and our party of 8 was actually seated within 5-10 minutes.    Banana nut muffins. Get one free if you check in! They are amazing!!! Soft, not too sweet, super moist.   Chicken fried steak skillet. Crisp breading. Gravy flavorful.   Corned beef hash. Comes out on a skillet and was really good. Large pieces of shredded beef was in every bite. Very tasty.   Habla Diablo sauce was really good. I put that stuff on everything and it kicked it up a notch.  Everything was good. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffins. Soft, moist, and not too sweet.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash comes on a skillet! Wonderful!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak skillet. So good!

TLWQgII8VxLytJ0NXxuedw.text: I premise this review that I'm not a big fan of American breakfast. For me, I can't differentiate the best of the best for this staple American cuisine. In any event, came to this popular locals' spot in LV. I tried the strawberry filled French toast with bacon and scrambled eggs. I also tried a free banana nut muffin (it's free with Yelp check-in). The French toast was overbearingly sweet. The French toast on it's own without the strawberry madness was moist and fluffy; however, the strawberry filling along with the strawberry topping and the whip cream really overdid it. It was hard for me to finish.  The eggs and bacon were standard fare. Nothing to note. I tried some of my buddy's chicken fried steak. Again, decent seasoning, but tasted a bit too heavy for my liking.   What stood out for me was the banana nut muffin. It was moist and the muffin top was crispy. Even better that it was free. I liked how it didn't have too many walnuts in it. Nice balance between breading and nuts.  Service was fast and courteous. I would say if you're looking for a popular American breakfast spot, check out Egg & I.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry filled French toast

QAnXMzlGbXjUH8B2Ih3Jbg.text: The breakfast potatoes were so good, I bought the seasoning they sell at the font counter register.  The food here is generally good, and if you do a Yelp Check In, you can get a FREE muffin (I had banana nut).

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AkUF4P4o8voP4kzf-75Mbw.text: Best part of this place was the service. Service was great, food was nothing to write home about. The menu is huge and had lots of options. I had Eggs Benedict with avocado. Great family friendly location, parking isn't great but you can sit in your car and they will text you when your table is ready with is a nice feature. The banana  muffin is worth a try. Overall, if you have the time stop by and enjoy the atmosphere.

6cRhNTmk1lKHJIkH2TpxUQ.text: Not a bad little breakfast place away from the strip. The banana nut muffins are warm and melt in your mouth. The omelets are huge and the biscuits are flaky and soft. Good place to get away from the craziness of the casinos.

3BJXrTwPr7yRewOapXETIQ.text: What can I say? Just wow.  First of all: Karen our waitress? My favorite waitress of ALL time. I didn't know what I wanted but then she suggested the strawberry cream cheese French toast and that was exactly what I wanted. My friend had bangin cinnamon raisin French toast. Also Karen hooked us up with the Yelp offer of a free banana nut muffin which was AMAZE.  Only con was they only had the type dye shirts in youth sizes- damn. Have to take that business to their website. Plus, prices are reasonable for Vegas.

byXIJVK2fUZK0bxxGwEpnA.text: I picked this place because of the amazing reviews and I was not disappointed. We came on a Saturday morning around 11 and waited 30 minutes for a table. I had the Bloody Mary made with their signature mix which was fantastic! I ordered the chili relleno omelette which was one of the best omelettes I've ever had. I added  jalapenos to make it spicy and it was perfectly complimented by the salsa verde. My partner had the waffle topped with blueberries and whipped cream with eggs and turkey bacon. The waffle was perfectly cooked and lightly crispy. Overall the food was amazing. The service was great as well. We were running late for an event and our server Karla made sure everything came out quickly and brought our check immediately. I loved that she brought our banana nut muffins before our meal arrived since we were starving. Those muffins were SOOOOO good! I highly recommend this restaurant. It's a must do while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili rellenos omelette with extra cheese
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut Muffin. Delicious!

8xtgeer0jnjyE6eg2n5lYw.text: Always so delicious! the eggs Benedict is my favorite thing on the menu and when ever I'm in town I make it a point to come here. yummmmmmmmmm

EE7OCLXod8sEOLzKN9Xi4g.text: Would have been a perfect but the air was blowing right on us, we turned the fan off, so it worked. Between the three of us we have two with food issues, and one cranky woman. Liza checked the kitchen for Soy free foods, and read the ingredients to double check. Really great service. Never an empty cup of coffee, food hot, all cooked great.  The Prime Rib Benny was a tad salty but I expected that from the Prime Rib. It's delicious. The Original Benny was great, too. My daughters Fruit Plate with yogurt was fresh and a much different variety than the usual fare at other places.   I think we'll add this to empty breakfast place slot that was opened Baby Stacks told us to freeze so the servers would be comfortable later in the day.  :/  Parking lot large enough, bathrooms clean, and tables stocked and condiments full. :D

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love communicating with Egg Signs.

kLQ6nVaUD1LA15lm3rrwbg.text: On our last trip to Vegas, my husband and I ventured off strip in search of breakfast. Thanks to the many Yelp reviews I read, we decided on Egg & I. Thank you, Yelp community- you did not disappoint! The line for a table was long, but moved quickly. The service was fantastic for the sheer velocity of people packed inside eating and the food was OUT. STANDING.  Nothing we ordered was bad. We will definitely be back on our next trip!

Cirsl04qhsL-XtItOh64tg.text: Fabulous service!!! Kelli was super friendly and accommodating to our many questions and substitutions. There was a huge group of people waiting to be seated, BUT don't let that intimidate you. We waited MAYBE 15 min and our food came out fast and super good. Definitely a go to when I vacation here!!

V4Dtogq2krUspeZMNr6zeA.text: Off the strip breakfast diner. We waited forever!!! for a group of 10..so I guess I should give them some grace...but still...  Some of the food was good, some of it was OK. I had a french toast something that was drenched in sauce and I was not happy b/c it was too sweet. I've had better breakfast at other places. They did get listed for top burger tho interesting enough. I would not go back for the mere wait, drive, and quality of food. Servers were nice tho. :)

b8sjPB-kiw_TpQ10QVeCBA.text: Great breakfast food and excellent service.  I had the Veggi Bennie with hollandaise on the side . It was delicious. Wasn't planning on eating the potatoes but couldn't help myself.

rOdBH2BL0DT8wge2BLWFlg.text: Great food, great service.   Found this place while visiting Vegas.  Great American and Mexican breakfast specials.  Great options, great service, great price - get off the strip.

Ny8ZS1CNWpuBSIBJ1hJEwA.text: Best breakfast place in Vegas, hands down!! The food was outstanding and service was extraordinary. Our server (brody I believe) was amazing. He went out of his way to make our  experience one of a kind. Definitely would go back just cause the service!

Uos2UixcBBltCu191D-qjA.text: We searched to a good breakfast place here in LV. So glad we went, the Eggs Benny was delicious and their potatoes were amazing! Our waitress, Chance was wonderful! She was courteous and efficient. We will definitely come back for another yummy meal to start our day in Vegas!

SLIfZ9U4EdU4ZpQMgy0UQg.text: A great breakfast house is consistent no matter what.  I only went here once, but it was disappointing. The food was on par to IHOP.  I can't tell you how many people get a omelette wrong. Either the ingredients don't gel right and is tasteless, or the egg is undercooked, etc.  The omelette I got here was tasteless. The potato o' brien was overcooked in too much oil to the point it was deflated and tasted more like leftovers.  Not a fan.

z3OGT2LuBfUwYT84ED5KOw.text: If your looking for a great Breakfast spot in the LV area, look no further.  This place was great.  I ordered 2 eggs over-easy, with Potatoes and bacon.  My wife got an omlet.  We also ordered a biscuits and gravy.  Everything was AMAZING!!!!!!  It can get kind of crowded in the AM on the weekends but its worth it.

Y4PukWQBsco7Zj9ljtDTDw.text: The banana nut muffin was A+. Brady took care of us and made sure we had an exceptional experience.

heAUzeeh7N0qLiVhhxmyYQ.text: We came here based on the great Yelp reviews, and this place did not disappoint! If you're looking for a big filling breakfast, this is the place. The staff was friendly and our server was attentive and a total sweetheart. The food is awesome! I ordered the egg-ceptional omelet which was huge and stuffed full of toppings and had the ranch potatoes as my side. It wasnt greasy or oily which was such a bonus, since you never know with a new breakfast place. The portions are big so I'd recomend coming hungry or sharing.

70W83O3EtLrE4mgu-RLj9w.text: I was looking for breakfast off the strip and picked this place based on yelp reviews, but I cant agree with the consensus at all. I feel this place is way overrated. The food was smothered in cheese, the potatoes were from frozen and  we were handed the check when we werent even half done with our breakfast. We felt rushed and left feeling heavy (food) with indigestion (food and being rushed out). Will not be returning.

17T8TDtuE6UjxrfYBpCjBg.text: Kept hearing about this place so my wife and I came in for omelettes. They have so much more! Everything was great especially Liza our server. Friendly and attentive, never had an empty glass. New breakfast spot when visiting Vegas.

UpxcoiN3Z7uWmltiO3Ytiw.text: Darn, a Yelp disappointment for me.  Karen, my server, was nice.  The food was just okay, though.  My waffle came out barely warm, I requested extra crispy bacon but they still had chewy fat on 'em, scrambled eggs were ok.  3 stars versus 2 because the coffee was good.

w7A3TqRGxAStojT7zS0JSA.text: Hands down, they are my favorite breakfast establishment.  I have been here three times and loved all the dishes I have ordered (eggs benedict florentines, taco rancheros, & omelette). Too bad, there is no Egg & I around where I live!

EqWi15AaYKLl2lM-Kb1GVQ.text: Awesome experience here. Chocolate chip pancakes were great, homemade muffin fantastic and amazing service. Waitress offered to grab us to-go drinks and food was out within 10 minutes of ordering (even with the restaurant full). Great dinner feel and exceptional service. Highly recommend.

Pln-QgXPohJ78nsKlBMA5Q.text: Nummy Nummy i like some eggies in my tummy.  Great food and definite stop off anytime you are in Vegas.  Place gets packed with locals, but when you walk in you become a local.  Honestly.  We were sitting there and some people walked up and asked what they should get.  I said eggs.  Try the crepes, they are stuffed with eggs and whole bunch of other stuff if you like.  I think they should rename the place hangover hamlet though :)

Uau6bn22ds3i05twOYPZaQ.text: Our server Raul was great! He was courteous..kept the refills coming without asking and was very friendly with my son.  Great service and great food is a winning combo!

Dl-zMtQ82HwitCEX8asTvw.text: Very good place for breakfast.  Had the taco skillet and it was decent.  The pancakes and banana muffin looked amazing.  Our waitress Samantha was great.

ecnS5OEg-8FPyvIVchCPFw.text: Brady was great! Very courteous and prompt with service. I can't wait to come back tomorrow!

cKQB55Xsos3rMLZhquy-rg.text: I love it lots of food, great service and a pot of coffee!

-IrQcpgPBDhiRWTwuaGI5g.text: TASTY!!  We went here twice for brunch during our 3-day vacation.  On the first day I got the ultimate skillet (no cheese) with Portuguese sausage instead of regular sausage (reminded me of Hawaii).  It had bacon, sausage, peppers, ranch potatoes and other deliciousness topped with 2 eggs over easy.   Super great! Also, the server gave me an ice tea to take with me.  The service was pretty good - it was packed but it seems the staff actually pays attention to the system of "frowny egg"/ "happy egg" because when we put the frowny egg on for more coffee, people came immediately.   The second day I got the prime rib benedict but with guacamole instead of hollandaise sauce.  That was awesome!  They were actually too generous with the guac and I had to leave some behind on my skillet.  Service was again pretty good, but we got the same waiter who remembered us.  Everyone else at the table was also very pleased with their meals.  Can't wait to return on future Vegas trips.

4cGPwYgD6BmV_U8eJE_n9Q.text: A favorite stop whenever we are in town! Extremely attentive staff, Paula and Penny always make you feel at home! Great options to swap out your carbs for a full serving of Of meat or protein.

Dyz400gzUBCZjqiXhXVhMw.text: Awesome service just after a power outage! Food was fresh and tasty! I got the stuffed French toast my husband got the Mexican omelette and chocolate chip pancakes for the kids! Everyone left fat and happy! Service was fast friendly and super accommodating!

3MI0bBEOOcC2WZ0M4XVIHw.text: Great food. Great service. Dog friendly patio. Huge portions.  Will Be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened prime rib Benny.

GP20YiUkSL6_KQarlQ8mBQ.text: Arrived shortly after 1100am and the place was packed. It was a 20 min wait to get seated which is texted to you. Very popular place with locals. Great place to gave breakfast as the food is very good and the portions are large. I've been here many times always having a breakfast item. On this visit I tried the 5 way chili. It was served with Cincy chili which has cinnamon in it. I didn't really enjoy it as it gave the chili an odd taste. The chili was rather bland with no spiciness at all. I doubt I would ever order this dish again. Otherwise almost all their breakfast dishes are excellent and I highly recommend it.

8GliR6ZBVNxtKCObHTjeuQ.text: Amazing breakfast/brunch spot! they have great drinks as well and a huge menu.

K1UkVRzjAQ98TAWXv5Cfww.text: I really enjoyed this place. We went here before heading home from Vegas and it was aproximately a 30 minute wait on a Monday morning at 10am. The banana muffin was delightful and they gave us an extra one when we checked in. I ordered a sausage omelet that turned out pretty good but my friends skillet turned out very salty. They offered to switch it out, but we were almost all finished with our meal so we asked if they could take it off the bill. There was some sort of miscommunication so when we got the bill, the skillet was still on there. In the end, after some time, they were able to take it off the bill and we left. Other than the little miscommunication, service is great and they were very nice.

WQuKqilDR6RAqM07WUCmHw.text: Soooo good with EXCELLENT SERVICE!!  I ordered the crazy chicken omelet. It was cooked to perfection.  They did NOT skimp on the cheese, at all.   It came with seasoned homefries that were the best I'd ever had. Super crispy on the outside, nice and fluffy on the inside. The seasoning on these fries was perfection.   The banana nut muffin that came with the meal was PHENOMENAL!! Served warm with butter. You could literally taste the spices inside the muffin.  You could tell it was homemade.   If I lived in Vegas, I'd be a regular.

vOjI2v1PtG9Tw-xB17hAvg.text: This place was packed when I went.. The food was great, I enjoyed the el Diablo potatoes, it had a nice crisp and was well seasoned. I ordered steak Benedict. Very flavorful and had some spice to it. Service was great as well..

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Benedict with el Diablo potatoes

W7Z59xiUf1qpExHnlTsutg.text: I had an egg white omelette cooked with their oil spray. The omelette had good flavor but it very watery and mushy. The potatoes were crispy on the outside and light on the inside. The banana bread is really good. Sticky, soft, and perfect amount of sweetness. All in all a solid breakfast place of choice. I might return if I lived in Vegas.

-9Jass8tEnRv3flrXCv2bQ.text: Got here at about 11:30am on a Sunday. There was a lot of people waiting but the wait was probably less than 10 mins. Love the fact that they use an app system and you get a text of your wait time and your table is ready.  Service was GREAT!!   This time around my food was a bit on the salty side but still great!  As always, The banana nut muffin is a must have. OJ had a bit too much pulp as my straw had a tough time sucking it up. Plus it was not cold. Also I wish they served a single stack pancake that was not $5 but then again it was in the shape of a micky mouse and I'm pretty sure it was off the children's menu  Quick tip! Save $5 when you buy 2 entrees if you go get the VEGAS coupon book at miracle mile. I'm not sure if it's at the  other shops but it's free and will save you some $$$

90TfpK1heyUf1Alkr1Snsg.text: We were just passing through on a road trip. My hotel recommended Egg & I and we are so glad they did! The whole staff was incredibly friendly and upbeat. Really seemed to enjoy what they do. Our server was awesome, I wish I could remember his name! I brought a collapsible bowl for my dog Mojo and our server brought me a big cup of water to give him. They have a big patio and are certainly dog friendly! Great customer service. If I'm ever in Vegas, with or without my dog, I will definitely go back! Wonderful experience, glad they were recommended to me!! :) go there!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My pup Mojo!

7fy7EjYadkiwcZumVzwWIA.text: The food was good. A bit pricey but you in Vegas . The computer system was down for a bit .

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z5vE4-HqyP3iXoAy33VAKw.text: My family and I were really looking forward to have breakfast together a party of 10 they told me wait is about 45min which is understandable those 45 min passed plus another hour we have been here since 10am and it's now 11:45am and we still haven't gotten sit I'm currently at the restaurant and the host comes up to us if we want to sit SEPARATE?!!! Like are you serious and they keep sitting people like we're so disappointed!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lxHtFQlTbDCr76mE1CgBsA.text: The breakfast here is so good! We came here on a Sunday morning at peak brunch hours and were surprised to be seated in less than 30 minutes. The house potatoes are perfectly seasoned and they have an extensive menu with lots of choices for any breakfast craving. The staff is helpful and attentive. I will be definitely be coming back next time I am in Vegas!

ul9XkwJ9mdz1TMAEw_Rcjw.text: Yelp helped me find this little gem off the beaten path in Vegas.   Glad it did.  Best biscuits and gravy I have ever had.....and I have had a lot of that.  Their potatoes are to die for....and I'm not a big breakfast potato fan.    Wait was a bit long bit it was worth it.  Service was attentive and on point.  If you are leaving Las Vegas to head home....you MUST stop here.

Wa7RidRZTpwTgW9ze7ZVhA.text: Had to wait for about an hour or so. Once seated I saw why. Great service and good food. Staff are very friendly

cxo7iVPV9zhJxGlP-1aBlQ.text: Good food, but what really made this experience great was the service. I recommend grabbing a skillet or the bacon avocado omelette. Strawberries and cream french toast was good too! The winner, however, was the free banana nut muffin you get when you check in.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon avocado omelette

j7Shwh70aXLUhxoKQ38N6A.text: Great service and food. Their biscuits and banana nut muffins are the best!! Hearty portions, so go hungry!!

CPuGAWlNACfeIe0-Q5p-bg.text: Awesome food - super fast service - highly recommend if you have been on a liquid diet in Vegas for a few days

mPEJebW36-wU4KWHaTG0uA.text: I really like this place. There are a few of them in Vegas. I like to venture off the strip and find little local hidden gems. So I typed in a breakfast in my Yelp app and this place came up it was in a little strip mall. It was very homey inside the waitresses we're very friendly and service was great. The home fried potatoes or just write with the right amount of seasoning. I had the corned beef scramble. It was very good. There's plenty of seating and it felt very homey and the waitresses again we're very friendly. Service was just right food was good and the muffins were great

ZBabMJkrThk972m_oJGR1A.text: The breakfast was great! The place was busy on a Monday morning, so we figured that was a good sign right off the bat. We we seated right away and received service quickly.   Manuela was our server and she was fantastic! She had our drinks topped off the entire time and checked on us frequently.   The food was delicious! We found a new breakfast spot while we are in town!

73YgZHxH1e0s364hc8GwKQ.text: Holy moly! Their banana nut muffins are tooooo dieeeee for! So good. They warm it up and it just hugs your heart.  I got the breakfast tostada with both sauces. Delicious flavor!! It's pretty big, I could only eat about half of it.   My mom got the breakfast burrito (original) and it was a perfect size! She really enjoyed it. My dad got the loco moco (I think) with the brown gravy, he loveeed it. My husband got the chili relleno omelette. It looked amazing! He ate it all before I got a bite of it :P   We really enjoyed coming to this place! The wait wasn't bad. About 15-20 min for a party of 4 at like 10:30 am on a Sunday! Everyone working was very friendly and super helpful! We would definitely come back again!

kxhp5CAoBAKP61PrNG4btg.text: Tried it for the second time with the family. Everyone loved their plate. I loved their house potatoes with light seasoning. Our server Kelli was awesome. Attentive and friendly. Adding this place to our list of fav places in vegas.

Qj1YDoGzqPkFQT0pA32E-w.text: This place is amazing!!!  The free muffins are to die for!  Kinda fill you up tho --- but the eggs benny is the real star -- so good!  And the service is wonderful!!  A must do in Vegas!!

kLkv_8llzTSSq5CR_Koukg.text: My friend and I didn't want to eat brunch on the strip so we decided to Yelp it and boy we were not disappointed! Service was exceptional. We were seated immediately and the servers were nice and friendly.

MjriS4BfOCj3Y8mcQfB8Bw.text: This is a great breakfast spot! We decided to give this place a try because it was close to the resort that we were staying at. We were not disappointed.  They have indoor and outdoor seating (the patio is dog friendly). We opted to sit outdoors because it was early enough in the day that it wasn't scorching hot outside. They had mist machines and fans outside to help combat the heat as well.  Our server Kelly was incredibly nice and friendly. I was having difficulty deciding between the Veggie Eggs Benedict (Works Veggie Benny) and the Fiesta Skillet. She recommended the skillet. It was so flavorful! The potatoes were cooked perfectly and the salsa tied everything together. The portions are HUGE. I was only able to eat like a third of my skillet so keep that in mind when you go. My husband loved his burrito as well. He could barely finish the second half.   The prices were reasonable and I would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cabo Breakfast Burrito
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fiesta Skillet with Eggs Over Easy

UNLaFDZMkWhiWGhJRF-a9A.text: Too loud the waiter heard my order wrong and I ended up paying and taking home something I didn't want because I didn't want to say something and have it be thrown away. I also showed him the free banana muffin coupon from the yelp app and he didn't take that off either. Muffin was good. Cool place Witt s train going around the whole ceiling. Just wish I got the correct food. I'm not one to make them take it back.

g5SpQiiP1HhHIkva2BUgNA.text: Good morning from the egg and I! As a first timer the wait time made me nervous... I don't like to wait. But I was seated sooner than expected so that's a win. The place is packed and everyone looks happy.  My server Kelli is amazing! At first I was nervous because I could tell she got three tables that the same time but she wasn't worried she was confident. She brought me a whole canteen of coffee and that made my morning because the patio felt a little chilly. I warmed up just in time for food and I devoured it with a huge smile. I am so happy right now I love this place and I love Kelli! Thank you so much! You guys hit it out of the park!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cofffeeee!!!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie skillet !

RmnihyJve9M5Lbn-caCMSg.text: I'm struggling to figure out why this restaurant has so many good reviews.  Top of the list and the reason for the stars is the service was good. No complaints whatsoever on the staff.  The food on the other hand....  - hash browns were frozen fried patties - bagel was basic store bought - corned beef hash was riddled with peppers that overpowered any other flavors.  - sausage patties were comparable to McDonalds which is good if you like them, but just doesn't stand out in any memorable or good way.  - waffle was pretty good - the poached eggs were good - the banana nut muffin was probably the best thing I had. Tasted just like fresh banana bread.  Overall I have no interest in coming back for any of the food we tried.

AOXQiwX9uAlAAhmI1g569g.text: Really good food. Big portions.  I got Grandma's Biscuits and Gravy. Coffee was good as whelk.

aKuiRUfS8nnkzrb60AqWHA.text: Amazing breakfast! An egg lovers paradise  We had the steak, stuffed french toast and a breakfast burrito. We enjoyed all of this a lot. Our waitress was friendly and the whole restaurant has an old American diner flair. 10 out of 10 would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n5gPBVS7oUf4mjJnb-apEw.text: A friend recommended this brunch spot to me. So my boyfriend and I came here for brunch when we got to Vegas. We arrived 1PM on Thursday and were seated right away. The restaurant seemed really busy because it took a while for a server to take our orders.   I ordered the bacon & sliced avocado omelette with a banana bread muffin and my boyfriend ordered the works omelette with a banana bread muffin. The banana bread muffin was still fresh and moist. It was so delicious. I highly recommend choosing the banana bread muffin over toast. We ordered seasoned potatoes with our omelettes. The portion sizes are really generous for the prices you pay ($10-12). In SF, you would have to pay at least $17 for the same portion size!  We really enjoyed our meals. We were so full after finishing everything. Our server was super friendly and made sure to check up on us to see how we were doing. The service was eggcellent. (Get it? Haha.) This is a really good and affordable brunch spot if you're not trying to break your wallet. There's also ample parking too! One suggestion would be to wear a long sleeve because the A/C was really high when we went last week.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and avocado omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana bread muffin

vOy-aVjFqMNtTLTxypN7eA.text: Solid food, prompt service and the ability to get on the wait list online. What more could you want?

S1_bfrtDMZfgiZyjnJWnCA.text: Breakfast heaven. We found this place on Yelp and oh my God I'm glad we did! We were greeted with a banana nut muffin that was unbelievable and amazingly fresh and warm. We ordered 5 different type of breakfast options and were so pleased and happy full by the time we left. We will make sure to bookmark this place to visit often and tell our loved ones about it so they can experience amazing service and food. Why can't we have more places like this in Orange County.

LXjrD1ER9r4rz5v2uvlndA.text: Best place for breakfast in Las Vegas Great service Stephanie is great, very attentive

tLOBnNgWAawdd8BMKgutkw.text: Great breakfast/brunch spot! They have a dog friendly patio which is a huge plus for our traveling baby  They have a huge variety of food to choose from from Vegetarian options to Carnitas. They also have some favorites from the islands like a Loco Moco and Hawaiian Sweetbread French toast. The staff is friendly and fast and they have a good group work ethic. Our food was sweet, savory and hearty. The portions are large and filling. I also like that you can "call ahead" online with Waitlist. We would definitely come here again!!

LAT-AhbC7hkSBdJUyHZwmg.text: Great place for  breakfast with lots of choices  Gets crowded so get there early. Parking is a challenge

1Vt3dr8yUXZByzg5T1_yPg.text: I wanna give 10 stars. This is plus more 5 star review. All Waitress and Waiter super kind, lovely. I'm from LA though I brang the left over food to LA lol.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yayyy hanging out with My Lov

915i_VECpj2dFDpDWPsCfA.text: Egg Works and this place have been our favorite breakfast places since we moved to LV. Last week for the first time - ever - we felt completely regretful of being so loyal. The food is always amazing, the service is typically exceptional except now. My guest and I sat for nearly 40 minutes, no one knew where our order was, no one asked to refill the original coffee cup, but what was worse, is when we brought it up - nicely- once, twice, thrice -  and eventually said we'd take it to go since we had a limited time- they absolutely ignored us. 5 minutes later we approached the cashier to pay for the single coffee cup and muffin we ever got --- and to our dismay the cashier was ready to charge us for sitting there while EVERYONE else was served. It was NOT a busy time, it was NOT a filled place. It was just we were insignificant. Now we'll find a new place. Blueberry Hill has been good!

Uln3TWqOxG_Xaj9T_BH9JQ.text: This spot is so delicious the French toast was to die for!! We came to eat breakfast here one morning because it had such great reviews... It did not let me down! The place is self is kind of like an old fashioned cafe but the food did not disappoint! Service was kind of slow but they had a full house on a Saturday morning! They were very accommodating to seat my group of 20! Over all I would reccomend this place

yg2N6Cw6JmTQrVyYRUMicg.text: Awesome breakfast and brunch shop!!! I ate here with my mom before her flight back home and I loved it. Mentioning Yelp! got me a free banana nut muffin... it was fricken amazing.  I highly recommend it.

deQwwwVdc8F5zA0dnQbbrQ.text: VERY friendly and service oriented staff.  Restaurant was clean.  Racheal was an excellent server - very attentive!  Food, of course, was great.  You can order half portions on many items. We did, and we still had leftovers!

HbH2oaPXNqk-lQRx-OEj2w.text: Would highly recommend this place has very well good food service is great not so expensive as well and has a very large menu good to go with the family

LBZuhVpJ7OSgMaUbKRazKQ.text: Great food and service. Pancakes were very good and so was the ham and cheese Omelette. Just be aware. If you're are coming from a hotel on the strip it's a 25 dollar cab each way.

j8EnRIKpijb9pVJslT8ZpA.text: Great service! The waitress was nice and gave us free, warm banana nut muffins. The food was also delicious! I had the special, the Las Vegas omelet. I would definitely go back!

54YfAWDmkTl1cvsMi5V0Tw.text: I came on a Wednesday and it was not as busy as a Sunday would be and the service was extremely slow! Multiple people including myself complained about the food taking to long. I would suggest going to Egg Works on Rainbow same thing just faster service.

mI6xKyuvdhpRcN3JaQqNVw.text: I love it here! The food is always amazing and the banana nut muffins are bomb! I also had such great service this time from Chance, a waitress there.

BaFhugb3fC18Vz-SZ-VulA.text: One word DELICIOUS!! Lots of breakfast choices, oh yea n lunch. If you're in Vegas you must stop by! mmmmm Can't wait to go back!

33yVFoJDVdZr6CHZjbrW6g.text: First off, my expectations were pretty high for those banana nut muffins.  I prefer mine with more nuts in them so they were just okay to me - I've experienced better and probably will not get them again.  I ordered a scrambler and it was very good - the potatoes were okay - a little too much seasoning for me but they were crispy.  My grandma said the coffee was good and she enjoyed her corned beef hash.  The service was excellent, the prices reasonable, amount of food was a lot, and the atmosphere was good.  I would come back.  Oh, and free Wi-Fi which is great when your grandma you are visiting doesn't have internet.

xq_cyo2reH2M2bE-WfMwVQ.text: Even better than the other reviews said. Ordered prime rib omelet and banana nut French toast with real maple syrup. Outstanding. Our server Oscar was truly the best. We felt like we were at his house and he would do anything to ensure we had a comfortable stay.

6xqRig-g_MS4L73fjtyyHg.text: Dragged an unwilling family to try a new breakfast place while we were in Vegas. I was able to convince them on the basis of the high yelp ratings/reviews.  Unfortunately, the experience did not meet expectations.    The wait was about 20 minutes on a weekday, at around 10:30am.  Not too bad.  A testament to the efficient staff and their ability to keep things moving.  BUT:  Pancakes were doughy/floury and heavy.  Neither of my kids could eat more than 1/3-1/2 even with coaxing and bribery.  I ordered eggs Benedict but it was nothing special. Worst part is there was a distinct fake butter/margarine aftertaste (which is a pet peeve of mine).  it was a definite disappointment.  My husband had some sort of corned beef hash but his lack of commentary tells me it wasn't great.  Maybe we ordered the wrong menu items?    The free banana nut muffin for checking in on yelp was nice and the staff were friendly and efficient. Too bad the food didn't match.  We don't understand the hype...

QHksRz0WhmGGH3QRKMHJrw.text: This restaurant was a great find! The omelette were delicious an buttery and the Diablo potatoes were amazing!!! Be prepared to wait in line but it is WELL WORTH IT!!! Oh and you must order the banana nut muffin, wonderful!!! I'm glad we found this spot! I'm sure we'll be back when we visit Vegas again!

vnozf3-n0XHu9Qr2hbqAqQ.text: What a GREAT choice for breakfast. We came here based on the Yelp reviews and can see why the ratings are high. There are many breakfast restaurants that are good... But the Egg & I takes it to a whole new level. Excellent, attentive, friendly service. Delicious breakfast selection and many creative options, like the delicious Chile Relleno omelette and the Strawberry Creamcheese stuffed French toast. The banana nut muffins are amazing and the potatoes are seasoned to perfection. Super pleased. We'd most definitely come back here.

ePsIv2m-ekgboCiNUj-gjw.text: Our amazing server Jessica was super helpful at providing us with recommendations (loved the waffle with strawberries and whipped cream), super attentive at providing us with water refills, and super caring by checking in on us periodically during our meal. As always awesome potatoes- good job Egg&I and Jessica!

SPt-IVBNkS2ljmkr0vdjbg.text: The beef burrito was perfect for the Vegas hangover. Our server, Earl kindly answered our questions and served us quickly.

l7RZ94M81Xv6Ijl_Vz4mqw.text: The Diablo potatoes are great, especially crispy. Toast is nice and chewy. Good choices

cTQfHmZ_TPvqRqZxDqxv9Q.text: Great breakfast..not a big long wait...probally were the locals go.....I'd go next time in town for sure

nzvcSmOm8Tr6PJDJ4YyPNQ.text: Excellent service by far! BRADY was very attentive and helpful wish more people in the food and beverage industry was like him. Hope he wins the trip to Disneyland

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They are very good about coming to your table when they see this

zoWu_EWlK5O-DfGvBYnZfA.text: Hands down the best meal we ate since leaving Texas. My wife had the Waffle Works with eggs over medium, bacon, and strawberry sauce and whipped cream on her waffle, and I had the Mexican Omelette.  Her waffle was to die for, the sauce was warm, and the whipped cream is homemade and delicious. The eggs were perfect as well.  My omelette was the omelette I've been looking for in my 51 years on this earth! It was absolutely amazing and huge as well! The potatoes are awesome, the coffee is great, and, oh yeah, our waitress Kat, gave us two free banana nut muffins! They were so good, we bought a banana nut loaf to go.  As great as the food was, it didn't hold a candle to Kat! She is very friendly, extremely helpful, and the most efficient waitress I've ever met!  If you ever make it too Vegas, forget the overpriced tourist traps and casino krap and come straight here. If I could give it a hundred stars I would!

zN3h-cQizmhWXpdmM_fj0A.text: Mother's Day, 10:00 AM, people all over outside... They tell us our wait will only be 20-25 minutes, and for once, a busy place didn't lie. We were seated within 20 minutes, got our asked for drink orders immediately upon being seated, and waitress took our orders as soon as we were ready.  We went to breakfast because my dad loves breakfast (and so do I, but not as much as him). He got the biscuits and gravy meal (as he does at most places). I got stuffed french toast, which means eggs, meat, and cheese inside.  I ate past the point of being full, while still leaving a little on the plate, and my dad finished his pretty quickly because it was so good. He said as we were walking to the car, "That's about as good of a breakfast as I've ever eaten." That's a top-level compliment that he doesn't use lightly.  It's about $8-10 for most meals, service is great, food is even better.

DQbm_w8rXRSMux5rAjN3iw.text: All the breakfast spots on the strip were super busy and pricey . After a quick Yelp search and 10 min uber ride, we landed here.   Located in a small plaza with other businesses . Medium size parking lot in front . Came on a Friday morning and there was an approximate 15 min wait. When you go inside to check in, they ask if you want indoor / outdoor or whatever is first. They get your phone number and will text you when they are ready. Out door seating is along the street side under an overhang so it's covered in shade.   Inside has the diner feel to it. Service was super friendly. Got sat inside which was nice and cool. So many good items on the menu . There was a free banana nut muffin upon check in which was so good!   I decided to go with the spam , eggs and rice! Sooo good and the pineapple on the side was perfect !

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam, eggs and rice so good! Pineapple was a nice touch!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free Banana Nut Muffin upon check was so good and fresh!

qh6d4GYB0qYTphi4cKAPsQ.text: Great, quick, delicious and friendly. We had great service and really enjoyed our food. Enchilada omelet and any combination of the Santa Fe (chicken and chorizo) is amazing. I had the skillet. 5 stars foo

taUpH1mJQOcS8r-qATJbmw.text: I actually came here with my youngest son to use a Groupon that I'd gotten a pretty good deal on! We arrived at about 11 for a late breakfast and the place was packed. Which is typically a good sign, but it looked borderline at capacity. Moving on, we opted to sit on the patio and it was a great choice! They had misters that added a great touch and I enjoyed people watching! Only tip would be if you don't like pets don't come out here. It's a pet friendly area and in addition to a few dogs Mother Nature's pets attended... there was a fair amount of pigeons. Almost unsanitary because they'd get really close and flap off leaving all sorts of pigeon germs in the air. The restaurant can consider enclosing the area with that garden wood or something that would keep it a bit more sanitary.   Moving on to the food. I felt first off there's way too much going on with the menu. Pictures, eggs , burritos, omelettes, chili, pancakes, and everything is served a thousand ways! I was overwhelmed. Thankfully my baby just learned to read and knew he wanted waffles! I on the other hand ordered half a bacon and avocado omelette and a side of corned beef hash!   At best, the food was ok. The omelette was well cooked but the amount of avocado was overwhelming, a shock because usually you don't receive enough. The bacon was non existent because of the overwhelming avocado. The hash was mushy. I'd read it in another review and thought impossible, but the flavor was good, but the texture was similar to that of fried stringy mashed potatoes.  I will brag my baby's waffle was delicious, fluffy, and crispy! I'd come back for the waffles and the bacon!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids waffle with bacon!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half bacon and avocado omelette. They don&#39;t skimp on the avocado!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of hash! Not too shabby!

NDxglxs6TYW1_UV498mNxw.text: Flipping amazing food and service!! Try the banana muffin! The menu is very big. Something for everyone for sure!

X4LjicDKh5HphO7wnHo2TQ.text: Awesome place to have a egg based breakfast or lunch.   I had the pork chops with well done eggs and turkey sausage for a workday lunch. The service was pleasant without being too sugary and overwhelming. Just spot on. The food came out pretty quick.   The best part of the lunch was the Banana Muffin. That was just the best muffin I had..PERIOD. If you are going to this place....dont miss the muffin.

f4LT-DsciWgVdKbhznvPfA.text: Pros: Food is delicious Banana bread is amazing!  Cons: Always has a line to get seated Parking can be limited during peak hours  Despite the huge volume of people, their staff does a good job at managing the horde of hungry folks.

c4-eQSTSW8KkpZdxagIwUg.text: Found this place on yelp cause i wanted a local diner to eat breakfast at. Wow was it delicious. My server Paula was super nice and recommended the muffin with my coffee, its a must try if u have not tried it. I ordered the cali crepe and the potatoes. I loved everything about this place and will make it a regular stop when im in vegas.

GbF230NVL3_rZPpVQY4XYw.text: There was a little bit of a wait on Christmas Eve but it was totally worth it. Great coffee, lots of breakfast choices, fast and friendly service and the most delicious egg skillet. By the way, the waitress recommended this plate, the Santa Cruz skillet and it did not disappoint. She also brought a complimentary banana nut muffin for being my first time here. Delicious! I was not able to finish the skillet, i wanted to save space for my muffin that saved for dessert. Will definitely recommend this place for anyone visiting Vegas. It's off the strip but worth the drive.

-5qZghus08zMEHvl36gzXg.text: I tried the california omelette which was very good and portion was also good but I didn't like the potatoes or home potatoes it came with. They are too much like french fries and do not compliment the main course in my opinion. We also tried the carrot cake french toast which was good but very sweet. I had a cup of water and then noticed it had an odd film over it and looked slightly dirty. I thought the food here would have been out of this world based on the reviews but it was just ok.
