YgaNlVkUDxgNvJSuNBe2TQ.text: Chili Relleno and homemade soup of the day . Both of these tasted really good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YRBvm_eFfU_ZB1s2tfyZiw.text: Breakfast was good, I liked the availability of the 1/2 order.  My boyfriend was hoping for a different style of fried potatoes.  Will Go back, def recommend.

TG5MCgBWWRpLRiHYIit9zg.text: I took my family here after church this past Sunday. Lots of people waiting in the foyer, as you'd expect on a Sunday after church. They told us 20 minutes, then texted us a link to an online service that tracks your wait time. The app showed us who was ahead of us, how long they'd waited, and how many minutes we had left to wait. They beat the wait clock by about 5 minutes. I really liked having that real-time feedback.  The decor is woody, lots of rough wood paneling that is very warm and inviting. Tables are big enough. Lighting is just right, not too bright or dim.  Once seated in a very comfortable cozy booth - exactly what I was hoping for - we got our menus quickly and she came around quickly for our drinks. The selections are kind of vast, but the menu is well designed and logical, and we all got to a decision pretty quickly.  Given that wifey was driving I got the bloody Mary (very traditional for Sunday morning), and our waitress asked "double?" and not wanting to hurt her feelings I nodded 'yes'.  My Mexican Crepe was very good. Chorizo. Veggies. Lots of flavor. All my boys, and my wife all really liked what they ordered.   Our waitress kep a close eye on us without hovering. When we flipped the metal disk from Smiley face on black to Frowny face on yellow, she darted right over to answer our question "what is this for?" She said, "it's basically the Bat Signal" and like the Batman she was on it like a bonnet.  We never felt rushed. They communicated extremely well throughout the experience. Highly recommended. Probably gonna become a tradition for us.

JgHhGXNvTWqqjxWzGbF9qg.text: Usually I pick to eat at a casino buffet, figure for the price it's a better value. On this trip, this morning, I didn't really want to deal with the parking and walking from the parking garage to the buffet 30 minutes later ordeal, just wanted to drive, park and eat. Decided to see what's good. Yelped to find this place. My Rose like the picture of an item so we came to eat here. Wound up getting seated outside which was perfect for pre-noon summer weather. Breakfast was satisfying. What made it better was to find a waitress that actually heard you. When being asked if I wanted starch choices, I told our's that I wanted the banana muffin but I'll probably need it to go since I ordered so much food for just two. When my plate came, I wondered where my muffin was, figured they probably forgot about it as it seems to be more customary nowadays or at least the area that I now reside in. I really wished I remembered our waitress's name but I'll describe her as the blond cutie; when I mentioned she forgot my muffin, she told she had it boxed to go and would bring it when we were done. Wow. I forgot how Las Vegas emphasizes customer service. What a breakfast experience. The day we were leaving, when I asked my girl where she wanted to eat before we left for that long drive back home, guess what she mentioned? By the way, their banana nut muffins are awesome. Wished I bought that loaf now. Super busy but I would wait, you will not regret it.

DKnHphNrPGqV0pB281MIqA.text: Service was regular at soon We came in , but they changed the waiter , and Carolina was the best waiter!!! Thank Carolina for be so nice !!!  The food was better Than MR Mamas but MR Mamas owner goes table by table to say hi to costumers !!!

7jiexgk90WsZ13dk7RZgtg.text: Great service and food.The banana nut bread and muffin are very good.Rich and not generic recipe.The avocado burrito was good as well.

VQhimxoVLxHUAawoc9ZW7w.text: When i make my way to Las Vegas, I always have to stop here for my favorite eggs benedict dish. Their poached eggs are perfect. Toasted English muffin and grilled ham. Their home fries are perfectly crunchy on the outside and nice and fluffy in the inside.   The staff is so friendly and fast. If you take a trip to Vegas, stop here for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict

8RfGoiHI5JeiVtC3cUpKKQ.text: We've been to this location one a few times.  They area always super busy every time we've been here for brunch.  Despite that, the service works like a well oiled machine, and once we're seated the food doesn't take too long to be served.  The foyer is too small and one must be okay with sharing "personal space" with others.  Not a fun experience if you are claustrophobic.  Other than that, the food is consistently good.  Not my favorite location due to crowded conditions, so we go to other location more often than this one.

Fsi5FtRGvkbRGUzyUzzznw.text: Great place for breakfast with lots of choices and good food. Be prepared to wait but it was worth it. The fresh banana nut muffins are delicious.

UQ9EsgrRplU9XKtoM8Veww.text: Eggs Eggs and more Eggs!  Was looking for another place and stumbled onto this one and we were glad we did!   I was a bit hungover but I do remember loving he coffee and their food was tasty! Loved their complimentary muffins!!

ZqgU-nm1cH3Co2h71emfeg.text: The food there is always outstanding.  The banana bread french toast is amazing. Beyond delish. We are from michigan and it's a must to visit the egg & I every trip, most of the time it's everyday. My daughter gets the stuffed french toast and it's always amazing. Very filling. She eats half. So the serving sizes are huge. Worth every penny. Great prices for great quality food. It's our favorite breakfast in vegas.

seUQOSGXk__s7YoM8rcqzQ.text: Homey, tasty, and friendly.   Every dish I've tasted has been great. This is the homey eggs and toast place you're looking for. Large portions and good prices only add the fantastic value.

vcHnAUUz5t3FM9ixBN5t8w.text: Erin, our server, was so friendly and kind! The ham & cheese omelet w/ biscuits were excellent! I checked in w/ Yelp for my free banana nut muffin, but had to take it to go, cuz I am so full! This is our second time here, but it was at another location. My ONLY concern is the country music...I'm not a fan :(

sN6oi_5gcZ3gDGHLJmvymw.text: Breakfast off the Vegas strip.  No matter how much money I donate to the casinos in Vegas, it's all good when I stop by for breakfast before my drive back home.  There's a few things I look for in a great breakfast restaurant.  Coffee quality, food selection, and excellent service.  Well, they have it all!  I always get a half order of the ULTIMATE SKILLET.  Sausage, ham, bacon, mushroom, onions, tomatoes, spinach, and bell pepper - symphony of tastes!  Paired with a nicely buttered & toasted English muffin on the side and it's just bliss.  Their hot coffee served in their signature yellow mugs really hits the spot in the morning.    There might be a bit of a wait, but the service is great, the food is great, and the coffee is great.  Totally worth it.

D58Wm3_qobLK-gcsNzkH8Q.text: Egg and I is truly delicious! The banana muffin is a must try and you really can't got wrong with anything you order. When you come ask to be seated with Tamara, she is exceptional, sweet and very attentive!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and avocado omelette

2LVM0GjxPYOoWc_avBh0fQ.text: This place has the best breakfast in town.  I totally recommend it. Our server Tabatha was great.  Get her to Disneyland !!!!!

YxCnQYU2YY2P4H1fNzUsAg.text: I am not a big fan of Rachael Ray, but she doesn't get on my nerves nearly as much as she did when she was all unfiltered perkiness. Now that she has been homogenized and Oprah-sized and puts on make-up like Jack Nicholson as the Joker, I am somewhat sympathetic to her insatiable need to be the people's home cook, the pint-sized Paula Deen. Maybe that's why I was rather turned off by one of her Tasty Travels recommendations, the Egg & I on the corner of a strip mall out on Sahara Drive in Vegas.   Even though it doesn't have the A-frame roof, it's really an IHOP with a country kitchen vibe that seems to draw the who's who of the Convoy-and-trailer-park set. Rachael was giving her thumbs up to this place for all the egg dishes they offer. That I won't argue as the menu went on with variations of omelettes and skillet breakfasts that span the globe and stretch the pocketbook. Jamie W. was being very good and ordered the Original Breakfast Burrito (see photo). However, it was quite a log that came out with a flour tortilla stuffed with four eggs, diced bacon, bell peppers onions, potatoes, cheddar and jack cheese. It came on top of a plate of cubed ranch potatoes and some salsa.   It honestly tasted like any breakfast burrito, just more of it to justify the entree-level price. I went all self-indulgent and ordered the Blackened Prime Rib Benny, an Eggs Benedict variation which had little cubes of prime rib (whether it was blackened or even prime rib was quite arguable), sauteed spinach, roasted red bell peppers all chopped over what looked like a slice of Texas toast. Two poached eggs lay on top, and I asked for the hollandaise sauce on the side (see photo). Thank goodness since it was the congealed variety that clogs arteries faster than Drano cleans them out. It was on the meh side with nothing hofbrau-ish about the meat at all.  The dish came with the same cubed, packaged-looking potatoes Jamie got, and neither of us had any desire to finish them out. When you order coffee here, you actually get a little pot so they can charge $2.25 for it. Jamie had a glass of milk but it was $2 for just six ounces. Hell, I would have lactated myself for that price. Service was efficient, and even though they have a little egg sign you can flip over to get a waitress' attention, there was no need for it since they seemed interested in turning over tables lightning fast. I'm afraid I will need to second-guess Rachael Ray's judgments on what amounts to good eats on her travels, or else I may be doomed to high-calorie intakes of mediocrity.   FOOD - 2.5 stars....just thought the dishes were just too generic despite the abundance...it didn't seem human hands touched those ranch potatoes  AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...country kitchen quaint if that's your idea of charming  SERVICE - 2.5 stars...efficient if rather impersonal, no need to flip that egg sign over on a busy morning  TOTAL - 2 stars....right on the border between 2 and 3 stars, but I need to go with my bulbous, post-benny gut on this one

Wjv5WXdDJfMKa1B7QO8WrQ.text: The best breakfast i ever had. U need to wait to get in there. Worth wait.  Any Omelet here is awesome wit Sides Cajun fries or french fries. Fruits on the side.  We ordered 7 different omelets. Each and every person have their own specifications. All our orders are perfect. The waiter's here are pretty cool. If i stayed back in vegas and longer i would eat my Breakfast only here.  They offered us the Banana Muffins after our meal. Thats really awesome. We couldn't eat them so they gave us ToGo.

arWJD0GZ_diW8oW5AxD1og.text: Love this place! Oscar was our waiter and he was very friendly and attentive. Love the service and especially their banana nut muffins! I always order extra to go!

1soMvACcCwz_3g8P0d-7mw.text: Delicious  food. Excellent service. Affordable price. U must try the banana muffins. They are very moist and hot bake from the oven. Talking about it makes me want more. I'll definitely come back when I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The whole thing costs $30 and u get free yummy banana nut muffin if it&#39;s ur 1st visit.

kMuGjHdwWnGI_ToflHWJDA.text: Works Veggie Benny was really good, Chile Relleno omelette was incredible. Our server John was a sweetheart and gave us free banana nut muffins and said our drinks (Diet Coke and coffee) were on the house.

laqU2ir4CsmSY-0wo4rxaQ.text: Went early morning on a Sunday, seated quickly and the service was super fast. Their vanilla cappuccino was hot, sweet and foamy, loved that. Eggs Benny and the potatoes that came with it came within ten minutes of ordering! And when I checked into Yelp my server Perry got me two banana nut muffins which tasted like they were fresh out the oven and weren't too heavy, perfect end to the meal! Perry was very helpful with suggestions as well since it was our first visit! Weather was perfect to sit outside at that time as well!

3sUp8k87lSa-C0I1bP9A_A.text: I would easily say that we received the most amazing service from the most incredible server in the world.  I only wished  i lived in Vegas to get the chance to have brunch here at least once/week.  the banana nut muffin was very fresh. The Chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes were perfectly fluffy and pumpkin was fresh, and teh chocolate chips were just right (not too much, not to few).  The Fried chicken skillet was also AMAZING!. Cooked just right, with a thick and creamy gravy, with perfectly cooked potatoes, and an egg, just how i asked for it. even the OJ carafe tasted fresh, and it probably wasn't though, but it had me fooled. Again the prices, service and quality of food were amazing. (only thing is that this particular Egg&I restaurant was a bit far from our Hotel on the strip, but definitely worth the cab ride). Even the General Manager came by our table  a few times to ask how everything was. (my receipt says the  server is Mandy but i believe her real name was thiereny (shes getting married soon)). And they have an amazing GIVEAWAY trip to Disney

mCcpncrSjce83F-q8PeR2w.text: Loved the food and the service! Our server Reina was better then exceptional, checked on us every time she passed by. We will be back soon.

dOB7m66xRe9x_btyYU8YsQ.text: Got there early before heading to Death Valley. Easy to park. Cheap. Good service. Nice Eggs Benedict and tasty crispy bacon.

Qmzd69157DvsGvcsZdGZqA.text: Great Breakfast place. Omelette a are wonderful. Patrick our server was the best!  Try it you won't be sorry.

a791EscZHIUiRPx9QAYzxg.text: This is the place you want to go if you really want an awesome breakfast! And I mean AWESOME! I came here with some friends on a busy Friday morning, the place was packed. Luckily, there was outside seating in their patio where we can be seated. The menu itself was very extensive from the benny's, omelets, crepes, pancakes, waffles, etc. I honestly felt getting my monies' worth from the Works Omelette that it filled me up. If you haven't been here while you're in Vegas, you're definitely missing out! It's a place known for it's breakfast and just open during breakfast and lunch hours.

6_dVUVdjKYQyc-1_rs-Udg.text: Amazing food, amazing service! We received complimentary banana nut muffins - delicious! The servings are huge! Erin was a fabulous server, always offering drink refills and great service!

mTAbJJaqTkuqwsjTTq0naw.text: That banana nut muffin tho! It came out nice and warm AND free! Aye! We checked in, showed our server, Oscar, he came swiftly came back with the goods! Though we were quoted a wait time of 15 min, we were seated in less than 10min. Food was REALLY good. Generous portions, I had the Prime Rib Benny and my husband had the Crazy Chicken omelet. I'd definitely come back on my next trip to Vegas.

fUpNH033UJX8eY7uyTVxjg.text: AmaZing best american brunch/ breakfast ever! Prices are reasonable. thank you Karla she helped us to find out the best ones in the menu! Easy to park! 4 miles to stribe dont be lazy is worthed

t3no1MA2bGq4s-nK0dYOuw.text: So very delicious it's off the strip but worth the trip! You get so much food, you will definitely be stuffed when leaving this place .

y0dhcRDK7mioHJW0pRuW2A.text: This place is awesome . Food was incredible and our waitress, Chance was just as awesome.  She was very personable and quick to serve and made sure we had everything.  Highly recommend this place for the service and the food.

4_ISrC_K6PM0DZ-bjGf0qw.text: Yum! I went to Egg & I after my last day in vegas for EDC! I ordered the prime rib benny and it was delicious. They also gave us some of their famous banana muffins for free since it was the majority of the groups first time there, which were to die for! they are soooo good and I am not even a huge muffin fan. Service here was awesome as well.

B2xHzVYuPvSXttd11zQnGw.text: The Mexican Omelette was good. Plenty of butter on the whole wheat toast. The place was packed on Friday morning but service was quick and professional.

3bpVGRPP9dEpo2f3145rhA.text: My wife and I were looking for a place to celebrate our anniversary. I found Egg & I by looking on here.   We had to get the bus as we were staying on the strip but it was well worth the journey! This place is amazing!   My wife had the breakfast burrito and I had the corned beef hash with poached egg. My wife devoured his and said it was fantastic, mine was so good that I can't find the words.   I was expecting the sort of corned beef you get in a tin, I was soooooo wrong! This was real pulled beef! My eggs were perfectly poached and I cleared my plate which is rare!  Our server was a real asset to the restaurant, so good at his job. When my wife told him how we had found out about the restaurant he brought us complimentary muffins which were mouthwatering.   We had a massive jug of coffee that was just perfect! I can't recommend this place highly enough, the food, service and value for money are spot on!   We will most certainly be back here.

mSVSk27lsOcB9PcmtdL_xw.text: This place is great and I hope this review helps Linnea win a trip to Disney California!  Oh any of the egg dishes are awesome too.

YsyeBBeTY6khLeWYGjvLQg.text: A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!! And we haven't even gotten to our food!!!! The banana nut muffin is EVERYTHING!!!! We also just got our food. Paula said everything on the menu is good and we just ordered 5 different plates and none disappoint!!!! Best way to start off our Vegas weekend!!!!! Paula is super awesome and so are all the staff!!! Ordering a loaf of banana bread for my toddler YUMMY YUMMY!!!! Thank you Egg & I

TRopdVokl074jOaC8kksmA.text: Favorite breakfast place ever!!!  Served by the AWESOME waiter BRADY wearing Viking's jersey, always following up with his customers, way to go. Checking in on yelp got an extra all time favorite banana nut muffin, yummy... Chicken  fried steak skillet & the works omelette to complete  the meal. Generous servings!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;The Works Omelette &#34;

f3l8Sq_KrjWxQJWHj54ilA.text: Eggzzzzzz lawd have mercy. I've been wanting to try this place for the longest and finally found myself stopping by for some takeout after a late night.   Tried the strawberry cream cheese French toast and it was too bomb. To be honest the strawberry cream cheese tasted like it came out of the Philadelphia container but no big. I also could have done without the strawberry jam (or preserves?) smothered on top. Came with a generous portion of potatoes which were also soo so good!  Another breakfast staple I usually order anywhere is the corned beef hash meal. Egg & I didn't disappoint! Corned beef was super num and came with a side of eggs and potatoes.   Literally drooling........... Coming back forever and ever. Long wait always so order to go and eat in the room. ;)  PPS: check in via Yelp and get a free banana nut muffin SO GOOEY AND GOOD.

ziUKyFgTbaHPGD_OtUxrMA.text: The better half just said.... And I quote..."oh my god I'm eating way to fast, but it's so good I just want to shove it my face hole!" In regards to the veggie Benny she was enjoying. I had the Mexican omelet with potatoes, skipped the toast or muffin. Still so much food. But omg it was so effing good. Saturday morning 7:30, walked right in. Service was awesome and food came fast and to hot to eat. Very clean and not your typical diner greasy smell. Nice job!!! Guess that's why they are rated number one on yelp!

v3zEt03YCuxHQcaNjP-IEw.text: The service and food is excellent!!!! Bree was our server and she did such an amazing job. Would definitely recommend this restaurant!!!! The banana nut muffin, spinach Bennie, Chile relleno omelette and Mexican omelette are all amazing!!!!

kzjRKtqp_OE9FCXQOatgRQ.text: Wow! So we came to Vegas for a quick getaway. As we were leaving our hotel, our valet attendant told us to try this place for some great breakfast! Soooooo glad we did!  Thee is ample parking and our wait time was like, 25 seconds. We were taken care of right away. We go super delicious coffee, beyond superb customer service, and a great atmosphere to spend a morning or afternoon to indulge in tasty breakfast food.   Would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict florentine --yummy!!!!!!

BVXHjzKRoxhfduAJPNjfbQ.text: I'm guessing a little wait time is typical here, because the food here is really good.  Its worth the short wait.  Moderately priced and off the strip a few miles.  I had the Rellanos omelet and it was really good.  Great Service.

3LtJd1YBDWnGVsfmUSFeNA.text: Friends finally came into town this memorial weekend and I've been reading good reviews about this place and finally got a chance to check it out today.  It was packed.. But hats off to Egg & I because we were able to be seated quickly ( when at other restaurants it would take about 40 mins to be seated)   Make sure that if you decide to come here that you use yelp and check in to get yourself a banana nut muffin.. The muffin was super light and moist and delicious.  There are so many different things to pick from on the menu.. The menu is super creative.. I got the breakfast burrito and it was the perfect size for my appetite.. The salsa for it was delicious too (I asked for extra).. I left full and ready for the day.  So I would definitely recommend  this place if you are hungry, because of the price, the amount of food, and the service. Is it mind blowing you ask? No, but it is definitely better then average. Hence the 4 star. I'm going to definitely come back.

YzpV1fuZ4WIdmNZxm_fZxw.text: We are from out of town and decided  to have breakfast at the Egg and I. We stood in line and had a choice to be seated  either inside or on the balcony. We chose which ever came first and were seated on the balcony and soon found  it was too cold and requested to be seated inside. Kaia our hostess checked with the greeter and was told  we would have to go back in line to be seated inside. Requested to speak to the general manager = Kady, who explained the restaurant policy( if you chose to be seated outside and then changed your mind you would have to go back in line) but was happy to seated us  inside and did so quickly. Karen our server  was very polite and explained  that we could have half orders any items so we could each enjoy two items. Service was excellent and food was great. We left  content and with complimentary banana bread. Thank you Kady.

cLz1Y_E7937jDs2oyoqnaQ.text: My original eggs bene was pretty yummy. The Canadian bacon was a little too smokey for my taste, but the English muffin was tender and easy to cut and the egg was poached perfectly. And there was plenty of hollandaise. My boys enjoyed the kids meals and we had plenty of food to go around. The best part was our server always had a smile on her face and was very friendly. (Even when faced with a family with five young boys.)  Towards the end someone started smoking on the patio so next time I would definitely wait for a table inside.

bQQKVOam7qlpTuNR8nsz9A.text: It was busy on a sat morn but the food and service was great!  There was a variety of options!  I like that the pancakes can come with fresh fruits.  A group of 5 ate here and we were satisfied with the food and service.

FR1WSZzLWGoGOR1Cuhih3A.text: The banana muffins were delicious. Free when you check in :)  I was super excited to have brunch here during my stay in Vegas. I loved the cafe/home ambience and it was cute to have an egg concept throughout the menu/place but the food was not all that great.  I had the eggs Benedict which did not taste fresh or traditional. The sauce was way too heavy for my liking.   My boyfriend got the meat omelette but it came with more potatoes than meat itself. The potatoes were dry so it was quite disappointing.  Service was great though. We had more than one server check on us and everyone appeared helpful.   I wanted to like the food here but it didn't work out.

kaCBGUBOQiWjlkva-llCEg.text: Great little local breakfast/brunch or lunch place with awesome food and fast, attentive servers. This is one of my favorite places in Vegas to have breakfast and they're typically open until about 3 pm, 7 days a week. You have to try their potatoes and banana nut muffins, they so good and addictive! I usually go for the omelets when I come here, and no matter which one you order, they're all delicious. If you have ever been to Egg Works, this place is owned by the same people, but is just a little smaller in size and menu.

0se_uOK6EK6IyzNi-HHR8g.text: We went on a Saturday around 10 am after feeling discouraged over the wait at Hash House a Go Go at the LINQ hotel. The wait was only 15 mins which was not bad at all. The service was attentive and polite. We ordered the works skillet which is potatoes mixed with green bell peppers, onions, ham, sausage over 2 eggs cooked any way you like. We also got half an order of carrot cake French toast- which we thought was too sweet. The banana nut muffin was terrific- very moist, fresh out of the oven, and not too sweet. Yelpers can check in for a free banana nut muffin if it doesn't already come with your meal. Overall a good place for brunch/ breakfast.

0i4TRMvWvbsWST0c1zip9Q.text: I love all day breakfasts! In fact, I have a hard time going anywhere that has Eggs Benedict and not ordering it. So I tried the Spinach Benny with Canadian bacon (ham) and a side of Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes. My husband had The Classic with 2 basted eggs, seasoned potatoes and toast....,they both were good but not egg-ceptional as advertised They have these eggs that you turn over on the tables if you need service (see photo) which is a cool idea but our server was swamped and really was so far away with other tables that she couldn't take care of us well. We went to the oldest location and although it was busy, it really could use an update and maybe even a day to shut down and be cleaned from top to bottom. TIP FOR YELPERS! Check-in online for a free banana nut muffin. They are HUGE and delish!

P2DhdbxRoW6shbCvHzs46A.text: No strip fans, so we tried Egg & I out.  Very friendly people inside, huge portions (which we don't like, sorry !) and a very good taste. The guacamole was - unfortunately - not good at all. Regular coffee was very good. We will come back to try out something else.

yeR7p3DISEEFNlJAzMSqtw.text: Nice atmosphere. I loved the wall murals. Friendly staff. I enjoyed the food. I had the classic platter with bacon. Eggs, bacon, bread.   If you want to depart from the chain restaurant and have more of a country restaurant atmosphere this is a nice spot. Sometimes I like to just sit and journal for a bit and they were ok with people "camping out" in the restaurant.   Be mindful of the hours when you come. I believe they do their last seating at 3pm so give yourself enough time to relax and enjoy.   I would definitely come back. Can you find better food elsewhere? Yes. But the atmosphere is really enjoyable and sometimes that's more than enough.

They have a huge selection on their Menu. Overall, it was a great experience. Would definitely stop by when I am in the area.

xjKUHMBx8ATrrAXZ9QGL-Q.text: This was mine and my husbands first time eating here and we loved it so much we ate here two times during our weekend in Vegas because the food is delicious. Small and cozy restaurant with very friendly staff. Prices are incredible for the amount and quality of food you are served. I ordered the sunrise mountain the first day and the Ensenada breakfast burrito with potatoes the following morning. Hubby ordered the chicken fried steak and eggs one day and pork chops with eggs the next day. He enjoyed both days so much he wanted to come here all weekend. I would highly recommend trying this place for an inexpensive and very tasty breakfast when in Vegas!

ngqtsMAzIhj3WSFXDXNpOQ.text: This breakfast spot was an amazing restaurant away from the strip. There were many different options and variety of foods. Very different from typical breakfast spots like ihop and Denny's. I ordered the ham and onion skillet and it was DELICIOUS! I also checked in on yelp and received some yummy banana bread.  Also, the prices were reasonable.

2iuZhOdH1K8Z0jEOOpK-TQ.text: Our last place we visited before coming home from Vegas. Thank you YELP for letting me find you. This place was the Bomb.com. I loveddd it!! This place was super packed however we only had to wait 5 minutes before getting seated. Simple menu on paper but tons of options. I ordered the Chicken Skillet, my husband ordered the chocolate chip pancakes. Both items were reallyyyy good however the chocolate chip pancakes were total overload, the pancakes were drenched in chocoalte chips and i love chocolate but it was a little too much actually not a little just TOO MUCH for my liking even my teeth starting to hurt because of the sweetness. The prices were really reasonable and food was good and the service was awesome especially for how busy it was all. You must visit this place! yummmmy!

-myxiROfU2AoHVHQT2J69g.text: My new favorite breakfast restaurant in Vegas! Me and my wife are big breakfast people, and this place fit the bill. I got the Mexican in omelette, which was perfectly spicy and packed with chorizo and other add ins. I would recommend if you like chorizo. My wife got the corned beef hash with an over medium egg. We always make jokes about how other "Egg" based restaurants just can't make an over medium egg! Well, looks like we found a place in Vegas that knows how. Just look at that picture! Great job guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8E9f7KYf65vUgsRt9o5NgA.text: Great service and good food. I had the vegetable omelet and hash browns large portion enough for two. Suggest that you arrive early it gets crowded on Sundays

3XLWrsDemRFc3R8zlrhPWA.text: This place is the egg-bomb! From the cute-n-sexy egg decor to the (hooray!) Aloha Soy Sauce bottles set at the tables, this place makes a local gal smile!  Another smile maker is the super friendly service. Host station, servers and waiter all seem to enjoy their work and sharing pleasantries with their guests.   Hubs decided on the Three Pigs omelette and I had the chili loco moco. All was yummy. We cashed in our Yelp! check-in bonus for a free banana muffin that was pretty good. I wish we went with a large group so we could have sampled the bacon-maple cream cheese stuffed French toast, waffles and the blueberry cakes.   My rating would actually rest between 4 and 5 stars. It was their friendliness toward dogs that catapulted them to the top. Loved that they are clear on pet expectations so visitors can bring their furry family members, too.   Tip: Don't be put off by the long line. It moves quickly and you can always browse at the neighboring shops and bakery.

1hdmL8JGCl2-PFdiU2XNew.text: This is now a must every time I'm in Vegas! Our table ordered the Stuffed French toast, cordon bleu skillet and banana bread toast. Everything tasted amazing and so fresh! Plus, the wait was only 25 minutes on a Saturday morning.

pjcE8FgEAa4zlc8TWR2Uew.text: The food here is tasty and will definitely fill you up. I had the stuffed french toast (substituting in egg whites) and it was glorious. You can substitute virtual anything in an menu item for something healthy if you so choose. The staff were kind and down to earth. Will definitely go again when I go back to Vegas.

Xu4DotgV8fM61-3vTEcP_w.text: I was pretty excited to try this place. Seemed like the reviews had this place pinned as one of the better breakfast spots in Vegas. It was busy when we got there which was a good sign. The service was great as well. The food just didn't come through like I wanted it to. The menu says the corned beef hash is fresh. I'm pretty sure I could of copied that at home. The toaster was broke so a side of bread wasn't available. The home fries were good but I wouldn't come back.

TQWVTZ52YgpoVrHPTvyoMw.text: Everything we had here to eat was delicious. The service is excellent. The staff are super friendly and nice! Definitely worth the wait and drive. My only slight complaint is the coffee could be a bit better.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0EDjW0RsPeqFbCgqc7zTyQ.text: This is a busy place. They take your cell and text you when ready and you can even see your place in line on your phone. We sat and were given a newspaper menu with a variety of meals. I got the classic ham and eggs and potatoes I did chose the banana nut muffin which is one of their specialties everyone raves about which I agree was very good. The food was really good and they give you enough that you don't leave hungry.

fb2hFh1SSuJOxy72PBUFBQ.text: Great food!  Western omelette was huge and tasty. Sour dough toast was good. Banana bread French toast...really good. Came with both maple syrup and a tasty apple compote. Food came out super hot (temperature). Patio is pet friendly. Casual but nice decor inside. Bree was a great server.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food!  Western omelette was huge and tasty. Sour dough toast was good. Potatoes were seasoned well.

L1o1CSYcicoYJbrrvRXVGg.text: Thee place was pack but we waited the most maybe 15 minutes.  There was so much options on the menu it was a bit overwhelming.  But our breakfast was good and their banana nut muffin was warm and delicious.

R05u2QnjsxT4ngBGNwDVlQ.text: Love egg & I! The banana muffins are the best. Our server Carole Ann was a sweetheart. She was very attentive and made great suggestions :)

RRyZn4ovp7Qr9-H2biwT8A.text: This had been our favorite breakfast place on two previous trips to Las Vegas. I'm only giving it 3-stars today because my breakfast (prime rib Benny) was awful. The croissant on the bottom was just a pile of mush, the prime rib was just little pieces of meat, and the hollandaise sauce had NO flavor (my husband, who loved his biscuits and gravy, agreed with me on the no flavor).  Service was excellent, but I'm really disappointed with my breakfast.

They prepare everything so fast too. The eggs are always cooked exactly how i want them and the pancakes are so fluffy.  The prices are a little bit higher than some lithe places i won't name but everything is always good here.  It get packed on the weekends.

7-jcjRzoWy__HaeU3vDMFQ.text: Food tasty and generous and also a bit on the pricey side.

nHGuM5QERcXytlpusR8OVw.text: Amanda was great.  The food came out in a flash.  It was very good.  The place was clean and busy, but no wait for 2 people.

If we could we would give 3 stars for food and 5 stars for service.

qMsdQoSJ3SdPDDPBsR4piw.text: Excellent portion which two people can share n reasonable prices but even more important, very courteous service

FNRkjmtCmCXPWpzjzOtebg.text: Items selected:  Coffee Cinnamon Roll Banana Nut Muffin Chocolate Chip Pumpkin Pancakes Carrot Cake French Toast with Sassy Apples  With a house full of boxes waiting to be unpacked and a long run already in the morning's rearview it was with carbohydrates on my mind that we descended on venerable The Egg & I just after 6:30am and finding only a few regulars inhabiting the space as a half dozen holiday-clad servers stood in waiting I can only assume that both food and services rendered were as good as the restaurant gets...and both were pretty darn good.  A whimsical concept with a plethora of breakfast staples "eggceptionally" categorized plus a number of seasonal specials it was without hesitation that eyes turned to things autumnal and with a full pot of coffee in hand each dish that followed was exactly as expected - fresh, comfortable, and delicious; the sort of thing you 'could' make at home but never do...though if you make banana bread this light and moist or carrot cake pudding moldable to crispy French Toast I'll gladly come over, bring the coffee, and do dishes.

E_rAbrLjB3byVnoAIRRJrQ.text: Overall the best place you can go for a breakfast in Vegas. Their muffins and potatoes are to die for! That's actually the reason I keep going back lol. Oh and of course they're superb customer service.   I think to run a restaurant business you need three things: 1. Great customer service  2. Amazing food 3. Great atmosphere to enjoy that food  This well run food joint has it all covered and makes me keep going back and others as well. There is always a wait to be seated but not a long one.   Enjoy!

JjzVOLkNwdwRM-x7gcR90A.text: Came here on a Saturday. It was busy. Has a lot of seatings including outdoor. It was packed when we got there. We were told the wait would be around 15-20 mins. But we were seated within 10.   Our waiter was nice and helpful. There were other servers that were helpful too even though it wasn't their table to serve which is a plus. The hostess could greet their customers better. Just a hi and how's your day, also Didn't smile much. I noticed it wasn't just us. I greeted them more.   Food... Was great. I ordered the spinach Benny. Eggs Benedict with potatoes on the side. I'm picky with my poached eggs and they made it perfect. Not too wet or to cooked like some other places I've been to. My BF ordered original house burrito and he said that was good. I tried it and it was good too. Lastly we ordered chocolate chip pancakes. I've never had choc chip pan cakes before but for having it the first time. I loved it.   Prices were good not too expensive. Would definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original house burrito. The sauce is is good. If your a spice person add chili sauce and it&#39;s even better.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate chip pancakes

RlTB72llvCQOA7Qh6O6f3g.text: My hubby and I love coming here as a part of our Vegas trip. We always do the Yelp check in for a free banana muffin and take it to-go!  The service is always really good and the food is very good too!   The only dish I've had issues with is the corned beef hash. It comes out way too mushy and too salty! I've ordered it twice and have been disappointed both times. :( hubby is obsessed with the country Benny. That's a biscuit with a sausage patty, poached eggs, and country gravy. He tries to get the same thing at other restaurants, but it's never the same :)  The seasoning on the potatoes is great~ We bought a bottle to have at home although we have yet to use it haha  Anyway, 4 stars for the general deliciousness and service!

u-TJfbKwkzuiFQSJXs4bOg.text: In search of that last good meal before heading back to California, I decided to give The Egg and I a try due to recommendation of a family member.  Yes there were people waiting outside to eat due to this place being so popular for breakfast.  The wait was 15 minutes which wasn't that bad.  I tried the waffle works, which consisted of a huge Belgian waffle with 2 pieces of bacon and 2 eggs.  I did request whipped cream on the waffle, which made it taste even better.  The waffle was huge.  I enjoyed every bite.  The portions were very generous for the price.  Worth every penny.  The server Lindsey was wonderful and made sure I had the meal of a lifetime.         The Egg and I taught me a lesson that the best places to eat are not always on the Strip or Downtown Las Vegas.  There are good places to eat all over Las Vegas and you have to dig deep into your soul for the best food possible.  The Egg and I has a small town feel to it which provides an intimate dining experience.  This is one of the few places in Las Vegas you can eat at everyday and not get tired of it but wouldn't do so simply due to the fact that you don't want to spoil yourself.  This will become my new go-to spot in need of a good breakfast while visiting.  As far as the food quality and atmosphere goes. the Egg and I destroys Denny's and IHOP by all leaps and bounds imaginable.

o_I93EaZFpKVkmRHK6LSRQ.text: Customer service was the best! Coming back next time. Highly recommend. Banana mufs was warm and moist, I can't believe they give those things out for free when you check in.

KgnbJQ9sI5SKEjutXAJ9fw.text: The Egg & I! If I could eat at one place for breakfast every day of my life, it would be this place. Granted, I've only been here once, but I can't stop thinking about the delicious food I ate and how I wish we had this place in LA.   I ordered the Chili Relleno omelet and the Country Benny. They had the option of ordering smaller portions of the skillets and omelet dishes which I really enjoyed because the portions were fairly large and I unfortunately can never finish my food, no matter how hard I try.  The Chili Relleno was so extremely flavorful, the omelet practically melted in my mouth. And the Country Benny, the gravy, the sausage, the biscuit... Mmmm! My eyes rolled back with every bite. I wanted to order the banana pancakes but I think I was getting ahead of myself.   Our waitress, Carla, was amazing. She was very helpful and attentive, and definitely made my experience more enjoyable.  I will go to Vegas again just to eat here. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The half orders of the Chili Relleno omelet and the Country Benny, yum!

aNOVkLMmO3dJrdH3lr9Kkg.text: People talk about Hash House and others.   This places doesn't do all the crazy stuff; just quality breakfast food.   I had the skillet and it was awesome.  Lots of potatoes, "stuff" and bread on the side.     I'd come here if you're looking for a really, really solid breakfast without the frills and upscaled food items.

MD3mMqh86mSdQjbuSs1oIA.text: Food was delicious. I ordered a strawberry waffle so it wasn't that hard to get it right.   However, my biggest issue was with the wait staff. The host was mute and wouldn't say a word. My main server was rude and in a hurry to rush me out of there by throwing the check at me as I'm eating and before I even asked for it.   Not quite sure why or how this is the best of Vegas...

kkbaRN4zQC1JwXLUBk9niA.text: This place is away from the strip which made it appealing to us. Got there about 9:30 on a Monday and we were seated immediately. The place was very busy but service was prompt. We had the chile relleno omelette and the kitchen sink omelette, one with a banana muffin and one with sourdough toast. We ordered a side order of the bacon maple cream cheese for the muffin, it was so good! The omelettes were cooked perfectly, the potatoes on the side are delicious. Highly recommend making the drive to come here!

BW_gbFozP7pwEwCXGyb6gA.text: The food was great and the service was excellent! Definitely coming back when we are in Vegas.   We got the Santa Fe Skillet & the Stuffed Strawberry and cream cheese French toast   The banana muffin is soooooooo gooood!! Amazing!

VUfHlZAAyF6hnvtFXk0zXw.text: What a breakfast experience! My first time in this restaurant and I could immediately feel that it must get VERY busy in the weekends! It was Tuesday morning and the place was crowded up to the last available seat. We ordered the Sunrise Mountain and the Eggs Benedict and they did not disappoint at all!   Oh, did I mention they offer free banana nut muffins if you check in through Yelp? Do not underestimate the muffin: they are the most delicious, truly homemade muffins I have ever had in my life. I am not having muffins anywhere else anymore but the ones from this place. Darn, I need to go back to Vegas JUST to have breakfast again in "The Egg & I"... :)

Nm0__X-vTGxK7Rzh9VgPwA.text: Great server! Paula is wonderful!  The hot banana nut muffins are bomb! The carrot cake French toast was so good! And you can't beat the price... we will be back!

jCSriaPoVY8osPgNsxyAYg.text: I ordered the classic. I love the potatoes. The banana nut muffin is delicious. I have it a three star because the wait is way too long. I came in with a party of 5 and we were quoted 20 min and we waiting an hr. I recommend a seating system so that they will be able to know how long the tables have been sat. So they can give an effective wait time.

BkbshWoILiNcjnRWMzeIGA.text: Usually only come out to Vegas for gambling on the strip, but somehow always end up at Eggs & I. Love their breakfast burritos and friendly staff.  If you enjoy playing credit card roulette with friends use amex and you'll always win (They do not accept amex).

AqoJXg53w-JxKrdN9Bd42A.text: A hidden gem in the sea of places to eat in Vegas. Great breakfast spot and we even drove out to this place two days in a row on our last trip.  Don't miss the banana nut muffins as they are delicious.

K04SGx8GrzVRSXWx2Q8loQ.text: The food:  Blackened prime rib Benny - prime rib is diced small, mixed with veggies, served over a slice of sourdough with poached egg and hollandaise on top.  Their habla diablo potatoes are  pretty good. Crispy on the outside,  soft on the inside and dry seasoned with a reddish spice mixture that is slightly spicy.   New York steak and eggs - this is an egg based restaurant that served cold, browned (aka overcooked)  scrambled eggs?! The steak was thin, cold,  and lacking any flavor. Their signature habla diablo potatoes were probably the only really good part of the dish.   (I know that there is no built in firewall against poorly cooked eggs at an egg based restaurant but c'mon)   Mimosas: You're given a small, unopened bottle of champagne turned upside down in a glass Mason jar. A cup of pulpy orange juice is served on the on the side.  I like that you can control the ratio of champagne to orange juice.   The atmosphere: Farmhouse chic. Packed with patrons. There is an open air patio in the back (pets allowed). Booths in the middle, tables along the walls.   The entryway deserves a paragraph to itself.  One. Big. Clusterf**k. People are waiting to be seated and are either sitting along the walls or standing (most likely in the way of someone). People are lining up to be placed on the seating wait list. People are sitting or standing along the wall just inside the dining room and outside of the front door. People are ordering food to-go. People are lining up or grouping together like a human barricade, waiting to pay their bill. Honestly, even the hostess could not tell me where the line ended to pay the bill. After being one of the few courteous people constantly moving out of others' way, a new line has formed and of course they want to act like you cut them in line.

Z7VIZi92OS9YRgsPFSzgRg.text: Two breakfasts - one was delicious, one not so much. Portions are huge. We enjoyed the omelet and potatoes. Potatoes were hot and delicious. The bacon maple french toast not really.

wDur9HsG7_df1234aKnhQg.text: I tried their Chile Rellenos Omelette it sounded good so I thought I give it a try and I wasn't disappointed. Very busy but service was fast and everyone was so pleasantly friendly

MMCDAEz9Q7cFD59MYMRBXQ.text: The food was great here, but the service was HORRIFIC. The server forgot to place my order all together, but his manager made up for it by coming over to bring something to eat in the meanwhile. We appreciated that much for sure.  The thing that got me was the fact that the server never apologized or even acknowledged the mishap. And even after that he wasn't around to refill drinks. It was very strange.   I am still giving it a great review because the food was amazing, especially the banana bread.

dcD_feginPrdJiuAXrdYfA.text: It is so good this is the second time I've been here since Las Vegas services and they are very attentive they always come back to your table and make sure that you're good, the food is really good. nIPH-vSbMdCuS-e3h_guFQ.text: The friendliest staff with the best breakfast food at a very reasonable cost in LV.  Everything is fresh and made to order.  Be prepared to wait for your table on any day of the week.  It is worth it though.  We went back three times during our one week stay in LV.

q86Rs9wYVeYOTeU-2rQcHA.text: I'm leaving another review because the second time I ate here during my 4 day stay in Vegas was even better than the first! Yes I had to wait 40 minutes but oooohhh it was worth it. I had this veggie Benedict meal which was a healthy indulgence. Fresh perfectly cooked poached eggs atop of FRESH spinach, yes fresh not cooked like other places do a spinach Benedict. Then the tomato slices were grilled and with fresh avocado. Once again I subbed the fruit for the potatoes. So impressed with the array of sliced fruit. My family loved the huevos rancheros as well as the huge chocolate chip pancakes. I must mention that our server Linnea was delightful and sweet. So attentive and friendly. If you are in Vegas, you must go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Benny. poached eggs were perfection. underneath spinach was avocado, Grilled tomato slices atop english muffin halves.

LrAkrFc49zEjZ2jde07fbw.text: The food is what won this place over this time. The eggs benny were fantastic but our visit was not that great because of the service. I know this place can get pretty busy but please train your servers better! I will try this place again because the food was great and hopefully next time the service will be on par with the food.

yu8f2RDDm2Uk0BPFYazzHA.text: Great tasting food and large portions were a nice part of this moderately priced place. We went there at noon, and it was busy, but they were getting people seated as quickly as they could. Wait staff was nice, professional and knowledgeable. We got the Mexican omelet and the bacon omelet. It had the right amount of cheese and the food came out hot. Potatoes were great- tasted fresh and hot, not chewy or old. We had our food to go. I'll definitely be eating here again next time I'm in Vegas.

1gYkWaCJC5VzvPBW9vZQNw.text: Great service and yummy food!  Glad to get off the strip and enjoy a wonderful breakfast!  Had a waffle which was delicious.  The mimosas are huge and worth the money.  Will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

Overall just friendly wait staff, did I mention the recurring banana nut muffin checkin deal! The waiters are so nice friendly too. Always will come here when I crave a hearty American breakfast. GREAT JOB

ijaySX2am1goXpY3W-lqgg.text: We love Egg & I, not just because of the chili relleno omelette is amazing as is the eggs benny and Santa Cruz burrito, but more than that our favorite waitress is here, Karla. Karla is the best she knows what we want keeps our iced teas full and always delivers the best customer service. That's why it's not surprising that she was awarded by the mayor last year. So when you visit the Egg and I be sure to ask for Karla and get ready to be blown away by not only the food but also by the amazing service that Karla will provide!!!

D_dcMAcXd67f04TYRr6O4Q.text: This is the only place in Las Vegas that I will go for breakfast.  The food is great and the service is even better.  The homemade hash, and banana nut muffin are my go to items.  On my last visit, Carole Anne and her trainee Oscar were great, they were both polite, courteous, and professional.. Makes me feel at home :-)

Hr-RiYEeNL2BBWdPXsbL8g.text: Great variety, good food and friendly staff. I had the country fried steak skillet and it was 2 meals worth of food!

6ggKAOf-voWQtZSenLcvuw.text: The place was ok...we went on a Tuesday afternoon around 12pm. We waited about 30 mins. They sat other folks who arrived after us with the same # of party. I had to go back and question the hostess, they sat us right away. We wanted to sit outside because inside of the restaurant was a Lil small and not enough ventilation. I did not want to smell like food.  Now we waited an additional 20 mins just to place an order and then another 20 mins for our food. Omg I was so hungry, when my food came out, I only took 3 bites.   But our server Karen (I think that's her name) she was very nice and friendly. She did bring us 3 banana nut muffins which were yummy! My friend's breakfasts were much better then mind. The server also took my order off since it was not that great.  Over all, I would not have any interest in going there again.

VcQk_2wsIw6jBEtCe3ksnQ.text: Send Genesis to Disneyland!!! She was an awesome server! Very kind, attentive, and quick!   Also, food here was amazing. I don't think you can go wrong over here.   We'll be back!

SSSWe8rf9wDSPNOu3eNR9w.text: Food was good. We came off the strip to eat here. They got us seated quickly even though it was busy.   Jessica our server was cool and nice. Send her to meet the mouse.  Only con, was that they didn't bring all the food out at once. I had to wait to eat until my girlfriend got her food. NBD.

TLkXYPeO7hJDy16aQvnHZA.text: On our last morning in Vegas, we decided to have an American breakfast and found Egg and I on Yelp (of course!).  I had the pancakes, bacon, and eggs combination (around $7.00) and my friend had the eggs, muffin, and potatoes combination (@ $6.75).  Both were excellent and the vibe here really brightens your day.  The people working are cheery, friendly, and serve your quick and come back when you're not happy.  How do they know when you're not happy?  Well, you turn the egg over to the unhappy face!!! haha.  great customer service!  I enjoyed my breakfast here and all the way into the parking lot until Jeff Rose (of Boston, MA) backed into our car and left a dent.  sad face!  We got the car fixed, but so far Jeff has not responded and looks like Jeff's going to bail on paying for an accident that was his fault.  Xie Xie!!

jNZ6HnkKiVODs6w0aDcoTA.text: 2nd time being here since 2015. Still great service. I wasn't sure what to get and my server gave me a few good options. Her name was/is Manuela. She was really sweet and nice, very helpful. Kept checking up on us, making sure everything was good. I ordered the stuffed french toast, it was delicious!!

E65jBpSC_q2ZS2HIoFSZ2g.text: The food was amazing so it was worth the almost hour long wait. The portion is also very big so sharing should be taken into consideration. They give you a mini champagne bottle for your mimosa; it's super cute! The servers were all very nice.

4x-gzEQjgxH67lqEQpauJA.text: The banana nut muffin was so good:) Our server Chance was so awesome..great, positive vibe and super sweet:)

seuPV4JfjtS2VkdAVE_B1A.text: Probably 4.5 stars, not the best breakfast spot I have ever had In this world but but hands down the best spot in vegas so it gets 5.  This place is also the same as Egg Works and I have eaten at both spots and they are both excelent.   There menu is awesome with all the regular stuff plus with crepes, omelets, scrabbles, skillets, bennys, and hawaiian breakfasts.  They also have a cincy chili section that I like, I have never had cincy chili for real but I know what it's all about (over spaghetti) and this chili is real good.  You can also get toast or a banana nut muffin with your meal.     They do everything well and I have never been disappointed with anything but my favorites are the cincy chili omelet, enchilada omelet, and anything with their excellent country gravy all over it.  They have a chicken fries steak skillet that is potatoes topped with chopped up fried steak, topped with gravy, topped with eggs however u want, it is AWESOME.  They also won some awards for their cincy chili burger but I have never had it.     My good friend and fellow yelper used to think cracked egg was the best place in town and refused to eat here for some stupid reason.  Well we ate here and he was mad at himself for missing out on this place for all these years, don't make the same mistake.

P2ZK0ZqIoCdADJJlE9hVCw.text: Cute little place, good service. Probably the closest thing to a diner you'll find in Las Vegas. I had a very nice, fresh breakfast for about $7!! We even took home a souvenir mug.

MLBUPsMdSfpWHqQSvhyGeg.text: Breakfast was delicious they have 4 egg omelets and a standard is 3 eggs. Portions are plentiful definitely need to walk it off on the strip. Only disappointing item was Daily Egg Burger. Was too dry for me and the eggs yolk was already fully cooked. Other then that, you will walk out with a to-go container.

Spj-V1dUjxjCZ3mP48o1-w.text: Super tasty breakfast spot just off the strip. Their menu is like a newspaper and is a couple pages long so there is something for everyone! Our server, Karla was very friendly and the service is fast!

qfQEcdTjIZ8oIMQnu8_1aA.text: So I found this great little restaurant on Yelp during one of our many Vegas trips and I have to say that I am in love with the french toast sandwich!!!! I'm a huge fan of savory and sweet and this place nailed it to the wall!! Great place to have breakfast after dancing the night away on the Las Vegas strip! I just wish I lived closer because the food here is amaziiiiing and totally crave-worthy!

X4Lr10DeZcXM7QynKfDsiQ.text: Our server  was breeaanda? She was super nice and helpful. We were  originally sat outside but someone in our party had a fear of birds so they were able to relocate us inside. Our server was attentive and help and friendly. Chili Omelet  was the best!!

eV-DsHF7AjwB30v8Zn9ABQ.text: I love food the ppl and my fav waitress karla haha if you want a funny waitress to make ur day nothing but laughs shes the waitress. I come here almost everyday possible.

GCZBQAkbeEyDcA4EkLSlOw.text: Awesome place!!  We were undecided between the Egg & I and another place we saw on Yelp with great reviews.  We'd gotten rid of our rental car the day before so we'd have to take a taxi to either.  At the spur of the moment, we picked the Egg & I.  Yay for us for picking an awesome joint.  We waited only about 10-15 minutes before being seated.  Once seated, we flipped through the newspaper menu.  I'd read so much about the muffins, we ordered a couple to start our meal.  They were banana nut muffins.  We both ate the entire thing.  So good.  And with a great cup of coffee, we could've stopped right there.  But we didn't!  Since breakfast is not my favorite meal, I love it when I find a place that has lunch style breakfast.  There were so many options I had to choose from.  I was stuck between the stuffed pepper and the Tacos Rancheros.  I chose the Tacos Rancheros.  It was a tortilla topped with refried beans, ground hamburger, two eggs (which I got fried) and topped with cheese and sour cream.  I would've liked some salsa with it but it didn't need it.  My partner got the garlic mashed potato omelet.  It was enormous.  She could only eat half of it to which our server, Karla suggested getting the half order next time!  Shoot, we didn't know you could do a half order.  But, my partner said she wouldn't gotten a half anyway because the portions would be all wrong.  We both loved the Old Bay seasoned fried potatoes.  As we waddled out, it was great that the front desk called a cab for us.  Very nice.  Oh, and there's a little egg face on the table that you can flip revealing a sad egg face if you happen to need anything.  That's a brilliant idea!  Karla was awesome and if we lived in the area, it would be our go to place!

u2FyDdYyuveEV4MKROV6NA.text: I decided to stop here since we landed at 7:30 AM and wanted breakfast.  All the reviews raved about this place.  The food was good, but the waitress was not very attentive.  The muffins were alright.  The portions were good.  I felt that the potatoes stole all the seasoning and everything else was a bit bland.  Maybe next time I will try something else.

UCfenksiy2QnoLiaEggDBA.text: A really good breakfast place to eat while in Vegas. I had the chicken enchilada omelette, it was pretty good. The banana nut muffins were awesome with butter. So good we ordered a loaf to go.

0Ew-4oaXxQLViaO0FRLoWw.text: Great breakfast with the locals for 2 Aussie boys. Our server Linnae was wonderful as well. A sure thing for a great feed!

upJeSWVfgs7MQQbQBQsHfQ.text: Not bad. This is a great neighborhood joint with lots of locales. Muffins are delicious. Yummy large portions.

OF37l0G0DzJfDgT_VI4P5g.text: My favorite breakfast place . Egg works ,egg and I etc they are all the same amazing breakfast food , beats any breakfast place I've ever been too . Good service even with busy hours opens 5am-3pm . I try and go here at least once everyone I'm in town and always take my friends who all fall in love with it every time .

ietTU6qUAidoPsnbaSaKXw.text: A very nice surprise.  We went here because of a food network recommendation and we were not let down.  It is a basic breakfast, but very good.

Yeosr8RVyW75o2Bf6_cIBw.text: This place deserved 6 stars but I am limited to 5 stars (yelp limitation). The extra star is for the service. The service was amazing better than any other 5 star restaurant. The food was also equally amazing. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking to venture off the strip.

C55q4xt3GeMlwVrij9HYJg.text: This is by far my favorite place to have breakfast and now lunch in Vegas. Their banana nut bread/ muffin is amazing!! The best! Very moist and nutty.  This was my first time ordering off the lunch menu and I got the Cinci Chili Burger.  It was delicious!  Great tasty chili with the Ranch Potatoes on the side.  Comes in an open bun with a large pickle, lettuce, and tomatoes.   I was very satifised with it.    Usually the service is pretty good and friendly except when they're super busy.  Then it gets a little quick and snappy.  But overall, I definitely look forward to coming here whenever I go to Vegas.  And if you like the muffin, definitely buy a loaf to go and put it in the fridge.  It lasts for a while in there and its always moist and soft.

6_cTPJucaabjKn7eQe1kBw.text: Our server Raul was very good. Food was great and parking was easy. We only waited 10 minutes. Pricing? $50 for 4 of us. We left full.

pxqOssj_ZMhE_8RICJpMYw.text: Empty glasses came out (with the orange juice caraffe) COMPLETELY dirty. Food leftovers in them and LOTS of it. Very gross. Makes you wonder what the water glasses really looked like that came out pre-filled and just how sanitary everything is that comes out of the dishwasher!  Vegetarian eggs benedict was quite blah, toaster muffin was soggy from the get-go. The boys weren't crazy about their meals, they were just ok as well. Nothing special here.  I love strong flavors, personally. I season the heck out of my hash at home, but the potatoes really are over kill. I couldn't finish them.  Pretty disappointed. Only notable GOOD things were quick seating outside & decent prices.

6jX0dmcbmebi8MVtpwpT9w.text: I was a little skeptical when I walked into this place at first but once I saw the menu I realized this as a lovely surprise at Vegas. The place was bustling with people and the food was excellent. The coffee was great. A great b'fast place to go at Vegas.

wDP7wYhBVltSJ-oPXpggEw.text: Had a great breakfast. I always come for the prime rib Benny. Tabatha was our server. She was super friendly and gave egg-cellent (get it) service.

a3B0r0ghtooyuTpj0T-98w.text: Carole Ann was wonderful! Cheerful and helpful! Food was good. Potatoes were good but I couldn'd eat all of it. A bit salty after a while. Had the Crazy Chicken Omelette. Was good but rich. Banana nut muffin was the best! I'd give the server 5 stars and the food 3 stars (banana muffin saved the rating).

S5t70P0I83MHUHmM0m7iOg.text: My husband & I visited this place once while we were visiting Las Vegas & after eating there we wished we had known about that place sooner so we could've had breakfast there every morning while there. The second we walked in we were greeted by the hostess & given a table right away (it was really early so it wasn't that crowded yet) and a couple of mins later our server Amanda greeted us & took our drink order. The menu had a HUGE selection of items and after minutes deciding my husband ordered the ciabatta breakfast sandwich & I ordered the French toast breakfast sandwich     (both sandwich came with a side of potatoes) and we were pleased with our selections. Not only were the portions big but they were delicious! Their potatoes are super good too, my husband isn't a potato guy he prefers hashbrowns BUT he really liked those potatoes. A good restaurant with good food is nothing if they don't have good service & our server Amanda was great! She was very attentive, she made us feel like locals which we loved because when traveling we don't like to be treated like tourists. Over all, I give this place 5 stars because of their delicious food & great costumer service! When visiting Las Vegas, this is must try spot!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top, egg bacon &amp; cheese ciabatta sandwich (my husband added avocado) Bottom, egg, ham &amp; cheese french toast sandwich! Delicious!

wx2jEbTAdUqn1fJFHgkkBQ.text: I was reading the yelp reviews and maybe just hyped up myself that this was going to be mouthgasmic. The food was good and from what I can tell so far is that it's better than IHOP or Denny's.

DGVvqGwmmCF9KafHVpP1MA.text: My fiance and I stayed in Vegas for the weekend and we wanted an awesome breakfast not in the hotel. We yelped this place and it had 4 1/2 stars so we tried it. It was packed! 15 minute wait but we sat outside. Awesome food! Would definitely come again!

xic-IRQMSestCEfxFR1heg.text: Food is excellent! We were looking for a good place to eat and less expensive than the hotels. Eggs & I was perfect. Our server was Amanda and she was super nice and friendly. Great experience. We'll be back on our next trip to Vegas.

6RAlEPF7OkBAfboPWKIHzQ.text: First time at this location and it was great. Food was amazing good!! Tamara took great care of us. It's our first time and we're thinking on coming back gain tomorrow!!

pxnIJ_Z8LB1T4BvRoL2BDQ.text: Great bang for your buck. Carole Ann was our waitress and she was epic.. we had the French toast and the sunrise mountain. Both were good. Lots of food so heads up. The vanilla capinchino is quite sweet but yummy !!! Overall great. Would come again.

lTbH_XgdfKS6LU9Z6pOhJw.text: I love this spot. It is one of my top 10. I can eat break fast all day. I love there potatoes. I usually get a skillet with meat and potatoes. Perfect hang over food, for me any way. Only thing I don't like is this place is always packed. Many locals know about this place. I haven't ate inside yet, I always order over the phone, and pick it up. It stays busy for a reason.

W-JIJnFEMh4ldDqoRcx2yA.text: always a good breakfast place and good service. always with a smile from the hostesses to the server.   I recommend this to all locals and tourist.

7Reu3XO8jroMwEOHXiN73Q.text: Found this place on yelp. I read a few three stars that didn't like the upsell. I found it was very polite and good value. I got a wash and wax for $50. All the staff were friendly, they work hard and don't take short-cuts. Whole wash took maybe an hour with no idle time. Great results, no missed spots, will come again. I wish Irvine had a place like this.

QP_9496VCq6aCKmilH5IGQ.text: The Egg and I is truly the BEST BREAKFAST in Las Vegas ! !  Food is HELLA GOOD and the wait staff, especially our server Kelcey, were very attentive.  The restraunt was very busy as it was Sunday mid-morning, but they were very speedy without rushing people to get out. The Chile Rellano omellet was delicious !  I'm going back again tomorrow ! !

h7W9otABC5H4z2GAUp0A5Q.text: So, after a crazy weekend in Vegas whats the first thing your body needs before you hit the traffic on I -15?  An IV, close... Breakfast.  The Egg & I is not to far off the strip, only about a mile depending on where you stay.  We took the back roads from Caesars and our ETA was about 5 minutes.   The coolest thing is their "happy egg, sad egg" stand at the edge of the table.  Whenever you need something like a drink refill, or if you have a problem with anything, just flip the egg from the happy black face to the sad yellow face.  We tested this unique method of customer service and within seconds we had our waitress back at the table asking if we needed anything.  Even without flipping the egg the waitress was very attentive.  After you get your drinks the waitress will bring you a fresh baked banana nut muffin.  My buddy thought he was flirting with the waitress, and they totally were, so he made us all thank him graciously for the 2 muffins.  Then after 30 seconds of looking around, you realize everyone gets a muffin.  *Sad egg face Jordan, sorry :^(   But the muffin is warm and delicious.    We had a party of 4 and we all got something different and it was all great.  I got chicken fried steak covered in gravy atop a mound of ranch potatoes with 3 fried eggs on top, and the best part about it was... they CUT it up for you!  This is when I found out I am lazy because you know you're lazy when you get excited about your food coming pre-cut.  The chicken breast was moist and the outside was perfectly crisp, and with every bite the batter unleashed a flurry of flavor.  Mouth watering.  The hype about their ranch potatoes is True.  They are really good and live up to the expectations other yelpers have set fourth.  I haven't had anything quite like them ever before.  My plate also came with a side of fresh seasonal fruit and a biscuit for gravy dunking.   The rest of the gang ordered: eggs benedict, the breakfast burrito, and a plain jane 2-egg breakfast with bacon.  All of which was worth the wait on a Sunday morning.  5-Stars for the overall experience.  The waitress was cute and friendly even if she didn't give Jordan a muffin because he was "special," their happy egg / sad egg system works well when you need something in a pinch, the superior quality of the food and the prices are great especially after losing a couple G's at the tables in Vegas.

rgAwuhi2ao5M7JJM70XDxQ.text: In love with the potatoes for breakfast, well seasoned and don't even need Ketchup if you ask me. That's a first : D

6u-E8C8Oqah2SnhZoqTetg.text: Really really good savory stuffed french toast. Very good service too! My mum loved her omelette, and she's a fussy critic. I will definitely stop here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

1gXe1L9tXYM5VdcA0WAMjg.text: The food is great along with the customer service.  When you go there you have to try their banana nut muffins they are the best. It is not overpriced and you will get a lot of food for your money.  Friends come to visit and I have recommended this place to others and they too enjoyed it.

01634W6EMa1jAfdR00HqRw.text: The Eggs Benedict were amazing!!!!  In fact all the  food was incredible. Our server Amanda was awesome.  Can't wait to come back!!!!

8Pc9JgwqyF-_pF4UYYbs1w.text: Manuela was my server and she was very sweet and down to earth. That's the thing about this place, the food isn't the only awesome thing, the people are too.

tP6iBvPqrMwA0j8n5_E5Jw.text: Great food at a great value and the environment so home-y and family friendly. Our waiter was one of the best I've ever met--incredibly nice, attentive, and efficient. I ordered waffles with scrambled eggs and sausage and it was fantastic. I also got the free Yelp checkin banana muffin and it might have been the best muffin I've ever eaten--served warm, crispy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside with amazing flavor. Can't wait to come back here!

18NbgV03xp8ILqZH0GwR3g.text: Great food! Homemade style, fresh, flavorful. Loved the mashed potato omelet, hash browns, and banana nut muffin. Big portions and fair price. Fast service.

ezKxIwFut5RL5eod4dUNGQ.text: Love ittt!!!!!! And the banana muffin omg sooo freakin good make sure to check in on yelp for a free muffin and then buy some to go

r-N1l5RdjBj83fBx8fDRtg.text: Great food and especially service from beginning to the end of our meal. They served us warm delicous banana bread muffins that are homemade in house!! Then Dylan and I ordered half orders of Stuffed French toast with bacon and egg, veggie and bacon skillet, and Luis had the banana bread French toast combo. Everything was amazingly delicious. They serve large portions so if you don't want alot ask for a half order if it's available!! Make sure you check in on yelp for your banana muffin!! P.s. It's rare when I find a place I will write a review about. So check them out when your in Las Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best breakfast and service in town! This a half order of the Veggie and bacon skillet!! Sorry half eaten almost forgot to take a pic!! Yum

XvLGSBhHs1WLV4TuaDR7Yg.text: This place was amazing!! The service was super quick, and the servers were very friendly. Paula was amazing, and helped with my selections (she was spot on with her recommendations). I ordered the half chili skillet, and it was to die for. Absolutely perfect size portion and tasted incredible! I wish I could've brought home a million of the banana nut muffins. It was my first time here, and I definitely wish I could go back all the time!

I prefer to have my eggs cooked first, and the inside ingredients I prefer to have it cooked separately I think it brings out the flavor More. All in all a good place I would recommend it to others

Yr-ca5kAwMlrmxzvXZp6ZQ.text: Amazing portion size and really good brunch menu. The place has the 80s vibe which made the brunch experience even better.

A5Z3ms7GKXA20gLMiw3tuQ.text: Great customer service! Tamara was really nice  and the banana nut muffin was delish!!! Definitely going back for another. All the pigeons crowding the patio was pretty gross... they should do something about that.

lRq5_JJJ776yMbaemiCz0g.text: Omg what can you not say about this place that hasn't already been said. Amazing food, service, and the banana nut muffin mmmmm. They are always busy when I go in however they continue to give great service every time.  Love this place

I0UUmeo-NhdY1EdWFF8h3w.text: Parking is no joke.  I thought two guys were going to exchange fists over a spot.  The parking lot is jammed.  Cars circle like sharks with blood in water ready to pounce on any opening.  We found a dude going to his car. He got in and proceeded to start texting.  We were visibly waiting, but he seem oblivious.  After waiting for around 10 minutes. I got out of my rental and walked up to his dusty Toyota and knocked on the window.  He finally back out and I took his spot.  This place is packed but we were able to get seated in 15

KmnUYInbdPd-9hvLtSFdQA.text: Lacey was great! Was patient and had great recommendations. We will definitely be back. The food was amazing!

DnM5q0kY1RJl3UcpkJ8qsQ.text: You want a big and delicious breakfast after a night of drinking. This place is good!

mUXyEpxsDWMA5zsGcRtUhg.text: We're almost there at St. George Utah! But before heading to our final destination, we did a breakfast pit stop at the Egg & I in Las Vegas. I like how they 'egg'orated their restaurant; characters of the egg adorn the whole restaurant. I also liked how they did on a spin on the breakfast menu names. I had an Egg Works Country Fried Steak.  My breakfast meal was good; country steak was delicious, gravy was good, and the eggs (over medium) were cooked spot on. The Diablo Seasoned potatoes were a little on the salty side though. What I and the rest of my friends agree is that their Banana Nut Muffin was very delicious.

76hKyUObcXulioDLbc25xA.text: This location is very speedy, so if you have a big day planned & need to eat fast, it's a great place to stop!   The tables are spacious, with plenty of room in between (not over-crowded) as many tend to be.     I had the spinach Benny, which was very good, the hollandaise was a bit salty for me, but my husband said it was just right.    His California crepe was very good, loaded with delicious guac too!   Another wonderful location, grab a bite to eat here, you can't go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California crepe- what you can&#39;t see is the delicious guacamole hidden inside, so good!

Xh1zYCpU5rV8jiTJ_HIevw.text: We came here on our way home from Vegas for breakfast and I have to say it was amazing very filling ...but my fav part was the free muffin with check in it was amazing and our server was so sweet ..I wish remembered her name . But my famliy and I really liked it here .

XoyFejCxBO3wq_phJSe-HQ.text: Totally worth it if you are a breakfast junkie as I am.  The waffle was amazing and so were the potatoes!

2G2Kvvyo3kUVb0DBPnTu2A.text: This place is pretty good, they give you a lot of potatoes and they are seasoned with a yummy flavor! It's a bit of a way off the strip but worth the trip. Good prices and service.

GU03UGfqAiKr-VvcNyXZQw.text: Great food and awesome staff! Have to try their banana bread it's to die for!! This was our first time there and everyone like the meal. Large portions at a good price

2RuKj64RJgPeiJbNNsAIEA.text: I got the Works Veggie Benny and it was filling and delicious! It was a hearty meal as it included spinach, tomatoes, and avocados with a side of some potatoes seasoned with the famous Hablo Diablo! The customer service is on point with the "Let Us Know If You Need Service" egg flipper on the table. Reminds me of how Brazilian restaurants have those red and green things to let them know when to come to your table or not.  P.S. Make sure to check-in and get a FREE banana muffin! It's so moist and is a great way to end a meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hahha I like that. How eggscellent!

2bGrSYJ6dmamTrLwSaQcxQ.text: If you check in you can get a free banana nut muffin and trust me. You definitely want one. It comes out warm and delicious and we just devoured them. I got the bacon and onion skillet and it was amazing. A little on the salty side but I mean, I got bacon.

p-IXGg8E0WIigF34QcYAvg.text: Came here and got the sundance special. Very very tasty and huge portions. Service here is excellent. Place is super duper packed so expect a wait. Well worth it
