ZP7wj7QgLvdoNH_kPmLv5w.text: I stopped by with my hubby for a late brunch. We arrived about 10 minutes before the kitchen closed. No problem. We ordered the waffle with turkey sausages and eggs. We both commented on how fresh and tasty the food was although we arrived at closing. Our server was "the hostess with the mostest." The food was reasonably priced as well. When visiting Vegas, I like to try places off the beaten path. This is one I'll definitely return to again.

y6PkuC-pB_uAmgFmpDMe1Q.text: Just got here been going here all my life so good it's always amazing nothing here is bad it's all great and the staff are cool but they get busy and I mean busy like line out the doorbut the shit is good lmao

lI5kvTMHXN6pG77pOgAnmQ.text: The service is very friendly, the menu is huge, and the food is massive, but that's kind of it. We ordered a variety of food (mashed potato stuffed omelette, chili over hash, and french toast), and it was all huge and heavy. The banana muffin that comes with everything was delicious but very sweet and oily. It's a lot like Cheesecake Factory meets Vegas breakfast dinner. I would recommend "eat." far more for a place with stunningly delicious food.

Ts0PMaa7FrqxuFqTtZtEwQ.text: Egg-cellent Food, Egg-ceptional Service! Definitely worth the 20 minute wait on a Sunday morning.  My wife was not feeling well and just picked at her food.  The manager came by to make sure everything was alright, we explained that Ellen was not feeling well, but the food was great.  Without even asking she took $4.00 off the bill.  Now that's Customer Care.  If your in Las Vegas and want a great breakfast, with caring servers, at reasonable price, go to the EGG & I.

bnZsB8rBpe-3ERgx0snyTg.text: We seem to have arrived at exactly the right time, about 9:15, and immediately got a table.  Afterwards every time I looked up the on-deck bench was full.  Our order was taken promptly but there was a bit of a delay before it came.  I had the Works Skillet and my wife had a California Crepe.  We thought both of them were delicious, and there was plenty to eat.  So much that about half of our order came home in a box.  It was open seating and a bit noisy so don't expect much privacy, although that wasn't a big issue with us.  The staff was courteous, and prompt with the extras we asked for.  The cashier was, to use and old phrase, "bubbly" while checking out a line of people, a trait that we found refreshing for such a busy place.  We were very satisfied and agree that they lived up to the positive reviews that we used to chose them.

8tNKJsUAwsKCWMfEoCFcOg.text: I have been coming to Las Vegas for YEARS! My father moved to Las Vegas almost 20 years ago. The one place that is MUST for us to go to for an amazing breakfast is the Egg & I restaurant.   This last visit was no exception to any of the past visits. The food was so fantastic. The options were endless. Who knew you could prepare eggs so many delicious and wonderful ways?  Lindsay our waitress was very friendly and helpful. We brought our youngest son on this trip (for his 21st birthday) and he was having a hard time making a selection. Lindsay took the time to answer all of his questions and gave him a great recommendation of the country fried skillet. He LOVED IT!!! Thank you LIndsay!  All I can say is - if there is a line or a wait (and there most likely will be) then take the time because it is worth it. The coffee is fresh and hot and the banana nut muffins are a MUST (unless you are allergic of course).  We only waited about 15 minutes and our food was on the table - pipping hot. I ordered my favorite - the Greek scramble. FOUR eggs, chicken, spinach, mushrooms,and feta cheese make up this belly busting breakfast. It is served with choice of toast or muffin (I got the muffin) and breakfast potatoes.   My hubby ordered the Chili omllete and he had a choice of chili's. His came with the same sides only he ordered toast instead of a muffin. I have no idea why because that muffin is served warm with butter. YUM!!!  Cost is a little higher than say a Perkins or iHop - but the food is SO much better! Expect to pay about $ 15 per person including a beverage. Serving size is SO BIG that you could almost split something and share.

uWoOdwE5AsxCEArubOYxdA.text: This is our favorite breakfast spot because the most amazing waitress is here Karla, we love Karla she makes us feel like family every time we come!! She knows our order and can anticipate our every need.  The foods delicious of course, but the real reason we drive, wait and happily spend our money here is due to the incredible service we always get from our favorite waitress Karla. Ask for her and trust me she is worth the wait!!

u4bpj7V4fGV7SzWUeqM-RA.text: First time here the food was fantastic. Busy but the wait wasn't long, it's run very efficiently. Karla was our waitress and was fantastic! We will definitely be coming back on our next trip to Vegas!

sRNtEFjfilLqjFmPkKthcw.text: Food... Eggs'cellant !  (sorry) had to do that.  Agree with the other reviews here, the homemade banana-nut muffin was worth the drive.  Served warm...and I'm not a banana 'anything' lover,  but I'd order it again anytime.  This review is more about our Waitress, her name is Linnea.  We were seated promptly, and quickly thereafter a smiling young woman appeared at our table, offering water and taking drink orders.  Each time she returned to our table she had such a  genuinely  engaging smile.  "Now there is a young woman who is one of God's Happy Creatures" I said.  She truly was delightful!

RVljr-IhTzFgHRSF9F6CZA.text: Karla is the best!!!! Great service and very very very fast!!! Give her a raise guys and a big tip when you go!!!   Food was good!!! Definitely coming back!

-GKHTUY7dWHaT7NVdEJulw.text: Dawg.... Amazing. Their omelette's are 5/5. Stuffed French Toast is amazing as well. You'll love this spot.

3dlduAchr18buZuKDprrXg.text: Wow their banna bread is perfectly made. 1st time visitors get it for free. This is a great place to have breakfast or a brunch. Get their early or you will wait. Get off the strip and get real home cooking 10 minutes away.

X9Z_dpnMdin6OeU3Yn25vg.text: Alexa was great - take her to Orlaaaaaaaandooooooo! The food was absolutely amazing! 10/10 would come here again. Huge portions and extremely good!!!

wPtgJS4XPHEWmzQvl4fJ_Q.text: Wow!  Decided to eat away from the tourist spot.  I found a coupon in one of the LV booklets you get at the hotel, it was buy one get one free breakfast. This place is definitely worth going to.  It's about 10mins from the strip.  Food:  Corned Beef Hash and eggs, Eggs Benedict Florentine,  Banana muffins.  Corned Beef Hash:  husband really enjoyed the "real" corned beef in the hash!  Eggs Benedict Florentine:  Yummy!  The sauce was delicious, I think I would stick with the original eggs Benedict.  The spinach was served fresh and not sauteed which I was expecting.  Banana Muffins:  this is what they are known for!  Must get them!! They were so good, we ordered 6 to take back to the hotel!  The service was AWESOME too :)

a6ZeZ6QsUWmO-rJCqgU94Q.text: We ate here on our last day in las Vegas. We were looking for a place to eat off the strip and I'm glad we found this restaurant.  The portions are huge, more bang for your buck. I ordered the half portion of the southwest omelette and my husband ordered the chicken fried steak and we both were satisfied.

DlADeI3PEgUiJiAykxIY6A.text: Service is great, price is great, portion is generous, however the foods are too salty. The gravy, the potatoes have too much seasoning salt. Everyone on our desk are commenting about how salty the foods are.

-I27zniYudMwwgwYwYd0Vg.text: The banana nut muffin is to die for! A must have when you're here. We had the Country Benny and The Classic and both were great - the potatoes especially surprised me! Portions are generous though; so us three girls shared the two portions with more than enough to go around.

HRYl6GkRvvQvq_gETzRHLw.text: This place was packed when we walked in but didn't have to wait too long (for a party of 2). They sat us outside. The tables were big and they had misters, so that was cool. I checked in on yelp and got a free banana nut muffin, which was delicious! I ordered the country fried steak and my husband ordered the fiesta skillet, added chorizo to it. Both meals were served in big portions, on a hot plate, and they were delicious! Our waitress was attentive, which we really appreciated. The OJ was a little pricey ($3.25) but other than that, the prices were decent. The only reason I'm knocking off a star, is because we asked for a cup of ice to-go, (we're from CA, and planned on driving home after our meal. Wanted the ice for water on the road) and when the ice melted there was some sort of dirt in the bottom of the cup. I'm not sure if she gave us a dirty cup or if they have dirty ice. Either way, it was gross.

Last time I was here I even saw a guy commenting to his waitress how great their taco salad was.  I love a place that is always good everytime I go, consistent with service and food quality.  I think they even sell their own hot sauces now.    This is a spot I try to hit every time I'm in Vegas.

Our waitress, Kelli, was super attentive and timely, but not in your face.  The food was spot on. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.

_nhjwfi_vy5rdEzsKv4Lpg.text: It was so crowded when we came in for a table for two. We didn't wait long as we were seated in less than 5 minutes. We were seated outside and thank the Lord for lite spray misters. I decided on a veggie omelet with bacon add-on. The order comes with these fried potato cubes seasoned with their special season and it's hella good. The omelet was cheesy and delicious paired with the crispy seasoned potatoes. Coffee alone just makes everything better. Service was great and it's a cool local spot. Nice change from the crazy ass Strip.

N4lCIfjMsc891M6ICFDxvQ.text: I found this place on vacation. Pure luck! I loved it.  Today I woke up craving a muffin and an enchilada omelette and of course the potatoes.   Feeling like I'd fly back from Chicago just to go eat there! Great job guys

mEYI-tzRmQMWXxA0GgNQkw.text: Kind of disappointing. We've been here several times over the years and generally been happy. But things have gone down hill and our group of five were all disappointed.   First they were out of several things that a breakfast place which has been in business for years should not run out of. Like bread for French toast, one of their more popular items should always be in stock.   But what really surprised us is how cheap they've gotten and lazy with inferior ingredients. Hash-browns were those frozen oval patties you buy at Sams or Costco in bulk. Tasteless and cheap. How hard is it for a breakfast joint to make real hash browns? My son ordered country potatoes and they too were from frozen and preseasons. They same kind you can buy at any grocery store.   I asked for a blueberry muffin but was told those were also store bought. The waitress suggested the banana muffin which they do make which was very good.   My wife ordered maple bacon French toast which seemed to be made of a muffin batter. That doesn't really work for French toast as it's heavy and doesn't get crisp or toasted at all. The whipped maple bacon stuff tasted of old rancid grease, it was lumpy and everyone of us who tasted it said it seemed like diary gone bad like lumpy old milk! Three of us were sick to our stomachs all morning.   Hey but at least service was slow and it was extremely noisy to the point that I had to go outside to escape the noise.   I doubt we'll ever be back. Our waitress was attentive though.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito

ubvdHbm8ps1EAI2CpQ9y0w.text: Breakfast and brunch spot in the Sahara area.  We came for Sunday brunch. TIP: they stop seating at 3pm. The menu has a huge selection of breakfast dishes as well as lunch selections like sandwiches.  I had the prime rib eggs Benedict. Instead of an English muffin, it was served on a croissant. It came with country potatoes. I really enjoyed it and the croissant was an interesting but delicious variation.  They do serve mimosas and Bloody Mary's but it is not bottomless.  Outdoor pet friendly seating is available.

DvXCXh7ci_IKXENz2-L7Kg.text: Delicious breakfast. Huge portions. The fresh fruit was ripe and tasty. Kelli, our server, was very attentive. My only suggestion would be to use real heavy cream for the coffee instead of creamer.

We didn't wait very long for service.   I accidentally forgot my phone on the table and it had been only two minutes so my husband went to get it from the table and they had already cleaned the table. The cashier had it and was waiting for it to be retrieved.

I had the works veggie Benny and it was delicious! The potatoes on the side are a must too! The seasoning is slightly spicy and so yummy. The complimentary banana nut muffin was tasty too. Staff was attentive and we went at a time where there was no wait (Sunday at 9 am). Would recommend if you are looking for breakfast/brunch off of the strip.

And my boyfriend ordered the Original breakfast burrito with potatoes. The burrito had eggs, sausage, bacon bits, cheese, and onions on a warm flour tortilla.   Ordering was super easy and the food wait time was great.

s4Q0kpVxFb7dmqmZ3cBnMw.text: Who doesn't love eggs in the morning. This classic breakfast spot in Vegas has reviews galore. I remember coming here a few years back but I don't remember what I had. But this second time the food is unforgettable and the staff much kudos to them. The stuff French toast and the banana bread French toast were wonderful. Not to mention the fresh baked banana bread for my kids. The wait staff was so friendly and great with our kids, they made quite a mess but the staff was quick to clean and reassure us. Customer service is always key to a great experience especially in my book. This place ranks one of my top spots in Vegas for breakfast, lunch or even dinner if you love eggs as much as we do.

A lot of that is because of the service we received from Lacey our waitress.  She made excellent recommendations from our coffee and omelette suggestions to our cocktail drinks.  We enjoyed EVERYTHING!! She had the Sundance Special Omelette and I had the Egg-taliano!! Seriously.... we are from Philly and so glad we came.  In fact we cancelled our brunch reservation for Sunday at a place on the strip and will be coming back here tomorrow to see Lacey at the Sahara Avenue location!!!!

hsA62uwecOeWYyxQ567cug.text: On our way out of Vegas back to Oceanside, I was searching for a place for my husband and I to have breakfast, and found Egg & I on Yelp. With all the stellar reviews, it wasn't a hard sell! Located in a strip mall, it's unassuming from the outside but super cute on the inside! The ceiling is a vibrant green, and there is a farm/county-esque mural on on the wall, with other fun rustic touches.   We were seated and greeted by Cece, who brought coffee and took our orders, letting us know that if we needed anything at all, to just flip the little egg over at the end of the table, and someone from their staff would come right over. I accidentally tested it by reaching over to check it out, and as soon as I did, a gentleman rushed right over asking whether I needed anything. Now that's attentive service!!  Just a warning - if you are a fairly healthy eater or are sensitive to too much fat, oil, etc., come prepared to modify your order to omit certain things or ask for a smaller portion (which is a great option!). The skillet breakfasts we both ordered arrived (they were pretty huge) absolutely encased in cheese. I pulled about a 1/2 pound of melted cheese off my skillet before I even began eating, and I'm glad I did, because my husband didn't and had a stomachache later. They also cooked their eggs perfectly - my request for over-medium came as-ordered with no runny white (which I hate), and my husband's over-hard eggs were good too.   Settle your check up at the register at the end of your meal like the old days. Great little place! I would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kgDacPVoFprsg_fT4R0TCg.text: Yelp saves the day again when it comes to finding delicious brunch spots! Saw this place get really good reviews so decided to give it a shot. Came here with a group of 4 on a Saturday morning around 10 AM and it was jam packed! Our wait was only 10 minutes though so no complaints here. The staff were all so friendly, helpful, and welcoming.   When you check in on Yelp, you get a free Banana Nut Muffin! WINNING!  Our server, Penny, was so happy we were using Yelp and said she'd even bring us 2 muffins for free! That was super nice of her. The Banana Nut Muffin here is amazing! Homemade, fresh, moist, and comes out perfectly warm. I'm not even a fan of Banana Nut Muffins, but damn, they don't play here!!!  I ended up ordering the Prime Rib Eggs Benedict and my wife got the Chicken Fried Steak Skillet. My in-laws shared the Prime Rib Eggs Benedict. The portions here are huge! Our food came out super hot/fresh and in a timely manner. My eggs were perfectly poached and their house Hollandaise sauce was the bomb! Perfect creaminess and flavor. The chunks of prime rib were tender and well seasoned. I love how they used a crispy croissant as the base of the benny instead of an English muffin. Very different and unique! I had a bite of my wife's skillet and thought it was OK. If you come here, you have to eat the Prime Rib Benny and their Banana Nut Muffin. I'd come back here just for those two items alone!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak Skillet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib Eggs Benedict. You can see my devoured muffin in the background. So good!

lfWEmhFmKhQNP4modf_fEg.text: This place gets packed on a Sunday morning and now I know why. Great portions for good prices and flavor to spare. Next time I'm in Vegas I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good to me!

F7YSjQR8--tZKNhsEfApcg.text: Came here few days ago, their banana muffin is really yummy! Service is fine but their other food is not that great as everyone says.. my skillet was barely warmed enough to melt the cheese. I've had better hot smoky skillets from applebees! The potatoes are all premade and were dry by the time we ate (afternoon)

bGOeGu_YySMJZbUUebqAUw.text: Oh wow, those banana nut muffins are a piece of heaven. I first tried the Egg & I last year when I came to Vegas. I don't know what they put in their food but I always come back for more. Their omelettes are beautiful, thick, and not to mention VERY tasty. This past visit, I had the Fiesta skillet. I can't say it was better than the veggie omelette though. I personally like my potatoes very crispy and I didn't think of the fact that the potatoes that come in the skillet are in a sauce so they inevitably lost some of their crispness. Now I know to just order the sauce on the side because nothing beats the flavor in each of their meals.  The atmosphere resembles that of a True American diner. The service is great. I've never had to wait for a seat and I have gone on weekends every time. Eat here!

MlRroLmlgo_tgjU5jeaNMg.text: AMAZING breakfast!!! I got the chile relleno omelette and I almost regret it because I know I'm going to crave it and I won't be able to travel back to this awesome restaurant for a long time! I also ordered a side of banana pancakes that were DELISH. They were super fluffy and overall had perfect texture. The service was also 5/5! My server was nice, helpful, and attentive. If you've come across this place on Yelp, just GO NOW. IT WAS WORTH EVERY PENNY!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Relleno Omelette

3D3shIiFGK1h9HFFrEtZLA.text: I'm from Los Angeles but everytime I go to Vegas, there's no way me and my wife would stop by here to have breakfast. This is the best breakfast place in town and we always love their unique entries as well as their servings are more compare to others. Definitely recommended!

ljlYgYD403gq9frNLagZiQ.text: After being hung over , I wanted a nice hearty breakfast. My aunt recommend this place to me, she raves about it . I didn't want any of these boujee places . The breakfast was affordable and delicious. I had the veggie scramble and he had the breakfast sandwich which was huge .   I was disappointed by the potatoes . The menu made it seem they were good but they were dried out and flavorless .  Our waitress was jelly and she was super friendly

s52vCCVqiWTMeWmFFtka_Q.text: Such a fabulous breakfast spot in Vegas!   My friends and I wanted to grab breakfast off of the strip and were impressed by the high rating of Egg & I. It truly lived up to the hype.  SERVICE:  We had a very friendly server who gave us some great tips on the menu. For example, you can get half orders for almost all of the breakfast entrees. Since it was our first time, she also gave us complimentary banana nut muffins. DELICIOUS.  FOOD: SO. DAMN. GOOD.  Large portion sizes and excellent flavor!  I ordered the bacon and avocado omelette and was super impressed.   The seasoned potatoes were perfect, too. Yummy.   The OJ was fresh squeezed too.   OVERALL:  Egg & I lived up to the hype and is the perfect spot if you're craving breakfast away from the hustle and bustle of the strip.

uCJh6ztmoEnwaozF5aTNJA.text: The to-go packaging was an "A".  I got breakfast burrito with potatoes and THE BANANA muffin. Oh boy, I think I would go back just for the muffin. If you check in on yelp you get one for FREE! The burrito was average. Heavy on the eggs and cheese. Barely any meat (chorizo). I should have asked if they can replace with sausage.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8LehWaff4vzJ9Ksh4z1RJg.text: Little to no wait time. Nice waitress who brought us a free banana nut muffin( I don't care for bananas but it was okay.) my boyfriend ordered biscuits and gravy which was good but my Cabo breakfast burrito tasted like Taco Bell.

gln5lmZGvbDB_U0aatduGw.text: Real fast was delicious! Huge menu. Staff was so friendly & helpful. Only a 20 minute wait on a Sunday morning. Line was out the door. Kelly was our waitress. She was great. Boyfriend said it was one of the best breakfasts he's ever had. Def come if you want something off the craziness of the strip. Parking was easy.

_0_r24CFYjOJZKIFoY2tww.text: The inside of this location was fairly small. You are set rather close to other tables. We went on a busy day so it was a little cramped. We ordered the Maple French toast and 2/3 did not like it. They were really mushy and flavorless. The omelet I had was a Chile relleno omelet and it was delicious. The potatoes that came with it are just that, fried up and seasoned. They are more of a French fry than a homestyle potato. The dishes were okay nothing to wild to rave about.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menus

tRppejaVjUYU4U8_xYJOOQ.text: This is the best breakfast place in vegas! Tamara Was our server and she was very attentive and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach benny= Delicious!

-9JpfIlJxyWydVVxUFyOpg.text: This is my go-to spot for breakfast/brunch off the strip! I always make sure to stop by here at least once during my Vegas visits. I usually go on weekdays with family at around 10 am, and there's normally no wait during then. Service is fast, and the staff is super friendly and polite! They give you large portions for what you pay, and, in my opinion, there are no bad items on the menu. My favorite items to get though are any of their Eggs Benedict.   Definitely come here if you're looking for a cheaper brunch option while vacationing in Vegas. Their food honestly beats any other breakfast you'll find on the strip for the prices they offer!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie eggs benny with Spanish rice and beans for the side! Delicious!

ERHolbE3h9KN81ThXNLWoA.text: Great place for breakfast. I came around 9, it seemed like a busy time but we were seated right away. The service was great, servers were nice & attentive. I ordered a veggie skillet, checked in & for a free banana nut muffin. The muffin was SO GOOD! Environment is like any other breakfast place .. a little loud, a little small/cramped with space but it wasn't bad. They have a waiting area so you're not just standing by the door waiting. I yelped this restaurant & chose it based on how many stars & reviews they had.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front menu

xHnVtDMYWpJ9L6NHksizxg.text: Cute spot but not updated. The food was a delicious decent portion. I had the egg Benedict with steak, potatoes and to drink a coffee with Kahlua. I was super full once I was done eating most of my meal.  The food had plenty of flavor. It was definitely worth going away from the strip to try this place out. The menu looks like a newspaper. Very creative!  They take all major credit card but Amex. Checkout was easy. Once you get your receipt/check from your server, walk to the cashier to pay. Sorta like a Bob Evan's or Perkins.  I would visit this place again. Happy belly! The service is great. Our server was on point. We were given a warm banana Nut bread muffin to begin... yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vXj7wz5IgL8mLvRkN09YSA.text: Always trying to find good breakfast places I haven't eaten at. This place was a WIN! One of several locations in Nevada, they all have a train track that circles around the room above your head. The one at our location wasn't quite done being built but looked cool anyway. Food selection was huge and delicious. I would definitely go back again!

zldM1EudL3MRyY37d2-LeQ.text: Egg & I only opens until 3 pm every day.  We came here around 1 pm for a very late breakfast. It's a great place for a big breakfast if you like eggs. The price is decent you get what you pay for.  They have many substitute options for each dish such as protein, fruit, potato and other things you can pick instead of the original dish. I think this is a great recovery and hangover breakfast place after a wild night out in Las Vegas.

Clp36-Vygeg3_KPuMyxYuQ.text: I heard about this place from some friends. So i decided to stop by before i went to work a few days ago. I was not disappointed. portions were big and delicious. I had the Piggy skillet with home fries and a side of biscuits and gravy. I was not disappointed. A must try place.

bHSQbZx02V3l78XurLfQNg.text: I love this place.  They have great food and great service.  What more can you ask for from a restaurant?  I would highly recommend this place for breakfast or brunch.  SO DELICIOUS!

_7fN0T6J_xfhJyQMVrvAMw.text: The food here is good, but not great. I ordered the Sunrise Mountain, and appreciated getting a slice of watermelon and a couple of slices of pineapple when I ordered fruit instead of potatoes. The restaurant itself is decorated in a kitschy Western style, with a little train that runs along its track near the ceiling. You pay using a device that sits on your table, but if you have a credit card with a chip that doesn't have the 'tap' feature, it's not a straightforward experience.

44yQySXL7qeOc6ubTpUlpg.text: Hard to imagine a 5 star breakfast but this place did it!  Great food for everyone in our party along with excellent service.  They cover all the basics fully along with special additions (home made chili omelette was outstanding).  First time here, but it's now my go to spot for breakfast/brunch!

K3bR-BWfmDAl5uqjNUZZPA.text: I LOVE this place! It is consistently first quality food! I take out of town guests here for breakfast. Huge portions. Great service. Great menu with some craveable specialties you can't get anywhere else.   Some of my favorites are the carnitas and egg breakfast with tomatillo salsa and a side of their breakfast potatoes. Yum! Also, their banana bread muffins are addictive. They also have killer biscuits and gravy and the prime rib eggs benedict are decadent!   ps. Their burgers and salads are really delicious for lunch as well! My mouth is now watering.

Ar8BI56_q9ydL33T4lPXmg.text: I didn't want to waste my money on the crappy over priced breakfast at the hotel so I Googled good spots and found this one. It was a quick drive from the strip and definitely worth it! Service was great and the food was so yummy! I am definitely going here again before I leave.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NJafQ0sjBsPhBgINlyR-FQ.text: Their service is amazing! Their waiting list was on point, Great staff, constantly checking up on us once seating, BUT!.... the food fell short. You could tell it's pre packaged food, potatoes are perfectly square and overly seasoned! Whatever happened to freshly cut, grilled and served? Same for the meat within my omelet, "steak" pieces perfectly cut with fake grill marks, it was not fresh at all. If only their food was freshly made it would be the best gourmet breakfast place in Vegas.  Amazing service Terrible food

b0GDlKbsE_-sW8_8j4_s1g.text: Tam was amazing!!!!! Funny and great recommendations on food  if you guys love eggs this place is to go to!

-A2hg5HNngHPa9Gm0dXISQ.text: As classically delicious as breakfast gets!  I definitely suggest to be ready to wait, but it's bearable aside from there being a very small area inside to wait. The muffins are great :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1qticP0xedPHcRIF9q32XQ.text: FYI: While this offer lasts, check-in for a free Banana Nut Muffin, you will not regret it!   What a gem to have in Las Vegas, definitely one of the best breakfast spots I've ever had. After looking up a few places, ie. Denny's, Hash House a Go Go, we decided to come here even though it's off the strip. We took a Lyft from Venetian and the ride was only $11.   With a party of 10, we thought that the wait would be around an hour, hour and a half, but amazingly, it was only thirty minutes. If you are coming here though, expect a long wait, so be patient, but it's worth the wait! Once we got seated, they handed us menus which looks like a daily newspaper. Deciding what to eat here was probably one of the hardest decisions I've had to make since there are 8 pages of food to read. Took a while but I finally decided on the Santa Cruz Skillet.   Santa Cruz Skillet: The order came with toast and butter (since I got the muffin with the check-in) and sunny-side up eggs. The potatoes, chorizo, Santa Cruz sauce and the runny yolk was probably the best breakfast you could ask for after a night of drinking. Portion-wise, you could easily share this with another person but I was able to finish it on my own.   Service was amazing throughout the meal, they have a system where you flip the happy egg to a sad egg whenever you need something, genius! I would have subtracted a star for them bringing out the 2 Bloody Mary's and Michelada after we almost finished the food, but they didn't charge us for the drinks in the end. On top of that, 7 of us checked-in for the free Banana Nut Muffin. I can't stress this enough, don't forget to check in! Will be back here for sure to try the other items on the menu.   Beware: You will get a food coma after eating here, we all ended up taking a nap in the room afterwards, but once again, soo worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Santa Cruz Skillet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. time to read the newspaper

zDJbBQEzuvW0EyQzViqoug.text: We can at breakfast anytime any meal period!  The wait was manageable as we arrived in between the early morning rush and weekend late breakfast crowd.  We can tell why it is a local favorite as it the staff offers a warm welcome.  Their famous banana muffin arrived almost immediately after we put in the order.  It was so light, fuffy, yet sticky, we could have easily eaten a full loaf just the two of us.  We didnt realize you can order the full lf until a plate was served near us...   Their menu (made to look like the morning paper - clever concept!) offered an abundant options that it could be overwhelming.  They dropped our veggie eggs benedict, so they had to fire it again... the spinach was left raw and piled in top of the itty bitty english muffin and slivers of avocados.  We love spinach, but the proportions were off - would have liked a slightly sauteed spinach or place a smaller portion of raw leaves.  Our other orders were a classic over easy eggs with spicy seasoned potatoes with an xtra side of waffles.  Since they had to re-fire the eggs benedict, the egg was luke warm and waffles were not as golden crispy as we liked.  Whoever made our batch of coffee added too much water as it was missing that needed caffeine perk.  Im sensitive to caffeine and even I thought it was too weak.    We love the vibe of this breakfast spot, so hopefully, it will be a win next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7TDeBEi96FCXc4wYFg5qmg.text: First time here, the food was amazing!! I had The Works Skillet: Ham, bacon, sausage, mushrooms, onions, peppers, and tomatoes with a banana nut muffin and OMG!!!! It was delicious and filling! My friend had the Italian skillet however, she did not enjoy her meal. The portions are huge which I like. The wait time was 40 minutes but we did go on a Sunday around 11 AM. The staff is very friendly and our server didn't come around as often as I would have liked but when she did come around she was attentive and make sure we had everything. This is definitely a place that I will visit again when I do come back to Vegas. It is off of the strip which is another good thing. The Lyft ride over was a shared ride & we only been paid $3.00 for both of us. Highly recommend trying this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ihCvr0ZrYjTMyq3f-ADsrA.text: They have the bestttttt breakfast in town! It was worth the long wait in line! Can't wait to come back!

WOodSkCimR92YVoN3C_D0g.text: Nothing beats starting your day in Vegas indulging an eggcelent hearty breakfast.   Egg & I is a casual breakfast joint, offering warm hospitality, home-like atmosphere and American faves food, making it a great place for enjoying a laid back meals. We decided to pay a visit to this happening place on weekend at around 11 a.m., and it was packed! The wait was tediously long, but it was so worth it; as they really live up to the hype by offering an extensive menu of breakfast goods at an affordable prices.   For breakfast, it's egg benedict all the way for me! Ordered their Blackened Prime Rib Benny:  buttery slabs of croissants underneath tender, juicy prime ribs, topped with sauteed vegetables and hollandaise sauce. Nothing on this plate disappoints me! Nothing! All of them were superb, I personally love their habla diablo potatoes, it was crunchy and seasoned perfectly. The price for my breakfast is about $14; which is more than reasonable, especially if you witness the portion...  And if huge pan of egg benedict and half a plate of yummy potato goodness is not enough... wait for it.. They give you even more. As an offer for Yelp check-in, they generously gave us four of their famous banana muffins.  IT IS TO DIE FOR!!  Overall, if simple ambiance and BIG (tasty) breakfast experience is your cup of tea, Egg & I definitely will not disappoint. What a delicious find and happy to recommend this spot to you :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened prime ribs egg Benny. King of breakfast!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The banana nut muffins w/ Yelp check-In.

PElmFgAFP_ez2DaBTf-2hg.text: A must try! Great service, atmosphere, and best of all, food! We ordered the bacon and avocado omelette (1/2 size for me was plenty!) and the poached egg (something "Benny".) Both were delicious! You can't leave without trying the banana bread- Yum!!! Their salsa was also really good.   The only thing I'm mad about was they offer a military discount and I completely forgot to ask for it when I paid (my bad). But I SO appreciate that they offer this to our military. The next time I visit Vegas, I'll be sure to visit again. Great place!!!

_kWUXnBA3srrXIOKJ1L11Q.text: Delicious food and great service!  Very accommodating for food substitutes!  Everything was fresh and the banana nut muffin is a must!  Anytime I'm in Vegas I will make sure to visit here!

--XDvaDzh7iAr9UhN5wWcQ.text: I've been coming to egg & I for the last 3 years after EDC and it I'm never have nothing bad to say. 1st of all of you have a large party you will be seated as soon as your entire party shows up which is great because no one should be late for a brunch. With that been said I've have the best customer service from this place even when is a mad house. The patio has a great view and also is pet friendly . They also give you this little egg on top of your table to tell the waiter how the service is. A black egg says everything is fine and a yellow egg is you need service.  The menu is vast everything from Biscuits and Gravy, waffles, omelettes, wraps, and sandwiches also prices are really good for the amount of food you receive.  Thumbs  6 six stars

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nhv5trAA1gh58hsaYZwdLQ.text: Breakfast was delicious. We ordered the Veggie skillet with avocado, it was very tasteful. Also, we got free banana muffins by checking in on Yelp, and for being our first time there our server also gave us free muffins to go. Overall service was great, we will visit again when in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Skillet add avocado

1QPCyMsN7ASn-xzPwfbkHQ.text: What can I freaking say that hasn't already been said? I have been here numerous times. I make sure to stop here every time I go to Vegas. The breakfast is to die for! The scramblers are amazing along with their warm banana nut muffin... so good! Service was always great when I go. Never had a problem. Staff super friendly. The only thing is on the weekend you will probably have to wait 30+ minutes to be seated.  Thanks to the Food Network I found this gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scrambler with eggs, bacon, ham, peppers and onions.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belgium waffle with strawberries, bananas, and whip cream with eggs &amp; cheese and sausage
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast stuffed with eggs and bacon! Delicious

L3CtrLO6hDQ2yLbtttpz7w.text: Whenever I come visit my brother, we always eventually grab breakfast at Egg & I. It's kind of a mix between Cracker Barrel and a Dennys. They have an amazing banana nut muffin that I always try and make sure to order. It's a solid place, usually with a 20 minute wait, but nothing extraordinary.

HakisjY8iGB52A7LUhgZDg.text: After seeing all the 5 star reviews I was excited to try the Egg and I.  We arrived a little after 8am on Saturday morning and were immediately seated.  I do not remember the name of our server, but she was fantastic.  She was energetic, thoughtful and the type of server you hope to have during every dining experience.  The coffee and drinks flowed and she really knew the menu.  Top notch employee.  I ordered the mashed potato omelet, the hubs had the three pig omelet and the littles had the Mickey pancake with bacon.  We opted for the hashbrowns over the specialty potatoes and they were sad.  It was similar to two oval shaped McDonald's hashbrowns, which would have been fine, but they were over done and not too appealing.  The omelets were good and plentiful, but nothing out of the ordinary.  Unfortunately, the food did not live up to the hype.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't so good that I would go out of my way to visit when we're in Vegas.  They have an expansive menu that would satisfy any palette, I'm just not sure it's going to get us back.  To our sweet server (she was pregnant), you're a rockstar!

yuo79hwzvf0hUJC42h9HJA.text: If you're looking for a cheaper breakfast option off the Strip, I'd definitely recommend coming here! Call ahead of time, to see how long the wait is. They usually seat people fast, but because it is SO good, you should definitely expect to wait.   I'm so glad I took a group of 10 of my girlfriends here at the end of our Vegas trip. The portions were humungous and I had to challenge myself to finish my plate. Yes, the banana nut muffins do live up to its hype!! So delicious and so fresh. Most plates actually come with the banana nut muffin as an option, but they'll give you another one if you check in!  Their menu is EXTENSIVE. So if you are an indecisive person like I am, it'd probably help kill your wait time if you take a look at that menu to decide what you want! They offer breakfast sandwiches, french toast, egg bennys, OMELETTES, specialties, and more. I went for the chile relleno omelette and I'm SO glad I did! It wasn't too saucy and the sauce they offer is super good. Their POTATOES. SO GOOD. Thank god they let me get half potatoes half fruit, because the full portion of potatoes is HUGE!   My girlfriends and I all ordered different items on everyone enjoyed their meal :) I would say you probably can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Definitely coming again to end a Vegas trip.   Service is great. The interior decor is super cute. Very family friendly!  I spent $15 including tip for a HUGE breakfast so, yes, I'd say this is a very good breakfast deal located off the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed potato omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili relleno
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib Benedict

UGtqbLZkABJsg3cHbq_KcA.text: This place is great ! Very fast service ! The food is to die for and the banana nut muffin is highly recommended !

ur1OMPhzwQ2CnbkNRgy3bw.text: Man this food was good! Went out to Vegas this past weekend & decided to try this spot, instead of a "more known" name breakfast joint down the street, because they had a dog friendly patio. Lemme tell you, I am so glad I did! I had the Ruben & oh my gosh. So freaking good.  Took it home in our ice chest & had it the next day, still SUPER delicious!  Also, HIGH FIVE for treating my baby so lovingly. They gave her a bowl (paper) of fresh water & gave us another bowl for our leftovers. I'm always ecstatic when I'm allowed to bring my baby.   Thank you so much for the hospitality & AMAZING food! Can't wait to come back!

2OvsgwmqJ6OZa3pFhpTDnw.text: Can't say enough about this place. Just all-around good American, Mexican, and even Hawaiian breakfast food. We had the Sundance special omelette with a side of fruit and the chicken fried steak with the side of potatoes. The omelette was vegetarian and extremely flavorful. We love feta cheese and it comes loaded with it. The chicken fried steak comes with your choice of two eggs, toast, and potatoes. The steak is smothered in a flavorful white gravy. The portions are large so you can always take some food home for later  The service is great also. Our order came fast and easy. Don't forget to check in on Yelp to get your free banana nut muffin. They're very moist and delicious. It hits the spot when you're starving for a hearty breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with potatoes and a side of toast. Yummy!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sundance Special with fruit instead of potatoes

Wmi_sDT-0MYKv7qOKMmDwQ.text: This is definitely something I would totally  recommend,  the seasoning on the food. .delicious! !!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Works Omelet,  and the works crepe omelet

SAZ25b4R7ZWJMtYEvs68_w.text: If I'm ever back in the area I will stop by. The food was good and I enjoyed the free muffin for checking in on yelp.

VexCQ3BFtYY0q4Pqe8-CXA.text: This place was amazing. We had a little bit of a wait. They work like a well oiled machine. So organized and efficient. The food was delicious. You sign in and they can text you when your table is ready. You can check your place inline online. Definately recommend and will come again.

68xUsutG-ucCbJ3jbaP3gw.text: Service was outstanding from the beginning to the end of our visit. We were seated immediately after we walked in the full restaurant. The person who seated us also took our drink orders so we didn't have to wait for our waitress to get freed up.   I ordered the waffle works with strawberries and cream on top, came with turkey  sausage,  and eggs. The waffle  tasted a little  like heaven it was cooked perfectly the strawberries were fresh and sweet.  The sausage were tasty, and the scrabble eggs which I ordered egg whites were nice and fluffy.  I even redeemed my free banana  nut muffin.  Apparently, everyone loves the muffin but honestly I'm not in to banana  nut and this one did not change my mind. They give you so much food that you don't have room to eat another bite if you can finish the meal at all.  Egg and I had the best food, value and service that I found in Vegas for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle works and Pancake works

CbToSuV5gTqjsj3RqPRW6Q.text: Love the breakfast. We got the stuffed toast and the bacon avocado omelette. Portions are pretty big. Well worth the price. The potatoes on the side were really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado and bacon omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6tI2qMdt6FyZmtrLYRW2dA.text: We came as a group of 7 on Friday around 1:30pm and only had to wait for about 15minutes. Thank goodness the wait wasn't too long because by now we've been on the road for 5+ hours and we're starving!!!   I have a feeling that this place is super busy all the time--the restaurant is packed with people and the service is also super duper speedy, like the servers here are always on their toes to get people in and out as quickly as possible. But they're still super friendly, so I'm not complaining because I love the efficiency of this place.   F O O D: Honestly the food here was a pretty big disappointment. For some reason the food here was very very salty--the ham, the sauce, everything. Eating this makes me feel super gross and pretty terrible about myself. Especially because the portion sizes here are HUGE! My friend and I shared the Stuffed French Toast and we couldn't finish it (sorry potatoes :( ). So I recommend sharing just one thing between you and a friend or you can always take it to-go. I thought the Stuffed French Toast was really delicious because it wasn't salty at all, but our friends that got the Eggs Benedict dishes weren't so lucky :(   P A R K I N G: There is a parking lot right out front so no worries about parking!   Don't forget to check in for the free banana nut muffin! It's warm, it's wonderful, it's amazingly good!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast - so good!!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oatmeal

0dXyQVlZpmYDnVkQMALFWA.text: Great food, Great service. This place is located not too far from the strip so if you're not driving and don't wish to take an uber you can always catch the city bus here. There is a stop right in front of the restaurant.   We checked in and received a free muffin. It was delicious. The server even gave my friend one even though I was the o to one that checked in. I had so much food leftover. Didn't realize he portions would be so big. But it was wonderful. I will definitely be revisiting this place when I come back to Vegas.  I ordered the Sunrise Mountain and boy was it a mountain. I didn't even put a dent in to, but it was the Bomb.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise mountain and potatoes. Very delicious. It&#39;s a lot so you may want to share with someone if you don&#39;t eat much.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu. Lots of options to choose from.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best muffin ever. Don&#39;t forget to check in to get a free one.

YySSpEGU7U_2xTKIOUoBng.text: Soooooo good!!! Service and food was great. The food came out super fast too. It does get pretty busy, so be prepared to wait. Definitely worth it though!

YAcKk40cuV7_KBDcFkE1rg.text: Went here for brunch on a Saturday and this place was packed! We waited for 25 minutes for a party of 2 which wasn't really that bad of a wait but we were really hungry by the time we got a table. I got the works skillet with a banana muffin (I swear, best banana muffin I've ever had!), my bf got the mashed potato omelette with 4 pieces of toast on the side, and we also got an additional order of waffles with whipped cream!   The works skillet comes with works potatoes, bacon, sausage and ham, then topped with eggs (any style) and gooey cheese! So good and very very filling. The mashed potato omelette also comes with the works potatoes on the side. Seriously, the omelette is huge (4 eggs!)! It's filled with bacon and garlic mashed potatoes then topped with cheese and sour cream. The waffles are just okay, plain but tasty. We definitely enjoyed our meal!  Service was fast and excellent considering they were so busy that day. Our waiter is a pleasant guy and he's very efficient.   Our order came up to 35 bucks. Pretty reasonable since portions are huge, coffee is bottomless, and food is really good! Definitely coming back next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed potato omelet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works skillet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best banana muffin

xfIW1Qi4xyr7uHk38UozTQ.text: Went here on a Saturday morning. They take reservations on the phone but will only hold the table for you for 10 mins - so I suggest calling as you are on your way.  We had a big group (8 BABES)   Once we got there it was only a 15 min wait even if there was a ton of people waiting. Not sure if it was because we called in advanced.  This place is quite large on the inside with ample seating. A family environment.  They have this thing on the table similar to what I saw at Bubba Gumps where you can turn the sign to make it so that if a waiter sees it, they will help you. See pics!  If you check in VIA Yelp - you get a free Banana Walnut Muffin - but I got one anyways with my meal. I ordered the Sundance Special which was a veggie omelet with spinach, mushroom & artichoke hearts topped with tomatoes and feta cheese (which would lead to my later food poisoning - not through the fault of the restaurant but mine) It was super yummy but it was a huge serving so I had to take it home. FYI; leaving feta cheese in a car for 5 hours is never a good idea.  You pay up front. FYI.  I would recommend it as there are a ton of good choices for food and they all look good. There are a ton of choices for vegetarians as well. Always a PLUS!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla Cappuccino.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sundance Special.

eD8DzMYbFyNZXFoIX4od1w.text: Good breakfast... not a fan of the free Yelp "check in" banana nut muffin but other than that, a descent meal. Go early to avoid the weekend wait.

86lTEmE2ou7j40tFV6do4w.text: This place was awesome. The food was excellent and the service was great. The only thing is they are so busy it takes a while to get seated. This is definitely one of my go to places when in Las Vegas.

6ftNRstM1jU-17uuQCR6OA.text: Good place for breakfast. Its always good and the service is great. Evrtytime we come here there is always a wait. But the good thing about it is thst they will text you once your table is ready. Is worth the wait on a Sunday morning can get pretty busy. We will come back here again

VnpMAshrqV52prbi1868Qw.text: Awesome food and service.  Don't get disappointed if the crowd waiting looks big.  They have a great system to text you when you're table is ready AND at all times you can see your place in line through an internet link.

SO2lcS8h1f1jQg70SaNZ2Q.text: Best breakfast in Vegas. Took 10 Veterans to eat here and got 20% off for each meal. Great service. Big portions as well!!

644LaIxu1Y8rdabdxO_v_Q.text: I love this restaurant for Sunday brunch love the eggs Benedict my friend loves the outlets it's amazing everything seems so fresh the sides of fruit are wonderful the hot chocolate is awesome we love it and we'll keep coming back Sunday after Sunday

Z0iSXevaIsxv_D9mJpeJmg.text: One of the best breakfast/brunch places ever. Omelettes here are flavorful and filling, served with country potatoes. Choice of Toast or Banana nut muffin, chose banana nut muffin and boy was it a good choice. This muffin is closest to some of the best homemade-muffins I've ever tasted.  Will go there every time I'm in Vegas.

xWl2KzMelmG8ccqsi_jCVQ.text: We were in Vegas for the weekend and looking for a good breakfast spot and found it.   Despite being busy, the wait wasn't bad and the staff was very friendly.   Great breakfast choices and generous food portions.   Highly recommend!

SBpyeaiRC4S78MgJrlRUQg.text: I've been here 3 times though out all the years I have lived in Vegas and it has always been consistent in serving good food. There is always a wait too. Had the Blacken Prime Rib Benny,  it had a great flavor but instead of using a English Muffin, they used a grilled croissant, which I felt made it at little soggy during my last bites of it. Good drip coffee too.   When you check in they give you a banana muffin.

eMDswLjqU72CJaMWD8AF0A.text: This place was pretty good if you are looking for a break from the usual strip food and buffets. Free banana nut muffins. The French toast was still wet with batter which was off putting. The waitress put in a new and the manager came out to apologize, but it kind of ruined my appetite biting into toast soaked in batter. The portions here are very large. The Cincy style chili is pretty good also, but the food is honestly just OK. Would probably come back next time were in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vbCsvZntB3uhZxbm44WfVg.text: This week on diners, drive-ins, and dives.... my group and I took a chance on this place when we searched for brunch places on Yelp and I'm SO glad we did. The service was quick and respectful and the food was a savory spectacle.   We were a group of six arriving at peak brunch hour and we were seated in less than 5 minutes. Our dining experience began when we checked in on Yelp to get a free batch of their acclaimed banana nut muffins. Our server served them to us warm and they were perfect to peak our appetites for what was to be a massive, hearty breakfast. I ordered my own creation of the The Works skillet with country gravy on top while the rest of my group tried different variations of the Eggs Benny. The country gravy was the best I've ever had and the fresh ingredients in the rest of the skillet balanced the whole meal out. I was impressed with my friend's Eggs Bennies as well. You really can't beat their brunch especially at their modest prices.   This place is definitely gonna be a staple of my future Vegas trips

hFkemuCk0qqoIqdaKkVbNA.text: We went here on a Friday morning and we had attentive service. I've also went to egg works, but I actually liked the food better here even though they're all owned by the same people.  I got the stuffed French toast. It's French toast stuffed with eggs, cheese, and your choice of ham, sausage, or bacon. They also have turkey bacon. It also comes with a side of potatoes. I got the homemade orange juice again. It was really delicious but I couldn't eat it all. Afterwards, my waiter said they can do half portions! :)   My other members got burritos and stuffed French toast. They were gobbled up and said they were good.  We also got to claim the free muffin - it was moist and delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French toast

O4_XQg8C3VLjEtpDt6YxHA.text: We had fresh vegetable skillet and it was great. We should have taken their suggestion for a half order. There was a plenty of food with a full order. Totally agreed with others about their hot banana nut muffin. It was so good. We went there around 11am and were seated right away.   The place was in an old strip mall and needed some remodeling. However, the food was scrumptious. Definitely would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome fresh vegetable skillet.

1ddcvKNIm4J4HThD5Qu1hQ.text: I love this place!!!! If you are looking for a GREAT place for cheap delicious breakfast with excellent service then look no further!  I ordered the stuffed French toast and our waitress ( Amanda ) delivered it prompt and professionally. She definitely deserves to go to disney btw.  The portion was was generous and did I mention delicious ?!?

mmwVtMQgBK2RgZTjY5bzcA.text: OMG,lots of food!  Banana muffin was so yummy.  And they have reasonably price alcoholic beverages!  You won't leave hungry

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French toast, spinach eggs Benedict
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YHsNTaU-gNKOiKUPr8upIw.text: Did not meet the expectations of all the other reviews. There were 4 of us and had some basic breakfast items (blueberry pancakes, loco moco, island favorite, eggs) and it was okay at best. Nothing to rave about.  Customer service was good.

9gj-FXha8FwPHF-qTh5vNQ.text: It was a 20 minute wait to be seated inside. The hostess and waitress was friendly. I asked for a low carb option and told her about my daughter's nut allergy and she was great about substituting and pointing out other options.  You    get a free banana nut muffin if you check in with Yelp. The blueberry muffin was good even though it's not freshly baked. The Pancho's scram, chicken enchilada omelet, Cincinnati Coney dog, and kid's chicken fingers were good. My husband enjoyed the side of potatoes and the fresh fruit was good too.  We enjoyed dining here and it's nice that the prices were good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchilada omelette with fruit
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kid&#39;s chicken fingers

2CeevEe3lKgqXTbf2xQi3g.text: Came here after checking out of our hotel one weekend in vegas with a group of 4 on Sunday at around 1pm and our wait was about 30 minutes. We were all starving and all a little out of if @_@ (as you should be when devouring food in Vegas).   I ordered the basic eggs, potatoes, and sausage breakfast. I opted for the banana muffin and was so glad I did. They make it in house and was warm and delicious. My main dish was really greasy and hit the spot good! They were generous with the sausage portions. I wasn't feeling that adventurous that day, but others in my group ordered the chicken enchilada omelette, Tacos Rancheros, and Huevos Rancheros and all loved their dishes. Service was fast and friendly. I would definitely be back on my next Vegas visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs-Plus: 2 eggs cooked to order w/ ranch potatoes &amp; honey cured sausage links. So good! Hit the spot!

_UQbd6qQuc7V_dReIbTx8g.text: Best place to eat breakfast in Las Vegas. The only sin I committed the weekend in Vegas was finishing my plate. The portions are huge, go there very hungry.

GR6ic4cygxfLvyIvWETsBQ.text: A pretty standard, diner-like place. Their menu has southwest flare. The service was excellent. Paula? I hope you're one step closer to Disney!   We ordered a skillet and that was enough for two of us. Came loaded with veggies, bacon and cheese. It was standard. Paula offered us their banana muffin on the house since it was our first time in. A really nice touch. It was served warm and was delicious. Would come back just for them!  The condiment holder on the tables acts as a service signaling device when you flip to sad face egg -- very clever! If you're looking for a friendly, diner with stellar service, come here. I think you'll be pleased.

uv5Sxn2z1OrF5PSgyh2V-Q.text: The service here is amazing. Everyone is SO nice! The food was delicious and very fairly priced. I couldn't be more happy with my experience! The banana nut muffins are delicious-- and this is coming from a person who likes neither bananas nor nuts. I definitely will come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7ejf0XPKkobTOX_7CUt3Wg.text: Omg this place is packed always because the food is delicious. Every time when I go to Vegas, I always pass by this place for brunch. Check out their skillet menu which I think is better than a regular breakfast dish. Their banana muffin is the best cuz it's fresh, warm, soft and moist. On top of that, they're very pet friendly. I bring my corgi to the restaurant and sit in the patio outside all the time. The staff is friendly and even offer me water for my dog. Definitely I will recommend this place to others.

fgtVNTKVDMOcwCnVEUOa-w.text: Great food service it was just two of us they kept the table cleaned off everyone looks to be working as a team

Bxku1Eild7CV-UjyAyQu3w.text: This place is THE FREAKING BOMB!! From the service to the food, everything was A-1!! I got the stuffed French Toast and it was amazing!! My partner got a burger and fries and that was good too. Next time I'm in LV, I'll definitely make Egg & I part of the itinerary!!

Ycw5365dSb6d-6ezxremRQ.text: You know a restaurant is delicious when you forget to take pictures of the food. I've been to Vegas countless times and I have never checked this place out, but I'm sure glad I did. We placed an order for pick up because I had a feeling it was going to be packed, and I guess I'm psychic. That also means I won't be commenting on service as much as it wouldn't be fair.   The bomb: I ordered the mashed potato omelette. Seems to be a favorite. Easy to see why. The omelette itself was very tasty and flavorful. The potatoes were also delicious af. It also came with sour cream that made it even more delicious af.  It deserves its own line. The banana nut muffin. It's amazing. Ditch the toast. Be brave and go for the muffin.  My mom had the veggie crepe. It was also amazing. I have a big thing for avocados and there was plenty of avocado up in here. Highly recommended.  The chocolate chip pancake was great as well. Not too sweet, not too bland. Just right.   The bad: If you're planning to eat inside, be prepared to wait. But honestly. That's it.   Will definitely come back when I'm craving some eggs. I love eggs. If you're willing to drive a little from your hotel, it's definitely worth it.

9Vq6l49yj_-0iKFYzYq3Cg.text: This place is so amazing! They have it all and it all looks incredibly appetizing (sweet & savory). I got the prime rib eggs benny and it was so good! 10/10 highly recommend a must get item. Also, the pork chipotle Benedict was also fantastic. Their spicy Hollandaise sauce is fantastic! Also if you check in via yelp you can get a free banana nut muffin which are super yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9DoowGwIlsgSkOwaOSjY1Q.text: Came here a few months ago while in Vegas and omg why do we not have one in San Diego?! There were 6 different plates of food and everyone loved what they ordered.  The homemade banana muffins are amazing and a must try! We actually ordered some to go for the next morning and they were still delicious : )The staff were friendly and attentive despite the fact that it was a weekend. Would recommend this breakfast joint.

pfTjxdJyuxBB9wcFYCXe-g.text: Lots of options for breakfast with pleasant and efficient service.  They allow you to substitute a protein for the potatoes and bread, which I really like.  The Chilli Relano omelette was very tasty.

cGtHbwTEBUczzyfqS2VyQg.text: Sunrise Mountain platter will cure that nightclub hangover. There are 4 eggs and a crossaint hidden underneath that load of melted cheese and sausage. Bargain of a meal for what you get. Sausage was a little bland but nothing some hot sauce can't fix. Potatoes on the side were awesome. There's some seasoning they put on it that really makes it work. The muffin was pretty good, not the best I've ever had but pretty darn good for a free muffin (if you check in on yelp to unlock deal). Service was friendly and attentive. You have to walk the check up to the register to pay...thought that was a bit weird but whatever...its a minor inconvenience. Overall I'd say worth a visit if you're close by.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise Mountain platter

IvVWv9mYEYzvVZBw7mQZ9g.text: The Biscuits & Gravy, so good!!  The staff is very friendly & know the menu like the back of their hand.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Biscuits &amp; Gravy were so good, i wasn&#39;t about to put down my fork to take a picture before it was all gone...

aQdPygeL5j7Zu8MT-T28tA.text: Looking for a place away from the strip for breakfast this is the place. I've been here s couple times and haven't been disappointed, I'm a huge breakfast kind of guy. I've had the chili omelette it was big portion very flavorful, also the square potatoes are seasoned well. Don't forget to check in you get s FREE banana muffins which is to die for.   Update: Today I tried their country fried steak it was tender and delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak! Amazing

JcBViUI5oQfGcntMcmSrmA.text: Wow what a great place for delicious grub!!  Amazing banana nut muffin and some of the tastiest biscuits and gravy!! We had one of the nicest waitresses ever Leilani. She really made our day start off great and was so friendly and helpful. The place was very clean. . Cool patio when the weather is nice. Hope to visit when we return. Highly recommend!!

TCyI-kxRbnQTRDVWnjppXQ.text: Food was very good and banana muffins are highly recommended! We enjoyed the fast and accurate service and the friendliness of our team. We will be back!

y-4ainsdXhwymf_3JJsLoA.text: A must in Vegas, Karla our server was incredibly nice, the food was amazing, I had an egg Benny with their signature home fries. Everything tasted amazing, service was fast and price was very decent. Not a single complaint

n2kevTlFwqxPr_i3KTWzDw.text: I got the original Loco moco and wife got prime rib benedict, they use a croissant for their benedict which is unusual, usually benedict is made with muffins ? Wife said that they put a little too much hollandaise sauce on the benedict, so if you don't like them drenched, ask for lighter sauce. My Loco moco is perfect, portion is definitely large, I only eat a little more than half of my plate. They don't take American Express, which is not a big deal but the fact that they put Amex logo and crosses it out with a red "X" kinda too much in my opinion, it's almost like they have a big problem with Amex.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib eggs Benedict &amp; Loco moco !
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu !
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu !

JR5UywNl2XMXfWJ5xKza3Q.text: I went here on a whim with some friends on a Saturday morning after giving up on trying to find a cheap buffet that also had good quality food. When we got here, we were originally surprised at the line, but we decided to put ourselves on the waitlist for about a 30 minute wait. Luckily, they had a great waitlist system that tracked the people ahead of us and texted us when we were ready to be seated, so we could wander around instead of waiting around.  We were pleasantly surprised when we got seated after 20 minutes. For the food, I ordered the Spinach Bennie, and it was the best-flavored I've ever had. The staff is also very nice, and gave amazing service. I would recommend this place over any of the overpriced food at the Strip.

z10rnzZvGip7lzfy_sXuxg.text: First time here and it was amazing!!!! The food was delicious and our server Lacey WOOOOWWW!!! She's amazing, fast and she's super friendly! Definitely made me feel at home! Lacey is definitely one of the main reason I would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GOnccwPOLRL18fwfsPFHrg.text: we ordered the bacon, egg and cheese skillet and the country fried skillet. Both meals were good. Based on the previous reviews I was honestly expecting it to be delicious. The muffins were really tastey. The service was great.

plHYkX47lAMONO86IJtdCw.text: holy hell..amazing. i had the stuffed fresh toast. like wow!! make sure to check in to get your free mouthwatering banna nut muffin. it was so rich and delicious i didn't even finish it..and i love to eat lolz.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cCSgybqukb7QuMJmcezpAA.text: First time here for breakfast and it was delicious:-) I had the chili relleno omelette, fruit and sourdough bread. The hubby had a chili burger with potato salad and he said it was very good. Definitely will be back and recommend this place to family and friends. It's off Sarah/ Decantur not in a Casino.

4VLflZRiy770kvg_cXPHog.text: Best breakfast potatoes I have ever consumed in my life. The salty diablo seasoning (not spicy) is amazing and the potatoes are always perfectly cooked. While this may seem to be a rather strange thing to rate, a lot of breakfast places overlook the breakfast potatoes, even though half your plate comprises of these carbs.  The other breakfast foods are solid. I got the eggs Benedict and they drowned it in hollandaise sauce. I hate it when places drizzle that delicious egg butter concoction and am so glad to have found a place that isn't afraid of it. My husband always gets the typical egg sausage breakfast and he is always happy because in all honesty, he really comes out for those potatoes.  I've also had a few of the spicy omelettes and they have all been amazing. I watched my brother in law devour a four egg omelette. He ate through the pain because even though it's rather large, it was so delicious that leaving any behind would have been a crime.   Check in for a free banana muffin that's warm and goes to wonderfully with a cup of coffee.  Also, it's always busy here, even though it's a bit off the strip and the middle of the week. It doesn't matter, it's worth the trek

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vege eggs Benedict is hidden under all that delicious looking hollandaise!

sWKnoKVXez6ON60PLlAHrQ.text: Food looked really good.. I was happy with my Spinach Benny.. Hollendaise Sauce was a bit salty.. the potatoes were interesting .. one piece salty and the next plain.. next piece spicy.. the rest of the party was hit or miss.. I liked the eggs..   A bit salty for everyone's taste..

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free banana nut muffin.. check in with yelp and get a freebie..

ne2QroVUOb7FLcaNmDBPGg.text: Must go to breakfast restaurant when in Vegas!   This place is off the strip and it gets pretty busy but the wait isn't long at all, for three people is about a 10-15 wait but worth it!!  I had the beef hash with two over easy eggs and it was so flavorful and you can taste the quality.  Family owned restaurant where they care about their menu choices and how the customers experience.   Would surely come back again! Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash with two over easy eggs

j69DDqhUsvxjpoUetNz2Zw.text: Really great service! Large menu selection! Dog friendly patio! The free banana nut muffin with check in is delicious! Coffee is hot and fresh. I had eggs, bacon and toast. Very good and I love that I can take my dog with me instead of leaving her at home. I will definitely come back and recommend this place:)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sadie the beggar!

dw4CGLehWDSyrVx1m27ggg.text: This location is ok, very crowded and not enough places to stand and wait for a table, it almost needs to move to another location, due to the high demand of customers, I have visited other locations around Las Vegas and they are not as crowded. I also sort of felt rushed when there because when your sitting down the servers are like in a hurry to get to you order and get you out. I guess that is how they want to make their atmosphere location. I would  go there if others would want to meet there but I would rather go to another location. Also the first time I thought the food was different but it turns out the place is the same as Egg Works, not sure why there are two companies with different names, but I would rather go to my other location. The food was good just felt like it was cramped in there and couldn't get out soon enough.

UOnkEfgI1MH5Hz75Lv4Vgw.text: Great breakfast place... Banana nut muffin was great, no too sweet, just right... Had the Spam, egg and rice which hit the spot. Spam was cut thickly which I liked...  Prices are so reasonable too. Definitely will come back....

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my favorites... Banana nut muffin... Really good

Y9Mlmm4wHuNlZ_t-w05ZZw.text: Enjoyed the good breakfast, really enjoyed how you can substitute just about everything to make it healthier. I got the western and subbed egg whites, no cheese, turkey bacon and no butter, with fruit instead of potatoes. Forgot my coffee but that wasn't anything to bad, also our waiter mixed up our ticket with another table. Service was good minus those couple things, very prompt on getting food out, they have a quick turn around so if you see people outside waiting don't be to afraid to stop in. Facility was little aged, and not the cleanest but that comes with the age of the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Western omelette

lchwoR_zH2kL8411nYho5A.text: Ok... so the muffins are worth the visit alone! Holy moly guys! Warm and this awesome crunchy crust ring in the muffin top that is just so good

pxa2WJDjBKNBsVb25lx3Zw.text: Found this great breakfast spot on yelp, and it definitely deserves five stars. Kind and attentive service, and an affordable yet delicious breakfast. The banana nut muffin was a highlight. If you are looking for a delicious breakfast away from the exorbitantly high prices of the strip, the egg and I is the way to go.

skxDP9YBrvOuCIifSapRvg.text: A good variety of breakfast/ brunch options.  All staff were extremely friendly. Ordered the crepe and pork Benny. Both were flavorful. The pork Benny was a little too saucy but other than that, everything was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fOlDkvn7AoXOWOSRSWtVZA.text: This is an awesome place for diner food!! Just be prepared to wait in the weekend. And make sure to try their chilli!

CuYzM1dlTwIe0guy1wzCyA.text: A must for breakfast every time I come to Vegas. Mom and pop atmosphere, phenomenal breakfasts and check in on Yelp for the great banana nut muffin.

8sXDF8Bc7W2KBhaSVIr6wg.text: Great breakfast place, this place is busy! But the wait is worth it. You can sit outside on the patio great time for that! Cool menu!!

hiy51Wbzu8FW60njpIeu-w.text: A great breakfast with enough portion to satisfy any type of hunger. I had the ham and mushroom skillet and it was a very good portion and the potatoes are sooooo damn good!!!! Also had a banana muffin and I must say that the bread is well made with a balanced flavor between banana and nuts...not over sweet. Service was great and be aware that this is a very busy place and you may have to wait for your seat but its well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ham and mushroom skillet and a half order of Brads scramble

xtuofymkqhJI_HFlZGQm_g.text: This is one of the coolest places to have breakfast at in Las Vegas! Even tho we are locals this is one of our favorite places to come by with the family.  We always sit outside when we can, its always nice out there. They have cool menus like newspapers, they are reasonable prices. Portions are large and yummy. Potatoes are a must. You can get anything with eggs pretty much! dont be shy to wait about 30 min  Thanks nice place highly recommended

8mHmiwzGtGAXrIlqtOvt1g.text: So delicious and amazing service! Really worth the wait. It has been awhile since I have had such a great breakfast. Can't wait until the next time I stop by here!

uYr4lYGX8_7G9TWEk5fMyg.text: I'm a big fan of eggs!   Largest selection of eggs for breakfast I have ever seen! My friend and I arrived here on a Saturday for lunch and expected there to be a long wait because of all the high reviews but we were lucky enough to be seated within 10 minutes.   Their menu is quite extensive .. they even have non egg options if you're not really feelings eggs that day. Portions are huge for a reasonable price. Great spot to eat at if you're venturing off the strip.  Tip: Free banana bread muffin with Yelp check-in

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Steak Skillet

ErjqrjJNO_lTZC_bOsD7Hw.text: Kelly was our server and was very pleasant. Don't forget to check in for a free banana nut muffin. Always great food.

FX1FEHZw-apktffNhEkUOw.text: BEST EGG AND I. I've ever been to!   This one is smaller then the rest and as busy as they get they get you in pretty quick!   Customer service is great, very friendly. PERRY is an awesome server! Very welcoming and was always there when we needed him. He was so nice that he brought each of us at the table a Banana but muffin ( best banana nut muffin are at EGG AND I's)   Food is always great, we come for the breakfasts and they are Big! One plate feeds 2 people ( if your not a big eater.   We went for the stuffed French toast and it was delicious!   If you go on Groupon you can get a coupon to use at the restaurant , for $26 you get a $40 voucher!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids chicken fingers and fries
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffins
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamburger!

2GIoQC68ew1fr-e8mPdfEg.text: There was about a 30 minute wait when we went. Luckily, if there's a wait, they'll text you and you can also check your spot in line, view number of people ahead of you and how many are in their party.   The service is great.
