They offer a free banana bread muffin with a yelp check-in. The muffin is pretty good!   The menu is very extensive. So many options, you may need more than a few minutes to decide what you want.   Seems like the majority of the breakfasts are extremely heavy. Mine was loaded with soooo much cheese. Like do people really eat that much cheese?? geezus. They do have healthier options and the option of cooking without oil for example. And I could have asked for light cheese - I just didn't know that I would need to! Overall, it wasn't a very positive experience since I was pretty disappointed in my food.

90flz22Sn50xofGOsTLnrw.text: I've been here multiple times and this place never ceases to amaze me. Their banana nut muffins melt in your mouth and are always served fresh a must have if it's your first time here. I'm a great fan of the loco moco but you can't go wrong with anything here. Be ready for large servings

aejdYmrMfipkNNfJSUE1HQ.text: Delicious. Been there both times I visited Vegas this year. Big portions of food and food came out very quickly. There's usually a wait but that was fine with me since the food was so good. Staff is very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6MCKaxo3-csbD_0I-gjQrg.text: Had a great breakfast here, nice waiters and great service. I had the parfait and scrambled eggs with bacon. The parfait was really good and refreshing after a long night out. We also had a skillet, their potatoes are especially good!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parfait

EQk54iiK0xxW9Ly7NKelow.text: My mom and I decided to go to brunch. It was so busy but didn't wait too long. We were given each a delicious banana muffin while we waited for our breakfast. Amazing Eggs Benedict and enjoyed mimosas. Very friendly staff. Most definitely will go back again soon

Bnos9LMCc4Dny7AqsRjn6Q.text: Excellent place to go to off the strip if you are looking for eggs.  Been to this location 3 times and never had a bad breakfast.  our waiter was outstanding and kept the coffee flowing.  It is a very cozy place and excellent food.  They have a very big menu here and the portions are big.

T9Rq-0tmBesUm1cJZeYGWQ.text: Came here with some co-residents during a brief lunch break. They were able to accommodate our large group and we sat outdoors. There was a wait, but it was not too long.  Service was fine and prices reasonable. It's mostly breakfast fare, and we all enjoyed our meals. The food was good, though nothing particularly mind-blowing. The interior is very homey though, and their logo is cute!

vQwQjP4m7I2ExheqMBX8Dg.text: Day trip to Vegas and this dog friendly restaurant was our choice for breakfast! The best choice! The food (huge selection), service (Perry, you were awesome man!) and the hospitality! Highly recommend for the food and for dog owners. Could use some heaters outside but it is Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchilada omelette

8rx-8PZUJ7iuNLG45ozBRQ.text: Excellent service with smile. Party of six was given great food n service.  Little wait time can b neglected due to food n service that is unique.

L-8yHbmzBZ2h0KWGvhyYVA.text: Very good full portioned food. I had The Works omelet and added avocado. My only critique but not really critique on that is they added so much avocado that I think they skimmed down on the other ingredients - but I love avocado sooo again cannot say it's really a bad thing.  The potatoes that came with it were on the crispy side and seasoned very well. My meal automatically came with a muffin but we did the yelp check in and got an additional banana nut muffin for free. Muffin was delicious and we were glad to have a spare for the road!   Service is fast and friendly. Sat on the patio with wonderful water misters. Music was on point. Cute little rabie looking pigeons walked around to add to the ambiance HA-HA

GkAj6FUxLA0hW3B9BMe98Q.text: It's been a decade since I've been to Egg and I due to my last experience but throughout the years a lot of people have consistently recommended me to consider trying it again but I've been reluctant to.   One day I was hungry and I happen to pass by so I try giving it a shot again. And let me tell you it's a much better-experienced compare to what happened a decade ago.   Our server Denize recommend us the Patty Melt. When I took that first bite I have to say my doubts about the place disappeared. The cheese compliments the patty so much it felt like it melted into my mouth. The fries were seasoned just about right. Denize also gave me a complimentary banana muffin which was a nice addition; it's fresh and warm. Assuming she's a seasoned server she knew what the customer truly wants. I no longer have doubts about Egg and I. I recommended this place to anyone that happens to pass by the area it's a few blocks away from the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patty Melt
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries

2eKRAh_ze7cGq0EldOVw8w.text: Food was excellent as always. Definitely a must to come here whenever we're at Vegas. Carole Ann's service was amazing! Let's get her to Disneyland!

Yk2iCs4rbXtOfYsrTAe0vA.text: I LOVE THE POTATOES!!!  I don't live in Vegas but whenever I come here, I make it  point to come to this place. Unfortunately the line is long and it's off the strip, but I honestly do feel it's worth renting a car to come over here.   This place serves breakfast - and most of it comes with my favorite part (the potatoes) If it wasn't for a recommendation from a friend I probably would have never gone off the strip to make this my now regular pit stop when making it to Vegas!  Beyond that I try to get a bit of everything since I can usually only stomach only so much! I recommend this place!

6GDRnuhOp3WtsQVKuNPR8Q.text: At Egg and I.  My 3rd time here.   The service is great.   Better than the strip restaurants.   Brady has good timing and was attentive.  When I go to Vegas I always go there on Sunday morning before the painful drive back to Cali.  I'll recommend anyone that is willing to venture off the strip to go there.

fRRSssgo0WNlqrAQdY-tag.text: Fantastic service despite the place being packed. We were in & out really quick. Our waiter Curtis was very attentive & friendly. We even got a free muffin since it was my first time! Breakfast couldn't have been any better- we had the child relleno omelette & veggie bennie.

u09cqtVIagKpiYxbEotF-A.text: From the outside (& inside) it looks like a typical diner type restaurant BUT dine here you'll soon notice the difference.   First, the staff is great, always warm & welcoming. Second, they have a system in place so you never have to wait longer than a couple seconds for anything (whether it's more water, ketchup, your order).  The food is really good!! I've never tried anything I didn't like here and they're consistently good! Their coffee is my absolute favorite coffee, it's rich and full of flavor.   My favorite items:  - Their skillets are really good, esp. The bacon & onion one.  - Avocado bacon & cheese omlette  - Banana bread french toast  - Pancakes  It's a great place for a fuss free brunch, sweatpants and hangover included.

jnOc5VtcWrm_IIFx5DXllg.text: Fantastic breakfast. Better than anything I've had on the Strip and for half the price.

Cee9q0piH9JTBUA0wMm1XA.text: After an interesting night of debauchery, my stomach was hungering for a good, full breakfast.  Apart from having the cutest name ever, Egg & I has THE best banana nut muffin I've ever had in my life.  So moist, so warm.  So delicious.  Their bacon, avocado and cheese omelet had just the right balance of cheese and fillings, although a little more bacon could never hurt anybody... Orange juice was freshly squeezed and a bit pulpy, which a nice surprise :)  A nice, comfortable, and homey place to recover with generous portions and awesome staff.  Definitely recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. best banana nut muffin EVER

e1ptrgIZeHNWv6h-aTGOiA.text: The Egg and I is one of our favorite places to come to every time we come to Vegas. The banana bread is the best.  Erin was very helpful and attentive.

MAAkRkR2jEGaacl0ymuM_A.text: Egg & I has become a recent tradition with the future in-laws.  It's a nice change-of-pace versus the Strip and a mere ten minute drive but not worth the added expense if you plan on cabbing.  Parking is plentiful and there is a delicious bakery with some of the stickiest baklavas in the same strip mall to warmup while you wait (ranging from 10 to 30 min).  Prices are reasonable, service is shoddy, and luckily one cannot mess up eggs.  Food wasn't greasy for whatever's thats worth.  As you may have guessed menu is egg-centric but fear not.  I decided to change things up during my latest visit and ordered hawaiian food.  Yep, you read that right and my internal organs as of a week later remain intact.  They offer: loco moco, spam and eggs and portuguese sausage and eggs.  Ordered both the spam and portuguese sausage and had no regrets.  Forgot the name of the breakfast burrito with the chorizo but it was dense AF and subsequently awesome.  Their homefries are also a must.

5ZIkBN_akIZhwooDSX8BZQ.text: I had ordered the eggs benedict which was recommended. Overall, it was alright, it was just smothered in hollandaise sauce and I got kinda grossed out after a while. Their potatoes were good and nicely seasoned. But the main reason why I gave them 4 stars was for their banana nut muffin. Sooo good, slightly chewy and a nice sweet thin glaze on top. It was the best banana nut muffin I ever had.

IQiL_YEMrlBBfMblUnDkFA.text: Love coming here it is a must! Carole Ann was great and attentive. When something happened to our order she brought us the amazing muffins!!!! Food was great as usual. Love coming here! Potatoes are the best! I got the prime rib Benny and it was great!

KDxheqpVMSM2oQESXgLAjA.text: BANANA NUT MUFFIN you MUST!! The service was eggsellent ;] Our server was very helpful and fast.  Food is delicious.

00p0XgfK84_1zlLxBKf0Mw.text: Thanks to Yelp and the good ol community of yelpers out there i know A LOT of places where 10 bucks can go a LONG way in providing some good eats.  My Buddy recommended The Egg & I after hearing some good things about it from other sources. I've driven by this place multiple times and it's caught my attention a few time while in the same plaza as B&C Camera.   They have a diverse menu of egg related items. I was about to order one of the combo skillets because another table's home fries looked GOOD but ended up getting a Hawaiian themed plate which featured Portuguese Sasuage or Spam (went for the sausage), rice, two eggs any style (sunny side up), "sticky" rice (turned out to be calrose rice). Also came with a choice of what ever bread or the banana nut muffin everyone raves about.   I choose the muffin and man oh man it did not disappoint. Blueberry's always been my favorite muffin and to be honest i havent eaten enough muffins in my life time. If i were in a situation where the entire fate of humanity rested upon my recommendation for a muffin it would be The Egg & I's banana nut hands own, sorry humanity you had your chance i'm throwing this one out and if it lands under the bus so be it.   Overall the island favorite plate was good, obviously the Portuguese sausage made the dish but in all honesty it wasnt worth the price. Even with the banana nut muffin dreams are made of it still wasnt quite worth it. For the same price my buddy got one of the combo skillets and he ended up easily with three times more food then i did.  So far i do like this place. Outdoor seating was available immediately seeing as it was a cold morning but their heaters are very powerful and aside from a few gusts of wind there was very little outdoor discomfort. Looking at other people's plate was very easy on the eyes as their selection of food is diverse yet seeing common dishes amongst different diners makes me want to come back and get what they're getting because they cant all be wrong.

1ccw2PFMdqR73bkjvW3l5g.text: So glad we made the drive over. Simple diner with great food, fast service, and reasonable prices. Does get busy but worth the wait. All 4 at our table loved their choices and as others have noted the Banana Nut muffins are a cant miss.

V2-R0LvMSG_CrDXiv842-A.text: I would give a hundred stars if I could. Alexa was beyond amazing, I'm shocked she's not serving at the nicest most high end restaurant in Vegas. She has a smile that lights up an entire room and a personality to match it. We were being somewhat complicated with our order and everything came out perfect and tasted great. Will absolutely be back!!

7HoyVGgMAzFJKDyh0SZACw.text: the muffins are really good . fun down to earth laid back enviroment with excellent food .

NTkxithZ-RMsqpLb1Z8GcA.text: vegas breakfast?..afternoon flights and up early...last meal for some...egg & i extra large breakfast platters...enormous sizes...literally mountain of potato cubes with heavy seasoning salt sprinkling...a brad's special...eggs, spinach and meats loaded and large...hungry?...egg & i will deliver a tummy expanding plate for $ten...comforting homely interiors...casual diner atmosphere...friendly service...

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. brad&#39;s special $8.50...

gamdYtK_JQ6ZVkVjRkysNw.text: I love the Egg & I, we are from Denver and have been to numerous Egg & I's. Of all the ones we have been to, this one had the best customer service by far! Unfortunately my meal got messed up (no big deal, it happens) but without question they remade my meal, brought the manager over and took my meal off of the bill. Our waitress was named Tamara, and without me asking or complaining she gave me the best customer service I could ask for. The staff and food were awesome but Tamara made my visit extra worthwhile. Highly recommended place, they really take care of their guests here!

s7Yp_j5CGfwafFZgwcyD6Q.text: Tried this place with a friend and had probably one of the friendliest waitresses I've every encountered. The selection of food is pretty amazing and fills you up. The waitress gave me and my friend two free slices of their famous coffee cakes and it was heaven. The breakfast food was ridiculously delicious. I highly recommend this mom & pops place if you want something different than what is on the strip.

llAprvEBG-xg50svyBRhmg.text: Definitely one of the better breakfast spots to try when you are in the area. I plan on making this place a regular stop on future visits. The location is off the strip and worth the drive. You know your at a good spot when people are lining up and waiting outside. The staff is very pleasant and they are quick to get you seated and fed.

Cz3oacmtbCZ8hfksc9IPdg.text: Love this place and has the best Banana French toast and will never let you down five stars and still going almost every weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aZiHc_2BcBh_F20Ggnf4bw.text: It's very seldom I rate a restaurant five stars. Our server was extremely attentive, checked on us a few times. The food we ordered was prepared exactly as we specified. My friend ordered a  "Crispy Waffle", and yes it did come out just the way he liked it. I had the Spinach Benedict. I ordered the eggs with no runny yoke. It was perfect! The hash brown potatoes had their special seasoning and had a generous helping of those as well. Additionally, our large OJ was only $3.50  The sever put the ticket in our table so we were free to relax, no rush rush   pressure. The ladies at the door gave us a great smile and a "Thanks for coming, have a great day!" Brought home a menu and they also have lunch fare.  Will definitely be looking forward to reti  Another wonderful breakfast at this place. My friend had a perfect waffle and I had the Spinach Benedict. I asked for extra spinach and I got it! PERRY, our server, gave us outstanding service Very delightful late breakfast .

IPXbTtaNnMv0bb9gY9BBoA.text: I came here with a group of friends on a Saturday morning and boy was it packed! We waited for more than an hour and I felt the waitresses could have done a better job telling us real time updates about wait time. I wouldn't say it was worth the wait but I can say the food here was really good nonetheless.  First and foremost they do have a mini selection of alcohol, hahah because why not? You're in Vegas! Mimosas, screwdrivers, bloodymarry's and as well as other basic mixed drinks as well!   If possible you can check in on yelp and they give you a free banana nut muffin! This is a must order!! I want to say it was the most softest and moist muffin I have ever had. Once it gets on the table, cut it in half and smother it with butter. Yes, I said butter, believe me it will change your life.   I had the country fried steak breakfast and it was bomb. Not all breakfast spots can cook fried steak as well as this restaurant! Very crispy and juicy at the same time. I loved their gravy that went with the steak. The hash potatoes were seasoned perfect! Not sure what kind of spice was used but it was similar to cajun. I loved it though! The portion amount was endless. I'd recommend this dish if you love fried steak.   My girlfriend had a bacon avocado omelet and that was a handful as well! You'll see in my pictures that the omelet was huge!! We honestly could have shared. Everyone at the table enjoyed their meal and of course we had to have some mimosas! Overall, I'd come back here but at a time where there isn't that much of a wait. By the way they do close at 3 PM.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big ol omelet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This muffin is fiyahhh
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried steak!

70G7WoghrsbWzOs23bWSnQ.text: We used to be able to get a cheap and good breakfast inside the hotel. Not so! We ventured out. The breakfast was SO GOOD here and very friendly service. It fills up and has a long wait by 9:45 on the weekend. So go early if you want to just walk in.  The Hawaiian breakfast was great. I enjoyed my half-size chili skillet. Mom and cuz each had the waffle breakfast. All together, $15 less than the same/similar lukewarm breakfast the day before in the hotel.

Z6hq4lS8HYSLM74kHTkjCQ.text: Egg & I has been around for decades. Locals and visitors swear by the friendly customer service.  First time visit and we were not disappointed!!  on her last day, Hailey was friendly and fast!!  Check them out.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Egg and I
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Veggie

fykwaCHdEPF9zSdczUSU3Q.text: This breakfast joint was delicious! I'm actually from Ohio where we have very specific chili and I was surprised to see it on their menu! I haven't seen that type of chili offered anywhere outside of a skyline restaurant. Anyways the food and service were great! It's a very busy here but they were very fast, we sat down almost immediately. By the way, check in on yelp to get the free banana bread!

uoNrXQQOqRUAANiRqv6pYg.text: Had the Stuffed French Toast with potatoes. It was amazing! The location is off the main strip. Smaller place with great staff. The potato's sounds like they will be spicy on the menu but they are not. They even sell the seasoning so you can take it home!  Highly recommend. Especially for the price compared to the strip.

DCAc6JAeuqy2tKbiQw0tPA.text: About 10 minutes off The Strip, towards Stratosphere.  We came on a Tuesday morning & there was no wait, however, during the weekend, expect a wait.  They serve a variety of items- eggs benedicts, omelets, has, scrambled eggs, French toast, pancakes, waffles, skillets, crepes, salads, coups, sandwiches, wraps, burgers, Hawaiian specialties, & more!  Make sure to check in on Yelp to get their famous Banana Nut Muffin for free!  Spinach Benny:  With crispy bacon instead of Canadian bacon.  Served with Habla Diablo potatoes.  I was nervous that the potatoes would be too spicy but it was actually more flavorful than spicy.  Loved the hollandaise sauce.  Make sure to try their hot sauce at the table because like the Habla Diablo seasoning, it is more flavorful than spicy.

iGtEtTtp6viqkAQ-fgFVeg.text: Provender: this is a great diner that specializes in breakfast food. I ordered the skillet, which comes with a banana nut muffin. The eggs were scrambled to perfection, just look at my photo.  Prices: a skillet will run you around $12.  Parking: ample, it's located in a large strip plaza.  People: fun for all, they also have high chairs for infants.  Perks: the food is delicious. The staff are excellent. They close at 3pm, so this isn't a late night joint. Although there's plenty of seating it gets busy fast. Especially during weekends.

bsInx6TfvUhl52y68P8T5A.text: I love this place. It never disappoints me! The service is always great and the food amazing. This egg and I had a train that went around the restaurant and it kept my little one distracted!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1Y5JHQEImDOKP2tiKCCGKg.text: Lacey at Egg & I was a great server!! She knew it was our first time there and went out of her way to recommend her favorites and even brought out complimentary banana muffins.  Service was excellent!!!  We had a party of 8 with 4 little kids (40 min wait for a Saturday morning on a long weekend) and she swung by every now and then and cleared the mess they made.    And of course I have to say the food here is amazing.  We ordered 4 of the items that Lacey recommended and ended up just splitting everything so we can try it all.  I honestly can't even tell you which is our favorite because all the plates were delicious.    If you are visiting Vegas this is a must stop.

moKEn50AKZHSp0JY9xfLIQ.text: We've eaten here several times and the food is always great. This time we had our puppy with us. We couldn't have been happier with the service and care we received. Our seat on the patio was great and they even brought our puppy water and treats! Everyone was just so kind to us and our dog. We recommend anyone coming with the dog. They are fantastic!

LooW_21Bs9-YeSFsEF1xGQ.text: October 28, 2018 Sunday - 7:45 AM for breakfast  2 Adults  Atmosphere - 4 stars Food - 5 stars Service - 5 stars  Background - Heading home, back to Reno, and wanted something away from the strip and on the way home.  Yelp helped us find this place.  Atmosphere - Part of a strip mall.  It feels like this place has been here for decades.  Not the place is worn down but just the style of woods, tables, and the art.  Food   Drink - Coffee and I actually was given and insulated coffee pot.  Woot Woot!  I would have finished that thing off but I have a long car ride in front of me.    Breakfast - The Mexican omelette, it had me with chorizo.  The jalapenos were a nice touch too.  I think most of the heat came from the Habla Diablo salsa, which they advertise on the back of the menu.  Side of cubed home fries went well with the omelette.  That four egg omelette was filling.    Service - Our waitress was great.  Like a diner you pay the cashier near the door.  Future - Sure.  Now I am curious about Egg Works, their other restaurants listed on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my own coffee pot
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu cover
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. black egg, yellow egg

4DO4Fs6LSSXlO_D10v4e2w.text: Food was little cold, prices aren't great and food isn't great but not many places to come during brunch lunch. Muffins are good though! Little better than Dennys would be

N_-7hO27XhM-9CWhotMZDQ.text: Superb service. We had a female server with glasses, and she was outstanding--super friendly, genuine and attentive. We came on a Monday for brunch and it was incredibly packed. It made me wonder what it's like on the weekends.   Their menu was formatted like a newspaper (too cute) and there were so many options it took us a good 10 mins to decide on what to order. Everything sounded good. They had everything from traditional American breakfast and Tex-Mex to Hawaiian plates and more.   I redeemed the Yelp check-in offer for the free banana nut muffin and they were gracious enough to hook everyone up at the table. My goodness, was it good. Warm, fluffy and moist. Very great start to our dining experience and surely got us excited for our entrees. Please, please redeem that free muffin.   Everything that we ordered was flavorful, delicious and filling. Amen to their portions. Their breakfast potatoes were seasoned well (you can buy their seasoning) and quite crunchy. Our bellies were happy and the hanger was tamed. Major plus for bottomless coffee.  It was a bit chilly that morning (in the 50s) but we were starved and had no time to waste so we decided to sit outside. If you decide to dine al fresco, know that you'll be joined by lots of pigeons! Didn't bother us too much while eating but once you're done with plates you might have to shoo them away.   This place is definitely worth the trek from the Strip (it's not that far) and it's a decades-long favorite by locals and tourists alike :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. banana muffin

Fv-lE1SBXh19EbHGGAPV5Q.text: Wow, this place is incredible. I'm not really a breakfast person, but this place has so much to offer. The menu features everything imaginable when it comes to breakfast. The skillet I ordered was huge and delicious, only $11!!! The service was awesome. Our waitress Manuela, was attentive and kept us very happy. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in the area.

tVp3hjubvnnQ2Q3NfCJqkQ.text: You would think after 11 pages of photos and you can't find their home made corned beef hash, it might not be very good. I only found that out in perusing the photos today.   Why would you put home-made if you're not that good, why bother at all? Well I did try the corned beef hash and it was kind of slimy and not chunky. It was like they mashed it up instead of chopping up the meat. I liked their hash browns and banana muffin! My husband loves their sausage and biscuits. I stick to regular eggs over easy next time. I also noted no grape jelly. Strawberry, blackberry and orange jellies to choose from. Their service is very good and the waitress was very attentive in refilling the iced tea and coffee at our table. It was a weekday and very slow, but I think the weekends are pretty busy.   Didn't check out the potty this time.

b-N-m_apd4auCMw7GWzp8g.text: We stumbled around to two other breakfast locations that either had outrageous wait times or weren't open before Yelp saved the day and found Egg & I. Third times a Charm! We put our name on the waitlist for a 35 minute wait and just as we were going to walk away because it was a ton of people waiting to eat, a patron said that "it's worth the wait." She even said she would keep us hostage if we didn't say we would stay. Lol!   We obliged and stayed. Excellent decision on our part! The place is sort of a dive, located nowhere near the strip, but oh so worth the Uber or Lyft ride here. It stays packed on a Sunday, which is the day we visited, but the line moved fairly fast. They apparently have take-out and show a few NFL games on a few tv's throughout the restaurant, and they have outdoor seating. Only open until 2pm, they specialize in breakfast/brunch/lunch foods.   I ordered the chicken enchilada omelet and it was so authentic and delicious, just visualizing it now, is making my mouth water! Delicious!!! I'm so glad that woman told us it was worth waiting because it truly was! One thing I noticed, was a lot of the great places to eat, weren't even on the Strip! This was a great find, thanks Yelp!!

bcRxdolWaFmse8hENoVdCw.text: If you're looking for a yummy and wonderful service along with a menu filled with delicious food options you must stop here. Do not leave without trying the banana nut bread. If you're a French toast lover you MUST try the banana nut French toast. There's no going wrong people with the selection of yummy dishes in this menu. Prices are good ;) Service is amazing. Oooh! You get a coffee pitcher at your table ^.^ For train lovers, you will see a train going around the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qR8KPWAMM9vXAq_PJa_GwQ.text: The food is great and the staff is so friendly. I recommend Chicken, Mushroom and Spinach skillet.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

waVdmB3YDX_Nx2i5XwjffQ.text: Liza, our server was great, 5 star service. Our food was very good. Portions were large, wife and I shared chicken fried steak and eggs, couldn't finish. My big appetite teenage son had the three Pig omelet and was stuffed. Reasonable prices short drove from strip.

QFzwjdfJeI-A_wy3NqX8uQ.text: First time here and will be making this a regular breakfast spot when in Vegas. Patrick was probably one of the best servers we've had in a very long time. He greeted us with a friendly smile, recommended their signature banana muffins (which were Ah-Maz-Ing), and always checked up on us.    Their food is great too and the portions are enough to share so make sure you come hungry. Now keep in mind they can also do 1/2 orders on omelettes. So instead of four eggs you get 2 which was more than enough. Our family loved everything we ordered.   This place gets packed so expect a wait. They have indoor and outdoor seating available.

v99BJ1OP64ZYGT4FByduXA.text: I wish I came here with a group of 10 people so I can make everyone order a different dish for me to try. I can eat eggs everyday and every meal and not get sick of it. So Egg and I pretty much describes the story of my life. This place is roughly 10-15 mins away from the strip so there was no wait like all the other crazy famous Vegas brunch spots and that's 10 extra bonus points!  Like I mentioned I'm a crazy egg person so ordering brunch was never difficult for me. I would always always ALWAYS order an omelette but no joke, it took me more than 10 mins to decide what I wanted here since almost everything had eggs in it and there were so many choices! But of course i ended up getting the work omelette and we also ordered carnitas something (I was so hungry and forgot to note the name). The omelette was okay nothing special or different for everywhere else but the potato on the side was AMAZING! The other dish was also super good- I've never had carne asada that's so flavorful and delicious! I cannot wait to come back again and try the other dishes they have!  Oh did I mention, instead of stretching your neck out to track down your waiter/waitress, you can flip the "egg sign" and someone will swing by to attend to your needs. Awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piece of heaven.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The potatoes.....

8RLNnDPbuJSU4kRH6w0zcA.text: So, I've come to the Egg & I on about 7 of my last 8 trips to Vegas after initially discovering it, but this was by far the best service I've had, even though service has been wonderful each and every time. Today, I just wanted to give a couple of shot outs to Brady, the Assistant Manager, and to Jesus, whom I discovered is a 20-yr  employee of the Egg & I.   Jesus is a busboy. On my last two visits prior to the one I'm writing about (this past Monday, Memorial Day), Jesus has asked me if I needed anything to let him know, which he did again on this visit. Jesus is ALWAYS willing to help, and has gotten me coffee, filled my coffee and even scored me an extra banana nut muffin or two before. Not really his job, as his is to clean tables and make sure their customers have somewhere nice to be seated, but Jesus ALWAYS goes above and beyond what is expected of him to do, and I appreciate his hard work.  Which brings me to Brady, the young Assistant Manager. Brady is definitely young enough to be my little brother. Brady is a genuine, bonafide talker. He shoots the shit with you, but real talk. Not fake talk like I'm only here to make it look like I care about you talk, but good ol' fashioned back and forth banter. He has a tattoo on one of his forearms that says "Family First", and Brady made me feel like family! While shooting it with him, I told him that we had just come from Laughlin but had to detour cause one of my wife's uncles fell ill and ended up in the hospital and guess what Brady did? He sent me home with a loaf of their bomb ass banana nut bread to take to my uncle at the hospital since I told him that's where we were heading after breakfast! THANK YOU AGAIN BRADY! I'LL NEVER FORGET YOUR KINDNESS!  I'll end this review with a little bit about the food.........my Italiano skillet was on point, AS USUAL. Onion, bell pepper and sausages were all cooked to damn near perfection, it had just the right amount of marinara and cheese that didn't drown or overwhelm, and to be quite honest, have they every messed up a batch of their famous potatoes?

WKwY4ED1kMGhOQyZQP5HTw.text: Second time here. They is always a full house. The service was cheerful but not consistent, we had to flag down people for water.   The potatoes are always on point. The Monty cristo sandwich was just MEH. I ate 70% of it because I need the energy for driving back home. I tried some of my friends omelette and it was way better than mine.   The hot sauce was bomb also so I bought a small bottle for the trip home.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friends feta omelet. Quite tasty indeed.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sandwich was meh. The fries saves the day.

fhu6KOol0s_q-CnKY7ymNA.text: Reina have us perfect service! Prompt courteous. Great selection and quality of food. Endless coffee. Muffin was soft and flavorful. Nice to sit outside and people watch.

KVy5hcp8qYdrYYNyoh3ZCA.text: I ate breakfast at the Egg & I on Sahara in Las Vegas, NV on 11/23/2014.  I was my 1st time there.  There were seven of us.  Everyone had something different.  I had their western omelette.  This place is connected with Egg Works and has the same menu.  Plus, I took photos.

dyrKv6Ls-rYjSfMB86R7mA.text: I only got to try the banana nut muffin and the traditional eggs Benedict but both were delicious and I think that says a lot about this place. The muffin was very moist and sweet with few nuts, just the way I like it.  The eggs Benedict, though traditional and simple, was perfect and filling. It made its way to the top of my list of favorite eggs Benedicts. The hollandaise sauce was one of the best I've had. This dish alone will have me coming back if I ever make a trip back to Vegas.  Our server was also very accommodating to our party of 9 and super friendly.

ci-uU5CSetf4fib9oVOYKg.text: We came to visit family for the holiday and able to find this "groovy" diner.   First tip when dining here is  Bring a dolly to roll you out of here when your done with their delicious food.   Count on waiting for about 30 to 40 min but believe me its so worth the wait.  We had the privilege of having Veronica as our superstar waitress and her team of bussers who couldnt be more helpful and nicer.   I had the traditional benny that was cooked to an ooey gooey of egg perfection  Our girls had the mouse pancake that were super cute and fluffy  Hubby had a french toaat sandwich  He did wish he had asked for sunny side up but was still  Satisfying and huge might i add.  My son had a club style burger which was a monster serving  I would say he was happy because there was not a piece left behind.   When visiting Vegas this will definitely be our go to breakfast spot.  And before i forget order the banana muffin with some coffee. Thats a must!!  Thank you Egg and I team for welcoming our family into your restaurant.

J5S9Xmyhsm2QNZTwleoPqA.text: Great service.  Huge portions.  Please ask for Amanda.  She is a great server; attended to my table with her professional service.  I will definitely ask for her everything.  U will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the egg white chicken enchilada omelette.  Delish!!!!

k-V81FSc95qUnNm76nh6aQ.text: By far my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas off the strip. The food and service is always great and friendly. The banana bread is a must, and if you ask for it, they usually bring for free!

8yeyfpFY_k5voWAKilxN3Q.text: Just your basic breakfast place, what more can I say? Nothing to write home about, not too unique. Prices are decent. It's dependable. If you want a decent breakfast without the frills and hooey this is the place. Seem to be around the valley in different locations.  Good, clean establishment!

BT3T_nnjllrMyPOnNc7tmg.text: The Egg and I, and Chicken Fried Steak!  Experience:  I met some friends for early lunch or late breakfast.  It was pretty busy for 11:00 on a Thursday.    Facility:  fairly good size place with a dinner atmosphere. There were murals on the walls,  and typical tables and chairs with some half booth seating too.   Service:  not the best service I ever had, but not the worst. Doesn't seem to be one set waitress per table...this can be a good or bad thing. It took a good 10 minutes before someone took my drink order, we had to flag someone a few times, and after the food came, no one did the check back to make sure we didn't need anything else....but when they did help us, they were friendly and quick.   Food:  a girlfriend and I decided to split two meals, so we could try more.  We ordered the "Chili Relleno Eggs Benedict" special, and we got the "chicken fried steak with over easy eggs and banana nut muffin."   The muffin came out warm and it was pretty tasty.  Would have been perfect if they served some butter with it.  The Benedict was good. I love the chili taste that cut the richness of the Benedict.  The chicken fried steak was good, but not the best I ever had. It was crispy outside and a nice southern white gravy on the side to dip it in. I really did enjoy the hash brown potatoes on the side.  When they first came out, I thought I wouldn't like them because they looked to have too much seasoning on them.  However, they actually had just the right amount, and it had a Lawrys season salt flavor.   Overall:  I would definitely come back here again. They have so many good things in the menu I want to try.  See yah soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with gravy on the side...pretty good
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili Relleno Eggs Benedict special...very good!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin...warm and tasty!

PgHZS92hEsP_guKFRxiXCg.text: They were amazing. It was a 25 minute wait, which they handled smoothly. The menu is inventive, unique,  and enticing, and printed like a newspaper. The waitress was helpful and wonderful, and the manager was reallt great with mt allergies. Even though it was crazy busy, our food came out fast and perfectly made. For coffee and tea, you got your own pot at the table for refills, and the mix drinks were just awesome.  Thank you for a great time, I will definitely be back!!

1sRyW1dDgBPt7LigCoKPeA.text: Went here on a quick bite and decided to go in. The food tastes so good here. I was surprised by the banana nut muffins, it was soft and just a really good desert. What I ordered was the hash browns and pancakes. The hash browns are actually cut into little cubes and seasoned I was surprised at the shape but they were still really tasty will come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D3fROzeKdI1CQFmjCMc7zg.text: I came to this establishment with a craving for some biscuits and gravy.  The hostess and waitress were both really pleasent. The waitress did a excellent job explaining the menu to me and letting me know how I could customize my order. Everything I asked for was promptly brought out.  While not the best sausage gravy I have had in Vegas, it was still decent on it's own and still better than most of the sausage gravy I have had in Vegas. Nice amount of sausage throughout with a nice homemade flavor. I do believe it was made in house. But it still had the consistency of being out of a packet. The biscuits weren't as soft and tender as I would have liked, but still passable.  The bacon I got was on point. They were straight and crispy. I asked for the eggs to be extra soft. They were okay, but it was weird, the top half of the pile was cooked how I wanted, but the bottom half was cooked hard. I'm  guessing they were left on too long and not continually scrambled.   All together, I enjoyed my meal, but I am still looking for well made biscuits and gravy in Las Vegas. I will come back to try other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy with a side of eggs.

4ncPVvElK6iIawAJsqZ25g.text: Five stars for service and portions, this def hit the spot ! Reina our server was very nice and attentive, everyone who works here seems to be in a great mood and social, which is rare these days. Keep up the good job management!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You know its agood sign when theyre too busy eating to argue!

pw-_GT4OoxmAB31hNBkP2A.text: Perfect last stop before flying out of Vegas. Got a half order of The Works Omelette. The banana walnut muffin was delicious. And they give you the whole pot of coffee.

MI32rZDwHJdJViyhTb7KiQ.text: Man everything here is pretty bomb. They had my turkey bacon too. The good Godshalls brand. Oh my.

H6gULbxid5vjrdC_xR8tOg.text: Fantastic breakfast! Because it was our first visit, our waitress gave us free banana nut muffins. Man, were they good! The restaurant was busy, but we were seated right away.   They did not skimp on portions, and the prices were decent. The biscuits and gravy were tasty, and I loved their carrot cake french toast. So yummy! I received breakfast potatoes with my order, and I wasn't expecting them. I'm so glad, though, because they turned out to be my favorite thing on the plate. I've bookmarked this restaurant so I can visit again next time I come to Vegas.

DrYgnHtfbzZhlXwp8-cDrA.text: this little place been one of my favorite place to have breakfast on special occasions,what I like about this place,is the staff,they are very friendly,the place is very gozy,I love the orange juice they serve,and the coffee of course,plus,I love their omelettes.they make it how ever you like.so glad I don't have to go to a casino to get a breakfast .for me and my family.

x_mfpBGHh94VbinruZT6zQ.text: The number 1 reason we come here is for Amanda. She's such a doll & always goes above and beyond!! All the girls here are great but Amanda has our heart! Foods always great and coffee is always fresh! Egg and I is a most come!!!!

Vc-H5VFrfbb9kidlmRQF5w.text: Took my daughters and her friends here for a breakfast birthday... Carole Ann was our waitress she went out of her way to make our visit awesome from singing happy birthday to my youngest daughter to recommending the two younger one share a meal because it's soo much food... Thank you again we will return soon .. ;-)

XS6t2AgVU3CFeIKmnyK4Xg.text: Stacie did a great job serving us. Delicious potatoes!!! We'll be back on our next trip to LV

pBtNhRqWCcwiCIU8wVS7xQ.text: The breakfast was great Lianna our server was polite and prompt. the menu is vast and a bit overwhelming but those potatoes are so scrumptious

oxj6uWz8JNOW2XzCVh_A4Q.text: Great breakfast for a great price. Good quality food and a nice relaxt athmosphere accompanied with excellent service by Amanda our waitress

QZlO126gR54TwgTHESrjtQ.text: It's a very busy place always crowded but it's well worth the wait. The last time I came I only waited 10 minutes which was shocking I usually wait 20-30 because how crowded it is. The customer service Is pleasing for a busy place! They always make you feel welcome. Their potatoes has to be one of the best things there. What ever I order I make sure the item comes with potatoes or I get them in the side. If you are a fan of banana but muffins then you will honestly love theirs. Always moist and fresh out the oven. I've been to Egg works which is the same business but for some reason I prefer the Egg and I more.

0SL8YNxGSUSdO5Y0fsANVQ.text: Great breakfast spot away from the strip and fantastic prices! Best vegas breakfast imo

XZjEFGRE1eZrCo5E-hKMOw.text: Our server Brady was awesome. He is efficient and an effective worker. He always has a smile on his face and is cool with anything you ask him to do.  Best server I have come across in Vegas!!!

2y_J5kwepPKllSUlxNxSmw.text: Have came here several times with the family, service is always friendly and they are as fast as they can considering they are PACKED! But thats not a bad thing , food is good and portions are huge, we love coming here when we are in Vegas after a hard night of Partying the Egg and I delivers the goods!!

9OntJSNUZNAgQ_wFNWUWag.text: Alyssa! OMG! You are awesome. Wish we could be regulars so you could be our regular server! Service was great. I got biscuits and gravy, awesome first bite but then a bit salty. Service made up for seasoning.

HSyzP6HwiTQ7G_By87zndA.text: The food was AMAZING - and Liza had the best customer service - we will be back...!!!

7-hLX0S3aS6ilA22JjuZXQ.text: Delicious food at reasonable price the coffee and banana muffin was delicous

DjZf11qcGS67efxVdgPdTQ.text: Large plates! The corned beef hash was really something. Coffee was a bit pricey but the staff were friendly and the food came out faster than i expected. Should definitely eat here at least once if youre staying in the area.

K4x6T6C9xtRgOjy7RHJv_w.text: Come here with an empty stomach and an appetite or be prepared to take some food home. The portions are huge! The breakfast menu is one of the most diverse that I've ever encountered. 4-egg omelettes and scrambles seem to be the rule in Las Vegas. The Egg & I omelettes were delicious and loaded with cheese. We had a veggie omelette and a veggie scramble. The potatoes were seasoned just right. Reading prior Yelp reviews beforehand, I doubted that the banana nut muffins could live up to the hype. Boy was I wrong. Excellent. Fluffy and not too heavy on the banana. Prepare for a large crowd and a wait on the weekend. The hostesses were very pleasant and friendly. The bus staff too. And our server, Tamara, was a delight.

2TDgPTQvx2BC6p2zh2dr7w.text: Carole Ann provided good service!  The huevos rancheros are amazing! The hazelnut cream is good.  Friendly place and the food is amazing.  The crepe is out of this world as well.

2EVXpoQjZ6o6K3GegvSAsw.text: Excellent breakfast place off the strip.  Busy but minimum waits.  Food came out remarkably fast considering how busy they were.  Veggie eggs Benedict was great!  Maryanne didn't let my coffee get cold and seems to be a mind reader :)

U6w7WwJkbpfKNfeR_CvGVw.text: This place is wonderful. Our server Stacie was so sweet and cheery. How can you not smile in a place called Egg & I anyway?  Hint...come up with some "eggciting" comebacks. So much fun. Our Vegas trip was topped off with this place. Will be back!

1SeUwibRlP7ueGltZjwWGg.text: we yelped to find the egg and I while staying in Vegas. So glad we did . This place is so yummy. Nice warm banana bread muffins. Great variety of food choices for breakfast and lunch. Our family of 6 all got different items and we all loved each of our selections . I don't think you can go wrong with anything you choose. We received wonderful service from our waitress STACI. She was on top of refills and making sure we liked what we ordered. . I would go back again just because STACI's service was great. I would request her every time we go back. Definitely should try this place if you haven't already .

EHu9nfEw8qSclqmV8n50OQ.text: Amazing! The food was great and the service was awesome! Banana nut muffins!!!! It seems they get really busy Friday-Sunday so make sure you give yourself enough time. I will for sure be going back!

_wL3msmwFBabv-dAK8D0tA.text: We ended our vacation in Las Vegas with this breakfast!  We rented an AirBnb so we cooked a lot of breakfasts but on our checkout day we found this gem via it's amazing Yelp reviews and they couldn't have been more accurate! The staff was amazing and gave recommendations to their menu, they're very knowledgeable with every meal.  Definitely recommend the breakfast potatoes because the seasoning it incredible!  You're given a caraff of coffee and they even gave us the most deliciously warm from the oven banana nut muffin because it was our first time there. We sat outside and enjoyed a beautiful breakfast enjoying the views of the surrounding mountains.

wHIfiuRZ8du2BzZfE2peQw.text: I was staying at the Aria with my wife. They wanted $40 for the breakfast buffet....GTFOH...Im not paying $40 for breakfast unless it includes a tank full of gas and new nike sneakers. We drove to this place. It was fine, I'm glad we came, but not that great. I got corned beef hash with a muffin. What can I say...the food was a little greasy, the coffee a little flavorless, was unimpressed by the diabla potatoes (just homestyle fries) with lots of seasoning. The muffin was decent. MEH

QjQb28ETT1gJUaFnx7pL7A.text: Excellent service , friendly welcome always . And the menu is the best one in Vegas. My first choice always. Go and try:) yummyyy

iwXLcDblhpRdSMRSeb8qIg.text: GREAT PLACE if you're passing through. Tam makes the experience so worthwhile. The service we received was amazing!!!!

BtdwFL5dHVXRu05Pz9D_yw.text: Great and huge breakfast! Options for everyone, sweet and savory! Healthy substitute options available and nice service. There is wait usually bt it definitely worth!

ix7PBgvfeGhhZFSVMy4Zbg.text: Love this old school American diner. Portion sizes are large and affordable, and the waiters were very kind to let us know recommendations and gave us some free desert. A perfect way to fill up for brunch and in a less crowded part of Vegas.

PP9BYIyIdVdLozueKJVfUQ.text: If you are a wondering soul from the gambling and drinking from last night. This is place to go. They are going to fill you up then you will be good as new for another round.

fbio6wS8eKfFMBiuLVXAwg.text: Better food than ihop. Great service. Got the works omelette and was A+++. Go check them out.

werf5EsCpxdosRp6i69L8w.text: I would definitely give 0 if I could. The hostesses were very rude not welcoming at all. We used to go here every weekend for years however due to bad experience we stopped going so often.. today we thought about trying it again.. when we walked in the hostesses were rude and unwelcoming.. we waited about 10 minutes to be seated. We were a party of 5 and they sat us down in a table which probably only fit 3 people comfortably. No elbow room. We ended up leaving instead

zedXYKFy3lWafKoWpNB1og.text: Found this family owned breakfast place outside the strip with pretty amazing comfort food and awesome service!  It's worth the wait and they give you some delicious fresh out the oven banana muffins that literally melt in your mouth. While we were paying, a satisfied customer send a beautiful flower arrangement.    Maribel P.

58u5A4__U08x5S_8ELnkig.text: First the banana muffin I was questioning why this is a automatic side with each dish lol but it's amazing and warm when it comes out  highly recommend!! It's like a small cake!!!  Anyways, I had the chili (the hot one not the cincy sweet one) on egg white skillet without cheese, so yummy and amazing. My husband had the island favorite which he really liked. He describes the spam as something he would eat everyday if he could, I'm not a spam eater so I trust him if you like spam get it :) Coffee is good here also, and they're not cheap on their sauces, or creamers. Plenty to go around here. Good price. Good portion, good location. There can be a wait though it's worth it.

fvQPxN1xfQU5In_0d8fOYw.text: Simply amazing food! Be prepared to wait but so worth it! The service is great too!  Check in with Yelp and get a free banana nut muffin!

9FD8Zk22V7O5V1aGCRYiMQ.text: Stopped in for breakfast here with a friend before checking into our hotel. Wow this was a great choice! I got the Santa Fe burrito and it was amazing, great portions. My friend got French toast, eggs and bacon and everything served beautifully and excellent overall. Highly recommend!

6Aabglp39ALDJQcBnOHQXA.text: Eggs Benedict were yummy, I really enjoyed the food, the ambiance, and the service!   The only reason I don't give the Eggs and I the last star is bearcats my kiddos disapprove the pancakes!   I asked they if they wanted to go back and they immediately responded NO mommy the pancakes there were not delicious. I can't testify for it since I did not try them... but that would explain why my toddler kept on spitting them out.   Regardless I would recommend this place for the adult menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUM the sauce was perfect

X4B-iRKU7MrHYLN-yAaODA.text: It's eggs. There's really not much more to it. They do it right too. Perfect on a lazy/hungover weekend morning. If you're hungover, make sure to wear sunglasses and speak quietly because there are a lot of families and kids around.

SRzFQFUaxwQycOItVUkimA.text: Visited this place because of the great Yelp reviews. I must say that it was definitely worth going to too. Is the wait wasn't too long about 15 minutes they also texted us when our table is ready which was convenient because we were able to check out some of the other shops in the shopping center while we waited.  I ordered the chicken enchilada omelet and it was beyond delicious very flavorful and the tortilla chips on the top was the icing on the cake! Their hash browns are seasoned so well and you can tell everything was made to order.  The only reason I did not give it 5 Stars was because it took a long time for us to get water and when we did they only brought one instead of 3 & we also did not have silverware.  But our waitress was nice the service was good and I have already recommended this place to some of my friends and family.

After we got our drinks we placed our orders I had the Hawaiian French toast with eggs and bacon. That was a fantastic choice as I ate every last bite on the plate! Our server Kelly was absolutely perfect very friendly and attentive. We will definitely be back!

sajtDEhiAcMjCELjloXEvg.text: This place serves you a large portion. You can definitely take some of it home and eat then as leftovers. The omelettes are jam-packed! Their home fries are super good too!

rr5lEo0AFXyqlXOCHD78hQ.text: The French sandwich is a must, great service and food came out on the fly  Had the stuffed French toast and cream cheese stuffed too

5r69HXEmvv6vkjFO7OEPDw.text: This place is quite old but, they do great food and great service. the crew is so happy and you know you get good food. coffee is always brewed perfect and they have great seasoned fries i always love. their all the omelet are super good and, my wife always try for the breakfast.

tufcLnlnkkjZ67Kw4Q-1XQ.text: Hated the pancakes, too dense and heavy. So, I ordered the waffle, yup, same basic mix and not very good.  The scrambled eggs and sausage were great - sausage very greasy, but not in a bad way.

_t7DfHV1J984G0MAkio-hQ.text: This place is crackin' like an egg. Love the chile relleno omelet. So far this is my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. Friendly staff. Quick & pleasant.  Worth driving off the strip (Not too far). Opposite side of airport.

PiywlIn6O5Vo_WoRdCNc4g.text: This is our favorite brunch spot!  They have the best service and the freshest, hottest, most scrumptious food in town.  We often bring friends and family for a special occasion, or not. :-)  We're never disappointed.  Be warned, they can be very busy, especially on a Sunday. So plan ahead, but even with a reasonable wait, you won't be disappointed!

ABkDq8WvSyJ3ZCnJnwUrNQ.text: The Egg and I used to be my favorite breakfast place in town. It is now crowded and thefood taste so manufactured.  What keeps me coming back is breakfast with the girls, the banana nut bread (OMG, it's SOOOOO good), and the ranch potatoes.  During the weekends, the wait is up to 30 minutes. The staff is super friendly, they are great at keeping your coffee cup full. Also, what's cool is that when you have an issue or need something they have an egg on the table, you can flip it to reveal a sad, yellow egg. Someone is usually at your table within 30 seconds. It's like they have sonar for these yellow eggs.  The Egg & I serves breakfast and lunch and they close at like 3 PM.

w3-qY8sgNLXBkYoG4vK2CA.text: There's a reason this place was totally packed when we arrived. Even though it was packed, we were seated in a couple of minutes. The waitress was fantastic, fast and attentive. AlThe food is amazing.  Best potatoes I've ever had.  I can't wait to go back!

31G3U0t0NTCj5IX3Bd4Uow.text: I got the Texan French toast... It was pretty damn good! Coffee could have been a little stronger but not bad. Our server Alyssa did an outstanding job.

fKauzuiIK4DgBvU0CuxYzw.text: My wife and I came in on Sunday, 11/11/12, at 10:00 a.m. This was our first time here. There was a wait, but considering all of the Zagat listings on the wall, we didn't mind. When we were seated, the server was prompt and attentive. From there it was all down hill.  It too 30-40 minutes to get our food. Really? For egg dishes? Our food was cold. I had asked for my eggs basted medium. They came fried, sunny side up. The salsa that came with my wife's huevos rancheros was bland. That was better than my tasteless food. The cream cheese for my bagel was in a small metallic packet. It was so cold I could barely get it out.  Neither of us finished our food. I don't know how anyone could want to. I was still tasting my greasy "cordon bleu skillet" breakfast hours later.  Maybe I was just unfortunate, but bland, cold food and an unreasonable length of time to have the food delivered to the table means this is the 2nd time we will go there: first and last.

n7ApNw3HgpyCC7h3Rgzulg.text: Summary:  Perhaps the best breakfast restaurant I've ever found.  Long version:  So I'm on vacation with my two adult sons (and one of the boy's GF).  Since we're at a timeshare I'm enjoying making breakfast most of the week.  On a lark I decide we're going out, and I google "best las vegas breakfast".  #1 on the list is "The Egg and I".  So we map it and off we go, without a lot of expectations or knowing what's on the menu.    So first of all there's a bit of a wait - 15-20 minutes for a table.  Staff is friendly, place is clean, and every table is filled.  We are seated outdoors on the patio and there are heaters set up (the stand-up propane ones) every couple of tables so we're nice and cozy.  Coffee comes and guess what - it's really good.  I'm a bit of a coffee fanatic - I roast my own beans at home and can distinguish varietals between African and South American by taste - and it's surprisingly lively on the palette for a breakfast joint.  Between the four of us, we order a vegan breakfast, two different omelets and biscuits and gravy.  Each entry is under $10, and the portions are absolutely ginormous.  It's a quarter to midnight and I'm still stuffed.    But most importantly, every thing on the plate is absolutely delicious.  From the specialty omelets to the potatoes to the gravy, everything is simply first rate.    Apparently the place has won several awards and is Zagat rated.  I have no reason to doubt any of this - if you're in Las Vegas for breakfast, you absolutely MUST search out and try The Egg and I.

3zilfDlobUWe1GJFfrCpmg.text: Liliana Liliana Liliana, she was awesome and not to mention the food. Awesome food, awesome taste but most of all the best service. It is a must

RoJRJJMHph_12q-YGAkUxA.text: The food here is good just the amount of food And everything came out hot. Service was better than some of the other places we have been to.    We would come back here to try the rest of menu

zm_hM_jm_-1H6Mt7dvS1Mg.text: Had the biscuit and gravy.  It's served in an oval baking dish.  Biscuits are fluffy soft and the gravy is perfect.   I like the way they serve it in a bowl type dish (as opposed to flat plate) because it keeps the heat better.  Good attention to detail.

VOlfZsIllNlmaNqqONnU2A.text: Delicious food, the reviews are no lie! Came here for brunch while passing through Vegas on a cross-country road trip. Tried the:  1) Crazy Chicken Omelette: very good! The chicken was tender, there was a good ratio of guacamole and mushrooms, and the omelette was smothered in cheese and sour cream. Ranch potatoes on the side were fantastic, as expected. 2) Sausage gravy + sausage patty: a little on the salty side, but I thought it had a good balance of chunkiness and creaminess. I'm a bit of a sausage gravy aficionado (haha) though, so it may be that my standards are oddly high. 3) Banana Nut Muffin: needs it's own category, even if it's a side! Delicious delicious. Moist and warm, not too sweet.  I would come back! The service was great too. Even though we came right at brunch time and the place was packed, there was only a 5 min wait for two.

10KFtSkB2yw0p1rNWi1rZQ.text: Just like most other reviews say , the banana muffin is great- the potatoes are as well- the wife & myself both had the skillets , they were good . Plenty to eat , service was good staff was friendly , food came out quick- a good place off the strip

ytBNOEQVhrgXadAzuqRtog.text: Came here for brunch with a friend who's a local. The wait was about 25 minutes, but it was definitely worth it. I ordered the biscuits and gravy. Best I've ever had. The biscuits were melt in your mouth, and the gravy was so flavorful. I also had the orange juice, which tasted hella fresh.

N0zAo6srPkgPkkIGyZoVVQ.text: I had the huevos ranchero and was AWESOME! Sauce was fresh and tasted clean not greasy or oily , customer service was equal good, waitress very attentive and polite, even with it being busy they are still fast to respond to my needs while dinning, I will be back very very soon

rvN8xH8hn_5jI-Aslm9t-A.text: The reviews for this location are misleading.  This place is dirty. The center railing doesn't get wiped we sat next to dust and insects.  Expect a long wait and minimal customer service. The hostess was probably the most pleasant worker there. I didn't even touch my cup of water, the cup wasn't clean. Won't be back to this location.

i3UXTtI7b8qBrn8XpaN5aA.text: Big portions and tasty too. The works skillet was awesome. Would highly recommend for breakfast.

J8uOV0s2NlCJhI8ieHRIvA.text: My breakfast was disappointing. I disliked their potatoes. The bacon was hard, and old. The whole thing was a little over priced.

s3H8suLbRepdJIlYSjt76w.text: Best breakfast I've had in a long time these guys n gals know what customer service is all about. The French toast is amazing they know how to keep a drink filled, they're fast and all for a reasonable price. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

5S9MQm5jFUFeK1OzOAdReQ.text: This is a great place for breakfast. Huge portions, great banana nut muffins, fast service. They leave a huge pot of coffee on the table. Even the glasses of water are big. We were leaving to go back home and our super-efficient waitress, Jessica, even made us waters to go.

fI2MjrGdIM_gd4AxT6xt5w.text: great breakfast joint off sahara btwn arville and Decatur  think this was the original, they have a number of them in vegas now  buddy had the chicken enchilada omelette, which he said was pretty good for some reason though, their hash browns are now patties, like you get at mcdonalds....no biggie, still looked good  I had the loco moco, which was good, not anything to write home about though it was basic hamburger patty over rice with brown gravy and 2 sunny side up eggs on top....funny the waiter asked how I would like the eggs prepared, didn't know there was a choice with loco moco!  in retrospect, probably should have gone with standard breakfast fare or my go to key largo crepe sometimes you shouldn't try new things it wasn't bad, I just think their normal breakfast items are a lot better  noticed they have added quite a few southern/Spanish dishes, maybe to cater to changing tastes? I will have to try next time...I know, stick with what you like, but have to let you guys know right?

pdO04C4Yj7yOESFiOIk9EQ.text: I really like this place for eggs Benedict and I always make sure to come here everytime I'm in Vegas. Unfortunately this last time I went it was an awful experience. I was told the wait would be 20 minutes, but we ended up waiting closer to 50 minutes.To make matters even worse, there was a mix up in calling my party. When I first checked in with the hostess I made sure that my name was correct on the sheet and that it said caitlin, but when my "name" was called they called Lin???? We assumed that wasn't us because that's not even close to my name so we kept waiting. Finally after I noticed that parties that came after me were getting seated and we weren't I was getting really annoyed and it turns out that they had passed us a long time ago and they were 5 PARTIES AFTER US. When we brought it up to the hostess she tried blaming it on us saying that it was somehow our fault?? I was actually shocked like wtf?! They did nothing to try to make the matters better like I just waited 15 more minutes when I should've been seated already? Awful awful awful customer service, I don't care how good the food is or how awesome your business is doing but you've definitely lost a loyal customer

pPN4sbucvolX25LEZzDKZw.text: We came in on a crowded Sunday morning, but the wait for 2 was only 20 minutes. Service by Karla was phenomenal. She refilled my iced tea 3x without me needing to ask. Had the waffles with whipped cream and blueberries but the best part was the link sausage. Perfect amount to flavoring. Definitely will return to Egg & I on our next Vegas trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle with blueberries and whip, scrambled eggs and bacon. Added sides of half potatoes and link sausage.

jrVbhFD9h6rt2zByK-xrOg.text: Great service.  Interesting menu.  Food was well prepared and tasted good.  Ambience lacking but the food more than made up for it.

D-RifqeHqUoJoRJj62UTgw.text: Oscar was our waiter. He was quick as well courteous. Got us our check in muffins in a jiffy. Helped us with getting our orders correct since the menu has a lot of options. Very awesome place.

8x-ohYrngeVggmpv0H7XOw.text: Awesome breakfast I had incredible huevos rancheros  and a biscuit with gravy. Yummy. Everyone in my party loved their breakfast. Huge portions I only ate half. Karla gave us wonderful service. If you are visiting Vegas a must place to have breakfast!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t0UuL8H3o6y1-FyWS28i6Q.text: Really good service by Sayra and excellent food  we had the abundance special omelette and choc chip pancakes.. Everything was so good and the service perfect.

2HnuCWmPFDvWAiwBGjs0BA.text: The environment is awesome as well as the service. I ordered a chicken, mushroom, and spinach skillet but my mushrooms were not cooked as much as I thought. It was pretty much raw. The chicken was warm so I felt like it sat there for a while before serving it to me. The banana nut muffin is amazing though! Add some butter and bam you got yourself something even better. Overall experience is good. I would come back.

CBU3WDjbnu_GPjjSG2PAOQ.text: One of my favorite breakfast places to eat. Food was good and service was even better. Thanks Karla.

D9m_YIePd_E0fWaYUUqacg.text: If we are in Vegas, this place is a must!!! You will not be disappointed! And if you are, it's because you lack taste in food! Everyone is very friendly and attentive! This place is perfect for the whole family!

KLgpxVSFA6liRJ9tkESTjg.text: Just flew into Vegas and went there for breakfast. Had an omelet, ham, toast & juice. A friend had eggs & blueberry pancakes. Simply put, I would rate this restaurant A+.

slSQnuzQ8Ea1neph3kzoOw.text: Our server Karen was fantastic. Very helpful with our order and service was quick. The prime rib eggs Benny was delicious !

ZghAARGefB5EyO96es2lsg.text: I absolutely LOVE this place!! I always come here whenever I'm in Vegas. The service is excellent and super fast, it literally took 5-10 mins for our food to come! My favorite is the works veggie benny. The potatoes are so delicious! Definitely recommend coming here, if you haven't been here, you're missing out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili relleno omelette!

pH-i5h7JG1pMzipldTQPuQ.text: I am very please with this place. I ordered the chile relleno omelette & I could not believe how delicious it was. A lot of places take a wack at Mexican which usually ends up tasting like nothing more than Pace picante tossed on top; not this plate! I can't call it authentic but it's pretty close! We also tried the chicken fried steak & eggs, yummy!! It was nice to sit Outside on their patio and enjoy the Day I'll be back!

8M_0BzE2yeiCLDckSoJk4w.text: Friendly staff, regular customers addressed by first name, oh and great, fresh food.. Banana nut muffins were great, waffles with heaps of blueberries, potatoes tossed in spicy cajun seasoning, and the chicken guac omelet (decided to go light) definitely hit the spot. Worth it if you don't want the crowd and headache of casino buffets.. Why would you, if you can have this! Will be back.

It was warm and moist. Not to mention you get one with your meal that you order!! We tried The Works Omelette & The Crazy Chicken Omelette. You get tons of hashbrowns with your meal....it was so much I had to get a to go plate. Service was alright, nothing extravagant but the food is delicious and their menu is huge! I would definitely recommend it.

vKOie_rGSXUlbxmaHVsgdA.text: Really good food, priced well for amount given. Only thing is the bathrooms can use a little attention, but it wasn't bad. I will definitely be coming back here, the food is a must stop at place!

dcIVrcXhtDugEyXBYYMQNg.text: Great place, food, hospitality! No wonder it has so many good reviews. We had spinach Benny and Sundance Special and both were great! Sundance was fully loaded with artichoke and vegetable goodness. Very good/big portion. The muffins was fresh out or the oven so soft and yummy. The host and waiters were very polite, nice and friendly. 100% better experience than competition (eggslut). Most importantly, the place was filled with people and our food was on our table in less than 10 minutes! Huge selection of food too. Totally coming back and recommend this place.
