Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sundance Special

46CMYNpRHrNpQoQgId7WPw.text: This is my favorite breakfast place to go to when I'm in Vegas. I usually save this for my last stop before going home. Always making Vegas a yummy food destination.   If you're a breakfast person this is the place for you. They have every kind of breakfast you can think of and they do it right.   Also, a must is there banana nut muffin that you can also buy to take home as gift! Always really really yummy! This place never disappoint.

26rHPrYgwlrQbPhLcf40Kg.text: Wow wow .!! I've been in Vegas many times and we have the mentality of "just Las Vegas Strip food " thanks to Yelp we found Egg and I amazing food better than IHOP to sad we don't have that in LA.! And by the way amazing Costumer service.!!! Thank you

7Ckxbfb9AIJf29pw6F9tVQ.text: This place is great. Big portions worth the price. We loved the banana muffin (I think there's a Yelp check-in for it). We shared half a chicken salad with a side of chili and the country fried steak. The bbq chicken salad was great and I'd recommend if you are trying to eat light(er). The chili was ok-- I think I've had better. Finally, the fried steak was the star. It's everything you'd expect and it's cooked right. We'd definitely get this one again!

PmjvOPK-d7wjWEwlOf4IKA.text: Great! Have came to this place several times and it's never disappointing!  There food is amazing!!! And the muffin is to die for!  The service is great too. Everyone is so nice and the food come out at a decent time.  A must have when visiting Vegas!

AX8ho3VCUWYBnITnlbZfTg.text: This was our first visit here. I wanted to try something new for breakfast this morning so after a quick Google search I found The egg and I. It was amazing! Service was amazing! We were seated immediately and after ordering out food it was out waiting a matter of minutes. If you like hot sauce be sure to try their hot sauce that they make! Yum!!!   Thank you Liza for being an amazing server!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4xnnKPb1nSgiSomtVJGruA.text: Food and service were great. The only issue I had was the birds. We sat outside and the pigeons were flocking to us even though we were not throwing food at them. Manager came out and basically said there is nothing they can do. Could of send us an extra muffin for the inconvenience.

Hkt0nNObAQeDyFRgxbjJXA.text: This place is busy but the wait wasn't too bad.  Great service! I didn't like the waffles, a little too soft for my liking.  The avocado omelette was good.

BNtq3-lh7xgMwA44eMHH2Q.text: Exactly the experience we were looking for. We wanted a place off the strip to fill up before catching a flight back to NC. This was the right place. Huge portions that had us fueled for our trip. Don't expect fancy, just a good solid breakfast with a local feel. They have an egg sign sort of thing on the table. The black egg means all is well at your table. The yellow egg signals the staff you would like assistance. We were getting pressed for time to get to the airport and wanted to-go cups for our coffee. We turned the egg to black and a staff member showed up immediately to help us out. Neat idea as this signal is not only for your waiter, but for the entire staff.  We walked in around 8:30 on a Saturday morning and were seated immediately. By the time we left there was a line out the door.  We had the Country Benny and Grandma's biscuits and gravy, both with the hash browns. Excellent choices. Anyone familiar with Bojangles on the east coast and their seasoned fries, the hash browns here have a similar flavor. Very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Benny.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grandma&#39;s biscuits and gravy with eggs and bacon added.

n4GgJxi2F6Tq25b3u2nJjg.text: Been here many times before. Food is always great. Bringing my girlfriend for her first visit. She's already loving the muffin

c3JwVox3cR8NP_9PMfKUTA.text: The service is great! Our waitress was super sweet and helpful; she answered all our question. The orange juice was delicious and definitely freshly squeezed. The food was delicious! If you are in the area, this cute little breakfast place is a definite must. The children's meal was super cute: a chocolate chip Mickey Mouse shaped pancake! And the wait time was not that long, definitely worth it. I got the chili skillet and it was so delicious. The portions are good sized and I left happy and full. The key manager Abby served us and she was so sweet and nice. Loved her!

TRP4q6zx5A8j4M3wib576w.text: Classic always hits the spot! I love their home fries and the seasoning is what keeps me coming back for more.

rIkZ22nnIudvBvh91RDoaA.text: I had such a wonderful experience and Oscar was probably the best server I have ever had. He gave suggestions right away, which made the ordering process a lot less stress-inducing for me, which I highly appreciate, as I have a lot of anxiety over ordering food from a menu that I'm not familiar with. He also took interest in us as customers, and asked about where we're from and made lovely conversation. I am so thrilled about my experience and will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.

Qi0kPdDO69aRG0YtKA9JTQ.text: Randomly chose this place based on a breakfast yelp search. I ordered the chicken fried steak skillet with a banana nut muffin. The muffin was very soft and moist, almost melt in your mouth. Very delicious. The skillet was also exceptional. The country fried steak needed a very light push of a fork for it to break apart. It was very tender and juicy.   The service was very friendly and welcoming. Our server Oscar was also very attentative and refilled our drinks before we finished drinking. That always scores huge points with me. This will definetly be a Vegas staple whenever im in town.

QU-JAMp6CGj2YO4cup-gHg.text: 10 Stars = Service Menu selection is on point when it comes to eggs, but it's the service that speaks volumes at this establishment! Patrick is THE MAN! And use the happy/sad egg service sign, they come running!

yfhmIpM9vpnbwSZ3JTSbHQ.text: Not bad. Crepes were more like an omelet than a crepe. I enjoyed the banana nut muffin.

5xqjNWJeBGyrJ_JOFPA1rw.text: Great environment. The wait wasn't too bad Friday morning. They are very attentive. Got the enchilada omelet and really liked it. What I liked more was the potatoes. Seasoning was amazing on the potatoes. The banana muffin you get for free is surprisingly good too.

-E0xb6z207O3qlaQUXybVQ.text: My husband and I have been wanting to stop by here for quite awhile but it always seemed so busy. The service and the food were great! I ordered the veggie omelette and he ordered The Works scramble. The portions are giant so we had a lot to take home :-) We also tried their awesome banana nut muffins!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Works Scramble
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Omelet!! Huge and delicious

ldtYnLXj7SNk3y4HnwFFUg.text: More like 3.5 stars for me but I'm going to round it up to 4 because of their yummy banana nut muffin and breakfast potatoes which are the stars of the show here!  I ordered Brad's Very Special Omelette with spinach, mushrooms, tomato, and cheese which was about 3 stars to me - good but not the best I've had.  I chose to have it with their famous muffin and potatoes which are delicious!    Got here around 1 p.m. on a Thursday afternoon and there were plenty of available tables.  Service was good and prompt and prices pretty low so for those reasons I can also round up from 3.5 to 4 stars.  I definitely enjoyed my food and overall experience here more than at Hash House A Go Go, so save on waiting time and come on over to Egg & I!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. About to dig into the banana nut muffin!  Yummy!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brad&#39;s Very Special Omelette (spinach, mushroom, tomato, cheese) and potatoes

zXESpPBu2EcLU4iTQP58Yg.text: I had the egg white omelette, my son had blueberry and chocolate chip pancakes, my daughter had chocolate chip pancakes, and my wife had the hash, not the kind you smoke, but often times I wish she'd try it, ... food was great, service was perfect, but the wait was long (which is why I gave it 4 stars).  However, that single condition to reduce it by one star is really unfair if you think about it...? 'Cause the reason it was long to get a table was the fact so many others were waiting before us, 'cause the food and value is pretty damn good.  Truly I should give it five stars. But life isn't fair, so they get four.  Notwithstanding I was standing for about 30 minutes before getting a table.  Why was I standing? I'm a glutton for punishment. Therefore I ate with a gluttonous appetite once they sat my tired ass down.

QxPOfw6m_E2NqO1LuwqEUg.text: Love the banana muffin and the potatoes dusted with their signature salt.  Had the eggs Benedict  good hollandaise sauces. Great place with huge portions and amazing happy wait staff. Look forward to coming here each time we are in Vegas.

wVj48cc_5fAzh7oICaG6MQ.text: I wanted to try breakfast off the strip and read the reviews. So I did and I'm HAPPY to say. It's worth the drive. I walked in and was seated immediately. The wait staff is very attentive to their customers. I had barely sat down and was asked if I wanted coffee or water. I said both, please.   Kai, the waitress, said "Hello!," asked If I had questions. The breakfast menu has nearly anything you can think of. It's on there! She returned within a couple of minutes and took my order. Ham and eggs, with a choice of hash browns or home fries. I went the home fries,   While I was waiting someone would come along asking if I wanted coffee, I was impressed. The place was crowded with locals and some of us tourists!  The order arrived in about 10 minutes. I nearly fell out of my chair, the slice of ham nearly covered half the plate, it was lean, cooked to perfection. The home fries were not greasy and the eggs were cooked perfectly. As I prefer over medium, along with the toast.  Kai, came by at least two more times before. I ask for the check. This place had a good feel to it. By the way, it's situated in a strip mall and a person could drive by it. The words Egg and I are in yellow, the parking can get a little tight. However, the parking lot can handle the customers.   Enjoy your breakfast there !

V1Fg_Zsq9rNDVuhuFjRcdQ.text: When I'm in town I have to eat here!! The food is amazing. I love their banana muffins that you receive when you order. It's so worth the wait when there's a long line. Great price for the proportions. Make sure you get Oscar as your waiter , he is awesome!

yPS3dqjnqS_GgfS4_ZzaNg.text: Great food and service! Met my high expectation! A must place to try! Will be back again !

ulsNQ4vAf59GNKi22hUryQ.text: Huge portions. Great value and brunch food cooked to perfection! I ordered soft scrambled eggs, and they came out perfect! This place knows their eggs. Also home fries was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic breakfast!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco!

JCV9oa_nsKnWwMH6jmZqsw.text: A great breakfast spot off the Las Vegas strip . I would recommend this place . Large portions , fast service , and food is delicious . I would be returning back while in Vegas .

SQvYmXapHOrwLY-6x1_B6w.text: My expectations were high after seeing and reading the reviews on Yelp.   The inside was clean and cozy looking and they had several flat screens.   My order the corn beef with scrambled eggs and the banana nut muffin.   The food didn't WOW me. The corn beef was average although it was home made, muffin was cold and the potatoes tasted deep fried with a to much seasoned salt. The pineapple slice and honeydue were juicy and a nice extra to the plate.  Service was good and attentive here but I probably would not return here.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash breakfast

561AZoeGqz9k-vB6x-Kqug.text: Fantastic! My wife and I were in town for the rodeo. Came here on a Sunday morning for breakfast based on yelp reviews. The place was busy but we were sat down in 10 minutes. Waitress was super friendly. Placed our order and we had our food delivered quickly. I had the county fried steak and eggs. It came out hot and tasted great. We also had the muffin. It was awesome. Next time we are in town, we will be eating here!

Dp3n-aonjpBrYcXfl7Oyyg.text: This is BIG! Cant say much cause I am full. This place will make you feel good all day. Real good place, servers are all friendly and good. Recommended!

rCMUgTRTehF5LO-fxA2ozg.text: Really awesome service. Food is fresh and served warm. Portions are just right tho we had to take some home. Server is pleasant and has great customer relations ethics. We will be back again.

9qPfEHtpU8DdqE9ZAFQe-Q.text: I've heard A LOT about Egg & I and in a quest to try different breakfast spots in Vegas my husband and I landed here on a Saturday morning. The place was packed, obviously very popular.  The menu is extensive, quite a few breakfast items to choose from. Obviously eggs are the feature here with a large omelette selection. The place is homey, and they have murals of farm lands all over the walls.   I decided to get the Mexican Omelette - Chorizo, chiles and onions and cheese, topped with sour cream. Came with a heaping side of potatoes and choice of bread - I got wheat.  Overall I was kind of underwhelmed by the dish. Usually I love chorizo, but for some reason this omelette just did not meld like it should.   Service was SLOW. Yes, it was busy on a Saturday, but there came a point when my husband looked up and said, "Where's the food?". Never a good sign when you actually start questioning whether or not they put the order in.  They did have a very yummy banana nut muffin, which I highly suggest getting if you come here. AND (as of this writing) if you check in on Yelp, you get one for free!  This is definitely a go-to breakfast spot if you live in the area. But, if you live elsewhere in the valley I am sure you can find a place that is just as good, if not better. I still like Black Bear Diner over Egg & I for breakfast.

LcYibkQyPqXeR2kPgu59zA.text: good food but not great....huge servings too much for seniors

RnSEgy_Da_fshXoY98bU6A.text: Awesome food and great service. The food was a little slow to come out, but we were advised of that by our waitress... I loved my Chicken Fried Steak a lot, the gravy was very delicious. My partner's omelette was also delicious. The Diablo potatoes are crispy and flavorful. I will definitely eat here again and again...

4nGnjG0Mh4ishgGWRrlI2A.text: Was in town and saw the reviews here so decided to come try it out. We got there early (7am) so it wasn't packed. I ordered the strawberry cream cheese stuffed french toast and it was really really awesome. Huge portion and just really well done. Also got some OJ and it was nice to see that it was freshly squeezed. Prices were affordable and service was friendly. I'm not a huge breakfast person, but if we had this place back in LA, I would definitely make it a point to become one!

c1HFB9UVKXDsDyWTcxnthA.text: Amazing breakfast off the strip! Such nice waitresses, best breakfast potatoes I've had. I had the french toast sandwhich and it was to DIE for! but I recommend sharing since they are HUGE.   Must go

i-Hl6pV6gUUj-0L7GY6xNg.text: Our server forgot to bring utensils til we got our food. I know it could happen and isn't a big deal, but she disappeared for a while. So we have to find other server to get utensils.  She appeared again, and she gave us check at the moment we just had some bites. I looked around to see people with other servers whether they had a check, just in case "it's the restaurant's style." But only people who seemed already finished got the check. I felt she wanted us to leave asap. After giving us the check, she had never came our table again.  It sucked. Better train the girl again.

zS7NQnnGHKtn_SK-jxwGyA.text: This place is excellent, we have gone 2 consecutive days. The food is good and affordable, the muffins are amazing. The service is outstanding, from the manager to the servers. My server Alexa is definitely a great asset for the restaurant. I will definitely come back.

oiYOKI7rgD-fdPmGSRsGgA.text: THE breakfast place! The portions are always large and rarely have I found a breakfast menu with more variety. It's popular for many reasons so there may be a small wait, but the tables get turned over pretty quickly. The staff is always friendly from the hostess through the bussers. Our server, Stacie, was very nice and quick with the food. I work in the food service industry and usually have a very critical-eye when eating out. This place is outstanding!

vZ-qBLNRq6d6pwhqoYzA_Q.text: Great food! Big portions! Good value. My wife and kids all had something different and it was generous and good. Lilliana was excellent! Super sweet, prompt and took care of us well. Glad I finally found a Vegas breakfast place that is local and great!

A82UAM_No4D-B6I8R5YRtg.text: Hello hungry people!! Yes, I'm back (again)!  Let's dig in...  So, my local bestie recommended this place to a friend and I who were in LV and I'm so happy she did!  This quaint little gem is AMAZEBALLS!!  They give you menus that look like newspapers and bright yellow mugs, awaiting your coffee, adorn the tables.  Of course, as the name suggests, eggs are their specialty, but they offer much much more!  The waitress suggested I try the "Loco Moco" and I was not disappointed!! It was a beautifully, delicious symphony on my tongue!! Sticky rice, eggs (any way you like), hamburger patty, and brown gravy.    I know what you're thinking..."is this chick pregnant?!" rest assured, I'm not (any more) and this dish really made sense once I took a bite!! Just wonderfully cooked and seasoned and all the different components played nice together in the tummy!  (there's a party in my tummy...so yummy, so yummy yummy)  It's not in the nicest part of LV, but that's why I love finding these "off-the-beaten-path" joints!  What they lack in environment, they make up for in taste and ambiance!

WX3CJFtsprpW6YykT458YA.text: I went here last year and wasn't super impressed. I don't remember exactly what I got, but I think it was an omelette. Decent, but I didn't see what all the fuss was about and especially for a place that isn't cheap. Well, I'm glad I tried it again, because now I see more of what people have been talking about. I went with a party of 8 and the service was excellent. Someone recommended the stuffed French toast and although it didn't really sound like my kind of thing I ordered it. Well, I'm glad I did because that thing is awesome! Perfectly cooked eggs with the right amount of cheese and sausage. The French toast was done just right as well. So, I suppose it really depends on what you have here and what your tastes are. For example, I tried those muffins everyone at our table was raving about and I didn't like them. Go figure!

QrfEVYGDFIoaioXYN7Fl3Q.text: Yummy breakfast.  Wait is as expected.  I ordered the portugese sausage hawaiian breakfast because other than in Hawaii this is the only place I have been able to find it.  It is a whole sausage they don't skimp.  Good food!

cqow-0HOv5A40Oh0m3YSQw.text: Awesome breakfast and awesome server! Manuela was so attentive and probably the best server I have encountered in a very long time. I highly recommend the Crazy Chicken omelette! If your appetite is big get the whole thing (half portions also available). Best banana nut muffins too! You can't go wrong here!

hH_d0visttlpdqYzpwfk7A.text: We used to come years ago more often, but since we've moved to the NW I just seem to never be around this area when it is open so we made a trip to come eat here.   So I saw they had loco moco on their menu which is something I wasn't expecting. I decided to order it anyways though I wasnt sure about ordering a item at a non Hawaiian spot. It was actually really good, even better than most of the fast food style Hawaiian places as everything tasted much fresher and the gravy had good flavor.   The fiance got a apple walnut chicken sandwich which he seemed to enjoy. I took a bite and it's solid as far as cold chicken salad sandwiches go.   The thing I like is they are always friendly here. I really liked our server as she was just chipper.   It's always busy here so I avoid the peak times to not have to wait, but if you go later in the afternoon like we did, there's no one there. 1 hour wait for breakfast time or no wait for breakfast at lunch....I'll pick the no wait!   It's been a long hiatus, but my next visit won't be so far off again.

NkAFT0c8yU3xodCswcj9Eg.text: This place is a gem. After a very disappointing buffet at a casino with a price tag of 32.99 per person. We decided to use yelp for our breakfast in the morning. Place was packed and it's worth noting but they clean tables and have people seated as fast as possible.   Pros.   Food is great. I have paid triple for similar food. And I had the cabo breakfast burrito which is and easy item to mess up. Sause was dryer and baked on so it did not cause the burrito to become soggy. Was crisp without too much grease.   Great customer service.   I will be eating here again before I leave is how much I truly enjoyed my self.   Wife would want me to give it a 4.5 because they used too much cheese on her omelet however it said cheesy so I blame her.

pauM3MKQjNrZnxJIGQxuHg.text: My husband and I had breakfast here this morning. There was a      10 minute wait which was fine.   The waiter was pleasant. They offer a lot of breakfast choices.  We ordered Eggs benedict and coffee.  The sauce was bland and sloppy on the plate and did not taste like hollandaise.  The order came with seasoned potatoes- way too many potatoes. The coffee was served in a coffee pot the coffee was luke warm. This place is not cheap.  The service was ok but the food could be better.

tn_gcj7AFoyQsvXzSuBaUA.text: We are visiting Las Vegas from Boston and this was an amazing brunch meal for our first day here. We decided to check this place out after reading the glowing reviews on Yelp, and we were not disappointed.  We arrived around 10:15am on a Sunday and the place was packed! There was a line outside the door of people waiting. However, the wait was quite fast and our party of 6 was seated in about 20 min. The service was excellent - our waitress Alexa was super friendly and took our complicated drink and food orders with ease. Any one with a Yelp account can also check in to receive a free banana nut muffin, which was huge, warm, and full of banana flavor. It was one of the best banana nut muffins I have tasted. In addition, coffee comes with unlimited refills!   Our table ordered: Bacon and sliced avocado omelette ($11.25): excellent. The omelette was huge and stuffed with ample chunks of whole avocado, bacon bits, and topped with a generous amount of melted Jack cheese and a dollop of sour cream. There was also a side of buttered toast and a choice of home fries, cottage cheese, or fruit (I think this is offered with any egg dish). Delicious, and a large portion size for one person.  Heart stopper skillet special ($10.25): this was my favorite dish that our table ordered. It was one of the specials and consisted of a layer of works potatoes topped with bacon, ham, and sausage and smothered in homemade country style gravy and two sunny-side up eggs. The gravy and the runny egg yolks mixed with the potatoes and meat created a delicious creamy explosion of flavor and umami.  Southwestern Cobb salad ($10.50): a huge salad with a ton of toppings. I was impressed that there was very little lettuce, and instead a lot of delicious toppings such as taco seasoned chicken, black bean and corn relish, tomatoes, black olives, bacon, cheddar cheese, tortilla strips, and a whole sliced avocado (amazing!) with chipotle ranch dressing.  Sundance special omelette ($11.25): veggie omelette with spinach, mushrooms, artichoke hearts and Swiss cheese topped with tomatoes and feta cheese. You can also add chicken for an extra $2.50. The feta cheese melded perfectly with the creamy egg flavor and the various vegetables.   Overall, I highly recommend this place for brunch. Service was super friendly and efficient, and the food is great value for the portion size and the price!

oC-vQe0mLVdIIDp_EOc8vQ.text: This place could get really crowded!  Why only 3 Stars? 1st star - originality of the place: the seating arrangement is really unique. the center dinning area is high up and the side dinning area is ground level.  2st star - menu has a ton of choices! a lot of different ways to serve egg for breakfast and more: burgers, salad, sandwiches, and steaks.  3rd star - service is good even though they could get so busy each server was alert and ready to serve customers who need help. Also, they have this EGG SIGN on each table where you put the WEIRD EGG FACE if you need service lol   Food was okay, but I totally blamed my self for ordering my egg wrong. Apparently, I could order my egg "scrambled easy" so it won't be so dry. Oh well, there is always next time. Definitely will come back to try more of their stuff and of course! update my review for my fellow yelpers.

PmdBFM4c3t4VWzVEK8n0-g.text: Everything was fantastic.   My server Patrick did an outstanding job.   The food was excellent and prepared to my liking.   Great place too eat away from the busy and overpriced restaurants on the strip.

grZlx2EhCQzYeZJ80ywybg.text: Ordered avocado, they didn't put it on my meal. Told the waitress they forgot it and to forget about bringing it. She began to goad me on to get avocado, which was strange after saying no several times. I repeated that it was fine; at that point i didn't care for it. Eventually I submitted but asked for only a little amount of avocado. She brings me avocado and soon after - the check. I look at the check, no avocado charge. I was happy, and ready to pay. A few minutes later, she sneakily replaces the check with a brand new one. I hardly noticed that she had done that and after looking at the check again, a $3 avocado charge made me cringe. Wtf? If it was your mistake and I said I was fine on avocado, why would you goad me on to get it? Then give me a check without it (again forgetting, but this time you forgot to charge me so might as well leave it), and replace it with a ridiculous charge? And do not call your customers "babe", it's just weird especially when you say it behind them. "Thanks babe" - as I was holding the check in my hand. Thanks? No thanks lol.I wish I remembered her name, but she was some older red-haired lady. I was not pleased with this incident. Also, their "Habla Diablo" potatoes, which comes with every meal, are horrendous. They taste like over seasoned, beyond-salty fast food potatoes. 2 stars for getting seated quick, polite service, and a banana "nut" muffin for a side, despite the fact that it was overly sweet and did not receive the slightest bit of nutty flavor. Be weary of such scenario as I have endured. For these reasons, I would not consider returning.

7h2RZD9hwP-gEztP77WlWg.text: My ritual before heading home. I head to Egg and I and have a breakfast feast. I enjoyed everything that I have tasted there. From fried eggs to the pancakes to the seasoned potatoes. It has a very homey feeling.   It is nice to get away from the strip and get used to life outside of Vegas before heading back home. I love the staff here. Super nice!

9hV6FfGFziaDiRIWavBKtg.text: Great food excellent service. My waiter Patrick was very helpful polite and gave us amazing service. Thank you.

kqlH_zCAPETkg4X9rWJKNw.text: Great place for that comforting desire of the south west. Service staff is friendly and accommodating. There are regulars left and right due to the variety of food served. One can order the American eggs and toast with a side of fruit as well as the Belgium waffle that is crisp on the outside and moist on the inside. Their house banana muffin is awesome! Their potato fries and squares have an seasoning that has just enough flavor in it to mix perfect with your eggs.  We had an excellent experience and will most definitely go back.

q8RwwOBEcvt-Ifgpyh5mAw.text: Everything our party of 4 ordered was delicious!! Try the banana nut muffins!! Linnea was an incredible waitress!!

gMsTQtgd5RixPNTjs3QF2g.text: Great, great, great! I had Waffle Works. Crispy, light, tasty. Served perfectly by happy, smiling Stacie.  Will be back for sure.

W74_770kTfK8yRHg77t7sQ.text: I was searching for a solid brunch spot while in Vegas and came across Egg and I.  It was about a 30 min wait for a table on a Sunday around 11am.  I ordered the Country Benny and banana nut bread French toast to share.  Both were delish!  If you're a fan of biscuits and sausage gravy then the Country Benny is the way to go.  The French toast was great with the apple syrup they give on the side.  Service was fast and friendly.

8n7Vb1MDpNr41ZvjtHLlrw.text: We're from Cali and never been here before but from the moment we sat down Linnea made us feel right at home! She was so polite and helpful, with excellent advice on the menu we ended up with 2 delicious plates for breakfast! Linnea made our last morning in town eggcellent!

N3jbRf8Z1lytq64rEyn5sg.text: This is a great breakfast spot in Vegas if you are visiting the strip and have a car. If you want to avoid long lines or expensive buffets, this is a great local alternative. Be prepared to wait in line! There is usually some time of wait in the morning to brunch. I would definitely recommend trying to get there as early as possible. When I first walked in, I thought...hmm this looks like a glorified Denny's. However, the painting on the wall was cute but the the rest of the restaurant was a bit dated in decor. However, it was easy to ignore all of that and realize that every seat was packed with a combination of locals and visitors to the great city of Las Vegas.   Being a more health conscious eater, I ordered a egg white veggie omelette. My husband ordered the combination of eggs over easy and banana nut pancakes. Both were excellent, high quality ingredients and well made. The best part was getting the bill which was just a little over $20. That amount would barely cover one person's entrance into a mediocre Vegas strip brunch buffet.

-mdTmPReWjhJl0LnilxbHg.text: Outstanding breakfast spot!! We go every time we visit Vegas. Our server Tabatha was great!!

53bYbaSDrn_rsTMrxbg84A.text: The chile relleno omelette was alright, not spectacular but decent. I expected an omelette stuffed with a fire roasted pepper stuffed with cheese. Instead it was a fire roasted Anaheim chile inside an omelette topped with cheese. It was good 4 stars. My partner ordered the stuffed French toast. It was delicious! If you like sweet and savory it's a must have. Banana muffins chewy and moist with no crumb. Our waitress was lovely, I forgot her name but she was very sweet, welcoming, attentive and genuine :-)   Overall fair price, decent food, solid service.

qsyGdrKwCm6w8ePodhGUtg.text: I was really enthusiastic to try this place, based on the good Yelp reviews.  What I found was a nice coffee shop.  The service was very attentive, but the food was mediocre.  Maybe we missed the point, because neither my wife nor I wanted a breakfast consisting of "hot sauce with something under it," which seems to be the specialty of the house.  So, for example, we both ordered ordinary hash browns instead of the potatoes "diablo" (or something like that).  The hash browns we got were clearly pre-frozen patties - not quite as good as the ones you get a Trader Joe's.  My stuffed french toast, and my wife's eggs benedict were very ordinary.  And the prices were at the higher end of the reasonable range.  I can't see any reason for us to go back to this place.  For now, our three favorite breakfasts on the West Side remain the Black Bear Diner, Hash House a Go Go, and the buffet at Orleans.

WH-HYo5mR2dGdHa0ATNdqg.text: This is a cute little place with nice people here.  We didn't order much and we got it to go.  They are only open until 3pm for breakfast and lunch.  We came around 1pm during the week and it seemed like there was a long wait to be seated.

4yUJ7hfSwt05bJd54RV6kw.text: When you're in Sin City and breakfast comes to mind, many people might think the breakfast buffets on the Strip hit the spot. Don't get me wrong, those are good. However, if you are looking for something a little off the beaten path for the BEST spot for breakfast in Las Vegas, look no further because the "Egg and I" will have you covered. With an astounding 2,500 reviews (as of October), its no wonder why this place has near-perfect Yelp reviews.   I've actually had this place bookmarked forever as I finally got the opportunity to dine here with my lady on the morning of Saturday 9/30/17. Located directly on West Sahara Ave. (and adjacent to Arville St.), Egg and I is located in the Westside neighborhood of Las Vegas and only about a 10 minute drive from the Strip. Parking especially during breakfast hours can be very challenging as there are other business here. But the majority of people the park in this lot dine here.  Since we had arrived around 10:45am, we park quite a distance from the main entrance. The exterior is very rustic and looks like your mom & pop place. The interior has a very cozy and charming feel to it. Since the weather was a perfect 76, we decided on dining at their generous outdoor patio. Since I was still tired (after not crashing until 3:30am and waking up at 7:30am), I ordered coffee. What is nice is that they give me the entire carafe of coffee! And lots of liquid creamers to go with it. Score! And our server was very sweet, attentive, and took care of us in a timely manner.  Their menu is very extensive; they have a huge variety of Eggs Benedicts, omelettes, corned beef hash, French toast, pancakes, waffles, and crepes. I finally decide on ordering their "Bacon & Onion Skillet" (for $9.99). My lady opted for "The Classic" which are two-eggs (she chose over easy) w/toast and Godshall's turkey bacon. Both of us receive their signature Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes. Even though business was at full capacity, both our breakfast platters arrive in just 10 minutes.  I've got to say, I was very impressed with what I received. There is something magical about these potatoes because the seasoning in them was addictive! And the bed of eggs over the ooey-gooey cheese made every savory bite a heavenly experience. I had the opportunity of trying some of her turkey bacon and damn, this was flavorful and on point! For the price you pay, you will get enough food to carry you through the rest of the day. In fact, my next meal wasn't until around 8 hours later at 7:30pm.  A little added bonus, if you check-in on the Yelp app, they will give you their signature Banana Nut Muffin. However, we got so much food that even more carbohydrates with that muffin would equal a massive food coma. Overall, the "Egg and I" is definitely a place worth checking out. A great family-owned experience, quality food, excellent prices, and stellar service makes this one of the easiest five-star ratings I've given in quite some time!

B6f9gmV4Be28uWB6rYrZpQ.text: Not even sure how we found this place (thanks to Siomara for that!) but glad we did. Were staying on the Strip, but wanted a good and reasonably priced breakfast before a long road trip, so here we came. The place is in a small mallish shopping center about 15 minutes from us (the Excalibur) but worth the drive. Busy as all get out, but we found out why in short order. The menu is extensive, and if you can't find something you like then you're just not hungry!  We had an avocado and bacon omelette, bacon maple cream french toast and an egg dish I've never heard of previously, the "Fiesta skillet." All were large, delicious and filling. The house featured Habla Diablo salsa was exceptionally good, with a nice thicker consistency than I expected and just enough heat to accompany but not overwhelm the dishes it was in (in our case, my Fiesta skillet). The service was good and attentive, considering how busy it was. Tables were cleared quickly and reset for the next guests with practiced speed. We were even treated to a complimentary house made banana nut muffin. When I ordered a "muffin" for my toast, thinking "English" I was given a banana nut muffin. I didn't know this, and the waitress was kind enough to bring the English muffin as well for no charge, so we all had our fill of these dark, moist and so sweet (but not too bananey!) muffins! Sooooo good! As for prices and servings, none of us left hungry and there were leftovers to take as well - and for all 3 adults we paid less than ONE buffet price at Harrah's the previous day. Definitely a place to consider (there are several locations under the Egg and I and the Egg Works branding), and if you don't like eggs check out their salads, sandwiches and burger menus - you'll find something!

I opted for a biscuits and sausage benny and my partner got the cordon bleu skillet. Both meals were served fast and hot. Potatoes were crispy and seasoned and eggs cooked perfectly. I loved having the option to pick a flavored coffee creamer, too. This place knows what they're doing and they're doing it well. Would return and recommend for a hearty Vegas breakfast!

Cx_TuJSfSgogijKv3a1hpA.text: The anticipation of eating at Egg & I was wonderfully fulfilled on this my first visit to this location. Everything as expected at an Egg & I as I have eaten there in several states. I ordered the Blackened Rib Benny and every bite along with the seasoned potatoes was simply delish. All was cooked perfectly especially the eggs and the hollandaise is just right. Be sure to check in with the Help app and get one of the best banana but muffins you'll ever taste.  The service was quick even though they were pretty busy. To sum it up this place is not to be missed for a hearty filling and scrumptious breakfast when your in the neighborhood.

B_0rWq9Sx8w0ONPxVrncaw.text: This is the best breakfast place in Vegas. The portions are big, the food is great and everything I have tried is so good.

vHlU_ZKyBmdwvfgfH1bOrw.text: On our last day in Vegas, we decided to leave the crowded hotel / strip scene and eat breakfast on our way out. Thanks to Yelp we found the Egg & I. It was about 2 miles west of the 15 fwy. There was still a slight wait but we knew it was a good place because there were so many customers. They really need a revolving door. Karla was our waitress & she was the best!  Answered all our questions & was very attentive. The staff were all on point. From hostess to bus & kitchen staff. The food was great with reasonable prices. They had the best breakfast selections to choose from. Had about a dozen omelettes, 10 bennies, 8 skillets, pancakes, waffles, French toast, crepes and on and on. I never even looked at their lunch selections! We will definitely be back to this hot spot on every Vegas trip!

rGcGzOF3GcYptptPyo8lRA.text: SO DAMN SALTY. HOLY COW.  friends wanted to try this for lunch when we were in the area and i had high hopes for this place. wait for a little over 10 people was a long wait as this place is super busy. once we got seated we noticed the place was packed and our service ended up being horrible. i guess they utilize these egg signs on the tables to indicate if we need help or not and look. we were the unhappy eggs of the place. sat down and ran out of menus. we waited for over 10 minutes then got menus. after we all decided what we wanted to order it took another 10 minutes to get someone to help take our order. the guy who took our order kept hitting my friend's chair as he took his order over 20 times. after we ordered our food took an okay amount of time to come out. once it came out no one could eat because they ran out of utensils and he had to ask wishing a 15 minute period three different waiters to get us utensils (how long could this possibly take?) then we ate our food. EVERYTHING WAS SO SALTY.  i had the burger and fries (i know who gets a burger here but its what i wanted and when you have such a large selection it truly suffered). my burger came WITHOUT onions. i was confused had to ask the waiter if they give onions and he was like they should. patty was cooked with no seasoning at all. bland. tomatoes were frozen. nothing special on it like damn i know its a plain burger but its so bad... NEVER GET THE BURGER. fries were the most salty thing I've ever tasted in my life. like wow. I'm a person who licks my plate clean and i didn't finish this plate at all. biggest waste of my money. i tried my other friends dishes and we all agreed all the dishes were salty. not acceptable.  don't recommend unless you want salty ass food for days. one star is just for the free yummy banana muffin for checking in...

z0GIB76XiY211-brTRPrag.text: Beyond the incredible breakfast I had (prime rib, spinach Benny) the service surpasses excellence! I'm happily greeted by every staff member I make eye contact with and blown away by the speed and response of any and all of my request.   They pay attention to you!   That says it all for any good restaurant. Of course, the restaurant was very clean as were the entire visible staff. Keep up the great work guys, I'll be returning here until the end of time. That damn good!

rD-CdmzkdrUbGIH1Bqe3UQ.text: At Egg & I, you can stick with classic, such as biscuits and gravy, or be a little adventurous with something like the carrot cake French toast. If that doesn't sound appealing to you, they have a lengthy menu of options (including those that are healthy) that will make it difficult to decide. In my opinion, the menu primarily consists of classics and southwest combinations, however, I also noted Island/Hawaiian style selections. It's somewhat of an odd array, but you can't go wrong.   The restaurant is located in an isolate shopping plaza with plenty of parking. Wait times are long; I suggest you plan for an hour of that (during peak times), with limited seating, so you may have to stand outside with the overflow. However, once seated, the service is very fast and friendly.   During a recent visit, we received a gigantic, banana nut muffin with each Yelp check in.

JMHZ4zIGq0XXdeKNKzCxwA.text: The egg and I has the best breakfasts I have ever eaten. Wish we had one of these restaurants in New Zealand. Thanks

Qh2zQTSn0VlVkr1TO1G7_w.text: Mr. Egg. Mrs. Egg. And Egg Kiddies are all here. Yeah theres usually always a Wait  Line. Foodies who Really Really Really LOVES Breakfast needs to Eat Elsewheres. To ever relieve Egg and I constant Lines.  Look around if you Eat here. Everyone is always A Smiling. Is it the Huge Delish to Max Bannnnnnana Muffins??????? Ans before you buy a Dozen, do Yelp checkin for one free. Hope all family members have Yelp App.  Egg and I have won like 20 awards.  Myself.... prefer Hash browns rather than seasoned potatoes! Too salty for my taste. Other with us liked the Biscuit Gravey... I had much better. More Flavorful. Less Salty. My bacon was soft and oily.  This my second time over the years. 3 stars total both times. OJ, Muffin 5 stars. My selections choice could have been better.  Place here always packed AM. 30 minutes wait

zNGrErzBSGBmISybMHrvaA.text: This is a great breakfast/brunch spot just off the strip as an alternative to the hotel buffets. Like all popular brunch spots, the lines are usually out the door - literally. So if you're visiting Vegas in the summer heat, keep in mind that you may be cooking for awhile.  If you check-in, you get one of their AMAZING banana nut muffins on the house! They're almost the size of a Costco muffin, so be careful not to fill up too much if you plan to enjoy their menu items (although it's easier said than done when it pairs so well with their house coffee).  Their menu is filled with enticing options - both savory and sweet. If you're like me, and literally groan in pain from indecision, you should persuade/harangue/guilt/extort your friends to split a 3rd entree! I ended up getting the "blackened prime rib benny" ($14.25), which is an eggs benedict with prime rib, bell peppers, and spinach over a grilled croissant.  Like most of their savory dishes, it comes with their famous "habla diablo" seasoned potatoes, which resembles a creole-seasoning, but tastes fantastic and every serving can feed a small family of four! The eggs benedict itself was decent, though not eye-popping like their potatoes or muffins.  The pancakes (diced apples and cinnamon, 3 stack for $8.25) and french toasts (Hawaiian $8.99) that I forced my friends to get are huge, fluffy, and satisfyingly filling. For the apple and cinnamon pancakes, they put the cooked apples on the side, which is great if you don't want to be at the mercy of the restaurant's preferences.  On top of the reasonably-priced food and gigantic portions, the service is fantastic, and the staff is very friendly! If you get seated on the patio during the hot summers, the misters do a pretty decent job of keeping you cool, and the staff ensures that your cups will always be filled with water.

N48HAGEY1JGAdU8Dane_XQ.text: Great breakfast/brunch restaurant!  After arriving at 11:00, we waited about 25 minutes to be seated, but it was absolutely worth the wait.  They have an extensive menu, something for everyone, that is very reasonably priced given the large portions.  Make sure to have a banana bread muffin - really good!!  The two of us had different breakfast skillets that were pretty amazing!  Oh! and great coffee as well.  The staff was friendly and very attentive. Highly recommend!

pI412IfqQ-CkuGETTVrdCg.text: 3.5/5 stars Just rounded up for good service.  Came for breakfast on a Monday with family around 9:30am. Thankfully we didn't have to wait and were seated right away.  Our waitress Lacey was very helpful and nice, got everything we needed and checked up on us. The food we ordered also came out pretty quick too.  I got the Strawberry Cream Cheese stuffed French Toast and of course the free check-in Banana Nut Muffin which was just fabulous! Others got the Veggie Skillet, Huevos Rancheros, Country Fried Steak Skillet, etc. First of all, my order was just amazing as I thought it would be. My other favorite was the veggie skillet, we did low-sodium for that and it was just perfect! It was the best out of all the dishes. However, the CFS skillet was a bit too salty for our tastes and the huevos rancheros was just ok. Portions were more than enough and price-wise it's more on the affordable side when you think of LV breakfasts for just under and over $10.  Overall honestly this place isn't above average compared to other breakfast places in LV, just ok.

QdeDgeGTqTkrGk_lI4upmw.text: Great food, excellent service, and reasonable pricing.   If there is a line, Edd & I, uses a scheduling/line manager software that will send you a link to where you can see the progress of the line.   This is awesome!   Staff is super friendly and great at what they do.   If your not happy with the service you are given there is an indicator at your tables in which you can make it a frowny face that lets other servers know they need to jump in and help out.   My kids enjoyed the kids meal options.   My wife and I enjoyed our omelets.   Great job Egg & I!!! Love to see a family business get it right!!!

vLD21Bo5S1hNMq7jKlKFGw.text: My husband read the other reviews and the high ratings were right.  This place is hopping! We came Memorial Day mid-day.  It's a smooth moving system, pretty quick wait.  The food  came in large proportions and quality was not skimped on.  The Banana muffins were 'to die for', just like others said; light and fluffy.  We both had a 4-egg omelet, filled with what we ordered.  We took a to-go box with us...  Tabitha, our waitress was very attentive, sweet and generous.   Everyone was hard working to make this place run smoothly.    5 stars for great quality food, hard workers and a delightful place to eat!

0yBEVDDMIhT03qmkF4v69g.text: So when I am out traveling, one of my most favorite meals in the history of the world is breakfast. And I usually like my breakfasts to be big, home style, and comfortable. So on my last trip to Vegas, rather than brave the elements of the casino buffet, I decided to get in my car and venture around the city and hit up some of the local spots.  Of course, I hit up Yelp to find out what the breakfast scene was in Las Vegas, and it led me to The Egg & I. This place is located in a strip mall, and has really really good parking. But that's just the small stuff, let's get into the real treasure within.  Right off the bat, you feel totally at home in this place. It's got all the elements of one of those quaint little hometown diners that you know and love and probably grew up with. The staff there is super attentive, and honestly made me feel so welcome as soon as I walked into the door.   I didn't have to wait long at all for someone to come up to my table and asked me what I want to drink. As I slipped on my coffee and looked at the menu, they had a wide variety of stuff to choose from. I settled on the combo plate which had two pancakes scrambled eggs and my choice of sausage, bacon, or sausage patties. I went for the link sausage, because they said that was absolutely the hot ticket. And of course, long-time readers of my Yelp reviews will know that I always order a glass of milk with breakfast as a test for the server's attention to detail.  My breakfast was delivered by a different server and was sat down in front of me and for a brief second I thought I was going to have to make a mental note to give them one star off for forgetting my milk. When lo and behold two seconds later comes my waitress with a glass of milk. Great save on their part!  The food itself was really good the pancakes were light and fluffy, the eggs were cooked to perfection, and they were absolutely right on those link sausages ... they were the bomb diggity. The staff was really good about cruising by every once in a while and refilling my coffee and asking how things were without being overbearing. Honestly, it  felt like I was at a friend's house rather than a restaurant.  The bottom line? If you are ever out in Vegas and don't want to have to navigate through a horde of drunk people, obnoxious teenagers, or Keno players to get to your breakfast, you really have to go to The Egg & I. You won't regret it!

2lpGilm1xjw1RMxeQv_GCA.text: The waitress was pretty nice, except she kept rushing us. The food here was phenomenal, we ordered the omelette, eggs benny and waffles for four people and it was the perfect amount. The line here was about a 25 minute wait for us because it was around brunch time (10:30-11am).

-43N8Le8-aN89q9sCj1zzQ.text: So good! It was my first time here so my friend and I got the free banana nut muffin that is included in a first visit. Our waiter was very tentative, and pretty cute. The food was really good too, I got a veggie something with potatoes and it really hit the spot and came out quick! My only draw back was that we waited 30 mins to be seated but we also did get there right before 11 so im sure that was not a slow time. Could be cheaper but it was really good! I will be back soon im sure.

2vXpLhO86J8DSPb89R69wQ.text: It was ok wait was to long an couldn't enjoy food because waiter keep stopping by asking the samething food was good could've  been hotter when coming out especially the time it takes to come out an need a Lil more space we were just box in at a back table an they keep going in an out the door but maybe next time

Ucwt7XVODS1o5mgna17JPA.text: The service started out really nice. Our server took great care of us initially. She was prompt and polite. It was wonderful. Then I placed an order to go. Good grief. It took longer for the 1 to go order than it took for the 3 of us to eat initially.   The food was pretty good. The muffins, as everyone says, were delicious.  I had a bandito scramble. It had a lot of cheese and just didn't look like what I expected for the items that were supposed to be in it. It was delicious though. In addition, the potatoes that came with it were wonderful!  My daughter has the Mexican omelet. She was in seventh heaven....eyes rolling, lips smacking, spoon licking heaven. Who could blame her? The food was really good!  The wait for our take out, and the aggressiveness of the manager cost them a star. I thoroughly recommend coming here, just be prepared to wait a minute or two.

CcVz75w4qfs7lnLrdy7Jvw.text: Adorable local spot! A delicious and very very reasonably priced breakfast! The banana nut muffins are to die for, taste homemade. I got the Huevos Rancheros with eggs over easy, some of the best breakfast I have had our whole vacation here! Everything was fresh, service was attentive despite how busy it was, and very reasonable for the large amount of food you get! It's worth the drive off of the strip to enjoy a local favorite!

FYr8ontCyqtx4aK39mjWew.text: Love this place. We came here 10 yrs ago and still remember the name of the restaurant. And still the best skillet.

zKR12D5zeErso7__LFqyig.text: Food was great. The service was outstanding thank you CeCe. Stop by when your near it's a great place to eat and with friends and family. Don't forget to try there banana nut bread.

4WtC5oZlejg6yWNNFcLMHg.text: Good food,  nice staff, will come back, fresh and hot... Ubered here from the strip... well worth it

d4Auq2HzDac-HzdAbg5Q3g.text: Banana nut muffin Coffee Santa Cruz burrito Huevos rancheros  Key largo crepe Works skillet Works potatoes....if you don't order these, you're missing out!  If you order any of these, you're going to win. These are my go-to's! I've visited multiple locations and have always received wonderful and timely service. Their food is always hot and delicious and their staff gives good recommendations. For the amount food you receive, you're being charged a fair price. They definitely don't gouge you. My mom and I get in and out in under $25 and that's including our tip (no, we're not stingy tippers either) their food is just reasonably priced! They are ALWAYS packed on a Sunday morning so be prepared to wait. It's not usually an excruciating wait, probably 20 minutes if you have a table of 4 or less. If you bring four generations of family then of course you're going to have to wait longer than 20 minutes but that shouldn't be a shock. I would definitely recommend your try at least one of the above mentioned items!

x4GJVEI2inYIQrIdSbyk3A.text: Stopped by for brunch, before getting on the road to Moab, Utah.   Service: 5/5 ------------------ The service was good. There was only one bad service experience. One of the hosts that was taking our phone number and name to seat us when ready was very rude. She looked very unhappy, and spoke rudely with very few words: "Phone number....Name....Number of people." We gave her the information and she just turned away. Some what rude. After being seated, our server was very polite and kind, an opposite from the host. It being our first visit we asked for recommendations, and he gave us a number of recommendations, from the stuffed french toast to the chili relleno omelette. Because it was our first time, he brought us free banana nut muffins on the house, as a welcome to The Egg and I! First time a restaurant has done that.   Food: 5/5 ------------------- We ordered the stuffed french toast, traditional eggs benedict, and chili relleno omelette.   Stuffed French Toast: 4/5 Scrambled eggs, cheese, and sausage sandwiched between 2 pieces of french toast. Was good but not amazing. I found it to be dry, but I'd honestly get it again.   Eggs Benedict: 5/5 The eggs were perfect, and english muffin perfect texture. However, a bit heavy with the hollandaise sauce. Overall, probably my favorite entree.   Chili Relleno Omelette: 4/5 Cooked perfectly, with lots of flavor. Unique dish with the chilis inside the omelette. Didn't get to try much of it  Habla Diablo Potatoes: 5/5 Probably some of the best potatoes I've ever had. Cooked perfectly, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I'd almost compare the texture to McDonalds french fries. They're seasoned with spices and we're very very good!  Banana Nut Muffins: 5/5 Best banana nut muffins I've ever had! Not too sweet and very moist. One of my favorite items we got.  Overall: 5/5 --------------- Great value, food, and customer service. Each person costs around $10-15. However, almost everyone I saw left with to-go boxes because they gave so much food!

WB4e7fMnpH60yBlb0ON74g.text: What's with the hype of this place???! My dad and I came by, early in the morning, on our way to Salt Lake City. The place was dead, but we waited about 6 minutes to be seated. We sat down, received our complimentary banana nut muffin for checking in on Yelp and drank some coffee. I kid you not, the coffee tasted like beef broth. It was gross. The banana nut muffin wasn't really anything special, but hey, it was free! I ordered the veggie works eggs benny which saved Egg & I from a 2 star. It was really good, but I was expecting a lot from the outstanding reviews on Yelp.  My dad said his breakfast was "ehh."  We paid our bill then headed to SLC.  I can assure you I won't stop here again on my future routes to Utah.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free banana nut muffin w/ check-in!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie works eggs benny
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barely put a dent

OfjNSyIcLW57uOqT9ANPSQ.text: Always so yummy and big portions!! Very busy so come early or call and reserve. They have a few locations and this one is just far enough outside of the strip to be less busy and a great option if you are in town.

Vi-xDbCbDXUUhexp7u-eYw.text: If your looking for nice healthy breakfast come here! Service is great! I eat on the healthy side , they have good options for that! I order egg white omelette with feta cheese, very yummy and fresh! Fresh fruit instead of potatoes.  Got out free muffin with check in! Amazing! I ask our server Oscar if they had iced coffee, they didn't but he offered me coffee with lots of ice, it was perfect! Thanks Oscar!   Best place for breakfast in Vegas!! Wait is a bit long so we sat outside, near water mist. Not bad!

SIdDBT9z0FEw3ARHxS3Lhg.text: We truly enjoyed this place. It gets really busy but our wait was less than 15 minutes. We were sat outside, this is the only reason they did not get a five, it was fresh but the pigeons were a little annoying. It did not help that someone thought giving the birds bread.  The food was good inexpensive and plentiful. It was served within minutes. They also leave a carafe of coffee at the table. If you check in with YELP app you get a banana nut muffin for free. If you do not mind the wait you should stop by. They also offer a military discount.

_D7mYxd7Ukde80fC2EF6HA.text: This place was so good, I came for breakfast twice in a 3 day Vegas stay. Huge portions of food and cheap prices. Diablo potatoes were so good (not spicy at all) and the skilled breakfast kept me full almost all day. Highly recommend. We didn't have to wait for a table either day either, first day we got there before noon, second day it was around 1 pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ox3Z8tPtBSEVnZxOBsWt1Q.text: So completely awesome. Love the table service interactives. Makes things so easy. The food was delicious with great portion sizes.

bZl1Uv0u2aifxsReqmOjNg.text: We were on our way out of Las Vegas and it was lunch time when we actually arrived.  We were really hungry though and were craving breakfast.    Atmosphere is down-home.  Food is very good and there is alot to choose from.  Service was a little slow, but our waitress wasn't being lazy.  She was just very busy with lots of customers.  All in all it was a unique breakfast house and we'll return!

xhxkJB9e5Yytq-ECqVwLJg.text: I didn't think that this restaurant deserved the four star rating it has for several reasons. The potatoes were basically over seasoned fried potatoes squares. My breakfast was good but overpriced for basic breakfast food. The muffin and service were the only highlights.

5A3uYiZ4PKHwt6aGG2Xrmg.text: I'm a biggggg fan of breakfast! This place is so so so so good! Went to Vegas for the weekend and we wanted to stop by for breakfast and we are so glad we found this place! Their signature muffin is out of this world good!! And this is coming from a person that doesn't like bread, cake, or most things that have some type of bread. I'll be going in May again to Vegas and we will defitnelty come here again!

UpvaBCNh3CsoIbcEacnXEw.text: This place was awesome. Food was good. We got there early and there was no wait. We checked in with foursquare and got a free banana nut muffin. It to was awesome. Try the stuffed french toast.

rAByEa02rgQZmQ3UoU-Zzw.text: Officially my favorite place for breakfast now.  Those crepe omelettes are some serious stuff!!!  It was funny..we had such a difficult time picking what to eat on the menu cuz everything looked so damn good..it was borderline stressful.  But what's the big deal??  We're going back next week!

Cgx04KYKUHERF4---fihjw.text: we ventured out from the strip during our weekend in vegas since I LOVE breakfast.  I read the reviews about the corned beef and hash.  I tried that on the "first" day. : - ) My friend and I went back to the others in our group and I had someone else join me the next day.  I added the blackened prime rib this time and it was great too.  there were a number of items on the menu i really wanted to try.  I can't wait until my next trip to Vegas.  Enjoy!

hzN_nKOOe97tpmXnBgCc7A.text: The best thing is the Banana Nut Muffin! OMG it is TO DIE FOR! How good is it you ask?  My sister made me bring it back to San Diego for her on a business trip! I had to lug the goodness in the car all the way back to OC and then back down to SD! See the love for the muffin and for the sister! I delivered a muffin from so freaking far! lol  Yes, it is THAT GOOD! I still think about it that I drool and want to drive to Vegas again just for it! lol The muffin top is flat so more chewy crisp surface area.  We all know that is the best part!   Here are the dishes I recommend.  I have had a bunch of different ones but I only order the Piggy Skillet.  It's the best of all the meat worlds! They put Crisp Bacon, Diced Ham, Pork Sausage, Potatoes, Cheese, and Eggs.. how can you go wrong! Mmmmm meaty cheesy goodness! Yes you can easily make this at home but I want the muffins! lol  The Chicken Enchilada Omelette is pretty good too.  The chicken inside is tender and flavorful paired with all the condiments on top.  All the dishes are huge and plentiful.  I can never finish it, but that can also be that I scarf down as many muffins on the table and more! lol Still the food is pretty good and the seasoned potatoes are delicious! ^_^ Yum Yum.  If you are ever in Vegas, be sure to come try it out.  I think the design of the place is cute too, very wholesome! I like the mom and pop feel with cute sweet servers that are very attentive.  I have been back many times since and will keep coming back! Muffins!!! O=p

39pJR2GdM66EpPazkL7Zlg.text: Absolutely love Egg and I been coming here as long as I can remember!!! The staff is amazing as well as the quality of food and the menu is quite selective!!! Their motto is eggsactly  what you want and they mean that!!! We eat here at least four or five times a week and it is always a homerun!!! Best breakfast and lunch in Las Vegas as well as a very well ran business!!! Brad is one half of a business owner and as you can see there is never turnover in any of his four locations soon-to-be five!!! In this town you are as good as your last meal!!!

UwcB11b9wjWE_SQSfVzyuQ.text: Good food, good prices and a wonderful atmosphere. Glad Google showed me this place. Was just what I wanted after dinner at my hotel last night.  My server, Lilian was prompt, friendly and quick to make sure I had everything I needed.

xJjFP--z0_1NjS4MFB1WXg.text: I was not impressed with this place at all. Coffee wasn't great, but drinkable (similar to hotel lobby coffee). My pancake was not very fluffy, too dense. I ordered it with fresh strawberries which were cooked into it, but I would have preferred them raw on top. My boyfriend's skillet (the one with sausage and ham) was ok and was probably the best thing I tried there. His mother's bacon and cheese omelette was not very good and she ate less than half. The bacon they use for omlettes is the same stuff Taco Bell does... shredded little bits that tastes like some kind of pork, just not bacon. Her friend's bacon strips were extremely overcooked, dark brown and crunchy vs. crispy. The homefries were terrible. Just potatoes with A LOT of some kind of cajun seasoning all over. I thought homefries were supposed to be seasoned with salt, pepper, onions and green peppers... The one good thing about this place was the wait time. 10 minutes for a party of four on a Sunday morning.

PlbbVYgsCdJitrrqG0s3EQ.text: EGGsellent: -Newspaper style menu that's fun to read and packed with choices. -Cute egg stuff every where and fun little eggsquisite sayings. -Huge Portions -easy parking, no valet necessary as it's off the strip. -They give you a big coffee carafe so you can refill your coffee as often as you'd like.  Not so EGGsellent: -Ordered a skillet and it didn't really have the "bacon and onion" in it ... it was all potatos and eggs. -The potatoes are not good.  They are the little cube kind, and they are just meh tasting.  Considering the potatoes take up the bulk of the portion ... this is the main factor that kept me from a 4 star review. -Eggstremely slow service when paying.  There was literally a line out the door to give payment. -off the strip -Kinda pricey.  Total was $24 for 2 people.  Overall, it wasn't bad.  It didn't live up to the hype. But not eggsactly "rachel ray" worthy ... seriously rachel?  What the hell? (it was featured on her show once)

W8NdB4AIEo-yjeXi0rs3zg.text: At some point during breakfast, my husband started laughing at me.  It was probably the look of utter ecstasy on my face as I made sweet love to the banana nut muffin.  ... oh yeah, and the Italian omelette gave me such an upset stomach that the timeshare presenter freaked out and ended the presentation early.  That alone is worth the price of admission.  Five stars!

1JOwQ1pnv-TzDA_Ffk7M2w.text: Pluses: Fast & friendly service Gigantic portions Home-fried potatoes  Banana muffin Fruit came on the side of every order in big pieces, not some crap salad. Not on the strip  Deltas: Hollandaise was shockingly tasteless for the amount of fat it presumably contained. Food was frankly notable only for portion size.

sKPWdoTaSQnio8AmpTNBlg.text: A favorite of skeptical locals who have seen their share of bargain and selection!  I'm not usually into American breakfasts - typically pricey (for the cheap ingredients and unskilled cookery) and consisting of bland big portions.   The Egg & I made me eat my words, plus some kickass Huevos Rancheros and coffee. My co-eater had the Country Benny - Buttermilk biscuits grilled and topped with sausage, two eggs any style, doused with "homemade sausage gravy" boasts to be a "heart stopper".   Not close to the Strip, but then, no good cheap eats is.

lHsY0r3_7V269Sw9Pc62ag.text: Oh. My. God.  I want to marry this place. I want to have its babies.  Stuffed French toast -- more like a French toast sandwich with eggs, bacon, and cheese -- total party in my mouth. The combination of sweet and savory was enough to make me die happy right there. The bacon and the scrambled eggs were perfectly blended (no limp strips of bacon criss-crossed on top of your eggs in THIS joint!) and the whole concoction dipped in syrup was like a MIRACLE.  Jess got a skillet and I have never SEEN more beautiful over-easy eggs. OHMIGOD! I wish this place were local, I would be here every weekend. The iced tea was good too, and the staff is friendly and helpful. This is probably where we'll come for a farewell brunch the morning after our destination wedding. Mission accomplished!

uY9JWHI9K2jPeDKMgJz6eQ.text: If i could give more stars i would!  5 stars for sure , breakfast is the best!  I got the piggy skillet, so freakin good!!!!!! Trust me, go here, its a must go to for a breakfast on a vegas trip, you will be going everytime you visit vegas!  Potatoes are the best, skillet had bits of bacon, ham, sausage.  Topped with 4 eggs i had them overeasy.  U can get them scrambled.  They have coupons too, buy one entree get one free!? =)   This made my day..trust me it will make yours too.  Best breakfast I have ever had from what i can remember

Ktco0ICHuWSiSzu3RgHyLw.text: Off the strip but soooooooooooooooooo good. Love this place --- and it's in Las Vegas only!  Just a few words that you need to heed:  Fresh. Banana. Nut. Bread.  OH YES.  The other items are great --- everything we had was so good. Skillets, omelettes, home fries (oh mmmmmmm yum), and eggs done to perfection. Wonderful service, friendly smiles, and great directions on the phone when we were trying to find the restaurant!  And their little egg logo is just SOOOO CUTE. What can I say? I'm such a sucker for branding!

YZOqKE7KISMLnpHOtOJabQ.text: Food was really good and it comes out quick.  Our server was on top of it and very nice (Lindsey).  The "works" skillet was delicious.

3WSnHrm3HK93LqhdftfWdA.text: Had a great, great, great breakfast there 2/23/2015.  Stuffed french toast was killer, or as Guy would say,"out of bounds."  I had the ultimate omelet, love hot food and it came that way, great potatoes, and toast.  The coffee was fresh and not packed with extra caffeine.  If we lived there we would eat there weekly, if we ate there more often wouldn't be able to get thru the door!

iZT7Zb1Eg6zOlpUBdjfDWA.text: Was introduced to this place by Mother in law.  Very popular, had to wait 20 minutes, but was well worth it! I orders the island favorite ' portuguese sausage eggs n rice, my husband had the tostada..huge portion , he only ate half. Pearl ordered the scrambled chirozo which was very delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hCnn8cH-cYxpMYd5Ov0VLQ.text: First time here, and I will definitely return. Stopped by for a late breakfast on a Sunday before leaving Vegas. I had the biscuits and gravy with potatoes. Eggcellent! The gravy is delicious and I love the fact that our waitress offered a sample before ordering. So good we ordered gravy to go. The potatoes were flavorful too. Cool spot to enjoy breakfast or lunch while watching sports. A variety of games were shown throughout. I can see why this place stays busy.   If like me and you don't eat eggs don't let that fool you. Lots of options way beyond eggs. The customer service was good too!

l6Ik9ZQjN_DQgFFULbzDbA.text: Always liked this place , but after going back recently I'm thinking is the best breakfast in town. The veggie omelette is my favorite,with home style potatoes , mmmm!

bpVhTaqTVC2FCV4mKgSdBQ.text: Super good! My husband and I make a point of going every time we visit Vegas. It gets busy quick! We recommend coming early to avoid wait times. But worth the wait!

ix1C-GrFWE0PeS20iqW3Mg.text: My husband's cousin and her husband were visiting and we decided to come here and have brunch. My husband and his cousin both had skillets. My husband said it was the best skillet he has had since we moved to Vegas last year (and we are big foodies). His cousin also enjoyed hers. I had the BLT with pasta salad, and that did not disappoint either. It was filled with so much bacon. They did not hold back at all. Our cousins husband also had a sandwich, although I don't remember what, but he also was impressed with his food. For a quick breakfast stop we all left very full and happy. We will be back!

5Z4bSwL9ynL5VRB5P8yCtg.text: Food was amazing. The server we had was fantastic (Garrett); he has a great personality, continually checked up on our table, and was funny as well. The food was way better than you would expect hence why this place has great yelp reviews. I had the breakfast sandwich and it was probably the best I've ever had. Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free muffin for checking in

9jVzJvTTqBrWrhcLakDH1A.text: Fantastic service and food especially the Spinach skillet were to die for oh and the banana muffins  must try!

lFfm4Do0G_RUBVKwb_KD0w.text: Chief call and said this spot was it, so I swung by to see for myself and what do you know??? THIS IS IT!!! 10/10

I4d-o0RyuApgplWEbsDi_w.text: We've got a country benny with a poached egg Top notch, gravy tastes great, good quality biscuits and the full seasoned potatoes on side, they offered two complementary warm banana muffins with our coffee which was cherry on top.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rj8LZwVgMqySRCZ1VgrOpg.text: My family loves this place, we have a lot of fun visiting here. We ate pick to sit outside. Fresh air is always refreshing.   They have cool menu old style like news paper! Very well organized they keep up with everyone ! Very busy place tho parking is a little hard but it's well worth it. Defiantly recommended!!

rqE2RjqLKoUYz6_dElsQuQ.text: Wow.  This place is great!  I say is, because i am still at the table and cant leave without writing this review!  The service was as good or better than last nights $100/person steakhouse.  The gravy was great, the bacon is really good, and the eggs are any way you want them.  Portions are my pet peeve, and these were perfect, BIG.  The muffin they make is really good, and yhe ambiance is perfect for your morning, even a train running around the edge of the ceilingl A.  Will definitely eat here every time i come to vegas.

bCTZYFUoQQ8C6udl8IXoBA.text: Very good breakfast joint! Came here one morning while visiting family that live in Vegas.   Egg & I is in a little shopping area, but it's still really easy to find. When we got there it looked like it was a pretty popular place, our wait was about 30-minutes but we ended up getting seated within 15-20 minutes.  Our waitresses were very friendly. Made good recommendations for everyone, and made frequent check ups on us.   The food was great!! I ordered the country fried steak. It was cooked just right, and the gravy was very flavorful.   Overall, very good experience, and I would definitely go back on my next trip to Vegas!! If you're not winning at the casinos, you'll definitely win at Egg & I!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their basic breakfast

wWHFVCbcvB3uugSzZC3f1w.text: Locals place with a variety of mild to spicy hot sauces for you.  Decent meal for a fair price. $10-15 per person will cover food and drinks. I have dined here for over 10 years and the decor hasn't changed. The inside looks like a country barn. If you like that kind of thing, you'll like the Egg and I. Country music plays throughout.  Menu - The menu is extensive with about everything a breakfast diner could want. Dozens of egg combos prepared every which way. Waffles, crepes, burritos, pancakes. And choice of many sides too.  Coffee is average. I am an espresso snob so perhaps their coffee is A-OK for most.  Not fancy or touristy but honest, good food.  Stop on in.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lRmVgddMlo-EB8H9OrUa_g.text: Loved this spot! Great food and even better service. Was able to turn the skillet into a low carb option with minimal effort. Will definitely return next time I'm in Vegas!

16shnevWYWnAm8fothsAiA.text: Awesome brunch (we got the country fried steak and maple bacon French toast). Yummy banana nut muffin , free with Yelp check in! You can ask for flavored creamer for coffee.  Despite being busy, they are efficient! Have nice app to see what place you are in line. Waited 15 min for 2 at 11am. Would gladly return!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QGkLXYXH9rTzfYTaRchnTQ.text: I had already found this place after I googled "good breakfast in Vegas". My daughter & I were in Vegas on vacay & wanted to try this place. It was delish & our server was amazing! I really hate that I forgot her name, however I am doing this review 5 days after our visit. I would definitely recommend this place! Food is great, service is amazing & prices are awesome! Will be going back as soon as I go back to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My daughter had the skillet &amp; she loved It!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the pancakes plus.

RZ3xi18x4GIUUnzCbFCdCw.text: Before walking inside, you can tell it's one of those places that's always busy. I was a little worried we would have to wait but it was only 2 of us, so we were seated promptly. Someone came to us quickly and asked what beverages we would like.  Manuela was out server. Super personable and very friendly, and funny!  I ordered the chicken and chorizo hash plate, which was amazing btw.  She recommended beans and potatoes, which I would not have paired together normally, but realized she steered me in the right direction!  The beans are very tasty and I really enjoyed them together with my meal. The hot sauces they offer are really good as well. Lots of flavor!  Will return!

gAT-l30AvmUkAEobBR6IYA.text: I've been trying to eat here several times when I come to Vegas. Finally, I was able to indulge!! The wait wasn't as long as the line outside. However the picture may not show justice because I devoured it.  Very good breakfast and nice portions!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jpzjdLCItdAzqdUBQ8y_tw.text: Omg! I'm going back for that banana muffin...and the choo-choo train running around the ceiling...and the omelettes... And the Habla Diablo potatoes! I'm going back.

gL6KzKv2ybJfUfJ6Z8ef6g.text: Went on a Thursday morning and there was a line. The service was great and the portions were huge. My family really enjoyed it.

wNPKQN9u2JB6cMQ1o625WQ.text: THE BEST BREAKFAST!!! I love trying new places to eat! This is a winner!!! My husband and i were lost and he was mad because we couldn't find it. He wanted to just go to Denny's. I insisted to keep driving till we found it. (Wasn't hard to find) we made a wrong turn.  My husband left soooo full and soooo glad we went there. Atmosphere was great, food wonderful! I had Avocado Omelet with Portuguese sausage, and the muffin. Delicious!!! If you're in Vegas this is a must!!!

qnXBpMOaL4LypB_YjNV5jQ.text: My boyfriend and I went to this place really randomly when we went to Vegas for New Year's in December 2005. We found this place by looking in local ads.
