I know we each got omlettes and shared the french toast, and it was all very good. This will be the first place we go to if we ever go back to Vegas. The service was good and even though it was packed, we still received our food without the long wait you usually get in the bay area.

a2vYiNokbNyQG0tAwyyrAg.text: Terrific local place, varied menu, competent staff, GREAT FOOD, huge portions.  I figured out the LAS is not the cheap place for anything anymore.  Other half had the waffle - which was one of those big, thick, crusty ones- about 1 inch high.  Most places sell the wimpy 3/8th inch high waffle.  Killer home fries with some kind of chili/onion powder that came w/ my two eggs.  I felt our waitress was a little pushy, but she was just doin' her job.  All I wanted was the two eggs that came with potatoes.  She kept asking if I wanted sausage, or bacon.   Choice of English muffin or the 'to die for' banana nut muffin.  Too bad there's no place like this on the strip.  If there was, lines would be 10miles long. Keep in mind, ya need a car to get to this place.  I don't know about public transportation in this area.

X6cXZxuPIUD91c5dYv1Yjw.text: I don't think you'll be able to top this place in regards to price and portions.  The food is plentiful and the price is even better.  Best breakfast for under $10.  I got a half portion which was more than enough and it slashed that price by a third.  Their banana muffins are to die for and their wait staff is so friendly and sincere.  It's off the strip but well worth the trip.

jGiBIb02pQMLUxRyjkWjew.text: My husband & I found it on YELP and we were not disappointed.  Loved it!  We had to wait a few minutes but it was worth the wait!  I ordered an omelette with bacon, cheese and avocado & my husband had something else (ha...I was so into my breakfast I didn't notice) and he loved it.  The  seasoning on the potatoes was wonderful and I tried the "Pepperdoux" sauce.  Loved it so much I asked if I could buy some and they said YES!  Thanks for giving us a reason to leave the strip!

fp9BOOwTe6bts9ufOsMg5g.text: Thanks Yelp for another great recommendation.  Wide variety, good food, good service.  The blueberry pancakes were very good, and the turkey sausage was great.  An excellent breakfast choice if you have a car

zrDPaLP9TqzeB3XWFY_YjQ.text: Egg & I had really great food. We got the EGGS-PLUS which included 2 eggs cooked to order, ranch potatoes, toast or banana nut muffin (get the banana nut muffin... makes a great appetizer!!!), and choice of bacon, sausage or ham (get the sausage links). Service was good. Food came out quickly. A few miles/minutes off the strip. Definitely worth trying out. Will definitely go back here when we go back to Vegas and would recommend!

L5rIE5kCQ4-XcZIQLZBjjA.text: This is the place to come for breakfast while staying in Vegas. There were six of us and we took two cabs from the Wynn...somehow our cab drivers got lost and it was a complete mess to get there...it ended up costing us $50 in cab fare to get there but once we did it was so worth it.  (The actual price of a cab not lost from the strip is about $12) We were seated in 15 minutes of arriving....and our server was sweet and good. I love anyplace that brings you not just a cup of coffee but a whole carafe....let me start off by saying I am not a breakfast eater but others in my group LOVES breakfast.   I ordered the oatmeal which was oatmeal and it came with milk and brown sugar. I also ordered a side of bacon which was perfectly done. My husband had the waffles which were huge and came with strawberries and whipped cream, eggs and bacon it was really good. I tasted from everyone's respective egg plates and they were all amazing. I believe there was a Vegetable Skillet and a Little Piggy at the table and those were divine. There were two fruit plates that came with cantalope, blueberries, strawberries and some other fruits. The ranch potatoes were amazing just the right mix of crispy and soft....I wish that I liked breakfast...one of my friends said that the pancakes here were the best she has ever had and she is a bit of a pancake snob. The portions were huge and the prices were right. You cannot go wrong with hitting up the Egg and I if you are into breakfast or with a bunch of people who are into breakfast. They also had other menu items available...burgers, salads, sandwiches. On my next trip to Vegas I will be sure to head off the strip for some of this eggy goodness!!

3kv3H5iNGV6SzLJ-_MQqzQ.text: Good food but left hungry. Cin. Raisin French toast, scrambled eggs, and bacon. Banana nut muffin was more like a banana bran muffin.

5Q23cUVIWPLkAFs0xbklSQ.text: A great place to get a hearty recovery breakfast.  Friendly staff. Flipping the egg at the end of the table for service is great, no  need to flag down your server.

kOHLvs73p2t2kPVWDqhmZw.text: We were in Vegas over Thanksgiving (2012) and found the Egg & I on line. Ended up eating breakfast there 3 out of 4 days. Both my wife and I had some of the best breakfasts ever! The chicken enchilada omelette was awesome! Service by Janeen was the best! Ask for her and you will start your day right.

XgxwplsMkU4Ydf352jw8yA.text: Awesome menu.  I took photos of the different egg-ers.  They are just too funny.  Good breakfast food.  Friendly service.  Affordable price.  But they close at 3pm!!  I had to purposely woke up earlier in order to make to the place.  Com'on this is Vegas...  It would be nice if they at least stay open till 5pm.

UUo6KBWpHgObB0YmTzzCpg.text: 5 stars for the BOMB homemade banana nut bread.... SOOOO good.  yes, sooooo good.  so good that I ended up buying a loaf and bringing it home as a gift to the guy who eats like cookie monster (doesn't eat only cookies like him, but devours food like him)!!!  All the other breakfast foods are good, eggs are cooked to perfection, clean restaurant, fast service - what more could you ask for?!?!

SKR_JWkYQz8VMo4oFWT-sA.text: Real good breakfast place.  Everything is fresh and they have a nice assortment of food.  I have been there a few times and nothing jumps out at me as GREAT but its all very good and the service is pleasant.  You really can't go wrong here.  I have had the meat eater skillet and a few omelets.  Good stuff.

H4X-Pk6piJR1zDaC35xdYA.text: More like 2.5 stars.  This place is ok.  Nothing special.  A bit pricey.    Went here with my cousin and a bunch of friends on one of many Vegas trips.  My cousin was super excited because she had seen it on Rachel Ray.  I've never watched Rachel Ray, but if this is the kind of place she recommends, then I cannot trust her opinion.  This was another one of those "it's more about saying you've been there, rather than the food" type of places.  A lot of things on the menu sounded great.    got the Chicken Enchilada Omelet.  It was ok. I forgot what my girlfriend ordered, but it sounded fantastic on the menu.  It was ok. My friend ordered pork chops and eggs.  Looked great.  He said it was ok. My cousin and her hubby ordered whatever it was that Rachel Ray had ordered.  She was spouting off about how great it was, but honestly, it didn't even look that good.  Her enthusiasm seemed forced. The other members of our party weren't very pleased with their breakfasts either.  This place is only open until 2 pm.  So you better get there early.  Don't worry about me holding up your table though, because I won't be back.  I'll be at Blueberry Hill, on Flamingo Rd., enjoying a very good breakfast for about half the price.

nEZkb7py0Jshlp3lAuPPFQ.text: Went to the Egg and I today with my family! I am delighted that they have wifi here! It is very convenient. :) I think the dishes are a bit pricey and so I ordered the side dishes in the back of the menu such as the bagel with sour cream, ranch potatoes, and two eggs! The atmosphere in the place is lively and comfy. The servers seem friendly and the music in the background is decent. After finishing my food, I thought the bagel was okay, I could find better at Winco! :P The ranch potatoes did indeed taste like ranch, but I am not a fan of it! Also the eggs were fine! I just love eggs. Overall the taste of the food was just okay. Nothing spectacular about the place.

340WHyIQPPYpHqnsIaZ2vA.text: My wife and I were in Vegas on vacation, and went back to the Egg & I.  We had been there about a half year ago (the last time we were in Vegas).  Both times the food and service were good.  Both time the place was very busy.  Both times we were there closer to lunch time, so I imagine Breakfast time must be even more busy.  The food is very good, and the prices are reasonable (no Las Vegas deal, but normal for a off the strip family place).  Next time we are in Las Vegas, we will be at the Egg & I.

8oUoPIko2sNS16Vt8D0X_A.text: Excellent breakfast. I had eggs benedict florentine. The eggs were a bit runny, but that added to the creamy flavor of the somehow still crispy English muffin. Ham was very tender and easy to cut. The homestyle potatoes were pretty salty, but not too much. Portion sizes were gratuitous. The service was prompt, nice, and attentive without being annoying. I'll definitely eat there again.

wnB-tED1z-p_gw8WAdWAbQ.text: If you are ever in Vegas, you gotta try this restaurant out! They are only open for breakfast & lunch. Excellent value, fast & friendly service with a big smile! I wanted to try everthing but couldn't this trip. Even if you can"t eat eggs there are alot of options. Can't wait to go back!  Thank you Rachel Ray for the recommendation!

hpsSVR7-u5vsOO6kFubA4w.text: We went to have brunch at egg and I this past Sunday. Fast service really good filling food. A great option to the buffets while visiting in Vegas. This will definitely be a place to go whenever we are in town. Our waitress was also really nice. Can't wait to go back to have the biscuits mmmm!

uJM_M6hTb58tiB5pUH4y2w.text: Great place! Breakfast was amazing, employees were wonderful. Come to Vegas often and this is by far the best breakfast we've had out here

XPbQWOox-f7WE4k836goSg.text: Sweet Jesus this was some pretty good breakfast food. I'm from out of town and I'm glad that my flight was delayed long enough for me to come and eat this food. Service was great, and the food was even better. The banana nut muffin is an option to come with your meal instead of toast and I encourage you to take this offer because it is a sweet, dark, moist muffin that leaves you speechless. I had the works skillet, which comes with lots of meat and veggies topped with gooey cheese and eggs any style. Lots of choices for any taste. I highly recommend this restaurant

_yHM8W8GfZolDr8wKKGO-g.text: This place is great for breakfast. Tons of options from eggs to sweets.   The service was great my first time here. I messed up my order and they fixed it right away and were really nice about it. Amanda was our sever and she was really sweet and accommodating I would definitely recommend this place for post Vegas nights.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nPZkvYL__i1v3_acQoX1Lg.text: Unbelievably great food! Banana nut muffin is sinfully good!  Breakfast was amazing.  Our server Reina rocked!  Definitely no sad egg face here.

Jub4LbVX4ewsPg7-AKMIMw.text: From 2/25/15 Finally, got to try this place after seeing it on Google maps before I moved to Vegas. I know it's a corny reason to pick a place, but the name was what got my attention. We walked in, and the place was packed.   Our server Carla was great. Even though it was busy, she was attentive, friendly, and our food came out promptly. My boyfriend got the three little piggies.I got the fruit parfait that came with the best banana nut muffin I've ever ate-ever!! I will definitely keep coming back here, to try out other things on the menu

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you have bad service flip the egg. The service I received was good however.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good service

9oni5uE7kW8SmOrkmUaBcg.text: Previously, I have written a glowing review for the Sunrise location, and every bit of it still rings True. I tend to go to this location more often though, and recently, it was the first time I had brought my husband and dogs with me.  Our server fussed over our pups and brought them water so major bonus points for that. She also made sure we had patio heater nearby. Even though there was only one other occupied table outside, we were still checked on frequently.  I had a lovely vegetarian omelette, but I was really crazed over my banana nut muffin. It was better than I remember, and it was actually steaming in the cold weather. I felt bad for all the yum noises I was making because my husband is gluten free. Speaking of which, when the waitress asked what bread he wanted on the side, he said none, and she offered to bring him a side of fruit. He was very appreciative. My husband declared his corned beef hash to be the best he's ever had, and he might have gotten a second order if he didn't have part of my meal to finish off.  The Egg & I will continue to be a "must-visit" when we come to Vegas.

mk7erMC8gQtiJaZkg1J9Mg.text: This place was awesome, we went while in Vegas , great service and great tasting food , freshly made to order . Money well spent

rNRYDywjo0uWntDPHnZuIQ.text: Breakfast and service was great. Large potion sizes and the atmosphere was comfortable. I'll definitely return for another visit.

RB_J_LLLaDDXrmUJL1CN0w.text: This is definitely a good example of a brunch place where what you order can have a significant impact on whether you love or hate the food. I ordered the California crepe, which was not made well and tasted fairly bland, despite how promising the combination of ingredients sounded. My friend, however, ordered the chicken fried steak, which was great. This brunch place has a HUGE menu so just make sure you order something that you will definitely like, and you're in the clear. Additionally, the free banana muffin is delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WlU88lOcru3ixlBLvEXYEQ.text: I'm all about yelping places to eat. Came across this place so I took my family and brother here. I went in to place my name on the list and went for first available meaning we might be seated outside. It looked okay since they had mists going on and it was pretty shaded. My brother didn't think it was a good idea so I went back and they had no problem noting we wanted to sit inside. It's busy but people go in and out quick. We waited for about 5-10mins.  As usual we got seated, got menus and they asked for what drinks we wanted. So far so good with service with Amanda. She took our orders and talked a little to my 1 1/2 year old niece. Drinks came out quick. The banana nut muffin that came with our meal came out as well and it was so delish!!! My daughter and I got one each and we saved one for later. We didn't want to get full so we shared one.  Our food came out. I had the corn beef hash with the side of potatoes. Potatoes were good. I don't know why I got the corn beef. I'm not really a fan of it but it got a lot of reviews. My daughter ate half of her omelette and saw a hair in it. We bothered one of the servers about it and she took it back and made my daughter a half order of the same omelette. Almost done with our meal, they forgot to t bring out the banana pancakes my bro ordered. We reminded them about it too.  The lady that took back the omelette came out with a complimentary plate of these banana bread with custard filling goodness. She probably gave it to us because of my daughters omelette and forgetting the pancakes on time. Omg! It melts in your mouth!!  I love this place and they have the best customer service. Especially when it's crazy busy in there. When they brought out the pancakes, they told us they did not charge us for the omelette and pancakes. How awesome is that??  They're super nice! Thank you Amanda! I'll definitely go back but not order the corn hash for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash with potatoes flavored with their house seasoning
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana bread with custard filling. The bomb!!

JVsV4FUVhtNGvhc7_26o7w.text: Good diner and very close to the strip. Went with my friend after a long night and they offer good portions at a good price. Checking in alone gives you a free banana nut muffin that was delicious. I had the country fried steak and eggs as well as the corn beef hash and eggs for brunch. The corn beef hash was very good and better than the country fried steak and eggs. Although the reviews rave about this place, it fell just short of my expectations but it was still delicious. Would probably think about coming here again when I am back in Vegas, but it wouldn't be my first choice

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak and eggs over potatoes (top) Corn beef hash and eggs (bottom)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin for checking in

I56sBMRjg8fJRU3g2cZtjA.text: My mom worked at a cafe for 19 years in Iowa that won best breakfast place in town. This place is better though. Probably the best breakfast place I have ever had

HUIFAMLYLYXQA0wCUk-stg.text: This is really a 3.5 star rating for us...  couldn't quite justify the 4 though.  The free banana nut muffin was the highlight for sure - highly recommended.  My Hawaiian French Toast was pretty flavorless (including the syrup), and my wife's Original Breakfast Burrito was a little above average.  Orange juice was not freshly squeezed, but my daughter's Mickey Mouse pancake was pretty decent.  So a mixed bag overall.  Service was the same as well.  Will probably return for the muffin though!

NssdztC8IK1O-ALQkAmK8w.text: Found this place from yelp. The complimentary first timers banana muffin was so amazing we had to order a couple more. The staff was great and we will definitely be back

xEM5KMHYTGrDyFSHlR6Mvg.text: They have extensive menu. Menu is printed newspaper liked. Service is friendly & fast. Restaurant is clean. Even 7 am the restaurant is almost full. A great hang out fir breakfast with friends & relatives. The foods are delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Works. Big omelette !
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilli bowl.

vhqmIeHFrgiPFqW3lZmX1w.text: I went in feeling nervous about trying a French toast sandwich. The bread was French toast and the inside was ham, egg, and cheese scrambled. It was deelish! The food was great and the waitress was sweet as pie.   We sat outside and enjoyed the patio that allowed a soft water mist fight against the Vegas heat.   I would have given them a rating of five but the patio tables needed to be cleaned because there were cobwebs on them. I Don't PLAY with spiders!

WRL2toBXvs0mdbobMt-yeg.text: Stopped here on a Saturday morning. Was seated right away on the patio (which is pet friendly). Food was good and portions were huge!  Most egg dishes were made with 4 eggs which is too much food for me. I substituted my potatoes for fruit and received a nice assortment of pieces of fruit. I would definitely dine here again!

jA1U6IhpuMV3EhCgVw4J9w.text: Came in a party of 8.  Service was excellent and the food amazing.  Majority of everyone got the steak and eggs and they really enjoyed it.  I had the country benny which was amazing! We all agreed that the seasoned potatoes were delicious! Definitely coming back here again next time I am in town.

SqQRESZWyuN28JuOy_1d3w.text: Had breakfast there. Food was good.  Just a little pricey for  eggs and corned beef. Then again I am behind the times on prices. The waitress was doing her best keeping up on a holiday weekend. I would eat there again when it's not so crowded.

nzXCidDmTju_5IN58OIfPg.text: Fabulous place to have breakfast. We are eggterians and wanted break from food at the strip. This place was so refreshing. Very welcoming staff, great selection (menu has so many items), good quantity and fresh food.  Kids loved the place!  It definitely made our day!

l7BRwkfY-A_Sd9r-1g768w.text: BIG fan over here. The country benny? Aces. Eggscellent food and super friendly service from Erin.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EdFsvBTYXNYuDR8ula6aRA.text: Good breakfast food off the strip of Vegas. Price is reasonable (Around $10 per plate) and they give you a lot. Enough for you to take back home unless you are coping with a hangover and need all the carbs you can get.   The Banana Nut Muffin is really as good as everyone says it is; especially with the spread. You can tell they bake it fresh as there is no complex presentation to it. It is just simply muffin off the pan. I ordered the egg-ceptional omelette and it was decent. Definitely worth the money but, not mind blowing. I would try their other items if I go again. My friend got the stuffed french toast and that looked very good. However, the ranch potato side were delicious and exactly what I needed after a long weekend in Vegas.   Their high selling point is their super nice staff. They give you the perfect amount of chit chat and leave you alone time.  Use their egg signs. Yellow Egg means you need attention; Black Egg means leave me alone.

aINoEGg6_davQnPD92jvhA.text: I was immediately sat down by the host. This restaurant normally is very busy and wait times can be up to 30 minutes but it is well worth the wait! My dining experience was nothing short of amazing by Perry. He was very patient and willing to help me choose the best plate on the menu that suited me. I chose to go with The Classic. First, Perry brought me out this FRESHLY BAKED, OUT OF THE OVEN Banana Nut Muffin. By far, the best muffin you could taste at such a great establishment. Also the entree plate was huge when Perry brought it out to me. I ate every bite and Perry smiled at me asking if I enjoyed my meal.  If you have read this far, hopefully you are waiting for your food. You won't be disappointed!

NXwP6DDYtTntG9lZJg135Q.text: Super friendly service. Huge portions. Decent prices. Delicious banana nut muffin (comes with most breakfasts). My husband got a skillet- he really liked it, though barely made a dent because it was so big. I got a crepe omelet. It was ok... Too much avocado (don't say that too often!). The salsa on the side was yummy. Potatoes were good... Just lots of them! Overall good experience.

pbhgfC6-GRwuLK40HatI3A.text: Food is very good and portions very big. Totally recommended for a hearty meal. It's True that their banana nut muffins are excellent:)

9IcsG4Hj0j1_nypnwUkVWQ.text: What a great meal and Karen was a great waitress, very attentive and smiling. I am a person of few words. I write reviews both good and bad.

JQPK3_dC-8YZqQHHSBLwkg.text: We tried this place before leaving Vegas today, we were not disappointed. The food was great! The service was exceptional! Amanda was our server and she was very friendly and super helpful! All of the staff seemed very professional. I definitely recommend this place.

SkLqz9leuwcZ8Yd5jy80qA.text: Delicious I loved it big portions great prices we all got skillets and you get a free muffin which is also delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cordon bleu
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works skillet

JXokOWQTxe3tP0XLL3nYfg.text: Egg & I is a super-cute local breakfast joint away from the strip. It gets SO crowded and busy on the strip for breakfast/brunch whenever I've visited, and it makes people even hungrier and grumpier while waiting. My advice? Take a cab or drive over to this place for a REALLY tasty meal.  My group and I of five people waited about 10 minutes for a table. Once seated, we were serviced immediately. Food only took about 10 minutes to be ready, and the staff were very attentive and worked together to address our table's needs. They have a little egg sign that you can flip to the sad-face yellow side, which indicates that you're in need of something. We did this a couple times to test it out, and it worked! Lightning fast.  Great food, great service. I recommend the Biscuits and Gravy! The Ranch Potatoes (their regular side of potatoes) are very flavorful and filling. A must have. Oh, and their Banana Nut Muffin was soooo sweet and moist!  I just may be back when I'm in town. If I can get outta bed next time after a long night, that is. Tehe.

qbT1SiNC1C9BaAynqlpIYg.text: The food here is the best value in Las Vegas . All the items are tasty don't forget the Banana Muffin. Liza is great be sure to ask for her !!!!

38zynZhmKEhAmGkJimX31Q.text: Erin was an amazing server we went with a group of 15 and she did great! Everyone's food was hot and delish!

FK0Y1pSrTIPQs-w8hgrxQg.text: A wonderful place for a great breakfast. We go there and Genesis is the best waitress by far and we plan on asking to be seated in her area every time. She remembers us by sight and has a delightful personality. This is becoming a regular breakfast place for us.

T09QNcfwjEEGxzNo1Cq0Cw.text: The food was yummy. The restrooms and restaurant has a pleasant and clean atmosphere. Our server, Liza, was very loving and catered to our every need without an issue. The plain pancakes were delicious, along with the stuffed French toast. I'd recommend it to anyone headed to or past Las Vegas.

HNCfPEb7ckx0wAlkpjTeFg.text: I had the breakfast burrito it was wonderful. .. super big I can never finish all my food here very large portions!  Great service every time I come in.. my kids and hubby love this place as well !

GeipFdq4q_brYJSUQNHu6Q.text: Wow super impressed best breakfast in the Vegas metro area everything was above and beyond from hostess to wait staff to cashier. I can't say enough the food portions were huge and delicious!!

nGOpmfxWwtkSojMMpSc4aQ.text: This place is a gem, nice break from the hustle of the strip. Good cooking, the banana but muffins are awesome, and as for service, we had excellent service two days in a row from Carla. Moderate prices, generous portions, happy customer. Check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

43DGHzTTzxhUhRlYZg7X9Q.text: It was just about the most pleasant experience I have ever had at any restaraunt. The service was quick,our server was delightful, and the food was very satisfying! I would most definitely say this is my new favorite restaurant

VJruJfTVqeqO1dJMcLM1gA.text: Such a filling breakfast,wish I had room for more in my stomach and bottomless cup of coffee,can I ask for more?

bYkuLfRO0NWdsmT-t1xulA.text: Amazing brunch stop before your trip home from Vegas! If you check in you get a free banana nut muffin. Not just one for the table, one for each person checking in! Service was speedy and friendly. Food portions are generous so you can order a couple things and share to taste more of the menu.

1b_W53o5Ifu7vZsA6L2LNA.text: My husband and I LOVE this place. The server we had was amazing and the menu is sooooo vast. They have amazing muffins and great portion  sizes. My husband's favorite food is biscuits and gravy. He got the chicken fried steak grilled plate thing to branch out a little and he said it was the most amazing thing in the world. We will definitely go back.

Fsl1Lij6hMsVzswnP7m4Xw.text: We drove up and saw a horde of people waiting to be seated.. Thats how you know foods on point! When i checked in at the front desk, i realized no one was sitting outside(it was like 50 degrees maybe thats why lol) so i told them we dont mind! Even though it was effin cold! Coffee warmed you up anyways so its okay, we ordered 2 country fried steak plates and some blue berry pancakes, the steak plates were delicious i was so full i skipped lunch and had dinner at night lol! The pancakes were good very filling!! Overall this place is good, and the best part was when your ready to pay just go up to the front desk! Last but not least those banana muffins are the best!!!!!! Make sure to try them with a yelp checkin its free!!

Y-oQs8Ruhm7jm8_xYVFI4Q.text: I love this restaurant.  It's a GREAT American style breakfast, and an awesome way to start at least ONE of your Vegas mornings.  Yep, just like everyone has mentioned, the Banana Nut Muffin is amazing.  Soft, warm, full of delicious Banana Nut taste!  We would've taken some more to go if we didn't plan on going to the outlet afterward.  Our group ordered different items and not one of us had anything bad to say about anything!  We looooved ALL of it!  The potatoes were very good too.  It's a place everyone should try at least one morning here.  Seriously...GO TO EGG & I!!!!!  NOW!

WnhrUR8tIIjjJZOlwm6tlA.text: Came here for a late breakfast with a line out the door on a Saturday morning.. we opted to sit outside to skip the wait. Our server was Tammy, if you can sit in her area, DO SO! She was super attentive and on point with everything. All her recommendations were really good, even though everyone got delicious meals. The muffins were delicious, the chicken enchilada omelette, country fried steak, and the French toast sandwich ... can't go wrong!! Everything is delicious. Honestly everything could have been crap and I would still be I pressed. Tammy outdid herself and made sure we were always taken care of even though our table was in the forgotten area of the outside. She checked on us and always came by with creamer for our coffee, butter, napkins... truly the best service we've had in our 3 day weekend stay in Las Vegas even compared to the 5 star steakhouse service.

yeaTxamTPTlGyeJIdNBIaA.text: Salty food.   Why the high rating ? People are super nice , but the food is prime , so 1 star for this restaurant . Salt can make things taste good, but those potatoes man!!! Salty ...  improve your food and ordering taking skills , my orders was totally wrong

cjx4hb45-CIFvb_kRiwRkA.text: I know there's a lot of other breakfast places 2 eat at, especially the buffets in Vegas but I can only take so much of all u can places.  That's y we chose here, w the help of yelp of course!  It's kinda "retro" in there.  The waitress we had wuz nice.  She kept coming back & giving me coffee refills.  I ordered chicken fried steak.  It came w 2 eggs, ranch potatoes & the best banana nut muffin.  Omg, it wuz 2 die 4!!! That wuz yummy!!!  The place gets busy so try 2 come early.  Located off the strip.  I love breakfast places like this!!!

cFxYV517vYPGNQsUGH-J_Q.text: We ate here on Tues. morning 3/28/17. Our server was Tamara and she was awesome only to be complemented with the amazing food.

n0VvTlUIfIUGbBuPC19DuQ.text: This place is easily the best breakfast place off the strip in Las Vegas. I have been coming here for a few years my favorite menu items are the Loco moco and the biscuits and gravy. Also my server OSCAR gave pretty much the best service you can give!! I am a huge fan of this place I definitely recommend this place for anyone who loves breakfast!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benny!!!

RMYVanoZVAvs9CMYDEorig.text: Heard this on place was good so dropped in to give it a try. The food was delicious as advertised and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends and family! But the best part of this place was the service! Even though the place was packed and there were plenty of people waiting in line, the turnover time is amazing, waited probably 15-20 minutes before getting our table with about 6 parties ahead of us. You're then greeted by the staff members who just make you feel good and welcomed, they're all smiles and super friendly! Our server in particular, Karla, was super helpful and welcoming. She made sure we had everything we needed and that we were enjoying our meal despite being busy tending to other tables as well. I would definitely come again, great people, great atmosphere, great food!

w88pcUZYoDfO2W0WNWC2xg.text: Love this place and there other location on West Flamingo! The customer services is fair and the prices are very fair specially towards Law Enforcement. The food is unbeatable specially when you don't wanna cook yourself!

AGTFxRCgWVziLFeLNigk0A.text: A groupon and good reviews lead me to try this place in Vegas. Normally, I do not go off the strip to eat. I don't think this place is as good as the reviews lead it to be... the place was packed when I went though, around 11am. It took about 30 minutes or so for a table. Looking at the menu, LOTS of stuff looked good and I had trouble deciding what to eat. The menu is a newpaper, which is actually really cute and different; also, there is a lot of word-play on the menu which I thought was cleaver. I ended up getting the chicken fried steak skillet and my brother got the carnitas skillet. Both did taste good, but I did not think it was spectacular. Portions were a good size, a bit larger than average. My chicken steak was tender and crispy and the gravy was good... but the house potatoes it came with was way too salty. I mixed everything together to try to lessen the salt taste, but in the end, I couldn't finish all the potatoes because, well, it was just too much salt. I think they need to put less of the seasoned salt on it. I'm a total potato lover and I couldn't finish my potatoes. My skillet also came with 2 eggs, anyway you want and a muffin or toast. I chose the muffin. It was good-average. I tried a bit of the carnitas skillet... but I'm not a big Mexican food fan... so it wasn't to my liking really, but my brother liked it. His did not come with a muffin or toast though. I also ordered coffee, thinking it was going to come in the interesting cup I see posted... it came in the ugly typical diner coffee cup...  Personally, I think Hash House A Go-Go has much better food and better prices... and way bigger portions!! My brother agrees with me too.   I don't think this place is worth the wait... it didn't stand out in my mind. Just an average breakfast place. Prices are fair... my chicken fried skillet was $10.50 and the carnitas skillet was about $11.   Go to Hash House A Go-Go if you want special yummy breakfast food... this place is just average.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cdh9E0vBDpf_z-0XvVwGmQ.text: Food was really good!! Service was really good! Heather was our server!! She was GREAT! This is the Breakfast spot!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Food here!! If you come to Vegas breakfast is a must here!! Heather our server was GREAT!!

lL6ZXbpECc3ulsLvLUoQEg.text: Staff is super nice and the food is excellent. I have 2 favorite places and this is definitely one of them. Don't pass up on this place no matter which location.

eeZOIThUbPudrD0tb6_QqA.text: Thank you Yelp for putting eggs and I near the top for reccomendations! To begin, Manuela was our server today and dealt with my non speaking English friends respectfully. She even gave us the wifi password! The free muffin is a must have. To die for. Amazing. Delicious. The banana nut muffin was different from what I expected, in a much better way. I ordered the country fried steak and the whole meal was crazy filling and satisfied my American breakfast cravings. It even comes with another muffin! She got the eggs Benedict and the one bite she allowed me to have made my mouth explode with heart felt desire for more. I'll deffinately be back to this spot during my next visit to Vegas.

3VPI6a06BIo0mm6ov0Bitg.text: Stopped by for breakfast before our trip back to LA.. We got there at about 10:00 A.M.  The wait was about 10 minutes, our server was Linae (spell check) she was really nice and attentive, 5 stars to her! The food was good. I ordered the huevos rancheros and the BF had an omelette.. I can't remember the name... The potatoes were yummy.  Good price.. It got a bit crowded and it was very difficult to stand in line to pay at the register when all the parties waiting to be seated were standing right there.. Some old man even cut in front of us.. I guess he thought we were waiting to be seated.  By the time we left it was packed! Did I mention it was a Monday!?!  Will Definitely be back when in Vegas, I enjoyed the food and everyone was super friendly..  I'll try it a bit earlier with less of a crowd next time

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros with red sauce
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h6ABz3Iv-prflKag1c5aYA.text: Tried it for the first time..I had the Veggie Benny and it was delicious. The place was so busy but our server gave us free banana-nut muffins and it was delicious.... highly recommended!!

D18q7v64UbHLaBWiv0p62Q.text: My dad were in town and for our last day here we stopped at Egg and I, and we were not dissapointed. The service was amazing, our waiter Oscar was polite and friendly and made sure we were taken care of through our entire visit. The restaurant was clean and the food was absolutely amazing. It was probably the best meal we've had since being in Vegas. I wish we would have gone sooner!

g4bxGI5Rj5jDx9MQmkMrzQ.text: Fast friendly service! Generous and tasty portions of food. Staff was very attentive- I will definitely go back!

WlvDW_kqnE0y41_G3QcT4Q.text: I love this place. They have an extensive menu, full of great options for a great breakfast. Their friendly staff and  awesome food makes your day.

QkB6wgkOplFg9pmSCRsnHg.text: Everything we ordered was delicious! Stuffed French toast, works veggie Benny. Our server Alexa our server was attentive and kind. Really everyone here is super friendly. Great place for breakfast off the beaten path.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works veggie! Delicious!

gL567M3jN466qmX97ORYUg.text: Exactly what we wanted, great food and great service. Awesome patio too!! Oscar was really nice and his support staff was very helpful! We will be coming here for breakfast whenever we are in town!

0_iMm0M-lDXjb4q-6Xhzcw.text: Dont be fooled by the exterior! its not your typical VEGAS glitz and glam.. it is a bit off the strip but every bit worth it!!!   Both my husband and I had Omelets.. WOW.  absolutely delish! Not skimpy on ingredients at all and piping hot!   My husband is a breakfast potato guru and he was FLOORED and in love.  We may have to plan our next vegas trip just around this place!  - been back time and time again and never disappointed! This place does draw a crowd- a hungover and local crowd so be prepared to wait!

dzlkZyW4KZ0fQj7dup8NsA.text: Food is awesome and our server Chance was awesome! Strawberry cream cheese french toast is a nice thing to share.

qyLrezn5LRq-MeNPARau_A.text: Excellent selection on the menu. It was so good we went back 2 days in a row. Reina was an excellent waitress very accommodating  and friendly! I would highly recommend The Egg & I.

d4EysrXJjLJ1tFHbk8o5Qw.text: Great tasting food.  Diablo potatoes were great.  Very friendly hostess and waitress.

3wlxc7bys0RxQdMGlh0Ypw.text: Weekend trip to Vegas and I wanted to avoid the strip and hotel restaurant breakfast scene. Yelp recommended this place so the wife and I gave it a try.  Pretty busy for a Monday morning. Were seated within 2 minutes, great. Server was friendly and attentive. Wife had the strawberry cream cheese stuffed french toast...yummy. Very good with a nice sized portion.  I had the corned beef hash. Good stuff, also a nice sized portion. I love corned beef hash and this was homemade. Excellent. Hit the spot. Great food, good service, reasonable prices. I was not too fond of the location ( I felt it was a bit far) but I wanted to avoid the strip so I guess I shouldn't complain.  The only CON for me was the lack of info on the server's part. I love pancakes, and always have them for breakfast when I dine out. I asked for pancakes instead of toast and was told they could not do that. Okay, no biggie. Not the first place that does this. However, the pancakes were HUGE and 3 came with the order. I barely even touched them because I was almost full from the hash. I was pretty upset that I dropped $6.25 for an order of pancakes that I had less than 1/4 of because of the shear size. I feel the server could've let me know they were huge and given me an option. Service is a big part of the experience when dining out. If I wouldn't have dropped $6.25 on uneaten pancakes our server would've gotten a nicer tip.

Bc-15eYpMbg7-Xh2YpFP8Q.text: OK You must go there, if only for the CHICKEN FRIED STEAK. I can't imagine it being any better

MLs_hmnPkyOTxEksaapMxw.text: Depends on what you are looking for. This is by no way a fancy place... Like your I hop or Dennys but better food. So if you're on strip looking for a fancy place, this is not where you should go.

3hxe3XQKJAs4Sfta9D7vgQ.text: In Vegas it's hard to find somewhere that feels like home. This place seems to specialize in doing just that. Away from the hustle and bustle of the strip is a huge plus. Greeted as soon as we walked in with a smile. For a small place the menu is large and diverse. I didn't know you could do all that with eggs. Reina was friendly and genuinely gratefully that we chose her establishment for breakfast. The food was fantastic! Exactly what we ordered, even with my dietary restrictions. Will we return in the future? With everything to do in Vegas, this place is a must do as well!

1HGVUNAbiz4KGRdNgYXtgw.text: If your looking for breakfast look no further. This place is amazing. I had the breakfast burrito and my girlfriend had biscuits and gravy, eggs, and potatoes. I would recommend this place to anyone. Always come with an empty stomach and leave full!! Check the 24/7 magazine for b1g1 coupons.

BRnpk7QqiNX4BL4I-gSPjg.text: Came back here because I had a dream that I was in heaven munchin' on their banana nut muffin....ZZZzzZZzZZZ..   Came by for breakfast to try one of my favorite breakfast dishes, chicken fried steak. I had "Brad's corned beef hash" the first time, kinda salty..  And Of course, it wasn't hard to choose, "toast or banana nut muffin".. Is this a trick question? haha, banana nut muffin, please! Muffin was Awesome just not as warm and moist as the first time. There were many more customers dining this day and maybe they were a little busy and in a rush making them?   Chicken Fried Steak: Nice portion with a good amount of gravy, I went with egg whites only and their seasoned potatoes. The steak had the right crunchy skin, meat was perfect and their sausage gravy was mild and heart warming. In my opinion, much better dish than their corned beef hash.  Upped the rating to 4 Stars because they deserve it.

tB0l_YQX-E19OEmxoP5ynQ.text: Big tasty servings :) Really quick and kind staff, specifically BreeAnnDa :) Super clean :) Everything I want in a dinning experience.

1Nk8kdsWCX73Idg7v8XLPQ.text: I had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated.  Food was excellent. I had a great waitress that was very attentive I ordered the everything omelet.

wkTtB_xe5TIcP4zj9uMYBQ.text: The food here is on point! Also the service that we got from Amanda was incredible! I had the bacon and sliced avocado omelette which was the best omelette I've ever had. Check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and sliced avocado omelette. On point.

oi-AJOsxDtJRkuGd82NDaw.text: Whether you hear about the Egg&I through word of mouth, or through online posts, you cannot trust a review until you experience the venue yourself.    Well, if you choose one place to experience, the Egg&I should be it.  This restaurant, provides great service and food.  The servers are knowledgable of their menu.  The food is deliciously prepared and served.  The busier times you will have provide your name to the host stand, the wait has been only fifteen minutes.  And if  your server asks your bread choice, ask for the Banana bread.

EI0iDnG3bENkFvccVzcGvw.text: Food luke warm coffee way over price and luke warm and bitter to taste. French toast soggy could not finish it, Way over price for what you get.

sB9eT6Heut8N9FaJdUSw8A.text: Still great all these years after the Rachel Ray review. I ventured to the Hawaiian section at the back of the menu. The Portuguese sausage with eggs, sticky rice, and a banana nut muffin (of course!) was delish. The sausage was juicy and well grilled. It's a great off-the-strip brunch spot.  ...and I'm writing this at the restaurant using their free wifi!

u3Zk7Nofanv6EW_73zw8bQ.text: I came to the egg and I in Las Vegas because I had been previously to the egg and I in Estes Park, Co. They didn't have the same menu items as they do in CO but everything was just as good. I ordered a breakfast skillet with potatoes and chili. The skillet was very good, I loved it. My wife had the breakfast burrito and she also loved it. The potatoes are seasoned with paprika and other ingredients and are very good, but I prefer the CO potatoes. The only thing that I didn't like about this place is that they don't use the egg and I brand hot sauce.

oJpGDQ8tKCo3_6-MAOaAJA.text: We are visiting the area and came across this place on Yelp. This is a great breakfast place. I had the Jose's Breakfast Burrito. It was good, great chorizo. My hubby had bacon & eggs. They have great customer service. Everyone was very helpful. Our waitress gave us a banana nut muffin to try, that was sooo delicious! OMG to die for. It was hot, not too sweet and went perfect with my coffee. We are hoping to make a stop tomorrow before we drive back home!

J_u5b-YMC1cjeJrsBdXe6Q.text: This is a great place to try right before you leave for your drive home. Definitely off the beaten path and away from the strip.   Went on a crowded Sunday morning.  They sat us very fast on the patio.  Our food arrived equally fast.   I would have given it five stars, but our waitress wasn't the best.  She was bussing our table and actually did the finger wave for me to hand her my plate across the table.  I know, I know, is it really worth taking a star off? But yes! I was a waitress for years and that's just a big no no.

r5tN7iPrhuEbNKzukT0_sQ.text: We stumbled across this local secret while on vacation last year. Its not much of your typical Las Vegas Strip crowd, more of families that actually live around town catching a late breakfast/brunch.  We had some really awesome pancakes here, and its a nice escape from those crowded hotel places. Just a few minutes from the strip!  Definitely will go back on our next visit this summer!

z-A35BgxdTAapbO0NM60Uw.text: This place couldn't be more worthy of a 5 star review! I'm a big brunch fan and try different places often when I travel. This is one of my favorite yet. The Chile Relleno omelette was AMAZING. So were the potatoes. I was also impressed with the service. That being said, I personally would not suggest the stuffed French toast. It seemed like a popular choice for the tables around me, but I tried it and thought it was only okay -- not bad but not comparable to my omelette.

aXULnwm1MR-XTTdUeCSDZg.text: Karen our server was amazing! Me and my boyfriend had breakfast. We enjoyed our meal and time spent in restaurant

lhPJ41arYtVNnpDdGAQWmQ.text: So yummy!! Our server was so nice and attentive! I got the egg breakfast sandwich, and it was delicious. We had 2 yelp coupons for a free muffin. Our server was nice enough to give us a third one for free for our third person. Will definitely be back when I'm in Vegas again.

81U1HXB6XfbqMYam4mW3fQ.text: One of the best breakfast spots in Las Vegas.  The food is always consistent and the sides are great.  Banana bread muffin from here is just solid!

FVKUpweF-2Uz4XfyiZxRCQ.text: This place is amazing! The food was awesome and the staff was really helpful and wonderful. The Strawberry and cream cheese french toast was DELICIOUS!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry and cream cheese french toast

u7wmdB0_2oKkxYsYhrj_6g.text: Wow! I love this breakfast place. First time here. The prime rib omelet, chicken enchilada omelet, and the Chile relleno were all amazing!! And to top off the great food the service was amazing! Our server was very attentive and gave great recommendations on food. Definitely coming back when I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken teriyaki burger with American cheese and fries. It was decent.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno with wheat toast. Another must! It was hard to decide whether this plate or the chicken enchilada was best.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib benny with mozzarella cheese on the potatoes. The meat was very tender.

ePv8G66Z5yBbbt0f8ya_zQ.text: The food came out quickly, and a huge portion! So if you're hungry and want to check out a great brunch place, egg and I is for you.

KOkfuIy6Q2CfIgjtmMLohg.text: Great food. Exceptional service. Servers are phenomenal with a friendly attitude and super efficient. Always crowded but they move very quickly. We come here every time we are in Vegas.

x87HaWDJu8Y_zejvGBAh1w.text: Great place, good food, great service. A great family owned restaurant in Las Vegas. Look forward to coming back.

yQr0ba4cytP8WjqH5apQoQ.text: The king of breakfast and brunch in LV. Known for the banana bread, but everything on the menu will make you want to live in Las Vegas only to come back here every weekend. This is a must-go place, no matter if you are in hangover or just chilling with your family. Breakfast here will definitely boost the mood of your party! Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aeBdO_jOeMy6uQN1cmIYvg.text: Great service and the food was delicious. It was defenitly a bang for our buck. Highly recommend.

GQhMVeeGWP_2lFHxmGApwQ.text: Huge portion sizes, great friendly staff and only minutes from the strip you can't go wrong. Some thing to remember if you check in on Yelp you get a free banana nut muffin and they are super delicious. The second thing we learned that there is a happy face on the table and if you turn it over there is a :-( if they see that :-( they will come rushing to your table immediately help in assisting you. I opted for the open-faced croissant sandwich it was loaded with cheese bacon and four large eggs even came with a side of Diablo season home fries that were really good and crispy you could even buy that seasoning to take home with you so if you're in the area and you want a breakfast to fill you up for the whole day I highly highly recommend that you drive to this location you won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open face sunrise croissant w/ diablo seasoning
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turn happy face over if you need assistance

hf8Bnni3xSgXYLgpI3XHzw.text: Best breakfast in Vegas!! I had the denver omelet with banana nut muffin and potatoes...all were so delicious!! The muffin was so moist and was like dessert. My husband got the Hawaiian French toast with bacon cream cheese and maple syrup it was so amazing and such a unique flavor. Love the carafe of coffee which was freshly brewed. Service was awesome and we received our food very quickly after we ordered and they were busy as well.

La7_UsCaL0KB3pED5_jz7w.text: Banana nut muffins are AMAZING ! I got the hue is rancheros and the enchilada sauce is to die for. Friend got the garlic mashed potatoes; so fantastic. Pretty convinced everything here is great. I only wish we were staying in Vegas long enough to eat here again .

tXw7nuB6awqEpadq4y368Q.text: great breakast , great service. banana nut muffin to go. thanks to our server liliana.  we'll be coming back for our next trip to LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sundance omelet

tLOQn3RheSpuDmISL96I1A.text: Exceptional service. Great portions. My bf and I split the blackened prime ribs eggs Benedict. So freaking good!!! And we got moist banana muffins.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aePuz6-Xer8l362Gpk10yA.text: The Egg and I was amazing. I went while on vacation with my mom and brother. The wait for our food after putting in the order wasn't horrible at all. We will definitely be back next year when we come back to Vegas. The Egg and I is well worth the drive off the strip. It is the best breakfast from a restaurant that I've had in a long time. Great service and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good!

oi1F_elEhAo1P86C8oK3oA.text: Lacey was our waitress and she was so friendly, cordial and accommodating! The food was beyond our expectation and to top it off they offer military discounts!   We were told a 25 minute wait but were seated after about 15 minutes. The wait was well worth the time...  We thoroughly enjoyed this spot!!!

rHCpaau3wqTOt4P28-FDcg.text: I love this place! It's my go to when we are in town! Their portions are big and their staff is friendly! If you have any issues they're quick to fix them! The banana muffins are to die for. There's sometimes a wait but it's definitely worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cordon blue skillet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese and cheese omelet

5Vv8toLduUN3EL6_0ymMYw.text: Food and service were great. Parking may be a battle on a weekend so we are lucky it was a Tuesday. Food was really good though and a great price.

dBNbA5-tqBsX_8PAslTkzw.text: Went there for breakfast and their chili relleno omelet and homemade muffins to die for!! Definitely one of my favorite places for breakfast!

e3-boyMcFCdiUXoyRbU9fQ.text: the food was great and so was our waitress Karla! The customer service was wonderful and our waitress made our experience even better

KTmqwRjL888NLYdwCjwY5Q.text: The food here is amazing! Almost as great as Amanda's service! Highly recommend this place to everyone! Had the Country Benny- ermahgawd. So delicious!

YiPW_hDk6BAOAfSXUd1YIQ.text: One of my favorite breakfast places in Vegas .... My last visit there wasn't so great ... The waitress messed up the order 3 times and well the rest of the staff more than made up for it ... The assistant manager was great taking care of us and the bussers were the friendliest and most attentive... Will return but will refuse to sit with in that waitress' section

PIYVUCrGVvckiNY9P15wmg.text: I have been to the Egg & I whenever we visit Las Vegas and it never disappoints. The food is always tasty and the people are always friendly & helpful.  We had Amanda today and she is an asset to the restaurant,  friendly & efficient.  I had the works benny,  tomato,  spinach, avocado & poached eggs with hollandaise sauce over English muffins,  delicious! I also had a side of Portuguese sauage, yum! My friend had banana nut French toast, with apple compote & maple syrup, she thought her food was fantastic. Definitely a place not a place to miss when you're in Las Vegas!!

o950kTEJ_vlKZcNDsv-Lhg.text: We were curious if the banana muffins were as good as everyone said our server Karla overheard us and brought us one so we can decide for ourselves. It was moist and delicious. Thank you, Karla. We also enjoyed our breakfast, really good breakfast burrito.

WDTRIs9XZRC_Zzba34e9hQ.text: I have been there several times and every time I have a great experience. We have ordered different things bisquit and gravy, omelets, pancakes, all the regular breakfast foods and everything have tasted great. You cannot leave this place without trying the banana nut muffin, breakfast potatoes and the coffee. All the dishes we have tried for breakfast have been delicious. This place is a must and is on our list for every Vegas trip. We have even purchased their coffee bag to make their coffee back at home.

FjaEPHpHSSPPmmDteroekQ.text: So glad we found this great breakfast spot before leaving Las Vegas. The food was great and the service was excellent. Thanks Amanda

GYxK-J18yWC4GDbW-A5OUw.text: This is our favorite breakfast place, hands down!  Staci was very nice and attentive. The Veggie Bennie is my go-to dish.

TicwJxQFcm9PpHIwljwwOg.text: egg-cellent place for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed the eggs and complimentary banana muffins at the beginning of the meal. the blueberry panacakes were a bit dry however the omlette made up for it. i must also say the service was top notch and ended up tipping more than usual

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M3zO0tGCjC7ANJDVtY8Wyg.text: Glad I listened to the reviews! Very good food and great service.  Good idea to call ahead on a Sunday morning...  Banana nut muffin so warm and yummy!

1rGz7Ztt3Ruv78I8wyG9XQ.text: By far, the best breakfast in town! Our server today, Karla, was super attentive, quick, and very nice! I have been a loyal egg & I customer since moving to vegas in October and I have no plans to go anywhere else. Their hot sauce is amazing as well. Egg substitute omelette for the win!

b6GIUsckql5_VafI6FPa-A.text: We had a bit of a wait to be seated, but the food was worth it. And I love that they leave a whole pot of coffee at your table, very good!

D9do-zuiLpWBI3WBwzdMWg.text: This was my first time to Egg and I. It was busy and we were quoted a 20 minute wait and sure enough, at 20 minutes we were called. We sat down and the server Karla was amazing, attentive, and friendly. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs...the gravy is excellent! I definitely will come back here when visiting Vegas.

jxOAMk0U2_ZKUmp7nmCaKg.text: Whenever we come to Vegas, we make sure to stop here for breakfast. Everything tastes phenomenal and the amazing breakfast potatoes top it all off. All of the staff has been great! Reina even went out of her way to change an order at the last second. Definitely go here. You won't be disappointed.

mcJ1e6_mVgLdXcs0JizEfw.text: The wait time was not bad at all, Sunday morning only about 15 min. The staff was super friendly. Get the muffin.  My omelet was ok.

0nB8o1D5UQfmIGN40dh2rQ.text: My 300th review, and what best celebrates that then with a review for the best darned breakfast/lunch joint in TOWN! I'm from San Francisco, and I wanted to eat somewhere OFF the strip. (I was staying at Vdara). So I yelped Egg and I, and ventured off the strip with my rental car and my husband. My husband of course was a bit hesitant to venture off the strip, but he was SO happy I found Egg and I. (We ate here every morning of our 3 day stay). It was seriously that good.  We ordered- breakfast burrito (ordered with egg whites and light cheese) A+ chicken fried steak: A (better to get sauce on side IMO) chicken omelet (it had a "special" name to it) A+ Denver omelet (ordered with egg whites and light cheese) A+ whole wheat pancakes (HUGE ORDER!) A+ Portions are big, so don't order too much!  Service was great! We had the same server all 3 days. She was surprised to see us back on the 2nd day, but was just laughing when she saw us the 3rd day. A bit funny I know :) She made sure our visit was pleasant, asking if we needing anything. The only thing I needed was help walking out their door, since I ate so much.   I hope Egg and I continues to serve great food. Sadly we don't live in Vegas, so we can only visit when we need to sunbathe and gamble :) So that's twice a year, hopefully more!  Thanks Egg & I, for a 5 STAR experience.

nVt6T9QCX0RMcbZ5cZrfBQ.text: Good coffee...good food...good service...great banana muffin.....reasonably priced with large portions....I recommend!!!

jkifQj4LWoLRm05_G4wkng.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in Vegas off the strip. Must go here every time I'm in town!

m_K5Yg2GtEuij9P_6QFHog.text: Liliana provided excellent service for our breakfast visit. My wife had the classic breakfast and said the bacon was very good. I had a special, the Hobo Scramble, which was exactly what the description said and really hit the spot. Their potatoes are deliciously seasoned. We both also had their tasty sourdough toast. Had already had coffee so can't speak to that but the iced tea was good. It was Memorial Day so there was a pretty good line but it moved quickly, only about a 15 minute wait. Hostesses were great, too!

QTXN3eKNhd2fl8QDR511Xg.text: It's ok but expensive for what it is.  Food is good. Service is great.  Had better breakfast off the strip.

qkdCbiCDl7oI2BGjl4sONw.text: Karla helped us with an amazing brunch!  Food was tasty and plentiful.  Service was terrific.  Will definitely return next time we are in Vegas.

q6jJ4EwdVzOHaW0g-HpGkQ.text: Went there this past weekend with the GF and my NY friends.  We had:  Blackened Prime Rib Benny - Blackened Prime Rib with onions and peppers and 2 poached eggs on a croissant with hollandaise sauce - Pretty good, but the prime rib was a little dry.  Eggs Benedict Florentine - Pretty good  Eggs Taliano - Very good, tasted like a pizza with a soft egg crust.  French Toast - This was ok.  All the egg dishes came with ranch flavored home fries which were geat.  This was a good breakfast place.  Very quaint and clean inside.  I would definitely go back there again.

tz6B342mmMBU1rc31IOkTg.text: You definitely have to try their version of a banana nut muffin. I've never eaten a banana nut muffin quite like it.  Now I know why they're famous for it.  I also love their newspaper-like menus, very creative.    It is a comfortable atmosphere and friendly service.  This is a popular restaurant, and we went on a Saturday morning, thus we had to wait for about 15 minutes for a table, which isn't bad at all. It took a while for us to decide on what to order because everything (they had quite a variety of choices on the menu) sounded so appetizing.  After we finally ordered, our food came out quickly, and everyone was pleased w/ each of our orders.  Everything looked very good and tasted great too.      It's not located that far away from the Vegas Strip, and it's definitely worth the short drive.  It's also a nice getaway from the chaos and traffic where the casinos are.  I certainly couldn't have gotten a decent and fairly priced breakbreast/brunch meal somewhere on the Strip. From now on, whenever I visit Vegas, I'll have to goeat at Egg and I.

D00pW5zl_pvBCnK87orCCQ.text: Whenever I am in vegas I always make sure that this is the last place that I hit up before I hit the road. The breakfast menu is really good and there is so much to choose from that it makes it hard to decide what you really want to eat because everything sounds so good. It is reasonable priced and the portions are large. So be sure to go on an empty stomach, cause you will walk out of there stuffed.  The service is great. Very mom and pops style. Only thing that sucks is that the cashier takes a while to ring up your stuff. She is pretty slow.  When you go make sure to have soem of their breakfast potatoes and their waffles are deliciuosly huge.

uNQpwnLWjsuAzmrGIt9U1Q.text: Was in Vegas for a little vaca and we wanted to get away from the hustle and bustle on the strip and I wasn't down for another buffet or spending $16 on breakfast at the hotel we were staying at.    So I trusted fellow yelpers and hopped over here.  It was approaching noon, but I still had my heart set on breakfast.    We were seated quickly.  The service was ok. I don't know in what order the food went in or what, but this is what I noticed.   There were 2 tables in front of my view.  One table got seated 5 minutes after us and the other table seemed like they were wating forever for their food.  I'm assuming the manager, went up to the table and apologized for their food not getting there yet.  I then noticed the table who sat down 5 mintues AFTER us got served their food first.  I looked at the hubby and said, "how did that happen?" AND they were served way BEFORE the table that was waiting.  So something happened to communication from the servers and the kitchen.     I got the chicken fried steak.  When we got our food I was lovin' the potatoes!!  My scramble eggs were over cooked and hard - really no flavor.  My chicken fried steak was good, but the put sooo much gravy, I had to take half of it off.     Overall, the place is a good spot for breakfast in Vegas.  I wish I could get more of those damyn potatoes!! :)

F5OGmMQKPdcfBF4X5UC4xw.text: I always thought this place didn't seem appetizing from what it looks like on the outside, but it's actually cozy & welcoming! The service is quick & food is delicious...especially their banana nut muffins & ranch potatoes. I will definitely come back & recommend this place to my family & friends.

_szUInj7kSaRg7h4dJRJgw.text: Great place to have breakfast.  Fast and friendly service.  Arlene was very courteous and attentive. Hefty servings at a reasonable price.

y9w4swVas6cJJUUSsV8Z7g.text: Saturday morning in Las Vegas, really needed to score a solid breakfast. The eggs benny florentine was incredible, but the potatoes that came with it made the meal.   Waitress came by to remove our plates and we just growled at her :). Sh realized we had a couple of potato morsels left and backed away.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict Florentine &amp; Country Potatoes

Q9K2B6ZNzMVGjaDDYLy3Iw.text: love this place ,, food it's great !!!.. great customer service from "koko"..CHILE RELLENO OMMLETT it's a must try !!!. Love them potatoes !!!.. ohh and the prices are awesome .. it's a great restaurant for all the family , kids meals plates are huge at great prices.. wish I had taken a picture ,.. but we couldn't wait to eat .. lol..

FeKaqHua9_AfWCYJMnPN9A.text: My family loves The Egg and I!  We visit Vegas several times a year and have breakfast there at least once per trip.  The service is friendly, efficient, and fast.  The food is delicious.  We highly recommend the Fiesta Skillet (add chorizo) and the warm Banana Nut Muffin with some butter on it is to die for.  It's a small place, expect a wait, especially on weekends.

iIRYUr7py1_qGSXikfl6kw.text: Absolutely amazing! The place was busy but we were still seated right away. We didn't have to wait at all for our food. Our banana nut muffins were so fresh they were still warm. We all got different things off of the menu and liked everything we had. Lisa was our waitress- she was very friendly, and very efficient.  We will definitely stop here again when we visit vegas!

ZpBMmByOIorUwKm7hAVGmw.text: The Egg and I is our favorite place for breakfast when we visit Las Vegas. The food and service is always good. But this time our waitress Ashley H. made it even more enjoyable. She was extremely personable and helpful .My  husband and I always share because the portions are very generous. But we always have to compromise because we each want something different. Ashley informed us about the dishes that we can get half portions of. So now there is no need to share. We can each get what we want. Everything on the menu is great. So be adventurous and  try something different.

8Q83dB-YrETgnMjpT5Us2Q.text: Fast service and amazing food! Price was was very good.

NkS21rNvMzffVvkMVMX96A.text: We have been enjoying breakfast here for many years.   It's always delicious, and the staff are always friendly and accommodating.  We always bring out out-of-town guests here, and they love the food.

PZjswVC4idKN3rj1OzaJxg.text: I was in carb heaven at the Egg and I, had the biscuits and gravy and the banana walnut muffin which were both very good. Service was very good and our food was delivered quite fast. Crowded, but the wait went very fast. Look like a new favorite in Vegas for me.

BjQMOGxeMc74OCrjaaYAIQ.text: bomb.com .. And Alyssa was such a good server ... We'll be coming here more often not bad first my first time trying it

dD0flI13reot-sQOkS8-dA.text: My husband and I didn't realize how far this place was from the Strip. A little too expensive of a fare for breakfast! HOWEVER, this place is super yummy. We did have a wait for about 40 minutes upon arrival as well. A local favorite. Combine tourists like us with locals, you got a busy place! Look in the 24/7 guide for a buy 1, get 1 entree free coupon. The banana nut muffin is served warm and is a must eat. We both got omelets - love the unique variety! The homestyle potatoes are super tasty and you get a generous portion. Fresh squeezed orange juice - a plus! The little black/yellow egg flipper as a service indicator is fun and helpful. Within seconds of flipping it to the black egg (meaning we needed service) the MANAGER was over at our table asking what we needed and joking with us. Everyone here is friendly, upbeat and happy you stopped in. Good place, good people. Go.

Lh1GojBDm22Pj9Er2EO1jA.text: The best thing about Egg & I is the seasoning that they put on their potatoes!  It's fantastic!  Large portions, and otherwise pretty tasty breakfast food.  I love that they give you the whole carafe of coffee!

BcBfB4VLjStbogOcpK9aNQ.text: An awesome local breakfast diner, a couple miles off the strip on Sahara.  Lots of cool touches like the newspaper style menus and the little flipcharts to let the server know you need something.  The breakfast skillets are superb here, served hot on the skillet with a layer of ranch potatoes.  I have tried both the Chili skillet and the Ultimate skillet, both were excellent.  I also recommend the banana nut muffin side.  I would, however, advise against ordering from their Mexican inspired menu.  They should definitely leave the chorizo con huevos to the Mexican joints.  Overall one of my favorite Vegas dining spots, for breakfast or a late night snack (they are open til 3AM).

sqsnqJ-H8DFJvlJ17YlHNg.text: Came to breakfast with a large group while in Vegas for a Birthday trip. It was so nice to eat off the strip and have a great cooked meal. Everyone in my party loved their dishes. I had Eggs Benedict, which was wonderful.   Why I rated it a 4... server wasn't great. She was nice, friendly, and polite but wasn't real attentive. We had a long wait to have our order taken too. The coffee... was not drinkable. I love coffee w my breakfast food so that was kinda a disappointment but the Eggs Benedict made up for it!!

iphFASWmSCyUp4G-Kd6xCA.text: Always good food and service. Get the potatoes for breakfast with your order, they're the best!!

E8IiXove9g0kxAzb3Q-ErA.text: Just had a Fantastic breakfast at the Egg and I out here in Las Vegas. But with what was really good about the experience was our waitress named CHANCE, she had a great smile and very very good serving skill. Would come back just to see her.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle works

UhzqwfFdFcgCWn5O1pSEjQ.text: Thanks Patrick for taking such good care of us. This is going to be one of my top five breakfast spots in my book. Definitely worth and highly recommend the drive away from the strip for breakfast. There are tons of other great lunch dishes too. Service was great. Dog friendly patio. Food is crazy delicious BTW.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A beautiful day and a delicious breakfast. 2:09 PM on a Thursday afternoon.

WQi330r3mVNrm3mzAkoDtQ.text: Great place great workers. Group of 7 and fast service

B9_IRTwBvLNugixUy_TPhg.text: Liza was a really great server. She was very attentive and everything was brought promptly. The food was really good. I will be leaving a decent tip and can not wait to come back again.

VzrePDWR5QcVLrLsT-3a-A.text: The food is amazing and the service was perfect, thank you Breeannda, u were awesome!

wbV87zbsUyG1sCip8BieFg.text: Wow, what a great place for breakfast! This little mom & pop restaurant that is out of the way from the busy strip and expensive breakfast prices!  We found this place from one of those Vegas pamphlets they hand out with a 2 for 1 coupon in it.   And by the looks of all the other reviews, I would say that everyone knows about this place too. It was packed when we showed up.   I got the corn beef hash with two eggs over easy and their banana nut muffin. The corn beef was fresh and their banana nut muffin was really good! Now I see shy they were famous for them. The ranch potatoes were a little too salty for my taste. They need to tone it down on the salt and then they would be really good but really didn't eat them  because I felt my blood pressure go through the roof! lol..  My BF had the Chicken omelet and he gave me a bite and it was really de-lish especially if you are an avocado freak because there was a ton of avocado stuffed in the omelet.   The service was really good even for sitting out on the patio. I would definitely go back for breakfast when I come back into town!

U_IB1yi4v-5mkctvLrunqA.text: his place has redeemed itself.   I was lucky to be seated right away since I was there all alone. My waitress Amanda was there immediately to see if I had any questions and to take my drink order. She has a warm smile and made me feel very welcome. I ordered the Texas toast French toast with eggs and bacon. It was delicious. I also ordered a side of toast for which she asked if I wanted it buttered which usually they don't so that was great. The eggs were perfectly over medium and they were actually seasoned. Amanda was very attentive and was sure that I was not in need of anything. I also had the banana nut muffin it was one of the best I've had in a restaurant, I am a bit partial to my own.  I will say the service through out was exceptional from the moment I walked in until I left even thought the register had trouble reading the card I had.   The food would definitely be worth the wait, and the service I experienced was above expectations for how busy the are. Give it a try if you haven't been

H-4kGckG8lQ0dS5OMNpIWw.text: Huge portions and good food, but long wait line for breakfast. We were seated rather quickly (about 20 min) considering how many parties were ahead of us (about 8) Be prepared to be put in a food coma... I had the sunrise omelet with chicken and could only finish half of it. The thing I liked about the omelet was that it wasn't too oily like in other omelettes I've had. Cheese was a little too much for me as well. My friend and I split the strawberry cream cheese French toast. If you don't mind having gobs of strawberry jelly and whip cream on your French toast, this is definitely for you! The taste was spot on, but can be overwhelmingly goopy for some. Overall, good food, good service. You definitely could feed a small family with just a couple of entrees!

hsTS2GmvtAkc0HVuHPSj4g.text: This was another great Yelp find. Very friendly and quick service keeps this local breakfast restaurant moving smoothly. The food was great, no bad surprises. The banana but muffins have a great flavor, but the texture could be improved upon.  Great eggs, good chorizo, fresh fruit was sweet and hash was good too. Great place for a simple but tasty breakfast!

---WDP9kwKyVQiw9GTgNmQ.text: 2Nd time eating here today.1st time was great but now i dont think so. My husband ordered chicken fried steak. The gravey tasted very strange. He scraped most of it off & continued 2eat. I ate1/2half of 1 of his hashbrown paties which had some gravey on it . W/in 30 mins i threw up ,w/in 1hr he also did the same & has not stoped all day vomiting.  I finally called & spoke 2a manager, the lady was nice &suggested  i call the operarions manager. I said no . but u need thow that gravey shit away!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5he8OfTQSe3VNcQZfWA2qQ.text: Amazing service, friendly atmosphere, and a great place to visit for tourist.

Z3jxlEyqFFZoMO35V6SHYQ.text: We live in California and have been here 4-5 times over the course of several years. The reason for my 5 star review is that I'm at a loss to come up with a single negative. Every server has been 100% on top of it. We (myself, wife and two kids) have raved about every entree. The prices are low for strip-area Las Vegas dining. The ambiance is more mid-west USA than Las Vegas but I have no issue with that.  I'm not one to freely give out 5 star reviews but the Egg and I has earned one.

vjPaQdbsopgU3WI-Nw3-AQ.text: The host was not good at all today this morning. My family had been waiting for a while and when she called us. She said my mom's name, since she was the one who signed in, and then "party of four" when I even heard my mom said party of six. The host seemed out of it & disinterested. She did not take down the correct number for my party. Her job is so simple & she could not perform. Bad service! Didn't get to taste the food so this review is for the service.

_eXg_One6v01-iqC7juMeg.text: Awesome selection and prices...food is really good! Omelette was the best with spinach and feta

3qdCg8wJMPznF4oTwkA-uA.text: The food here was really good. We got a free banana muffin for checking in. sooo good

ICnB56mlv26XEO6sSMCjBQ.text: Great little local place for breakfast. The banana nut muffins are great! The corn beef hash is also very yummy. Bree was our waitress and she was wonderful, very attentive. Overall a great spot for breakfast.

8zy7Q2uIIi-EggF8hbicKQ.text: Came for brunch  Had the skillet works and delicious  Mimosas were good and served in mini bottle champagne

qhU34y-mEF9mWij6-F6gCA.text: EVERY time we're in Las Vegas we visit the Egg & I before going home. My friends and I wanted to have a home style meal during our last morning on the strip. Don't get discouraged by the lack of glam and glitz, this restaurant is definitely worth visiting. We were all immediately greeted upon entrance by vibrant and welcoming staff. Our waitress was personable, friendly, and didn't miss a beat, she always made sure we were all well taken care of. The food was out to us in no time and their home made muffins are to die for. Everything is cheaper compared to the strip and the portions are ginormous.

gK0yxq_KONdgFXlLz5o_YQ.text: Will definitely be coming back. It was packed but we didn't have to wait to long to get a table. Shortly after getting our table our food was ready! And the Banana Nut Muffins were sooooo good! Our waiter Curtis (W/ the Colts hat) was definitely on it! He made the experience great, a great employee!

mxqqZYN_IQP5oFOmO-puXw.text: Excellent service, food, portions, flavor, mimosas. Our server Tamara was very pleasant, accommodating and friendly. Highly recommended & worth the Uber ride. Glad that we took a trip off the strip for local eats.

hmJ8I7fV5DuUTyvrOri83Q.text: I'm always shocked at how busy this place is.  Omelettes after all are pretty easy to make.    Having said that the service here is good and the food is solid.  What is unique to this place in Las Vegas, is the Cincinnati style chili. A chili with no beans and I believe has cinnamon.  The chili is normally had over spaghetti with mounds of cheese and for those of you that have no one to maks out with,  get it with onions and beans.  Yummy!  During this trip I decided to go low carb and get the chili over an omelette and of course bacon.  Most of the dishes here come with theIr seasoned country fries.  They are delicious.   Since I'm a fry connoisseur,  I can really appreciate these delicious cubed and fried pieces of carbs.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
