zfOAMZ27nDQUJvIpmN-roA.text: Great place to eat.  Oakland Rebels youth basketball team  love it!!!! Great service. Everytime we go to Vegas we eat here. Need one in the Bay Area.

VdmtQrxBeC5tZICMoZIGlw.text: Really enjoy this spot for breakfast. Maybe 10mins Off the strip and places to park   Food was really good and came out fast, services was very good. Well recommended if you're looking for something off the strip.

syxxhp56cOQ7QCYm6wYDMw.text: this is one of the best breakfast places in town for sure. They have a cinci chili omlete that is out of this world

m5n41mCOyyBC9ubn4yWrdg.text: Me and my husband were visiting Las Vegas and I found this place on Yelp. We have it a try and the food was amazing, the service also was great. We visited again for our last day of vacation and everything was great. Great food and great service I highly recommend here. Sooooo delicious  Thank you egg and I, you guys rock

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California creps and chili relleno omelette

krTw8UGIn39b17pvClVSoQ.text: Super fast and friendly service. The food is to die for and not expensive at all. We will definitely be going back to this restaurant.

rDZxP7STsuNsaKNj7NDV4Q.text: The location is off the strip so the wait was not too bad. We got there just before lunch time and waited about half hour (they text you when your number is up). Next came the foods, we ordered quite a few items. The one I remembered were seasoned New York steak and French toast sandwich with eggs and sausage. They are not bad but not super good neither, just your normal above average brunch foods. Price is good for Vegas. Our bill came to about $100 for 7 people.  Overall, I don't mind coming back another time.

i5L7YIz0TnwF-9zcK7Y9XQ.text: I had the Loco Moco. It was absolutely fantastic. I also recommend their muffins!  I make a point to stop here at least once every time I stop in Vegas. The food is amazing and the price is right. Highly recommended.

TJgo_54DnwzOMn3qD6leWA.text: Big eggs benedict fan that I am...I had to come here and I wasn't disappointed! Very busy place but the wait goes fairly quickly and was worth it. I wasn't as impressed with their diablo potatoes that a lot of yelpers seem to be. They were okay. Service was great. Full bar!  My only complaint is that we were there with a group of people. Had put in our name for the full 8 people but two were running about 5 minutes late. They wouldn't seat us until they showed...(even so the others could get coffee/take a look at the menu). They gave our table away and we had to wait again. But in their defense...probably how they get everyone in and out so fast.

Drg-Vd8AMC2v21q2xwP2ng.text: Service was so friendly and the food here was amazing. We ordered the Stuffed French Toast (5/5) Haole Loco Moco (3.5/5) they substituted brown gravy for country white gravy, and a side fruit plate (5/5) which had a huge assortment. I will definitely come back when visiting Vegas.

lyfr493tZs_4MWGLXCGPaA.text: Their service is great. You're serviced in a timely matter, orders are taken correctly, and the food comes out quickly. All their menu items have a great flavor. Their seasoned potatoes are a great compliment to almost any dish on the menu. I strongly recommend a visit to this place. Don't be intimidated by the wait times in the morning !

fI3nahoAdPX0Sn_Vuzm77g.text: Hot chocolate was wayy to sweet. Free muffin on check in and it was delicious! Had the waffles and eggs, kinda plain style though. Price wasnt all that bad. The muffin was nice and hot too.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffles

ygewKFZ0Zt588GKG2FMI_Q.text: Thanks to my server, Rachel and the rest of the folks working hard here to everyone's experience remembering. Definitely the next time I come back here, I need to come with a real appetite as depending on what you order, it can fill you up pretty good and quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top of the muffin to you. LOL

47jCIxI59OTqz_I1GYUZZg.text: Yet another delicious breakfast spot in Las Vegas. This place offers a warm banana nut muffin that is out of this world. They serve large portions I had the bacon avocado omelette with the crispy seasoned potatoes very yummy. I will be returning when in Vegas.

XpKqa9h2A0Z36cPlo2L_GA.text: Great breakfast place!! I'm not going to recommend anything. Just open the menu, close your eyes, and point randomly on the menu. You can't miss!!!

aE-2WYWhpneNFhSUtW88cA.text: Took a Uber to egg & I. It was 10 am. There was a crowd, but we got seated right away.  Our server was Denise , she was great considering the mob.  Coffee was decent, we ordered from these neat menus . I got the country bene. It excellent. And got to my table really fast.  So the service was excellent, (thank you Denise). Food was the best. Cost was reasonable. Overall excellent. Worth the drive.

4Gr8xXMwScB7-_U8hPhGLg.text: This was an exceptional breakfast joint off the beaten path. Lots of people, and a wait, but not too long. All the breakfast items looked delicious. My friend had the Michelada - which was so yummy. I had a mimosa , served in a cute mason jar. The portions for the food were quite generous, you won't leave hungry. If you've had a "fun" night the night before, this is also good for recovery breakfasts. Fried potatoes were so yummy, perfectly cooked. Service was on point. There were so many other menu options, I will definitely be back.

t05ZnXXHRjq8yCF6elHcOw.text: Found this gem right here in Yelp. Thank you fellow Yelpers!  This place was fantastic. We had a party of five and waited all of about two minutes to be seated. We must have hit the right time of morning because the place was jammed by the time we left. Well worth any wait.   Food - The menu was expansive. So many items to choose from. I had the Three Pig Omelette with a side of their excellent hollandaise sauce. Superb. My son was pleased with his waffle. My wife, who is not a huge breakfast fan, was thrilled to see she could get an egg white omelette. She commented that you never really know how egg white dishes will turn out. She raved about her egg white veggie omelette. The two others in our party had the the biscuits and gravy and loco moco respectively. The biscuits and gravy were a hit while the loco moco was remarkably reminiscent to the Hawaiian Islands favorite dish.   Service - The service was exceptional. In an industry where service can significantly impact the diner's experience, Oscar was fantastic. Oscar was well versed in his menu knowledge and was quick to offer recommendations and to gladly accept order substitutions. His pleasant, respectful, and appreciative demeanor really helped to set our dining experience apart from every other experience while in town. He was also aware and kind enough to notice the kitchen was getting backed up so he brought out a plateful of banana nut muffins to help stunt the growing hunger we all were suffering.   Overall - Highly recommend this restaurant for the wonderful combination of great food and top-notch service.

32d2lVb4OLFNqu9M3x_lbw.text: Erin was great. Attentive, quick, and friendly. Would love to come by when I am in Vegas again.  I had the Waffle Works, which came with eggs and a choice of meat. I had the turkey bacon. Delivery was prompt and service came with a smile; always a good thing to see in the morning.  Good aside, this place has a large dining room and an outdoor seating area with mist, so you don't cook outside.

BYcoxTHWeKOcaTHlwbQCww.text: First of I want to start of by saying Tabatha is by far the best! She was quick, friendly and knowledgeable of all items the had to offer on the menu, not only that but she definitely made all and I mean all of the breakfast sound as amazing as it was! Really enjoyed my "FREE"muffin by far one of the top 5 banana nut muffins on book! A must go to spot!! Egg works//egg &I

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In

0mY1zI71dLYEFEKjNGaOYA.text: Had a great time - our server Bree was excellent too. However, she never brought out our disco ball, and thus I was unable to OFFICIALLY beat her in the dance-off I challenged her to.   As a Cincinnati resident, their Cincy Style Chili was great. Their muffins are amazing. The egg dishes were wonderful and full of flavor. This was hands down the best breakfast I've ever had in Vegas!

gUVkDnMVxnD39Cxr7AQJSA.text: Great breakfast. We had biscuits and gravy, omelette with avocado and bacon and couple of banana muffins.  Food came out fast, hot and enough to fill us up.  Service was great as well.  I hope I didn't jinx myself for the next time i come again to get bad service and food. Haha

g1UMv0nUGUpMumkIKYHltw.text: Super service!!  Kat is the best!  She took care of us even though this place was slammed!  Had the steak and eggs.  Definitely try the Banana Muffin, you will not regret it!  They even were giving free Bloody Mary mix when you leave!

QaQd6NPlFaJnLxJH7Z1ICg.text: I know this place can do without another 5 star review, but I think I want to move to Vegas just for Egg & I. We came in a group of 10, but service blew our minds away. At 1 pm on a Saturday, we barely waited 10 minutes. Our server took our orders quickly, and gave everyone a banana nut muffin on the house!  A couple of my friends and I split the blackened prime rib benedict (a must must MUST!), the strawberry cream-stuffed french toast (tasted like fair food), and an Italian omelette. Enormous portions priced right--felt so bad leaving so much of it uneaten, especially since it was so delish. Even the coffee was the absolute perfect diner coffee.  I don't think I can ever do a Vegas trip without the Egg & I. It's so worth the drive off the strip! And believe the hype--just stick to the blackened prime rib benny and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum. Strawberry french toast, eggs Benedict and an Italian omelette.

sintp2wgOV51CQG7asIOUg.text: Wait time was about 20 minutes. (Not bad) Service was excellent! Food came out within 10 minutes. Blueberry pancakes but asked for Bananas in it. (Scrumptious!) Pork Chops were was seasoned well. Potatoes that comes with the meal was absolutely mouth watering. Sunny Side Up egg were prefect. Coffee was delicious.  Highly recommended this place!

V3UOl7Jf19W-j8_EbE81fw.text: The best places to visit are the ones where locals go. If you see locals going to a restaurant, then you know it's amazing. I was guessing we were the only travelers because no one else was taking pictures of their food. It is a rather small place. They said the wait was 20 minutes but we were seated much quicker. All the workers are very friendly and will assist you, even if they aren't your waiter/waitress. The menu resembles a newspaper and my parents were happy at the large clear print. I ordered the classic plate. The eggs were cooked to perfection, the bacon was not too crispy and not too flimsy, and the potatoes were just heavenly.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy egg= happy table.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EpRh7EJ6fZqd__VGbUDXTg.text: So my brother and my best friend and I decided to have breakfast here. Was a bit disappointed that this location doesn't serve alcohol but oh well. So we walk in and request an outside table and were seated in a timely manner. The hostess seated us that had the tip still on the table and I thought that maybe she didn't see so I let her know oh the tip is still on the table and she had a bit of an attitude while telling me the server would grab it. The server, Amanda, came over to us and greeted us and we told her what happened. I wasn't that upset but I just thought it was kind of ridiculous. Anyways our server was really great! Bubbly and cute and super friendly. She even sent the manager over after we had told her about the tip thing and they gave us a free round of muffins! I love that! I guess it's company policy they leave the tip on the table due to bussers stealing tips.   So on to the food. I got what I always do, it's just a platter with potatoes sausage toast and eggs and it's always delicious. My brother got banana but French toast and Biola got regular French toast and it was fricking fantastic.    Once again I'd just like to say how amazing our server was! Thanks Amanda! Also I hope you win that trip to Disneyland!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3MRs-F03VwBryJfgAJh_2g.text: great place for Brunch... best and moist banana nut muffins... My kids love their waffle with fresh fruits....

nk2j8PcPzhUqL1npL-9eqQ.text: I don't even know where to start that's how amazing this place is! From the Banana Nut Muffin to the Stuffed French Toast to our sever Tamara everything was great! Friendly staff who checked on us over and over to make sure we had everything we needed. Great job Egg & I keep it up! Oh yeah and I forgot to mention this was our 4 Year Anniversary Breakfast too!

uQH1IAwso35ymmclyphGTA.text: We were sat quickly, and served promptly by Tabatha. She was quick without rushing. The banana nut muffin really is as good as the hype. We enjoyed our prime rib benny and classic.  We would come back during our next visit and hope for Tabatha to be our server again!

87l6QfspZoBxEqR8nzI4lA.text: The best breakfast place in Las Vegas! Was looking for a great affordable place and we found it. We tried the omelets, the classic breakfast...it comes with a yummy muffin. It is also Pet-friendly.

wmHX-J9S0XdV0AZ_532Edg.text: This place is amazing!  Service was very friendly and the food was out of this world!!!  I had the Prime Rib Eggs Benedict and my taste buds are still jumping for joy!  My husband had the spam and eggs with the most amazing fries.  We received complimentary banana nut muffins and it was plain to see why they are a staple.  Will be back this week!

F743aRNGXGYgXMbfwtTdOA.text: Tasty and great friendly service by Breeannda!  The chile relleno omelette and the sunrise mountain (open faces croissant sandwich) were good choices.... Among the many many choices on the menu!

ca7bhUMKlSEuq-aOAP_2CQ.text: The food was good. I wasn't blown out of the water by any of the food we ordered but I gave it a 5 star because their customer service was one of the best I've experienced. Our server, Amanda, was so warm and welcoming and everyone else who worked there was just bustling with positive energy and good vibes all around. Servings are good for 2. There was just a bit of a wait as the line was out the door when we got there but they were quick to seat people. I would definitely visit again when I come back to Vegas.

It's a great place for breakfast food but I recommend putting your name on the online (yelp) waitlist and checking the wait times before going. hCbwu4QD9iZ3EV4XAuV5pQ.text: I came in here on a Friday morning a little after 9am. The place was busy but not packed. The service was terrible, for me at least. Two tables that got seated after me got their orders taken and were eating before I even got to order. I'm not a complainer unless it's just really ridiculous. I usually let my dissatisfaction be known in the tip I leave, although when the waiter came over and asked if I was ready to order I did comment that I had "been" ready a while now. I ordered a breakfast burrito, which comes with seasoned potatoes. The food came out in a reasonable amount of time and it tasted good. I noticed that as I was leaving, the place was really crowded.  The menu here is vast, from scrambled eggs to breakfast burritos. The food here is tasty and plentiful. The service for me at least, is hit and miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LWnqUDy18IeH2aTnGv4eYA.text: This breakfast spot is just amazing. From the food, to the staff, just everything is great.  I ordered the Strawberry Cream Cheese Stuffed, my husband ordered the Haole Loco, and I ordered the Works Fruit Plate for my toddler.  The food was delicious. My French toast wasn't too sweet, which is perfect for me. I had a bite of the Haole Loco and ended up finishing it! I'm not a fan of gravy, but the gravy was so delicious! Unfortunately, the fruit plate had fruit that weren't very ripe, so I asked for just blueberries and bananas instead. The waitress was very kind and only charged me for a fruit bowl.  Overall, we had a great experience. I definitely recommend this place.

I found the diced potatoes to be too salty while the gluten free toast was just right.  So why 3 stars? Well maybe that morning I did not feel connected to the place, the coffee was a bit too watery and bitter for me.  So good and average is my assessment. Again it could suit you just right and by the number of people coming and waiting, the place is well regarded by the local community.

Fz8WxM01ghiQrF9xtMQPtA.text: These guys/gals are serious eggsperts at what they do (sorry I couldn't help myself lol). In all seriousness the Egg & I know what they are doing when it comes to eggs and breakfast.   After 30 years of practice they clearly have a grasp on what it takes to run a well buttered breakfast machine.   The options available are almost endless with a lot of interesting dishes to choose from. The food was well proportioned and was an incredible value. Eggs of course were perfectly cooked and dishes seasoned well.   Staff is always happy and helpful which clearly indicates to me good management of the restaurant.   Overall it's an eggsellent place to go anytime your in the mood for breakfast or brunch!

IYIuIzLAuWdJS-t0e7Mihw.text: Egg & I is a wonderful brunch restaurant with great service and an extensive menu. It feels very family-owned here, and the egg logo is just so cute. The restaurant is pretty large so it was great for our group of 10.  +BACON & SLICED AVOCADO OMELETTE: This is a gigantic portion, which makes sense because it's made with four large eggs. While the potatoes are really delicious, I opted to switch it out with cottage cheese (weird, I know). I just knew the potatoes would be way too heavy for me along with the bread, which comes pre-buttered! Tastes delicious with the various jams already at the table.   +BANANA MUFFIN: Check in so you get the free, super tasty muffin. It's delicious and moist. (Maybe not for people who don't like the banana flavors.)  The service here is incredibly friendly. With a group of 10, it can get kinda hectic and things can be forgotten, but that didn't seem to be the case. We also were easily able to ask for more muffins (because deliciousness). There's also this egg flipping signage to let the staff know if you need anything. We didn't put this to use and they checked in on us anyway.  All in all, Egg & I is such a great brunch place with delicious food in great quantities. Love the atmosphere!

a2XmKduzi8DDx_ndBsy0ow.text: Review - Egg & I  If I were looking for a reason to move to Las Vegas the Egg & I would be the reason.  Funny thing to say when speaking about a location that has something to offer for everyone and a few of the best dining experiences that money can buy.   The Egg & I is simply a great place to enjoy breakfast and that's because it is simple.  Everyone who knows me knows that I love breakfast and can almost always be found at my favorite breakfast place in Corona, CA every Saturday morning without fail.  The Egg & I is a place that locals visit and has a lot of regulars.  It's located in a small strip mall that is way off the strip.    The interior is what you would expect in a diner that intended for locals.  It's a large open space with lots of tables and country-ish decorations on the walls  The menu is consists of many different egg dishes, pancakes, waffles and some incredible looking skillets.  On my first visit I tried the Works Omelet, which as you would expect has a list of ingredients including bacon, sausage, ham, onions, tomatoes, green bell peppers, mushrooms, cheese and sour cream.  It is served with Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes and a choice of toast or a house made banana nut muffin.      The omelet was cooked to perfection.  It was served hot, light and fluffy. The cacophony of ingredients came together to form the perfect symphony of deliciousness.   My preference for breakfast potatoes is hash browns.  I love them!  The Habla Diablo potatoes were a treat and a nice departure from the hash brown rut I'd been in.  The high point of the meal was however was the banana nut muffin(s).   They serve one almost like an appetizer when sit down before you order.  You get a free one with a Yelp check in.   It told our waitress, Chance (awesome Las Vegas name) how much I liked them and she sent me home with a couple of extra.  Bless her!  I'm not a huge fan of bananas.  In fact I hate everything about them but the banana nut muffins here changed my mind.  It's worth a trip to Egg & I just for muffins.  To summarize, great food, fun local ambience, extremely friendly staff.  I'd repeat and repeat and repeat and repeat...

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of omelette

W57gC-z3FKZ5eX5w3lCktg.text: Found this place on yelp.  I have to say, it is totally worth it.  Our server Penny was super nice and attentive.  The food was really good and the portions size was perfect for the price.  Don't forget to try the banana muffin. I'm not a muffin person but OMG.  These a soooo good.  I am glad we found this spot and will continue to come back when we are in Vegas.

lXSzwBBH6xjSfhpsMSnIrg.text: First time here and it was great. It gets extremely packed but we (2) were seated within 15 minutes. Its in a shopping center off the strip.  Must try their muffin! Amazinggggg Will def  be back next time we are in town.

6BTiJYevYv62HorOn2eH7Q.text: I've been to this restaurant twice both times it was okay. It's very busy so we chose to sit outside even though it was freezing because we assumed if they gave their customers the option, they would have heating lamps; but no we had to get blankets from the car. I had the spinach Benedict it was super salty and the potatoes were even saltier and hard. The staff were nice and friendly but I don't think I will come back.

l67TdfpuXAGMOXcY771I4w.text: The best!! First timers and would definitely come back!! The service was great the food was delicious! We had waffles, pancakes, the works skillet and muffins!! Delicious

igJEfINfqqvisfdBWaFmdA.text: Visited Egg & I after buying a Groupon. The place gets busy and parking is minimal and not really efficient but the food was delicious. I ordered Works Veggie Benny with potatoes and it was so good! I didn't even get to the potatoes though. The staff was friendly as well. The only downside is the bathroom situation. There are only 2-3 stalls available and considering how packed this place gets, it's not adequate. I was 4th in line for the bathroom and was so close to using that Men's restroom. I ended up just waiting until I returned to my hotel room.

Tqem8mrVX0cSfe0CFviJVw.text: Perfection in every way. No, seriously.  We were seated quickly by a friendly hostess and greeted instantly by our waitress who was incredibly kind and checked on us often. I never needed to ask for any refills. SPEAKING OF WHICH, they give you a large container of coffee to help yourself. Amazing for beating that hangover. So is the food. Oh.... The food...  It's great and the menu is HUGE. I enjoyed a veggie omelet while my buddy had French toast stuffed with eggs and cheese. Told you you'd be beating that hangover. The home fries are top notch as well.  I love the table system of alerting the wait staff when you need something. There's a smily face at your table that you simply turn to the frowny side. What a good idea.  Needless to say, I loved it here. I now have a new breakfast spot for my Vegas weekends.

SbG9vq2kCaVwMylvwhGFeg.text: This location of EGG & I is always busy (as are its sister EGGWORKS locations) but this EGG & I is just 'homey' and we are always treated like family. The food is always filling and fantastic as is the service. Thank YOU!

vofIg7Bmqcsv_6iYZJjiFA.text: This place is awesome! I was referred by a friend and had to kill sometime before check-in. The staff is so friendly and the food is really good with great portions. I also like that they do have mimosa, although I wasn't expecting them to. I'd try the enchilada omelette - not a fan of eggs TOO much, but this was a gem of a dish. I'll be back next time I'm in Sin City.

MBpz6E0X9UcHCH1frsWivw.text: Ketogenic/Keto available here!! Visiting and wanted to stay keto while on vacation.  Ordered the bacon and avocado omelet! They also have an option to substitute the bread and potatoes! You can get protein (bacon, sausage, ham), cottage cheese or sliced tomatoes!  Super huge omelet!   Definitely recommend this place if you're tying to stay keto in Vegas!

Vss_dBVpH-WZ765lQ96bxg.text: The breakfast concoctions are inspired and the ingredients fresh but service keeps this from a 5-star experience

cw8SQqv1BJFcD7PW0tithg.text: Very good bfast spot delicious banana muffin but long wait times... friendly staff. Overall good spot

4v5ZgJLyYBXwQYIZrslXgg.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast spots when you are in Vegas. They offer regular menu and they also offer vegetarian options. Plus when you order coffee they bring you a whole pot for yourself what's not to love .  Here I have had the veggie scramble and I've also hide the carrot cake French toast which are amazing I highly recommend. Good coffee!  The service is great and when you check and you get a free banana muffin which is delicious.  Also if you have a group on check out their breakfast deals that they have saved a ton of money .

gfpbBag105JPMEYP4tYL4Q.text: After a mediocre breakfast at the hotel where I am staying, I decided to look up "best breakfast in Las Vegas".  This place showed up in my search results.  It had over 1,100 reviews and nearly a 5 star rating.  Obviously, I had to try it.  My companions were a bit skeptical upon arriving.  However, after my first visit, I was thoroughly impressed.  The waitress and staff were very attentive.  And the food?  It was incredible!  I got the Bacon and Sliced Avocado omelet with fruit, one companion got the Crazy Chicken omelet and another got the Sunrise Mountain.  The amount of avocado in our omelets was awesome.  My one companion complained to me that it was too much avocado, but she's nuts.  There is no such thing as too much avocado.  And my other companion, loved, loved, loved the Sunrise Mountain so much that he got it the 2nd morning were went.  Yes, that's right, we went 2 mornings in a row.  My 2nd morning, I got the Chili Rellenos omelet (which was more amazing than the bacon one [I know!]), and my other companion got the Seasoned Center Cut NY Steak.  And again, it was incredible!  And the staff again exceeded our expectations.  The manager (sorry, I cant remember her name, but she's curly haired, blonde and very beautiful...hey, I was enthralled with food in front of me, but she's amazing! EDIT: her name is Abby...yes, I did go back this morning) brought out the steak and asked my companion to cut into it to see if was to her doneness preference because other steaks were coming out a little rarer than preferred.  Upon doing so, and finding it was in fact a little too rare, it was gladly taken back and finished to perfection.    All this to say that I am preparing myself to go the gym to work up a monster appetite so that we can go this morning for the third day in a row and enjoy another EGGMAZING (sorry, couldn't help myself) breakfast! God, I wish this place was in NJ.  FYI, I took a menu with their knowledge and explained to them that I am going try and replicate for my own personal satisfaction.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TulvrjBpY73PwExDzG_6mg.text: Man do the locals know about this spot and for good reason too. Thankfully they have a lot of seating inside and out. We ended up outside with the misters which was ok but still hot. The wait wasn't horrible despite it looking terrible. Our server was amazing. We mentioned it was our first time and she gave us a round of muffins, thank you!!! They were so moist and delicious! I also ordered a breakfast burrito which was gigantic and tasty. The potatoes it came with were ok and seasoned well. Definitely you get the most bang for your buck here.

ZnstT8S2eKw3vsbjNWk8QA.text: That giant jug of freshly squeezed orange juice is totally the way to go! The spam personally was too thick for me it needed to be cut in half and cooked a little crispier however I was still happy because NO WHERE has spam for breakfast! The food was really good! Deff worth going to!!! I love hole in the walls and I loved it more that it wasn't on the strip and the customer service was amazing. Our server killed it!

nxHpKB0hlpoOwz_Qau_ZUQ.text: Service was egg-cellent. Sorry, couldn't resist. I ordered the house specialty: corned beef hash. Got wheat toast instead of their special banana nut muffin because I got a free muffin for checking in! That muffin was warmed and was moist & delicious. Corned beef hash came in a ceramic skillet with 2 fried eggs on top. Tasty meal, but a little in the pricey side; around $11 for the dish. However, I would definitely come back because their food quality was good and the service was egg-cellent. Shit, did it again.

0deVbahR1UU8ZZ6H6cdX3g.text: We found the place on Yelp. Thank goodness we did. It was great. The portions were big and the staff was friendly. I ordered the Hawaiian French toast with strawberries and maple syrup. I also order a side of the honey bacon, eggs over hard and their signature potatoes. My husband order the prime rib benny. He inhaled it in 10 mins.   It does get quite busy so go early and prepare to wait. We went on Saturday morning around 10 am and it was a 20 min wait. So worth it though.

4vmAGpuo2Y5JaMCYo1MIUA.text: This place is delicious. Large portions and friendly staff.  We make it a point to come here every time we come to Vegas.  Karla is the best.

G5RkA2pocDQr5xP1r0saRg.text: With over 2,000 reviews and nearly 5 star rating, I'm not sure there's much more I could say that hasn't already been stated by others but I tell you what, this place is truly worthy of the raves and ratings.   Located about two miles passed Palace Station casino off Sahara Ave, The Egg & I is a wonderful breakfast/brunch place that is continuously packed. The service is quick, efficient and friendly. Our server Perry was right there ready to take our orders and food arrived shortly afterwards.   We had the prime rib benny, grandma's biscuits and gravy, corned beef hash and Island Favorite. Everything was delicious but I found the benny to be a bit salty for my preference....the banana nut muffin was sooo good and moist. I highly recommend this place and will be back here the next time I come to Vegas.

gdJaOmxMcdcKUALw-62kxw.text: Great experience with my family for a breakfast before a long trip to grandcanyon, prime rib Benny was the best, other food was great as well.  I would come again and recommend my friend to have breakfast here too!! Service was awesome

R-ayHOrD1NPbsLHYROhuBQ.text: Great food and delicious banana nut muffins! However the customer service was a little off. We tried to claim the free banana nut muffin when we checked in on yelp, but they did not honor the offer.  The cashier lady made up excuses and said since we ordered our food with muffin (which it should come with toast or muffin) we don't get an extra one with the check-in and that we should save the yelp check in for next time.  Checking in on yelp is one thing and ordering our food that come with an option of toast and muffin is another thing since that is part of the meal that I pay for.  The principle just make no sense. Minus 1 star for not honoring  the yelp Check-in. That could have completed our experience.

GNPrjLIgiGUWwC_ttqXUdw.text: Egg and I, is one of our favorite places for breakfast. My wife had The California scramble *****(Good portion size) I had Grandmas biscuit and gravy ****. Which is basically the Country Benny ***** with the eggs on the side and potatoes. Service ****

kpTEdv01WcTv_NitGGsUqQ.text: Don't know what they did to my food, it is delicious. Must visit when you are in L.V. Breeannda is the best.

6ytmnJTARJyPu85F49CqXw.text: Your typical greasy spoon, breakfast restaurant. Can't go too wrong with eggs, hashbrowns and toast. They're pancakes looked pretty good too.   If you want a touch of the old, midwestern Americana diner service - you'll get it here. Service was friendly and quick. Atmosphere was as you'd expect of a divey breakfast joint.   PS. Check-in on yelp and get a free banana muffin :)

Qphli1_byEVoe5yostA5ww.text: I've been coming to Egg & I for 3-4 years now. We come here for breakfast every year each time we come to Vegas. Now I can tell more about the dishes I've tried at this place. I even got a sweat shirt from here that I wear regularly to the gym in NY LOL. Cute shirt just like the logo. Hubby said that you need your ID to pay at the cashier (if you use your card). The service is one of the best in Vegas. They're fast without rushing you, courteous without over do it, polite and happy naturally. Never had one bad experience. Everything on the menu comes with eggs, what do you expect at "Egg & I"? They come with eggs but not with "U" of course, we don't eat people. The potato is amazing! I don't like potato but I like this type. It's diced-potato with tasty spice or could be just salt but very tasty. I don't eat much salt but I don't feel that it's salty, just tasty. I've tried different types of omelettes here and thought they're pretty big. Of all the omelette that I ordered so far, I liked Works Vege Omelette and Traditional Omelette. Not a big fan of Chili omelette. Last visit I had just the classic 2 Sunnyside up with toasted English muffin. Had something like this with multigrain before and fruit plate but this time I had it with cottage cheese. Hubby had eggs with potato but usually he would order it with bacon or ham too but I begged hubby to get something without meat for breakfast this time. Whatever you order here is great. I've tried many and highly recommended! Coffee is ok not so much on the "wow" side but they give you a pot for a table, so drink up your caffeine and then go play and win a jackpot!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mine!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hubby&#39;s breakfast. Didn&#39;t finish the potato but it&#39;s delicious!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smiley table

4vkQm_qLh6oP_qd0Ir2ipQ.text: Awesome place to come for breakfast! Love it! I would recommend to anyone looking for a good breakfast joint!

87YTuhPCJKZOCtdwBAtqSQ.text: Came here on my trip to Vegas because I was craving some eggs Benedict. This place was a little trip away from our hotel but defiantly worth it! Me and my boyfriend both got the eggs benny with home fries. Service was fast and food was delicious and cheap! Would defiantly come back on my next trip to Vegas!

YDnEUEebezvdX41lDebcIA.text: I come to this place every time I come to Vegas, no matter whom I'm with. They definitely have the traditional breakfast diner feel and the newspaper menus add to that feel. The waiters and waitresses are always friendly and conversationalists. The food is flavorful and you get a lot of it. I normally get the classic eggs (with cheddar jack cheese), bacon (it's crispy!), their country potatoes, and 9 grain toast. If I don't order that then I order their parfait. I know, parfait sounds lame but their parfait comes in a big old school milkshake glass with yogurt, granola, and a mix of fresh fruits. I actually couldn't even finish it last time.   This place is packed on the weekends and they do not take reservations.   They always have a deal a Groupon, it's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vodka grapefruit and vodka cran.

CvpmrMdjLuZR1mwGrs2U_Q.text: Hears unbelievable things so had to try it but was disappointed with my ham and cheese omelette. Potatoes were great though. I asked for egg whites and I didn't get egg whites. Place is kindve dirty also. Omelette had WAY too much cheese

b_WCh8FgKmG6eAGAQHxneg.text: YUM WOWEEEEE SO GOOD i love the banana nut muffin, i also was impressed with decor and friendliness of servers especially Leilani, she's the best!!!

_tVaugMB1P7TY2B-F5EEYA.text: Went here for the first time this morning. Not only was the food AMAZING, but our waitress Manuela was awesome! She was so attentive as to the point that we did not have to ask for anything! We love everything about this place. Will definitely be going back! #manuelarocks

mYnas0MeUNVqFImDrkUNqw.text: Venturing off the strip in Vegas this morning was the best decision we made all weekend. In a funky Sahara strip mall lies the Egg and I. Without our love and faith in Yelp, we never would have found this place.  Nearly every table was filled on a Monday morning. Our servers name was Debra and she was prompt, friendly and very knowledgable  about the menu items.   The menu is pretty extensive. They do just about anything you can imagine with an egg. I ordered the bacon and avo omelette and my husband had the chile relleno omelette. We ordered a side of Diabla sauce, which came warm and was the perfect compliment. Our omelettes were moist, perfectly cooked, and stuffed with fresh ingredients. The potatoes at Egg and I were nothing short of addictive. It took what little will power I had on our last morning in Vegas to push away from my plate.  We will come here for breakfast every time we are in Vegas now.

TVSOOdgB8LUWYaT1O5XI1g.text: Well ran operation!!! Our waitress Angel was very personable and fun.  the food came in quick and was delicious!!!!! And lots of it. You will definitely not leave here hungry. They have smiley and frown egg flash card faces at the table to express how your  feeling in the moment.

3qluIpUxxbKf6bpRodKy1w.text: I've been here several times and never leave disappointed. My current favorite is the chili relleno omelette. I always have leftovers. The server told me that I could get a half order on most of the omelette which was perfect for me.

93w0HJyMtUs3vmh_ShfF4w.text: Love love love this place way better than Denny's forsure!!! Breakfast all day oh man the best thing ever!!! Service was amazing as well her name was Holly !!! Very attentive and such a positive attitude also made me a skillet just how I wanted, special order  wait wasn't long what so ever and mind you we were here for the week of New Years ! Best breakfast hands down !

CG26xel6dxX2KTS9Gssg6g.text: First time here and I'd go back! Good food and prices are good too. I had the waffle Works. It includes a large waffle, bacon and eggs. Really good, And the wait staff are fast and friendly. We sat on the patio in 101 degree  weather but they do have misters which helps. If you do sit on the patio be prepared for all the birds that come looking for a snack.

VtpwyswT796X-2u8bIB9lw.text: Fun breakfast spot!!   I love how it's always quick and friendly reliable service.  Reasonable prices and a family go to!

SNcMTrVMqiya0E8uE4cNXg.text: Eggs Eggs an yes Eggs. My husband an I love this place an no matter which location you choose they are all  great. You know when you walk in as busy as they are the food has to be good. An of course it is. This is my go to place for the best traditional eggs Benedict ever. They always cook them just perfect an that's not always easy. There omelets are also very good. An I love the potatoes as the side. Crunchy on the outside an perfect on the inside. Hey also have a Yelp freebie for the banana nut muffin which is very good as well. You can always  use it later if you're not in the mood.   So go by an check them out.

npzxWpqFLfdhq1k4gwU5dw.text: On 3/11/19 I came to eat here with my family. I ordered the corned beef hash with over medium eggs. I got the WORST food poisoning. I'm talking about being violently ill and for THREE DAMN days. Constant vomiting, potty problems, headache from hell, blood in vomit and stool. Was I positive that it was the food from here? Yes. It was the only thing I ate that day. I will never come back here, nor will I seek out a solution- because what can they do really? BE CAREFUL and avoid this place

QIV95DsAh3WnebdBxyQZPQ.text: Awesome service; Food was delicious and very low priced; Lacey our waitress was amazing, she explained everything very thoroughly and her smile and friendliness was amazing !! I highly recommend The Egg and I worth every cent!!!

nAzMJhzkFUd2IqDmk9vIOw.text: good food, fast service.   Banana Muffin was warm and delicious. Arrive early to avoid wait time.

A7O7CcuMM5DW67GFvm4Gug.text: This little gem has off-the-strip prices with locals and tourist mingling.  We had such a great server, Kat or Katty. She was very kind and inviting and even suggested we get half portions, because the desert heat was killing my appetite. We got free warm, yummy and full-sized, banana nut muffins just because it was our first time there.   I got some veggie egg skillet. It was fresh and well-prepared.  My husband got a Mexican omelette and was very happy.  We'd go back. The bill was under $15 (we did half portions) and it was such a nice homey-diner. Full portions for an omelette equals 4 eggs! Crazy.

l_8t0Gg1hxgRia_F_uAO-w.text: Egg & I are the truth! The food on the strip is cool! But Egg & I are  definitely the the best food my wife and I ate as far as breakfast! The portion are big! The service was amazing. Don't even play a game just hop in that cab and go get some bomb ass food!

H82VCg63JWxzXqy-vXnJNg.text: You must get the Banana Nut Muffin. Paired with a cup of coffee is amazing! Portions are large so come with an appetite and prepare for a little wait to be seated.

y02SJYUplC-wnu175_orrg.text: Went to Las Vegas for a mom and daughter trip. Found this yummy restaurant on Yelp. My daughter and I both had the onion and bacon egg skillet.  The potatoes were both crispy and salty underneath a perfect combo of eggs, bacon, and onion. Each bite was perfect. It came with a choice of toast or muffin. I got the muffin and my daughter ordered toast so we could have both. The muffin was fluffy and soft. They served it warm so the butter became soft when it was spread on it.  One of the things I liked is that they left the carafe of coffee on the table so you can serve yourself and not have to wait for the wait staff to fill it again when it got empty. I would definitely come back if I visit again.  Some of the choices I was not brave enough to try like the mashed potato omelet.

smrMQP6xaDMAU7ArYJuQGw.text: We sat out on the patio! We thought it'll be to hot for us and our little one but they have misters which was perfect! It also is a dog friendly patio which is nice to know for next time. Lacey was our server and she was absolutely fabulous ! Me and my mans shared the stuffed French toast which was more then enough food! Our lil one had (with their check in) one free banana nut muffin side of avocado and some of our papas and she enjoyed everything as well! Wish their was a downtown location! Need more restaurants down there! Will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their food is more then enough to share!! We shared the stuffed Stuffed French Toast!

cLmUO564JTj7R6dFBo6DUA.text: While in Vegas for the college showcase, I Yelped brunch restaurants and had to give this place a try. We arrived and the line was out the door at 11:30am on a Saturday morning...granted it was St. Paddy's Day weekend, but I think it would have been just as long any other time.  We waited for a table for about 15 minutes. Not bad considering the line. Once seated, I checked into Egg & I, and I got a free Banana Nut Muffin. OMG!!!!!  THE BEST BANANA NUT MUFFIN EVER!  And that was just the beginning of our glorious dining experience.  Let's talk about Victoria. She's dynamite. You'll want her to be your bestie just as we all did.  She is so personable and friendly and funny and I could go on and on. She was so attentive, our glasses were never empty...even the Bloodies! She gave us her recommendations and we were NOT disappointed.   Between us, we had omelettes, stuffed french toast, waffle w/banana, coconut and toffee and a mexican skillet. As I said before, we were not disappointed.   If this place came to California, we would definitely make the trek wherever it lands. I HIGHLY recommend Egg and I...and their BANANA NUT MUFFIN!  Thank you Victoria for being our bestie even if it was only for 30 minutes!   We will be back!!!

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican skillet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flip to happy egg if you&#39;re please with service, flip to sad egg if you&#39;re unhappy with service.

vSN8jNtQLAquZ5n1kPKBHA.text: The wait time was very long, as there's a lot of people at this restaurant everytime  I've come here.  But the food is worth the wait. The banana nut muffin is so good, with a cup of coffee. We will be back the next time we visit. Wish we had a Egg & I in the Bay Area.

Fp5ezOmV_RIR4W-XXMdEzA.text: Amazing home cooked food! Great service! Tamara was our server. She was so happy and helpful with suggestions. She made our experience at Egg & I enjoyable and fun. Every staff member is so sweet and kind!!! This place is affordable and I highly recommend eating at Egg & I

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HT5W0sZlcWS-jpQbyYHf0g.text: Ordered spinach bennies: one egg over done the other almost raw.  The beef, tough, tasteless and only a couple of pieces.  We also ordered the stuffed French toast. French toast pre-cooked, not good to be honest. Service was very good though, at least two stars for that. Won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_Z7X7ZMeZVfKrO2XiAPR9g.text: Great food, big menu and great service- thank you Lacey!!!!  Will definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uA9TkC6r1zXn9ZHGDU86Eg.text: The food was awesome! Lacey was a great waitress and very attentive.  The Benny's are great. The Diablo Chipotle sauce was bomb!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5ti4DaG4d0GW8eAa2o_b1Q.text: What a great place!! My husband and I loved it so much we had to go back the next Day. The Chili omelette was out of control. The banana nut muffin was fresh and soft "like butter" :) Cici our waitress was Amazing, great with making suggestions. She made our visit a very pleasant. This will definitely be our new spot every time we visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D8Db2AWFWvPxWXOkuAC8yw.text: Huge portion with decent price & quick service! Servers look crazy busy, but they were all laughing and trying to accommodate our needs. Definitely recommend if you're in the area

GnBzCGP_DllbN6Icw8lbWw.text: Good breakfast place but not unlike most places you get eggs and coffee.  Food was good and came out very quickly, I didn't particularly care for the side of potato hash that come with the meal. The staff is attentive but not overbearing seeing as how they are so busy and they have a little egg dude on the table that frowns when you flip him over so you can get service ASAP. A solid 3 stars.

S-ooreI08MVlLQM1ByCz8A.text: Very friendly staff and delicious meals. The only problem is that is high on fat and you have to wait 15-20 mins to start eating. The banana nut muffin is overrated. If you check in with foursquare you can get the muffin for free.

H_SMHCTgVo9KRrWmWGh11w.text: We visited this location for breakfast during our vacation and totally enjoyed the experience.  The food was delicious and our server, Maria, was polite, friendly and definitely made the stop worth it!!  Customer service is a definite plus!!!

ejTWM8Th9IAQ3YmhJ5OvhQ.text: Chicken Skillet ( where is my chicken??) hey seasoning is really good

_x92ebb_mf88ljEwVQ9iPw.text: Totally worth the journey off the Strip.  If I lived in LV I would come here whenever I wanted a good breakfast out.  Big varied menu, friendly service, great food, kid-welcoming, clean, and clearly very highly rated year after year as all the framed Zagat reviews on the front wall testify.  Great experience.

ug7jjMd2CfkBpi7redHoxw.text: This place is good as long as you come at the right time. Too late, and you're doomed to wait a long time for a table on a Saturday or Sunday morning. Timing is key. The food is good and so is the service. We never walk in the door without a coupon. You can find them pretty much in any newspaper, city guide or Entertainment book, so be prepared.

_hu2gqKG4y7e7Vul2oYxBw.text: Huge portions, plates are enough for two. Definitely get the banana muffin as a side (comes with most entrees). Great coffee, very friendly staff. And yes, the ranch potatoes are awesome, don't substitute it with fries no matter what your kids say.

KYK4ubNRtcnmSIT8Y-aP_g.text: We walked right in on a monday morning for breakfast and the food came quickly!  The potato's were amazing!  Highly recommend hitting them for a very satisfying breakfast!

VhEvM7CxxhWfSCXN0gXXzQ.text: I have gone here for breakfast numerous times when I am in LV.  They have a large menu, service is quick and I have always had good food.  The only negative is that their coffee is low grade, just barely drinkable.  Its certainly worth the 10 minute drive for better food and lower prices than what you can find on the Strip.

2zUOhbmGeweCpBWpTPYvBw.text: Stopped in here on the drive to the Vegas strip with my boyfriend.  We were starving and needed some breakfast.  Not too much to say, since I've only been there once and am not from around there, but it definitely wasn't a mistake. Good eggs!

PsAUgG_NLfDdMpt-wj021Q.text: This place gets really crowded, but it was well worth the wait.  I came here on a Sunday morning for breakfast before leaving Vegas.  I ordered the eggs Benedict, which was very delicious.  I loved the Cajun home fries that it came with.  Everything was very tasty.  My bf had the muffins and gravy which he loved.  I would definitely come back the next time I'm in town.

ijiGrMsoiFRZmmrULRu2MA.text: I went here solely based on the good reviews and I was not disappointed. Servings are hearty and the food is very fresh. There are not a lot of fatty oils used so even if you pig out you won't feel to weighed down. The muffin that is served before your meal arrives is absolutely amazing. The coffee is pretty plain and is really the only thing that could have been better. With that being said, it was a diner so the coffee was on par for what I expected. The service was really good. I like that there is a sign that you can flip up for when you need service. It's nice not to be bothered every couple of minutes. Look for the waitresses wearing a button on their uniform declaring that the owner was right! (sorry, I forgot his name) As the story goes, when a server leaves egg and I to go work somewhere else he tells them they will be back. When they come back they have to wear the button! Lol

SD7z13K-Ce3g1rXMbJNCIQ.text: Food was terrific! We went twice. Double check that they have your order correct. They had our mixed up both times.  Staff is friendly and welcoming.

Ahe0uiDBdKtaxaHSpSG7Kw.text: Horrible experience. Bacon...cold and old.  Pancakes dense and hard.  Potatoes deep fried and extremely salty. Please go somewhere else. Their food is NOT good.

u5wdtxD4tZ39p3PokqEtZg.text: This was my 1st time here with my bf. I loved the Eggs Benedict Florentine with regular bacon not Canadian bacon. The potatoes were good. The little fruit on the side was bitter and I don't think they cared about the fruit. They just wanted to display it so it looked nice. My boyfriend got a crepe, it was good but my dish was better. The waiter Stacy, forgot my boyfriends English muffin so she gave us 3 free banana nut muffins to go. They were warm and moist and a little crunchy on the side. Even after 2 days the muffins were still very moist! This is a great place to eat breakfast and you must try their banana nut muffin! YUM-my!

k1gmwIpiLHFh7ZUetVyaBg.text: Don't miss this place if you like eggs. Super friendly staff. Great for breakfasts. 10 mins drive from the "strip"

xbJ5l9vwrzIp3nmgB9B_iA.text: Very cost effective, lighting fast service but never once felt rushed. There was a wide variety for the selection of food and everything that came to our table was cooked perfectly. The Egg and I manages to feel like a neighborhood diner and your family's house all at the same time. No better place in town for breakfast for both taste and value.

Z3Sr-Zg6MvgRXJBNfA_fSA.text: Visited this place the last time in Vegas.  I have to say I'd recommend it. It's in a little strip mall way off the strip, but worth the drive. Everything tasted great and the service was really good.

X4hWPzlKKJlpAHTgEidKog.text: I was looking for a great place to have breakfast in Vegas and this place was one that came up. I am so glad I went here, the food was great with much larger portions than what I am used to for breakfast and the service was pretty good as well. I definitely will be back on my next trip.

Wh67tGSAuNuN2RAMYFYfUA.text: Fantastic local breakfast spot. Locally-owned. Great food. Ample portions. Its sister restaurant, Egg Works is also a great breakfast spot.

fWe0kE49Qjz6ioD0NWj95A.text: Came for breakfast and ordered some french toast sand which and it was bomb as hell. Kelli B ook care of us and she did an awesome job

Mw2URpTo5Y_6tXXvI-sJlA.text: The service and the food are exceptional. The staff is friendly and attentive. Obviously family owned with a flare for customer service.

wof3FkyfWD4e5xbMOcKX-w.text: This is the best place for breakfast and lunch in Las Vegas. The food is exceptional and the service is attentive. Today we were greeted by a warm sweet server, Tamara. She was efficient,  thoughtful and someone you could joke and converse with ease. She immediately made me feel comfortable! I ordered the spinach eggs benedict and added avacado. It was amazing, the ingredients are always fresh and everything  is made to order but wait time is very quick. Thanks Tamara and see you next time. Thank you for such a delectable experience today!!!

zqwsAC7PPIPwcl_pY4Dzfg.text: This place was wonderful! The omelettes are tasty and the French toast is made with Hawaiian bread, which makes for a really cool flavor. The mimosas and bloody Marys are AMAZING!!! This place is well-known for its hot sauce and it's bloody marys!   The service was great (although one of the waitresses didn't seem to know if they offered drinks or not... a glance at the menu reveals that they do).   It's definitely worth a visit for breakfast/brunch!

afsWBgtlCvMa1CELqHAXQw.text: Excellent food and service! Went for brunch Sunday morning and were seated in under 15 minutes. The banana nut muffins were delicious as were the omelettes. Highly recommend!

EuA_96SGByg6Lf49oInb4A.text: What a great spot for breakfast! We come here with our family and always enjoy it. Only complaint would be the wait when it's busy, but that's just because it's that good. I'm a big fan of the open face croissant and bottomless coffee.

kj3m2sLHGkOU4awVJxOChA.text: Food and service was great.  The area outside could use a scrub since we had to wait outside.

C7hY8SQPqk4RN2RezrbVPg.text: Super delicious and an abundance of food is served. Great for groups! And don't forget to ask for banana nut muffins, you will not regret it!

zrAcoBqt0zj52pc4OIrRpQ.text: Their banana nut bread is definitely good. I got the chipotle Benedict. It was tasty...but I would prefer another style next time. I like chipotle sauce but for me, I'm not big on in for Benedicts. Still, I recommend this place if you can.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ygpxV3M-xuC-6HZN0FL6yA.text: A classic breakfast and brunch place. Pretty much a local spot. I enjoyed this place very much. This was my first time here and because of that I got a very fresh banana walnut muffin. It is their very famous and tasty treat. If you check in w/ Yelp you can also get the muffin.   FOOD:  1. *Waffle Works Waffle w/ side of two eggs any style and any meat (i.e. ham, bacon, sausage)  2. Fiesta Skillet Eggs any style with cheddar and jack cheese and a side home-fries  3. Veggie Skillet Eggs any style with cheddar and jack cheese with spinach and green peppers  4. Pancakes Choose a type of batter (i.e. buttermilk, whole wheat, homemade) and amount of pancakes (2-3) and flavor (i.e. plain, blueberry, chocolate chip)  Overall all the food was great. Except the home-fries were a little salty with a little heat. Also, the portions can be pretty large, so you can definitely share. But either way good brunch place to come with family. Definitely give it a go.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The veggie skillet with home-fries and side of toast.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fiesta skillet with home-fries and side of toast.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh stack of pancakes.

1NJOwVXq6cu-Pv_cFMkZBw.text: Absolutely delicious. We came from out of town and were pleasantly surprised to happen upon this perfect brunch place. I got something out of my wheelhouse and was not disappointed! Friendly staff and great, speedy service. Good for the wallet, too!

WwDTN0UnUYzgz0zwYpsMOg.text: Not a bad place. The service was friendly and quick. The food was pretty good as well. Be careful sitting out side though, the pigeons might get you!

2KcrVQnQMs740QVlIm4uCA.text: We arrived in Las Vegas very early and couldn't check into our hotel until 3 pm. I asked my husband to find a local breakfast joint and he immediately found Egg & I. I didn't think it was going to be good but boy was i wrong!  It's located off the strip and driving past it i honestly would not have given it a second look. We saw the reviews and they were good.   The place had a nice crowd. We were greeted and seated immediately.  Our waitress Tamara (who was helpful and awesome) suggested the Bandito Scramble. It had pepper jack, cheddar, sour cream, chorizo, jalapenos and of course eggs. It came with a spicy sauce on the side and breakfast potatoes. Oh my goodness, it was wonderful. Oh and it also came with an AMAZING banana nut muffin...pure perfection!  Another thing I liked on the menu that I didn't try was they had Cincinnati chili. I'm from Cincinnati and everybody knows chili is our thing. I'll be back before I leave to try it and get another banana nut muffin.  My husband did great finding this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bandito Scramble
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Made me miss home!

DWJmm-MAQhw5WvK-8rVWwg.text: What an amazing breakfast joint! They were all so friendly and helpful. They also made sure everything was prepared keeping my nut allergy contained. The waffles were amazing - the whipped cream was so smooth and creamy and the strawberries were fresh and delicious. The patio area was so nice to sit at!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing waffle with strawberries and whip cream!

Q-Rb-ezqstN_lrB6MvuO8A.text: It's worth the wait you will likely encounter.  Very popular spot but the service was excellent and finely tuned.  Food was delicious and the menu was full of options for all types of eaters.

1nS6YPRfn7BgscJOOX_05w.text: The Egg &I I is a must for every trip to Vegas. It's away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, but easy to find. The location is also convenient to the airport if you need to catch a flight. It has a hometown feel and you feel like a local the moment you step inside the door. The menu is huge and there is something for everyone. The portions are huge and hard to finish, a great deal for their reasonable prices. Our favorite is the enchilada omelet. I've never had anything like it anywhere else. As soon as you place your order, ask for the banana nut muffin- AMAZING!! It's huge and warm, with a swipe of butter it is absolutely heavenly. Everything is cooked fresh to order. We enjoy sitting at the bar so we can watch the staff hustle around. The service is always quick and friendly! We always carve out time for breakfast here when we visit and we crave these omelets between trips.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili omelet and the enchilada omelet

mGRxqpkuDQXuR9OBtjMD1g.text: Thanks to the online reservations on yelp, we was able to book a table before we got there. The wait wasn't too bad and the hostess who got us the seats was very friendly and nice. (She remembered my name, not very common). We ordered the veggie omelette and chicken omelette with spinach and feta cheese. The portions were very large and we were very FULL. The staff was very friendly and the ambience was great for breakfast. Will visit again when next in Vegas.  Banana bread was MUST try. Reminded me of a dessert from back home!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut Muffin

ABURmCrQWhvZZM4pj5lhCw.text: Truly enjoyed breakfast here. Perry our waiter was also nice and patient. We sat outside where they have sprinklers that kept everything cool.   Food: I ordered the stuffed French toast $10.50. This thing is fully loaded. It's French toast stuffed with scrambled eggs with cheese and I chose, turkey sausage. However you can choose any of these, ham, bacon or sausage. It also comes with a side of potatoes squares. They have large portions and vast selection of items on the menu. Almost everything has some kind of egg.   Drinks: started off with some hot tea, then had a corona :-)   Definitely try their signature Habla Diablo verde sauce with your food. Not too spicy, trust me.   There's parking right out front and this place is off the strip.   Their prices are very decent. Also make sure to check in to get your free muffin.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French toast $10.50
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enchilada omelette $11.50
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin

hNwmokFNlo74FVVgs9aZng.text: Love love love this place. Please get out of the strip and enjoy this awesome breakfast place!

2O9p1kBCqNfN2VIeEwZ9Qw.text: Last day in Vegas and decided to eat here for brunch. Wait was 15-20 minites to get seated for a group of 5. Food took a while to come too but it's understandable since they were busy.  Our server Oscar, was awesome though. He was very attentive and seemed like a chill dude. When they forgot to bring out my friends muffin that was included in his meal, Oscar apologized and brought out a plate full of muffins so that we could all try :) really appreciated it !  Food was also pretty good and satisfyingly filling.  I got the rib eye Benedict and it was pretty good. Also came with a side of potatoes that were seasoned real well. Great brunch place to eat in Vegas !

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye Benedict

XpVfLCGH67041M-K5RPLCw.text: Went there today for breakfast. I had the chile relleno omelette and James had the eggs Benedict. We were greeted in a timely manner by the busser who took our beverage orders. Waitress came by a few minutes later and took our order. Food came out pretty quick and you could tell it was picked up and delivered to our table right away. It was an awesome breakfast! The chocolate banana muffin was great with my coffee.

PgvBLYy1ltDWcZFSiqYgxA.text: I've only been here for breakfast/brunch and lunch, but it was an "egg"cellent experience every time. Big portions, really friendly service, casual homey atmosphere. They did a great job accommodating our large group (we called ahead to warn them we were on the way). It's a nice spot to get away from The Strip and have some comfort food. eggandi.com

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mo0jw8WijMZvTWYODHNBuA.text: Real good stuff.  Eggs benedict was super tasty, their hollandaise sauce is amazing whatever it is.  Ask for extra bread or english muffin so you can mop up the extra sauce.    Home potatoes are delish.  Not far from strip, great place for a bunch of guys.  Traveler friendly.  Watch what time you come in, can be busy if you show up too late.

qn_TutlLXIr_BiquwiUQ2A.text: This place reminds me of Hash house a go go, but a smaller size. The place is really pack when we went, and it seems to be pack most of the time. I got the Flapper and my friend got one of the omelet with spinach, chicken, feta cheese, tomato, and bacon. Both were alright, except I think the omelet was a bit salty probably from the feta cheese. It's a good breakfast place I think. Their banana nut miffin is pretty good. I think it's the best banana nut muffin I ever had because it's sweet - maybe honey and brown sugar and soft and moist and warm when we got it, but also a bit oily. Taste like cake.

_9pYT0JWb4oApP4EuKnauA.text: Wow! It's great to get off the strip to eat at places like this! The portions are just right and they taste Amazing! Get anything with their sausage gravy and you will not be disappointed!!

EP_y49ASl5Zj2N8okEWZeg.text: This was the second time eating here when I'm in town.   I'm usually in Vegas for work once a year and this spot is on my way to the convention center.  Service is always nice and friendly without being overbearing.  I ordered the Blackened Prime Rib eggs Benedict with the home fries.  The eggs were poached perfectly and the Prime Rib was flavorful.  I love Hollandaise sauce, and while this is not the best out there, it was pretty decent.  The home fries were a little bland, but I do like the touch of adding some red bell peppers and spinach along with the prime rib.  It adds a nice bit of sweetness to the dish.  I'm sure I will be back again next year.

YEEkhY42OBr9T66qxxg0Fw.text: There's one thing I like in a restaurant, and that is..... I get exactly what I ordered and the way I ordered it.  The pancake's were still warm up to the last bite, how rare is that.   The staff was friendly and it's off the Vegas strip.......  If you're looking for a good, no frills breakfast spot.  This would be it.....

igPCZOgYJN4Ugwu0h8nvFA.text: Had a great experience here considering it was noon on a Sunday in a place that serves hangover food.  We were seated right away, service was attentive and friendly, and prices were decent. The menu is vast, with all the traditional breakfast options as well as some unique ones like the "crepelette" an omelet/crepe hybrid. They offer dozens of lunch items too.  I had the "Flapper" breakfast platter ($8.95) which consists of 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, and 2 sausage (your choice of pork or turkey). The eggs were perfectly cooked (I like 'em over easy). Any place that offers a turkey sausage option is awesome for me as a non pork-eater. The real star of the plate was the pancakes. They were perfection! I am usually more of a french toast/waffle person so this was a gamble for me. The pancakes were piping hot, spongy yet fluffy in texture, and really flavorful! Served with a side of hot maple syrup too.  I would highly recommend Egg & I to anyone looking to get away from the Strip for an inexpensive and tasty breakfast.

XQw1AEJh8RZ-fko4QYsdqg.text: OMG!!!!!! This place is the by far the best breakfast I've ever had!!!! Tourists don't waste your time going to expensive breakfast buffets or high end restaurants when visiting Vegas. This place will fill your stomach and pleasure your taste buds. It's INSANE!!!!! We had the chile relleno omelette and holy ****, I felt like I was having a party in my mouth! I've never had anything like it! And the potatoes and homemade banana muffin seriously! Our server Alexa gave us the best service. She was very nice and attentive. Even the bus boy Jesus was on it. He came by at least 3 times to make sure that we were ok. I noticed he went around to a lot of the tables since the restaurant was so busy. Alexa and Jesus should tag team most of the tables. This place would be even busier! Loved this this place! Please open up in Southern California! God knows we could use some good breakfast! PS You can send Alexa and Jesus to open it up

7uytI6LhtkNHBNXUQPxvDQ.text: My friends and I wanted to have brunch some place that wasn't a buffet so we found Egg & I off Yelp and decided to come try it.  I have never been more in love with Yelp.    Their banana nut muffin is SO good and I never eat muffins because I don't like them.  It is so moist and you can taste the freshness.  Everything here is good.  If you like spicy food, add some Cholula sauce on it to complete your meal :D  Their hash browns are delicious.  The spices used to make it come together so well.  Anything you get here will be a party in your mouth.  Although it's off the Strip, it's definitely worth a try.

bOgZUi5_iBw94sbOwF2iKw.text: We Ate at Egg and I.  I had the fiesta scramble and changed the eggs to over medium and added sausage. They took my adjustments in stride.  Ashley was our server.  Great service and yummy breakfast.

DwZ99OtO9HCJh73nCO8L8w.text: It was good very basic food not every one was a fan like I was, but they ordered Mexican breakfast at an American breakfast spot. I had the Omelet with sausage and orange juice. All was good but the Banana Muffin was oh so nice.

J8Ha9AH9PHX1Avd3zRgBBg.text: Looking for breakfast outside the strip! Look no more. This place has it all. Most importantly than the food, COFFEE is really good too. Don't get overwhelm by the the line of people waiting, it go by fast and in the meantime you can read their newspaper menu. It has variety of assortments! We loved their banana nut muffin. Enjoy!

iK5P5ZHOj7U5aqdIEhUW0A.text: This will be your little secret breakfast restaurant. It's amazing. Try the steak and eggs. If you get a waffle get it with whipped cream and fruit

lJ1YsMKSTJFb5UHvCT0Dkg.text: Never fails... I walk in and am greeted with smiles. I ask for my fav server CHANCE! She is truly an asset! She giggles because I know its a huge menu but the skillets are to die for and she knows what i want every time. What a great memory! Thanks girl!1

rTAhfrsng8ffoFOfUEPgyw.text: I was here on Sunday 2/12/12. OMG let me say I'm so glad I got the blackened prime rib benedict. Rich, oh yeah, but I've never seen an offering like this on any type of breakfast menu. Who cares about the seating being a little bit tight (there was plenty of seating outdoors BTW) when the food is so good. It's a vacation after all :)    large portions, so worth the $. Wish I had at least tasted my niece Amaya's muffin, as I also heard other customer's rave's as I was exiting. Definite return next trip!

k66ZVjnMuIyXR1GM6yK5YQ.text: When they have a 30 minute wait at 9am on a Thursday, they must be doing something right.  I got one of the skillets with chorizo.  I honestly don't remember which one because I was in a food coma when I left.  I will for sure get comatose there again soon I hope.

7WqsZYaflXfaa5Xt2KfZ-A.text: To start off, this place has been on my list of stuff to try for a couple of months solely based on the name.. and after reading through the rave yelp reviews my expectations for the quality of food slowly started to grow.   I planned to head back to socal early this morning and wanted to be the first one in the restaurant. I arrived at around 5:45 am and fidgeted in my rental car while checking the "closed sign." Suddenly another car pulled up next to me, the driver walked out and headed straight into the restaurant - the sign was magically on Open. Wtf...   The hostess/waitress was so friendly (and at the buttcrack of dawn thats pretty impressive) that I think this partly made me enjoy not only the food but much of the rest of my day.  The front lobby is decorated with articles and reviews AND pictures of eggs in action shots which I found pretty amusing (sometimes it doesnt take much) but the main eating area is pretty diner-y so I kind of zoned out till the food arrived. Ordered the fender bender egg crepe with avocado and sprouts and something else in it and it came out surrounded by a mountain of delicious seasoned potatoes and the softest, freshest muffin i've ever had. The egg crepe is in a league of its own compared with any kind of omelet you can get at IHOP or denny's or some drive by diner.   I sat there for a good half hour savoring the meal. At the end it was all gone - the muffin, potatoes, egg crepe and the bucket of coffee. For the amount of food I had, it was very very light and felt quite healthy. I didn't get hit by the food coma train on the way home which is a big plus.  As a heavy consumer of all things chicken, I recommend this place to everyone. Unless you don't have taste buds...then go to your local diner where your $4.99 omelet brings you to orgasm every sunday morning. If you have taste buds - go eat here. Pay a little extra. Its worth it. I would guess that this is the best "cheap" breakfast i've ever had.

xDkAGSUEvWCLRkwN4pOVpg.text: Visited on Wednesday and the kids liked it so much we went back on Friday. We were only visiting vegas and this is honestly such a good breakfast place I have been so many times to vegas with out kids and have never had a decent breakfast. I will definitely come back when we visit again (with or with out kids) the food was really good , I got an omlette and asked for avocado they are very generous on their portions. They were busy but the food and service was fast.our waitress Liza ( hope I got her name right) was such an awesome server! And she remembered us:) she is another reason I would come back when visiting vegas.

Mfezczwb1GaOOjOUrk3bRQ.text: Went here for breakfast with some friends after working all night. Nice family restaurant, and the service was quick and friendly. It is off the strip but it's worth the trip.   Everyone's food looked great and I was happy to find out that the taste and quality were there. Some portions seemed big but most of them were good.   I got the waffle combo plate and the highly recommend banana nut muffin which was awesome! Already planning on going back.

F8ik5RDuGpxU-U0q5gI0Qw.text: Two straight days for brunch. Food was awesome, a nice and clean place to go. Please be ready for the wait time on weekends....But worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Eq-JzBZ1B0tv99tHZ2NZg.text: I know I already wrote a check in review so I'll keep this sweet and short! Come here for good food and great drinks! You'll love it like I do!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mzHq8d9Pzpe_0vm72TBcUQ.text: Every time I do a trip to Vegas this is the spot for a PERFECT BREAKFAST. When you check in on yelp you'll receive a complementary banana nut muffin. Which is the BEST MUFFFIN ever!!!! There is not an item on this menu that does not look good. And the waitress that helped us out was Karla. Really quick friendly and funny. Defiantly coming here every time I come to Vegas in the future.

JtQ4HubN4M8RRig60QsOVA.text: This place was hands down amazing. I had the Chicken Enchilada omelette and it was TO DIE FOR. My fiance had the country fried steak and he loved it. Great service and amazing food!

8rX2K3gOQr2L0ZghLEU01A.text: Love this place. The fruit plate with cottage cheese is an excellent dish. It's extra crowded on weekend morning's. They have great outdoor seating too.

6JeEEbViaUSvnrCh5Xad2w.text: Karla is great! I am not the biggest breakfast fan in the world so I don't know if my review can or should be trusted. Nothing blew me away but a clean, fun ambiance. Ordered the corn beef hash. I wouldn't recommend. Good luck with the rest :).

Obo9TR4c8WXBOzImqhihug.text: Been here with family last time. This is one of our go to breakfast places. Menu is diverse something for everyone. My whole family loved this place and would definitely go back!

jlRwjouAFaqLIwA401LS3g.text: Looking for a simple and amazing breakfast to brighten up your day?   This place is it.   Great food, huge breakfast selections, great service, and reasonable price.  The staff told us the wait to sit inside was approximately 30 min to 45 min, but our group could get a table now if we decided to sit outside. So we decided to sit outside on the patio and the weather wasn't too bad for a nice weekend breakfast.  Skillet breakfast - works (ham, bacon, sausage, mushrooms, onions, peppers, and tomatoes - $10.75 w/ banana nut muffin): One of the best banana nut muffin that you will find and very flavorful potatoes. The portion was enough to fill my tummy up!  It's egg-ceptionally good! And don't forget about the banana nut muffin!   P.S. - Once you are finished with the meal, you will have to pay at the register.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet breakfast - works (ham, bacon, sausage, mushrooms, onions, peppers, and tomatoes - $10.75 w/ banana nut muffin)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade banana nut muffin (part of the skillet breakfast)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t6uqOEFyF4Qp7TPtd9nC1Q.text: My wife loved this place!  She can't wait to travel back to Vegas to eat there again!  Food good, service good and the coffee was decent.

RcWGeYnlfn4c2UT4E1HKVg.text: We were looking for a good breakfast place away from the strip. We found it . They have the largest breakfast menu I have seen . Food was great service was prompt. We went on a holiday weekend , the wait was not bad. You can wait in your car if you like and they will text you when your table is ready.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My best meal my whole stay in Vegas

VuYvfanzsKEZBtQdw88LzQ.text: Got there and it was a good 30 minute wait before being seated. Ordered the chicken fried steak skillet with eggs. It was good but a tad much on the salt for me. If you like salt, you would love this dish. The egg on top did help balance it out. I don't care for the country potatoes and should have gotten the hash browns. Fresh squeezed OJ with pulp, very refreshing. Service was surprisingly prompt for a pack house inside. Water was filled when needed.   On to the muffin - it's a winner, simply the best muffin i ever had and surprisingly with no salt added. It was banana nut but you wouldn't know by looking at it.  However, you can taste it. They should consider opening a muffin shop and just sell these as it would be a big seller imho. A 3.5 overall experience but I am rounding it up because of the tasty muffin and would come back again just for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GdVRmBfdMQvL5e6boGbiqg.text: Our waitress Troyce was very attentive, and friendly. Thank you for your positive attitude during this busy Easter Sunday morning.  1st time at this restaurant, good was good. They were very busy but we were seated relatively quick. Will be back try more of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
