Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5_vjlq1TZPOdBLUp9gnRJQ.text: Good breakfast place for groups of 4. With fairly short waiting times and quick table turnover.   Service: 5 stars -this place cares about their service on the side of the table they have a happy and sad face that you can switch. If you are unhappy you can switch it to the sad face but if you look around tables are pretty satisfied.   Food: 4 stars- food is decent but nothing special. Wide selection of almost any breakfast dish you can think of. Most dishes come with your choice of eggs and potatoes. They have seasoned potatoes and hashbrowns.  This is a great spot to catch a quick bite with friends. Easy to break up checks since you bring it to the front cashier.

5a9XS6jF334tpYpeq6CBOg.text: The prime rib egg benny was amazing. I will be back for just that. My girl had the bacon and avocado omelet and she said it was on point. Our server was very nice and on top of everything without me even asking.

jnJrsklNMUF9jAidg-FDhA.text: The Egg & I has got to be the best breakfast dining experience I've had in Vegas. The place is busy because the food is excellent for a really good price and the service is very good.  Food: 1) Banana Nut Muffin was the best I've ever tried so far. You could tell they used a lot of butter because it was so soft and flavorful! 2) Benedict - The eggs were poached perfectly and the hollandaise sauce was amazing. Perfect execution of this dish. 3) Ranch potatoes were FANTASTIC. They were seasoned perfectly and not overly salty. They didn't have that heavy, thick potato texture. It was lightly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Service: The hostesses knew how to handle the influx of people waiting and the servers were friendly, helpful, and very efficient. We even got water refills without even having to ask.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A healthy Benedict
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili cheese omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This muffin was sooo good!

WDOL1CQ1RcL6gdy4rVnzAA.text: What a great place for anytime meal, but we came for breakfast...and make sure you yelp and check in you'll get a complimentary banana nut muffin....great start!  I chose the Ensenada Burrito which was a great meal in itself but wonderful mix of mild Mexican flavors!! Our service was fantastic!! When you're looking for a great dining experience, stop in the Egg and I!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ensenada Burrito!!! Great choice!!

7SaXyiQ4o2Ey2d_5bNBBsw.text: One of those rare gems you're thrilled to find. We now have our breakfast spot in Vegas forever! I had a Chile Relleno omelette that was one of the best dishes I've ever had. Fresh, loaded with cilantro and outstanding salsa. Service was fantastic - team members clearly like what they are doing and it shows. Bloody Mary was well done - celery, lime and even garlic stuffed olives. Would give this place 10 stars if it were possible.

5vh7E9UHpXwrRXqh4Xf5SQ.text: Leilani was our server. Best service I received in Las Vegas. Banana muffin very good with butter. Worth effort. Better than the $70 bacchanal buffet I had last night

TE6UV5KcQ2OB69AT7i2UmQ.text: Awesome place!! The staff were very friendly. But it was SO crowded & there was no room anywhere. The serving sizes are HUGE. I would definitely come again.

trkbqQmFxqX2hnLCB6AfZw.text: This food is absolutely amazing!!!! We had eaten multiple Benny's and they were all great. Ate a coney dog with their spin on it, it was okay. They had given us a 25-30 min wait for a party of 4 and we were called with in 10 minutes. The service here is top notch I will always visit eggs & I while I am in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dwSvuYCrE88NSWtqMUgkRw.text: Great service, great egg dishes. When you order coffee they give you a pot so you don't have to constantly ask for refills. This particular location has more locals so you know it's a decent place to grab breakfast.  Definitely worth a trip out for breakfast if you are an out of towner like I am, or if you are in the area. So many dishes to choose from, that's probably the most annoying part about this place!

Ua2Eu-EUD8fmYgK_2Qxitg.text: My favorite place for breakfast in Sin City. Our server Amanda is great! Very attentive to all our needs. According to the receipt, mentioning her name here increases her chances to win a trip and we hope this helps her out; she was that good. Will definitely be back as Egg and I will continue to be a Vegas tradition for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One happy egg, considering he and his kin are about to be eaten.

nN2R4PHD37xl2U_UAGNsNw.text: We had so much high expectations for this place after reading all the reviews on yelp. Wow...we were somewhat disappointed. Here's my review:  Food: 3 stars - I'm not saying their food was bad but they were not exceptionally great either. There wasn't anything special. It tasted to us like your typical breakfast at a restaurant. We had the pancakes, eggs, hash browns, eggs benedict, potatoes, etc.  Service: 5 stars - the server was great and took really good care of us.  Ambiance: 3 stars - average  Will I ever return? Most likely not.

A7AipxjyuvFBQQXsFGZq7w.text: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!! Not only was the food egg-cellent but the staff was amazing!!! When you have a waiter sent straight from Heaven, you just have to bless him with kind words. This soft spoken angel, Brady The Key Manager, was the best we've ever had ANYWHERE!! Everyone was extremely friendly and it was truly a breath of fresh air compared to many other restaurants. If you love eggs and sincerely good people definitely try this place out!!!!

gGBP4Xy0U_SwmnDwZNdpIg.text: After looking at reviews on here for another good breakfast spot, I choose The Egg and I. I was not disappointed, everything on the menu looked and sounded good!  I ended up getting a FRANCISCO'S SCRAMBLE and it was flavorful!  I will be back!

6DMYGZS20HekYCdikhipCA.text: Food was awesome as usual.   Had the cheese and sausage omelet,  son had the avocado cheese omelet.   Both excellent.   Breeannda took fantastic care of us with her huge smile.  Great meal.

lOzcfW_ce2MGCrFIPRmF8Q.text: Breeanda, is a wonderful and the most ever best waitress I ever seen and met in a long time here in Las Vegas. This was my first time in the egg and I and well I have to say, the service was so amazing that Disneyland should have an egg and I too! My and I ordered the Hoele Loco. Let me tell you something it was Delicious and Tropical and FULL OF AWESOMENESS! !!!! Felt like Hawaii came to my mouth and give it a big kiss!!!! The dish is $9.25 and hey you get eggs and a hamburger patty on top of rice and toast and a pineapple.... what kind of deal is that. .... great huh? Just a reminder the portion are HUGE!!!! So, come over with a BIG APPETITE to the EGG AND I! !!!! Take it from me,  you will not be disappointed!

-Az_Xx2dE2c9zvSXX6-d6A.text: I find myself reading another review about this place I didn't know that I've been to so many locations but if you haven't read my previous reviews then all I can say is go here because it is phenomenal 5 stars awesome service amazing food great price go to this place to do it now

KzuhVbQBi74Ln912UsYiWw.text: Large Servings for Reasonable Prices. It is no wonder it is nominated the number one spot for breakfast in Las Vegas. I ordered a fruit plate and got a platter of pineapple, cantaloupe, honeydew melon, clementines, blueberries, watermelon, grapefruit, & strawberries, it also included cottage cheese (or yogurt) a side of toast, unlimited coffee, & a small orange juice. This will be a must stop among many when out in Vegas!

MMAlb6NEDDsqkT46HPSihg.text: Got the stuffed french toast with the banana muffin and it was SO GOOD ashley was our server and she was the best waitress ive ever had IN MY LIFE

HjugDYoBe1KRPPFvVPD25A.text: I just had breakfast here. Outstanding service! Great food! Nice atmosphere. I will be coming back. Their banana nut bread was amazing.

_Ag9SxngLFz55UU2JwjIug.text: LOVE THE EGG & I!! it has been my go-to place for all of my vegas trips!! and this time me and my BF justin whom has never been here... went there on a monday morning...and it wasn't packed @ all...which is a first time for mee!! :) and we were seated immediately....and our server was ALEXA and she was such a doll!! she was very attentive and she even hooked me up with a sausage patty...cuz i usually get my waffle and meat and THEY USED to be able to give mee one piece of bacon and the sausage patty...but she said that they didn't do that anymore...but being the sweetheart that she is...she brought me one!! and my BF got the biscuits and gravy which he said was good but them potatoes tho!! i would absolutely love to just eat a big ol plate of those all day!! but yeah we will be back there...since it is definitely our vegas tradition!! :) soo thanx again alexa!! you were awesome!! :)

DBEEJmDC2WWBICeBrAHhmw.text: Amazing food at amazing prices, about $15 per person. Everything is homemade and delish. Service is just as amazing as the food, there's a wee wait to get a table but well worth it. Very clean, food is quite fast. They make fresh banana nut muffins daily that just melt in your mouth and you can even buy a loaf or two on the way out, yummy. I can't say enough great things about this place. I highly recommend that if your in Las Vegas you stop by and try The Egg & I.

g7Cz8BCUTb7DE5iyAWyLPg.text: I love this place !! Delicious food , and our server Tamara was exceptional! She was a sweetheart and We will definitely be coming here again next time we come to Vegas !

jsy-aBkGWl3f4n9B6XH_oQ.text: We discovered this gem of a restaurant and was pleasantly surprised.  The menu is amazing.  I had the eggs and chilli relleno which was amazing.   Erin our waitress was incredible and provided us the most friendly pleasant service.  All the way around the experience was awesome.  I can't wait to go back.

6zDcqlA-BAQp7ky_f-4lJw.text: The coffee is good, service is great,banana muffins are great, they add a ton of cheese to the top of the scrambles:/ and the house potatoes have too much seasoning on them but now I know and what to adjust. Overall experience was great.

CDE0JCpZGGmC0589ODSVWA.text: Superb, friendly service. Outstanding fresh food. Most breakfast places are ok...this is great. Leave your strip hotel and eat here. Prices are more than fair, portions are large. Biscuits and gravy were so yummy, fluffy ...omelette was drowning in wonderful cheese and veggies.

3E_N8gCqHqYiquQLDJMyPg.text: It was my first time having breakfast at the Eggs & I. I ordered a Brad's scramble which was super tasty! Curtis had been very nice and helpful to me. He was patient and helped a lot, thank you!

oCuSCURx9xqVvD-nr8MzUA.text: This place blows broken yolk out of the water.  You have to get the potatoes with your breakfast.  It's off the main drag but totally worth the short trip.....

tRQ9K9ConIK85P558ffwzg.text: Bad attitudes fair food too much comparison for poor employees thou I must say the chicken tortilla soup is good

Tsgn0YkVS882DaOXanCCvA.text: I got a skillet meal trying to get a taste for something different, I liked it but it wasn't really amazing as it looked in front of me. the flavors were mildly okay and the bread wasn't really toasted. I'll come back to try something else and hopefully give  a better review.

THonDNWOuc6kjrGFm0x7rQ.text: Great place for breakfast or lunch.  Variety of menu items.  I think it's a little pricey but the food is good.  Needs to be bigger, there is always a wait when I go.

kSDj5XFl30hMkZ-o8XGhQQ.text: Yes, being in Vegas you would think the best places to eat would be on the famous strip. However, I've found that the restaurants worth pilgrimaging to are actually on the outskirts of the strip! I can't help it, I like to eat like a local. Being a breakfast/brunch fanatic I figured I'd look to Yelp to find a breakfast spot with big portions that won't break the wallet! I found Egg & I as one of the best places to go to for brunch so I thought I'd give it a shot.   The ambiance has a small-town diner feel to it which I loved! The menu had way too many amazing options which made it difficult to decide what to eat. I chose to get the eggs benedict while the boyfriend had the country benny, both which were AMAZING! The portions were huge, the gravy is perfectly made, the banana nut muffin is to die for, and the staff is always friendly and pleasant. Now this is our "go to" brunch place to eat on Sundays before we make the long trek back to California. This place is a MUST!

Hv3UUrVaVX50uuIaBhfOvg.text: A decent,  not great, breakfast experience in a market  hurting for a good breakfast restaurant. Few truly healthy options here. Too busy for really good service. Prices are very good. Beware the at their sausage patties are rather flavorless,  pre-fab frozen breakfast sandwich patties.  I had the vegi-benny breakfast with their breakfast potatos, ie deep fried potato nuggets. The Benny was very good. Their cinnamon roll was very good. Not 5 stats for having to wait way too long for coffee and for few healthy options. A last note about all the televisions they have mounted on the walls. We enjoyed watching COPS while dining. Really guys?   The fact that this place has long waits on weekends goes to show that Las Vegas needs better because even this greasy spoon with a homecooked image gets slammed.

rGej8LwPCt6LZTj4pk0_2Q.text: We were originally getting a breakfast buffet at the Wynn and decided it was too pricey. Did a quick yelp search and Egg & I appeared.  To make the review short: the skillets were huge and nicely made. Prime rib benedict was on point. But the star? The warm muffin. Could just eat that for breakfast and nothing else.  Service is great too. Our server, Thay, took our group pictures voluntarily and filled our glasses and coffee mugs frequently. Awesome food and service makes for a great experience.   Casino buffets move aside. Come here for breakfast but leave a spot open for me.  5/5 would come again.

xwodM61Qd8SOc5zK2PAfIw.text: I just had the steak and eggs,  it was cooked perfectly. My server Earl was awesome,  very polite and friendly.

Xq_YhfPO9IGNe-sh2yLvsw.text: Liza was an amazing server and made the group feel at home. The food came out in good time considering the whole place was packed from front to back. The food was delicious and the portions were generous. Great experience overall. The works omlet was amazing and i highly recommend it.

ISMVuhbZk80Hl6a7OFVx7g.text: We tried Egg & I on a recent trip working in Vegas. It's hard to find good breakfasts, and the reviews here made me think we found the holy grail of breakfast spots! The reality: not so good.  I had a benedict. I asked for the eggs medium hard, and they came out essentially hardboiled (I am not holding that against them), but worse, the hollandaise was pretty awful. Sort of an off, slightly grainy texture, no lemon to cut the richness, just unappetizing. Potatoes seemed too regular, like processed frozen potatoes.   On the upside, I tried one of the banana nut muffins, and it was pretty good. The staff was wonderful--really nice, helpful, on point.   If only the food had lived up to them.....

0wu5mS3zP7EcvvsuNk3Edw.text: Absolutely love this place. It's a must stop pit stop whenever I come to Las Vegas.   The basic breakfast is great. Eggs any way you want them, fluffy pancakes, sausage /bacon is good. Nice homestyle potatoes. Amazing french toast. I'm sure they have waffles. Try the Country Fried Steak, do the muffin, not the toast and thank me later.

zEMNW9sDh81JsHXr1PW1VA.text: First time eating there I ate the prime rib poached eggs ssndwich.  Very different style of presentation.   Food was cold when receiving it.  Potatoes were nothing special.  But what was the kicker for me was their salsa.  Thank goodness I didn't dump it on food without tasting it first.  Tasted like vinegar.  They had table tent advertising to vote for best breakfast of Las Vegas.  No I couldn't do that at all.  Service was excellent.   That's only reason I'm giving 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib poached egg sandwich

lJLNXj95o4lM0XsrBQYSfw.text: I was introduced to this wonderful place a few years back by a family member and knew I had to come back next time I visit Vegas from LA. So on the way back home today we stopped by for breakfast. The place looked as I remembered and we were promptly greeted and seated by a very friendly hostess. The menus are quite charming as they look like your local newspaper and there are many delicious options. I ended up ordering Grandma's Biscuits & Gravy with scrambled eggs, home fries, sausage patties and a banana nut muffin. The muffin was soft and warm; slather some butter and it was great. I really enjoyed the gravy on the biscuits and the home fries, where are very well seasoned. The rest of my party got a ham and bacon omelette with home fries and a blueberry muffin, along with a chicken salad sandwich on rye bread with cranberries and walnuts. All three of us ended up eating half the plates so we have some food to go with us on the 4 1/2 hour trip back home.  Overall, great food, nice service and reasonable prices. Will definitely make a return trip next time I'm in town!

c4ta7T3SzVfGzGu9B6S13Q.text: Got to vegas frm san diego this is the first place we came to eat...the place is clean and easy to find..the menu was wonderful..a plus for me was that there was rice...the price were good and the portions were big...are waitress karla was wonderful and very nice started are day off positive....will tell othe

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CilFn6Pp5E80BKjoQbY-TA.text: First time here, amazingly fast service (we were in a rush, too), server Kelcey was awesome, highly recommend to everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thanks Kelcey!

8WTZhCIGq997AfpFz6-9kg.text: This place is da bomb! No accident it is the best breakfast in Las Vegas. This is the one location that does not have mimosas FYI. Had the Veggie Benny Works and it was beyond delicious. Huge chunks of avocado, grilled tomatoe, spinach and eggs done perfectly. Only improvement would be to have the English muffin more toasted. Coffee looked pretty watery but it tasted good. Service was excellent in spite of them being PACKED. Worth the 20 minute or so wait. A definite must visit next time we're here!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Benny Works

VVufK3SwSl3RW86n4Oj7cg.text: Great Food !!! Great service will come Back again. I would never order a banana nut muffin but this one was great a must try. Tamara was our server and she did and great job!!

1fdj5LwXRNnjaHLRqgAMVQ.text: Me and my dad have gotten the chili relleno omelet numerous times ! It is amazing ! I like to add avocado to mine!   They have several many locations in the Las Vegas valley - those are valued Egg Works. Egg and I appears to be the original in my eyes, being born and raised here as well .  Another omelet I like is the mashed potato omelet !   The other thing , they have red bull - sugar free ! That is awesome !

vfmzN51JycXHFlOL-Y7YXg.text: Love love love this place.  Came out to Vegas house hunting in July, this was the first breakfast I took my family to. Food, service, staff are EGGcelent! Get it? See what I did there?  was just there again yesterday and knew why I fell in love.

sxqxg5KM-880C-WR6Cdn7Q.text: Great French toast. Overall awesome experience the food was exceptional and the service is on point. Uli was our server and he made sure we were pleased.  btw nice booty Uli.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jean be all over those eggs.

lXHE0kWr8yPZ2vY9SJZhQA.text: Definitely a "go to" place for breakfast or lunch! Great food, reasonable prices and amazing staff.  Especially PATRICK, outstanding demeanor, customer interaction and service!!!!

UafKqHA1RFasDMDLsudfrg.text: The hype is REAL!!!!! Mushroom, cheese + avocado omelette- ahhhhhmazing!!!!! Huge portions backup the reasonable pricing. Once you go The Egg & I you'll never want to go anywhere else!

uz8N1zijDh3GR8v99LDvtw.text: Rude service - called ahead for reservation and was very rudely told when I came in there was no reservation available!!

4aM7J7sR0ABnhrFRESfugg.text: Found the review on yelp and was not disappointed! Very friendly staff and clean! Fast service even during rush hour and I will be coming back next Vegas trip!

SjNrwFJWvp7gum_ZU3YaDw.text: I would never recommend this place... food was horrible and cold... felt like slop in a plate..quality and taste is awful

nu_ZbBlTt5rAE_ZBUL3Jeg.text: Best breakfast I've had in vegas in a long time. The service was on point. Food came out fast and hot. I had the turkey everything skillet with bell pepper and onions. So happy I decided to stop in I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ieX9nn4iskgIptYBKCqpvw.text: Holy crap where do I start??? Tldr: if you're reading this, just go there as soon as you can.   We went on a Sunday morning, for a lazy brunch and that's exactly what it was.   The menu options are EXTENSIVE. Lots of sweet and savory options. We ordered the Brad's Scramble and Waffle with a banana nut muffin on the side. I'd read tons of reviews about the muffin so I wanted to know what the hype was all about.   And I was BLOWN AWAY. This is one of the yummiest, tastiest muffins I've had in my life. And this set the bar really, really high for me.   Then the waffle - with a nice layer of whipped cream and blueberries was perfect.   Scrambled eggs were great as well. The potatoes were really excellent! Cooked perfectly and coated with the Hablo Diabla spice, not too spicy - just right.   When we went to settle the check, there was a mixup and they charged us with someone else's bill. But they handled the situation well, and fixed the goof up very humbly.   The staff was always nice and sweet.   This is in stark comparison to the fancier places we dined over the weekend, where the staff was very curt and hostile at best.   Will definitely come back, just for those muffins awww man.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle with whipped cream and blueberries - just look at this deliciousness
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brad&#39;s Scramble with potatoes

__tLDel-o7SmtZ4akvLf7A.text: The waitstaff was very friendly and the server seem to be very efficient. The food was OK we had the chicken fried steak in the scramble. The potatoes were deep-fried which was a disappointment. The homemade muffin was a nice touch. For the amazing reviews I would've expected a higher quality food.

iDu0tWjw6ASOFKDpRb1w8g.text: A perfrct place for brunch and breakfast. I like their southwesten salad and the Sunshine mountain. The amount of food is more than enough.

hZvYyPVwxwBW9nljLzfMIg.text: This was a really cute brunch spot. I found it by the recommendations off Yelp. I drove by on the weekend, and boy was it packed, with even 10 or so people waiting out front!  I ordered the steak and eggs breakfast. The steak was good, and cooked just the temperature I ordered. The eggs tasted fresh. Breakfast also came with a banana nut muffin, which I actually enjoyed! It was moist and warm.  The potatoes were well spiced and served well with the rest of the breakfast.  Great service! I would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs

W7FqBAvZx1xpysLzfqc8ZA.text: I am not an egg person so I was happy to find items on the menu that did not have egg.  I have tried the pancakes in the past and was very happy with them.  This time I tried the Cincinnati chili which I didn't like much.  Nothing was wrong with the dish I just didn't like the flavor.  It is more of a meat sauce over spaghetti and not really chili.  The service was great and if your into eggs this is the place to be.

K53xmttJNEsmH3Lb-tv8WA.text: 5 stars for the amazing service from our server LINNEA! She defiantly deserves to win the trip to Disney!  1) Linnea went above and beyond when it came to serving. When we order she would ask additional questions like, would you like flavored creamers? And give additional recommendations towards the food choices.  2) Linnea would always check on us and see if we were doing good, always having a cheerful welcoming smile on her face and the way she talked made us feel very welcomed.  3) When there was a slight mistake, because my friend ordered steak and instead of eggs they wanted an omelet, which never happened before and Linnea brought out my stuff French toast and apologize for the confusion and mishap, that the steak was cooked inside the omelet and apologize for the confusion and wait... Which we didn't even wait long. About 3 minutes the steak and omelet was brought out immediately. Still apologizing... It didn't matter too much to us and for the fact that they were sincerely sorry. Wow what exceptional service.   4) I was going to stop at 3, but since Linnea went above, she not only brought us our check but a "sorry" gift of banana bread wrapped and gifted nicely. I was shocked to see such service!!!   THIS IS WHAT YOU CALL AMAZING SERVICE, someone who went above and does more than just servicing you! Thank you Linnea!!! We enjoyed our visit and defiantly will be coming back! I hope you will be in Disney by than!!! :D

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fIDo-LJv9s-gWklpAvS20A.text: Service, food, atmosphere. If you're in Vegas, venture a bit from the strip and don't miss this awesome place! You can thank me later.

KSGH9yfBt6otbPnT85VEKg.text: The hostess was rude as soon as we asked to sign our names.  Anyway, they take your phone number down so you're able to wait in your car with the AC on :D I got the country fried steak and my friend got the enchilada omelette, they were both pretty good. The banana nut muffin was delicious, and bigger than I expected.  Our server was so awesome! He was so nice and very attentive even though it was busy. I'm assuming his name is Curtis because that's what our receipt says.

uc-if03eXMy9UP7NihieYw.text: First time at Egg an I. We chose this based on Yelp ratings, I'm so glad we did!  The wait was about 20 minutes. Once we ordered, we waiting less than 10 minutes before our food. Our waitress, Carol Ann was attentive and personable, that's worth its weight in gold. Our breakfast was one of the best I've ever had.  If you're thinking about going here, go, don't hesitate!

F0nuLBeuY7Yhd4_rpqGJEg.text: This place was bomb! Eggs are my favorite so I'm a bit bias, but as honest as I can be the location was super busy and that seems to be a regular thing which is good and bad. Try looking this place up on google so it will give you the times it's not as busy. That's what I do! The French toast with bacon- apple butter is absolutely amazing and would Quench the sweetest of tooth's. My girlfriend got the house potatoes and sunny side up eggs with a side of bacon, the potatoes are great only the eggs are pretty average. I'd say the service is above average our server was nice and helped us decide on our dishes based on our personal preferences. Over all our experience was four stars and only because of how busy the location was, we were unable to enjoy our conversation and the food completely. Go here and find out for yourself!

8e6-MI_vQkZLX0sW1UcfsQ.text: The perfect local spot for a cozy friendly meal, bring the whole family. They've got plenty to keep the kids occupied. I loved it here and I'll definitely be back! The breakfast is AMAZING!

TJ5p7lFlXSioQhA4AqzTbw.text: The omelets and waffles are delicious!  The place was very full but we were sat down in less than 10 minutes. Our waitress came within the first 3 minutes. The food came out fast and very hot. Despite it being so busy this place was very welcoming and customer friendly. This will be my breakfast spot when I return to Vegas again.

C0MkxiLsttMec5j5zcVdIg.text: Came here from LA for the weekend, wanted a good breakfast,  I saw the high reviews, it has over 2k 4.5 stars, but honestly if your from LA and know about Norms Restaurant, it's basically the same thing.   The seasoning they put on their potatoes, it's really salty, out of the 6 of us sitting in the table, we all though they we're salty.   I got The Works Omelette,  it was decent, it had flavor, but not something over the top.   Orange juice was good,  hot chocolate was okay.  The one thing, that was really good was the Banana Nut Muffin. Other than that..this place was alright.  The service was good, our waitress Mariah, was really nice and friendly.   Overall,  my rating is based on the service and somewhat on the quality of food.

cl83wAsDL0yHOzKX5CVgtQ.text: Seriously one of thee best breakfast places around!! The omelettes are amazing!! Definitely will come here every time we come to Vegas!!

0--VCf3c2LSGJdqDQzPt8Q.text: The Egg & I  has been a True breakfast staple in the Las Vegas valley for years, I have never had a bad meal, the Veggie omelet is great the turkey sausage is very tasty and the coffee is always brewed fresh and is hot!  The BLT sandwich is the go to for lunch and most important is the people are nice.  We have always enjoyed our meals at the Egg & I.

FuZC13upRIL0Tfww3mYzpQ.text: For starters this place looks like the food is blah. With that being said we were greeted pleasantly by Stephanie there was a 10 min wait then we were introduced to Lacey. She was prompt and friendly and engaging. On to the Food...LARGE PORTION so go hungry or just share your food, the bloody Mary's are amazing and if a wonderful experience could not get any better Robin slid through to make sure everyone was on point and I was truly happy. Overall if you want to go somewhere where Customer Service is on point. The Food is delicious and you feel like a valued customer look no further than here. I will be back. My only regret is I don't over eat like I used to.

s-iWh-BcsZKeMpIZnLmilg.text: What can I say perfect eggs benedict phenomenal breakfast selection all around it's off the strip totally reasonably priced this place is a jem and every time I come back to Vegas I'll be there! Awesome service, fantastic food , great location. Go early or you might wait, so worth it though.

Uf4QLaMHspuj7ATGloBXQg.text: Found this place searching for a good brunch stop before leaving from Vegas.  Don't let the simple looking breakfasts fool you, these are down to earth home style cooked breakfasts.  There's a lot to choose from, making for more stops in the future.  My Gf got the standard and I the works skillet.  Definitely well done for the both.  I used the yelp check in to redeem a free banana nut muffin.  Omg, this was so good.  We went thru two, the one that came with the skillet and the free one with checkin.    Our server Linnea was very attentive, and even with a packed house it was just a short wait when we needed some service.    Very good place, will definitely have to make another visit when back in Vegas

cap8QSLjoX5CScivr3gfLA.text: The portions were large and filling and our waiter Raul was attentive and fun!  Definitely a nice spot for a local or someone who wanted to get away from the Strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh veggie skillet! So large and filling!

ptg4MMF-ZYuUKkU2qeZpLQ.text: About a 15 minute wait for a table on a Sunday, but it was well worth the wait!! The biscuit and gravy breakfast was delicious! The gravy was a tad salty, but still good. The biscuit was amazing! Fluffy, thick, and perfect. The potatoes seemed to come with just about any breakfast dish and they were great, crispy and they had a great seasoning on them. My husband had the Cincy chili. He said that was great as well. The service was exceptional, especially considering how busy they were! Definitely putting on my list of must visit places in Vegas!

BZUjtDIIayt16HLGgd_eBA.text: My wife took me there it was my first time and the food was fabulous! Even more Fabulous was our server. His name is Austin and if you go there to eat I highly recommend you asking for his section. He is polite, kind and very helpful. Quick and on point at his job. He recommended Biscuits and gravy and he was right delicious!!!

p0fa5BR1tWF2WBQArbgzFg.text: Love the egg white omelette from here! Everything is delicious and everyone is extremely nice!  Highly recommended!

L1Ylep8wW4U356JhOp8Jig.text: Beast breakfast place I have ever eaten at. I'm from out of town and we ended up doing here twice because the food is so good!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gH_Sm48GuwiyqINEuD7qYA.text: Banana nut muffin is moist with a great crust. They dont skimp on the canadian bacon when it comes to the eggs florentine benedict.  Hollandaise was on point; not too much salt and is not too creamy, complementing the egg yolk. Potatoes were seasoned perfectly, although they could have been crispier. Had a bite of the chili relleno, overriding flavor was the chili, which is a plus. Coffee left me wanting, but we were there for the eggs!  Great service, no wait to get in, overall great place to have breakfast off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict florentine
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili relleno omelete

GvgqIWPj3wYGoy4IamET1g.text: I'm super impressed with how delicious and well run this breakfast restaurant is. The service (my server was Stacie) was very fast and friendly and they have a funny colored egg sign on each table that you flip over and your server will come running to get what you want. I had the Classic 2 Eggs with Potatoes and Ham Steak and it was soooo tasty I was in awe as I was eating it. Each potato seemed to be individually seasoned!  Their coffee was also much tastier than what you'd expect and I would say its as good as the brews at The Coffee Bean and Starbucks. Well done Egg & I, you're exceptional!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The funny Egg Sign. Flip it to Yellow and your server comes running.

cS-T_VlIUZKYQGwx4C1YrA.text: Amazing food, superior service.  Get off the strip and give this place a try.  A great experience!!  I was in town for a conference and my husband was able to join me for a couple days.  We always try to get away from the tourist traps and try to eat at local establishments.  This one was definitely a win!    The food was plentiful - way too much to eat, but too good not to try.  The eggs were hot, cooked perfectly and served promptly.  The service staff was all very down to earth, stayed on top of every request, and smiled the whole time.    Everything we ate was wonderful and all the plates around us looked great too.  Can't order wrong here.

9b6ozvMXhXAsYkXaXeiB1w.text: who tf names a restaurant "Egg & I" just the name makes me want to not eat there.  It's like if you eat here, you become one with the eggs.

USp_othuBiLxLLwv-reNMw.text: i loved highly recommend. my favorite dish was the Chipotle benny my husband had it . the tradition benny was good but the ham was very blend. waited 30 mins but was worth the wait. or serve was amazing.  will most likely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5DOz2HUzPgr8SnXIap4wdA.text: This place is amazinggggg!  Patrick was our server and he was super! He remembered a drink that I requested with my meal. He made note of the small details.  He made sure he was always in the area to make sure we had everything we needed throughout our meal. He brought everything in a timely manner. He was very service oriented. He made our dining experience outstanding.  ...And the food is great too. The restaurant reminded me of a breakfast joint in Southern California. This place is way better! The food tasted SO good! The portions are enough. I checked in on Yelp and redeemed a voucher for a free banana nut muffin. It was moist and full of flavor.

KQ_tgPCSDascYWPcK-oV1A.text: Went here because of the great reviews, and was not disappointed. Long line out front, but surprisingly only waited 15 min for a table. Food was excellent. Lindsey our waitress was very friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back on my next trip!

MjURQdsqfNUf3jBe4GLtbg.text: The food was delicious! I had the original breakfast burrito! It came with a delicious side of home style potatoes which were seasoned perfectly and had a side of salsa, which also tasted amazing!  The other entree ordered at the table was the chicken enchilada omelette which was also delicious! So the food is a big part of dining out, but then there's service which we all know can make or break an experience ...  Amanda was incredible! She was polite, friendly, and fast without being pushy! She encouraged us to take our time and when we were not quite sure what to order she offered recommendations which we definitely took and did not regret! The cinnamon roll and banana muffin were also DELICIOUS!   An elderly impatient man sat himself behind us and after only a minute of being sat was incredibly rude and calling out for a waitress and coffee (despite not waiting to be sat by the hostesses). Amanda was calm and very polite when she greeted him which I can tell you, takes a lot when you aren't being treated with respect!   So with food and service being on point, I'd have to say this place is a hit and worth traveling off the strip for while in the area! I'll definitely be back and recommend it to friends! Thanks again staff and especially Amanda!

jeGbQMlDYX-qCsvI3XM8LQ.text: This place is so perfect! My family has been coming here for years, there is always excellent service, and superb food! Our waiter, Oscar, was very attentive. I highly recommend this restaurant.

AYdQw6E-tlYa61KMDby5Fg.text: Yelp guided us well! When we arrived, it felt like a breakfast place for the locals. They have plenty of choices. They have traditional American breakfast but we wanted to try something different (not pancakes, waffles or French toast). I had the Italian skillet and my husband had the Sundance omelet. It is a lot of food but we ate it all. I had no more room for my muffin so i took it to go. We loved the experience and would come back any day. This definitely a keeper in my book.

sztRX5FdHTEeQBv1A7hbpg.text: I love the Sad Egg and Happy Egg face decor at the tables for service needs. When you turned the Happy Egg over to the Sad Egg a waitress comes over to the table in seconds. They work as a team at Eggs & I which I appreciate being in the service industry.  The food is wonderful. Whenever I visit Vegas we always stop here for breakfast on the way in or on the way out. I have never ordered anything I didn't like. The Eggs Benedict is my favorite followed by the chili omelet. Don't forget about the breakfast potato's, the best I have ever had.  I love how their menus are printed like a newspaper and I love that the service is always excellent. We will be back next month when we visit Vegas in April!

aQCiBUihIizxvyDywNfQOw.text: Everything is great here. Food is great. Server is really nice. I ordered bacon and onion skillet. My friend order omelette and classic. We really enjoyed our brunch here.

VeGyHnESmgojBwmW2fDSZg.text: This places is fantastic!!  Erin was our server for b'fast last Saturday and she was great!  Good prices, great food and very friendly.  We went twice over a 2 week tour of NV and CA. Would highly recommend going here to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip!

lp9cf6OjJdOJ3sGg8oQbJg.text: Our first time here and the food is good. The gave them at 4 star. The only thing that I didn't like so much was the crazy large menu. It's a bit too much. The service was good and the people are really friendly here. It seem like everyone Who worked here asked us how was the food and have we been helped. You don't see that kind of service anymore unless you are eating at a fine dining. We definitely will come back when we visit LV.

CwC8uwI6-CJi7929vbduKA.text: Went to Egg and I and had Chance as our server. She was awesome. Took really good care of us. Made sure we were well taken care of.

wcJ22lrwdpnTgl1Mk_LpQg.text: I really enjoy breakfast food but going to breakfast eateries, they just give so much food.    Anyway gotta eat breakfast so we came here.  Typical breakfast shop.  I ordered the Fiesta Skillet which was a layer of their ranch potatoes topped with a mixture of green chilies, onions, and salsa.  On top of that was a layer of melted cheese and two eggs over-easy.  The skillet was accompanied by two slices of wheat toast and two slices of fruit.  It was pretty tasty.  I really like the ranch potatoes, eggs were cooked correctly, no brown spots and yolks were runny.  There were three different types of Habla Diablo sauce on the table Original, Chipotle, and Verde.  So if you need a little spice in your breakfast you can choose your pain.  Well not really since none of them are that spicy.    Overall  I enjoyed breakfast.  I have tried other items at their other locations they all taste good.  Would definitely be up there on the list of breakfast places to go.

jIR-lzaaej4bLz8RsxpRhg.text: Gets packed around 10. You can call ahead to get your name on the list, but they will only  honor it for 30 minutes in advance. The banana nut muffin is delicious with coffee. The potatoes were also delicious because of the seasoning they used. Service was friendly and fast. I recommend their original breakfast burrito.

mkJDeV_KjQwn3d8Bt0O7BQ.text: This place is awesome and our server Liza's the BEST! My wife and I ate here for breakfast on our visit to Vegas. We at the bacon avocado omelette and country fried steak. Banana Nut muffins are homemade and melt in your mouth! Coffee also tasted delicious too, didn't want to stop drinking it! Place was packed but definitely worth waiting for. A must when visiting Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

HcgJROsD50oJ8sZE9Nkb1w.text: Hubby had the Bacon and Sliced Avocado omelette and now he does not want to eat breakfast anywhere else in Las Vegas. The four eggs were fluffy and cooked to PERFECTION! It was generously filled with bacon and avocado and smothered in freshly grated cheddar cheese. The potatoes were diced and crispy with a great blend of seasoning. Wheat toast was done just right. Paula was our waitress and she was attentive and friendly. This is a not-to-miss breakfast stop. And the coffee was wonderful.

vpKnSgxs1wdC0kp391TzGg.text: Really great eggs! Such variety. Muffins galore. Tabatha excellent server! Great Vegas trip experience. Come here for good breakfast and unlimited coffee refills! Bandido muy delicioso. Would eat again after long drive to Nevada!

r5AqVVtR2F7rXLWk0_4Rpw.text: Wish this place was in California! Gotta get the banana nut muffin. I've only had the country fried steak here, but refuse to get anything else. The potatoes are so bomb here, Airways finish it! Service is great and is always crowded. The 4.5 stars on Yelp are definitely deserved!

tYqvwIKgJi1K_BMi_JMYSg.text: Solid breakfast, a local hangout.  It does have outdoor seating.  Breakfast is always good and the place always accommodates changes in the menu.  I do like it and come back again and again with my parents, who have been coming here since the 80's.  The service is always good.

Uz25CRpOMhHi7fXJrkh6Rw.text: The food was delicious, service was great, and price was reasonable. You must try the banana nut muffin so good !!!

Nsvco0tPxx6JptFp7cE-cg.text: Really good!! Muffins are awesome. Great menu with a lot of interesting items. Can order half orders!!!!

WhyOVIs1gaX7Pzns10oZTg.text: Another breakfast review.... well I just had too as we found another local joint in Las Vegas which just hits the top notch mark. I found this place while yelping and I'm sure glad we did...  Great customer service, great food and wonderful staff..  a big high five and HUGE thank you to our server Lindsey (hope I spelled your name correctly) as she was amazing first of all as well as everyone else in the place. Treated us like their best friends... the food came out hot and fresh and tasted wonderful. Not to mention those amazing muffins they treated us too for free for being first timers!!  Now THAT is customer service!! Talk about making an instant impression and creating an instant loyal customer... thank you to all of the staff at EGG & I for treating us so well to our visit to Vegas... we will definitely come back to see you again!

HXF-5Ygv-8MqGdNFhqm3mw.text: We came in the morning for breakfast and we've been coming here for the last 3 years. We can't miss it when we come to town and every time the service is fantastic!  This place isn't very big and it gets crowded on weekends. We arrived at about 10:30 on a Saturday morning, but we only waited 15 minutes for a table. Our food came out faster and we were in and out in a little over an hour including great conversation. Before our food came to the table, our server, Stacy, introduced herself and brought us the delicious banana bread muffins with butter.  I ordered the eggs Benedict and some orange juice. The hollandaise sauce was creamy and not too thick. The eggs were perfectly poached. Together with the Canadian bacon, everything was well balanced. Sometimes, if the hollandaise sauce is over seasoned, the combination of the hollandaise with Canadian bacon leaves the dish too salty. That definitely wasn't the case here. Throughout our meal, Stacy was fantastic. She kept checking on us. At one point I needed an additional napkin and was about to flip the egg when the manager walked up to ask what we needed. Although Stacy did bring the check a little early, she apologized, ensured us that there was no rush and brought me the additional orange juice I wanted to order. When we were done, one of the other servers noticed my injury and offered to help me up. I really appreciated her concern. This place is great!

LSgkBidm2_AagAc7BuUKVw.text: Ranch Potatoes - HOLLA!    Need I say more?  Don't ask, just go, order it and eat it.  You'll understand.  Breakfast at this quaint eatery was delish!  I ordered the stuffed french toast with a side of bacon.  Egg bread dipped in a custard batter. Grilled golden and lightly sprinkled with powdered sugar stuffed with strawberry cream cheese.  My plate came with 2 helpings of syrup for reason i can't even fathom.  The goo of whipped cream and strawberry stuff was oozing everywhere and definitely sweet enough to ravage alone.  The wait staff was friendly, helpful and patient (we were a group of 4 adults and 5 kids who couldn't make up our minds with all the yummy food to chose from).  I don't know about you but I'm going back the next time I'm in town and eating the rest of the menu!

VSzwgSaF406gUezpNFRIIA.text: Nothing like Egg and I to complete a wonderful vegas trip with my friends. I ordered the Western omelet, which was just the sustenance I needed for the drive back. Not only that but I was lucky to have such a great server this time too. Amanda is one of the best servers I've ever seen in a long time. She's friendly, efficient, and extremely courteous :). SHE'S EGGCELENT. IF YOU EVER GET HER BE EGGCITED!

_0R3jIpex3S7E4svfy5kbA.text: Great bfast after a nite of boozing. The banana nut muffin was spectacular. They have half portions which is great if you are not super hungry or are watching your figure. Service was top notch. Ask to sit in Thaynara's section. She was one of the best servers we have ever had!

WycbfIjZN_Yb92uNOv91dw.text: I had a Sunday morning breakfast at the egg and I yesterday.  The place was super busy, and the hostess wrote my name down as milassa (it's Melissa) and when I told her it Was spelled Melissa,  she said "we'll figure it out" thankfully,  our server,  Kelcey was awesome!!!   She made sure to do her quality check, even though she had several other tables to take care of,  and when I had an avacado issue,  she took care of it and the manager stopped by the table to make sure everything was okay.  The only thing that I was displeased about was that this one location does not serve bloody Mary's (the other 5 do) or any alcohol in general.  I was seriously looking forward to a bloody with my eggs benny.

k2rQJ9pTGDeVSZBxO2sRpg.text: Amazing customer service as well as food. On our very first visit there was a problem with my order. Not only did our waitress not hesitate to bring me something else, they did it quickly AND brought us a free "gift to take home" - an entire loaf of yummy banana bread! I was pretty blown away by how nice they were to us.  They go out of their way to make sure you leave with a smile on your face. I wish all restaurants had customer service like this place. We loved the food as well and will definitely be back for more.

wWJj3zMH5p64dRZ7qO4UXQ.text: Great service and great food! I ordered the corn beef hash with over easy eggs. Reina is a very attentive, nice and quick server. Kudos to Reina!!!

pY3R1EujwzCn8W9BHOntZw.text: Searching Yelp for breakfast restaurants, I found Egg & I. With four star reviews and excellent quick tips, I had to try it. Arriving around 10:30am, the place is packed (which is always a good sign), yet there was only a 10min wait. Very friendly staff and waiters/waitresses. I got the Kay's Omelet (w/added Chicken). I was offered the choice of toast or banana nut muffin. I went with traditional toast. The omelet is simply the best I've ever had. It had the perfect combination of spinach, artichoke hearts, tomatoes and topped with feta cheese. Brilliant  Now, to the matter of the toast. Fortunately, one of my companions ordered the banana nut muffin. Even more fortunate, she offered to share. Not an over powering banana taste, more of a whole grain taste, yet just nutty enough, with a hint of chocolate bitterness.   While I loved my experience, I can't give five stars, as some in my party were not as happy with their dishes as I was with mine. I do look forward to trying more from the menu very soon.

sjtzmtit2vvOAUt_e35SVA.text: You gotta try, excuse me, have their banana nut muffin! It is so moist and onolicious! AND they also include some meals for us locals from Hawaii!! How thoughtful and well received by those of us who miss our foods.

vHQ1mNonpnODyTR1G7xPNw.text: My new favorite breakfast in vegas!  Country fried steak was awesome!  The potatoes and muffin were very good!!

kO4Lv-eeH2Evdy-mfKwjpg.text: This is one of my regular stops for breakfast. Normally a great breakfast joint but not today. The greeter wasn't friendly and the food was average. This place has been around for a long time with a good reputation. The kitchen needs to try harder and they need a friendly, happy greeter. It will be a while before I go back.

vfjxaMA04m6eIj1AkmkPEA.text: We came here by default because the Pepper Mill had a 2 hour wait.  The wifey found this on Yelp, and we were so glad we came here.  Great breakfast food at very reasonable prices! I had the prime rib benny and the wife had the veggie benny. Both were delicious!  The wait was not bad and the service was quick.  If you're looking for good breakfast without going broke at the buffets on the Strip, I highly recommend this place. Way better than the Pepper Mill.

BJ3s-JSSft1WWp62QIoxUQ.text: Breakfast was great.  Samantha was awesome. Only ate eggs and chorizo but would have loved to try the carbs.  Pancakes and muffins looked amazing.

wiCyH9CgA5Hr9mCNx_jW4g.text: Popular place about a 30 minute wait for a table for 7. Staff is really nice and the menu is detailed I got Benny country with poached eggs and seasoned potatoes. The gravy is out on top of the sausage eggs and biscuits and it was delicious I was not fond of the seasoned potatoes a little too salty seasoned for me great will looking forward to coming back to try new things.

JmOFPjjNlVg3Blit7IoYOA.text: Ive had this place several times, take out and dine in!! My best experiences are truly dine in! Mashed potato & cinni chilli omlette to die for!!! I love this location best servers have to be alyssa and bree!! Dont mind waiting as the food and service always wows me!

xJ9vtAm17xxhuKZKVvVfMg.text: Great casual breakfast.  Everything we ordered arrived quickly and was very good. Loved the potatoes--bought some seasoning to take home.

2GWqKek0PUJiMrLz2W_Xzg.text: This place never disappoints. The only thing disappointing is the long wait, which only means one thing. Parking is also difficult. It's definitely worth the wait. The banana nut muffin is a must. I think the menu was made for hangovers. Anything you get on the menu would mend it. The only thing on my last visit I had an issue with was my potatoes. They were really salty. It wasn't just my potato it was also with my group. Everyone's potato was salty. Other than that everything was EGGcelent.

L9dvkGb-XkBWo0qb8soe_Q.text: Omg this place this delicious! Had the bacon and avocado omelet and it was Huge, they definitely don't skimp on the avocado either.  Service was fast and meal was amazing, waitress Chance was attentive and brought everything quickly. I will be eating here every time I'm in Vegas from now on!

rsiWxze-ldwLoFAeOjGDwg.text: This place is nothing special! Breakfast is the easiest meal to cook, and when I pay for it I want it to be flippin awesome. This was just ok - like Dennys.   The place was packed, but it only took a minute to be seated. The service was all around good - no complaints.  I ordered one of the skillets - maybe the three meats - which was okay. It was fresh, good portion, and tasted ok. Just nothing to write home about. The best thing, other than the diet coke, was the banana bread.   It's not bad, just not good. Make your own breakfast, and you'll be just as happy.

AuRMB40c5u6RvD0QvTXKmA.text: Pancakes are moist, fluffy, and delicious! The menu said they serve small pancakes but when I got my order it was almost as big as the plate :) Sausage links amazing too!  I ordered orange juice which is freshly squeezed = YUMMY!!

0MPbF2J70ECrOX4l5ZeDPA.text: This morning I brought my mother and daughter in for breakfast. We had Oscar as our server. Oscar had a great attitude from the second he came over to our table. He was very attentive and friendly the whole time we were there. Food was awesome as always, just wanted to make sure Oscar was recognized for his great service.

3Bxaj-RTyTmLiV-UbnigYg.text: This is a phenomenal place! Not only for egg lovers but for everyone! We had stuffed French toast, mashed potato omelette and California crepe which was beyond amazing. Oh and don't forget to order some mimosas!

m2cwAtv-FldLz_uU7dsb8g.text: My husband is a big Vegas aficionado but I resist sin city as much as the religious right. But alas we had to attend am event so we came together and he's been trying to show me the other side of Vegas.  So far a success. And a key contributor? The Egg and I.   Lianora seated us within 5 minutes despite large crowds - very efficient! Kelsey and Gia were most attentive servers. Even sending us on the road with some muffins and butter. Along with some non gaming locals only recommendations.   And the food... Enough has been said about the egg dishes. But someone please try the buckwheat pancakes! With cashews and fresh blueberries. And REAL mar syrup.   I'm just saying.

wRuTdCb-9LkMtqCyeWOuzQ.text: Reina was a great waitress! She was friendly, attentive, and informed about the menu. Food was delicious! Definitely coming back again

NbLy45bnvKqsKF6RwqTAHg.text: I like this place. It's got a cute atmosphere and friendly service but it also gets busy and crowded.

1YnxZrpX3yaZluGRvwZr9A.text: Good food and generous portions.  The wait was about 20 minutes.  Our waitress  Liza was awesome.  Check it out if your looking for a good breakfast in Vegas.

wC7y3tIavmQu5kx0KgBz2w.text: Great breakfast and great service from Tabatha! The Traditional Benny was awesome (soft yolk) and loved the banana nut muffin. Definitely will be back next time I'm in town.

jI7O33poCk0G9CrN_l5XOA.text: GREAT GREAT breakfast and you def get your money worth I was not even able to finish my omelet. It was a very nice change from being on the strip and the price was great. We had a groupon and had it not been for the groupon I never would have found this place. Our waitress was great and had a  wonderful attitude I wish I remembered her name. Everything was amazing and had a great taste not bland at all I love the seasoning on the home fries. I will def be back soon.

oNJSh_q5jROQX0Hb0sKKaw.text: This breakfast place is awesome! Their Habla Diablo Seasoned Potatoes were delicious. And, our server Paula was great. She tended to our needs right away and was very nice. We're definitely coming back here when we're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Classic breakfast.

SrGsJ_50UMtFowIjbTdt4Q.text: There is a reason this place is rated as one of top places to eat in Vegas. The service was really good with a very kids friendly environment. The prep on food was really good with great vege. Options. The potatoes had a special spice to them which tasted really good. We ordered the skillet and omelette and kids ordered pancakes. One suggestion for owner to consider are floors, very slippery for chairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mouse Pancakes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veg omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veg Skillet with egg whites

b9JHn17r5ThuIZhasZ_zbA.text: I have a few things to say about the dishes I've tried:  - Egg's benedict: flavor explosion in my mouth!  I was recently introduced to the benny and can't believe what I've been missing out on. There are so many sensational flavors in this dish that you just have to try it for yourself!  And those potatoes - I'm not much of a potato breakfast person but could not help stealing these off my friend's plate!  - Strawberry stuffed french toast: I am more of a 'sweets' type of breakfast girl so I typically order french toast. You get 2 slices of toast stuffed with strawberry cream cheese goodness.  Unfortunately, this dish starts to become a little TOO sweet at the end so it's a struggle to finish the last few bites.  (I've had to confirm this by ordering this dish twice.)  If you can share this dish with someone, that'd work out well.  - banana bread muffins: you pretty much have to try this when you go there. I'm so confused because sometimes, I've been given the muffin for free and other times I've had to order it...but whatevs, you gotta do what you gotta do!  The muffin is soft and when served warm = bomb-dot-com.  ** ALSO, must note on the service. All the workers are very polite and friendly. If you ever need something, they have this egg face you can turn over at your table. When the egg is black, you're fine.  Need something? Then turn the egg over so it's yellow. I have to say, this system totally works. Because the few times we've need a coffee refill or something..flip over the egg face and *BAM* someone helps you out right away!  This is one of my breakfast spots of choice (another is Baby Stacks) for good, consistent, yummy breakfast food.  Prices are decent too!

D606Sdn3OsQrildLJTJt5A.text: A new Must when visiting Las Vegas!!  The food was absolutely delicious!! And the portions were extremely generous. The staff was very friendly and very attentive. Our server Earl made sure we were well taken care of as well as Carole Ann. Definitely coming back!

ZwY7Yn8RzBG0bbPMD1W3KA.text: Brady was a great server! The omelets here are really good. But i was most amazed by how great the service was. I could see that all the servers were working hard trying to please the customers.  There was a bit of a wait time, but tis worth it.

dlOiV2o_L6t5ccwJlbaspw.text: Came to Egg & I for lunch, was seated promptly and the server Partick was extremely informative and told us about their service system. Sat outside where the water misters were spraying to keep the atmosphere cool in the Vegas heat. Food came within 15 minutes for a group of 6 and food was delicious. Will be back again !

mGfnRCpoWbpDl6FINMAbGg.text: I gave Egg and I a 4 star because it was delicious but not extraordinary. As first timers we were given complimentary banana nut muffin. It was delicious but too oily for me. We went on a Sunday morning and waited about 20 minutes to be seated for a table for two. Our server was very polite and actually everyone there seem happy to work there. You can tell everyone was working hard and had a a routine that works. As for the food, I was satisfied and left full. I ordered the stuffed French toast with bacon and potatoes. The potatoes were tiny and well done with extra seasonings (average). My BF got the biscuits and gravy with potatoes as well. The gravy had the right amount of sodium not too salty and not to bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy, stuffed French toast

8Ly2fuMIxGxprzjab5WCXQ.text: Great food and service! I got the classic. Warning: orange juice is $3.25 and you only get one small glass of it.

FDav9WV4xLvR6G5cHbZ71g.text: the service is great, the skillet course was wonderful. we didn't enjoy the blubbery pancakes..

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Za5aOUJ-M5DrI4KKTzqrsg.text: Ordered the diablo potatoes, scrambled eggs, bacon, and chocolate chip pancakes. The portions are nice sized and everything was fantastic. There was no wait and the server was efficient and pleasant. My boyfriend's food was excellent as well. Great breakfast spot!

tdp4Q0yy9cPkPFRViSmEew.text: Packed (understandably), but we got the last empty table. Waitress, Genesis, was there instantly for drinks order, then food order--she made recommendations that we wisely accepted. Food came quickly and was great (skillet scramble & omelet). Next time, breakfast burrito (looked like 1.5x normal size).  Just about everything comes with Habla Diablo potatoes, which the waitress accurately explained as having seasoning salt, but they've not really spicy or hot.  Restaurant is very clean, has a huge menu (almost entirely breakfast fare), and is very well staffed. Table-to-waitress ratio was very low, and tables are bussed immediately. Tables also have a little placard on a ring that's normally black smiley face, for all is well, or yellow frowny face for service please. There are managers or expediters wandering around, and they pounce immediately if you turn the placard to yellow (service).  Excellent overall.

8VsfIuOAqND-WACi09-6Gw.text: Came here for breakfast with my two girlfriends and Curtis was our server. It was pretty busy when we went but we never felt rushed and he made sure to tend to whatever we needed. The food was great and the service was even better. This was my first time coming here but i will definitely be back in the future!

8Dlt_PZ3CUvhu3jgODtkkA.text: This place was as good as the Yelp reviews say! Really really good breakfast place. Service was great, food even better. Will try one of the Eggworks places next time.

Af_K9iCGg0cby6z2p3AbBw.text: I ate the Chicken fried steak and tasted the homemade corn beef hash. Both dishes were good and reasonably priced.  The potatoes seasoning was too salty for me to eat more than a few bites. The seasoning resembles Lawrey's seasoning salt and just overpowered the crispy potatoes.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak and eggs

UjBw_aApLdAFrQgDOr9f-g.text: Let me start off by saying that this place has good food.   Came for breakfast and had the banana muffin and stuffed french toast. I now have a go to spot for breakfast and will definitely be back soon

3PhS1Lw5-YeCStAt-KV9bA.text: So excited we got to eat here! We traveled to Las Vegas with our two young children and NEEDED a family breakfast spot.  I read tons of Yelp reviews and decided to come here.  So glad I did!  They were pretty crowded when we arrived but they somehow had a table available and sat us down right away.  My 1.5 year old was super cranky and everyone who worked there smiled and tried to get him to lighten up- no eye rolling or snippy comments.    The kids got super cute menus that looked like little books/newspapers and crayons.  It kept my daughter well entertained.  Our server was friendly and super quick.  I got the eggs benedict and I'm not sure why.  I had never had it before.  There must've been a picture of it in the menu or something.  But let me tell you, it was SO good!  I've since ordered it back home in Chicago a couple different times and NOTHING compares to the one I had from Egg & I.    Each table has a little egg figure on it.  One side is a happy egg and the other side is a sad egg.  If you need ANYTHING you just turn your egg to sad and someone IMMEDIATELY tends to you- even in the chaos of a super busy day.  We needed more napkins and had more than we knew what to do with within seconds.    The food was great.  The price was average.  The service was amazing.  The place seemed very clean and had fun whimsical decor.  They handled being very busy and I was not uncomfortable as a customer at all.  If we ever head back to Vegas, I'd come here in a heartbeat- and possibly more than once.

mKEU4C5rX06PC0-1MEj9eg.text: Egg & I makes for an amazing breakfast spot -- unbelievably savory morning foods. The menu is very extensive, which is surprising, because they do most of the items on the menu VERY well.  Between the 4 of us that tried Egg & I, we each got different dishes and were all very happy with the food. The portion size is huge as well. If you're not that hungry, share with someone. The omelettes are made with not 1, not 2, not 3, but 4 eggs. FOUR EGGS. It's a beast omelette among eggs.  Three things I will highlight: The eggs benedict, the banana nut muffin, and potatoes. --Eggs Benedict: Order this and you will not be disappointed. The hollandaise sauce that's drizzled over the eggs is something that most places mess up, but at Egg & I, it's made to perfection -- smooth, creamy and seasoned just right. --Banana Nut Muffin: They give this to you when you order and omelette, and don't miss out. It's the most airy, soft, moist -- yes, moist -- muffin you'll ever eat. It's like they fold air into the batter before baking. THAT GOOD. --Potatoes: MY GOD. These are the best side of potatoes I've ever had. I'm convinced they have to be fried, but I'm not sure. The exterior is exquisitely golden crispy with a perfect seasoning blend on the outside. Best potatoes west of the Mississippi; hands down.  Pros: Breakfast food for gods Cons: Can get busy, limited parking

Zx8-uls5G2P_BueePbNFmw.text: they have awesome breakfast this pancakes are pretty good they got great olives and the prices are pretty good not a bad place to go with the family I was satisfied for sure

JRDtD0EcjMXAE2xrHsS6Bg.text: This spot has become a regular part of my Vegas experience!   Their banana nut muffins are INSANE and their egg skillet meals are huge enough to keep you full for the rest of the day, easily. Boyfriend once finished a full chicken fried steak skillet and I feared for his cardiovascular health for a hot minute. As an added bonus, the coffee is delicious and I absolutely recommend the bacon avocado omelette and banana nut French toast.   Service is excellent and we always feel cared for when we visit. Our server today, Bree, was awesome and attentive!  Ambiance is charming. This place isn't great for huge groups, but it is totally perfect for the family. Expect a line in the morning -- but the wait is worth it!

q1Mn7oFpOxuT8ac50w4orA.text: I've seen it packed in early hours at almost every location and don't understand why? Breakfast is pretty regular and nothing special. Price's are decent but i'd rather go to dennys or the Omelette house.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ilC4cFpXlwFWE12flxYDjQ.text: The food was nothing out of the ordinary but pretty good. Although the whip cream they used for the hot chocolate and waffles was mighty delicious.  Our server Brady was phenomenal. Even though he seemed to be overwhelmingly busy he greeted us with a smile and continuously checked in on us to make sure we were doing fine.

w4HPzfLTJyyzgrliN4NWZg.text: Been here twice on two separate trips and both dining experiences have been great. Excellent food and even better staff! They seem to really care about customer service and I've noticed that all the staff helps each other out so the customer has everything they need without ever even asking. I'm all about the little details and love that they bring you lemons with your water just in case that's how you like to drink it. I think our waiter's name was Patrick this last time around and he was great! My wife and I both had the country gravy (country fried steak and the country benny) and it's so good!

QZbVr3g_7FVBwQyWwSc0ng.text: I've been here since Monday and today is Wednesday FINNALLY some real good food! Chicken fried steak cooked to perfection gravy was on point and the potatoes works were seasoned and cooked just right! My husband got the egg sausage bacon and toast SOO GOOD!! Oh and the banana nut muffin!! YUM!!!   I definitely recommend this place for the perfect breakfast!

86e9a_ONnkXgcNI1QG5vEQ.text: Place is decent. I wouldn't say it's any better then a Denny's or any chain breakfast joint. I had country fried steak & wife had bacon avocado omelet. Both came with potatoes which were crispy which I liked but not so much flavor. Tasted like a buffet potato. Also order a waffle which I thought tasted great but not much better the a chain restaurant. If your looking for a traditional family breakfast and not try a chain place this is okay. Price is pretty fair. We stayed on the strip and I didn't feel like it was worth the cab ride to get there for something I could of had any other breakfast restaurant. Staff is friendly though & attentive.

DlqIbHrLuX5CyzfICBWuuw.text: Decided to try a breakfast place outside of the strip and found this nice gem. Carole Ann was a great server and provided us great service. The food was fantastic and the portions were awesome for being a half order. We orders the mash potatoe omelette and chicken enchilada omelette and it was delicious. We will be back again soon!

noyItbbPQRcAo8UVvIyZ1g.text: Breakfast was wonderful! The service was great. It was about a 15min wait to be seated but it was well worth it. Huge portions; definitely should have shared. Pancakes were just fabulous.

qc8RJpbJuxuiKaQ1AOYeOw.text: This place is a must for breakfast! Every time we come to Las Vegas, it's a tradition to come here! Our server Koko was awesome! If we could give her 7 stars, we would!

MUmjprWRtP2l9iqVFXKHlA.text: This place has the best breakfast in Vegas. Portions are proper and not over the top (you're not throwing half of it away but still paying for it). Oscar and the other servers are great and on top of serving you. My favorites are the cabo or santa cruz buritto. The bananna nut muffins are awesome too. They sure know how to make the 6 hour drive worth it.

mP-Ju3Ri4QB5Z2dm4yCvdw.text: Originally I didn't plan on eating here I had requested IHOP to my husband, but he quickly shot me down and stated we would go to egg and I. I was a tad bit apprehensive about their food but agreed. Once arriving at egg and I the service was top notch. Our waiters name was Amanda and she seemed so happy to be working and really looked to be enjoying her job, She was a breath of fresh air from the waiters we usually experience. Down to the food, I ordered the Waffle works but instead waffles I got strawberry cream cheese french toast and my husband ordered an omelette. Ohh my was it good my French toast were simply put amazing and my husbands food was just as good. I give egg and I 5 stars and they have gained a new customer

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely Great

4ukJGC0MbilPoHf-EqihLw.text: One of the best breakfast places I've ever been to! The service was impeccable-- customers are able to flip an egg decoration from a happy face to a sad face when in need of something. Employees are required to attend to the table immediately! We did this just to test it out and it was literally 3 seconds until someone came over to attend to our needs.  Food was delicious and reasonably priced. Great place!

XgH8Qzrw2OSG3AQqQmk6Dw.text: Perfect place to enjoy breakfast! Fair prices and large portions. Try the sundace with turkey bacon, delicious! Friendly and good service by Sayra. I will definitely come back again

5a-IeoChD2_xBuxO4lYuPA.text: I'm not sure why I haven't written a review before today, I've been here like hundreds of times.  I will say that there are a few things this visit that I wasn't too pleased with though. I ordered a classic 2 egg breakfast with a side of salsa and unfortunately they changed the salsa.  It's not the same they use to make and I'm not sure why they did that. This new salsa they use is just down right yucky tasting.  Also when I've ordered eggs here before they usually scramble them soft and this time they were kinda dry.   Maybe this visit was just a slip up so I'm looking forward to coming here again and giving them another try.

PB3gy-BfYYajKuIp1fkvPw.text: This is one of the best breakfast joints in town and they are always busy but they seat you fast and service is great the banana nut muffin is one of the best muffins there is it's huge delicious always fresh as far as the food concerned well I have my favorites and I never try anything else so I can tell you their menu is perfect for me the price is great the coffee is hot and I always leave with a smile on my face

nCzOtBcRE-B0PqMplCMfTw.text: Went to the Egg and I .When I had arrived the line was  long. The wait was about 20min but when I got inside the service was fast our waiter was really nice I had the chili rellano omelette came with potatoes and a choice of toast or a banana muffin I choose  the banana muffin which was really good I would come again

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Rellano Omelette

tpCN0YrNMW2MMvA9KbF9MQ.text: Our Server Breeannada (Bree) WAS AMAZING!  She was attentive, respectful, and a model of an excellent server. She knew her menu front to back - and it's a big menu!  The food was delicious - this was our first time here - if we lived here in Vegas we would be in here all the time!   Next time we come out here  we will definitely be back!

lnjBLOZHvjtMl5NE5SBW-Q.text: This is still my favorite breakfast spot in Las Vegas.  It is my first choice and the food is as good as it had always been.  The service is also excellent!  I have to admit that I've never had anything on the lunch menu before because no matter what time I go I always order breakfast - it is that good!

5k4WOz_KHXbssgiT7g7beg.text: If you are in Las Vegas and you are looking for a good and filling breakfast, try this place. I had eggs benedict with spinach, delicious! My friends had french toast which came in a big portion and were very good. Prices are ok, and lower compared to the places in the strip (this place is 15 minutes from the strip). Definitely recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On the menu
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict with spinach and fruit as a side instead of potatoes - superlative

YZEr0NWP1kKy71DvaLCQ_A.text: Definitely recommend this place for breakfast...the wait is probably better than Hash A Go-Go but the con are that 1) when you call in to out your name on the list, they tell everyone that it's at least 30 minutes wait but actually it could be 45 min to an hour and 2) their waiting area is very tight & a bit fire hazard. The pro is that is food portion is pretty large, and the staff are super friendly unlike Hash A Go-Go where the hostesses are super snobby because they think they have power toco trial when you could be seated. The hostesses at Eggs & I are super friendly & do their best to find tables for large party. They even gave us extra banana muffins for free for the long wait & the muffins are yummy.

AaDMIZ6_w9Wxs9ytOBoaSA.text: $ Service was excellent. Veggie Benny was large with fresh vegetables and excellent Hollandaise sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Egg and I

SBS5J6ohaLb4syIKfyOVZg.text: Above all the service and staff were amazing! The food wasn't shabby either;) our server Sunshine brightened our morning up! And the outside patio is dog friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food is amazeballs!

bXfRtbQgGfvRFZdkniSing.text: Oscar was the bomb: He recommended the 3 Little Pigs Omelette and the Green Chile Relleno omelette. Both were served hot and were absolutely awesome. Relleno sauce was super flavorful and not too spicy. I selected the warm fresh-out-of-the-oven banana muffin (YUM). We ordered fruit on the side which was in large chunks and consisted of pineapple, 3 types of melon and an orange slice. Very fresh and tasty.  I would love to come back to try other menu items.  It looks like this place can be pretty busy, so allow for time to be seated.  Oscar was very sweet and attentive, letting us know our order was working and did frequent check backs. Plates were cleared and check promptly dropped. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me and the menu
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana muffin, Chilean replenished and 3 pigs were omelette.

a8qlt_stlQs6JhcRX2zWpg.text: I am just gonna rant.  Why does it take so long to cook an "unseasoned" chicken breast.  There is also an up charge for a plain chicken breast.  I thought I was saving them money when I asked for no seasoning..... Also some other food item could have been offered to eat in the meantime as a person waits patiently for 30 minutes after ordering.  It's kind of hard when your hungry and you see other people after you sit down around you get their food first.  Also I was not told at the time of ordering that I had to wait 15 min for an unseasoned chicken breast.

A53d_D1cyr-nIxbt9O_g3A.text: Wonderful people and wonderful food.  I loved the happy and sad egg table displays.  Easy and effective way to get your servers attention.

eLn0PuGgP0SseuykzEELww.text: Saw the good reviews on trip advisor so decided to gave it a try. It was very busy and waited for 10 min or so for a table. Lots of food selection on the menu. We ordered biscuits and gravy, skillet potatoes and crepes. Overall food tasted good and would definitely go back for the food. I took off a star for the service, it was average and she neglected to inform us that we can substitute fruits with potatoes. We over heard that from another waitress at the table next to us. The service attitude from other people there was also average, not very friendly and don't feel appreciated being a patron there.
