uNWGColOJV_PBs5Ys94qrA.text: Love the omelets food and great and service was excellent! Only complaint was the server didn't ask if it was our first time! It was so we could of got a free banana nut muffin there specialty! Oh well it's worth it

GLksm6WBsCuYDlAiyqduTg.text: * Saturday breakfast * Arrived 10:45am * Approx 25 guests waiting inside and out * A table for two took only 10 minutes  I've been wanting to try this place for a while  now, but the crowds and the wait discouraged me from trying. All the good reviews kept this place on my radar, so when a friend wanted to try somewhere new, we came here.   The wait was not bad at all - especially because as we waited, we had the menu to look over and wow, there are lots to look. Eggs benedict, omlets, pancakes, skillets and more.   Today, I went with the Crazy Chicken Omlet ("you're crazy for not trying it"). It's a plateful - so much so that we got a box to enjoy it later.   Outstanding service - They even have happy/sad face eggs you can display on your table to signal for service  I would probably come here again and again to try the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Chicken Omlet

ZULEaG26tL3HZqRfhyPvQQ.text: Very good food and nice service and omg! That banana bread is soooooo delicious and I would definitely recommend them s place and did not forget to check out the carrot cake French toast soooo bomb.xom

hJwktM2KlV-_Ncl1YyLaLw.text: Good quality comfort breakfast food that comes in huge portions! Each entree is about $10-$12 and most  come with fruit or potatoes, and toast or a banana muffin- definitely big enough to share. (I would recommend choosing the banana muffin, it's freshly baked and absolutely delicious. Note that you get a free muffin with Yelp check in!)   While I don't consider most of the menu items to be healthy, as is typical of many American breakfast diners, you are given the option to make your order healthier, whether it be by using egg whites only, no cooking oil, etc. There are also SO MANY menu items to choose from.   Stop by here to have a great start to your day!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Benny

IUpGPGHf5lVrdfKT7UoWFg.text: Great service. Misters for outside seating is a great touch for warm days like today! Free banana muffins for your first visit!!! Perry is such a nice and patient waiter! Thank you for your great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AyjGVzINfmePYOHQ0AtbVQ.text: Outstanding service and food.  Local favorite.   Paula is nothing short of amazing with her service , this place makes ya feel like your at home..   big portions and great Salsa

cWqb69LpJLuOqYlU9DZ6MQ.text: Service was great and the food was delicious. I love the banana nut muffin. We split the chicken fried steak and it was delicious.

bXDEvO7zkunixc7kR5ejyQ.text: E&I was definitely one of my favorite meals here in Vegas. Originally my friends and I wanted to eat at Peppermill for brunch before leaving Vegas but the wait for 6 people was over 40 minutes. Called in to check for the wait here and was happy enough to find that we would only have to wait for 20 minutes despite it being packed.  There isn't much space inside for customers to sit while waiting for their table; you'll most likely have to wait outside and that kind of sucks especially in the hot summer weather. When we got seated, we were promptly given the menu and starter drinks. Service here is on point. Karla, our server, went out of her way to make everything as easy as possible for us. Instead of having us go to the front ourselves to split our check, she went ahead and split it six ways for us. I LOVE YOU KARLA.  Food portion here is very generous. You definitely will get the bang for your buck because most of the food items costs $8-$12 and only one person in my group was able to finish his order. Whatever you order, make sure the potatoes are included or order it on the side! There's Cajun seasoning on it, I think, and it's amaaaazing. You won't regret coming here!  P.S. there's this cute egg centerpiece on your table. Instead of flagging a waitress/waiter down, just flip it from its black side to the yellow side and someone will come to your table. How cool is that??

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cincy Chili over spaghetti!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak with sunny side eggs and sourdough bread
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak skillet

4a-vogVsB3xFT_s-wOPNbA.text: Coming here is a MUST every time I go to Vegas. The food is amazing and the banana bread is to die for! The portions are good. I usually share the omelet and potatoes with a side of pancakes and leave super full. Also, love that they leave a carafe of coffee on the table so you can do your own refills! I love the Egg and I and we need one in LA!   This last time we were there we had a waitress named Tam and she was the best! Tam was super funny and a great waitress. The place was packed per usual and she still managed to be attentive and never miss a beat.

qj_R-bFjeXAGKgg6Flp9-Q.text: We went here as family for breakfast. We enjoyed it. Good food and great service. We would come again.

6F6wP5sIol4FYPdOo-k75A.text: I had the eggs over easy, banana muffin, potatoes, and patty sausage. The service was spot-on very attentive. The speed of the preparation was above average. The food was served hot and it was very tasty. My friend had the chicken-fried steak and he stated the gravy was very good as was the balance of his meal

w_1p2do0nMZdCGcPGXnn6Q.text: Lacey is agreat server, great brunch place. Drove to vegas needed a place to have brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good brunch

8SPSahjygn2r2HRs_mX9Uw.text: This place is like Denny's on steroids! Come early on weekdays to avoid long lines, but usually it's not TOO bad. Just get hungry while you wait :) I've been coming here for awhile and just wanted to give them some props. Keep up the good work!

JtsHztxlNwSsQqgPFVLA3w.text: Came in and the line was out the door, still only took about 10 minutes to get us seated. This place operates like a well oiled machine turning tables over quickly with good service and getting the food out piping hot and fresh.    Had the blackened prime rib benny and it was so good. It's a very huge portion and it tastes super good by itself but throw on some of that chipotle hot sauce and it's a winner. The side of potatoes it comes with are phenomenal super crispy and seasoned to perfection.   GF ordered a sundance special omelette and loved it too. Came with the same potatoes.   Checked in and got the free muffin, server actually gave us an extra one at no charge because of the wait.   Clean, friendly, fast and cheap and good food. Hot sauce is for sale up at the register too.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib benny

90um2kIf_TYUT4XOxVbzOg.text: While the benedicts look amazing with all the hollandaise sauce, my dish left a lot to be desired. I had the blackend ribeye benedict. Meat is cut up in small pieces and was very dry. That pretty much ruined the whole dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened Ribeye looks great, but meat was dry and rubbery.

clJ9vlvaNB4G0YUWOm7_Kg.text: As a lover of breakfast, I can attest that this spot is awesome. Everything about the menu is suitable to all. The prices, portions, and taste can really cause instant love. The location is a nice size, so the wait wasn't too bad. The customer service is excellent and the clean atmosphere is super inviting. The portions are huge so come hungry and leave happy.   We ordered stuffed french toast and an original breakfast burrito, both entrees included the most tastiest home fries. We really enjoyed our meals and didn't want to leave our plates. They have an amazing seasoning salt and housemade salsa that are pretty addicting.   Defintely worth a try and a revist whenever we are in town. Yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrito goodness

cFxKgb_5CGJJakY54uKc9w.text: Just found this place at random during a stop in Vegas, and now I wish I had one by my home in PA!  The service was excellent, the waitress was so friendly and the food was top-notch delicious. If I was creating a restaurant, this would be the one. I had been unable to decide between a crepe and a waffle when the waitress suggested half a crepe to go with the waffle. Perfect! So delicious and they have a cool concept of a tag on the table that you can flip up when you need service and anyone will come over, managers, busboys whoever. Brilliant concept. I had often thought a call light or something like that should be in most restaurants and they have one. So, five stars for this place only because I can't give them more than five stars. Stop by, you won't be sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A delicious brunch!

MMJh689unZdvIQtwdWJ-ig.text: The cashier/hostess Caresia must've been having a bad day. She was not friendly or personable at all. The food wasn't good. I ordered the strawberry cream cheese french toast. There was so much cream cheese, whip cream and artificial strawberry sauce that you couldn't enjoy the French toast at all. It was soggy. No need for syrup at all because it was so sweet. Definitely won't be going back to this place. The only thing good was the hospitality by the waitresses that's why I give it 2 stars.

2jkUq3E8n9oX0wUgIS1YEw.text: Great food. Amazing service. Banana nut Muffin was too good! BREAKFAST TOSTADA was very tasty and reminded me of my Indian food(a bit similar to Rajbhog, with Chicken and Samosa chat). I strongly recommend this restaurant to everyone.  I would also like to appreciate the great service from Amanda who was very interactive and helpful. She helped us choose the right items and provided super fast service. The owner was a delightful person and very interactive. She was moving around managing her business and making sure everything was in place.

5_U-LGdcl_IWWsr7KE74Og.text: This place is amazing. Loved the food.  The banana nut muffin is a must try. Carole Ann was awesome. We had 13 people in our group and the service was still amazing.

E4OWfeOCX0ZadilKHTt2LA.text: Absolutely delicious! Vanilla cappuccino is amazing, iced or hot! The banana nut muffin is so tasty. I had the veggie skillet and my boyfriend had the blueberry pancakes. Both were extremely good! Our server, Maggie, was so sweet and attentive! Overall a very friendly place!

97UFpZNd8P4wsAuZsykCEg.text: Absolutely amazing food! The service was also outstanding, I went in for breakfast with my girlfriend. The waiter that helped us was very attentive and sweet not considering that she was very much pregnant. Hard working woman, 5 stars to her and everyone else. Definitely returning to eat there again.

dCFXPyvww2rEzH7_9I33lA.text: Place -- Family friendly, smiles all around!   Food -- The banana nut muffin. I saw the clouds parting and sunshine came through.  Service --   All of them were so nice. So, so nice.   Go back? -- Hell yes. Yes.

gYNbXPB5xpNP4JCtPAVHTA.text: Infinite menu . Besides they'll make anything you want if they have the ingredients in the kitchen . I usually get a waffle with strawberries and whipped cream, sausages and scrambled eggs with cheese and bacon oh and the house potatoes you can't forget about those  . They have something for every taste guaranteed

ws6dUEoEG-FVEuJrSReQeA.text: Located "off of the strip" in a plaza, The Egg and I is definitely a local's haven. We only discovered it since our hotel (The Artisan) was nearby and we used our Yelp app to find the closet breakfast place that wasn't a buffet (by day 3 of buffet hopping, I needed major portion control).  Even though it was Mother's Day and the line was out the door, this tiny restaurant somehow managed to get everyone seated quickly and keep diners moving through the door. The menu was quite extensive for breakfast with everything from stuffed french toast to eggs benedict to the infamous breakfast burrito. I tried the eggs benedict, which came with ranch potatoes and a huge portion of fruit. The orange juice was the best part though, it tasted like it was just squeezed in the kitchen.  Highly recommended if you are staying "off the strip," in Downtown Vegas or if you are on your way out of town!

ZDbnsEknnwdo0c42gM2f8g.text: You won't go wrong with Egg & I. The waitresses are practically giddy with happiness, the portions are humongous, the food is fresh and delicious, and the prices are very fair.   The location is about 5 miles west of the Strip, so this is primarily for locals, which adds a more normal vibe compared to the touristy traps that dot this crazy little town.

pbpJdpSrADb5XJIiD5AAgw.text: Food quality is not that great so I always stick with egg options. Cute homey decor. It's in a convenient location for breakfast and lunch. Salads leave a lot to be desired. Wish they just had a few more healthy options.

UdCjRwQGzl_15Eqdzd95Lw.text: Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day, so I'm glad I searched this place out on our last trip out to Vegas. I'm so over the pricey and mediocre food at the buffets on the strip for breakfast. So we came here based on the yelp reviews.  First, they have a huge menu, which makes it hard to decide what to get in the first place since I love all breakfast foods. So I went basic with buttermilk pancakes and eggs and bacon. Everyone's eggs were cooked perfectly. Bacon crispy as I had requested. Short stack of 2 pancakes was more than I could finish. My husband and a friend each got some sort of skillet concoction, and I probably didn't finish my pancakes because my fork kept was always in his skillet because it was so good! The four of us were all pleased with our meal.  The place is busy, but we were seated after about 20 minutes. Service was good, portions were large and a reasonable price. I would probably come back to this place next year on our annual trip!

zyOL5dh79McS2ZTcSxi0Rw.text: The first time i came here was with a car club I am associated with. I was surprised they accommodated 15-20 people on a sunday morning on their patio. I thought that was pretty cool of them. The waitresses were very friendly. Nice girls. The food was really good. I had no complaints for them. Everything was on point. I definitely recommend this place.

q62tqK8T0xx21vb6XpGmpg.text: This place has great food service is amazing. Oscar was a fantastic guy. Highly recommend this place

36ete3P_np9AUKxB__zgpw.text: We arrived early on a Monday morning and was seated right away.  Our waitress was very friendly and checked on us throughout our meal even though it had gotten pretty busy.  Our meals were enormous but so delicious.  Even though we were traveling, I brought my leftovers back to the hotel because I couldnt leave them - it was so good.  Best breakfast I've had in Vegas.

RtQ8nHYJTMUs3pz7cWBLzw.text: Always a great breakfast and super service. They give you the whole pot of coffee! Banana muffins so good and great deal! Portions are huge. So split if u can.

Vt_nFHGePerhzxvsodMPxg.text: This is the best place for breakfast around Vegas. Nice size potions, yummy food and great service.  I go there all the way from Los Angeles!  Keep up the good work! :)

JR8pjavjEo6Xa7QWMKGvjg.text: Taste: 3 Creativity/Authenticity: 3 Atmosphere: 3 Service: 5 Bang for your buck: 3.5  Lets start with when your standing in line (with no one in it) and 2 girls walk up they will ignore you and seat them first so off to a bad start. The waitress is what made me change my mind very friendly and attentive (perfect service). Now to the food, not sure why this place got such high ratings but i wasn't that impressed. They seem to be all about the omelets so the other stuff might not be so good; to start i got a side of biscuits and gravy... more like stale dry biscuits with not enough gravy so again not off to a good start. So the main dish yeah i should have got an omelet but with so many choices i couldn't decide so i got the cabo breakfast burrito... bad choice the burrito was soggy smothered in sauce it was just very un appetizing and the side of house potatoes covered in that texas seasoning was one cold and dry so i don't know if i just got the last of that batch but my experience here was nothing short of just meh nothing that dennys couldn't have filled. Overall the service here at least from my waitress was what gave this a 3 star but the food was not what i expected; especially from the high reviews this place got. NEXT

Gs_4MRRwifMVt17EcpcZNg.text: Another breakfast place serving up obscenely huge, greasy portions of artery-clogging nonsense. However, they do some good healthy choice options on the menu that are fan-fuckin'-tastic!   The food quality is excellent and they have a patio for al fresco dining...although the patio faces out onto West Sahara Ave, an insanely busy thoroughfare clogged with carcinogen-belching traffic. So maybe not the BEST place to sit outdoors.  When considering breakfast spots on the West side, it's between this, the Coffee Pub (better alfresco dining atmo) and the Omelet House kitschier, retro vibe). All three are great, though.

2e0PBzfopdYQXaHi5OTzsw.text: Excellent breakfast spot! Vast menu--almost too many choices--with plenty of vegetarian options. Large portions, and everyone's dish came with a healthy serving of fresh fruit. I had the veggie benedict. Good choice with the grilled tomatoes and fresh avocado, although my eggs were a bit overdone. The home fries are amazing though! Crispy and great seasoning. The bottomless coffee wasn't that great, but good enough for a bottomless pot to wake you up in the morning.  Service was incredible! Fast, attentive, friendly. I wish I could remember our waitress's name to give her a 5-star review. The service is definitely what would keep me coming back. The food is good, but the pricing was a bit high (I think bennie + coffee came to $14 + tip) to make it a regular go-to breakfast.

PU6-pKTV_2vAGEeMg1v6pw.text: My first stop every time I come to Vegas.  The country Benedict hit the spot every time.  The wait is well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The country benny

PsXTwWndOoXoQmCPhNsurQ.text: Awesome breakfast with the family, great food, fantastic service, short wait to be seated. Leiani was a superb server, need more than 5 stars.

MTIa58KTXiDwgOR6sk5olA.text: This place is a must stop every time I go to Vegas.  I go to Vegas at least once a year, more if I can and anyone who goes with me know that we will go here.  It is still pretty busy in the late morning even if it is off the strip, but if you go early (cause you're still on E. Coast time), or later, it isn't so bad.   At home we have a place with this name, but it is NOT the same place.  This place is epic good.  My favorites are the Chicken Enchilada Omelet, the Strawberry Stuffed French toast, the banana nut French toast, and the banana nut muffin here is out of this world.   After a 2008 trip to Hawaii I became obsessed with Hawaiian breakfast and they have both your traditional breakfast of eggs, rice and spam or Portuguese sausage, but they also have loco moco!  If you've never had loco moco it is crazy good.  Rice, steak, and eggs with gravy dumped on top.  Yummy!

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Enchilada Omelet

1ZZhCnOCdA0gb9fOf81Zxg.text: Not a bad place. The food is delicious, but the prices are high. Drinks are not bad. Service is slow and not friendly to me it seemed. Many people. The place is slightly overvalued.

3u8jVegmClQ9dfLu2hfkxQ.text: You have to order the veggie Benedict and loved it. It comes on a bed of bib lettuce with avocado and sauce. I asKed for bacon too. Yum! Server was great. Substitute the potatoes for fruit and it was sweet aNd fresh.  This's place rocks!!!!

ITPdBrrfW0UauuSCEGuUGA.text: Amazing food as always.....only downside was the pigeons. Highly recommend getting the banana nut muffin.

L5avgoMxd9FjRVsYfZM-Ww.text: Food was outstanding. The sunrise mountain was delicious and left me stuffed. More food than we could eat for a reasonable price.

BFiLVfaVezQUISclgSGHCw.text: Worth the wait and the service is amazing. The menu is unbelievable, so much to choose from. We had the Chili Relleno omelet , Chicken Chorizo Hash, Raisin French toast with strawberry. Everything excellent you will not be disappointed. Don't let the people waiting out side stir you away.

o6GMDHLjuO3wnckH8M8vKA.text: I really like this place.... I used to live in Vegas and it was definitely one of our go to spots. It's always crouded. Service sometimes is good sometimes not so good. Still a go to when I go back to visit my friends. Food is good :)

ik1QF79ZpgWvFwQ9eBKdlQ.text: Amazing food, amazing customer service (thanks Garrett) and above all, had a fantastic time with my family. Keep up the good work guys!

DBk5g1ELanE42cYGr2uIog.text: The place is cute a nice spot for a breakfast I had a three pig omelette, fell in love with the banana nut bread *one of a kind* only reason why i give a 4 star is because the coffee was not the best, it is not a cheap dining place as it looks to be it was a $35 breakfast for 2 for only eggs and ham but only reason why I would go back is because of the delicious banana bread.

nQcnJpNFDhM1eBhG-rZ9sA.text: Very good food at very good prices. A huge menu to choose from.  All the staff were friendly and knowledgeable.  Patrick our waiter, was the best. Super friendly and right on time with everything.  We will make this a regular place to eat.

ldqRnbYkF-dVg3FpG0RORA.text: Best breakfast I ever ate!  Seriously!  I will say - my coworker and I were in Las Vegas for work.  It was a Friday, around noon and we had finished with our client earlier than expected. We did a Google search to see what was available close by for food as neither of us had a chance to have a real breakfast that morning.  After scrolling past several chains I landed on a name that wasn't familiar and highly rated - Egg & I.  I was later a little bummed to discover that Egg & I is in fact a chain, as I had hoped it was local to the area (I was unfamiliar with it being from the Northeast/Mid-Atlantic region and never encountering one before).  I will tell you though - I did not regret choosing this place for a late breakfast/early lunch.  When we pulled up the place was hopping.  A good sign that we picked a good place.  Inside there appeared to be a mix of both tourists and locals.  Although they were busy, we were seated very quickly.  Every plate I passed on the way to the table had breakfast food on it, and it all looked and smelled amazing.  The menu was quite extensive... what you would typically find in a diner.  The omelettes and breakfast skillets sounded especially appealing, and come to find out are their most popular choices.  Our waitress was attentive and very helpful in providing menu suggestions.  When she found out it was our first time there, she insisted on bringing us fresh banana nut muffins - which was a great touch!  The muffins were divine - served warm, they were thick and rich.  Like a really good banana bread in muffin form.  I chose to get an egg white omelette with mushrooms, spinach, artichokes and cheese.  It came cooked perfectly and I liked that the cheese was smothered on top and not actually in the omelette.  It was a nice twist.  The breakfast potatoes served on the side were also cooked perfectly - crisp (and not greasy!) on the outside, soft on the inside and seasoned with a signature mix of spices.  Based on what I've seen online, most other locations do seasoned ranch potatoes.  I liked the Vegas location's spicier take!  It had a kick, but wasn't too spicy.  I liked the blend of seasoning so much, I purchased a bottle to take home with me.  My coworker ordered a skillet and raved about how delicious it was!    Even though the place is a chain, they must be locally franchised and I really liked how the Vegas location had the feeling of a locally owned place.    Great food, great people and it was less than 15 minutes from the Strip and airport.  I'd definitely take the trek out for a meal or two on my next Vegas trip.

_VqOE5Y_4oOoQPhVH_IthQ.text: Delicious food, good service. The restaurant is a happening place! But it only took them 5 minute to get us a table together. We had an omelette, waffle and BLT all good. And a few of their house special muffins! Yummy!! We will be back!

Dt3kCk7e0ojNkaUg1I4eCA.text: This place is one POPULAR and PACKED breakfast spot on weekends that's for sure.  Although they were super busy and packed the one weekend day we showed up, we were seated immediately near the back where the patio seating is.   I ordered one of their scrambles I believe and I got the banana bread on the side as well. Banana bread was seriously super moist and very buttery. I loved it!  Service was very friendly and efficient.   Pricing is obviously very affordable being that it's off The Strip. Once again, we love eating where the locals eat. Best bang for your buck fo sho! Thanks Vegas Yelpers for helping us find this decent breakfast joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fender Bender

H5wBCr-Gn6nqKeCglJCnSg.text: This place is off the strip and packed. Nice little mom and pop type place to eat. The food was good and the people there are nice. Would recommend

OkDiOBUwg5C9rbTeD3JTHg.text: I wanted to try something new for breakfast. I had no idea where to go or what to eat. I came to Yelp like I normally do. Mostly everyone had something positive to say about this place, so my friend and I packed up and headed 15 minutes away to get some good breakfast.  When we arrived, we could tell that it was going to be a long wait and a headache. I sent my friend in, ahead of me, so that I could park. As soon as she walked in, she called me. She said that the place was a mess and she was going to have to come out and wait the 15 minutes it was going to take to be seated. Nevertheless, the hostess pointed out some empty benches, around the corner. So, I walked in to wait.  Upon entering, I was discouraged because a lot of people were standing around waiting. I just knew it was going to take 30+ minutes. Surprisingly, it only took 15 minutes before we were called and seated.  The place is really small and packed to capacity, so I was thankful that we got to sit around the corner where there were only about 4-5 tables. We had plenty space.  The server came around fast to take our drink order. She was quick to bring our drinks back too. She asked us if we were ready to order and we said, "No, we're looking at Yelp pictures and we need some more time." I did ask about the stuff French Toast dish that someone shared on Yelp. She smiled and pointed it out and said that it's a popular dish. Then she left and took orders for people that was around us.  As soon as she walked away, we decided what we wanted, but it took her about 6 minutes to make eye contact again. When she did stop back by, she asked if we were still looking at pictures or if we were ready to order. We went ahead and ordered. It totally slipped my mind to check in and get a free muffin for myself. The waitress said, "You were on Yelp, did you check in to get the free muffin?" I was happy she reminded me to do that.  She came back a couple minutes later and brought 2 muffins. I don't even like banana nut muffins but I took it anyways because it was free. I took a bite of it and fell in love. It was so warm and yummy lol. My friend got emotional lol. She said it reminded her of childhood, when her mother used to make them. They were just delicious.  About 12-15 minutes later, our food started to roll out. I order the Stuffed French Toast with eggs, cheese and sausage on it. It also came with seasoned potatoes. It looked incredible. My friend ordered the 2 pork chops that came with 2 eggs, the muffin, that she had already ate, and the seasoned potatoes. Her's looked delicious too.  I LOVE potatoes so I ate those first. I put ketchup all over them and had a ball. My friend didn't like hers, because they were kind of crunchy, so she gave them to me. I put ketchup on them and finished them off too lol.  Next, I started in on my French Toast sandwiches. I didn't like the sandwiches. The sausages, eggs and cheese didn't have much flavor. I thought I made a big mistake. Being that I'm so smart, I thought to scrape the sausages and eggs off the French toast and season the filling myself. I did, and it was 90% better. I ate the filling separately, and ever so often, I would dip the French Toast in the warm syrup that came with my food.  My friend said that the pork chops were Just okay. They were really thin, for sure. I don't know why, but we were expecting some big juicy chops vs the breakfast chops. I wanted to taste the chops for myself, so she took a bite of mine and I took a bite of hers. They tasted as if onions were the main and secondary seasoning. She was right. They were just okay. She did enjoy my mixture of filling and seasoning though.  The good thing is, we got really full and still had a bunch of food left. I'm sure it has something to do with a humongous portion of potatoes we got and the muffin we were served in the beginning.  The service was like a 3/5 because there was a little piece of hair in my water when the server dropped it off. I asked for another one and she just stared at my full cup for like 10 seconds. I guess she couldn't understand my reason behind needing another one. I didn't even mention it because it wasn't a big deal and I didn't want anyone to make a big deal over water.  But also, I took some points off service, because it took my sever a long time to refill my water, once I had actually finished it. It took her maybe 4 or 5 minutes to check on us, after we finished eating too. We just wanted a box to pack up leftovers. When she did stop back by, we asked for the box, she quickly picked one up, dropped it off and walked away. She came back around maybe 3 or 4 minutes later and told us to pay upfront. We were just sitting there, waiting for her to come back by so that we could pay and leave. I'm glad she did stop back by because we probably would have been sitting there for a while.  Although I'm in love with the potatoes and muffins, I probably won't go back because the rest of the food was just average.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We had a lot of food left...We were stuffed.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I took the sausages, eggs and cheese off my French Toast because I didn&#39;t like everything mixed together.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These thin pork chops taste just like onions...I don&#39;t even like onions.

KgQK5iUNwGCumosXsgJKRg.text: This is my number one favorite breakfast food spot. I eat here, what seems like, once a week. I bring my family and friends any chance I get. The service is amazing and quick. Everything on the menu is delicious you can't go wrong.   My favorite is the Huevos Rancheros with added avocado. You MUST get the Works Potatoes, so delicious. Also, the banana nut muffin is to die for. Their in house hot sauce is also amazing, if you like hotter, you'll have to request the Caliente from your waiter/waitress.

Fd4QTS1bpZQw7YSyAcfopw.text: This place allows dogs on the patio, the breakfast menu is pretty extensive and everything is really good if like eggs. They also have a homemade chili which can be ordered as a chili and eggs dish which is pretty tasty. Can get busy on weekends.

GRGVRUK2z1V12aHDGCITVA.text: It's a coozy feeling place, food is average,   it's doesn't wow me, but so far no complaints.

a6KokU1Z0oHHXNaOIl0p5Q.text: Food was Rockin at a reasonable price with great service! Get the Fiesta Omelette, you won't regret it!

Dz7iy0mwIaRBvKw9g7G-LQ.text: Good food and great service.  Order the gluten free chocolate pancakes.  I highly recommend this place.

vn9bhwupKeo30hDhRUX1Mw.text: Chose this place for breakfast before heading back home. Love this place, we waited about 15 mins before being seated. The house was full on a Wednesday morning. Their menus are cute! They are printed out newspaper style. We were seated and our server, Tam, came around quickly to get out drinks and give recommendations. She was the sweetest! My party ended up getting the Sunrise Mountain, Bacon & Avocado omelette, breakfast burrito, and the hawaiian bfast (not sure what that was called). When the portions came out we were surprised! Definitely shareable between 2 people, depending on how hungry your party is. The potatoes were very interesting! Overall, everyone enjoyed the food, service, and atmosphere.

YLrUXbCS5KvCo53eGIaf3g.text: Awesome food, awesome service. I had one of the skillets and a banana nut muffin. Love in every bite. Would DEFINITELY GO BACK!

p_H2uX2NUZsSIy0aJOBnCQ.text: Great customer service. The food was amazing. Kelli our waitress was wonderful. The spinach, mushroom, turkey sausage omelette was delicious.

JcGFGHhvstgMx6FV3VqNZA.text: Eggcellent (nuk, nuk) breakfast place, away from The Strip & downtown. Had the three pigs omelet, friends had a waffle & the Classic two egg breakfast - all prepared well - Great service & food

kGmDKq4o7g_c0PdRmKS-9w.text: The food tastes amazing! Their chicken enchilada and banana nut muffins are really good. The service was prompt. This place is a must visit for having a hearty breakfast.

b-fMqYM2jmNIwB-K1gIG-w.text: great service and amazing food i love love love the cinci chili omelette   they are always super busy but you will always get ur food fast and great service

OEXwutFO14W83MPBvmOi7g.text: I love this place and they're banana bread! However I found a hair baked inside my banana bread muffin and it definitely ruined my entire experience

dz1bxWHfsS5eLsNNQylQkQ.text: I love this place. I always start with free banana bread. I HATE bananas but I love this bread. Warm with butter. OMG. I order the bandito scramble  because Chorizo is life. Seasoned potatoes, sour dough bread, shole is good! I come here every time I come to Vegas. Service is great, food always just right.

zQmR1wowtws9W35fSItYDg.text: Nice place, lots of different items.  Banana nut muffins were great!  Pleasant staff very accommodating.  Lots of choices and the Bloody Marys were very good.  Will definitely be back

YKaA5G6PFepRVvN7CvGMnA.text: Very good breakfast place on Sahara! I've ate here many many times and give them a solid 4 overall.   Gets a little busy so don't go in a hurry but I like this place a lot. I want to give them a 5 star so maybe I could update later if some minor things change.  Checkout line gets pretty long almost every time so they need 2 cashiers or a faster system.  It takes awhile to get seated sometimes but they did update the seating list so you can get a text when your table is ready. It gives you an estimate on how long the wait will be.  Our quote said 15 minute wait to get seated but it was 21 min, it was a group of 6 during busy time so not bad and that was the longest I have waited.  Food is pretty good, chorizo burrito and mashed potato omelette are very edible.   I really wish they wouldn't give you so many of those weird potatoes though. They are pretty good but not good enough to finish or take home, so almost every customer is sure to throw away a lot, my guess is they through away a few hundred pounds of potatoes every single day because no one finishes them. I would recommend they give you half the amount of potatoes and some fruit which would be so much easier on the stomach and make the meals a little less boring.   I do recommend to stop by and give this place a try though. I will certainly be back soon.   Thanks Egg & I!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sent out overcooked eggs again, I even asked for little runny. Remade but they&#39;ve remade so many eggs for me. Annoying.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sat us at a filthy table today, asked to have it wiped but they didn&#39;t so moved. 10 minutes later they sat someone else without cleaning it!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t recommend the waffle meal, just okay. Burnt my eggs but without saying anything the server noticed and brought more. Great service!

d46Og4ycPL4qew86gD9Vpw.text: This is a good place for breakfast, I came here looking something delicious and not falling for all the tourists trap restaurants in Las Vegas . This place was great the only thing is the wait and the way the place looks but the service, food and prices were great. My wife ordered the apple cinnamon pancakes and I ordered the enchiladas egg omelette. My egg omelette, woah that was so good I loved the enchilada sauce they used on the eggs it had such a good flavor with my fresh coffee. My wife also liked her apple cinnamon pancakes too they were so good. The service was amazing, it you can't get your waitress to notice you just flip the egg sign on your table to help someone notice you need some help. Everyone was so attentive to helping, I cant wait to come back.

lC32eA1TZWjOdWpGHDBWJg.text: When it comes to banana muffin, they have the best one!  I also love their seasoned potAtoes! Their list of food option is enormous, but some just don't feel like it's for breakfast. The staffs were very friendly and helpful. I always get their corned beef, pork chops, steak, i even tried just egg and spam. Food is great!

5nPt0geUjoPoyJO7rdYHJQ.text: Lots of great reviews on Yelp led us to this very busy breakfast place. Big menu printed on newsprint.  My husband had the Works Omelette and it was ok.  Breakfast potatoes were seasoned perfectly and were yummy.  I had the bacon maple cream cheese French roast and honestly I didn't care for it.  Thank goodness it wasn't stuffed inside the French toast or else it would have been sent back. The French toast,  however,  was under cooked and squishy in the middle. Overall it was simply ok.  With so many choices in Vegas, we won't be back.

yVjNSfXgtEvF4odVbGf9HA.text: Tons of delicious food. Definately a must go. I went on Tuesday and it wasnt too busy. We were sat right away. I got the prime rib skillet and it was so yummy. I was able to switch the croissant for a biscuit because I dont care for croissants and it was very tasty. The server was wonderful and attentive. I'll be back to try everything on that menu!!

dzk1eIqQxULK4h0amk2wxw.text: Steak Benedict was sooooo good especially with their chipotle sauce! The service is great, food is great, not far off the strip & sooo worth the drive for a delicious breakfast.  Their muffins are also fresh and yummy!

tK6mX0LwCeSvCxQA75cb_w.text: Fresh yummy food. Your own pitcher of coffee on the table and an outstanding server named Kelli. what's not to like?

vOMk_5RJF51jPcz20n9aYA.text: The best breakfast spot in Vegas,  super affordable food and really good food. You get way more than what you pay for and our server Raul was amazing very attentive and helpful, this place is lucky to have a server as good as Raul.

lqI4w7Z35krsugaIxE2iuA.text: Just your average breakfast diner.  I saw Rachel Ray talk about the place on her Tasty Travels show and I thought I'd give it a try and get out of my "usual" Vegas routine.  But after going to three Rachel Ray recommended places (Vegas, LA, and Denver), I think I'm done trusting her judgment!  We went on a rainy, Saturday morning around 10:30 and had to wait maybe 15 minutes in a small waiting area which was crowded w/ folks trying to avoid the cold rain.  When we were seated I already knew what we were going to order b/c I had Yelped the place and read their menu online.  I ordered the Ultimate Skillet for the b/f (he likes breakfast skillets), and the large Cashew Blueberry Pancake for myself.    We had the "famous" banana nut muffin as our bread choice with the skillet, and let me just say, it was a regular ol' banana nut muffin.  I was gonna buy a whole loaf if it turned out to be good, but really, it was nothing to write home about.  Very average.  The b/f noted that the skillet was made up mostly of their potatoes (another thing that ppl rave about).  I hardly got any of the other ingredients in there so I was disappointed in the skillet, too.  The pancake was alright.  It *WAS* big, as others have commented, but again, no big deal.  It was served with blueberry compote and I thought that helped b/c it tasted sorta dry.  The b/f thought some of the pancake was undercooked b/c he could taste the batter.  Maybe I should've gone w/ the silver dollar sized pancakes?  Also, I think cashews don't really work w/ pancakes (unlike walnuts and macadamia nuts).  The "large" 12-oz glass of OJ was pretty small so the b/f thought it was funny they would call it a "large."  Breakfast with tip was around $25 I think.  Not cheap for what you get.  I think I'll make Dunkin Donuts my new Vegas breakfast routine whenever I'm in town again.

BnTS0a-zTVjok8tShmzOmw.text: Not a good place. Potatoes taste like barbecue potato chips, way to salty. Benedict was watery. Straberry French toast was good but that's it Not sure why the place is highly reviewed.

4emLJZMktML2Mg_yvacGmA.text: Must stop here for breakfast if you're in Vegas! Awesome food and great service, Thank u Carole Ann!! Try the corn beef hash.. Homemade and delicious!

XOC7BGPICJ4l5AbpqV0kkQ.text: came to this place 2 times in a row I'm from California and I wanted good breakfast lunch after having lots of drinks the night before and I couldn't of picked a better place the staff is super friendly and they remember who you are felt very welcomed  one of my servers was Alexa very nice and I can't remember my other server for Saturday but she has curly short hair super nice. omg the food is amazing I has the mexican omelette with OJ and my husband had the 3 pigs or 3 meats omelette the next day I had the same thing and he had a bacon burger which he loved. I will decently go back .also their works patattos are the boom .

yrA5iBBkJ73oMlu70Odd6Q.text: This place was just ok. It's not worth the trip off the strip. I do like that they give you your own carafe of coffee. Much appreciated after a night imbibing in vegas.  Unfortunately the food was nothing special. I got the egg, ham and cheese croissant they brought it late because they had accidently made it with bacon instead of ham but it was still disappointing. it just wasn't very flavorful. They have better ham and cheese croissants at Dunkin Donuts.  My husband was also disappointed with his eggs benedict. The hollandaise sauce was good but the benedict was drenched in it. Moderation people!!

sVmvORYHREVvyrJy1RPlZg.text: Definitely one of my fave breakfast place in town. I used to get the steak and eggs before I turned Pesco-veggie, and it was gooood. My bf and I grabbed breakfast here a couple days ago and I just had two over easy eggs, wheat toast, and blueberry muffin. Muffin is always moist here and it's served warm so butter is a must. My bf got the steak n eggs with ranch potatoes and said he still loves it. Ranch potatoes are always flavorful here. I also suggest the tuna melt here--delicious. Service is good, we're so used to coming here so we don't mind the inconsistencies they have with their service. Although it would've been great if they wouldnt have alot of turnovers with their staff. It was great coming in here and the staff knew our names. But ever since the turnover we don't know anyone anymore except the host lady. Once again, food makes up for it so we shall be back regardless.

gAvGxCyLqbrWdzHhniEOyQ.text: My first time...enjoyed the stuffed strawberry cream cheese french toast! Coffee was piping hot like I love it. Atmosphere was good. LIKED OUR WAITRESS, CHANCE!!! Good service!

SGahzAjfU3OGrRyPyxal2g.text: We came after a fun weekened at the strip. My friend flew in to meet us for a friends bachlorette. And she had to catch a flight back. So we wanted something good but quick. I looked on yelp for a breakfast joint and found this. We walked in and asked if we could sit and eat within an hour. And the host said we could if we sat outside (since everyone wanted to sit inside because it was a bit chilly that day) so we sat outside... ordered quickly... i had the flapper ( eggs bacon and pancakes. ) My friend had the burger . And the other two had biscuits with gravy. Everything came out very fast. We couldnt belive it.also... Crystal was the best server!! She was constantly checking on us and made sure we had everything we needed. So back to the food. OMG. My food was good. But my friends burger with fries was amazing!!! And the biscuits with gravy! But that burger.... lol. Maybe I was a little hungover.. but it was so juicy.the bread was not your typical diner bun. Also the french fries were the match stick kind with great seasoning.. only thing I would recommend is that they mix plain fries with these seasoned match stick fries ... I found myself fighting to eat all of them because It was a bit salty. Other than that I will definitely come back when I go on my weekend getaways to vegas! :)

WF-XUBwUVuzydWzAPxjLvw.text: Delicious! Great variety of breakfast dishes. From different benedicts to a variety of scrambles and omelets. Also non egg dishes like french toast and burgers and sandwiches. Have the country potatoes, they're seasoned and cut into perfect bite sizes. Well worth the 20 minute wait

zJsbwAwYhZt3n3MiweXUCA.text: This place is fantastic, can't believe I never stopped in before. Biscuits and gravy off the hook good. Great service from Amanda!

6Rrqrau6pr5NGtLyIpSAYg.text: The Egg and I has been a staple of Vegas breakfast dining for years and is consistently lauded as one of the best places in town to getcher morning grub on.  It's easy to see why - this is just great, unpretentious food.  While it's fun to dine well in a dinner environment with tiny gourmet portions and fine presentations, for me breakfast is all about big portions and perhaps a little less regard to the appearance of the food.  It just needs to taste good and help wake your sluggish butt up.  The Egg and I offers breakfast staples - eggs, toast, pancakes, waffles, crepes, french toast, omelet, sausage, bacon - in various combinations and specialty skillets and frittatas as well.  Everything is always fresh, cooked to order, and served by a friendly wait staff.  I wish I lived closer, because I'd probably have their eggs benedict every day.

Aw8-yeBNn-Wk7rZihfzq-w.text: I love breakfast food, especially pancakes and omelets.  So when a friend recommended trying this place, I was down to give it a try.  I had high expectations and I wasn't disappointed!  I like how they give you a carafe of coffee when you order a cup (like IHOP) so you don't have to constantly wait to get refilled.  Since I usually drink 3-5 cups every morning, this was a plus.  As far as the food, it also met my expectations.  I decided to try the egg-ceptional omelet (has bacon, mushrooms, ham, peppers, onions and sour cream) and not only was it delicious, it was more than enough food to last me through lunch.  I wanted to try the pancakes as well but I couldn't get it as a side so i tried the banana nut muffin that other reviewers had recommended - it was good but not great, but I'm not a big fan of banana nut in the first place so others may enjoy it, i don't know.    The overall price was reasonable and I prefer quality over quantity and other than a handful of a few breakfast places on the strip the Egg and I is one of the best breakfast places around Vegas.  Highly recommended!

k1s8vEFb25ufyX5KsAKsRQ.text: Great service, decent biscuits and gravy. But I wasn't quite as impressed by the experience as I was led by friends to think I would be. I think I prefer Cracker Barrel.

AafmE3R0-WRyBl4Xk4EJgg.text: Went there sunday am for breakfast with a friend! It was early just had less than a 5 minute wait, the service was good and the price for a breakfast special was $2.49 it was a good bfast 2 eggs, 2 bacon or sausage, has browns, 2 toast or biscuits and gravy! It was a good breakfast well worth the price and would definitely go back again this was my first visit and friend grew up in the area so that's how he knew about it!

UEaYMmNg3mp-ZJRpiTvdjA.text: Never been disappointed in the Egg & I on Sahara in Vegas.  Chance took really good care of us.

1FXzsZsjXSXdJBkw2Wu3VA.text: I'll keep this review short and simple.  If you want a delicious breakfast, go here.  This spot is on point and we couldn't complain about the food at all.  I got the their special corn beef and hash, with two over easy eggs on top and a side of potatoes.  Their corn beef is pulled, not the typical chopped up kind you find most places.  The flavor of this was awesome and the texture was amazing too.  I can still taste it.  On top of that, bust the yolk and it's on!  Wifey had their special banana french toast.  This thing was like a cake, literally.  It didn't have a "bread" texture, but it was rather good, something I've never had before and I have to say I really enjoyed it.  It came with syrup, which was a waste because the taste in the french toast was just right.  Prices are cheap for what they serve, service is good, can't complain as the server stopped by a couple of times to check on us.  The place is BUSY though, so expect a wait, especially on a weekend morning.  Highly recommended and they NEED to open more of these breakfast type spots in this area (booo IHOP and OHOP).

3l598srVAH28AxIMfrRryA.text: The Egg's Benedict Florentine is a great breakfast to start your day with. They have several TV's on during the morning, with the volume turned down and closed captioning turned on so you can still catch the news.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front view from Sahara

3jEUQvKVCZdrVgOzualigA.text: Best breakfast/brunch spot in Vegas hands down! I wanted to buy a chain for VA. Everything taste fresh and homemade. Food was amazing, none greasy, nice portions, and great friendly atmosphere! I will visit every time I come the Vegas!!!

MWmG8ibPp0T6NZ_w6Rt2pA.text: This place served the best corned beef hash I've ever had! Shredded corned beef, mixed with potatoes and maybe some onions and peppers. I'm not exactly sure but yum it was delicious. Definitely coming back for this dish next time I'm in Vegas.  Their blueberry pancakes were packed with plump blueberries. Saved the banana nut muffin for the drive home immediately after breakfast.. Very tasty, once you start you cant stop. The place was packed on the Sunday we visited but the wait was not bad at all. Glad we came here instead of a buffet on the Blvd.

OpHRHdK3hoCUGXjnsS_5bg.text: It blows my mind how this place has the reviews it does. I came back a second time to give this place another chance and I will never be back. All the food tastes like it was pulled off a cheap breakfast buffet and thrown on a plate. It was obvious that the scrambled eggs were made in huge quantities and sitting for quite some time before they were served. And another thing, FLAVOR! One other major components our dishes lacked... badly!

EwldnliCIU61XG2X_mEeXg.text: Eats: Sundance Omelette, side of corned beef, classic benny (eggs Benedict), hot chocolate, and banana nut muffin   Takes: The best friend and I literally planned our Vegas trip around our meals! She's the breakfast person of the two of us, and she ultimately chose Egg and I of the two places I suggested.  Two words: No regrets!  The corned beef was the homemade, pulled type of thing, and not your typical canned corned beef! The Sundance omelette is your veggie omelette complete with a side of potatoes and your choice between a banana nut muffin or toast. This omelette had mushrooms, tomatoes, spinach, and artichokes. The feta cheese is the one that brings this omelette home! The only downside is that protein is extra; I ordered a small side of corned beef. The potatoes were seasoned (they are on the salty side, but nothing ketchup couldn't counteract). The banana nut muffin came out warm and moist! It definitely was the highlight at first bite!   Portion size: Large! Both of us took home leftovers! We went from stomach growling to food baby status after our meal.  Service: You flip the egg to the sad one when you need something. Our servers were very friendly and patient. They gave us recommendations on the menu, one even offered us free muffins for our first visit (before the Yelp check in).  Wait Time: immediately seated on a Monday morning  Parking: Shared Lot  Bottom line: Go here for your breakfast fix! It's egg-celent!   Highly recommended.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Benny with a side of homestyle potatoes

UrlvCRFU_qz11uRlXzwBLw.text: Way past all the strip hullabaloo is a classic diner spot offering the best breakfast deals ever. Quantity wise, I think Egg&I is unparalleled in both the menu variety as well as their portion sizes. I'd recommend sharing dishes to try more items, things definitely come out family style. We had the Maple bacon French toast which had a unique savory-sweet kick to it- you could really taste both the maple and the bacon in the whipped cream cheese! Amazing dessert for sharing. The banana nut muffin that came with the yelp check in had just the right balance of banana, and was moist but firm, great texture that didn't make you feel too heavy after. The veggie eggs Benedict crushed the eggs Benedict game, all the ingredients were fresh and the home fries were perfection. I don't usually like home fries, but these had a special seasoning that was particularly delectable. Also, kudos to Egg&I for having such a great online seating system. You can check using a link texted to you to see your place in line, and turn over is quick and smooth. Anytime I stop by in Vegas I'll be sure to be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PRjb7MkoMz7eczMrr88kWw.text: Great food. In fact for my taste this is the best breakfast in Las Vegas. It is off the strip but with cab ride and more than we could eat we still saved money. Staying at the Bellagio on the Strip with a lakeside room. Needless to say room service for the same breakfast would cost 4 times as much.  We ate at the original Egg and I and Penny the store manager came by multiple times and our waitress (I think her name was Denise).  I like to write reviews when we travel. By far a must breakfast if you are in Las Vegas. I have been coming to Las Vegas for years, cannot believe I haven't found this place sooner. Definitely a "locals secret" so I'm getting the word out with Everyone back in my hometown Tallahassee, Florida.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not the best shot but this is outside and it&#39;s in a strip mall.

K1k3-FIXHh7TyGD8YdOpkQ.text: Sooooo let me start by saying KAREN is soooo awesome! I came in with a group of 8 people and a dog and this amazing woman took great care of us and on her own! She was attentive, didn't hesitate ever and extremely friendly! Karen made sure our food orders didn't get messed up and addressed a minor issue we did have. Our food was so delicious. A great place to eat, especially after a weekend of partying. I do recommend calling ahead to make reservations, especially for such a large group. We didn't do that and Lesly the host with red hair told us it would only be a 5-10 minute wait, seems reasonable. Until it turned into over 30 minute wait time, her giving our table away to someone who called after we were already been waiting and I won't even start in on lack of customer service skills. Either way it goes, Karen and the food were so amazing that we'll be back next time we come to Vegas. We'll also be sure to call ahead of time, right Lesly, right. -Leisah H.

n6mXPwcIqcvKF3pXZ-d3zg.text: So we went there to eat and all I can say was the vegetarian sandwich was wonderful. My wife had breakfast and agreed the food was amazing. The portions were huge so we took the rest home. The staff was so friendly and attentive. We enjoyed our visit and will definitely be back. I can't wait to take my kids there also. Great place.

w5egT8zBWVqamwS1OGxfiw.text: Such a. Great place to eat breakfast!   I had the prime rib egg Benedict.  Not a potatoe person but it was soooo yummy !  Definitely recommend their homemade carrot cake French toast. It's to die for .... I promise   Customer service was great . And I will definitely be visiting again sometime soon !

TPeZRQxFqWwwvtGAA3FdEA.text: So I was searching through Yelp looking for breakfast spots and this place popped up. I'm SO happy I tried it. The people and food our AWESOME. My waitress Tamara was really friendly, welcoming and most important she got all of our orders right lol. She came by to checked on us often.   I ordered the works omelet and loved it. Every bite had meat cheese and veggies. The potatoes was cooked perfect and had good seasoning. I'll definitely will be back the next time I'm in town.

4cgQKlNT4FwHkg4EI-6dbQ.text: CHECK-IN and get one of their Famous Banana Nut Muffins. Who'd dont Live Banana Nut??  I cant wait to come back. I'm here from California, San Diego to be exact. Slid out here for the MAGIC convention. Whenever I hot anywhere I like to eat where the Locals do. With Vegas Being Vegas for the most part it's always some kinda tourist type dining experience. I didnt look at pics or nothin so I was kinda bummed I didnt order the Stuffed French Toast (I was checking in and seen a picture. My wife Yelp'd the spot). I ended up getting the "Sunrise Mountain" not sure But our Server Tamara said it was "Really good". I also want to add that Tamara is A-1 like the Steak Sauce. I overheard her talking to another table offering suggestions, without prompt. See, I dont eat like the average person so I no longer ask for suggestions. That's Dope cause I be places where servers be on some other shit. Not looking. Don't want to talk, really. We're  in a time where most establishments show it's the money not the people. I'm all about Love in Business (Being a small Business owner) cause it shows appreciation to the customer base. Anyway, shes Lovely, made us feel welcomed and comfortable. I just be rambling a lot cause i be having alot I want to get out. Who knows the next time you and I will ever Interact?? If you ever looking for good eats in Vegas I highly recommend this place. TAMARA FOR PRESIDENT 2018

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Damn, so many options. This gonna be my Go-2 when I touch soil now.

Ab6J-onuB-qS9wXgnKsZAA.text: I loved my first visit here. The long drive was totally worth it! I am always nervous when trying out new spots since it is quite the gamble as far as food, let alone service. I found the newspaper style menus, the tablet/card reader at every table interesting. It gave a vintage yet modern feel to the place. My waitress, Denisse went above and beyond and really made an impact on my short visit to Egg and I. She managed to surpass the high bar I expect from smaller chain breakfast spots by never letting me have an empty cup, consistently checking on us without getting annoying and by giving off the energy that she genuinely enjoyed her job.  I truly believe the management at Egg and I treats their employees exceptionally well based on how my server interacted with me and others. And that is the key to a healthy establishment. 10/10 definitely the new breakfast joint.

nqbgly8RbroMvFXViTFObQ.text: Thank you so much Karen for your happy upbeat attitude and great customer service!! Thank you so much Egg & I the food was delicious and HOT!! When we come to visit Las Vegas we will surly come back! The turn around was Fast so we were seated right away!! Loved it!

De9srMJYV160b9AH4pxLZA.text: Wow!!! Amazing.. I love to try local eats and this establishment met my expectations.. I chose the corn beef hash dish w/ the signature muffin and it was great!!! The mimosas were not mixed & I like the fact that you can make the beverage to taste.. A definite go to!!!

bDi6XAO1E6aw94IVbaHjGA.text: Great food, awesome service! But the 2 star review is because of cockroaches crawling around.

XgKQiytxtYI4zW9bZrOg2Q.text: We were visiting Las Vegas on vacation and found this on yelp. The food was great and servers were very helpful and quick.  We had the breakfast in a skillet with the chicken, mushrooms and spinach and a stack of pancakes. Everyone loved the banana muffins too.

B8kHPpgJRHhzQno9D-Zhbg.text: Fast friendly clean this place is pretty great and consistent, get there earlier to avoid waits. Price decent good for kids very clean. Delish off the strip yum

ThuJNHTgUhM5zFi_cNZ-SA.text: I chose this place based on all the great reviews they have. It's has a cozy atmosphere and the food is really good. My caffeine monster was glad they left the carafe of coffee at my table, unfortunately the pour spout looked grody. It needed a good scrub.  Food was a generous portion for the price and it was awesome tasting. The Spanish rice was a little oily.

K-90oorP1xsdihPNdbxypA.text: I ordered the works scramble, but half way through, I'm pretty sure they brought me the Greek scramble. The food here was "good." But nothing really seemed to wow me. I'll prolly stop by next time I'm in town and give another item on their menu a shot.

FE_3ZfW_m5r1uG-DQPWfkg.text: Too much spice on the potatoes! Chili on eggs.... yuk. Was very disapointed with tbis place.

Rqwav72UZql4U8jru509fQ.text: Pretty good breakfast spot if you're in Las Vegas area. I'm not an egg person but i decided to give it a try since my party chose this place. I got the traditional Benny which came out to be so delicious. I checked in on yelp and got a free banana muffin which also was delicious! It wasn't dry or nasty. It was perfect. They also have a cute idea of flipping over a plastic egg to a sad face when you need something. We needed some extra tortillas and flipped our egg to a sad face and they came immediately. My plate came with a side of potatoes which tasted amazing. I'm so glad I gave this place a try! Open to trying new places now.

OjB4II8uLHvCH5w3SVrM0w.text: I haven't even eaten yet and I already love this place.  The normal 20 minute wait for a table at a popular breakfast spot (according to Yelp).  Abby was great!!!  Service is very pleasant.  Angel just swung by to drop off the water and coffee and we had a fun little 2 minute conversation.  Never too busy for friendly banter here.  Menu looks great.  I ordered the Green Chili Hash.  Can't wait to try it!  Also , they have a cool way of letting us get their attention.  See the pictures.  The Black egg means everything is fine; the yellow egg means we need something:  I did a test run (didn't need anything) and they were on us immediately!  That was worth a couple of extra dollars in the tip!  Angel left a pot of coffee on our table which is a plus in any breakfast restaurant setting...  Fast forward 30 mins....  food came out way sooner than we expected.  Cook staff is ON POINT!   Green Chili Hash was phenomenal!  Rice and beans and sourdough toast a perfect compliment.  Better half had the stuffed French toast with strawberries and cream cheese.  Pro tip:  get the strawberry and cream cheee in the side (unstuff the stuffed FT).  Might be too sweet for some but by unstuffing, you can manage that sweet tooth just right!  Love me some Egg and I!!!
