FnrmNNokQcuP4wubv7eDzw.text: Yum Yum! Great breakfast, great service, homey and friendly. This will be our choice from now on when in Las Vegas.

R5ZhpgKRjbGzphMoyuE0Gw.text: GET THE BANANA MUFFIN! You cannot leave without trying it, it was awesome! Everything here is really good, hands down one of the best breakfast joints i've ever been to.

1wIasN6XY8Ke_Q3tCI1ovQ.text: First time there. We had great eggs and stuffed French toast!

rOpLW6zo4QQ4wpMBNQu9Uw.text: I always eat here when I am in Vegas. The food is always fresh and they have a huge menu. If you can't find something on the menu you like, you really have something wrong with you.  I've never had a bad breakfast however I have had a few service snafus but they were easily corrected.  Not far from the strip and well worth the effort.

WIyka7cUKroq_4gbSPRqLw.text: Went back...nothing changed but the service!! TOP NOTCH! The servers were super friendly and our food came out withing minutes....yummy as it gets for cheap...fast and big portions. Please try the french toast sandwhich with eggs and bacon!!

czWuN5D2HclI2QBuSYnTXw.text: Okay. Food and service used to be better. Ordered buckwheat pancakes this morning.  When the cakes arrived they looked much lighter than normal.  Sent the cakes back thinking they were wheat instead of buckwheat. Waitress returned with order of cakes saying the restaurant had changed the batter.  Now the cakes are cold.  Taste was not bad, but not as good as the original buckwheat pancakes.  Disappointing. The waitress did not ask how we liked the "new and improved" version.

fw5xyUaxza9WeQ2txfRqUw.text: First off, I had the cordon bleu skillet, and it was great! Their house potatoes are pretty good, a little salty, but not too much to make me not want to eat them. I would say borderline on the seasoning. The service was great for a Saturday morning, and they were very busy. I recommend sitting outside in the morning, it is quite pleasant with the misters on. The food was very tasty, and the portions are excellent for the price. I will definitely be going back here again.

xIhJ3BQTu2WCiRLdiHepgA.text: Great breakfast!!!! Rented a car in Las Vegas and decided to getaway from the strip for breakfast. Found this place on yelp and had great reviews. So glad we did!!! John was an awesome server and loved the table egg flip card if you need anything :) great idea!!!!! Best pancakes and he even gave us a bowl of blueberries and whip cream if we wanted it. Yum!!!! Great food, prices, service and worth the trip!!!! Can't wait to go back.

OHtcTAB-RMmvXtS8zHgxQg.text: Tried this place this morning after reading glowing reviews.  I found the food nothing to rave about.  It falls far short of the food at any of the Cracked Egg locations.

kTKsg8qc0Ppwfa3rF-4_sg.text: Delicious breakfast here! I love the breakfast crepes they have! And the banana muffins are by far the best I've ever had! Great breakfast place for sure! Skip Blueberry Hill and head here!!!

3U7YnZVH8odaVgQ0HVmhFA.text: Find a 2 for 1 coupon before coming here!  They are in coupon books handed to you the minute you cross the Nevada state line.  For some reason, food tastes better when it's free.  First time guests get a free banana nut muffin.  IT WAS AWESOME!!  I even bought an $8 loaf after my breakfast. I had a chicken sandwich and it was just ok.  My girl had a spinach omelet w/ feta cheese (the Kay special) and thought it was just ok.  I guess after eating the muffin it was just a slight let-down from there.  At least I enjoyed my loaf for the next couple of days after.  I would come here again and order the pancake stack.  It looked really good.  Service is excellent and prices are pretty decent.

VPEZ-nSsgz3SdjyQfVUFog.text: The food is delicious and the customer service is great. I feel like I'm down south.

3BoyoacIuU2dMjD4MV9W3A.text: Food is excellent if you can get it.  We had a table of 7, and 6 received their meals within a reasonable amount of time, except me of course!  Not one word was said to me, so we put an unhappy face on Mr Egg, but I still had to flag down our waitress, which took at least 5 minutes.  She seemed pretty annoyed when I asked where my food was. She said "we can only put 4 orders on one ticket, so yours will take longer". Hmm so why did 6 orders came out???  Finally, someone else came out because of the unhappy face on Mr Egg, and asked what she could do. I said everyone is almost done with their breakfast and I don't have mine. She went to check, making sure that we put the happy face back on Mr. Egg.. A few minutes later, our waitress came back and said that they were still baking the biscuits, and promised that she was watching for my order. Hmm, by then 3 people at my table had finished their breakfast. After another 5 minutes everyone was done eating , Finally a different person brought my order, with the explanation "they poached the eggs, so they had to remake it with my cooked eggs".  Ok which one of you clucks the truth?  So I got to eat while 6 people at my table watched me, so needless to say I ate pretty fast and didn't get to enjoy the egg-cellent food.  I'm pretty easy going when it comes to food orders, as normally we all do our best, But by the time I got my food and had to listen to 3 different reasons, I really did expect for them to take my meal (and only my meal) off of the bill. Was that too much to ask? Well I left with egg on my face, no discount...not even an apology. All I got was a "there now you have your breakfast, you are all set".  Really??? No we won't be going back to that location.

eYmbjb3oMLbDLOTTbRKzzA.text: I don't get it.... I thought the food sucked. The people weren't very nice and the food was mediocre at best. Yeah the banana nut muffin was ok but not like wow! The seasoned potatoes were kinda nasty. I like season salt on my fries but theirs was GROSS!  Maybe I just didn't want breakfast that day... I do try to have a rule to try a place out 2x before I say no completely. I just don't think I will be trying it soon.

pv8hwwZJIhzt8dufulUUnQ.text: Three of my friends and I, all hungry and a little hungover, came to the Egg&I around 2pm on a Monday so it wasn't busy at all. The banana nut muffins are soft delicious fluffy and warm, served to you before your main course comes. The portions are well sized, prices wern't outrageous, but the waitress forgot my friend's toast. I had a crepe, which comes with ranch potatoes. It was much more dough-y that I expected and would have liked. Makes me wish I just ordered a scramble. Overall I liked driving off the strip to see outer Vegas to get good food at not ridiculous prices.

FqzCl12YwkNptvxrjno7cg.text: Wow! Great portions for a great price. Service was great, very attentive by not annoying. This location wasn't too far from the strip where our hotel was. We wanted a descent price, tasty breakfast and thanks to fellow Yelper's I was able to track down this great place. Our group of four were seated fast and by no time we were all enjoying our breakfast's.  For our first visit I had the Egg's Benedict Florentine- Fresh spinach atop canadian bacon, two poached eggs & a grilled english muffin, smothered with hollandaise and served with fresh fruit garnish and ranch potatoes. We all left full and happy. For our second visit I tried CHRISTY'S CINNAMON RAISIN FRENCH TOAST- Cinnamon Raisin bread dipped in a custard batter. Grilled Golden and lightly sprinkled with powdered sugar. Served with Sassy Apples. This is a great spot, it seemed like it had "The Regulars", so that's nice to see they have loyal and satisfied customers.

DziwWyU7oBhjvQiI0Cq6fA.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting Las Vegas for a convention, we wanted breakfast before we headed over to the convention center, so I asked him to find something.  He found Egg & I.  It wasn't far away, the parking was good, we were seated immediately, and after we ordered we had our food in under 10 minutes.  Our waitress was friendly and fast.  I love this place because you can ask anyone to get you something, you aren't just tied to one wait person.  You have an egg posted by the table, you need something you flip it to the unhappy yellow side, you are happy you leave it on it's happy side, when they see the yellow side they come over and see what they can do for you.  We had biscuits and gravy, which were piping hot and tasted good and served different ways.  We also got coffee, and they left the pot at the table for us.  How cool is that, no waiting to refill that cup when it's empty.  Love this place and will def come back when we visit Vegas again.

6kydvM2hn7tbKqTifnF3kQ.text: Just ok breakfast.  All too often, I believe people mistake quantity for quality.....They just serve a truckload of potatoes and make them seem exotic by putting a little paprika on them.  Everything is ok, but average.

le8e2Zch2aWZm9xVmwxJDQ.text: Loved this place for breakfast off the strip!!!  Wish there was one in San Jose!  Check out the back page for the Hawaiian Portuguese and eggs.  IT was awesome!  Mom (old school Hawaiian Japanese) loved it big time with eggs and 2 scoops of rice!  Coffee and banana muffin was excellent.  We bought one to munch on the plane ride home.  Excellent friendly service.  Definitely a can't miss in Vegas!!!

tvZ2_l7XarY3UUJN0sUBXw.text: My fiance and I came to this place twice on our last trip to vegas.  I can't tell you how much we liked the place.  The interior was unique and so wat the menu.  The portions were big the coffee was hot and the atmosphere was great.  Good service both times as well.  If you're looking for a great breakfast or lunch joint that blows dennys or ihop out of the water here's your place!!!

x-am4peGe2wLqXEDPV6Rfg.text: When in Vegas this is a must, either when we just drive in, if early enough or right before we are heading home.  Check in for your free banana muffin you will not be disappointed.  Reasonably priced, good service and amazing food.  Everything I have tried (chile relleno omelet, enchilada omelet, pancakes, steak and eggs) have all been delicious.

nqUABcDoTo0YD2pKNHi4YQ.text: Every time we come to Vegas, we have to stop here! The best breakfast spot by far. Off the beaten path, but definitely worth the drive. Great service too.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak w/wheat toast and breakfast potatoes

DlkFxoepz9qZymmUehDErQ.text: Very good menu, good food, excellent ambience. Would definitely go there again  when i visit next time.

NGmNFUUBDMPflQf923gvlA.text: We stopped here for breakfast two months ago when we were on our way to the Valley of Fire State Park. They had a huge selection of breakfast choices! We stopped here because I read about their cornbread, which did not disappoint. In fact, we bought a loaf to take with us on our day trip. The service was quick and friendly. If you're in the area, then I would definitely recommend stopping in for breakfast- you can't go wrong!

cmNIbiC6tsTt4fNejGBNGQ.text: Excellent food and ambience. Came here for the first time on my friend's recommendation and it was completely worth it. Started off the meal with the muffin which was great. Definitely coming back for another breakfast.

smfmRIMtS-gw8pZoiOfWmA.text: Awesome customer service. Best brunch I've had in a while. Great coffee and banna Mifflin too.

aRE6TYKmJC05V8jKbCkpHw.text: My basketball team, along with some parents went to breakfast at this restaurant. We were immediately seated with waters and and great service. Our food came out quickly and was delicious. I had the Santa Cruz Breakfast Burrito and I would highly recommend. Also the potatoes were fantastic. Overall it was a outstanding experience.

zNWAtY5_18KTEoUjtlsPYw.text: After many years of coming to Vegas and being condemned to expensive hotel breakfasts, we decided it was time to venture out. A 10-minute drive from the Strip is this breakfast gem. The menu is a small newspaper. Literally. A massive selection of eggs and other breakfast favorites means there is someone for everyone.   We both ordered egg dishes and they were huge portions at reasonable prices. A little more than $20 for the two of us; and you can eat here cheaper than we did if you want.   It's a no-nonsense diner-type atmosphere inside focused on fast service. The staff was fabulous. Our server, Karla, was like a best friend from the moment we sat down. They have these "smile and frown@ signs on the table. If you are good, you put up the smile. If you need anything, you put up the frown. They watch for it and respond quickly.   There's a great outside patio and its dog-friendly. It's also a very kid friendly place. Plenty of space even at prime breakfast time and there was no wait. They turn tables quickly.   One thing of note:  they give you a pot of coffee. But on other drinks, refills are not free. Fine by us since the drinks they serve are very large.   What a great find!  Thanks to Karla and the staff here for giving us a place to come back to when we are in town again.

eDVBdFkXFc-teonXBr2o2w.text: This was my first time here and everything was amazing! I had the Works Scramble and it was delicious. The potatoes are some of the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had. They were so crispy and delicious. I was brought here with a friend and her family and they raved about the banana nut muffins. I'm not a huge muffin fan, but omg these are a must have! SO MOIST. Our waiter Patrick was the best! He was so kind and very attentive. He made the experience that much better. Definitely recommend! It gets pretty packed, we waited about 30 minutes for a table, but it's so worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lth6Xvy-bVeTQCwdsbXjUg.text: Came here for brunch on a Saturday. Waited 15-20 min for a table for two, and ended up with a nice spot in their shady outdoor patio with water misters. Out server, Amanda, was really sweet and we enjoyed the service. However, the table next to us had some interesting service...they asked a server for silverware and were told there was none left!!!! What?!?! They also waited a long time for cups to pour their beers into and were eventually told the restaurant was out of cups? WHAT?!  Food was great though! Got the classic with two eggs, toast, and delicious potatoes!  The paying process was annoying. You pay afterwards at the register, but it took us ten minutes to wait through the line just to pay!

33TDDM1UugXrJZBaAHRL1Q.text: Food bomb specifically the Diablo potatoes an eggs. Price great never a long wait. Not to far from the strip an you saving cheddar only makes it better. All I have to say is GO NOW!!!!!!!

qm-yXrN3fSL2POwUNpBuXA.text: Alike so many Vegas go'ers we were looking for a Good Breakfast place after our late night out on the Strip. As always, I turned to Yelp. I was craving Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs. my cousin wanted an Omelette and my Niece wanted pancakes or waffles. Yelp brought up several options and I read the reviews. The Egg and I had everything we wanted and the reviews were good. So, off we went. We got there pretty fast from the Strip about 15 mins. Upon our arrival the place was full. We were told it would be a 10-15 min wait but a table came up outside rather quickly. It was a hot day but we were starving and they had cooling mist sprayers which helped a bit. We were greeted by our waiter OSCAR who was friendly and hospitable. He took our drink order, mad some recommendations from the Specials and left us to figure out our orders. He delivered the drinks with these Bannana Nut muffins we didn't ask for. I didn't want the muffin but after I had a pinch I was hooked. Yes, it was warm and delicious. With the size of my breakfast I decided to save it for breakfast the next day. We placed our orders and no time after that we had our orders. The food looked and tasted great. The portions were large and pippin hot. We were all silently eating and enjoying our meal.   Ok for the review. I am really specific about my chicken fried steak and I rarely get it because it usually sucks unless my mom or Southern grandma made it. But this one was quite good I must admit. My only complaint was with the potatoes. They were cooked well nice and crispy but was a bit salty. I prefer to add my own salt to taste because of that. My family agreed that their potatoes were also a bit salty. But overall our food was delicious and the service Great!!  Oscar is truly great at his job and we truly appreciated his service. We would gladly go to The Egg & I again without hesitation.  Oh....and the Bannana Nut muffin was AWESOME the next day with coffee :-)

1USjD10uPR4p-sQ44Zsqpw.text: Place is about 10-15 minute drive away from strip. There was a short line when we arrived Monday at 9am. The line went fast. The server we had was prompt and accommodated our special request. My friends bday that day, she made something special for him with the famous muffin. The serving is huge and can be shared by two people. Food arrived fast. They have a wide selection of omelette, Benedicts and breakfast menus. Check in at Yelp to receive free muffin which I took mine to go, ate it the following day and still tastes good.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasoned potatoes was awesome!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Muffin! Thank you guys for starting our day right :)

sH-2TuEY02VrwCQhRxmnMw.text: I finally got to eat @ Egg & I this past Saturday, 03/30/13. Monday comes along and I'm back in the office and I read that a car plows into this restaurant. WTF? I hope everyone who was injured in this moronic act a speedy recovery. I also hope they are able to be fully operational again ASAP (if not already).   Egg & I is located minutes from the strip on Sahara. I believe their other restaurant goes by the name of Egg Works. This restaurant is open everyday but only between the hours of 6am-3pm. We got plastered the night before and somehow were able to wake up and drive our zombie behinds to eat here the next day right before noon. The wait wasn't too bad considering the restaurant isn't too big to begin with.   Our server Jacky was a sweet heart. She was uber friendly and attentive even when it seemed like the restaurant was chaotic. How many other tables did she have with a bunch of hung over dudes, possibly acting a fool beats the hell out of me. She was holding it down like a seasoned veteran. She started us off with that infamous banana nut muffin. This is not to be missed especially with a cup of joe.  Not going to lie and say that this place serves health conscious types of food. They may have some "lighter" dishes but the menu is dominated by heavy hitters. Everything we ordered was either smothered with country gravy or had some sort of heavy but tasty sauce. We thought of this great game plan to all order our own entrees and add an extra French toast plate to share amongst the five of us. Bad, bad decision. One entree is an adequate amount of grub. Anymore, you may want to check your blood pressure.  There are plenty of choices on their menu and as you can imagine, numerous egg inspired dishes. From skillets to classics, you'll find something for everyone. I had the Country Benny, you can look it up yourself. Let's just the menu states, "This one's a heart stopper." Need I say more? That dish was good but I also hated life afterwards. No regrets, it was delish while I was conquering that beast but just be ready for the consequences.  Egg & I is definitely a hit. I can see why locals and tourists flock to this establishment. We ate here and I had to immediately go back to our hotel to pass out and recover in time for night two. Only in Sin City...

v4TqPnCEvyLdNq8u5l_Y2g.text: Lot of food and amazing muffin .. but too much cheese and long wait .. just had a coffee and no latte or cappuccino available

AKl1ahHDc9P4EenIlD0W8g.text: Portions are HUGE!! If you are in Vegas, make sure you stop here!! I HIGHLY recommend this establishment!!

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OMG!

zn3RrcWi7ZwHm0JiLxYmtg.text: The Egg & I is a Las Vegas staple for breakfast... Their maybe a five minute wait for a table but it's worth it and that alone be should tell you what you're in for.   I'd like to add that Amanda our server was tremendous!   Her friendliness and professionalism did not go unnoticed.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3NnQLd8oPy4TcDokKi0htw.text: Was here in Vegas and came here for the first time! Awesome food with wonderful staff! The veggie omelette is amazing and you get a free banana muffins when you check in with Yelp! Highly recommend!

tkdU4wfYl3XYZ4MwYkn1rg.text: Chance was phenomenal! The food was amazing, defenitly worth trying if you are in the area. We had the Mexican omlete and the strawberry stuffed french toast. The chocolate banana muffin is a MUST try!

QURfMHu6y5qnR6L8GM0byg.text: I went for breakfast with my granddaughter.  The food was good, but the service was slow, Guess it may have been because it was Sunday.

NaaugQjIALTz2_qCBoBmBw.text: We went for breakfast.   Service was excellent  and both of us really enjoyed the food.  I had the veggie egg Benedict. Highly recommend  it.

aTDBDEjf9Bb9OBX2pK-vsg.text: This is the WORST breakfast place I have ever eaten! I have worked in the food and beverage industry for 18 years, starting off as a Jolly Roger breakfast server ending up at Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, and everything in between. I do not understand how this restaurant has such high reviews. The pancakes are so rubbery it's hard to cut and tastes doughy and undercooked. They DO NOT use real eggs! My husband ordered a ham & cheese omelet. The eggs tasted watery and you couldn't even taste the meat. The Diablo potatoes were over seasoned but the most decent tasting thing on our table. The apple juice tasted like it was dispensed from a moldy dispenser, it has a funk to it. I ordered French toast, and even that was tasteless! We will never eat here again...oh and my husband felt so sick after eating he threw up. I asked the waitress about the rubbery pancakes because my arms were literally getting sore while I was cutting them and she really had no response, and just asked me if I wanted a new one made. Maybe they used to be good long ago,  but not anymore

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasteless french toast! Yuck!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy restaurant with the worse food ever!

4m4J-3R41vaddMZkscohLg.text: We came on a Sunday morning 11:00 there were 5 of us and we had a short wait maybe 15 min. Seated, drinks and time to peruse the extensive menu!  A stuffed chilli 4 egg omelet was the winner! Also making the cut list choose your own omelet, Chile verde with eggs any way beans rice and tortillas , a fruit plate that would feed the whole table, another Chile and chorizo omelet.  All in all good food and lots of it. The Bloody Mary mix tomato juice was great! Thanks Robin for taking care of us. And your very own pitcher of coffee !

eParO-yPy6HE_ni1N9uZew.text: Love this place and Karla is a gem, she's always on point! Consistently great food and their banana muffin is too die for. Great coffee too! Sometimes they're busy, but it's worth the wait.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benny with bacon

ZNC7USYBENyjXTokH7b8EQ.text: EGG-CEPTIONAL OMELETTE:  The Three Pigs (diced ham, bacon and sausage, topped with cheddar and jack cheese) $10.25 ~ Love this! You will love it as much as I do if you like cheese. A lot of fillings and omelette is served with crispy cubed potatoes. 9/10  Mashed Potato (bacon omelette with garlic mashed potato, topped with melted cheese, onions and sour cream) $11.25 ~ Mashed potato is very filling. Huge portion of omelette and mashed potato stuffed in it. ~ 6/10  EGG-CREPES:  Works Crepe (diced bacon, ham, smoked turkey, sliced tomatoes, onions, cheddar and jack cheese, served with poppy seed dressing) $10.85 ~ Not too bad. This egg crepe has a lot of different fillings that compliments each other really well. Taste really yummy. 7/10  California Crepe (diced bacon, mushrooms, tomatoes, guacamole and Swiss cheese) $11.25 ~ Really really yummy! I love this dish the most! The guacamole makes it refreshing.  ~ 8/10  SKILLET BREAKFAST:  Santa Cruz Skillet (seasoned chicken breast, green chillies, onions, homemade Santa cruz sauce) $10.99 ~ Don't like this at all! Too meaty, too saucy and too heavy for a breakfast. 3/10  1st visit: Server Brady's service is really good. Our table is always on "Smiley Face" as he will constantly walk over and ask if we're doing ok. Good service!   2nd visit: Server Amanda is very attentive to our needs. Ensuring we had all we need. Great service!  Tips: ~ Check-in and get 1 FREE Banana Nut Muffin ~ Love the Happy and Unhappy Face on the table. If you need attention, flip to Unhappy face, if you're happy, flip it back to Happy face. ~ Write a review on yelp/tripadvisor and mention your server's name and they're one step closer to win a trip for 2 to Disney California to meet Mickey Mouse.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flip to Happy face if service is good, flip to Unhappy face if you need attention from your server
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scramble eggs

5Zxto293LBc246NfTHAadQ.text: My sister worked for this chain in TX- but the NV locations are completely different, with a country twist and a more innovative menu that includes Cincinnati chili, of all things?! I rolled my eyes at all the four- and five-star reviews and then I went for myself.   CHILE RELLENO OMELET: Huge and delicious. Wish there was a bit more red chili sauce on top but it's oozing with cheese and packed with green pepper strips and flavor. Side of RANCH POTATOES is addictive,  banana but muffin was a nice sweet treat. BF had the daily special, a BRISKET BENEDICT, which was also solid- tender meat, perfectly oozy eggs, and more of those crack-style potatoes.  I get it now, guys. They execute massive portions of tasty food with a side of genuinely friendly country-style service. This place makes me miss home.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket Benedict

UgjYEmE_m0vON1ikILFVNw.text: Asked for my breakfast burrito not to contain bacon. They served it with bacon, I'm a vegetarian. Spoked to the manager and took care of the situation. She turned a bad experience into a good one. The food was delicious, our go to spot when visiting Vegas. The server and manager took care of us, thank you!

9dCKJdC2kY3xWyYEpXX7wA.text: Great breakfast and lunch place.  Love the egg Benedict. Their potatoes are my favorite! Decent price for good food.

x21h_2QESj5Re4DpTK9TDg.text: Love this place! Large menu, great service, great tasting food. I have to keep writing so that's what I'm doing. I already said what I wanted to say

1yQOrwKbVH99jz-dwTEDvA.text: Been l to egg and i many times just not to this location . We brought the dog because they have a dog friendly patio and it was very nice outside . The portions are on the big side and the service was top notch . I got the bacon and onion skillet which was very cheesy and hard to mess up . We also got the stuffed French toast which was good but we will probably skip next time for better options . We had a couple bloody Mary's which were very good as well . Overall a good experience and we will definitely be back for the patio experience .

nByoYa7n3rVZCuvIJtwHDg.text: Great breakfast. Santa cruz skillet was super good. Awesome service. Evelyn was a great server.

JE55xbU7qjfC8Lsx09MYpw.text: Showed up at 1pm on a Sunday and got seated within 15 minutes with a 4 person party. They sat us outside which we didn't have a problem with. Though usually you get asked if this is okay by the host. Our server seemed to be busy with the number of tables he had but soon took our orders. I orders the Blackened  Prime Rib Benny with potatoes. It was exactly what I hoped for. The prime rib was cubed and well seasoned way better than what I expected (a slab of prime rib that would have been difficult to eat with my eggs benedict). Two of my friends got the crazy chicken omelet and loved it and the other got a simple breakfast with biscuits and gravey. The side of fruit was pretty legit as well. Over all a great brunch!

O7YSE69GjpegCWg8hsqb2w.text: This place is soooo good! Their bacon, avocado omelette is delicious and full of flavor. The potatoes that come on the side are amazing! We had excellent service, our waitress was so friendly! The menu has a lot of options. Highly recommend.

gfEs2WcIW4rTN-Zr5G1IPQ.text: In spite of its obvious chain affiliation, the food is better than average.  First, there is the Chicken Fried Steak Skillet.  Just so you know, the CFS has a crispy crust, cut into bite sized pieces and placed on top of their mini crispy potato cubes.  Topped with a good tasting, creamy gravy, this dish is really good.  I had to restrain myself from ripping it away from my son.  The Hanks Scramble contains fresh spinach, mushroom, tomato, and cheese.  I don't know where they went wrong, but I have had much better tasting vegetable scrambles.  It was a disappointment mainly because it tasted way to bland. Dumping their house salsa on it redeemed it considerably.  Then there were the pancakes and bacon. Decent pancakes, but nothing that stands out.  The bacon was salty but not smoky tasting and rather flaccid.  I like crisp.  Good, not great.  The Waffle and Bacon combo was similar, neither the waffle nor the bacon were crispy.  I really liked the serve yourself carafe of coffee left at our table. Got it hot.  Got it exactly when we needed it.  The service was excellent. Maybe part of that was because they did not need to run around filling coffee cups instead of taking care of more important matters like getting food out of the kitchen fast. Smart.  This was ok, but we shall continue to search for the ultimate Mom and Pop places in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On each table.. R...U....happy?....mad?
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A veggie scramble with lots cheese. Called Hanks Scramble.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak skillet. A good one. The gravy is slightly too salty, but still good.

2Dnwb03GC-BxFoEFky0cWw.text: Huge portions, yummy banana nut muffin to start. Quick and friendly service. Yelp has not steered us wrong. Never would of heard of this place without yelp. Great way to start the day!

bVEMBahWh85F11EerP_pkA.text: Have amazing Banana muffins!! The menu is pretty big and most things on it sounds great. Their omelette was good and their side of potatoes was in small in portion. I left with a fill stomach and a yen for more than one muffin. They can be crowded but are worth the wait.

8AHgkVqk20k2uzVKbyY7vw.text: This the most favorite place for breakfast in all around the las vegas. Home made style, with a variety choices. You can customize every thing. They have juices and hot tea and hot coffee. Every things are really generously lot like every portion is good for 2people. Flask of coffee or hot tea and so on.  Also, during the weekend the waiting time was almost 20 mins, but this time during the weekdays and 7 am there was not at all.

3UHzdemGKBUq-vHrX3tyRA.text: If you're looking for a casual and affordable (and delicious!!) breakfast off the strip, this is it! It was our first time so they gave us complimentary muffins which were outstanding. Our waitress was so friendly and made us feel right at home. I couldn't decide between the bacon or sausage so she gave me both. The potatoes were amazing--definitely get a meal that includes those. My husband got the chicken enchilada omelet which was the best omelet he's ever had (see photo).

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchilada omelet! SOO good!

h32rfKSLpgjgafg6ulIKTw.text: Four words, homemade..........banana..........nut..........muffin.  With so many reviews for this place, what could one gather from this review?  1.  Much much cheaper to eat at than on the strip. 2.  The drive is close by from the Stratosphere. 3.  Portions are VERY generous and filling. 4.  Service is outstanding with many smiles (thank you Amanda).  =) 5.  Hot sauce selection extends from regular tabasco and tapatio (thank goodness!). 6.  Saturday mornings are a little less crowded than Sunday mornings. 7.  Homemade banana nut muffin. 8.  Parking in a shared lot.  BIG TIP:  Be sure not to wait until 10:30am to get up and eat here or else you will be waiting.  So why leave the strip to come here??  To be honest, I wanted something good for also a good price.  You know that dry, empty feeling you get from some run-of-the-mill restaurants?  That breakfast where you are happy that you ate it, however, it just settles in your stomach because it has to, not because it wants to?  Exactly!  Here at Egg & I, you get breakfast that is prepared with meaning and with purpose.  Wonderfully filling and satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Works Skillet and Biscuits n Gravy

S8Nq_lhEV5zk3QZLk4bWmA.text: One of the best breakfast spots I've ever had. I ordered the "Stuffed French Toast" It had sausage and eggs stuffed between two pieces of french toast. The potatoes were slightly mild in seasoning and full of flavor. The coffee is great; the price was great for las vegas; and Maggie my server was incredibly approachable.   Oh, also free banana muffin when you check in via YELP!  5/5

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. french toast sandwich = amazing! Tots were nice and mildly spicy!

pdF8PD88QhEcPqwm8VC-3Q.text: This place has terrific food. Friendly staff and great sized portions! I had the loco mock haole style. It was awesome! My daughter had pancakes with strawberries and they were excellent. My wife had eggs Benedict and she loved it.aIl together for breakfast for four people they cost about 50 bucks... it was a much better breakfast than most of the places that we ate at on the Las Vegas strip!

tZLBdSaPt83kcnptHjdbXg.text: It was worth driving off the strip to eat at Egg & I. There's no reservations so expect a long wait on the weekends. The portion size is huge and I really enjoyed my hearty Works skillet breakfast. We were all very surprised that they brought out a mini bottle of champagne for the mimosa. That's really generous and the bottle was very cute. Price point is cheap especially compared to places on the Vegas strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Works Skillet

zTuaQS_jSglREMz_iCZJnQ.text: This is a great breakfast option off the strip. Took my family here for breakfast recently and had enjoyable experience.   It's about a 10 minute drive from main casinos, located in strip mall. Popular dining spot for locals and gets packed on weekends. Luckily, we arrived early before the breakfast rush and were seated immediately. Good thing too, 20 minutes after a bus load of people arrived and place was full.  Country style atmosphere and decor provide the perfect backdrop for their food. Both indoor and outdoor patio seating is available. Old-fashioned breakfasts are the specialty here, including huge omelet platters, pancakes, eggs benedict and a large selection of house specialties. Prices are reasonable and large portions. I highly recommend trying their famous banana nut muffin. OMG, so good! Super moist and the flavor profile is off the charts. I got mine free with my Yelp check-in. You can also substitute the toast that comes with your breakfast entrees for a muffin.   We ordered "The Works" scramble, Fresh Veggie omelet and the Hawaiian breakfast spam and eggs. Everything was fantastic! Served in large skillet, the scramble was yummy. It's loaded with sausage, ham, bacon, onions, tomatoes, green bell peppers and mushrooms, served with hash browns and topped with the fluffiest scramble eggs. Enough for 2, I literally devoured everything and no regrets. I loved the taste and texture of the hash browns, lightly crisp and tender. I usually prefer shredded kind, but this was equally nice. Of course, who doesn't love spam and eggs for breakfast? Simple Hawaiian-Pinoy breakfast done well here, served with steam rice. Just the way us locals love them.  Most of the time we usually dine along the strip because it's convenient. Egg and I was definitely worth the drive and waking up early for. Service was excellent too. Our server did a phenomenal job, friendly and refilled our coffee regularly. Still thinking about those banana nut muffin. Looking forward to coming back.

c29b5lObUY6zHyeFaBbGOA.text: Food and service was great. My husband had the Chile relleno omelette and I had the French toast. Both were great. The banana muffin was also good. My picky daughter ate her scrambled egg and muffin. Great value and quality food.

NrNIWFftp6zrPTN1u8PROQ.text: Delicious.  That's all you need to know.  Excellent, friendly service.  There was a wait, but it was well worth it.  We have definitely found our go to breakfast place in Las Vegas.  I think we are finished with buffets or eating at the hotel cafes.  We just wish that there was a location closer to us.

AQ535mIIx52ohrSi9E7U-Q.text: Great selection, wonderful people. We will definitely go back. Parking was not bad, the kids enjoyed the fries. Coffee is awesome!

CrEvXyJw2n9FuNgUaVb1gA.text: Penny was my waitress (angel sent from heaven above) today. Aside from the food being spectacular, Penny was the sweetest most beautiful human being this planet has ever seen. She encapsulated everything that is good in the world of sit down breakfast establishments. For eternity I will always compare my future breakfast experiences with the one I had with Penny today. May her and her seed be blessed forever.

VAhU3QLmNFy65zK2HXa3qw.text: Egg & I is such a good program. It's fantastic chief! You can't lose, especially if Penny is your waitress. She really cares about the customer experience and making sure every face has a smile. I love her. Penny is the best of the best when it comes to making muffins.

nnaM6j-y5fiwRuL9JJmZDg.text: This place is bomb! Our group got free banana nut muffins and they were unreal. They came out warm and were super tasty. Penny was an amazing waiter and kept our drinks full and our food fresh and hot. Everything ordered was tasty, from burritos to waffles and omelets. Job well done.

Ht1n2SB_34mWvF7hRm-amg.text: A great place for a hearty American breakfast close to the strip, not walking distance, but worth the visit. There's always a wait, so be prepared. Don't dare walk away.   On my last visit I got the corned beef hash with wheat toast and their breakfast potatoes. It was delicious! I also ordered their mimosa... which serves about 2-3 regular mimosa servings.   The prices are really reasonable for what you get. Don't forget to check-in on Yelp for your free banana muffin! It's to die for!

Bwyon56tyXFEQoAnVoV_ZA.text: Love this place. Large selections to choose. Beginning with banana nut muffins, so moist and soft, perfect sweetness, this is most ordered item here, I guessed. I ordered a California Crepe included diced bacon, sliced mushrooms, diced tomatoes, guacamole and Swiss cheese, I replaced diablo potatoes with fresh fruits. Food was so tasty. AWESOME good. My husband ordered a Cordon Bleu Chicken Skillet which is seasoned chicken breast, diced ham and Swiss cheese served with diablo potatoes. He liked his food except for diablo potatoes. Lol.  Service is fast and attentive. Would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg &amp; I addresses

5s7f5DPEMSmbb0a-3R5lSg.text: Coming off the plain we came straight here because they have great reviews and a ton of them to back it up. Their menu is like a newspaper and it was pretty large. There are plenty  of options for everyone from Benedict's to omelettes to burgers. We were a party of 11 and we were lucky enough to get seats right away and right next to each other.  I ordered the Works Skillet. It had peppers, tomatoes, mushrooms, ham, bacon, potatoes and eggs. It was off the charts delicious. I also got the banana nut muffin instead of toast, which came out first. It was a very good and if you check-in you get a free banana nut muffin (I got 2nds). Not only was the food good, it came in a timely manner. I can eat a lot and I thought it was plenty of food. A lot of my friends had to take half of their meal to go!   The server did an ok job on greeting us and bringing us our drinks. She wasn't the best server in the world but she did a great job with our large party.  She kept our drinks full and we had plenty of napkins without asking.   Overall, I rate this place a 5. It was great food, great service, and quick food at decent prices. Even though I tried some of my friends food that weren't very good, everything regarding my experience was great. Highl y recommend you try this place!

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin. Great!

HJqb_MrBtScyA-4lOpgOAw.text: I am ordering like crazy here. It opens early at 6 AM and there are already people waiting in the line. Well, I am on the line too. What's better than hot ages and fresh-cut fruits to start your day. I just checked in via Yelp app and they gave me a check in bonus - 1 free Banana Nut Muffin! Very good, I just love those type of offers - just check my self in and here we go something free is on the way. The Egg and I is a really good place to have breakfast, lunch, and brunch. They are serving in huge portions two plates are enough for 3 people.  One can eat outdoors too. The prices are affordable.  Plates like French toast with scrambled eggs or Stuffed French Toast are even cheap. Quck service and friendly staff.  During my last visit, my wallet was lost. Actually, I lose it in the toilet.  A few hours later a manager called me to come and bring my wallet back.  With everything inside! Thank you guys!

IZhI3UqfoOg73VfEX10lhg.text: Amazing breakfast place with lovely staff. Even tasted their fresh hot banana nut muffin. Good mimosas! Would definitely return here for brunch.

-1bqIMc-k_SxgJmb_hGymQ.text: We arrived at 10am on a Friday and it was packed. We were given a 20-25 minute wait for a party of two. The waiting space inside is really small so you go in and give the hostess your name and their app will text you when your table is ready. Then wait outside for your own sanity and fresh air.   Once you are seated, they give you the cutest menu because it looks like newspaper. This whole place has a very homey vibe. There is a good mix of locals who know all the waiters and tourists who are overwhelmed with the menu (me). Our wonderful waitress, Karla, suggested that I got the Chipotle Pork Eggs Benedict and I was so glad I listened! But I'm not here to talk about that. I'm here to talk about their breakfast potatoes. They are THE BEST, crispiest, best seasoned breakfast potatoes I've had! They are cut into small crispy bites and are so well seasoned I almost burst my stomach trying to finish them all.   All in all, there are so many damn delicious things on this menu. I doubt you can try them all even if you went every day. I'd definitely recommend it if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smokey Chipotle Pork Benedict

bBKJnq_26u0N_nMZ0a3omg.text: I was excited to eat here. The place was busy for breakfast, but the wait for a table was not long. This place is a standard spot to get breakfast with a nice variety of options. My omelette was good as well as the potatoes that came with it. I chose the banana nut muffin over toast. The muffin was a little too dense for me, but I enjoyed the breakfast as a whole.

U5Pm-K8r7NkVSkP7TfdBlg.text: Tamara gave us excellent service here. Everything felt like home and the food was great. Food always tastes better when the service is fantastic.

TXZ2rjoj_20wTHyq-4hYHw.text: Usually where there good food there's horrible service, but the wife and I have found a diamond in the rough. The food was amazing, prices are reasonable and service was among the best I've had. It's a ten minute drive from the strip, but it's WELL WORTH IT. Your tastebuds will thank you, and so will your wallet.

QSvv5Dhb4jUt-3IsFGHe5g.text: This place is very cute and the wait staff is fantastic. If you are a True coffee drinker you will be happy to hear that once you order coffee a personal pot of your own is dropped off at the table as well!!! My husband ordered the works skillet. It had three types of meat in it and two kinds of cheese with potatoes. He was very pleased. He also ordered the banana nut muffin when given the choice of that or toast. THE MUFFIN WAS THE HIGHLIGHT OF THE MEAL! It was brought out piping hot and delicious. I ordered the veggie works Benny. It was really good. Eggs Benedict on an English muffin with spinach tomato and avocado with hollandaise sauce; it was served with potatoes. Very good. The Benedict egg was a little more watery than I expected, but fresh and still very tasty. I would definitely return!

hwVw1G6C-BWRRGjvYAmeWw.text: Good place to have a relaxing morning by yourself or with somebody else. Great food and awesome staff. Plenty of free parking and short distance to walk of need to. Food came relatively quick and we were given a complementary muffin while waiting.

E7KjwZbtfp1T7RpFfLZMAg.text: In short.... BEST breakfast ever! Their menu is huge, the waitress and staff were super friendly, they even leave the coffee carafe at the table so you're not hunting your waitress down for a refill. And the portions!!! WOW we both took home left overs. Will be back for sure & also Sit on the patio it's beautiful outside.

X2nlmfaXHrApegm17NY_cQ.text: It's long story starting out with something I was looking forward to - trip to Vegas but individuals I was with didn't mention to me I'd get no sleep by going because they didn't get room till next day so I tried to make best of and was starving but waited for others to eat earlier, at different location. I was literally feeling like I'd been run over by something just wanted to relax and eat. Blonde waitress obviously doesn't know my plight and added insult to injury by comping someone that already ate two hours prior and had not been in dire stress situation like myself but I didn't know till after the fact.   I ordered eggs and they were green but I couldn't bother with changing anything then I thought to get order to go. Anyway everything got me sick and I'm sick to my stomach realizing the waitress judged me because I was dead tired from what was not my fault and rewarded the other person for what ? I'd like management to contact me it's ridiculous service and food was awful. Why the good reviews who knows maybe they were comped too and the ones that pay get crap food.

Cs23rXp1Zfu70TYnpFwACg.text: The food was amazing. Just for the fact that I had my little sister here and my family was done eating before they took out her order and all she had was a kids pancake. I had the burger with ground beef bacon and cheese style and it was amazing! The best part of the food is the seasoned French fries!

iFDXUl4IOxrYXe2V3Kh5EQ.text: Absolutely delicious!! My husband & I actually went twice on a 4 day trip. The corn beef was to die for! The Egg & I was the best breakfast we found in Vegas & we stayed on the strip. That says a lot! COME HERE!!!!!

kwURspqe0lEw-IbeKXLq3g.text: Love coming to Egg & I. They have so much variety on their menu & the food is delicious with generous sized portions. Don't even get me started with the banana nut muffin! They also sell it in loaves. The only thing is..seating is crowded inside, have to be careful about space since the tables are so close together to accommodate long list of customers and the parking isn't the best. Service is hit or miss especially when busy but they do move fast!

C9USqakq59Rr2A2ZsEze5A.text: In Vegas for a work convention but stayed with an in town girlfriend before my convention. Wanted a breakfast spot for the locals and after reading reviews chose here.  When we pulled up (Sunday noon) lots of folks waiting outside. Went in to be put on the list. For party of 2 in or out seating, they said it would be a 15-20 min wait. Cool. They use a text system. When you click on the link, it tells you what place in line your party is and how many minutes you've been waiting. Very cool. We ended up being seated inside about 27 minutes later- no big deal, it is Sunday.  I got the veggie skillet, light cheese. Exactly what I was looking for, the veggies were cooked to perfection. My friend got country fried steak. We also got a short stack of pancakes to share and the banana nut muffin.  The muffin is very delicious! Pancakes were pretty good 4/5). Country fried steak and gravy-a little salty but still veryyyyu good! Be warned, A LOT of potatoes come on that plate.  Service was very timely, our server Curtis was great and attentive.  Our breakfast was $31 so great value all around!

nuIVfeeOphCVXzB0ygG8Xg.text: Always a wait, 20 min to 60 min, but always worth the wait. There is a reason why this breakfast restaurant finds itself on all the online lists of places to eat in Las Vegas, it is delicious! Mainly, the habla diablo seasoned potatoes. Order a skillet, and these potatoes will be nestled among your skillet choices. You won't find these anywhere else, and they are worth ordering! They sound spicey, but they aren't too bad, they just have a slight kick with the seasoning, but nothing that is going to make your mouth run hot.  I have tried several other dishes, and they are all great, but don't stand out much above other top breakfast places. The portions are nice sized, and you are going to get your American breakfast standard fare, no weird or fancy twists to the meals you know and love. They do have mimosas.  The ambiance is not my favorite. It is bright and the tables are pretty close to each other. The walls have farming murals painted on them, but it's not the most comfortable dining experience. The chairs and tables are pretty old and slightly worn.  The service has, on average, been quick and good, though not the most attentive. They have an easy fix for that though, as they have a cute little egg character that you can switch it's expression from happy to sad if you need anything, and someone will stop by very quickly.

WHq0et5JwXGSm_J0VH2c5A.text: Great customer service and homemade food!  Ambiance was perfect for families,couples or just to have lunch breakfast by yourself.. portions are really big we all left half the plate

QkiorReQdVjBNrTbQ0rRtg.text: Not impressed. Service was horrible and each plate was missing something from the original order. Really disappointed.

PZxq3P2R3Tc506IgPVs04g.text: I couldn't be happier with the food and the service at this place! I'm here visiting from Boston with a couple of friends and all of us were completely satisfied. Food was delicious and had large portions of everything. Probably the best biscuits and gravy I've ever had, spices on the potatoes were amazing, everything tasted really fresh. Our server Lacey was very friendly, patient, and had fast service! Do yourself a favor and ask for her when you go there, you won't be disappointed :). 10/10 will definitely be coming back here when I visit again!

qWK9S89skg2aX3BCnf0RiA.text: Top notch meal! Had the Stuffed French Toast. It was a great breakfast. You get more than your money's worth. Def go for a visit while in Vegas. We came pretty early in the AM so there was no wait. Waitress kept our drink filled. No complaints here.

HNs8_l5TbMFHjT-R9rrELw.text: Wide variety of dishes sure to please all tastes. Biscuits and gravy were very good. It was very busy but Linnea and the rest of the staff did a great job of meeting our needs. I will eat here again.

XInD4qtbf8-r3UxmDu4MgA.text: So bomb! Got the apple walnut chicken sandwich with fries. Fries were a little over seasoned but sandwich is so good.

VLNfeojITo3HQseKnxzRow.text: Absolutely delicious.  Our server, Genisis, was wonderful & even took good care or our dog while we dined on the outdoor patio.  I highly recommend the omelettes, pancakes, & potatoes.  The banana nut muffin was warm & soft, crispy on the outside, & so good that we ordered a third one!  Much better than the high-priced bland Casino breakfasts.  Worth every penny!

8l0x2Lei3yro8_N0q_isIg.text: When my brother was in Kindergarten last year, he got some sort of award for some achievement I have since forgotten, which resulted in a coupon for the Egg & I/Egg Works. I don't think we ever used it, but I had looked it up on Yelp last year, and remembered it had good reviews.  Fast forward to yesterday, 4/2/11. While eating a breakfast of homemade blueberry waffles and chillin on the patio, Lawrence T. was telling me all about how much he loved breakfast foods - all kinds. I was trying to figure out where we were would eat before we headed off to The Adventure Dome later during the day (we ended up not going.) I was bummed when he said breakfast foods were where his heart was, because it's my least favorite meal of the day.   Around 2 PM, after driving around and me not remembering the names or addresses of the places that I wanted to try on the west side (where he lives) I spotted "Egg & I." Despite the fact I'm not into breakfast, I decided to suck it up and offer this place as an option because Lawrence had told me he liked breakfast so much. It helped that I vaguely remembered that it had good reviews here on Yelp.   Upon walking in, you get hit in the face with the "breakfast" restaurant smell. You know what I'm talking about. We were seated immediately and took it all in. Lawrence was all into the fact they had soccer on their tv and that they had a zillion choices on their menu. Despite the extensive choices, not too long after sitting down, we ordered. I got the tortilla soup and house salad with ranch, and Lawrence got some omelet and fruit... and was mistakenly given a humongous side of the most delicious skinny fries ever (the problem was quickly remedied by a pregnant lady who worked there bringing him the fruit he actually ordered.)   The tortilla soup, while not the type I'm used to was SO good, I could not stop eating it. The house salad rocked, especially with the sprouts on top, and the ranch dressing was on par with that of The Mad Onion (aka DELICIOUS!) I didn't try any of Lawrence's fruit or omelet, but the few fries I stole off of his plate were the best fries I'd ever tasted. Yeah, they're that good.   I have to agree with Bonnie G.'s statement that, "You know the food is good when you are so full and you keep eating."  Lawrence kept eating his fries, while saying he should stop because he was tired of fried foods... but they were too tempting, even when blanketed by napkins on top to hide them from view, hehe.  I was so full toward the end of the meal, but my salad was so good, it was hard to finally push the remainder away.    For our meals + coffee + $5 tip, it came out to $27 and some change. We both confided over our meal that we weren't sure about how good this place would be when we pulled up to the place, but after trying the food, it was super bomb.

AsNtve0ubCgbweB6bnyKCw.text: WOW!! You HAVE to come here for breakfast!! The homemade Banana-nut Muffin is to die for. It comes to the table warm, spread a touch of butter (not that it needs it) and succumb to a pleased palate.   Our server was Stacie. She's from Boston originally, so give her a wicked awesome shout out!!!   Will definitely be back this trip. You can't come only once. Those muffins and great service are addicting!!!

BMIseQhrhHmqL_gWLpYAwQ.text: Don't let the strip mall location and dodgy/sketch exterior fool you, this place is good stuff!

Kg4Spz_zRjpIXv1ytvEXHw.text: Went here thinking there was gonna be avocado toast. LIES!!! there was just toast. and avacado. what the crap.

1IZb8yvSHrMjYCMncPqE-g.text: If you're visiting, this restaurant may not be walking distance from your hotel, but it is very much worth driving to! Also it is not overpriced like most places in Vegas. Do not surpass the banana nut muffin! Order it, it is delicious.

LU8A-abPt4EvkOkT-sQPLw.text: This place was horrible! Did we come on a bad day or what?   The 4 of us decided to stop in here for breakfast before making the 10 hour trip back home. We decided to give this place a try as it had really good reviews.   We got in and got seated pretty fast, there was quite a few people. I ordered a vanilla latte coffee whatever and it was way too sweet. I feel like I might have gotten diabetes from that coffee.   Aftwr looking at the newspaper menu for a few minutes I decided on the chicken fried steak skillet since I am a big fan of all things chicken friend. The 3 others got the Mexican omelet, I believe that is what it was called.   The food came out pretty quick, first glance at my chicken fried skillet made me queesy but I was hungry and I thought it can't be that bad. The country gravy was gelatinous. It was weird. Like a slime blob of gravy exploded all over my food. Whatever. Give it a try.   It didn't taste that bad but it didn't taste good. It was very salty and I just couldn't get over the slime gravy so I stopped eating. Everyone else with their Mexican omelet had tears streaming down their face. Apparently the omelet was too spicy to even enjoy. My partner is Mexican and loves her spicy foods. She is obsessed with all things spicy, tears will be streaking down her face and she will still say it isn't spicy enough, but even she struggled with the omelet. Maybe not that it was too spicy but that it tasted like crap spicy.   Anyways, about 10 minutes after trying to eat my slime it hit me like a brick, I made a beeline to the bathroom and was in there for about 10 minutes only to return 5 more times.   As you can imagine the 10 hour car ride home was horrible. Never again.

fbOX6Ce11xkuUEfuDFCTpw.text: I go to Las Vegas a lot for vacation, and I frequently rent a car so I can get off the Strip a bit. Until recently, I didn't really know of anywhere to get a good breakfast off-Strip. Then I found the Egg & I and now I eat there. Every. Time.  The food has always been delicious. The banana nut muffin is to die for and if you tell them it's your first time at the restaurant, they'll give you one for free. I love free things.  The portions are huge and - how shall I put this delicately? - perfect for when you're hung over. My friends and I ate here the morning after the Rock & Roll Half-Marathon last December and it was like being in hangover heaven.   If you live in LV, or you're visiting and have a car, go to the Egg & I. Heck, it's even worth the cab fare. Trust me.

gOtf-bbjQGwVTNiOR40EyQ.text: Everything was great.   Carla , the waitress, was especially friendly, as was all the staff.    Crepes, burrito, buffalo wrap and strawberry waffle: all outstanding. Large portions.

t3k2EVWXZzTZTCO_D0JH4g.text: After waiting for 35 minutes waitress comes and tells us she forgot to put in our order. Used to love this place but the past two times I've eaten here you can tell that they don't care about customer service anymore. Go to egg works or jamms because The Egg & I has went downhill. What give no stars. but that is not an option. Really miss the good ol Days when people actually cared about getting the customers served. And she started off by saying she was going to take a couple of dollars off the bill for making us wait for 35 minutes. I have no problem waiting for good food. I have no problem waiting in a long line. But when your customer has placed an order and you just completely checked out from putting in the order there is something wrong and you really need to look at what you're doing.

mjudmOweneQ1xrR0YZhUZQ.text: Love! The service, the food, the spot is perfection!!! Highly recommend!!! Parking is not a problem and everything on the menu is divine!!

RsF8retonIutpPnN8zFY6Q.text: I some times go here for breakfast. The food is delicious and the service is great, anytime something goes wrong the waitresses try their best to fix it. Just at a flip of the egg that is sitting on the table.  i love their Muffins with coffe....

6zfH104HU0N0tdBU5UO1OQ.text: WOW!!!!  This is a bit off the strip, but worth the ride. Food was amazing. There are so many choices on the menu!  Make sure you bring your appetite!  Portion sizes are HUGE!  Prices are very reasonable!  Definitely go here if you have a chance!

7OTarqIwQ0KTXPBJP6go2Q.text: Karla was our server, and totally fantastic. Incredibly attentive, fun to chat with, quick service. Also, really great food! Biscuits and gravy were amazing.

PrDwfVlXb56W000iHRKv1A.text: Oh don't get me started on the fresh baked muffins they are amazing! And the food comes out faster then you can say "sunny side up!" I was getting bored of the same old breakfast joints like Denny's or iHop, they're just not the same! I took a risk with Egg&i and it's a risk I'll take again and again! They're menu has literally everything! From eggs to burritos, skillets to forgein! You name it! Trust me you won't regret spending your hard earned money here. I've never wanted an establishment to take my money so bad.

2z9yY3IkAxE7EBybGeSDLg.text: This place is highly overrated. I've eaten at way better breakfast/brunch places that are also reasonably priced and give you large portions. The major difference is quality! I was not a fan of their potatoes and I normally love potatoes. But there's is clearly frozen potatoes that they just fried and added some powder flavoring. It also was overcooked. I got an egg omelette and they are suppose to be famous for "EGGS". So why was my eggs overcooked as well?! My whole family and I were not impressed whatsoever with the quality of food. The service was ok. Price is reasonable. But the quality of the food and the ingredients weren't that impressive. As mentioned, this place is highly overrated.

iwoGCP9uk_KbvFj0GGirHw.text: Holy moly! First of Karla is the best. You'll be lucky to be a table of hers. Not from Vegas but I'll be absolutely coming back anytime I'm here in town. Banana Nut Muffins...enough said. Just what everyone needs in their life.

WgNYBWMok9gYdNiJiDghCw.text: Great menu. Something for everybody. Friendly and fast service. Must taste their banana muffin. Perfect poached eggs with many benny styles. My husband got the breakfast burrito and really enjoyed their sauces. Will return again.

LJhkMgfkwbJsPvBm3B09sA.text: I love this place, it has the best service. And we always come here because the food is so good . Not to forget the Banana Nut Muffin.....

jfIRG4jaIvy5nDY4YqB9Kw.text: Third time is the charm. We love love love this place. Servers and waiters are super friendly. Tamara especially sweet and nice . She gave us two banana muffins for checkin on yelp. Foods are super comfy and feels like grandma's cooking. We will keep coming back for more for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best breakfast in Vegas

9lRFqeCoNKPvWK-c4pAJyQ.text: Solid breakfast joint!  We decided to go off the strip for breakfast this past weekend to save some money. I swear we always spend at least $50 on breakfast when we eat in the hotels. Breakfast at Egg & I was under $30 :)  They were busy when we arrived and we waited about 15 minutes to be seated. They put us on the patio, luckily it wasn't too hot yet and there was one table left with shade. It was tolerable.  Service was decent but not over the top. They have a system where if you need something you flip over a plastic egg on the table and the waitress will come back. Seems like they never check on you unless you flip the egg.  Breakfast was good. I had the eggs benedict with bacon instead of canadian bacon. One of the bacon slices was too fatty and not cooked enough, but the other one was good. The hollandaise was tasty, although a little runny. The potatoes on the side had a nice flavor to them.  BF had their daily special, which was Cinnamon Roll French Toast. It was really good, had a custard batter. Too sweet for me, but he enjoyed it a lot. That was also served with a little cup of yummy cinnamon apples. I liked those very much.  You pay at the register, which is kind of annoying because that area is already super cramped with people waiting and there isn't really anywhere to stand in line to pay without getting in somebody's way. Overall though, a good breakfast place. If you're willing to drive a couple minutes off the strip to save some cash, I recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict with bacon
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Roll French Toast

L71Mk2KYaRyOEwZE_0YzuQ.text: Great off strip breakfast spot. I had the chicken omelette smothered in Havarti cheese. Cooked to perfection. The potatoes here are outstanding. It's got a half fried/half baked feel to them. I prefer these potatoes over hash browns. Pancakes are good sized and fluffy. The portions here are very filling. 2nd best to hash house a go go in my humble opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge portions!

GyfHydnpLhgxxwysMTN80A.text: I came here today with a good friend from out of town who wanted some breakfast while he waited for some car servicing to be done.  He let me choose the place and this was it.  I've driven by a lot of times and never stopped.  That was changed today.  We were seated promptly and were served coffee and water promptly while we looked through their extensive menu done in the form of a tabloid newspaper.  I got the Benedict's Garden, a vegetarian Eggs Benedict.  It came with English muffin halves on the bottom, then sliced grilled tomatoes, some avocado, and topped (the menu says smothered which is close) with Hollandaise.  There were potatoes and a side of some fresh fruit.  My friend got the Mexican omelette which was the special of the day.  Everything was really good.  My eggs and the mixture of avocado and tomato with the Hollandaise was quite good.  The breakfast potatoes were really flavorful and the small slice of canteloupe and fresh pineapple was like having a dessert at breakfast.  My friend thought his omelette was one of the best he has had.  Be prepared for a large breakfast.  The omelettes are listed as four eggs.  We chatted and passed a considerable amount of time.  Service was fast and cheerful.  It was a good way to start the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flip the oval over and you have a yellow sad face.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Condiment holder with smiley face.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benedict&#39;s Garden.

spz5Tq_KD17RQqL0eG0x3Q.text: Once I pick up the rental car from the airport, this is always my first stop for breakfast. the menu is huge, staff friendly and the food is filling and good. one of my favorite breakfast stops. dont forget to check in for the banana muffin.

7Jy26fairb86hE40V_6OFg.text: Amazing breakfast I had their French toast sandwich and it was the best breakfast thing I e ever had! When I'm back in town I will definitely come back here for breakfast! And the service is amazing and fast!

izxkrxqtoIiOvsCcei6_fA.text: Breakfast was great and servers are always making  sure you are being taken care of .

xkTsAkugLIO9iZ7GI_9Rpg.text: Best breakfast to end our trip. I've been to Vegas five times, so I'm always on the hunt for the places that are not on the strip or not as famous. A Google search brought us here. The breakfast burrito was amazing and the salsa is very good. It tastes authentic and had the right amount of heat. Since it was our first time, we got to sample the banana nut muffin. AMAZING! I'm ready to go home and make a batch of my own! They come out warm and have room temperature butter at the table. Winning! The potatoes are seasoned, crunchy on the outside, and fluffy on the inside. Very reasonably priced, too!

Y9ATdIey_WU2Wx4zsPADfA.text: Omg...the best omelette I've ever had. The works add avocado, won't disappoint. Service was excellent. I'll be back. Highly recommended. Banana muffin moist & warm.

VVqX-03EpRyK6j3sduTO9Q.text: The food was excellent!! Everyone in our party raved about their meals...sunrise mountain, breakfast skillet, and the stuffed french toast...oh and we cant forget that banana nut muffin (omg!). We all agreed next time in Vegas this will be our spot. Service was great. They even sung Happy Birthday to my friend. Oh and expect a line for Sunday brunch, but so worth the wait.

UEvIN_3BV9Soy8Zchv4j7g.text: The Eggs Benedict is the best I have ever had at any restaurant. I have been searching for the best Benedict for years and this tops the cake. I am so satisfied and so happy I found the perfect place, even if it isn't in California where I live :( Service was incredible as well! Thank you so much for this wonderful experience. Ask for Patrick as a server! Tipped 50%. He is amazing. :)

yV1KK-4j9y_gScdtTOIhbQ.text: Great breakfast spots are my favorite and this is one of the best I've ever found, thanks to YELP.  One of the most innovative breakfast menu's I've seen and particularly impressive is the ability to execute so many offerings to perfection.  Service was outstanding, our waitress, Jessica, was fast and efficient.    The feature here is undoubtedly their banana nut muffins.  They were excellent, rivaling the best homemade I've ever tasted.  What amazed me is how they can produce as many as they have to do to supply this very busy and fairly large restaurant.   They were warm and obviously very fresh and tasted as good as most any homemade.  They have a slight gingerbread taste to them so I suspect molasses is a part of the recipe.   I know how much work they are to make homemade which is why I really admire their dedication to featuring this treat.    The food was really good as well, because they wouldn't earn any points from my son who doesn't eat anything with bananas in it.  I feel my opinion was well founded and based on a total of three banana muffins- mine, my son's, and a free one as a YELP check-in bonus.  I carried two out and enjoyed them later in the day.  I had the three little pigs omelet which was great.  The potatoes were done to perfection- crisp on the outside, evenly done throughout with a nice seasoning on the outside.  My son had a western omelet with tomatoes substituted for the potatoes.  A nice patio is outside with misters to help battle the Vegas temps and low humidity.  It's no question this is a premier spot to enjoy a wonderful breakfast in Las Vegas with just a little drive from the downtown strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio with cooling misters
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Western omelet, no carb substitute tomatoes for hashbrowns

A-h8w6YMa8Fl7QfboqNLBg.text: Best place for breakfast! If you are in town looking for a good restaurant to have breakfast, this is the place I will be coming back for some more!

BXnyGovZaL5hzHJaf2FMkA.text: Normally really good but today was a total miss. In our group of five one person got and ate his complete meal. Two people didn't get everything they ordered. Two didn't eat there sandwiches one because of taste and the other because of the sandwich itself. Was really shocked and amazed. Server must have been having a super bad day. Made the first mistake while serving drinks (15minutes after we got sat) and it just never got better. We eat here or more often at Egg Works and normally it's amazing or at minimum pretty good so that made today so much worse. The manager made a good effort but one of our party who didn't eat so a little offended by the coupons she gave us for the problems. Buy one get one half off. I didn't have that much of a problem with them but she thought that was kind of rude. Service bad, food substandard, orders incomplete and you offer a bogo? I am sure we will return but still very disappointing.

dCIapStI8lkhkoeDCKH5dQ.text: This is a good spot if you like omelettes period Our Mexican omelette was pretty good, potatoes were good not great. Overall i wouldn't rage about this spot but well worth it for the price and service.   French toast strawberry cream was amazing.  Banana Muffin was superb as it came out so fresh  Service was A+  coffee was 3.8/5 good

M5BRJNBgiz33oEj0bKs0Jw.text: Had a wonderful breakfast here! Karla was an excellent server- very friendly and hospitable. We checked in on Yelp and got free banana muffins. The muffins were so delicious! I had the mashed potato omelette and it was very good! You can also substitute fruit for any of the other sides if you want a lighter option. I would highly recommend coming here! The line was out the door at 11:30 on a Friday but for two of us it only took 15 min to get seated out on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed potato omelette with side of fruit and whole wheat toast!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We had a make your own mimosa experience! Only $7- great value!

s36LNmQd9cBp9fPSJa3SoQ.text: Came in for breakfast while in Vegas based off of Yelp reviews, trying to stay off the strip for some "real" food and I am glad we stopped in.  SUPER friendly and hard working staff.  Lots of food.  Great banana muffin.  LOTS of potatoes on your plate with their Habla Diablo seasoning (really good seasoning, I even ordered a bottle to go).  I ordered the chile relleno omelet and it should have just been called a green chile omelet as the paper was not stuffed with cheese or anything as the menu claims.  Still good, but not a relleno.  My wife's scramble was also good.  They are really good in their offerings goo, if you don't want potatoes or toast they have all kinds of things you can substitute for; cottage cheese, fruit, tomatoes, etc.   Nice job guys.

nNVuzg14yO6P8EofRWcjtQ.text: Soooooo goood!! I added steak to the chili relleno omelet!!! BOMB.com Manuella was amazing!!! She was very attentive and polite... we were outside and even though it was cold she alway made sure to check on us!! My table never had a sad face!!

QXdyxduzmswaY3XuyDQRDA.text: Went in for breakfast and I must say , this is a must visit for breakfast lovers.  The portions are big and price is apt.  We ordered the 'Garden Benedict' which was mouth sacking delicious with their hollandaise sauce & their seasoned breakfast potatoes & 'Bandito Scramble' with seasoned potatoes on side which was amazing too. Their service is top notch and they really value their customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garden Benny
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bandito Scramble

3VWx5YGshGvk-xYah9FQlQ.text: I crave gravy eggs. I yearn for a dashing scramble, a plate of glorious orbs! The Egg & I satisfied every desire in my egging--sorry--my aching heart. Seriously, note the following reference to a study in Heart journal:   "Researchers studied nearly half a million Chinese adults over nine years and found up to one egg per day led to a lower risk of heart disease and stroke. Experts have pointed out, however, that participants in that study were not eating a Western diet."  As long as I'm sharing some of the truths about the benefits of eating at The Egg & I, I might as well touch on another universal that all patrons at the Egg & I should consider: the complimentary banana nut muffins. Each person who sits for an entree is gifted these savory, ethereal bread saucers that fly off the plate and into the palate. Every person who sets foot in the Egg & I moist try the banana nut muffins. They're surreal.  The entree I ordered rivaled the appetizer in quality. A member of the attentive waitstaff recommended I try the blueberry waffle. This dish ended up being a simple and refreshing repast. Each berry retained its dewy blue vibrance. I mowed through my plate so quickly I nearly neglected to try the dish the GF ordered.  What a rich breakfast the Mexican Crepe proved to be. Eggs, Chorizo, Onions, Green Chiles served with the Habla Diabla salsa that's sure to bring the heat. I burnt down all my old eggspectations about crepes because of this hot commodity. I will have to return just to be certain the crepe was that outstanding. Would that I had set aside my waffle a few more times.   The merchandise for sale at The Egg & I is not too shabby either. $15 gets one a quality tie dye shirt featuring a Grade A cartoon of a couple of super mellow, hippie eggs. Peace out dudes.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You are bananas, nut muffin.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The comprehensive menu.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peaceful egg folk.

fdQFY4Sz1R_1_hQ56K5qsw.text: Great Food, Great Service, and the menu has a huge selection.  I highly recommend the potatoes with their special seasoning. I was really impressed by how quickly they could seat us even though they were crowded. They also got our food out fast. I love the idea of the kiosks at every table where you can pay and tip the moment you're done.

QNZKzTl22l0xM1fXlYm9ng.text: This is a great place for breakfast, far from the madding crowd that is the Strip! The options are nearly endless and the portions are very generous!  We enjoyed the prime rib Benny and Mexican omelette. So I highly recommend those two menu items. Don't forget to unlock your Yelp coupon for a free delicious banana nut muffin.  And if you're really lucky in Vegas, you'll get Manuela Gomez as your server and she will bring your food with the best smile and service!

Qx9kKGN_xG0pH-QVGdkoMg.text: A surprising Easter egg (pun intended). A nice, soulful place with quality breakfast items. I went as part of a group that ordered their crepe, eggs benny and some sides. The benny was delicious - nice, rich, fatty. The crepe was fine, but a little too eggy. It was a thin omelette rather than a crepe.   Oh! Their banana-nut muffin was a highlight. I'd definitely suggest grabbing them. Moist, fragrant and flavorful little domes of joy they were.   Seems like a place that has a lot of wait, so if you can, go during the weekdays. This place was a nice, homely change from the hullabaloo of the Strip.

Yo6Z0VKwDGrWpBY7Ms5mHA.text: NOT BAD... I havent done a review in quite some time. Egg & I though I feel is worth commenting on. The serve huge portions & have a very prompt & courteous staff. The dining area was well lit & open. They also have outdoor seating as well with a mist sprinkling from above to help give some relief from that Vegas heat. For some reason tho I just cant give them 5 stars. I guess I just wasnt blown away but yes I'd eat here again.  My wife said her Egg & Chili skillet was salty. Other than that there were no other complaints.   Like I said "Not bad"...  Here's the breakdown... Service: 5/5 Food: 4/5 Restaurant: 4/5
