KwqDe629YjTSAnFJgo5jCA.text: Perfect hangover meal! Huge portions, hot, flavorful great prices...come with your stretch pants    we ended up waiting 45mins to get a seat but we were served immediately. Menu had a lot of options, so we ended up getting a little bit of everything and couldn't even finish it all.  it's not the type of food you'd take to go but really yummy for the time being.  It's only a 10min uber ride from the strip, can't wait to go again.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. classic and side of pancakes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baileys &amp; Joe

Yk8E67OxflvtjRH2SgEgiA.text: Stopped in yesterday for breakfast. Called ahead of time to see what the wait was like since this place is highly desirable. Said the wait time was around 15 minutes. Showed up like an hour afterward and the line was out the door. The wait time was still about the same. They had people in and out. They ask for your preference when you check in to see if you prefer to sit inside or out. Then text you when your table is ready.  When you check in on Yelp you get a free banana nut muffin, which is pretty good. The Country Fried Steak is a solid choice that comes with 2 eggs and seasoned potatoes. The Bacon Maple Cream French Toast was okay, not really my thing. The French toast itself was good but I could do without the bacon maple cream cheese. Overall, a cool little spot to check out if you are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Maple Cream French Toast

RVPh8igC0XZhtqpuDmm0iA.text: We stopped here on a road trip thru Vegas. This place is just as good as the other locations I have been to. The eggs benedict were good with overly generous portions of potatoes. A mainstay whenever I visit Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. eggs benedict

lUgrWByTdiofHeJlbcjDrg.text: Favorite place to come eat! Every time I come in there's never a complain about anything. I love there potatoes and banana muffin (:

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love there muffin

m8o5zetW4tUh2ocnbgjSxQ.text: It's been awhile since I've been back here, but managed to have breakfast with some friends!  Yes, there's a wait...but the food and service is well worth it!! I ordered the avocado omelette with a side of fruits(cutting back on carb loading), very tasty   The waitress patiently waited for us to order(5 in our group) and everyone enjoyed their meal, and even complimented on how often they got refills of their drinks! Kudos on the service and our meals, we'll be back again soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A view while waiting outside...

6iXs7Lu67kKz3HmLVmjZ6w.text: Some of the best places to eat in Las Vegas are off the strip, I was in the mood for breakfast and got out my Yelp app and found Egg & I and off we went.  We arrived around 10am on Saturday and where seated right away.  The menu is intense, its big and packed with a lot of great sounding dishes. I knew I was in the mood for a skillet, so I went with the Fiesta Skillet which came with a banana nut muffin.  The banana nut muffin was fresh and warm and huge and tasted great and disappeared quickly.  The Fiesta Skillet had green chilis, onions, tomatoes, cheddar & jack cheese, habla diablo seasoned potatoes and 2 eggs over easy. This was a great tasting skillet and just what I was craving for breakfast! The habla diablo season potatoes were not spicy at all, but seasoned well, was hoping for the spicy factor, but hey that's what hot sauce is for.  Egg & I is a great place to grab breakfast off the strip, I'll be back next time I am in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut Muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A4jZXsP8xTaSapYSSiJr5w.text: First time here with my Sisters and I really wanted to like this place. My coworker mentioned this spot to me several times and I was so looking forward to trying the stuffed French Toast. Okay, that didn't work out well, the french toast seemed to be missing something, I wasn't really WOW'd seemed somewhat dry and yes I did dip it in syrup but it still seemed like eeehhhh. The seasoned potatoes would've been tasty but were well OVER SEASONED, way too salty. The highlight was the warm banana nut bread which is A MUST TRY! It's brought to the table seemingly right out the oven and if you slice it in half and add a little butter....WINNING! OK, so our server was Perry who was polite and patient although he did seem to be a bit distracted, possibly because it was busy. Sis and I ordered the bacon stuffed french toast and out other sister ordered a scramble. She reported the scramble was very tasty and it looked appetizing but she also said her potatoes were very salty. We sent our french toast back and decided to share the works waffle which I clearly stated I wanted to be very light and not crispy although that is not what we received and to top it off, the waffle was just warm which can be seen by the butter just sitting on top of my waffle. Overall, I promise I would come back just for the banana nut bread which I guess I can say was worth the $12 Lyft ride to this location. I again Thank Perry for being so pleasant.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle with Bacon

V-FPrMkXE2S9nQVJQMJDhA.text: Banana Nut Muffin is to die for!!! Really don't even need any butter with it. I ordered the Stuffed French Toast with pork sausage and a side of the signature hash browns. The presentation was really nice. The Hash browns came out with a few extra taps of the seasoning but it taste really good. My server Lacey said the stuffed French toast was one of her favorites so that made me feel relieved about my choice. I would def come back for breakfast and I want to come back for their burger as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast

XHGDpDzgBVrQSNGzZg2XmQ.text: I awoke in my cushy hotel room on the Strip to find it was 11:00. By the time I got ready to go, it was noon. I wanted breakfast, craving French Toast in particular. Did you know the only breakfast you can get on the Strip at noon is a pricey brunch?   Thank God for Yelp and feet--and a nice day. I donned my winter jacket and sneakers and walked the 4 miles to Egg & I.  There was still a wait at 1:15. They have a cool wait list that keeps you from being anxious, as you can monitor your own time and where you are in line. They have a cramped wait bench inside, and 3 benches on the porch.  They both call your name and text you when your table is ready.  The pictures make the food look hefty and bland, but it's actually delicious! The frozen cubed potatoes are fried nicely and tossed with seasoning salt, to wake up the flavor. The French Toast is just FT until you stuff it with yummy fluffy eggs/sausage/cheese mix. Stay with the regular maple syrup; it suffices.  I should have stayed with water, as the cranapple for $3 and 200 calories, I could have done without. But with 5 miles down (for calories) it's still a whole breakfast for $15. It cost at least that to walk into a fu-foo breakfast on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast Sausage
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice reminder
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting List

_RY3s9pLVw4TRXCou7PiCg.text: While in Las Vegas for my mom's 70th, we wanted to have a hearty breakfast that wasn't buffet.  I remember hearing about this place from a friend so I decided this was the place to take my family.  May I say, nowadays I rarely give 5 stars because it means it is just impeccable.  This place is almost that level.  I cannot say it is 100% because the service could have been a little better.  Don't get me wrong, they were all very nice, I think we just had a server that was a little frazzled.  Other than that everything was perfect.    The restaurant is obviously off the strip, hence worth going to.  I think the prices were very reasonable for the amount of food and the quality of it too.  The restaurant is family friendly so good for all audiences.  They even have their own specialty which I will disclose in a bit.  As mentioned, the service was good, only because our server was a little overwhelmed, but when the other servers saw, they all helped out and got us what we needed.  The vibe was just awesome betweem staff and customers.  Let's get to the point...FOOOOD...here is what was on the menu:  Banana Nut Muffin:  this is their specialty!  It may not sound like much, but if you love banana nut muffins, you will find it hard to find something like this anywhere else.  Chicken Fried Steak: Two eggs any style with ranch potatoes and choice of toast or homemade banana nut muffin - perfectly crispy on the outside and juicy in the inside.  My two brothers had this with scramble eggs which were cooked perfectly.  The country gravy they had on top was just YUM.  Have Patience Please: Four eggs, with sliced chicken, fresh broccoli, sliced mushrooms and a blend of cheeses, ranch potatoes and choice of toast or homemade banana nut muffin - my mom had this with a side of fruit instead of toast.  It was really goos and super big.  It was way too much for one person but totally worth the buy  Steak and Eggs: Served with ranch potatoes and choice of toast or banana nut muffin - typical choice for my dad, meat and eggs.  He asked for it rare and guess what...it actually came out rare!  The quality of the steak was very good.  Not like the cheap ones you get at other places (who shall not be named).    Strawberry Cream French Toast: Two pieces of French toast stuffed with a delicious strawberry cream cheese filling then topped with a strawberry sauce and whipped cream and served with warm syrup - okay this was my order and I have to say....sooooooo good.  Their strawberry cream cheese filling was so tasy, light but enough to jolt the taste bud senses.  I ended up getting a side of eggs and extra crispy bacon and this came out just perfect  Loco Moco:  I don't remember if it was called this but that is exactly what is was.  They do it 2 styles, one with country gravy and one with the original brouwn gravy.  It is basically rice on the bottom with a meat patty smothered with either gravy and a fried egg on top.  This was actually pretty awesome considering this is not a hawaiian place.  They did well on the sauce,  my sister was impressed.  Bacon, Avocado and Cheese: A bacon omelette stuffed with sliced avocado and topped with cheese and a dollop of sour cream - my hubby had this and said is was delish.  They really filled it up throughout the whole omelet and they let him get a side of fruit instead of toast.  Overall I would definitely come back.  I suggest people to try it out too.  It does get very busy so go early if you are in a big group.

OSWZZcEYth4FHFERbr6iMg.text: Food was delicious. Perry our server was great! Very friendly, fast and attentive. We will definitely come back next time we are in town.

DdrLmE6TbFMfgo8qvPLhog.text: We came on a Thursday afternoon and we did not have a wait, we were sat immediately. Our server Lacey greeted us quickly. I was excited to see they have some local Hawaiian options on the menu, they even have aloha shoyu. The banana nut muffin was just perfect our food came out very quickly. Everyone liked their food. I got the loco moco and it was very good. We all left with leftovers. They have many different options for everyone to eat. Great experience and great staff will definitely return.

u8WL_BZz1pbLdbdQLpRPTQ.text: The best breakfast of my life. There banana nut   muffins were the best i have ever had. I literally can eat those everyday of my life and i am a picky person but the consistency was perfection tasted like home made at its finest. I  also had an omelette and great tater tots do try those. This place was so good if we had  one was in losangeles I would be a regular. Will be going back very soon!!!

7gAVNsf9LGyXruRnexiaJw.text: What more can I say other than we ate here 2 out of 3 mornings we were in town and the ONLY reason we didn't eat there all 3 mornings is that "just wouldn't be right" would it? Really nice staff, good atmosphere and portions that don't leave you feeling like a stuffed pig. Sorry if that is your preference. I personally hate food waste. Discovered the place on Yelp which suggests to me that the app might just still be working. Ate once inside and the second on the outside"pet friendly" patio. I'm pretty sure I will be back and hopefully I will NOT order the same thing again; because that "just would be right!" [Insert smart ass smiley face here] Peace/Out

26zjMVhGQGqRI1z0c0ATxw.text: We had a feeling this place would be good after seeing a line going out to the parking lot.  The works veggie benny was incredible (generious amount of avocado slices in it) and their banana nut muffin  (free with yelp check in) was the best I've ever had! Despite a packed restaurant, service was great and faster than expected.  This place definitely has their act together as no chaos going on with very competent and friendly servers.

AY9efIzGCbFUztnuzThUxQ.text: I'm not from the area but this is my favorite breakfast place ever amazing food good atmosphere great service and clean!

ynbUohTjLQaF42CLtw64ag.text: The service was exemplary.  Came at a very busy time and was seated immediately.  Ordered and meal delivered quickly.  Food was delicious and fresh

kOK9mI3ffEe8NIoqOwtV9Q.text: Ordered omelettes and pancakes for our brunch. Mmmm was too good. We finished with a vanilla latte. It came with whipped cream cinnamon sprinkled on top of it. Nice brunch :)

9DP-l34m9SegqIl1O03Yng.text: I come to Vegas every once in awhile but next time I'm here I will be surely coming back to this place. Server was sweet as pie, forgot my eggs but thankfully he did because my word the French toast plate was HUGE!!! I wouldn't of been able to eat them he insisted on giving me a free muffin he really didn't have to but the next morning hung over in my room a muffin was just what I needed. If you're in the area want Amazing food and service for a low price go here. Also the patio is dog friendly

DoVSODAF94ulm4cMny7G7Q.text: Free muffin with Yelp check in, you had me at hello! Perfect breakfast spot off the strip if you want to avoid all the usual chains. Plentiful portions and eggs galore. Everything we had was delicious. Next time I'm in Vegas, I will return!

boELQY1dUevKdq8dJrtVXg.text: Great breakfast!  The Country Potatoes were delicious!  Loved the pancakes with maple syrup!  Bacon was done to our separate request.  Out Waitress was great and we loved the happy egg face and sad egg face if you need her! We will go back again!

tw9H2P7Fr16Aq7eXb0F7mQ.text: Great little find away from the Strip! We had a large group and they sat us on the patio. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful in us deciding what to order from the vast menu. Everyone was happy with their choices.

7OnvFRvXqJ1rCLw14lw1Sw.text: Great food and service. Love finding this off the strip place. Great breakfast and lunch!! Don't hesitate. Go there.

i1wtbYU8G4_wgdhHH9j02A.text: Thought this place was great...favorite thing was definitely the free muffin we got for checking in on Yelp! I also had the corned beef hash which was really good. Service was great and I overall would love to visit this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. corned beef hash w/ the YUMMIEST potatoes!!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yummiest banana nut muffin -- free w/ yelp check in :)

sR1q74oxgUIdFda0_jCzVg.text: Breakfast was great! We went to Egg and I around 11am. Had a bit of a wait. They said 15 mins but was more like 5 mins. happy Moment. Patrick was our waiter. The guy new the menu like the back of his hand and i liked his response about the corn beef hash. So i ordered it. It did not disappoint. This is a Vegas Gem and needs to be recognized. Awesome food, awesome staff. Great choice.

HMozdM_LQSnfq3X-EIxk8A.text: Love the food here and especially the banana nut bread. Not over the top, just right. I highly recommend it.

e2qPEptVAtILyRJs96gFgQ.text: Love this place. Usually have the chicken fried steak breakfast. They gave us banana nut muffins--awesome (warm/sticky). Worth the 15-20 minute wait, which is common for weekends/holidays.

MzNpYUhqRDMkwiKYK_3_hQ.text: Such an amazing place for brunch! Call ahead and ask if there is a wait just because when we got there, there was quite a line. Waited for about 15-20 mins, not bad for a Sunday, specially for Mother's Day.   Ambiance is a homey relaxed vibe. They serve a variety of eggs, pancakes and chilis. They have a lot of options and vegetarians too so check out the menu!   Price is about comparable to Denny's or IHOP.   I ordered chile relleno omelet with banana but bread and the hubby got 'the works,' with toast. We enjoyed our food and both finished it in no time.   Will definitely come back.   Our server Erin is very upbeat and personable, made our dining experience a little extra special!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hope she wins it!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno omelet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works

WeCY-v6uvvmkepT7tdgrZw.text: Simply fantastic place to eat. The service was 5 stars and the place was packed. Our server checked on us constantly, when he found out it was our first time he dropped off two free muffins and never stopped making sure we were good with everything.   The Chile relleno omelette was fantastic and it came out hot and delicious. Normally packed restaurants suffer in service but it was quick and ready and service was on point. No wonder 2000+ hits gave it more than 4 stars.   Stop by and you won't regret it.

nxyxAbosIsjL-xW1mg4nPg.text: Absolutely an amazing place to get breakfast in Vegas. It was so delicious. The place was busy when we walked in and we were told to wait 10 minutes but got seated in less then that. Our waitress was super sweet and the food was great and inexpensive. The portions are massive so come on an empty stomach. I would suggest this place to all my friends. It's a cheap uber from the strip!

74vnT-BSEfSNfrQ_dvamEg.text: By far the best breakfast in Vegas! My wife and I recently got married in Vegas and this is the only place I could go to for our pre wedding breakfast! The food, the staff and the banana nut muffin are all amazing!

IdSkUzsdwsL_AGwMlYcaJA.text: Visiting Vegas for the first time and found this spot for breakfast! Excellent service and the food was delicious. The banana nut muffin was absolutely gorgeous! Very moist (homemade). It was so good we bought a loaf back home! Will definitely go back

5y-mo7OZmwc3B32HvjqjmA.text: Read the reviews on yelp and went to try it.  Glad we did.  I had the french toast combo (with eggs and potatoes) and the lady had some type of omelette that she thoroughly enjoyed and surprised me by finishing it. French toast was very good eggs were done right (I can't believe how many places can't do over medium right). Potatoes had a nice taste.  Service was good and attentive.  Definitely will return and suggest to others.

Rd4l-s-Xusy_qzApUeG3Fw.text: We loved there breakfast. Alot of things to choose from and grt service. from breakfast burritos and skilletS you cant go wrong with anything.  BOOM awsum place

8SNc9nzJf4LlLWn-BBvAQg.text: Karla is the best server who deserved a trip to Disney!!! Eggs are the best in town!!!

fF9Jwd4l2THzG8GNZGnwbg.text: Delicious hot food in a reasonable amount of time... I order eggs Benedict everywhere I go since they're my fave.. They never dissappoint... Service could be better with the waitress in the glasses but maybe she was having a bad day. Prices are around $10 to $13...good breakfast restaurant.

L6ESEV9nDQ1YmqZ-PZ_4Xg.text: The wait to get a table at 9:35am was THIRTY FREAKING MINUTES.  Plan ahead.  The menu is huge, and a little confusing, as the staples are towards the back (eggs, pancakes and waffles) while they seem to push several styles of eggs Benedict and four-egg omelettes (not a fan, blech.)  Service was what I expect from a half-decent diner - fast and punctual.  My waffle was not served with real maple syrup, which was a major bummer.  The potatoes that are included with the standard egg breakfast were small squares but were cooked perfectly and tasted a lot like French fries from Fuddruckers (heavy on the Thyme, which gives them a reddish, golden-brown color.) There's a little stand at the table with two metal egg badges. The first, in black, is a happy egg face which states to the wait staff that all is well.  The second is an egg-face in bright yellow with a somewhat consternated egg-face which signifies to the wait staff that you're either unhappy with the meal, but mostly tells them you need something.  I was in a particularly crappy mood, so I kept flipping the egg-face to the bright yellow unhappy egg-face, and the waitress was getting perturbed with me.  The turkey sausage was pretty tasty, so I'd recommend people order it if they decide to eat here.  In general, take it or leave it.

mws2Dbp1QknS7U2qR6mwSg.text: This place has always been amazing. The food quality is outstanding. Clean friendly staff. But today was wired. Our waitresses Liliana made us feel like we were being rushed. This would have been ok if they were busy but that so wasn't the case today. Got to the table and she was there asking "what can I start for your drinks today?" Girl let me sit and look what you have before you rush me. Then she comes back like 30 sec later with drinks. "Are you ready?" I just opened my menu. Dang can we have a few mins to go over it? Sure." Then food comes then like 2 mins after that. "I'm not rushing but I will leave the check on the table. Ok now we feel rushed. But the food and everything else is amazing.

ZLlnVTfLVqZDL2TcO0RDZQ.text: Been coming here for the past couple of summers, at least twice a week.  Considering that I'm only awake these 'early' hours (the place is only open from 6am to 3pm) a few times a week, that's a fairly high ratio, now that I think about it.  Menu items of note: Crazy Chicken - simply a well balanced omelette  Eggs Benedict Florentine - not a fan of eggs benedict in general, but I am when I come here  Banana Nut Muffin - this thing might be enough of a reason to come here just by itself  Haole (sp?) loco - on the back page, under the Hawaiian section, it's one of the more fattening things on the menu, but very tasty.  Not a fan of their homefries, so I substitute them out with fruit instead  Service: The servers are usually quite friendly, helpful, and attentive.  Reasons why I come here: This is one of the cheaper and healthier breakfast options in Vegas, yet there is no sacrifice in quality for the food.  Much better than the overrated Hash House a Go Go.  Oh, and if you are coming here for the first time, do yourself a favor and get the darn Banana Nut Muffin.

Ezg0xXP_tIWdfBEXB2ne_g.text: My husband and I just came across this place last weekend and I must say although we waited 30mins to get seated it was well worth it. After a long weekend in Vegas we wanted to get away from the strip and Long behold....was the Egg and I. The service was good and the breakfast was delicious. They have the best banana nut muffin! We ended up ordering a few for the trip back home!

j9to2ZJnbrgaxRoD5Nsw1A.text: This place is great.  Yep, line out the door on Sunday morning but well worth the fairly short wait.    Service was fantastic.  The employees all seem to be very happy, very busy, and very willing to help.  Prices are very reasonable.   Most importantly, the food is very good with very generous portions.  Oh, and I almost forgot!  Banana Nut Muffins!!!

hjg868rwDj9Pdm0G9KUs_g.text: We wanted to head off the strip and get a taste for the rest of Vegas. We got here early, just after 9 AM, and it was already busy but a quick 10 minute wait.  I opted for the bacon and onion skillet, figured that's not something I make at home. YUM! I thought the ranch potatoes were slightly salty but could be because I've been lowering my salt intake lately.  The husband opted for the bandito omelette with the banana nut muffin (which was delicious!). He did not leave hungry.  Large servings, fast service, delicious food and nice atmosphere. We left satisfied and glad we found this place on Yelp.

FXm7QVISXIJboowOsrBKFA.text: This is first place I went to when I first moved here... AMAZING!!!!  you can have so many things here, no matter what your taste is... always have great service and love the cute "egg" motif on everything... It is reasonably priced and fills you up..

0LWyq2eW7vkkrF4R-8kJww.text: Damn this banana nut muffin is delicious. And for the portions, sizes, and service, it's quick, and inexpensive. Whether you're coming in hung over, or looking to feed and fuel up... DO IT. I love this place for their courteousness and most importantly their delicious breakfast. Also, if the wait gets too long, go across the plaza and hit up Zia records and check out their vinyl, cds, DVDs, whatever you're into :)

7Qj8lcYPN208HjmdwVH5NQ.text: The food was delicious and fast despite the very busy morning rush.  Our server Chance was lovely and quick with the refills! A wonderful stop away from the strip.

h5bOAfEId08-ELamfPrUng.text: Alexa was a fantastic server, super accommodating to our food sensitivities, amazing with my kids, and just fun all around! The food was AMAZING! we all loved it! Thanks Alexa:-)

3ZQkljaV5VtGKo69rxbZ2A.text: Pretty good.  Local popular eatery. Lots of breakfast food items to choose from, lots of egg items from american style to mexican style huevos rancheros. A lot of american breakfast places arent that good, but this one was, so yay!~! since its rare i find an american breakfast place that i like. very nice and friendly staff.  eggs were cooked right, not bland, and just the right portion.

rfGKN8p9QvI9moDwjyceuw.text: We started out our breakfast here with banana nut muffins.  We originally ordered one, but our waitress in her infinite wisdom recommended that we get 2.  Sooo glad we did, because 1, they weren't as big as we thought they'd be, and 2, those suckers are really tasty.  The stuffed french toast is to die for.  Seriously, I think it'll kill you with all the meat, cheese and butter they manage to stick in there, but it's definitely worth the extra trips to the gym to work it off.  It's a pretty huge portion when you add in the home fries. The previous reviewer that said that it looks like somebody dumped a bottle of Lawry's seasoning on them wasn't kidding. They were orange.  SO got the Mexican Omelette and she couldn't finish it because of the generous portion size, but she enjoyed what she was able to put away. We both enjoyed the fresh squeezed orange juice.  There's nothing like seeing some honest elbow greased pulp in your juice to let you know it's the real deal.  Great service, friendly atmosphere, plenty of parking.  We'll definitely drop by when we're in the area again.

uezaCi054R9XjcUjgCLh8A.text: The Egg and I was good but unless you have a car, not worth the trip off the strip.     Perhaps we were spoiled by our visit to Hash House a Go Go earlier in our visit but the Egg and I was a bit disappointing after all the good reviews that we've read.  The banana nut muffin is worth a try and the omlets and skillets were good but definitely nothing special.    As others have noted, the potatoes in the skillet were very salty and definitely not the highlight of the meal.

DNSjB9Y4Fm_2NdSCN4dErg.text: What a find! After having humongous buffets at various places in Vegas, this was a welcome change! Definitely give it a try on your way back. My husband had the eggs Benedict and I got the veggie omlette. Very cute little place.

_zz6JmfIhZEHTNo3P56ugA.text: Went to breakfast twice here and it was tasty! Service was super friendly and awesome.

Q7MZPrMnmTFLs_p2041q1g.text: Karla was our server today, she was right on time w/ her greeting us and was very nice! She was of course wearing green on st. Pattys day and suggested something new which most servers do not.. I tried eggs Benny! Loved it. Thank you Karla, see ya soon

RM2vROBFF8_L4qXGcwAbqw.text: Staci, our waitress, was the bomb!  The service here is great. Everyone is so friendly. The food was great. I brought my husband and brother-in-law and they loved it!  Egg and i never fails to impress!

aC2YLH-o7-uqKG2uIs1zvw.text: Wonderful place ti have breakfast.. Love the skillet menu and the attention that the server, Amanda, gave us today make it better!

hHOb1sJol99BsQrPGfxwdA.text: I dig the atmosphere of this seemingly mom and pop breakfast joint. The food is good but nothing to write home about. It was packed with a line out the door on the Saturday morning we went.  I was able to try the combo meat skillet, beef hash skillet, and the stuffed french toast. Everything tasted homemade which places it above chain breakfast restaurants, but I think all cities have some sort of a joint that serves similar tasting dishes.  One thing that stood out was their banana nut muffin. Choose it over the toast, when asked what you prefer. This was the only thing that was better than anywhere else I have tried. I'm not a big fan of BNut, but if it tasted like the ones here, I would choose it every time.  Decent breakfast joint, decent prices. I might hit it again to try out different dishes to see if anything that can knock my socks off.

RxZ0iY68K-Q9BzvAeC1YZQ.text: This is a nice little breakfast place off the strip. We ate here on a Saturday morning around 11 a.m. and it was pretty busy. The menu is pretty huge and I had a hard time deciding what to get. I ordered the Fiesta Skillet with chorizo. The eggs were really good, but the chorizo left something to be desired. It probably wasn't the best item on the menu, but this particular morning I was feeling something Mexican inspired. The ranch potatoes were great, like little cubes of goodness.  And yes, the banana nut muffin is as good as everyone says it is.  Come here if you're looking for good breakfast with generous portions at a decent price. I definitely would consider coming back here the next time I'm in Vegas.

d4vAQblVMiSVXav5ML1CqQ.text: If you want some American style breakfast that gives you real proportions, this is the place to be. I was thinking about going to Ellis Islands for their $6.99 steak and eggs, then I changed my mind thinking about dealing with the strip crowd. The best advantage I always have in Vegas is my own car, and my own GPS. I can have the same options as a local.   This place is a Zagat rated breakfast joint. The food did not disappoint either. I tried out their waffle plate which came with 2 eggs and a large slice of ham or sausage. The waffle could've been a little warmer, but it tasted wonderful. $2.25 for all you can drink coffee has Starbucks beat. This was the perfect place for my stomach to get all that alcohol soaked up and out of my system for the long drive home. I now have a new off the strip favorite breakfast spot.

71YRpBV5gIIvUjJTo-a_5g.text: This place was great!  Not terribly expensive, great selection, good service and we would definitely go back.  As a note, we learned you could get half portions on most of the egg items.

R91-wT_YfoCbpfN-mFeM6w.text: I had read about this place, and really just wanted to check it out with my family. We were not disappointed! And, the place was packed...always a good sign. The food we ordered was delicious. The staff was very friendly and the service was quick and helpful., Prices were very reasonable and the portions good sized with delicious homemade flavors!  It was the best tasting skillet breakfast we ever have. ....Just a great experience all around. We definitely want to go back there again.

4EbhtsAQiDLNYLFdf8kLxg.text: I'll be honest this last visit to Vegas blew like a hot, lung collapsing desert breeze in your face while taking a whiz off the side of Zzyyxx Road. Between the bitch slaps I endured from Willy Wonka, Frodo Baggins, and those hags from Sex and the City I had enough and wanted to back flip off the Stratosphere without a bungee cord. Instead of eating more diarrhea inducing gobbledygook at the Caesar's food court my wife dragged my sluggish brown behind to the Egg and I. Thank God she did. Sorry no dancing ghetto looking dancing Despicable Me minions or card slappin' faux-porn peddlin' hombres here. What you will get though are those amazing banana nut muffins. The spinach benny I had was my saving grace, I doused it in hot sauce and devoured it Melissa McCarthy style. The waitress gives you your own container of coffee to refill your own mug instead of having to wait for her to come back. Jesus H. who does that anymore!!?? It's such a simple but awesome concept! Not these little doggy doo doo Denny's around where I live in the barrio, that's for sure.

nJ2gUikP8lLo4lYY2-2OBg.text: Breakfast was excellent, I had the avocado omelet. Server Lisa was great checking on how the food was. I think the managers name is Marc, have to give him credit too. Banana bread very moist. good luck getting to SoCal Disneyland

joTPWbOmzTAPVuAIC0rlAA.text: Best breakfast I had in Vegas. You'll need a car to get there if you're staying on the strip, but it's worth the drive. The ranch potatoes are fantastic! Great food at a great price and good service, too.

f6_ZIl3xJmJRLaRQYitdLw.text: My favorite breakfast place in all of Las Vegas. The staff is amazingly friendly and efficient and the food is off the hook!  Try their omlette-crepe combos for a treat you can't get anywhere else.  So fun.

9aCZiuJHqo2Jhqk8-jdj8Q.text: Good, but not the best.  Had the Ultimate Skillet and a waffle, and was satified, but did not leave raving about the food.  Was seated within 15 minutes even though the restaurant was busy.  Waitress was great -- friendly and on top of it.  I would recommend BabyStacks over Egg & I if you're looking for a truly amazing breakfast.

NfGCgu9vSA2oS6TXnvc0hw.text: I came here for breakfast with a few people the other day. The restaurant was packed and we had to wait about 10-15 minutes. I ordered the corned beef hash which was homemade. Good flavor and lots of it! My niece really liked it and ended up eating about half of it. My niece actually ordered the waffle with bananas on top (strawberries were out of season). This girl can eat but is skinny as a stick. Kids! One of the other ladies had Portuguese sausage, rice and eggs. They give you a whole sausage and it's pretty big. Whoa now, I'm talking about food! The other lady had spam & eggs which she really liked. We all got the banana muffin with our meals. YUM! We had a good breakfast and may be back again when we're in Vegas.

T5KPe6Fc2fRA9qMa5dA7lw.text: Great breakfast spot. I would recommend the Kay's Special omelet and the banana muffin definitely my go to at this place.

a3SFUUbo6nL5mZwXa4LSpw.text: This place is great on a early morning on ur day off everything is soo good even their coffee i love the southern eggs with sausage gravy its so delicious!....But is it just me n the hubby but we think the diced potatoes are soo salty !! =|  .....portions are great!, food is awsome!. fast service A+ ....ooo ya but there seems to be these young girls as host all the time i go and their face always looks like they smelled a bad odor....my thing is your the first thing i see when i walk into your establishment ...because of faithful and new patrons you are able to thrive and grow....least u could do is fake a smile for the 8 hrs of ur shift....I work in the hotel business when a guest walks into my workplace i make sure to make the guest feel welcome.....customer service 101....im just sayin biggest pet peeve ever.....If your so miserable call in and stay home.Only negative thing i have to say...but after u get by the yuck faces its all amazing from there....  PS: bin here 4 times cant say u were having a bad day.

gPL4EQ1338pjB2wAhvDg9A.text: Delicious breakfast place just  off the strip. Service was super friendly, food was really good and prices we're reasonable. Definitely check them out if you have the chance!

FijOEGrhmivnfdYsT3oN-g.text: I looooooooooove this place!  Amazing breakfast/brunch. If you love eggs ANYTHING, this is the place to go!  Good portion, cheap price and friendly atmosphere. Everyone should try the taco style omelette!  It's to die for!!!

5aEi2GJh_Q40-E6IH7OvBg.text: Great breakfast here the first time we ate at here, but the second time seemed like the staff was either overworked or very inexperienced.  Our table of 10 didn't have a waitress at it for 10-15 minutes, the food was good though, albeit it that too came out extremely slow.  Overall it was a good experience, but we'll see the if we come here a third time or not...

W15E3WIa7lOaJa0EHywPXw.text: Amazing!!!  Best service and best food.  Omelets were incredible.  All food came out hot, which never happens at most places.  Erin our server rocked it.

RGxwgkiKumlD9HJvn320sg.text: We always make it here when in vegas. In fact, it's a big part of why we come. The banana nut muffins are to die for and our server Stacie was very attentive!

qjLQTEfWMlNtQuEL_w5Gkw.text: When your in Vegas and want to venture off the strip of a great breakfast. Just down W. Sahara you will find this gem.   The food is great the banana nut muffins are awesome. It has a very down home atmosphere and very friendly service. Excellent place for parents with kids and wont break the bank.

aRqH5ehYPoLDN70xJFnIaQ.text: Have not eaten at this one in over a year, but all their locations make a great breakfast, its a chain with a family run atmosphere.  bacon egg and cheese stuffed into french toast, with seasoned  potatoes on the side OMG!

JQtSzw7vnurpJqFIT2iBqg.text: Far and away the best breakfast place in Vegas OMG huge portions and great prices, service was amazing and you always leave full!

hB1XK1FMizszlgwrT08FgA.text: Ulises was a great server, and the food.... AMAZING! Prime Rib Benny is a must have ;)

m1YICeJXdQae2RqruK_CNQ.text: This is a great place to meet friends or bring the family for breakfast! Great value for the amount and quality of food you get. It's always consistent and the service is good. The food comes out fast so not an issue coming with the kids, they don't have time to get fidgety. And the patio seating is nice of you have 4 year olds that need to stretch their legs on occasion.

wZwkc0-H84yNRX0Pdx6rYw.text: First time eating breakfast in Vegas off the strip....best breakfast in town! Got the Fender Pender, bf got the Flapper, everything was delicious! Karla was an amazing server, she made the whole meal even better :)

7q_4qt0LHpIEn2Joe2tIKA.text: My wife and I visted Vegas for a week long vacation and about half way through we were craving a good down home breakfast. Once we found and ate at The Egg and I, our craving was no more. We loved it so much we went back a couple of days later. The food was great and the service was just as good. If and when we return to Vegas, The Egg and I will be our place for breakfast.

QQwqdtC_pLJz_AoKUTZAEg.text: Great service and large menu for breakfast.  The "special potatoes" are chunks of potatoes with season salt.  That's it.  The corned beef hash was just ok.  The banana muffin was pretty tasty and warm.

SOfvn-PFgLcndoVbE-JWwA.text: The food was great and the best part is the server tabbatha. ....she must be new, never seen her before..let me tell you, if ur having a bad day and people being shity go see tabbatha she put a smile on my face she was great she treat u like ur family and always making sure we were ok with everything we were served.....she really knows service and making people comfortable at the restaurant after a long freaken night at work....thank tabbatha u rock...hope to come back with my whole family...

atrvTiDfpHTdTmO8IWlB8g.text: Great staff and customer service Food was fresh and Great First time Being here Definitely coming back thanks for the great Service Alexa

uVYPpeE3ELAKsvnpEPrqCA.text: Staci was just great and the food is so worth it. Great prices, everybody working together to help get people in and out. It's a breakfast wonderful

_4xMloKY1QBfD581xwFcEA.text: We are tourists (Vegas) and found this place via Yelp. Thank's yelper's ..... keep yelping!  If I was a 300# football player I could have finished my meal. The food was good but a bit to plentiful for our tastes. I liked the happy / sad face egg flippable sign to alert the serving staff of service status.  The most impressive attribute I found was the staff seemed so happy, positive and upbeat!   Judging from the level of activity, this place does a great deal of business and I wish them the best. For some constructive criticism ..... investing in some better quality flatware will elevate the perception of quality and will do much in justifying the relatively high prices.

f5J-v6Ep7XiU17fSjZFp2g.text: The food here was eggcellent! (Get it? Egg-cellent). Anyway,  the service here was awesome as the servers were polite and made sure we had everything we needed. The atmosphere was upbeat and inviting. The menu was an adorable newspaper that was almost like reading the funny section of the Sunday news. Portion sizes were phenomenal and the kids menu offered variety and portions were like mini adult selections. My 9 year old loved it. My husband and I ordered the Cabo and Santa Cruz breakfast burritos with the works potatoes. We were reassured by the wait staff that it was pure deliciousness and it was! Our burritos were made up of four scrambled eggs,  sauteed bell peppers and onions, cheddar cheese,  chorizo, wrapped in a warm flour tortilla and topped with their signature Santa Cruz sauce & a dollop of sour cream. My 12 year-old decided to be adventurous and order the stuffed french toast, stuffed with scrambled eggs, sausage and sprinkled with powered sugar with warm maple syrup on the side. Definitely, a taste bud explosion. Thank you Egg & I...we will NOT forget you!

3NNojzU8Bk_vC7s4GdS9RA.text: The food is excellent, the service is iffy but then again they are super busy so I guess it's hard to get it right & knock it out of the park all the time. Pancakes are awesome, eggs of course are great. Bacon tastes good (pork chops are goooood, Pulp Fiction reference). 5 for the food, 3 for the service (4 overall). If you're visiting Vegas, come here as you will leave with your stomach more than satisfied and your wallet won't take a pounding like it would on the strip!

uSIp5QBD-ve8zprVQ_ZtCQ.text: I love breakfast. It is my favorite... so Mama might be a little picky when it comes to it.  Obsessed with this place. Amazing service, kind staff, & delicious food! A ton of healthy options! YES!   Not too far from the strip to check out... skip the buffets & overpriced crap and indulge in the homefries & the amazing banana nut muffins. The scrambles are ridiculous and i added the "sassy apples" to my cottage cheese.   Just GO! It won't disappoint.  Only thing I would want is a larger selection of coffee type beverages like latte's, etc...

f1h08xuGjbfrtKT-USkgtQ.text: Great food; I got the classic and added avocado to the toast! Fast service and everything was tasty and our server Carole Ann was AWESOME!!! :)

QtmP3XzKF8vq5FncQHh9Cg.text: I heard of this place through a friend of mine whose friend recommended it.  So what's the first thing I do?  Check it out on Yelp, of course!    Yes, there is a wait.  But like everyone says, the line goes really quickly and I think we were seated within 15-20 minutes, which is not bad considering it was a Saturday at peak brunch time.    I loved their newspaper style menus and all the great descriptions to help decide what to order.  First thing I have to mention is the banana nut muffin.  Yes, I know everyone mentions it but it is SO worth mentioning!  It's so moist and delicious, I actually now crave the darn thing!    I ordered a corned beef hash with eggs and instead of their potatoes, I ordered rice.  The corned beef hash was okay, I like mine on the crispier side but it was still good.  The eggs were cooked perfectly.  Not too many places can make the perfect over-medium where it's a little cooked but just enough runnyness to get some yolk without it spewing all over the plate like an over-easy.  I tried my girlfriend's potatoes and should've stuck with it.  It was almost like little bites of french fries.  SO delicious!  I'm definitely heading back there next chance I get to, until then, I shall see the banana nut muffin in my dreams...

X1CG4rhq3jOad5x0Rk0fmA.text: I ate at this place yesterday before heading back to San Diego and had the best Chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes ever!  Okay, maybe they were the only ones I've ever tried, but still, I thought the pancakes were great, yet maybe a little on the sweet side.  I had no idea that this place was going to be so popular and after eating there I know why.  The staff was pretty friendly as well.  I wouldn't mind coming back to this establishment for breakfast next time I am in Vegas.

yDYp9UUnkAsl8aiWhxx7Jg.text: Huge portions, quick service, pretty good food, grumpy waitress!  The muffin we took to go and ate it on our way back to California, and it was delicious, warm or cold, quality is quality!

MaP8oLqe7VPA09QpRSe9Fw.text: The egg and I is a great place with great food. You can never go wrong eating here. Karla was an awesome server. Very friendly and makes me want to come back again. One of the best places in town.

iXMj1QKSI-KTcDKnA5354A.text: Best breakfast I've had in a really long time!  The banana nut muffins and the Diablo potatoes were outstanding. Carole Ann, our fabulous waitress, was a huge help in navigating the many choices on the menu.

s932mDjrgQmcwQztfJSA6w.text: Our service from Alyssa was awesome! Our food was delicious.  The California club was amazing and cajun fries hit the spot. Alyssa also started us off with the banana nut muffins that really hit the spot. Great service and excellent food. Highly recommend!

DjfS21YMnSajtZPr_OmglQ.text: I had the classic eggs.... I was so hungry that I couldn't wait to take the photo. Good food and Manuela was so nice and helpful. Great seev

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2cRUpiSXH0Y4fhXlRnvevA.text: Such a good choice for breakfast. The "newspaper" menus had so many options including breakfast burritos, crepes, pancakes, and waffles as well as the usual.  I choose the skillet and my husband the country Benedict.  We both LOVED our food! Bonus the flavored coffee creamer selections and healthier options of Turkey bacon, sausage AND ham! Would definitely return

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin, fresh fruit, country Benedict, veggie skillet add turkey sausage

WYWdtI9ba99XTC7C4-mI7w.text: The banana nut muffin is actually amazing. We shared the Chile relleno omelet. It was our favorite. Despite being busy, service was great!

Hx3WTrY5Rccs_bi3jLDnVA.text: The wait here can be long but it's so worth it! Everything looks delicious and the entrees we got were all amazing! It's a great "go-to" for out of town family/friends or somewhere you want to go to for Sunday brunch with your loves

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib Benny
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili rellano omelette and fruits

lt39eyQc7qBAgxx8FrJX1A.text: Yummy veggie skillet, the signature banana nut muffin is tasty too Very nice set up inside

hLx9msBhEEfHhrEYYeNxkA.text: I really loved how friendly the staff was! The wait was not too long and they were very organized and getting your order ready quickly. We checked in and got free banana bread. We were surprised to get two, one for each adult.. In all honesty as far as the food quality goes it was well prepared and it looked very good. But I am really picky and I felt as though it was cheap ingredients.  My husband really loved his chicken fried steak. I was surprised that everything has seasoned salt on it. The waitress brought two cups and a picture of coffee when only my husband ordered coffee and then I did drink some of it was pretty good and she didn't charge me. I did appreciate that!

qjmYLp0mJXlieaQMbOWiLQ.text: This was an interesting experience, for sure. We walked in, there are about 5 servers just chatting by the entrance, you walk past them to the host to be seated.  We were sat towards the back, which probably contributed to the experience we had.  You could tell that the employees were not happy. They place was way over staffed with servers, which gave them time to just gather and gossip.   There were other employees enjoying their breakfast at the tables beside us.  Learned that Saturday is the best day for them tip wise (about $140), and other days are about $70; in case you wanted that info. One of the other employees came over and asked the manager what she was supposed to do because the employees were sitting at "her tables". She was rude, cursed, it was odd.   They could probably cut the staff in half and increase productivity and be better off.  Anyways, the banana muffin was delicious! The eggs and bacon were good. I didn't care for the potatoes, they just load them with seasoning salt.  My husband had the stuffed French toast, which was delicious.  I doubt we will be back.

0YzWYCnb4KiIicT98MiYsg.text: I enjoyed my experience, a mixed crowd between tourist and locals. We were immediately seated and the staff was pleasant. The food was good and worth the travel off the strip.   I definitely think its worth trying out.

Hk9oGQ6-eqdIWdLfMryLTw.text: This place is amazing. The atmosphere is friendly and welcoming. They have unique menu selections to choose from, so your not limited to unimaginable items. We arrived on a Thursday morning, and had no problems getting in; however,  from what I have heard about the weekend... it's standing room only. If I am in the Vegas area again, I definitely would recommend coming here for breakfast, but maybe not on the weekend.... i.e. you don't mind waiting. It's that good!!

enCN_q5rLAQgwxEu3du1tw.text: 2 stars for cardboard tasting breakfast, biscuit and gravy, cubed potatoes, pancake. Egg scrambled with cheese was okay. Not boxed, anyway. Showed a culinary touch. Coca-cola was damn near perfect. Service was way better than the food deserved.

JDB2b1hzWxD9_v5z89EvNw.text: When you have a big family staying at one of the resorts off the strip, you know how expensive cost of food to feed a big family can be. Luckily, we had a car and driving here was maybe 15 minutes to our hotel. The drive here was fairly easy and the parking is plenty at this location. We didn't wait long for a table for 6. Our server came pretty quick and took our order. The menu is fairly big but we all found something to eat. They have short menu for kids meal but there is nothing you can go wrong with making Mickey pancakes. What kid wouldn't care for Mickey? Lol. The pancakes are a bit dry though but slather with butter, it fixes the problem. The homemade corn beef hash was quite good. A little salty but with the egg, it balanced out. Omelettes here are layered with cheese and though some would be good but I had to remove a lot of it off. My Denver omelette did not have much taste but ketchup solves all things. The whole table did enjoy their banana muffin. That was very good. Service was good and the prices are way much better than at the resorts. If you're willing to drive out, this place is good for breakfast. It gets busy but if you go before 10, less crowded.

vpaSQj5RziHP5ir4bBebcg.text: The menu has something for everyone. The portions are HUGE....and the food is amazing. The staff is the BEST! A must for breakfast in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IGPXfP61p6sCeutRBfZbrQ.text: Had a great breakfast after finding this place on Yelp! Service was amazing and the breakfast was served to perfection. The banana nut muffins are very good. If you are in Vegas and want to get away from all the casinos and take in a great breakfast, you can't go wrong by choosing The Egg and I.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mAk5tLS3SbyppoDK18XBbQ.text: We decided to try Egg & I after seeing such high reviews on yelp. Overall my wife & I were not very impressed. The banana nut muffin is very delicious, no complaints there. I had the Traditional Egg Benedict which was okay at best. The seasoned potatoes that come with it were pretty good, the seasoning was tasty. My wife had the waffle, which she said was good, but average. The wait staff were friendly & worked the floor quickly which was a plus. When we first arrived there was a large crowd out front, but the wait wasn't too long to get in.

8ZSo4zboyYV-1GAfTNRPAQ.text: The  Egg and I is one of my absolute favorite breakfast spots in Vegas, be sure to get get the 3 pigs!. Heres the country fried steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak and bacon Avocado omelet

f3J-vMABD5qFcNBT2Pvn8g.text: 3 words. Banana nut muffin. Sweet, soft, fluffy goodness.  I had the pleasure of dining here for brunch. Make sure to come early to beat the long lines because this place can get packed. Their menu has a wide variety of choices that you can choose from. But whatever you order, make sure that you get the banana nut muffin.  1. Sundance Omelette: It's the ultimate healthy veggie omelette. With feta cheese, spinach, tomatoes, and other deliciousness. I really liked the omelette. It comes with potatoes and your choice of toast or muffin. Get the muffin! All plates are pretty hearty, so this choice makes me feel less guilty of eating a lot of food haha (5/5)  2. Cordon Bleu Skillet: Comes with seasoned chicken breast, diced ham, swiss cheese and delicious potatoes. This one tastes great with easy over eggs. Very flavorful and savory. Overall, a great one to choose from (5/5)  The service here is friendly. Prices are reasonable as the portion sizes here are HUGE. Credit cards accepted. Plenty of parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best banana nut muffin ever!!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken cordon bleu skillet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sundance omelette

c45NHlEKC_cYoeeVYi-6yw.text: Totally in love with their Omletes and muffins. Freshly baked goods, excellent ambience and service. Must visit place.

QAidOx-JcD0m9G-3fg4wHw.text: The breakfast game in this city is no joke. After looking at the reviews I had to check this place out. The menu is lengthy with so many omelets, classic dishes and so much more.  The service is friendly, like most locals spots in Las Vegas. despite showing up on a Sunday Morning at 10:30 our wait for a party of 5 was only 20 min. The server was with us quickly and the food hit the table shortly after that. they have a ton of televisions around the main dinner so you can catch the get as you grab brunch.   The pork chops were good, as we're the potatoes and eggs. I would say I've had better, and like I said up top, breakfast in this city is no joke. if not for the limited wait despite the busy morning and the amazing service I'd probably be dropping a star on the Egg & I.   side note, they sell the hot sauce they have on the table. The hot sauce is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Center cut pork chop
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

wIsm3ARcpbawAn7-pLa5LQ.text: Great food and a great value.  The variety of breakfast choices is awesome.  Take the time to discover this place if you are in Vegas and want to get off the strip for breakfast

F9jEDox4xy3lpDes-zNcdg.text: The biscuits and gravy are to die for in my opinion... their ranch potatoes are bomb.com You must try the banana nut muffins they have as well.. I just love everything about this place...

JaLlwGWblW86x9Ln6FuiUw.text: Searched for a good breakfast place and found this spot. Read the menu and decided to try their Island Favorite - Spam, two eggs, rice & banana nut muffin, it was delicious! This is my usual plate to get when we travel to Hawaii and it did not disappoint. Service was great, our server Oscar was very helpful and friendly. This is our new breakfast spot when we come to Vegas.

gBwvAaUaqcLySF1XAhbZkw.text: Great breakfast spot when you're in Vegas! Off strip so you avoid strip traffic. Eggs everything!!! Plus lunch if you're not into eggs (weirdo). Their omelettes are perfectly done with great flavors, fresh veggies and tons of cheese. Eggs Benedicts were perfectly done. Portion sizes were spot on for an Merican. Works potatoes are freaking delicious! They taste like seasoned French fries. I love all things potatoes- If this place was called potatoes and I, I would probably give it 10 stars based on potential alone. Service is great- quick, efficient, and friendly.   Must try's: works potatoes, banana nut muffin, eggs of all kinds.  Yummilicious factor- A

Mp1K1uI0rM8hPkDwiCLjxg.text: Huge variety and options. No complaints from our table - everything was delicious and our server Karla was super helpful and friendly. The banana nut muffins are indeed to die for.

4E7IIwCkBKvC7Q5MFaGJcQ.text: First time here. As busy as this place was today, Reina was super kind and all smiles the entire time and consistent with all customers. I messed up by forgetting to ask for no cheese on a skillet and I felt awful telling her, but she gave a friendly no problem response and said she'd get another one out ASAP. She was awesome, thank you Reina! Can't wait to come back!

Xsy7MeLcwAr7ZV6a2YnfLw.text: yummmmm eggs yummmmm banana bread delicousness yummmmm brunch yummmmm everything

RiVO9LpA-OfQZ44ed8QXdA.text: I wanted some American breakfast other than the breakfast I had in my hotel. So I came across this restaurant on Yelp.   The restaurant is located in a plaza so there was plenty of parking.   Luckily for me there was no wait time so I was quickly seated with the menu. I ordered the omelette with the home fries which was absolutely delicious. I also ordered the French toast which was also tasty. What I would recommend you getting is the banana nut bread. It is out of this world!   The food came quick and the prices were very reasonable.   My server was very attentive and helped me big time with my order because it was very complicated. I don't remember his name but he was a young Hispanic man.   I'd definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in Vegas.

RufhFsRm2RvqcAOXHM7WZg.text: I love the egg and i but whats makes it even better is the service. Liza was our server and made sure we were well welcomed. She was attentive and prompt with our orders. She took care of us in every way to make sure we enjoyed our breakfast!  Thanks liza and thanks egg and I!

lE10iKjHJMEQZWzy37wejg.text: This place is delicious! Finally decided to stop by after passing by it. I tried the stuffed French toast!!!! The Diablo potatoes with syrup on top are awesome as well!

5RHM_7q4MKk2L_a5BNv95g.text: Carol Ann was great!!  Food is always good here. It's always super busy. I don't know how they get to everyone so quickly,  but they do. Just another great experience here.

S9Vopfsejd5XGSaXo-WDig.text: I always loved the Egg & I. My dad used to take me here when I was a child, and I've been coming back ever since. I drive about 30 minutes to get to this particular location.  I had an egg-crepe with mushrooms, bacon, and cheese- breakfast potatoes and banana bread sides. Although I wasn't impressed with the "crepe", it wasn't the fault of the cooks. The eggs came out perfectly cooked and of course I polished off every morsel of fried potato on the plate and considered picking a couple cold ones off the floor that have been there since we stopped in. YES- THAT GOOD! So back to the crepe, it was like trying olives for the first time in a restaurant and deciding you don't like olives. It's not their fault you don't like olives.. I don't like egg-crepes.  The banana nut muffin.. Oh man.. Would it be terrible to walk in there and order a loaf of banana bread and just eat it all for breakfast? Probably for your arteries, yes- but it's damn good for the soul.  Everything here is delicious. EVERYTHING!

D3RhOZh_SrxxhZSlkSaeMw.text: My first impression was, "Cute sad and happy egg people everywhere!"  The decor of this breakfast house really caught my attention as I first walked in. Eggs are featured on everything from their tableware, to their menu, and their walls. It's too adorable. The menu looks like a real newspaper which is also a nice little touch to the theme of this restaurant. Bright yellow everywhere is a great way to brighten up and start your day in Vegas!  We went to Egg & I for brunch and I can say it loud and proud, this is the best American breakfast I have ever had. Hearty, filling, innovative, more than just eggs and waffles. Egg & I has taken breakfast foods to a whole different level. I ordered the Eggs Benedict Florentine (featured on Rachel Ray) which had  spinach, canadian bacon, two poached eggs on a grilled english muffin, with hollandaise sauce. We also ordered an omelette, Both served with ranch potatoes...by far the best breakfast potatoes on this planet. I forgot the name of the omelette, but I know for sure I'd order the eggs benedict florentine and extra banana nut muffins on the side. The complimentary banana nut muffins are made fresh in house, and they are SO GOOD. The service was just as bubbly and friendly as this restaurant is. If you want to start your day right in Vegas, this is definitely one of your options.  The lasting impression? "Love my breakfast, let's get it on country style at Egg & I!"

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg &amp; I
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict Florentine
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette

Ya-fD90_K2M5U7QiasAXYw.text: We came here for the first time and will definitely be back. Great portions, good prices, and exceptional service. Tabitha was great, making recommendations for us and meeting all of ours needs. Thanks Tabitha!

V1MIlro7FJgMQ3afHSaAtg.text: First impression: very loud and raucous. I'm not really sure what all the fuss is about. The food was pretty standard diner fare. Nothing remarkable at all.   Had a BLT with their home fries. It was average.   To read some of the review here you'd think this place was heaven on earth. I'm here to say that the food was just okay. When you calculate in the above average prices then this isn't a very good value in my opinion.   The service, on the other hand, was very good. Staff was great.

08lhZ85NEKqoMtqzswxx_g.text: 1500+ people couldn't be wrong, so I checked this place out for breakfast. My experience was in line with the rest of the reviewers. Great food and service with a smile. Food comes out quickly, and their menu is interesting enough to come back several times. My new go-to breakfast place in Vegas since my previous favorite is now gone.

pK7QFgi2x4TOvc3AeVqocg.text: The food was delicious!! Portions were really large. Our server Jessica was super friendly and very attentive. I will definitely be coming here again on my many Vegas adventures! Off the strip, not a long wait, dog-friendly patio.

0t2pmZiEAg7LMYchUMipuA.text: Our server Tamara was excellent and kind! She made the overall experience here really awesome, and is probably one of the kindest persons i have met in Vegas! She has made the overall experience in Eggs & I wonderful and fulfilling, even as far as creating a cosy and comforting experience while i devour my breakfast in the most unglamorous way I love you Tamara you are the best

PVU4II2zufSNh6xMurKRPQ.text: The Pancho scramble was the best ever! Add the Salsas and it's a home run! Raul was a great server as well! He made some fabulous recommendations

KvuNgQha94SKeEWWg7JbtQ.text: First...amazing banana muffins.  Simply delicious.  The food is great with a large number of options.  Staci, our server, was an amazing server.  I watched her explain items to us, as well as others.  She was very attentive and personable.   The only issues I would have are these.  1) I wanted a pancake and they only have large portions and no option for a single normal pancake to add to the side of a large omlet.  2) the potatoes were very salty...tasty...but too salty.  I don't mind a bit odd salt or spuce...but these were over the top with salt.  Great place for a nice breakfast.  Give Staci the trip to Disneyland!

KujvXGd73NBxaSz7AErAQw.text: We wanted good breakfast and we found it here. Really good food. Big portions . Friendly service. When in Vegas .......go ......you will enjoy it :)

JeROUoFAf6eX7R2IwcVFIA.text: Our server, Genesis, is the bomb. Cheerful and attentive. Great recommendation of the bacon avocado omelette (lots of food).   Quick and great tasting.  Patio seating is shaded and with misting system.

ecAPQRE15kwm0J2y3XJs6Q.text: This is our go-to breakfast spot on our drive out from a full weekend of Vegas partying.  That Banana nut bread, oh, that banana nut bread.  I am craving it as I type.

L4trx2EX5G_IpmXTJ-48gA.text: Very popular, off-strip, local friendly, fast, friendly service, great food and atmosphere.  What more could you want in a breakfast place?  I had the banana pancakes and my husband had the pork Benedict and we were both very happy and full afterwards.

N2VXKvgqDO9otA71RQrPHg.text: Absolutely egg-celent breakfast stop in Vegas! Staff was amazing and very helpful, must go! All the food is amazing and it comes with huge portions! You definitely won't go hungry.

K80FMzVC8KuebkXjkODjNQ.text: Good regular coffee and HUGE portions. I would recommend getting a half portion otherwise you will end up taking food home. Country fried steak skillet was great, the hollandaise sauce was just OK. And corned beef hash was OK too. Maybe you can ask for it to be a little extra crispy as sometimes it's a little mushy. Good potatoes and our waiter Oscar was THE BEST.

saloAPmLI34fluhwvbKW_w.text: Went for breakfast with my two young daughters, were sat immediately but the service was slow and sloppy. Liliana our server, was busy, in her defense. But the staff (hostess & other servers) who werent busy didn't bother to offer help and we sat asking and missing a few items...too often for my liking.  The location is about 2 miles away from the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites, which is where we stay always, great location right off of Sahara Ave. The decor is super cute, a bit country, yet not overwhelming and suffocating. There is an outdoor dining patio, it does face the busy street, but it was quiet. Surprisingly.  The food is great, fresh, came out hot and the coffee is good. A great variety of breakfast and lunch items, and I am looking forward to going back because as i said, slow service but great food. Good tasting. Fair prices. Liked this joint  Gave the 3 stars for the poor service and time we spent there despite non busy employees piddling around.  Has a large tv in the dining area, up high enough that you are not distracted if you choose not to watch. We were able to watch a bit of the World cup Soccer match, great in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much food.  Yet the menu is not overwhelming.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy.  Had the Loco mono one day and the me I can skillet the next day.  Both were delicious.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My daughters cute breakfast.

GGsBBcF44VGLYVcOgA0R7Q.text: We went here twice on our last visit to Vegas. Overall 4 stars, one visit was earlier Saturday the other was later sunday.  For our first visit, we went for breakfast. We were immediately seated, no waiting. Wait staff were prompt and friendly, however, not very efficient. I noticed on 4 different occasions of them taking food orders to incorrect tables. Aside from that the food was awesome. The wife and I both had breakfast skillets, they were cooked perfectly and portions were spot on. We left full and happy!  For our sunday visit, we showed up closer to 11am. Told the wait was about 25mins, which it was. Staff were friendly and appeared to be much more efficient this visit. The wife ordered breakfast, Chicken Fried Steak and it was very delicious! I had the beef dip, which was average at best. The beef and au jus just didn't have enough flavor and the fries were soggy. So, I'd say 3 stars this visit, close to 5 the first, would be an easy 4 overall.  On sunday this place was literally a zoo, people packed everywhere, kids screaming/crying, rude people in the parking lot. I'd rx going early to avoid the rush if you are the type of person that gets anxious easily.

rY78ZwRMBGCpJCYheEqMjg.text: Love this joint! We waited about 20 minutes on a Sunday which was shorter than I would expect for such a popular place. Our waitress (bummed I don't remember her name) was ridiculously sweet and friendly. She provided great service. The food was delicious. I'm really picky about eggs benedict and theirs did not disappoint. I had the prime rib benny and highly recommend it, came on a croissant. We were planning on ordering a carrot cake to go and when they were out of it they gave us a loaf of carrot cake on the house - it's gestures like that that make all the difference. Great place and will definitely be returning. They're doing it right :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O376LTn4JzB0ZpDdJXbMrQ.text: Very god spot and friendly service Benedict is good my favorite local spot good patio

s7uFOeQt3RYFf3MmtHJJow.text: After such a long wait, we finally went back.  I love this place.  This time I went with my 2 and 1 year old and the server was very patient with us, even after the mess that was left.

wh0-mL9s8SPHQaKDMr5xeQ.text: Manuela was AMAZING! This was our first time here and with so many options, we didn't even know where to start. She was patient and offered so many suggestions and she was right on with all of them!!! The restaurant is equally as amazing- food was so good - I definitely recommend taking the trip off the strip and trying this place- you won't be disappointed

AqawaAsfstN32YCRmsvorA.text: Had the Chile Rellano Omelette and my friend had the Chicken Enchilada Omelette and they were both outstanding! Great service!  Lots of seating and the wait went fast.  Definitely recommend this place!

jfkgwHay6C058QA5TaIeVQ.text: We are fans.  I like that they have a few locations throughout the valley to choose from.  And they are dog-friendly.  So you can have brunch with your kiddos & furkiddos.

tjiaMqYPZyGk7v8bDws3ag.text: The good, the bad and the ugly:  The good: Service was excellent. I like restaraunts that take a community approach to service. Our server Perry was really good but when he was taking care of another table, other employees were more than happy to help us out.   Food was excellent. Breakfast is too often ruined by chefs getting too "fancy". Here it's just well prepared food with great ingredients. The house sauce and seasoning salt was a highlight.   The bad: Nothing really jumps out. Hence the five stars.   The ugly: How full I felt walking out of this place.

tvtNDx9I2jm0OeRgn4nyOg.text: Local Las Vegas breakfast place.  Waited 1/2 hour for family of 6 of which three were toddlers  Provided color crayons and child drinking cups.  Ordered corn beef hash with two over easy eggs.  Corn beef was not crispy but soft cooked.  I had the Hawaiian french toast with pure maple syrup which was good.  Also ordered the chocolate chip pancakes which were pretty good.  Orange juice and coffee to drown it all down.  The only thing I would say is the lack of service hospitality.  Waitress did not provide utensils and did not serve us the right amount of cups of water as ordered.  The hostess blurted out the WIFI password when I had asked but did not give me the proper spelling, therefore, I could not ascertain the service.  Food is good but service could be a bit better.  The best thing was the Banana Nut Muffin which you can get if you check into YELP.

esz26aEaRhmT3giNO-j1XA.text: Wait time was said to be 5-10 min and we were seated in 40 seconds, now we arrived at 10:45 local time but it was a full house. The menu was large but easy to read for me and my fiancee so we picked our choices and the wait for the food was a little longer than expected but nothing more than a few minutes (my fiancee gets impatient) the food was served as listed and it was delicious and filling and service was outstanding

Cm2u1WpF7fZ-H7mlmZ2cyQ.text: The service here is absolutely horrible. I can't comment on the food as we didn't stay long enough for that. We were offered a seat in the very back near the bathrooms even though the restaurant was half full. We were offered to have a seat in another section. We were not offered menus when we were sat down. We waited 15 minutes during which time no one came by to gives us menus or to otherwise acknowledge we were even there. Other people were seated after us and were greeted by a server and given menus. It was like we were purposely being ignored. This is my first time here and my last. Avoid this place like the plague. If I could give this place negative stars I would. Go to the IHOP a couple miles away for a real breakfast.

_ghtfBQZiq96Bj9mtd0r2w.text: Yelp did not fail us on this one! The food and service was awesome! The whole restaurant was packed but we only had to wait for about 10mins until we were seated. Everyone at our table ordered something different and they were all delicious.   I'm very satisfied with their service! Although it was super busy, our server Ashley picked up on things we were mumbling to ourselves, thinking she would ignore us like any other server would on a busy day but she didn't, and got our request right away, which was nice.   I got the Sunrise Mountain which was eggs, cheese, a choice of meat on top of a fluffy croissant. Served with their delicious seasoned potato bits! Yum! Definitely recommend this one if you love cheese an eggs! It is also a very reasonable price and perfect portions.  I'm definitely going to return for breakfast when I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Benedict
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dish! Croissant, turkey sausage, eggs and cheese!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancake works, breakfast burrito, egg Benedict, mountain sunrise, stuffed French toast and lots of potato works!

XXXWTBNi-7aRWTIKJHZelQ.text: Karla is my girl!!! First off, the food is bomb, the wait is worth it and the customer service is top notch! Everyone is friendly and very attentive to your hangover needs haha but back to the food...omg is too good! I would definitely come back to that Banana Nut Muffin.

FlnYJc4R4BkOIl_XDtxpdA.text: We were looking for a breakfast off the Vegas strip & a friend told us about this place. Well, we weren't disappointed. I had the Santa Cruz skillet and it was great. Good size servings for a good price. Our server Oscar, was very good and kept checking on us. Great breakfast restaurant with great service!  Cheers

Rm1NomGp9JF2ANLWMytfaA.text: This is my second visit; the first one was 5 years ago. The food and service are still as good as I remember. The choices here are endless so it's hard not to find something you'd fancy. I had the Country Fried Steak with 2 sunnyside up's, and polished almost everything except a small portion of the potatoes. If I had to point out anything, I would wish for some veggies on the plate. Otherwise it's great! Also, don't miss out on the banana nut muffin! Our server was Carole Ann, and she made sure we were great throughout the whole meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always always always choose this humble banana nut muffin.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome steak and gravy, perfect eggs. Mean potatoes!

zFzuU3jEnV1Fv3WKhJRkxQ.text: Seen the reviews and decided to give a try. Breakfast was delicious. The banana muffins to start was warm and yummy. I had the carnesada crepe and my wife had the strawberry cream cheese french toast.  Amazing breakfast. Highly recommended

FkP6MN8rmMtT-OYNI-Eq5g.text: Absolutely must visit if you're in Vegas! I love breakfast food and was super excited to visit. Bottomless coffee, superb customer service, and delicious food! Don't forget to check in to get a free muffin.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v_rae1HqI2a4e4QZFHCwHg.text: The service was the best part of the experience even though there was a 20 minute wait. Everyone was very nice!   The plates are generous.    I ordered chile relleno omelette.  It was decent.  My wife ordered the Chorizo Omelette.  She did not like it at all.  The pancakes were very good.    I suggest going with American dishes because there is no authenticity to any Mexican dishes. Stay away from the rice and beans, they are better at Taco Bell.  The salsa was nothing special either.

kSDfR-P4htKddn0_GKgYng.text: We came through here early this year. Our friends in town recommended this place and we were not disappointed. This place had a wait which is a great sign. Everyone was warm and friendly. It definitely did not feel like the strip, and felt more real. A great place for a family. The food was delicious with large portions. Perfect comfort food. We will definitely be coming back.

u94l81ZjMmVAeKZKavtZ7Q.text: Decor nothing fancy... the food rocks. Well worth the 30 min wait  I ordered the potato omelette without cheese ontop. With every bite I took, I went Mmmmmmmm while chewing. Eggs with bacon, scallions ontop and filled with garlic mashed potatoes. I am not a fan of potatoes with eggs. However, Mmmmmmmm their Diablo potatoes were wonderfull! I would go back today if I did not have other plans. Service par excellente!

E0ri-X38zOAqoCY0NGHMKQ.text: it's good to check-in to see if they are offering any deals.  I got a free banana nut muffin which was very delicious!  corn beef skillet was okay. salty even with the eggs on top. it needed a better balance.  veggie works Benedict was very good. something I will probably order again instead of trying something new only because it's fulfilling for me.   service was good. nothing to complain about but nothing really to rave about either.

QeDlyw8ErEA2uPwUno5J3w.text: My husband said I could pick a breakfast spot and I said, the egg and I! This food is awesome, the coffee just needs creamer and is delish....and Leilani was a sweetheart. Great food, great customer service and the place is always packed. It's easy to see why this is such a busy spot but well worth the wait. Just know there is a wait.

rqQYlxW3NlF8KwmzRdvCJQ.text: We love to eat here on our trips to Las Vegas.  I come here mostly for their banana nut muffin, yum.  They now offer smaller portion omelets and you can order half potatoes and fruit.  I was able to finish all my food this time instead of leaving half of it.  The coffee could be a little stronger.
