EnmjErg1HGeknBE2BDNvJA.text: This place had amazing breakfast. The servers were awesome, polite, and enthusiastic. Service was top notch. We were a party of 5 and decided to order completely different dishes just to taste a variety of entrees. OMG, every dish was delicious.

zR_VUDtQtIkAM2AUsCTUUA.text: Their potatoes are ADDICTING!!! seriously, when i go to vegas i need to come here and have breakfast or lunch. the club sandwich is really good too! Kelli, our server was absolutely wonderful and soooooo nice!!! If she is working try to get in her section.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XzMgZMbDCJ-HQAmCK8s0zg.text: Dont seat a customer if you dont have enough servers to serve them. We wasted time waiting and calling servers just to take our order.  So we decided to just walk out and leave. They know theres a long line outside just to get seated, then when they seat you they couldnt even take your order. If u plan to eat here make sure you have atleast 1hr allowable time just to wait in line, plus another hour just to get your orders taken.

eYoYMe-P97f93c6q5L4RKw.text: Great food and great service. Better food than the food served at the fancy casinos in Vegas.

9L6xwX_arQxf7lHwz7kf4g.text: Awesome place. Always visit when we are in town!! Servers are always very friendly and they have the best banana muffins I have ever eaten.

4GxiyoznzoqrV31zQoAPow.text: Great service, our waitress was very nice! She even offered us banana nut muffins on the house since it was our first time. Portions were good for pricing.

x9zL-TkZF_67rwQTuhLwEg.text: The best breakfast place in Vegas! They have the best banana muffins and French toast and many dishes you can order a HALF order!

MzXPEyW8p6QtQHJ-HpcZpw.text: This place is awesome, good service and great food. One of a kind breakfast potatoes and omelets. Been going here for years, always a solid choice for a family breakfast.

znNzn7XLE7aaAgO57mEoYg.text: Pros: Starting from the fresh squeeze orange juice with a mini bottle of champagne to wash down the Corn Hash.  Be sure to check in on yelp for a Banana  Nut Muffin, it's extremely moist and soft and melts in your mouth.  The service is amazing and welcoming, the food is really good, and the feeling after the meal, it's worth every calorie.    Con: The wait to get in, the wait to pay.....FOREVERRRRRRR!!!!!!!! wish they had a better system to deal with paying the bill.  Once you finish, you are given the bill and you have to pay as you leave.  However, if multiple people are leaving at once, it's a long wait.  Not a good thing to go through with a very full stomach. hahaha

JmULny9YmUo4ttTgvClhGg.text: The food was absolutely delicious!!! not to mention the awesome service me and my party received from Manuela. Big ups to her for making my first time experience at this location that much more special. Definitely will be coming back and I hope to find more staff like her example. Everyone must experience Egg& I. Lastly they have delicious banana muffins. Must Try!!!!

vXXWxncxYtblpV3b_4tmtw.text: This place has the best tuna melt that I have ever had! The sandwich bread has toasted cheese on top of it and melted cheese inside of it. It is a huge plus for cheese lovers like myself. I highly recommended it.

vtP50zTSCDuCIbUN3BJmpw.text: WOW What can i say about this place other than it was amazing! I ordered the chill omelette which was amazing and it comes with potatoes. Also the banana nut muffin comes with this and this muffin was probably this best muffin i have ever had. The service was great even with the place being busy. Just a heads up your gonna have to wait especially on weekiends, it was definitely worth the wait and i will be back here every time I am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin (Best muffin ever)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

7eZemtCGmRthH-G3gXi4zQ.text: Jaime P. and I come here at least once during our stay in Vegas for breakfast (obviously).  Since it's a locals place, it gets pretty crowded, so don't come thinking you're not going to have to wait a bit before getting a seat.  It's totally worth it.  Located right off the strip, it's a great place to grab a bite to eat without hassling with the nearby hotels.  The prices are reasonable and they have a huge menu to choose from.  Even the pickiest of eaters have something to pick, no matter how difficult they might be.  It's a country style restaurant with a variety of egg dishes.  My favorite is the Eggs Benedict.  The hollandaise sauce is creamy and perfect and it's paired with some seasoned potatoes.  I like them, but they aren't my favorite.  Their biscuits and gravy are pretty awesome as well. A great dish to serve with the table, but if you're starving, you might want to try to conquer them by yourself.

ov9Dm2C8qaIpjm2_gosIOA.text: This place is awesome. Good Quantity and flavor. Loved the banana muffin. Will defiantly make it a go to breakfast spot when I visit Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky rice with hamburger gravy and egg
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!

56kDuKtIedh2_ejnwQ505w.text: Best breakfast in a long time!   Huge menu, wonderful and friendly staff and the food is excellent.  I got great recommendation from the manager as I was paying, which was to order smaller servings so I could try more of their dishes!  Yep, I will be back before I leave Vegas to do exactly that!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best breakfast in Vegas!

IqzB2sQZv8XWPuFIVdIrUg.text: Great chile relleno omelette and the sliced avocado and cheese omelette were very good.

DfIzng2aZCRnbKZ3OKsF6Q.text: Made a Togo order. Breakfast Burrito. Waited 23 minutes for the burrito and my order was wrong. Waited another 12 minutes for a simple correction to order and finally cancelled. Do not recommend take out.

78xQ11CMQl3sAnFvM50Crg.text: I always get the Milk Thai Tea Boba it super good and refreshing . They also have punch card when you get buy 10 drinks you get your 10th one for free .

zQ7IrUmDUo5cJJRg9kB7sw.text: Enjoyed an incredible breakfast. They were very busy, but extremely efficient. Our server Oscar was outstanding. He was hustling with a lot of tables, but was very attentive, helpful & friendly. Habla Diabla potatoes were off the charts. Had the Carnitas Huevos Rancheros and wasn't disappointed. Great family owned restaurant. Will absolutely be back. Highly recommended

Ve8tKLwdz1EbLBt2pBAgog.text: Not sure what all the high reviews on this place is about. This is your standard ordinary breakfast place. The service is excellent, very friendly and nice waitresses. The menu is great, lots of variety to choose from. But the food was just average. I was really disappointed in my bacon and avocado omelette. I thought they seriously forgot to add the bacon. I dug through the omelette for it and finally saw tiny small crumbles of it in there. The egg was thick and dry and the only good thing about it was the avocado chunks inside. Big pieces of avocado. That's IT.  The potatoes it came with were not good. Just deep fried potatoes. The side of fruit was much better. The corned beef hash was mushy and had a lot of potatoes. Was disappointed in that too. Why the heck all the stars, yelpers??  Ok ok, the muffin was probably the best part. They give you choice of toast or muffin. Get the muffin!

DK9HPNuCQrj-SFDQJ-81JA.text: Stopped in for breakfast. We heard great things about this place and they lived up to the reputation without a doubt.   The staff is very friendly, polite and very efficient. They were always very conscious to our needs.   The food was fantastic! We highly recommend this place.  I'm just sorry that we don't live here to come back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Obviously a place that has a great reputation
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros with green sauce

y0loElgLYkTc5hyFp6MlQA.text: Back to LV after 20 years and breakfast still great. Service from Oscar was more than top notch and the Country Bennie was to die for - in fact if my cardiologist finds out I'm in here and hears my arteries slamming shut he may sue.

NcTE4x2hHNRLsrUvZVsmsg.text: Awwww yes I love me some breakfast anytime of day!  Took my sweetie here for breakfast after hearing all of the glowing reviews. I am sure glad we dined here because it was eggceptional! Make sure you come hungry because their portions are large and in charge!  Her- Denver Omelette 8.49 Diced ham, onions, green peppers and melted cheese.   *Three-egg omelettes served with ranch potatoes and an English muffin or toast.  Him- Mexican Omelette 8.59 Chorizo sausage, green chiles and onions, topped with Monterrey Jack and Cheddar cheese, salsa or pork green chili, sour cream and green onions. Served with a flour tortilla.  Their ranch potatoes are so good!  Wow we were very pleased with the service and quality/quantity of food!   My coffee cup was never empty, refills galore from a catering staff!  We will be back indeed!  Yummy for sure a must stop for a lip smacking country breakfast!

wNp_nAeY4osJxpBqltUBDQ.text: First time here in the multiple times I've been to Vegas, I wonder what took me so longggggg?  the food was amazing, especially the Yelp muffin and French toast. Our server Liza was such a loving lady always checking in every 3-5mins making sure we didn't need anything extra, because of her I'll be coming back every time I visit Vegas from here on. Thank you for your great service Liza! Hope you get those Disneyland tickets, you deserve them!!!

QV-vtvnDiuxE0cfqs_4EEQ.text: I ate at Egg & I and had a food server (Victoria) was absolutely amazing! She treated everyone in her section, including my party as if we were her only and most important table. I will definitely come here and ask for her specifically next time.

Rj0fkqiafpGuWXwsD2MrBQ.text: Excellent! Service was great, food was awesome, lots of variety and great looking place. This is a great place to take your family to when in Las Vegas. Loved it truly deserves 5 stars!

G2Rpb1ee6fKNk2ogPgnrlw.text: Stopped in here for breakfast on the way out of town.  Wife had banana pancakes with pecans, and I had some prime rib/eggs benedict plate.  She liked her meal, and mine was good other than the prime rib being a bit too seasoned.  The portions were big, but the prices were a little higher than I expected.  It was pretty crowded, but we had good service.  Unfortunately, there are a lot of breakfast joints in Vegas, so I probably won't be back.  But worth a try - maybe it just wasn't my style.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib and eggs benedict
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana and pecan pancakes

fsywqfASdfcRAZ_4fsEbQA.text: We arrived @ 8:30 AM and did not have to wait.  KAREN, our server, was promptly at our table making sure we had the menus, water, etc.  She stopped by again shortly to get our orders.  The food, skillet breakfast and Island favorite, was excellent.  I asked KAREN what the brand was for the portugese sausage.  She didn't know but went to the kitchen to ask.  That's service! I highly recommend this place for the food, pricing and service.

OVkbeBEaqB6vhxrsQj54zA.text: The food was good but not amazing, I'm not sure what all the hype is about. Service was great hence the 4 stars. Husband liked his works omelette. I ordered the stuffed French toast which had a little too much cheese and the kids' banana pancake was pretty dry. I'm not sure I'd come back.

oSx5k1AXAfRqO-RkhaF08w.text: This was my first time eating here and let me just say it was amazing. The service from Amanda was above 100%, and no sooner then sitting down did she have our drinks ready for us. After our drinks she was highly intensive even though the restaurant was busy it seemed that all of her tables were taking the best care of. Honestly the food as well was amazing, so would I recommend this place... Yes 100%

3gWgXj-KvfG7BDcUo_NkUw.text: First of all, when you walk in the restaurant people with colorful t-shirts and bright smiles welcomes you in, They want to make sure everyone is happy and satisfied so they have the smile/frown sign on the table. The food is amazing with good price and portion. Talking about portion.. It's HUGEEE but the best part is you can do half order. I recommend the country fried steak on skillet with fries and potato omelette. It literally melts in your mouth with all the happiness you can give to your tummy. its a baby friendly environment. But!!!! One thing It is a pretty heavy high calorie meal so be prepared. Must try!!! I will definitely come back whenever I visit Vegas for any reasons! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wn4Nn6hSEmGeHH75hmlvLg.text: Great food! Alexa was great, so patient with those of us new to the Egg and I. The portions are very huge so bring an appetite. I recommend the bacon and avocado omelet.

ibSsjWjavdxoPhOY-Ca0IA.text: wow.. what a fantastic place to eat! it's nice that you can get breakfast specialties until late since one does not tend to wake up early in vegas. place is a lil rustic looking but feels homey.  denisse was our waitress and she was awesome. we asked for another complimentary banana muffin because it was soooo good.. and she gave us a couple to take with us!! how awesome is that??  our food was really good and hearty. the kind of food that fills you up! coffee was good and strong.  ill def be coming back the next time i'm in town

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. western omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. philly cheesesteak

LEdBrsUvh74-sgCPjfGoWQ.text: This is our second time here and this spot Did Not disappoint!! Ordered the gumbolya OMG!! Perecto!! Just added a little salt and it was on!! My wife had the french toast , gave it thumbs up!! The waitress we had (Lacey) even gave her a little extra taste of what she could of had... which was a great touch of going beyond. We love the ascetics vibe of the restaurant, and the staff is second to NONE!!

q48KwrHRZVgb_3acZONx2Q.text: Busy but fast.   The staff is great and the people you see are "interesting" for this is Vegas, what did you expect?  The place is bigger than it looks but the food is on point.

fPC0KlFLAZbMTjAc8KXKTg.text: When I come to Vegas, I have to stop by here. It's a must! Stuffed French toast is to die for.

NPsyeSWGMPHArEAtVV4KXQ.text: Loved my Sundance omelet!! All veggies, topped with feta cheese and chopped tomatoes. Very fresh fruit on the side. Great and friendly service! Would definitely return.

e9e69gTOm9TQ9MOt1wCtGw.text: It's all about the banana nut muffin. It's five stars all on its own. One comes with the meal, but you get another for checking in. Sadly, I forgot my phone in the hotel room so I wasn't able to get mine, but my friend got his to go, and we ate it in the room later on. Yummmmm.  He got the chicken fried steak, which was good, and I got some chicken, mushroom, avocado omelet with added spinach. I loved all the avocado in it, but there was something lacking in flavor. Also, there was way too much cheese. I love cheese, so for me to say that, it's a big thing. Also, I wasn't a fan of the salty seasoning on the potatoes. I wish there was less of it, or none of all.  Don't wait for your server to collect your payment. You have to do that at the front counter.

Q3p4Y8vH67mg6aMmvmZa9Q.text: A little off the strip but a quick Uber ride it's exactly what we wanted when we are hung over

3tdf1QcFFPXZ81PMAu2XNA.text: Fast and polite service! The food was so yummy, I will be coming back when I'm in town! Loved the breakfast!

2HN9ApfHKiZ0Yg6vzgz2ew.text: Great food and great price! They have a lot of healthier options & you get a free banana muffin with Yelp checkin!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious!!!!

IsLjhicOXkt6ZXpogxgHRg.text: Wow! The best banana muffins in here! We also like the French toast. We orders so many food and end up pack to go. We will come back for sure

FECtmoh_qmIihl9HXt70Sw.text: You got to try this place. This place is off the strip and not something that most visitors are aware of. It's a gem of a breakfast/brunch place that is filled with positive energy and awesome food. They have a pretty diverse menu for all kinds of taste buds. The service is very fast hey doesn't take long for the food to be ready. Portion sizes are very generous and the price is more than fair. With The fresh taste of all ingredients combined with endless  fresh coffee in the morning, this place pays really well for the crazy day you're about to spend in Vegas. This place is a must try

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u4ikQMF7gRSVOzvExkPxsw.text: We saw all the great reviews and were eager to try this place. Totally packed on a Thursday morning, another good sign. Maybe it was what we all ordered, or maybe just not our style but for all of us, food was just so-so and quite bland. Hubby had the chicken fried steak skillet, kid had the chicken fried steak with extra gravy and I opted for the corned beef hash with eggs over easy. None of us were fans of the potatoes, over seasoned and very salty. Both guys said the gravy had kind of the same seasoning too it. Corned beef hash was flavorless and the eggs were a bit overdone. Overall we were underwhelmed.

BMyYx_QjAEw_C-ypYeRe4A.text: Probably the most reviewed business off the strip, what's more inviting than that?  Arrival wait pretty much sucked, did not help that the hostess was on the rude side.  Lo and behold our waitress (Paula) came through to save the day in the service department. She was great from the get go and stayed consistent providing excellent comfortable service that you'd want to get from a breakfast spot after a looooong night out.  Food:  The Check-In Muffin: Meh, nothing great. I'm a big carrot raisin muffin person and this was okay. Complimentary so am I allowed to give it a 2/5?   The Big Omelette: If it's not called that then it's some synonym of the word big. How impressive can an omelette be? Order this and you'll find out. The way that the ingredients are actually layered in between the eggs is a unique alternative to the usual blanket style omelette. Ingredients a plus. 4.75/5  Potatoes: These need a review of their own. Eggs and I let me know I was not crazy for expecting good side breakfast potatoes everywhere else where I've had them. The seasoning extraordinary...cooked to perfection..add a little catsup and you've got the best potatoes I have ever had at breakfast. 5/5  French Toast: I got hit with an avalanche off the high that I was on. There was something wrong with these. Not so the taste but more of the texture. Even the berries and the whip could not save these. 2/5  Orange Juice Carafe: It seems bottomless for two, good deal, good taste. Freshly squeezed I think. 4/5  Not disappointed with my meal here. The hostess and the french toast need to be reworked a little, get her to shadow Paula and steal Blu Jam's recipe, maybe?  Oh yeah, the salsa :/ taste like taco bell sauce but does not come with a witty packet message

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skip

HHpX868WF96nOc3B7ZecDg.text: If you've never eaten here please do yourself a favor and try this place! Everything is good, but I usually have the chili relleno or chorizo omelet.

zLONaPO0Lxm7o2Fe7TZvDw.text: Great breakfast spot off the strip . They offer some nice breakfast selection other than just basic bacon and eggs . Large portions and tasty breakfast . Come on a empty stomach . Also price reasonable for all the food you get .

ztfI1K_FU3WDWRk9MlDcLw.text: Good place to eat for breakfast  Packed with people but not too long to wait  Server nice and friendly  And I got a free banana muffin which is so good   ....

d8fzuQLF7VhLV5IswnKzIw.text: Maple Bacon Stuffed French Toast and the banana nut muffins were delicious! We were afraid it would be too sweet and overwhelming, but since you can just dip the French toast in the maple spread (it's not actually stuffed) and syrup it's just enough! Highly recommend splitting this with someone! We split that and the bacon, avocado omelet with potatoes which was also great. Portions are healthy and prices are very reasonable. Erin, our waitress, was an absolute pleasure!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado, bacon and cheddar cheese omelet! With Diablo potatoes!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maple Bacon Stuffed French Toast was delicious!

C5PG--GgYyO4FY8Sa1ljjQ.text: Quick service and great food. We stopped for breakfast and waited about 15 min on a Saturday morning. Vegetarian veggie breakfast skillet was super yummy.

HF0s0a5xBqh-3jfk6XYnSw.text: Everything is beautiful. Inside and out . Tamara is a great waitress ! The banana nut muffin is sooo good

aLh_OTcRzJwT5OaFm0nVTQ.text: We really loved this place! Kelly was our waitress and she was the friendliest server I've ever had. The food tasted great and came in big portions. The service was speedy too! It's a popular place so we waited about 15 minutes to get a table, but they have a text alert system, which I always appreciate. This will add to our Vegas check list next time we come back.

14UJtO3_yxYrnhO_q7vdpw.text: This is probably one of my favorite breakfast places in Las Vegas. The food is amazing and the waiters/waitresses are all very fast and professional. In the morning and on weekends this place is packed. But it is definitely worth the wait. The food is always cooked perfectly and the ambiance is cheerful. If it's not 100 outside I would reccomend eating outside, it's much more peaceful even though it's right off sahara.

S970_2R0ow-9GKm7OIWitg.text: Shot almost made it to 5 stars really did ! On a Sunday around 12pm my friends and I came in for some brunch ....we waited for about 35 minutes to be seated because it was packed ....once we got to our table service was speedy the waitress was on it ....there are some really cute egg reference items in this place on the menu and table for example they had an egg table piece you make it a happy face when your service is great and don't need anything but flip it to sad egg face if you need something and your waitress shows up right away lol...anyways absolutely everything we ordered came at a decent time the meals looked straight out of a food magazine and tasted heavenly.....except for .......:..the ranch ....yes the ranch I am a big fan of ranch and my fries and chicken wrap did not taste the same with watered down ranch I would think most people will agree.

hn79dP82F6fJYE_5jh22_w.text: Amazing!!!! A place I didn't think I would try but ended up loving ! My boyfriend and leave satisfied every time we come here , their orange juice is amazing ! I most definitely can't leave out their Cajun fries and ranch!!! Omg took my breath away , I ordered biscuits and gravy while my boyfriend ordered stuffed French toast  highly recommend.

j6Ujm0Q_XWYgYPPoRy5jDA.text: This place was delicious!  My hubby is pretty basic and orders the same thing everywhere we go, steak and eggs. He said it was amazing, his scrambled eggs were smothered in cheese. I ordered the Ensanada burrito, and omg was it great. I love Verde salsa and this was great salsa, amazing flavor and seasonings. You know sometimes there's some super bland salsa on your burrito? Not this salsa, it was yummy and I'd love to have taken it home with me. My burrito came with beans and rice which were ok but the burrito was huge so I couldn't eat everything anyways. I'd highly recommend giving them a try, it's a bit of a drive off the strip but we'll definitely be back our next visit to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m0HNKNjXOX4l8v9lSshQIw.text: We came here to eat breakfast. I found it on Yelp. There's a parking lot in front as we pulled up. When we entered, we were seated by the hostess. She sat us in the back.   Our nice and kind waitress was Karla. She was super sweet and friendly. I ordered an orange juice and the island style plate which consisted of choice of spam or Portuguese sausage. I went with spam, eggs over easy and came with two scoops of white rice. The most simple breakfast I have had. It fulfilled my cravings for spam. I love fried spam. I literally scarfed my food down because I was so hungry. I accidentally tipped my orange juice on the table and Karla kindly cleaned it up and gave me a new orange juice. Thanks Karla!   Service was excellent by our waitress Karla and the rest of their crew that works for them! I even got to sample the potatoes and corn beef hash and it was fresh and delicious! I definitely loved the breakfast. My daughter had fruit loops cereal and a muffin. Each of us received a chocolate muffin. This was hot and delicious. Very moist. So glad we came here. Definitely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island style
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Muffin! Fresh from the oven. It&#39;s hot!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good to know

prSKnHjIl_kkEiYcjmPrJg.text: Awesome breakfast food! Love their version of home fries--they're like seasoned potatoes  I had their green chili stuffed with cheese and it was inside of the folded omelet. Oh and you can't forget about their warm banana nut muffin (there's a check in offer for a free banana nut muffin)

Spdoq9QKbJcTS0SW7J2a0A.text: Forget the Strip, Egg & I is the perfect post-partying breakfast. There's a bit of a wait during peak hours, but once you're seated, the food comes out quick.   The menu offers anything you could want for breakfast. There are several variations of eggs benedict, and I finally settled on the Spinach Eggs Benedict with potatoes and fruit on the side. The dish met my expectations, but it was the service that blew me away. Everyone, from the servers to the bussers, were quick and friendly.  Be sure to redeem your check in offer for a free banana muffin. I know the next time I come to Vegas, I'll be stopping by Egg & I!

dKOmIPqDB3jyxQ43DQmSeg.text: The service is great . I am a big fun of this place. I do recomend the eggs Benedict. It's by far the best place for breakfast in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food... excelente service and now entertainment...
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r6tAYnJvChu_w4OBQ7UF2Q.text: Been here before outstanding service waited less than a minute Lacey was nice and professional knows her job very well came back to check on us more than once great smile and outstanding customer service

Te5laChqc0pFzppVvGIdWA.text: The Egg & I (and it's sister restaurants -- they're all pretty much the same so find which one is closest to your location...) are all wonderful classic breakfast spots, often full (as-in yes, there's gonna be a wait, unless perhaps you're there in the afternoon) of both locals and tourists who've heard about the place.    Service is very friendly & attentive -- it's clear that unlike many similar restaurants, this small chain actually hires partially on the basis of personality, and teaches/enforces good customer service), food tastes great, prices are reasonable.      Despite 5 - 15 minute waits before a table is ready, my visiting friends specifically ask to go back to The Egg & I for breakfast (or breakfast at lunchtime) when they're back in-town.

aEiD-wVUCdObsJPxWXKMbw.text: Very large menu. I had the classic breakfast with no meat while my husband got the avocado bacon omelette. We checked in and got a free banana nut muffin that was so yummy and fresh, steam coming out of it and super moist. They give you a TON of potatoes that are nicely seasoned with diablo seasoning?  The omelette had endless avocado that was very fresh and appealing to me as I sat across eat him my husband eat it, lol. Our server Karen was very friendly and attentive. The place was busy when we got there yet everyone seemed to be take. Care of which was very nice. I appreciate thy when you order coffee they leave an pot on your table so you're never waiting for a full up, very nice touch that set them apart from most. When we left the line was out the door.  Found this place on yelp and glad we did~

yHvalMoQ0WGFQmFbAMAuXg.text: Their skillets were so good and filling. Best breakfast in Vegas and will definitely come back here!

JyyKRU3Q-ty-UqWlosREbQ.text: Visiting Vegas and wanted to find a spot away from the strip.  Found this and decided to try it out. Ordered the chicken enchilada omlette w/ red enchilada sauce, huevos rancheros w/ red enchilada sauce and the country benedict. All were good but that huevos rancheros w/ enchilada sauce was amazing!! Will be back next time I'm in town. They also have a dog friendly patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EBMGGIMMveDY9OMeKbtMOA.text: The first think you'll notice about this place is how busy it can get during breakfast times. But don't let that steer you away! Or wait time was only 15 minutes and although it was packed, the service was exceptional. We were taken care of immediately, there was no delay. I highly suggest seating outside on a nice day. Our server Lacey was awesome! The prices are reasonable and I enjoyed the food greatly. Portions are above average and delicious! Will definitely visit this place again when I'm back in town.

h92tklpJEQSy39P3jKKbnw.text: Very friendly service this morning. Our server had a great friendly demeanor. Food was good. Large portions. The potatoes were tasty. Go with the banana muffin. No wait this morning but maybe because it was during the weekday. They have a "local" section for those that can't go without rice.  Also means Da 808 has found this place which equals plenty of business!

8TtWLx_JglLE7yWH7IKlCA.text: This particular place was great! Our server, Evelyn, made our experience amazing- she was so sweet and quick. The food was wonderful. We even bought some salsa and spices to go. Evelyn let us try a banana-nut muffin ... I want the recipe. We split a meal (which was more than enough food) --it was a breakfast burrito, which tasted like a flavor explosion -- and paid under 12 bucks. I highly recommend this place. Great service and great food!

S4WdBw-O-BFiQooHtgtBwQ.text: Their food is as great as their service!  There were about 15-20 people outside waiting, but since the restaurant has plentiful seating, my party of four waited about 10minutes. I ordered the spinach benny and candied walnut pancakes; both of which were delicious! Karla was our server and she was phenomenal!

4Kke-ErjEKc-TQEJTxJUXw.text: Yelp's reviews are the best.  All the way from Miami end it up here based on their amazing reviews and it did not disappoint.  Great food.  Must try the banana muffins!!

7J-48nRo0F-RahxZNnPlQw.text: This review is for my visit last month.   I Love this place...!! This is my first time having brunch here on my visit to Las Vegas.   The variety of food and the service totally blows my mind.  Our server was very nice and informative. She gives us her honest opinions when we ask which of the loco moco we should try. Instead of harming business, I think this is a good practice. To be able to know what the insider thinks...  The banana muffin.... speechless. Out of this world good. Still ooey gooey and warm out of oven. New guest should make sure to take advantage of the free muffin for yelp check in.   Enough said... just visit. U r not going to regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SiXFkwl0Z4pR99FOwUfLWA.text: Best Hawaiian burger steak in vegas! Loco moco is what you need to order in here! and the freaking spam! I don't not know but when they cook the spam it's so good!  They have the free banana muffin yo! so good!! very good service and very fast!  5 star!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

37NKXfSfMVNK2iPRF1xLWQ.text: This place has better service than most places. I only ate here once and would like to try it again and again. Very friendly staff and great hospitality. Unlike places like the Big dogs draft house and Peppermill, the servers at the Egg and I are extremely on target. I didn't have to wait 20 minutes for food and got my meal within 10 minutes. This place is very awesome.

7W8-R0B7W7ue8kX0QHDBDw.text: we were in vegas this past weekend for a very short trip. of course there are bazillion places to eat on the strip, but i wanted to check out some place off strip, to get away from the craziness of driving in bumper to bumper traffic, waiting for tons of people to cross the streets and then to wait to eat.   Egg & I is located off strip, east of the 15 off of the sahara exit. its located in a strip mall with plenty of parking. there is indoor and outdoor seating. there were a few people waiting when we arrived but we were quickly seated. the place was full with a few tables empty. we were expecting to wait but it was already about 10AM by the time we went.   i ordered the strawberry and cream french toast which was thick slices of soft french toast with a strawberry whipped cream cheese and strawberry preserves on top. it was pretty good. i liked that it wasnt too sweet like most french toast/waffles with fruit toppings at other restaurants.  the bf ordered the fiesta skillet with chorizo. it had green chili, onions and salsa. i thought it was gonna be sausage type of chorizo but it was the ground kind. if you've ever cooked or bought it at the market you know what im talking about. when you cook it, it pretty much just melts. so the skillet was as if it had chili on top. it was pretty heavy and greasy. i could probably do without the chorizo next time.  the bfs bro ordered the country fried steak skillet. this had chopped chunks of country fried steak with their homestyle potatoes and eggs with white gravy on top. it was pretty good. it tasted just like a regular country fried steak plate but all chopped up for you, if you dont mind your food touching (i know some people who dont, like my 5 yr old nephew...).  bfs bro's fiance ordered the stuffed french toast. this was two pieces of their thick sliced fluffy french toast with an omelet in between. the eggs had lots of bits of bacon in it which made it tasty but it was pretty firm. i felt like it was over cooked. maybe it was all the cheese. it tasted good though. it tasted good with either the syrup and/or ketchup. sweet or savory, whichever you prefer.   we had also had a side of the banana nut muffin, which was pretty good. it was large on top. it wasnt too sweet which was nice. it came out moist and warm. yum!  the service was good. everyone was pretty friendly and the food came out fast. we had ordered coffee and they gave us a pitcher of coffee. they take credit card but you have to show your ID and pay at the front.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fiesta skillet with chorizo
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak skillet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed french toast

JoEwgbI2x54vAenUsdNN5Q.text: Went to Egg & I for brunch and it really exceeded my expectations.  I heard good things about this place and the reviews are are spot on.  It is located off the strip.  Located in a plaza with other businesses and there is plenty of parking.    I ordered the new york steak and eggs.  Steak was tender and juicy.  Eggs were cooked perfectly.  Served with country ranch potatoes.  The country potatoes are basically small fried potatoes squares with ranch seasoning.  My GF had the cajun shrimp eggs benedict special.  The fresh fruit plate contains blueberries, madarin oranges, pineapple, cantaloupe, and honeydew slices.  Fruits were fresh and it was a great way to start off the morning.  Expect to wait a few minutes if you have a party larger than 2.  Luckily it was just me and my GF and we were seated right when we arrived.  The staff were fast, friendly, courteous, and they were as accommodating as much as possible.  Egg & I, you guys are now one of my favorite breakfast / lunch places to visit when I am around the Las Vegas Area.  Thank you for the great meal.  Bon Apettit

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fruit salad, well whats left of it
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ney York steak and eggs
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Shrimp with poached eggs

vXRvpK-qI8Xcn_UuOSqcAw.text: Muffin was good, omelet and potatoes were amazing! French toast was not impressive at all. Over all good experience. Kind of expensive but it was big plates.

Y6vDDpNPPQ8TGEEvSKpILQ.text: This is my second time eating here. Both experiences where exceptionally pleasant. Shout out to our server Lindsey. You were great.

7HIqkaGYESIWPdEC4qkk2w.text: Great food! Excellent service! Linnea was so helpful with the menu and made sure our whole dining experience went well.

lJ5pkhdX2yIxrzmo4nhEvA.text: Ate here with hubby while visiting Las Vegas. They had a newspaper-like menu, which I thought was different and cute. If they ask if you want toast or banana nut muffin, choose the muffin!!! The muffin doesn't look appetizing, but boy was it delicious! I had the traditional benny. Decent portion and very satisfying. We had a really nice server, Roman, who was attentive and checked on us often to see if we were doing okay.

rVyc7Kbz8tyC9eme-fcwDg.text: The food was delicious and the portions are generous. I usually am not a fan of banana nut muffins, but the homemade muffins here are amazing! The house potatoes that come with the breakfast dishes have a good seasoning to them. Our waitress, Alexa was very nice and attentive as well.

pQh2GzkAnbLKiDqEpxcylQ.text: This is a great brunch place. I enjoy the farm decorations and outdoor seating is beautiful on a sunny day off. A lot of selection when it comes to food with eggs of course, a little less creativity with things like pancakes, waffles,etc. Still a very solid place to eat, food is not oozing with grease like most other places. Service is pretty quick.

iB-T1yd5ot9R94WFWJSjJA.text: We decided to try something other than IHOP - and, we're really glad we did! Food was fantastic - and, the service made it a perfect breakfast! AMANDA was very pleasant, attentive & we loved her suggestions.....We'll definitely be back!

eyAEj7vJQpBWKMIsDnh3Og.text: Looking for breakfast on our way out of Vegas and happened by this spot. There were people waiting outside so we figured there would be a long wait...nope! We were seated about 15min later (as promised). So many great sounding entrees to choose from! I decided on the stuffed French toast. Wow! The food was delicious. The service was amazing. Manuela new the menu like the back of her hand, so when my husband attempted to create his own dish (banana nut French toast), Manuela knew exactly what he needed to order. This was the perfect ending to a great weekend! Oh, don't forget to check-in and get a free muffin!

Lz7pyihlF19feiCJc04xGQ.text: This place makes some of the best omelets I have ever eaten!  They are huge too, a 4 egg omelet stuffed with everything imaginable. The staff is very cheerful and attentive.

-1n0o2l1f_7lIjMS49bEnA.text: I always plan on having breakfast here while I'm in vegas. Great prices, Great food and Great Service.   Carole Ann served us today and she was great.   Worth the wait. If you have a group, Call ahead and let them know. They will try and get something set up for you before you get there.

HTSJYklbDMDkx4H6Qhdc0g.text: Food was super good, had a very good waitress, very polite, and generous. First time going, definitely get the banana muffin

UF9iJeC2e-srqqisoedJkQ.text: I only gave it three stars because we came in with a large party and they did not accommodate us well. A fourth of us got our meal then the other fourth and so on until we all got out meals. They came about 15 minutes apart. Our kids were with us and they were not happy to wait so long and get the food. They need to work on their timing better but the food was good.

QuefaX4Y2JedITL38tQPnw.text: Everything yum for breakfast. Had Combo pancakes and eggs just the way I like'em. Cooked well with mushrooms and spinach, Chance is an awesome waitress -quite service. Will definitely return my next visit.

S83oDVJ8k6tZz2leRUX05Q.text: This place is delicious. I'm sure everyone who knows this place knows this already.  The banana but muffins are awesome.  But I'm mostly writing about our server Amanda.  A young and friendly face that made our experience above expectation.  Her kind and always helpful manner left us in a good mood and ready to enjoy our day after breakfast.  Never in my life have I ever had such a positive server.  She really made our day.  For that I wanted to leave this review.  So if you're ever in town and want a great breakfast, come to the Egg and I and definitely ask for Amanda.

FbYOwuC8lm1EXlqU7YcPVw.text: By far THE BEST BREAKFAST PLACE so far in my life! Very simple & great service! The waffles w fresh fruit was phenomenal & biscuits & gravy - don't get me started! I don't know why this place isn't 5-stars on Yelp! It's probably because of losers or snobs who just want to make a statement. If I could I would give it 6-stars!!   I've been to breakfast places all over the country and this place is THE BEST!  "Johnathan" was awesome!!! Hope I'll see him in Disneyland! Cheers to the owners of this place, they know breakfast! :)

sKCUsgy_-uUmupLMFGlduA.text: OMG...!!! Everything was amazing. The banana nut bread is homemade and heaven!!  To die for Chili as well.  Lots and lots of options. I love local breakfast places and this ranks up next to my favorite one back home.  I wish they had this in Oregon!!

zTvmezmTI9L5CCd0dpvRbA.text: I went here based on the yelp reviews.  Lots of locals mixed with tourists.  Seated right away and even on a Monday morning was jammed packed with people. I had the Cheese, Spinach & Egg omelet. Even though it is not on the menu, you can design your own omelette.  so I designed one just for me, I asked for fruit rather than potatoes no extra charge to change the sides the fruit was amazing -big pieces of  pineapple, orange, grapefruit, watermelon, canteloupe and honeydew.  Everything was yummy including the home made Banana Nut Muffins and we took a few to go.  Good place for breakfast, nice menu selection and Carole Ann was a great waitress.  The total cost including two breakfasts, 3 muffins to go, 2 hot teas, = $31.00 with tax & tip.  Very good breakfast & service.

mmIsqESoqHYH3Qp5jq_ShQ.text: This place is amazing. There is often a wait on the weekends but it's worth it. The service and food have never disappointed so if you're looking for brunch, stop looking and start driving.   Btw - get the muffins, you'll thank me.

nirNCperHcb0cTj_41nGRg.text: Eaten here several times , the food is good , the service is usually good , but this time I was irritated by time delay for our 2 meals , a table of 6 was seated and their orders were placed well after us , all 6 meals were served at least 5 minutes befand ours   Monica , tried both the numbers in your reply several times and all I get is a busy signal or just continued ringing. The restaurant we were at was at 4533 w Sahara , Las Vegas .  We were seated about 20 minutes after I checked in , that was no problem, you were busy and it was just before lunch time, we had a table outside at the far end , it started out good , as we placed our 2 orders a group of 6 were seated at the next table , the waiter (did not catch his name) went and got us water , then he went to the 6 and got them all water , and took orders , we had ordered at least 5 minutes before this , then after a bit of time the 6 people were served Bloody Mary's just before they were served their meals , we were still waiting, our meals arrived about 5 minutes later . This was a bit irritating because I felt that our order was pushed behind others , we had simple meals , this delay should not have been a complicated prep time, I had the beef dip and my partner had a burger covered in chili, our meals were good as usual , but not real hot , they were both medium warm , not really enough to make the meals bad . The problem I had was the delay while a 6 people table got cocktails and their meals while we waited . This was the reason for the yelp rating . We usually frequent your restaurant at sunset and eastern , never had this happen before .  If you wish further information you can contact me via my email @. Rockym1212@gmail .com Thank you , Michael

sC7eL-3U3OyxKH_TjHqvsg.text: Egg & I is part of a chain family of restaurants here in Vegas, and well worth a visit. This review is for breakfast.  Food: The chicken fried steak was nicely fried with a light batter. I had my gravy on the side, and it was rich, creamy, and flavorful. Eggs were cooked as requested. The potatoes were a little too overwhelming and powdery with the spice they use on them, but otherwise were cooked well and in bite sizes. The stuffed French toast was filled with sausage, egg, and cheese. If yuh don't mind your sweet and savory mixing, this is for you. French toast had a soft center and slightly crunchy exterior.   Service: They know how to turn tables here on a busy Sunday. Staff were friendly and efficient. They have a sign on the table that guests may use to call for service, or note they are OK. Water gets refilled often, and coffee comes in a pot, so you may top up when you need to. They even brought flavored creamer out.   Cost: Two breakfast meals, a coffee, and an ice tea ran us about $34 after tax.   Overall: Great local spot. In a strip mall, so plenty of parking. Worth a try. They take cards. And if you check in using Yelp!, you have the option of getting an extra banana muffin each person. Bonus!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l2AyItO3OqjzmS3lFFM1qg.text: Came here on a Tuesday morning. There was a slight line outside but we were seated within 5 minutes which was great. There was both outdoor and indoor seating. I feel like it's important to say that even though it's a million degrees outside, they have water misters. I loved the egg flip notifications on the table-- a great way to get the servers attention. It reminded me a lot of a NJ diner. Our server's name was Lacey and she was very sweet!   I immediately loved the complimentary banana nut muffin that came with the meal (shout-out to yelp!). The menu was EXTENSIVE which I totally appreciated. I didn't even know where to start!! We ordered the Hawaiian french toast combo and the stuffed french toast. I honestly was disappointed in my French toast residually from the reviews I saw on here. I expected it to take like hawaain sweet bread but instead it tasted like plain french toast; still good but I would've ordered something different if I knew. The stuffed french toast on the other hand was absolutely yummy. It has cheese, sausage, and eggs with some seasoned potatoes. I would come back again to try another egg treat off the menu especially because it's so budget friendly for the area with pretty great service. But I definitely wouldn't get the French toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Hawaiian&#34; french toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu cover--cool newspaper vibe
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed french toast

vHnU50mUvofnz61q6ipaoA.text: Banana nuts muffins are delicious!!! They came out fresh and hot. It was moist enough to just melt in your mouth.  We ordered the Work Skillet, which took two people to barely finish. Every single ingredient was flavorful.  The server took care of us like we were their kids.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Work Skillet

IeL9wd2uveLQgah_rJyUnQ.text: I go to Vegas at least once a year and I am always looking for new places to try out - off the strip. I came across this place on Yelp and after checking out some pictures and reading some reviews I knew this was right up my alley.  When I got here, it was busy, but not crazy so I got seated right away. Because I spent so much time on Yelp checking this place out I already had a good idea of what I wanted. Chile Relleno Omelet!  The meal was awesome! Super flavorful and really filling. On top of that the coffee was delicious, hot and plentiful.  I have earmarked this place for my next visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Relleno Omelet.

N18iZvd3M1j3hGvVZtDc0A.text: This was a solid 4.5, and was one of the best food stops we had on our Vacation vacation.  It's far off the strip, but that's ok.  It was clearly packed with locals which is important in a place like Vegas were they have a ton of options.  Servers were friendly, food was fresh, and left us both full. It's everything you could want in a breakfast joint.   Husband got the three piggy omelet, I got French toast, and neither of us was disappointed.  Prices were really shockingly low (compared to the strip) and about what we'd pay at our local joint in San Diego.    If you have the choice, drive off the strip and head here. Don't let the lines scare you and enjoy watching the train.

GyNQE3HqLtBKjbl9qbCxUQ.text: One of the best breakfast spots I've been to in the US. They have that family-owned/operated vibe, super friendly and attentive service (despite being crazy busy), and of course, food that is out of this world good.   We waited about 15 minutes for a table for two on a Thursday morning around brunch time. I would suggest looking at the menu in advance (you can find photos on Yelp) if you're in a hurry as their menu is extensive.   I did the Yelp check-in for a free banana nut muffin and it was SO worth it! It was served warm and almost melted in my mouth. Definitely less dense than a typical banana nut bread or muffin.   I had a breakfast tostada with carnitas for my meal. The pork was juicy and flavorful, and the combination of that and the other ingredients was perfect. Their breakfast potatoes are really crispy and well-seasoned. I tried my best but couldn't finish it. The portions here are generous to say the least.   The other person I dined with had the maple bacon cream French toast which I tried- WOW. Super rich but the salty/sweet combo is to die for. She also got the bacon and onion skillet which looked good, too.   Prices are reasonable considering the quality and quantity. This is a WAY better bang for your buck than eating breakfast/brunch anywhere on the Strip.   I'm coming back the next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut Muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Tostada, Bacon and Onion Skillet, Maple Bacon Cream French Toast.

RGCPh8pPWeq64YCG9BIf-A.text: My spouse & I visited Egg & I just cause I wanted eggs for breakfast. First look outside, I thought I made a wrong choice by visiting Egg & I. The outdoor look is pretty simple, with no extra fluff. We were immediately seated, served coffee and we ordered works veggie Bennie and biscuits. You are given an options of fruits or potatoes. We then planned on ordering carrot cake french toast. The server was kind enough and I repeat nice to tell us the portions were huge and she would wait on the carrot cake order. I love food, but I hate wastage and I TOTALLY appreciate the heads up. The eggs were flawless, hollansauce 5/5 and potatoes for my spouse were crisp and spiced well. We were so full, we ended up canceling the carrot cake.  All in all thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast, loved the ambience inside (there's a little handmade train that runs above on a track - its cute!) totally worth our money and absolutely worthy for the food. Not on the strip, so no traffic and no parking hassles. 5/5 ---- 2nd visit.  Added the carrot cake french toast to our previous orders. We came back cause we loved the food so much. The carrot cake was just fine, just tasted like carrot cake. I was expecting a twist since it was a french toast version. Nothing out of the box. Not unhappy, but not elated either

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake french toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Works Veggie Benny with a side of potatoes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Works Veggie Benny with a side of fruits

Lw0y1O1MYGwD77dqYKOM6A.text: Breakfast delight. One of the best breakfasts I've had in a long time.   There was a steady flow of people around 9 on a Wednesday. Lots of small groups chowing down.  The menu is large and overwhelming. But it's fun to read and has lots of good variety. It homed in on the bacon and avocado omelet.  The omelet was great! Perfect ratio of fillings without being too rich or greasy. The potatoes were also on point; I loved their spice.   Even though there's a lot done to minimize contact with your server (e.g., mini kiosks for payment at each table), my waitress did a good job making sure I had everything I needed.  I'd definitely come back!  Pro tip: even though most things are advertised with 3 eggs, you can get 2 at a cheaper price.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and avocado omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmm pulpy

fntzc2N1L-3EYvfdzwDa9Q.text: Rundown: FOOD: 3.5/5 SERVICE: 4/5  This place was super super packed when we came on Sunday! Ended up waiting about 45 minutes to get a table for a party of 6.   Everyone ordered a little bit of the menu -- I personally ordered a banana muffin and prime rib Benedict which came beautifully plated in a cast iron skillet. The banana nut muffin was moist, gooey, and flavorful -- tasting like a smoother homemade banana bread. The prime rib skillet itself was beautifully plated with perfectly poached eggs, hollandaise, croissant on the bottom. The meat was tender but had a strange flavor (did not taste like a blackening seasoning, but maybe it was just my palate). The skillet potatoes were a bit over seasoned too for my liking. Nevertheless, I'd say the overall execution of the meal was pretty well done for a breakfast spot!  Service was prompt and reasonably attentive considering the crowd. Also loved the self-pay kiosks at the table!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blacked prime rib eggs benny
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin

OwBUAggvS_1xVKBZcP6ebw.text: Just discovered this place last week. Went for lunch & the line can seem crazy w/ impatient people. The service is great though. Once you get on the list, you can track your place in line through your phone. It actually didn't take us that long to get a table for 2 people.  The waitress gave the both of us free banana muffins. It's pretty big too considering that it was free & moist  Ordered the loco moco, stuffed french toast, mimosa & irish coffee. Everything was soooo goood  stuffed french toast wasn't sickenly sweet like how other places make it so I was able to finish it  It was also very affordable & the portions are reasonable!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast

hlRqwuczDKCQxoLBbRPc2w.text: Came here on a weekday around 1pm... almost all the tables were full when we arrived, by the time we left, it wasn't as busy. It's a small restaurants with many tables close together. Outdoor seating is also available. Casual, diner, country home vibe. The place was clean and the server was friendly.   I ordered their chiles rellenos omelet, served with diablo seasoned potatoes and choice of bread. The omelet was a good, not too spicy, made with 4 eggs. I asked for my potatoes to be lightly seasoned, and it had good flavor, slightly crisp, and soft inside. The others at the table had it seasoned as is, and it became too salty after a while. Husband ordered blueberry pancakes. They were nice and fluffy, but i thought they tasted a bit average. I also received a free banana bread muffin for checking in here on yelp. Nice texture, soft, dense, moist.   Overall, I thought the food was good and we all left satisfied, but nothing extraordinary. A decent place for breakfast if you're in the area. But it's not a place I'd drive out of the way for.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili  Chili Rellenos Omelette with potatoes (lightly seasoned)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3Efb7syL7E8RkJhj-WfuEg.text: Banana nut muffin... service was top notch with Cindy being a sweetheart of a server.  We ordered a veggie skillet and basic breakfast.  The potatoes have a great seasoning on them that is reminiscent of Cajun/bay powder.  More of a country style restaurant and great for families to have a sit down breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie skillet: classic scramble

GPqwfX8sdtjkL8wr_r5Ftg.text: Pros: Cute interior with an active train set that runs around the while dining room.   Creativity with the menus printed/layed out like a newspaper  Crayons and paper to occupy kids  Easy payout via a machine on every table or you can walk up and pay the bill  Cons: Food was okay, nothing quite special. Potatoes were potatoes, hashbrowns were like the kind you get at Mcdonalds. Waffles..were  unfortunately like the kind from a mix that you would whip up quickly at home and syrup was given in a plastic to go cup. Although portions were generous, the quality was mediocre-- not bad, not good.

5hS8rBR1gPjfNLay2oMinA.text: This is my first time here and it was amazing! I got the biscuits and gravy with seasoned potatoes. Biscuits were a little dry but the gravy was very savory and flavorful. Lacey was a great server, she came at the perfect times to check up on us, always refilled our drinks and made sure we were well taken care of. I requested avocado toast even though I didn't see it on their menu but she was so willing to accommodate my request. A1 food and service!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YxN5gbKo_yTCMSEnj1XTXw.text: Great little find. Omelettes are gooood. They use 4 eggs in their omelettes. Large enough to share but so good why would you. We substituted the fresh fruit for potatoes. Large slices of sweet watermelon, cantaloupe, honey dew, pineapple, orange, and grapefruit. It could have been a meal in itself. Don't forget to order some banana muffins, warm and delicious.

NMhzxxh_sdDEOtJiYLr0Cw.text: Wonderful customer service! Great prices and fun kids menu. My son loved the train that goes around the top perimeter of the restaurant!  Smoked chicken and chorizo hash was an unattractive pile of overwhelmingly salty non distinctive mush. Blackened prime rib Benedict wasn't really eaten by both adults either. Honestly, I pretty much had 1 bite of each and then ate the sourdough toast dipped in egg yolk.  I will totally admit that I think that we are spoiled Sonoma County foodies that have fresh and innovative food expectations. My tip: stick with the basics and remember it's reasonable diner type food in Vegas.  Love the carat of coffee that got refilled.

3C4V8Q2pMFKyMlzCLHpIfA.text: POP GOES MY BELLY!  So long story short we had a car appointment to get a nail taken out of our tire off Sahara, so while that was being done we decided we were hungry and that we would walk to the egg and I to get some breakfast.   It was about a mile and a half distance but no worries because we played Pokemon go the whole time, this was my first time at the egg and I so my first impression was it looked very homey (not a bad thing).   The server was very polite, we were sat immediately no appetizers we got straight to the point. I ordered a green enchilada burrito with cubed potatoes, my food was delicious as usual. my wife ordered Chile verde with an egg on top with toast.   Overall this was a nice experience the food and the service was very good and I'd definitely come back if I was in the area.   Keep up the good work egg and I.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This eggxactly how my face looked!

qTUkOmnNZ6UnRhAkfBGPSQ.text: Great breakfast place! My only complaint is the waits & how it's always jam packed. I guess that's one way to know the food is good! The side of potatoes that you get with most breakfast plates are SO good. Great flavor!  This place has become a "go-to" when we have visitors in town and we want to show them a good breakfast spot. I've found that I have a new favorite menu item, the Greek scramble. SO good

29-XpuuaDRujEjOPZQqLVA.text: Fabulous Bloody Mary's, and trust me, we are picky with our Mary's! We left a place to come here specifically for the BM. Happy they didn't disappoint! The muffin is delicious, and I'm sure the breakfast will be too.

bzsaFk1qdfJ2FqCSsge7uQ.text: Best place in Vegas for breakfast. Big menu big portions and excellent service   Doesn't look like much from the outside but breakfast nirvana inside

oDURpCFZPw_QyBcFZiAVqQ.text: Bottom line: top notch service, easy parking, mega delicious food - even on a super busy Sunday morning. Come hungry!

eU6VT67Ew_hZ5sJzaO3rVg.text: I haven't been here since 2011. Service and food is still excellent. My server REINA took great care of us. Thank you!

VyT8XJJfAC5disP2aNxEEA.text: Super friendly staff, busy but not too busy, great food.   We ordered the waffle with fruit and one of the skillet dishes. Both were extremely satisfying.   One complaint is that the skillet dish was at the salty end of the spectrum, despite special request to hold the salt.   Get the banana nut muffin.

tEWu4KwZaLSV8Ffjxhwfpg.text: My favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas by far. There's nearly always a wait, but I've always felt fulfilled no matter how long I've had to wait...which is generally around 20 minutes at the longest. The staff are great. The food is great and well portioned. I like the team effort when handling customer requests. Thank you!

LhqMhMiJ_eXlaqZzsbbVug.text: Love getting the half size (because the portions are so big) avocado bacon omelet!!!! It's sooooo delicious , I highly recommend. Food is always fast , we usually spend no longer than an hour here because they are so quick to get our food to us. They even have a little patio outside where you can eat and bring your dog!

C_YRGTROihDVh3LobkrvLw.text: I've been to almost all five of the locations of "THE EGG & I" throughout the years. Mainly the one on eastern and sunset growing up. Today's late breakfast was the best service hands down. Earl was our server and I did double check the name since I suck at remembering. Me and a friend came to catch up on things and I recently recruited her to Yelp and had her check in. With the check in we each got the banana nut muffin. Which was a 5 out of 5 Yelp star rating. For breakfast I always stick to the basics so I usually always order "the classic". Which comes with eggs, one choice of meat (bacon, sausage and I must note each come in turkey too), potatoes & toast. My friend got the "Country Benny" which she was very pleased with. Earl checked on our table throughout our whole visit. Also, if you've been to any of the chain restaurants then you know they have this egg shaped smiley face that you can flip to a sad face to grab anyone's attention for service. Needless to say, we didn't have to use it. Oh and Earl kindly offered me each type of creamer they had for my coffee! So for the first time there I didn't have to have plan old half & half.   To top it off they gave us a military discount for my friends portion of the bill! They actually check ID with your credit cards too here!!! #WINNING  Thanks for the hospitality Earl!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Benny
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The classic
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can flip it upside down if you need any service

dyeW6bGmxpt92u3mmld7pg.text: Always a favorite! Every time we come to Vegas we come here on Sunday morning! The wait varies depending on the time you come but it's always well worth it.   This time we got the Stuffed French Toast and it was amazing!  The banana nut muffins are always warm and fresh and the diablo skillet potatoes are perfect!  Our waitress, Liza, was awesome as well. Very attentive, friendly and fun!  I didn't take pictures because we are so fast! Maybe next time!   Thank you Egg and I!

nTo73Mf66tfG4Wn2ryuIHA.text: Various choices of food to order! I used awhile for browsing the menu (want to try everything!) I'd ordered a blacken prime rib Benny and my honey got a egg stuffed French toast. Both are delicious!! And we've checked into Yelp to get each of us a free banana nut muffin which taste good too! Our server Amanda is great! She carries a big nice smile in front of every customers :) not that long waiting time (I arrived at 12:30pm and had around 30 minutes wait which is totally worth after I tried) will definitely visit again next time when I come to Vegas! Btw, hope you can win a trip to Disneyland Amanda! You deserve it ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg stuffed French toast...another delicious choice!!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blacken Prime Rib Benny. The seasoned hash brown are GREAT!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin was free when checking in on Yelp

pDya9ESq-p100_rrroPoUw.text: I am really big into customer service and everyone here hits that out of the park. I do come here quite frequently and it never fails that I get excellent customer service.  I always get a coffee with only Carmel Macchiato creamer. (The waitresses never have a problem with my requests, by the way ask for Bre she's the best!) Than I always get the half order of chicken, broccoli, mushroom skillet, its awesome that they offer half orders because there proportions are already huge! They have awesome skillets!!! I also get a side of sourdough bread with apple jelly (once again the staff always gets it to me in a respectful manner)   I don't have anything negative to say about Egg & I. I want to say thank you to this AMAZING staff. I truly feel like home there!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always amazing food!! My favorite breakfast restaurant by far. I don&#39;t even like breakfast food but Egg &amp; I changed my mind.

z_1Jr1-4VI7nxuiTNtqjnA.text: I had chicken fried steak, portion is small except their potatoes. Food is okay. Wish they could make their fried steak little bit bigger.

ls00psulszbVJSA6iBnvIA.text: An amazing find off the Las Vegas Strip! Even though they were (understandably) swamped, we were seated quickly, our waitress showed up to take our order promptly, and the food came out before we'd even noticed. Our portions were huge, and they had no problem accommodating my request for avocado with a substantial serving (I would post pictures, but we were too busy devouring our meals). We'll definitely be back!

0g8bAZ44VHA2T4tI7ALkeg.text: Every time we come to Vegas we make it a point to come here.  Food is great. Service is great.

S1wlRfnq06XjVXDZOjQuzA.text: Skillet breakfast of seasoned potatoes, melted cheese, eggs, bacon ham and sausage is yummy delicious, worth sodium cholesterol detox for rest of week :) Banana nut muffin warm, moist and fragrant. Generous plate, be prepared to fill tummy... Friendly helpful server Paula tops a happy brunch!
