Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tkVK9qf0ScmDNry-oE9yuA.text: Excellent service and even better food. Tamara our server was super helpful n very attentive. We will definitely be back again!

gE2s1QrYrDr7Gp1-zGGqEA.text: The Wait wasn't too bad in the morning, maybe 30min. I got the stuffed French toast, it was pretty good but I really loved the banana muffin haha! Service is great too :)

JzCBk4ZV-J80Y76lpxdi1w.text: First off our server Paula was great. Very friendly and brought us extra banana nut muffins because it was our first time here.  The three breakfast items we loved were the Sunrise mountain, stuffed french toast, and Cabo breakfast burrito. All hits.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cabo breakfast burrito
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed french toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise Mountain

HPBi8lyc3XZCfV7Xb_ffsg.text: Massive portions, pretty good and unique menu options.  Not too far off the strip but far enough that you don't need to worry about parking or massive crowds.  There was a 15 minute wait on a Monday morning.  Good place to go after a night out in vegas.  Make sure you check in to get a free banana muffin - so good!! served warm.

f0MszeDg-CSyOcWNIl564w.text: Recommendation from my sister,  even though she's never been.  Went for breakfast in Saturday morning and it was a 15 min wait at 9:30 am.  Within 15 min the wait turned into 30-45 min wait.  So if you're going to check this place out come early.  First time?  No problem, you get a warm banana nut muffin. Regular, check in with yelp and get a free muffin. Lots to choose from. The portions are big enough that you can share with someone else.  Shane was our waiter ABC be was so nice! He recommended the rib eye benedict. So good!  It comes with home potatoes that are seasoned to perfection. The Mexican Crepe (made out of eggs) is pretty good to.  My boyfriend and I shared the rib eye benedict and the biscuits and gravy. Come on an empty stomach, trust me. Prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly and eager to make your experience a pleasant one.  This one is definitely going  in my book as one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye benedict
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin

4AC7zROV8Dbuo4KvNDOcZA.text: My friend and I frequent the Egg & I every Saturday on Sahara after our exercise class.  The restaurant was busy & we were told we had a 30 min wait when we arrived.  They called us back in only 10 min.  Tamara was there almost the second we sat down, took our drink order and then took our food order after the drinks arrived.  We have a certain combination of foods that we order that's not on the menu because we want healthy choices.  Tamara took our order and then subbed items out from their typical meal combination so that we didn't have to pay an upcharge for substituting eggs whites for eggs or fruit for potatoes.  As busy as they were, they accommodated us with efficiency & a smile.  Thank you Tamara & Egg & I for a delicious & wonderful breakfast every Saturday. From April & Joni.

OHMiFfLBBO2uL4M1p6AsLQ.text: We came here because of the reviews and we were absolutely impressed. The reviews speak for itself and there wasn't an empty seat in the place. Don't let the old style mom and pop restaurant scare you away. Amazing home cooked food and top notch wait staff and the prices were right on budget with what you'd want to pay. You have to try it!

wyj6eN2ANHSgB0L4O8FyGQ.text: Great breakfast.  French Toast stuffed with egg bacon cheese omlette was over the top.  Breanna was a super server.  Banana nut muffin was scrumptious.

CUFbxF4ubdIjSvlGTZEcVw.text: Let's review. Two days in a row. Two different items off the menu. Two reasons to smile. Janeen was great and attentive BOTH days as well! Can't wait to come back for some more banana nut muffins either! Everything is so fresh and delectable. I could seriously try anything on the menu and go home happy.  Hopefully I'll be back in a couple of weeks!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New favorite dish! Can&#39;t find it on the menu? Show them this pic! Sooo good!

Rhl22_IGYt4PRgbVDT4v-A.text: The banana nut muffin was delish, a must have! Service was wonderful thanks to Karla for making our experience wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin

bsvDgFxhsBOtznNsdawKQQ.text: Excellent food! Linnea and the rest of the staff were awesone... Linnea is super friendly and helpful!  Will be back!

ReP5viHcGq_8CRLTs-jFuA.text: Amazing find thanks to Yelp. I ordered the works skillet and it was amazing! The banana nut muffin is out of this world. Great place to eat while in Vegas for sure. Worth the drive outside the strip. Karla was the best server!

BZSHp8ZO01bSZFnq-Axu5g.text: Grrreat food!!!! A trip to Vegas is not complete with out The Egg and I.  Get there early they close by 3pm on most days

31THMMx7kKp37XFQZHyh_g.text: Good breakfast food, great service. Highly recommend.

pJQi9zLRWDC4mnfAmZjnAQ.text: Loved this place! The french toast favorite stuffed with egg scramble was BOMB. Good portion and worth my dollar. I would definitely go again!

v33SNophbC8aFrxQVnVPVg.text: So my boyfriend is a taxi driver and he gets all kinds of coupons, deals and freebies. He got a coupon for Egg & I.  I was so excited to try it because we're never awake for normal breakfast time. They stop seating people at 3pm, which is when we usually get there.   The food is great. The chili relleno omelet was amazing. I'm not a fan of the ranch potatoes. I think they are a good filler though. Same about the Banana Nut Muffin. But the meal I dream about is Benedict's Garden. It's a 'vegetarian' version of eggs benedict. English muffin topped with guacamole and tomato, poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. it's the greatest thing!  Service is great. Everyone is friendly. Waitresses are attentive but If you need anything, just flip the egg on the condiment caddy.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ecr7xK_tZvkw8plxUBJw0A.text: This place is absolutely AMAZING the strawberry stuffed French toast was DELICIOUS I WOULD CALL IT ORGASMIC HAHAH no seriously so good took me a while to decide everything in the menu seems delicious n it's so cheap wish I lived in Nevada so I can come Here all the time and let's talk about the server "EARL" great server super friendly and very attentive :) nice guy

ij_bxW3Szwqa5Bgu1spZRQ.text: This is our second time here and I must say it's delicious! Allan has ordered the Loco Moco from day one and says it's the best he has had. Their food has a lot of flavor. The staff is awesome! Sunshine thank you for always welcoming us with a smile! She's the best manager ever! See you again in a few weeks.

DqpKQjTgx9mlfuJ292HL2g.text: Good breakfast place. The eggs benny were awesome as was the banana nut muffin. Server Carole Ann was very sweet and friendly!

DrbmQ4QsXDrsUDlRsWwmKw.text: The place is very homey and cozy. There was a slight wait but not too bad. The menu is almost endless. Settled on the stuffed French toast and butterscotch pancakes which where the best pancakes I've ever had. Our server Amanda was awesome and very helpful. Definitely would recommend this place if you happen to be in Vegas.

7x-VJ7oUXpgnVgQcbmbSwg.text: This is a great breakfast and brunch place. Always busy and packed especially during weekends.   I tried their Eggs Benedict Florentine and it was delicious and a hefty portion. It came with potatoes and side of fruits. My friend had steak and eggs and she liked it. The steak was flavorful.   Will be back!

T9H1-cmqoL7fOR5p1b-VIg.text: Banana nut muffin, will you marry me?  My husband may object, but that's ok.  We won't tell him.  The wait on a Sunday morning was 25 minutes.  Obviously, it's a good place if people are waiting.  We didn't mind the wait at all.  We shared the stuffed french toast (stuffed with eggs, cheese, bacon) and the collision course (a cross between a crepe and omelet).  Mine came with a banana nut muffin.  My coffee was never empty.  You know the food is good when you are so full and you keep eating.  You know you're going to get sick, but you just don't care.

9n1wW5m6AgETgJP7TW8E6A.text: The Egg and I was just what we needed before heading to Red Rock to hike.  We were seated quickly by friendly staff and greeted with a carafe of good coffee.  We were there for breakfast expecting your basic bacon, eggs, pancakes etc but the menu was much more inviting.  I had an inlet with spinach, mushrooms, cheese and an order of hash browns with great seasoning.  My friend had pancakes with a choice of a great apple topping or syrup.  The service was fast and the prices were very reasonable.  The Egg and I is off the beaten path but well worth the 10 minute drive from the Strip.

GJFgX1sJihtzhLimNxqg_g.text: Amazing food and service! Tabatha was our server and she was awesome! Will definitely be back

gJxJLe1N7z0G8FxQVx8vqQ.text: Always the best, hands down the best breakfast in Vegas!

4t2cT18r_pTQAdrtDGMHVA.text: Good food and nice service. I had a delicious pesto eggs Benedict. My father said the potatoes were too salty, but I liked them fine. The OJ isn't fresh squeezed, and I've definitely had far better hot chocolates. So if you are on a budget, rest assured that you're not missing anything if you stick with water.

eh00TUOj79rTtgsIahZ1BQ.text: I really don't understand the hype with this place and why it is so packed.  The food is mediocre and the portions are so large that it's unhealthy. The service is also pretty bad. When we arrived the hostess seated us at a  with unraveled silverware and a five dollar bill still sitting on the table. She gave us our menu's and left the money awkwardly sitting there.   When we finally got to put in our orders our waitress recommended that we take a half portion of our cheese, egg and veggie skillet breakfast dish and I'm so glad she did. The half portion was like a full portion and I could barely finish it, as it had so much thick sticky cheese on top. Also, the seasoning that they put on the potatoes tastes exactly like Dorritos and I felt like I was eating potato chips (not in a good way).   Also I just wanted to note something that happened while were waiting for our food to come. The waitress hastily sat us at a 5 top (it was just my bf and I). A family of 5 came in about 10 minutes after us and she tried to sit them in the table next to us which could not accommodate anymore than 4 people. She grabbed a chair from our table to try and seat them there, but the family was really unhappy, it was especially awkward as we were sitting at the only table that could fit them. She then moved them somewhere to the other side of the room. I saw the family leave a few minutes later out of frustration.   The food is really just standard fare, nothing to write home about. On top of that it's incredibly unhealthy. I understand that Vegas has very little breakfast joints, but I would rather make my own omelet at home. Your health will be better for it.

MdaKPR2fIUZQBo6qeFn6EA.text: Love egg and i/egg works! Came today with my sister for lunch and ordered the spinach Benny and she ordered the breakfast burrito. Didn't realize our orders didn't include my favorite banana nut muffin! I have been craving it since the last time I ate here =P. Asked our server, Alyssa, and she said those meals don't include it but she was going to throw some in for us on her. Wow! That is what I call going above and beyond in terms of service! Will continue coming here forever!

eJVuG4zAGT02077gGNu4XA.text: Amazing breakfast and lunch! I've been here a couple times during visits to Vegas. Huge omelettes, great skillets and delicious sandwiches. You can pretty much order anything you want your way, even a custom made side salad if you want! If you're looking for a big breakfast in Vegas, you can't go wrong with Egg and I.

FvpgaPp-sPbH1FBLWf5jBQ.text: Everything's awesome. I had Mexican omelette. Potato works and fries are spicy. Dont't forget to try their delicious Banana muffin rocks...

QwaDBjOdk24UcHxi_TNyjw.text: Hard to ruin breakfast, but they managed. Dry burnt eggs and tasteless food. May have been convenient but would not recommend it.

tHrTSsGz41JSCTcS54Po0A.text: This banana nut muffin has been WAY hyped in other reviews. Yelpers were making it sound like this muffin was the secret to life. Muffin lived up to the hype in terms of taste, but not size. If we are talking about a life-changing muffin, it needs to be a little bigger. I wanted 2 of these.  Shoulda went with the crowd and got the Eggs-cellent Omelette. Kay's Special caught my eye cause it sounded like spinach artichoke dip but made into omelette form. It was really tasty but the 3 Eggs-cellent Omelettes at the table kept overshadowing my dish. But that was my fault and not the fault of Egg & I.   Potatoes were completely covered in a paprika type spice blend. It made them really dry. A good dousing of ketchup cured the dryness.  Overall your typical uber greasy breakfast that will make you feel ridiculously full all day long. The muffin made the experience above average.

w-bpSjiItxsOvafTn_A6VQ.text: This place was absolutely adorable : )  The service was very quick & friendly, food was reasonably priced and delicious!  I had to bring home an Egg & I mug

Cf9h8v09VhXQrSKLmShXOA.text: Came here on a bad day. There were confusion in their kitchen and other customers were upset. We waited over 30 mins for skillet and waffle. Should not be there with high expectations. Food was normal. Bloody Mary tasted like ketchup. Staff were great but won't be back again..

zA8480i2WdfjtphqQqVmjg.text: Omg this place is so good.... The staff is great too....my boyfriend and I were in Vegas for a few days and I will say that this was the best meal I had during the whole trip! You got to go here !

bmpAWj_yqGAHa_azqqv-sQ.text: Good bloody mary....corned  beef hash was excellent. . Didn't particularly  care for their  seasoned  home fried style of potatoes. ..should have asked about other sides if offered...overall very enjoyable

bKOu3cY38L6Mi1ysuVDfYA.text: This is currently my favorite place for breakfast in town and I have a feeling it will stay that way! They have a huge menu and I want to come back many times to try all of the tasty-looking options.  I had a gigantic omelet full of avocado and bacon. It doesn't get any richer or more fattening than that but it's okay because there's no way I could have finished that thing (despite its yumminess). My husband got this ridiculous stuffed French toast monstrosity- stuffed not with marscapone cheese, or some fruity filling, or whatever else you'd expect French toast to be stuffed with, but with eggs and sausage! It was hugely filling but delicious.  They have good coffee, too, and the prices are right, and the heavily seasoned potatoes are probably loaded with sodium but who cares because they're delicious.

_7lzgK1AvAYw1KFX-wLxJg.text: Good place to have breakfast. Good staff . Food was okay. Didn't like the seasoned potatoes. Homemade corn beef hash was okay.

ZNFTbkf8-Z0q4c7CoFwuGQ.text: Our favorite place to stop for breakfast when we make the trip from L.A. to Vegas!  Always delicious and consistent! The Egg and I never disappoints and Our Server, Alyssa was awesome! She was very friendly and was quick!! I think everyone should take the trip off the strip for some French Toast Banana Bread!!

iKFLr85EtzlzMIMTcw64Fw.text: Mmmm, mmmm gewd!  Wake up before you get here.  Drink some caffeine, ride with the windows down, stick your head out the window with your tongue in the wind.  Come ready to read & eat because you have a massive book of a menu to study before making a tasty decision, which you really can't go wrong.  Everything is very good, but very different with generous blends of ingredients.  Def not your normal boring breakfast foods.  So, if you're not awake and not ready to study the menu, use the random decision making method by closing your eyes before opening the menu to a any page and ordering the first item your finger lands upon.  You always have the choice of warm, fresh banana nut muffin or toast.  Let me repeat -- warm, fresh banana nut muffin, ahhhhh.  Just about everything on the menu is served with their yummilicious ranch style potatoes.  My favorite thing here is the Pesto Scramble (4 eggs scrambled with sliced chicken, pesto, tomatoes, spinach, and feta cheese.)  My other favorite is when they have the Country Potato Soup special, which is a creamy potato soup topped with lots of chives and some bacon.   It's not a regular menu item.   The wait staff is consistently great.  Prices are great and portions are generous.  If you come on a weekend day come early or call first.  Sometimes there is quite a wait to be seated during late morning.

x0aX21kBh9dw9dleg7SwNQ.text: My 1st time here and it was my server tabatha's 1st day. Tabatha was so friendly, knew the menu and was attentive to our table. This service was a great compliment to our fabulous breakfast! So delicious,  the Chile Relleno omelet was great! Don't get me started on the delicious banana nut muffins, omg! So delicious. For sure we will be back! A 5 star dining experience. .

S7GNQd8YGNRw8FDkTbT88Q.text: My experience was 5 star but admittedly that's not hard to earn from me for a breakfast place. It does mean I thought the food quality of my meal was well above average, aside from that it just means the atmosphere and service was plenty satisfactory or better. Would eat breakfast here quite often if I'm awake and not in the mood to make it myself.

Kn2DbMTUdmFQPze66vYi4w.text: Fantastic breakfast, great service (thank you, Lisa). I had the strawberry cream French toast.

UTr8nft3uILSVwsW3CsLCg.text: My wife and I love getting "Kay's Special" whenever we go there.  We love this place!

dWS6IGSdtVFnOCMPMUwFJQ.text: Our first time and we will be back every time we come to Vegas. Excellent food great service. Huge menu and all good

oIzPdNyZcJ0uaukC84zu8w.text: Wow! All I can say is incredible! Karla our server was amazing and super attentive! I ordered a Michelada with the Chile Relleno omelette and they were both epically awesome! The Michelada was huge and the chile relleno omelette was sheer cheesy goodness! My fiance ordered the stuffed French toast and looooooved it! Definitely will come back! And the banana nut muffin was so soft and delicious! Must try!

Tc852NJi-mTWcSoi2IA3eQ.text: Banana nut muffin & their potato hash is the business!!!  This place only serves breakfast & i believe they close at 3pm. The menu looks like a morning's newspaper, they have tons of yummy items to choose from. The trick to getting your waiter's attention: first you'd have to look at the smiley egg that holds the condiments on your table and when you flip the egg to a frown, you'll be serviced in no time. Unless they are super busy and most of the time they are so just wait patiently.   The food portion size is big, I would say that thee portion is adult men's size who is damn hungry in the morning because I never finish and always pack it home.  Every time I order unlimited coffee, it always taste old (drink @ your own risk) :\ so I never get coffee unless I absolutely need it.   Overall, I love this place! Mainly I give them a 5 for the damn food...it's just too damn good.

PtrGwnF8IrYL91FvOG9ODQ.text: Stacey,  our wonderful server couldn't of made it any better,  positive and helpful. Food was excellent can't wait to come back.

3XozixPlWVNjMLMNJOYv1Q.text: Great Chicken fried steak & potato fries. Such good gravy, and seasoned potatoes! Thanks, Chris - a great server in Las Vegas on 4533 West Sahara!  We are leaving satisfied, and full.

CgVLIl6Qcv_1Y7yWQZmNOQ.text: Best breakfast place in Vegas for the price. Our waiter, Oscar, killed it. This guys should own the place. We come here everything were in town. Bobillinanate

r-NUT-PK470Go0zeWA_tcg.text: My favorite breakfast joint in the US of A.  This is the 3rd time we have visited The Egg And I - so worth leaving the Strip to get here - the food and service have always been great - and the people who work here are a pleasure to interact with. The place was jammed with a crowd outside when we came on a Sunday morning - but the wait was only 10 minutes and it was worth it. Food-wise the Fender Bender Egg Crepe was out of this world. (After I wrote the above, my girlfriend said "Oh, I forgot to order fruit instead of home fries" with her breakfast. The waitress of course said "I can bring you fruit" and didn't charge us for it. That's exactly what you would expect from a classy cool place like this. I made sure to Yelp it because we need more restaurants like this. And I repeat: every employee from the hostess to the waitress to the cashier was charming. Yes, yes, yes to the Egg and I. If I had the stomach for running a restaurant, I would do it just like they do.

22mTJfkd323zxtl-dSS7UQ.text: This is the second time and both times the food and service has been over the top. I recommend the stuffed French toast but of course I'm sure their other food is just as great.. Carole Ann was great and her service was on point.

xO7kpVfYYq9vNNPV2Z11cA.text: Just wanted to say I love this place the food was great love the potatoes.  Amanda was awesome she was our waitress before and still was pretty awesome.

nXAh0rzH3VM5HuNVb-c8_g.text: Great spot for an amazing breakfast. Bring your appetite! I always stop in here when I visit Las Vegas!!

IQNi4kucHp0rk-cLsB9j-A.text: This restaurant offers a large and delicious breakfast with great customer service. We had breakfast there twice over a recent trip to Vegas and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. My first meal was the Ultimate Skillet. Bring a large appetite! My over easy eggs were cooked perfectly and all the ingredients were so tasty and fresh. I also enjoyed their sourdough toast. It was thick, flavorful, and buttery! The dish was so yummy and substantial.  It kept me going until late in the afternoon. My wife had the Bacon, Avocado, & Cheese omelette. She loved it. It was cooked to perfection; a uniform yellow color and cooked evenly through.  It was loaded with lots of avocado.  She said that it was maybe the best she's ever had. Wow!  I had to cut back on my next visit. I ate too much on the first one, although I really enjoyed it (trying to be good in Vegas???). I ordered the Eggs-Plus with ham. The scrambled eggs were cooked just right.  The ham was good. It was not dry, chewy or too salty. The potatoes were also good. The server helped my wife make substitutions to the Flapper which made her her happy. Who says you can't have your cake and eat it too? She rated the pancakes 5 stars!   Another great breakfast.  I must commend the staff here. They are welcoming, friendly, and they are willing to accommodate you so that you are satisfied with your meal. I am looking forward to my next Vegas trip so that I can eat there again.

TI9RFZl9jDNiv3quTU7lkw.text: Egg and I is currently the best spot for breakfast so far. It's usually very crowded but there is an obvious reason why: it's good. Everything from the service to the food, is outstanding. Our server was extremely humorous and friendly and provided a few laughs here and there. The coffee was good, nothing to be complained about. The atmosphere had a medium to loud ambiance level but it is tolerable, in a sense. The food was great! I had the French Toast sandwich, which is exactly as it sounds. French Toast with egg, sausage, bacon and  cheese inside with a side of syrup. Amazing flavor and everything is well done. Their potato's are fantastic as well.

_3CMpG95z6ItZ2-gNRdiCg.text: First of all, I have to say 'THANK YOU' to all the Yelpers out there that recommended this place.  Now the review...  The family and I were in Vegas to cash in on a Giants World Series bet.  I really didn't want the usual buffet, so we did a quick search on Yelp and off to the Egg and I we went.    We stepped in and were quickly seated.  The televisions on the wall was great.  I could see who was playing and not playing for that Sunday's Fantasy Football Lineups.  We ordered coffee and looked over the menu.  (Note- Coffee was ok.  Better than IHOP, but not my favorite blend.)   We looked over the menu and what a selection!  It took us awhile to figure out what we wanted.  I ordered the Egg-Ceptional Omelet, my wife ordered the Two-egger, and my son had the Chocolate Waffles.      The food quickly came out and as far as portions...  they were HUGE!  My wife's Two-egger was like 4 eggs.  My kid's waffles were shaped like Mickey Mouse, which was a nice touch.  My omelet was one of the biggest I've ever seen.  Our only problem was that the chocolate waffle was without chocolate.  We had them bring out some chocolate chips and all was well again.    The omelet and ranch spiced potatoes were yummy.  You could taste freshness of the ingredients.  The omelet had sausage, diced ham, bacon, onions, tomatoes, portabella mushrooms and melted cheese all topped with sour cream and green onions.       We finished all we could and off to gambling we went.

zqq1-IEUpW4cMRzVFmVfxw.text: Spent a few days in Vegas and wasn't feeling like a "buffet" style breakfast or our normal Hash House a Go Go meal. Found Egg and I in a coupon book given to us at our Hotel.   Located in a strip mall with a lot of parking, there was no wait on a weekday morning, but the place was full of patrons. Took a while for our server to take our order and asked us twice what we wanted to drink (amnesia maybe ?..no she was just busy, trying to tend to everyone), so after about 10 minutes, my husband flipped the sign with the un-happy egg, to show we needed attention. The sweet lady at the register quickly came to us and asked what we needed. Our server quickly came to us and apologized for the wait and also brought each of us the BEST BANANA  NUT MUFFIN ever !!!   I had the Blackend Prime Rib Benny, A Grilled croissant with  prime rib, sauteed spinach and roasted red bell peppers, two poached eggs, then covered with hollandaise sauce. Also came with home fries and 2 slices of fruit. This dish was AMAZING ! All the flavors tied together so well and that Banana Nut Muffin will make me a return customer ! The hubby had Crepes filled w/ Mushrooms, that I take was also delicious, since  I didn't get to taste it !   The coupon for a "buy one meal get the other for half off" made the whole experience even better.   We'll be back in 2 mos..EGG AND I but this time we won't be alone.

_2gTd5TRXLD4fm6DHZnkEg.text: Finally! Found a place that makes great eggs! Really really good. Great service as well. I'll be Regular here...

up0uSGfceVwAuQkt2oqRcw.text: We came here for breakfast and for some reason the tuna melt looked good to me for breakfast,  anyway the tuna melt on rye with lettuce and tomato was awesome, the tuna had no pickle relish in it , a plus for me  . The thing that put it over the top was the bread , it looked and tasted like they grilled the cheese on the outside of the bread, it was crispy, like when u make a grilled cheese sandwich  and some of the cheese melts and gets cooked  in the pan and u peel that cheesy goodness and pop it in your mouth , yum.          I have to go back and find out for sure, the waitress was busy, so I did not get the chance to ask about the bread.          The fries were very good , shoe strings sprinkled with the the same seasoning they put on there breakfast potato's , it tastes like BBQ seasoning to me. I would not hesitate to have this meal again for breakfast and...... call me crazy for lunch? ;)

2FvghnNvWA5Kr_gPcGeiTA.text: Great place, great food and amazing service. very traditional and a must try in Vegas. Alexa was great, she was super nice and supper fast very kind. We Will defiantly come back again.

DqQkcmPwocnJd-Ee21rd7g.text: We had our brunch here with stuffed French toast. I really love the coffee here. Our server Card was very nice. It is a good place, and the food is great. The quantity is large for me, which is good.

kmocjDMrFdPtJRmfJcGiiQ.text: In Vegas for a softball tournament & looked up a breakfast spot. Found this place on Yelp & decided to check it out. Had a great experience! The hostess was friendly, the waitress was great & the atmosphere of the place was awesome. Got our food quick, for how crowded it was! The food was perfect. Full of flavor and fresh. It was pretty crowded for a Friday morning but we got seated pretty quick and out of there within an hour.

pWTqB6qmCMAV5uNQxClUuw.text: Went to breakfast this morning and everything was fantastic.  I had the Brads scramble and my husband had an omelette with mashed potatoes and bacon.  They were both AMAZING.  The coffee was good and the server was friendly and engaging.  We couldn't have asked for anything more.

AKoJTZ041Pnedx8IZcNWYQ.text: After indulging us too much the day before at the Bellagio Buffet, we looked for a nice and decent original coffee shop - or such. The day before my lady had found a voucher in a tourist magazine together with the notion of a review that this place (i.e. both) we're very liked with the community and the reviewers, in fact best liked.  Being a no brainer it turned up trumps in reality: The place was VERY busy (which we took as a good sign to start with) yet being seated only took a moment and the service was very fast and attentive. Food variety on the menue is almost too big ;-) so I quite took my time to decide. Got an italian influenced omelette which turned out to be very tasty.  One more thing about the service: Our little boy didn't like his fries because they came spiced (paprika or the likes)... they were replaced with plain ones in no time - comped !  A little before the food arrived a nice and cheerful lady of the staff came over and chatted us up a bit. Her expert eye didn't fail to note that we were out-of-towners. Later, I found out that she was actually the manager (owner?) and had the same first name as my darling ! When she heard that I failed to order the banana nut muffin (house specialty) she had one sent to our table immediately - again, complementary !  I guess I don't need to say more. Prices very reasonable, yummy food with a lot of variety...wish we had breakfast places like that in Berlin lol.  Since I guess we will return to Las Vegas at some point in our lives I can clearly see us going there again !

lUldet-NBcOvH7IodMpuEQ.text: Thank you Earl for fantastic service! Food was delicious and plentiful . Our group also appreciated the affordability since we are budget conscious travelers highly recommend to anyone looking for "a locals best breakfast"

XXlFDJlXstW3hoDTnWoaLg.text: We came here specifically because of the Yelp reviews and boy they were spot on !!!  This place is an excellent local spot for breakfast and everything on the menu is incredible.  I had the eggs florentine and it was awesome, we also enjoyed the Chili Rellenos omelet !!!  10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Florentine !!!!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-R6r7k8M7GzH7_yBiadQQQ.text: Everything was EGGtastic. The long wait was worth it. All of the staff are super friendly and Alexa was awesome. She was very nice and attentive. I ordered the Chicken, Mushroom and Spinach and enjoyed it very much. My boyfriend for the must-haves stuffed French toast and he thought it was great. Make sure to check-in on Yelp to get the complimentary banana nut muffin.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken, mushroom and spinach skillet + two eggs.

m3uuNSoNKSPVgIK1bw_Bbg.text: Alexa was fantastic. Breakfast was delicious. Definitely worth the wait. Omelettes are huge, corned beef hash amazing, and biscuits and gravy delish. Somewhere off the Vegas strip where the locals eat. Not a bad place to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash and eggs

YrEPSchbF4rpDRFiSktccg.text: This place has become one of our favorite breakfast stops in town. Food is on point and service is always good.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade Banana Nut Muffins are the Bomb!

1WVAo_fo1jhRFQg48nkZcQ.text: The staff was so friendly and welcoming! Very attentive and the food is just amazing! Don't forget to try their muffin is so delicious and is served warm!

_xH_69Bl5061NX0rkZiiIQ.text: Our meal at Egg & I was the saving grace of our Vegas trip. Although when we pulled up I was doubtful, I held faith in my Yelp brethren--and I'm so glad I did. We were seated immediately for a group of 5 at 1pm on a Sunday, but that was just luck as it was a full house.   The menu is huge and a little overwhelming because there are so many options, but I finally settled on the Huevos Rancheros with carnitas, both sauces, and breakfast potatoes. I also used the Yelp check-in for a free banana nut muffin, and she kindly brought one for each of us at the table! The muffin is so moist--we're talking stick to your fingers moist. Our meal came relatively quickly and there was silence among the table as we all dug in. The huevos rancheros were probably among the best I've ever had. It came with so much carnitas and melted cheese--it was exactly what we needed after two days of Vegas, if you catch my drift. I was wary of the breakfast potatoes initally; I'm a hash browns girl precisely because breakfast potatoes are often underseasoned. Not the case here in the slightest. Each nugget was a little crispy, but soft on the inside and packed tons of flavor. The portions are huge though, so keep in mind when you're ordering! I split the huevos rancheros and it was more than enough for two!  My friend got the chocolate chip pancakes and they were also very delicious, but super thick and rich so not what my dehydrated body was in the mood for. Gimme dat salt!  Right before we left we were commenting on how good the muffins were, and she brought us two to go in a box because they were about to close up for the day and they make them fresh every morning. I will definitely keep this place in mind next time I'm looking for brunch in Vegas!

EX9NighhkR9V3VbVQHC81w.text: I went to The Egg & I after a night of debauchery in Las Vegas (recovery breakfast) and I have zero regrets. I was excited to pull up and see roughly 40 ppl waiting outside as that generally means deliciousness awairs. After a 20 minute wait,  my friend and I were sat in Amanda's section. Amanda was a very knowledgeable, amiable and capable waitress. She got our orders correct and our food came out promptly.   Speaking of food, I ordered the mashed potato omelette and my friend got the chicken fried steak skillet. Whoever though about putting garlic mash inside of a bacon omelette is a genius. Either that or they have grandmothers chained up in the back putting elbows and feet in the food. Absolutely amazing!! Will definitely come back when in the LV area.

hryt1-UEK-OohOqwl9g61g.text: On our Vegas trip we wanted to check out Egg & I since I bookmarked it on our last trip with all the great reviews. Omg this place was delicious! We even came back the second morning  I had the works skillet, hubby had the heart stopper, and friends had the Benny's. Everyone agreed their plates were huge and everything was so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works skillet.

GnJunSc1kwAbhLMqYagtLQ.text: Food, okay. Service, good.   With the long wait/line, I had high expectations.   The server, Darla, was on it, as was the rest of the staff. However, that is where the "WOW" factor ended for me.   Being from Hawaii, an order of the Loco Moco was placed, along with the Ranch Club.  The ground beef on the Loco Moco was hard and a bit bland. The Club was okay and unfortunately, the onion rings were average, at best, as I am used to panko onion rings which make it flaky crispy.  I can't say it was bad, but not what I had expected based on the reviews and the long line outside.

susmHlOQ8mQORFN-WJTQQA.text: Go Carla!!! She's awesome definitely added to the hospitality of the restaurant.  Good eat.

hbPBv84miDBCHOooHoHGbw.text: I've been living and traveling the US in the past 5 years. This is the best and most amazing breakfastI've had. Theres always a line, so male time... but it is worth every minute!:)  Props to rachel for serving us well.:)

AtA2kwhxmVsvr9xLG6cJ_A.text: Great food, wonderful customer service and the staff is so friendly plus they pay attention to everyone like a True team.  Even if they have a long line it still moves pretty fast.

AXhu8kCHAsI3bNw_P6rWhA.text: Good place for breakfast! Love their banana nut muffin! Staff is very friendly and always there! No problems at all! I always go for the Loco Moco plus I like to add mushrooms and spinach to it! Tried the stuffed French toast that was really good! My girl had the carrot cake French toast which looked bland but she said it was good!

R8DmvC5q8qcOrPXRUnR_hg.text: There is definitely a reason why there is always a wait for this place...it is totally worth it!!!  I got one of the Egg & I specials - Chicken Fried Steak  which consist of 2 eggs, ranch potatoes, and a banana nut muffin which you can totally share with 2 people except for the muffin. Please dont share that. Get your own, damn it. Its too good to be shared!  Wait a minute! Did I say RANCH POTATOES???!!! OH HELL YEAH!!! Its the best tasting season potatoes ever! They are not like french fries nor tots but they are cubed shaped fries. I almost died when I put one in my mouth. This is why I scored this place a 5.   The potatoes and banana nut muffin totally suckered me in for life! I dont even like banana nut flavored anything or muffins and this muffin was the bomb!!!  My chicken fried steak was huge and just perfect. Its not oily at all, just plump and juicy.   5 star in my book. I think the service was good...I think the wait wasnt too bad... shit, I dont remember, I zoned out after my first bite of those delicious potato fries!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut Muffin!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak and Ranch Potatoes!!!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piggy photos a plus!

Avb0M7QcE6Dig1HGKoilMA.text: First time at this location went here because of all of the good reviews... Was pleased that they offer  a free banana muffin with checking into Yelp. Ordered the half stuffed French toast with turkey bacon and seasoned potatoes and that is really enough for 2 people. Would definitely come back if around this area.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n7zoE-zarbTnkeSNe5M4Ew.text: This place is usually busy, but the wait isn't to bad.  They have indoor and outdoor seating.    The service is great, the wait staff is friendly and they use an egg flip system on your table to help with the service.  If you don't need help, the egg shows a smile.  If you do need assistance, flip the egg and it shows a sad yellow egg to alert your server.    They know how to cook eggs here!  It's hard to find a place that knows how to do a proper soft scramble and Egg & I does it right.  They have a great fresh fruit waffle and their crepes are really good.  They also have a Hawaiian menu with Loco Moco, Portugese sausage, spam, eggs and rice (the real sticky kine) and Aloha shoyu!    Tip:  try the banana nut bread...ono!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. PSE&amp;R w/Aloha shoyu.  They give one whole sausage!

D2HXobVW9N7DSnwXrwLzFQ.text: Fast seating, great service, the portions are huge but you have the option to half size your order. I ordered the half portion of the fresh veggie skillet and I got full with just half of that!  The banana nut muffins are the best I've  ever had and the food was equally amazing. You cannot go wrong with this place and it is pretty inexpensive.

iobOmcg57jXI0WKZX6SAjg.text: Anytime I am in Vegas, I ALWAYS stop by the egg and i.  I don't like eating breakfast, esp. for breakfast... but I'll make an exception for the Egg and I.... My fav dishes are any from the 'mexican section'... but you can't go wrong w/ any dish here.  They have the 'most bestest' home fries ever!!!! Most of their plates come with a side of home fries.  There's always a line anytime I come, but it usually goes fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno omelette

CYESQSu1hOMbGaX2ZbH5IQ.text: Wonderful breakfast! Great service!  Our server, Karla, was super friendly and helpful! The entire experience while on vacation was great!  Our grandson enjoyed his mouse pancake  and bacon, I had the western omelette, and my husband had gravy and scrambled eggs..everything was delicious! And my banana muffin was warm and moist and very tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-eh0tcjVJgeUroB-mJhNnQ.text: Our server, Linnea, was great. Dined with my husband and another couple. Everyone loved their food. They were out of prime rib so we had to substitute steak for the prime rib Benny. Hubby and I split it and it was plenty for us to eat. I also got a free banana nut muffin which was AMAZING! Menu is diverse enough that everyone can find something to eat. Will definitely be back!!

p9qGaHDY6KbaGiDeD_ybpQ.text: 4 of us got there at 10 am Saturday, 15 min wait but well worth it. You could tell by the atmosphere that it was going to be Good and it was. Our first time there and we all had something different. Oscar our server was great, will definitely go back again.

8cfDyD8eN-F8X_dAGw0_uQ.text: Best breakfast in Las Vegas.  Alexa was a very friendly server.  Great coffee and delicious potatoes. You sure you try the banana nut muffin it's warmed up perfectly

brEjmw6H_3Pmw4XQOlwAQw.text: Wonderful food and wonderful service.   Thank you so much Reina!!!   We will definitely come back :)

8FPp6_dW_J5UZFE09NlQ9w.text: Great food and great service! Carol Anne was awesome! This is a must if you're ever at Lea Vegas! Best Banana But bread I've bet tasted. Great skillets too. But their best one is the BANANA NUT BREAD FRENCH TOAST!!!!! You won't be disappointed!

zPJv17UxZkoqV8xJhR3x5g.text: I don't know what draws the crowd here. It could be the portions, the banana nut muffin or the people.  The portions are big enough to share. They're not skimpy on their omelettes and pile on the Works potatoes, easy to split. Banana nut muffin is so moist, leaves you wanting more. The house special burrito, hubby says, is the perfect combo of egg, cheese, bacon, Works potatoes and green bell peppers that just melts in your mouth. Kid's meals were big too!  Most likely it's the workers who create such an inviting atmosphere here. To the corporate manager: Caresia should win the Disneyland trip because she was such a friendly server! She was still smiling as we made our mutiple requests.  Thank you Egg and I, our bellies are full!!

xf50l3I8N4kRcQz7ujcHlQ.text: First time here, loved the foods and customer service was great. Chance she is a great waitress I do appreciate the hard work and for a great service.

cEqZaMmTJq4CFfDS5quDPg.text: Wow... it is certainly worth the wait.  Paula, our server was great.  All the dishes look better than the last. Make this a stop when in Vegas

v0wTaE323L4X7v6E9cVxMA.text: Drove well out of her way to chase this place down because of the yelp reviews. It did not disappoint. Food was yummy price was good service was good.  If you're in Vegas and around the area I highly recommend it. I like everyone else got the muffin for checking in but like a dummy I left it sitting on the table. I wish I could tell you if it was good or not!

BLjpjMSW3yMhSIZ0sNnp9g.text: Very pupolar place for breakfast lovers. Exceptional must-have-to-die-for banana nut muffin & habla diablo potatoes, friendly service & generous portion. Highly recommended blacken prime rib benny & stuff french toast.

PJIRRo-1udtWfkY_NXYcgA.text: Decided to give this place a try during our Vegas stay and its actually really good! The banana nut french toast was amazing!!!! Great presentation and delicious!! Our server Alexa was very friendly and attentive! Would come back if I wasn't leaving tonight!

HkAzh5GdmTHG761X1w35wQ.text: First time here and my husband and I loved it! Too sad we found it our last day in Vegas... Food was great and it was plenty! But what we lime the most: THE SERVICE!!! Our server, Lisa, make our breakfast pleasant! Very informative with the menu and the size if the order, making excellent suggestions! Love the fact that she was always with a big smile!   We extremely recommend this place if you want to eat good and be treated great! Thank you, Lisa, we are very grateful for all you attentions! So folks, if you come to this place, ask for her!!!

oD1AKjUTGiz4PAzEuplWqQ.text: So far, STILL my favorite breakfast place! I usually got a pesto scramble, but I no longer see it on the menu!? Boohoo.

p0D9nnN1pnULDibcKR0zxQ.text: I would give the food 5 stars; my wife would give it a 3.  We had to wait 20 minutes for a server and Crystal came to our rescue.  It was not her station and she was a star once she knew we hadn't been served.    I went there for Loco Moco but ordered the Island Favorite; Portuguese sausage, eggs and sticky rice with a slice of fresh pineapple.  It was a real treat!   I have used Kikkoman soy sauce all my life and was pleasantly surprised by "Aloha Soy Sauce" that Crystal brought to the table.  It is slightly sweet and was a nice change.    My wife said the biscuits and gravy were good but did not enjoy the "works potatoes: which looked like diced potatoes, deep friend and seasoned with Lawry's seasoning salt.  She had a side of bacon which was really good.

wIV-MUMAOqBbhl9aySQ_Yw.text: Our server was Alexa ! It was our first time here what can I say DELICIOUS the potatoes  were perfect definitely coming back again on my next trip to Las Vegas

fPVxjJ84RL-D0C4h8sZoaA.text: Went for breakfast with my family of 5 after reading some great reviews online!  The reviews were spot on! This place was great- we were seated right away and ordered right away..  The breakfasts were huge, I got the chicken omelette it was really tasty, a bit too many of the mini potatoes, would have been better to have more omelette but still plenty of food.  One of my kids got the chocolate chip pancakes and they were great!.  Also they had something for everyone, our youngest only wanted chicken fingers and French fries at 8:30am and they had it available.. My wife had the rancho scramble and it was amazing!  This place lived up to its billing on the Internet, best breakfast we had in 3 days in Vegas!

7zz8h8aDPjQS0z7zABsF0A.text: For someone that is out of town I recommend this place... u get your money's worth.. I'm writing a review while eating that's how good this place is, I couldn't wait to write the review... I'm coming back for more, next time

gjRIxexK_VRtX0jYTNgcJA.text: OMG. Friendly service, in fact, one of our party ordered something that didn't come with the banana nut muffin so she brought extra so everyone had one. These muffins  are super moist (and im picky about that) and are the best restaurant banana bread that I've ever had. Portion sizes are huge. Everything we ordered was great tasting. Their salsa is great.

I3aMU-ynfqNGnB79SvbvOA.text: This was a great place to eat away from the Strip.  Had the Veggie omelette.  Very good.   You get your own coffee carafe in this place.  Always a good way to start your mornings.  Wife and I enjoyed the seasoned home potatoes.  The hot sauce they carry is also good.  As long as you like some garlic flavor in your hot sauce.  Service was also very friendly.  We got a kick out of the smiley and sad egg faces they have on the table.  Good way to flag down your waitress.

pXtiVV-Q2Dw_GVOatA5AyQ.text: Holy amazing eggs! I loved this place so much! It's a mom and pop kinda place, and you know it's good because the wait list is a bit crazy and it's mostly locals since it's off the strip. We tried 2 different eggs Benedicts and they were both AMAZING! Staff was super sweet and service was pretty quick. I will come back for sure!!!

DdrAo_WKk8KYpCGrIfWA6A.text: Found this on Yelp and it was great. Our server Ashley was helpful and friendly.  The food was good and hit the spot.  It would of been 5 stars if there was Tapatio.

_Q2oipMnLIY_dp-cmKC8xw.text: This restaurant has great food. I had the New York steak and eggs with their special potatoes. It was great and I also enjoyed the banana nut muffin. Will definitely stop in again next time I'm  in Vegas. Our server Ashley did a great job.

A755VnlQ31W5-XRo7rmayg.text: The portions are big but they taste really good Karla  was an excellent server. Ask for her when you're seated . I recommend the Works skillet.

C8CZSqLRfVrcZ--vTaoptQ.text: What has happened to this place? Was so good when I lived here but has now gone down hill big time. The hostess screwed up and continually skipped people on the list, a waitress with very poor English and talks at a volume like she is in a night club. Food is still good though.

KPQfBNTALvy8bhKcx2wwlw.text: The food is always fresh and the service is great. Huge portions of quality food for a low price. Karla was our server this time and she did great.

jncirydjv-FEZRe6AvwQCw.text: We came here with high hopes because of all the choices, loved the potatoes. The coffee had a burnt taste so we asked for a fresh pot but it still took 3 sugars to make it drinkable. The skillet my wife had with the Portuguese sausage seemed over salted and gave her a stomach ache and sent her to the bathroom several times. Our waitress was forgetfull and not very knowledgeable about the menu.  We probably wont be back for a while as long as the Omelet house is still in business. Sorry Eggs & I

HBNydNIf-rMoqDuoHbOXFQ.text: Perry was great! Wonderful service! Huge portion sizes!! Consider sharing your meals.

KV7B-pGdKxnFlwEHzHdYMg.text: Our Friday morning Breakfast Club seems to be expanding and we ventured out to The Egg and I with a few new members. Looking back, we should have chosen a different location to welcome new members. I was not impressed with the waitress, who seemed to cop an attitude when reminded she shorted us a water. Of course I got the Chicken Fried Steak, but was met with resistance when trying to substitute a pancake for my choice of bread. I was told I could not substitute, even if paying an up charge, and would have to actually get an order of pancakes. This is the first time I have run into this problem. She also told us we could not get separate checks at the table and would have to take care of that at the register. This turned out to be a fustercluck and inconvenienced the customers behind us at the register. The CFS itself was good, as were the potatoes. The eggs were eggs. I was leaning towards two stars, but the quality of the food helped to compensate for the difficult waitress.

nBYRR7Uvg652jlOIQWw4zg.text: Great breakfast as long as you stick with eggs. Tried the chicken burrito which was served cold and tasteless. While paying at the register, the cashier asked "how was everything ?" My husband replied " the burrito was not good, but I guess it was my fault ordering a burrito". The cashier replied "yes - that was your bad". Glad to know that the customer is always right !  Customer service FAIL.

60kvHSNtj-25bMMCTBHPKA.text: Never in my life have I ever eaten a banana nut muffin that made me want to kill a unicorn so that it may get a leg up in the race of All Things Magical.  Godspeed, oh glorious muffin!

M-u8C1lJIz5LyzcW-SUeJQ.text: Our waitress Alexa was very nice and efficient and made our experience a really good one!

6QonJfuijQlUOKrBXwjplw.text: Believe the hype. Omelet, pancake, biscuit and gravy, beef dip sandwich all on point. Excellent food all around. Awesome service!

k4_cdODfIEPnRmX9epbfXg.text: Eggcellent! Food is delicious and service from Chance made for a great experience.  Great Vegas spot just off the strip.

W5Z9ohen25qttOOwsMxD6Q.text: Pros: Chicken Enchilada Omelette is the bomb! Home Fries are awesome, great seasoning. Wife loved the French toast!  Cons: None!

eZLNgqcqNqPiB7JiwiBvKg.text: Came for breakfast on a Saturday morning just because its our last day in vegas and we wanted something different from the complimentary breakfast we have from our hotel. Was surprised to see that the place is packed and hopping at such an early hour.We waited for awhile for the server to arrive to get our orders. ORder came after 15mins. The corned beef was good. Portions are generous. would recommend.

Zm6xc5QWJnnCj-lFp-JGhg.text: Alyssa was a great server today. Cheerful and attentive.  I enjoyed the banana bread French toast, but probably would have preferred something else.  We will be back!

rBoRrtZdlbpMAQdlaSMYow.text: This place is horrible. There was five in our party and four of us got waffles and the other one got biscuits and gravy. This gravy was so salty that she couldn't eat it. The potatoes are way too overly season salted also. It tasted like they dumped that whole container of salt in the gravy but when we complained about it to them they didn't apologize or anything, three different wait staff just simply said, "Oh we get that a lot. " One even said that everyone that gets it complains but no one here is going to actually tell the owner/cook that it tastes horrible and that no one likes it except the owner.  Service was slow, we had to ask several times for some items. Not sure why this place gets so many stars.

V0LLV51hnUxLArLlGMy19Q.text: It would've been good but they forgot my order. So I had to wait. The waitress did apologize and comp our meals but we took it to go and I lost my appetite. I missed my friend finishing her marathon.

148tKxVGeNLu60-cm6TbUg.text: Just average. Ordered the biscuits and gravy two eggs over medium with bacon and potatoes. The gravy had no sausage in it as far as I could tell, the eggs were under cooked, sent them back just to get the same under cooked eggs, the only really good thing was the potatoes. Only got two cups of coffee, the server took the coffee pot away when the eggs were sent back. I guess that was my punishment for sending the eggs back. Most likely will not return.

MqmW0FN37S682_e_M7B5ag.text: I usually don't take the time to leave reviews everywhere I check-in to unless there's  something that I have to say. I always come to the Egg and I every time I'm in town and the service here is always great. However, this time, I wanted to give a shout out to one of the employees named Elemar. Not sure if that's the correct spelling, but, as a pretty observant person, he definitely works above and beyond his regular duties, and should become a regular server! I've never seen someone work so hard at a restaurant. Thank you for being so efficient with your service!

AYg6woPvMtaAaOjLs8wOBA.text: Karla the  old bitch  is the best . I recommend the  Denver omelet . The food is great . Ask for her by name.

R7CsQE4SjcTEGqoAsph7aQ.text: Stopped in and had breakfast today, I ordered an all meat omelette,  it was good the potatoes were salty didn't really care for them, when looking around the room other people where not eating the potatoes, I wish they had hashbrowns. Service was excellent the food was just OK

unMA1y4qYolK-kG7ZMJLpw.text: Best breakfast i ever has in my life. Lol. But for real its the best breakfast ever.. server Kat is very nice as well,she's the best. Thank you!!  And Great job. Make sure you look for her and you'll be in good hands.

K7f8YLTLmgSnoyUZwKtzfw.text: my absolute go to breakfast spot in Vegas.  Worth driving, waiting, and paying for.  Everything I have had has been exceptional.  The only consistent thing I have had is the Banana Walnut Muffin.  Oh my!!!  Just go here.

hV0GWxNlhpHtKD47hqrjzw.text: Awesome breakfast place!   Went here twice-  steak & eggs first trip, Italian skillet on second.   Perfect banana nut muffins, coffee off the scale good.    Great service.   A bit of a wait sometimes but soooooo worth it!

SX_stPo20pHnnbS8T71XYA.text: Not too shabby. Only complaint I have is the wait, it's rather insane. The food is excellent, I recommend the Veggie Benny for any vegetarians. Their potatoes rule!!!

WTVWMH-Qy8-PbKHtVjZ97Q.text: Came here for Father's Day a while back and expected it to be super crowded. With no reservation, the three people in my party waited about 45 min in the morning and luckily we were seated inside and escaped the deathly Las Vegas heat. The free banana nut muffin was a great little appetizer for our breakfast and the food was overall tasty. The highly reviewed corned beef hash was delicious but a little heavy/salty for the morning

1NBbLWf6ep1OgXENftnQOQ.text: Service was amazing we had a waitress named Rachel who just was always there for us , the food was also amazing really great place everybody was having a good time and enjoyed themselves  we highly recommend this Resturant

TBA12HHMsmDS1QUZLVa_LA.text: This place caught my eye as I was passing by due to the great number of people who were congregating outside waiting for a table so I decided to try it. It also was a good sign that local firefighters were walking in to eat there. The menu was newspaper style and some of the menu items were original like chicken quesadilla omelet and chile relleno omelet. My boyfriend ordered the carnitas skillet and it was flavorful. The service was quick even though it was a packed house. You definitely get your money's worth. I wish they had this place in the L.A. Area. Word of mouth is that the owner is considering it! I am crossing my fingers!!'

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Egg &amp; I is listed as best value for your money for breakfast in Vegas in the newspaper

eFFdbDPBrkEfijDUzh_HyQ.text: We ordered veggie skillet and veggie crepe. Genesis was our server. She was very polite to us.  Restaurant is really good. I would recommend it to a friend

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DaFPixoqJtuDe_gm68dYqg.text: Monday at 11:30am waited 10 minutes for a table.  Can only imagine what it's like on the weekend.  The banana nut muffin is as good as they claim. Light and moist and very tasty.  Servings are generous.  Had the Veggie Works bennie, enchilada omelet, hash and feta veggie omelet. Everything was excellent.  Very fast service.  I and out in less than 30 minutes.  Definitely recommend this place!

eAhNAgA-gCITXimGWlRZcA.text: I was really hoping to find a place like this in my hometown.....unfortunately I will have to dream of this place. I had the bacon and avocado omelette which was the best ever....the potatoes on the side were just icing on the cake. The service was great and the two times we ate here we received our food within 15 minutes even with the place packed.   Thank you to Egg and I for providing good service and amazing food!

p9sGSeWxV30ZfUYgAETCwg.text: Nice restaurant, off the strip. Service was quick. Lillian our server was helpful.  Reasonable price. Large portions.  Definitely coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute menu
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enough food to share

GrJ0ju2B_QduBJFUIKgDrw.text: Me and my family went early around 730am or so and I have never been here before, the young gentleman who was really young was very swell and respectful and was caring that I had a infant and I thank him for being caring about him. Well mannered, our waiter was knowledgeable and very cool, I didn't catch his name but had a great sleeved tattooed on his right arm. The muffins are out of this world, they were so hot and fresh I was worried I want going to have room for my actual breakfast  The eggs bennidict were so delicious had a great zest to the sauce. The potatoes would have been great but there was a large amount of pepper and there specialty El Diablo of some sort of spice they created but ask them for easy on the spice. Other that great food good price. Had to take the remainder of my portion a home and I would go back

3-5Pyv_T8t7wkioSln38_A.text: Visiting from nc for a few days and of course my husband wanted biscuits and gravy. Our food was so good! He got the country Benny and I the corned beef hash. Amazing! The food and service was great!our server ulises was super friendly and the restaurant has a great system to let the servers know when you need something so they are asking you every 5 mins if you need anything. We will definitely be back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash and country Benny! Those diablo potatoes tho!!

YYp3EmCM82OFkjQ1fyHSTw.text: Came here with friends while on vacation. I appreciate the choices in coffee creamers and the carafe being left of the table, which saves the hassle of tracking down a server for a refill when you've got a small cup o' joe. Good coffee, but I come here for the eggs.   I ordered the hash, but our table also ordered a pancake plate and a waffle works. The waffles look light and crisp, the pancakes are fluffy and have a variety of fillings (but I think we got charged a different-than-base-price for these, so ask or watch out? Our server suggested something after we handed over the menus), and the crispy little home fried potatoes are so tasty! (I got a half serving of these, half serving of fruit--which is plenty of both!) My hash was homemade and nothing like that cubed canned corned beef hash, but it was pretty salty for my tastes. My eggs came out EGGsactly right and were mouthwateringly delicious for something so simple--eggs. My fiance asked for tomatoes in his scrambled eggs, and those were extra too, and we weren't informed of that/how much until we saw it on the check (the pancake chocolate chips and the tomatoes somehow managed to be about $5, so I don't know how that stacks up, but it peeved me a bit).  If they ask you if you want toast or the banana muffin, DO NOT GET TOAST. GET THE DANG MUFFIN. It is sooooo good. It doesn't look like anything special, mostly because it's flat on top and served upside down, but it's soft and moist and tasty and warm and goodness gracious, so amazing. If you're counting calories, #1 you're in the wrong place, #2 put butter on it anyway.  The little eggy signs are so helpful for when you need to track down your server--a great idea instead of trying to get someone's attention in the (can be) noisy atmosphere.   This place is fantastic, but I pulled a star because the server forgot a side order for half the meal and didn't notify us of the upcharges on the items at time of order and after suggesting (i.e. we order regular pancakes, he suggests blueberry or chocolate chip, but doesn't mention they cost extra) after taking the menus so we couldn't see ourselves. I know some things are extra, but how much sometimes influences people's decisions--knowing if it was $0.50 versus $2.00 would have made that difference, for example. Overall, will DEFINITELY come again.

0nXfwcVTVYoRdGaB7_t9vQ.text: 4 stars for the food and 5 stars for Karla our server.  She is awesome, she hustles and makes sure we have everything we need. We had the Mexican Omelet and French toast with a side of bacon. When you check in on yelp you also get a free Banana Nut Muffin.  Food had a lot of flavor and came hot and fast.  Definitely a place to come back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican Omelet, seasoned potatoes and sourdough toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast with a side (generous) of bacon

2GEinv-uwd82zRXLQ1HZRw.text: My family and I decided to try this place on the morning we were headed home from Vegas. We got it off of the Triple D website and have had great experiences in the past so it seemed like a great choice. While it was not a terrible experience, it was certainly a disappointing one and here is why:  My mother and I both have a food allergy to Monosodium Glutamate more commonly known as MSG. It is a flavor enhancer/ preservative often found in foods like Doritos, Cheetos, and all of those other junk foods you shouldn't be eating (but let's face it, sometimes we just need some junk food). For me, a little is OK, but my mother can't eat it at all.   When we sat down at the table, we asked if they used MSG more out of habit than anything else; why would a breakfast spot need a preservative? Our waitress, who was very nice, informed us that it was in most of the food, but not the eggs. My mother, who had originally decided on the highly rated Chicken Fried Steak, had to change her order. Both of chose the Sunrise Mountain and decided to order fruit rather than take our chances with the Habla Diablo potatoes that came with 90% of the breakfast options.  When the food came out it looked delicious, but one bite changed our opinion. While it was plentiful, it was bland. Even the blanket of cheese over the top could not help it.  My father, who does not share my MSG allergy, ordered a skillet. Mom and I both took a bite of the Habla Diablo potatoes from his plate and they were delicious. Crunchy and flavorful, I would have loved to be able to eat them, but they were covered in stomach pain inducing MSG. And the only option besides the potatoes was fruit (which was very nice, but did nothing for the dish itself).  I gave this place two stars because the service was good and the banana nut muffins delicious. Now if only they could learn how to cook with flavor rather than chemicals...

P--ZI5mcsJt0uH8acDL_pA.text: Breakfast makes me happy. This place made me happy. I had the Crepe Omelette and it was pretty substantial and good. The rave about the Banana Muffin is legit and i was very impressed. It gets very busy but it's worth the wait. Great service too!

FBZ9_yqbN6k2CFc52nlWMQ.text: I came here with a couple friends during New Year's weekend and boy was this place packed. We ended up waiting about 30 minutes for a table for 3, but I'd say it was worth the wait. If you do the Yelp check-in you get a free banana nut muffin. Let me just say this is like 2 muffins in one and it is seriously laced with crack because everyone at the table devoured it in silence. It was pretty damn good. I ordered the stuffed french toast and the other two got skillets (Santa Cruz and Cordon Bleu). Honestly, I was not prepared for what was set down in front of me. The sandwich was MASSIVE, I could barely get through half of it. The skillets were also massive in their size and no one at our table was able to finish their food despite how HANGRY we were when we got there. Everything was super good. Although the french toast sandwich was good, I liked the Cordon Bleu skillet was amazing! The prices were super cheap for the quality and quantity you get, it's totally worth coming here, especially considering how overpriced everything on the Strip is..

CryCnfTDu8te5kqutgqqrg.text: If you go at the right time, and you ca beat the rush it is completely worth it.  The Egg & I was very filling, and priced well.  If you are caught in the breakfast rush time, it can be slower, but it is still very good.    The Eggs Works I think is owned by the same company, as both logos are on the shirts of employees, but that place is a little lighter for breakfast.

CNJmo02hpL0sQOGR3yRe2w.text: Best breakfast you will ever eat. You can tell the staff is friendly and on point and The food was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oops. Took the picture too late. Sorry m8s

JJx5PKLtcJ4CNmi-qdaZlw.text: Yes there will always be a line, but you know that usually means where the good foods are. And the wait is so worth it for this place!!! The line moves very fast, and you will be sitting down with a yummy warm banana muffin. Portions are big, and you will be stuffed. I tried the cincy chili for the first time. It's an all meat chili with a sweeter taste. Then I had the best loco moco ever! Instead of the usual brown gravy, they use country gravy. And their homemade hamburger patty has so much flavor, and cooked to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEST loco moco I&#39;ve ever had, they use country gravy instead of the usual brown gravy
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup of cincy chili

TVVMH7I1WUN3kZFSkY3C1Q.text: Went to this place in Vegas when my boyfriend was playing in a basketball tournament. We were crunched for time and we decided to go there. It was really busy but we put our name on the list and we were seated really quickly to our surprise. We sat down and right away I ordered some banana nut bread with our drinks and it came right away! I recommend everyone try the banana nut bread, it is SO good! Anyways we ordered our food and the service was pretty decent. Had to wait a bit for our food but that's just cause it was busy. The food was good, nothing crazy special, and the price was about average or what is expected to pay in a place like Vegas. Overall I suggest going here if given the chance!

Fd3CU3bIEltoUe4OijAQ-g.text: Delicious food. I had the bacon and avocado omelette. Hella good! Came with potatoes and toast. Bomb. The rest of my party enjoyed their food and we walked away full. Good price for quality of food. Good service too.

UXs9K79o4IludUOyvMicNA.text: If in Vegas you have to come here for breakfast! Had the French toast and enchilada omelet! Service, family environment, and food where amazing! Liza was great and all the  staff here were super welcoming! Can't say enough great things! Definitely bringing the family here again. And a generous military discount.

Ixbybt5FPXJvcscQyqyenA.text: Just like always both food and service is good!!!  But this time I decide to pack some banana muffin back to LA and share with my family. Our server Curtis is really patient to take my complicated orders.  Overall, everthing is really good. Will be back again next time when we are in town.

KHR29UcOnH2gqVyCHi70PQ.text: Half order of Mashed Potatoes Omelet and an ice tea is how everyone should start their day!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Bread French Toast with warm syrup and apple jam.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed Potatoes Omelet with Fresh Fruit!

4SsS0acJhwoI0kJJs0tlTg.text: I always enjoy the food here.  A little busy inside kind of cramped but overall it is a good experience consistently

rtKhuPt_tdAUfgx4AfsrzQ.text: Tabatha was our server, such a friendly person! The banana nut muffin is so good!!!! So is the chicken, spinach, mushroom skillet! My favorite breakfast/ lunch place to eat. I always bring people here!!!

XQVX-Eu60wGEz8-O3iQWlA.text: What can I say..umm many Americans or travelers said it was good so do I. Love the busyness and ton of foods selection. Pancakes are amazing. 6 stars on the foods, 4.5 stars on the service because of there busyness I understand. Been here couples time and love every single time, just hate to gain couples ounces after the meal. Hihihi. Try it people!!!

ekouPTBBcruWeFqQwd96dQ.text: Amazing food and service! Bring your appetite! If you are military, they give a discount for each military member in your party. Just make sure to take care of your server and give a larger tip!

7YMKEnrr98ys-PMt-aPT-w.text: Geez, the portions here are ridiculously large, but then again, maybe it was because I had a Fat Tuesday Octane 190 large mug with 3 extra shots of everclear the night before. FAIL .    I ordered the corned beef hash and it was ok.  I wish they wouldn't put so many potatoes in there, I already have enough with the Ranch potatoes.  The ranch potatoes were pretty good, basically just "cubed" fries with seasoning.    My gf ordered some kinda skillet with massive amounts of cheese on it.  It was good, but way over the top in terms of a dense fatty artery clogging food.  She kept trying to feed it to me but I wasn't having it.  I warned her she'll be the one to suffer the consequences on the trip home to Los Angeles.  'nough of that.  The banana nut bread was nice and moist.  Good bread, but a little too sweet for me.  Solid breakfast spot off the strip.  3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G3ySaPbkIJgs1fqjNOx3OA.text: I had a couple hours on Sunday morning and decided I'd give Egg and I a chance.  I had heard it was pretty good.  My server, Breeannda was extremely attentive.  She made sure my water glass was full the entire visit.  (About 6 glasses worth)  I ordered the biscuits and gravy and asked to have extra sausage cut up and added to it.   The food was really good.   I recommend stopping by for breakfast if you are in the area.  I will be back.

Bm10bP1StwzZua3Q2K9a5A.text: Long wait for absolutely grease laden food.  If this is your thing you will love it.

Mce83TctuVkwV7pLcJbJ6Q.text: I've never used Yelp, nor know if this is a review that will be seen being I'm not a regular user. But I just wanted to make sure I informed everyone how amazing our server Darla, I believe her name is, was. Great, positive, contagious attitude. Also very helpful. Foods always great there, that's just a given lol. Just wanted to express our gratitude and show fellow servers with a great attitude that they are appreciated!! :)

aB3doFZwKfnVjuygzxRPFA.text: I usually don't give 5 stars, but I just had to! Great food but also awesome service!! Our server Lilly was very welcoming and gave us such great service! After eating some brunches in the LA area, I can say that this place was one of the best brunch places I've had!! If you're in Vegas, you must come here!! Also the banana nut muffin is amazing...

1NoroSgwpn1FloIf7ty1ww.text: Good food for a good price! This would be 4 stars if we hadn't waited 10 min before even getting our drink order in.

Hl78dTs7mmSNT3mPVpJu9Q.text: I am a cartoonist, and when I was in town talking to the editor of the Las Vegas Review-Journal - which apparently has some sort of partnership with this restaurant, since you get a free copy of the newspaper with breakfast, and their logo is on the coffee mugs - I heard about this place but never had a chance to drop them. This time around, I finally made it and found out what I was missing.  Simply put, this is worth the trip away from the strip in order to get huge servings of incredibly fresh fruit, and delicious eggs and bacon and pancakes and French toast and anything else that your carb-loving heart desires for low prices.  Atmosphere is close to non-existent, but whatever - your stomach will thank you while your arteries scream in agony.

NWW92LlhNx99dsepnqFhKQ.text: If you want your monies worth, this is the place to go. Almost always a long wait but worth the wait. The eggs are just amazing, menu has a great selection and service is warm and friendly. Great place for a weekend breakfast with friends and family.

FB6B4CPBvPS95F367eDgTw.text: The food was delicious . Yet the service was mediocre. Had to ask for utensils , napkins, etc. They weren't even busy, yet it was difficult to get the waiter's attention.

dQODsgjx_iIt4e4gT6qPsA.text: Good food, lots of it. Our family of five walked in under the wire at like 2:58 pm and were treated to fast, friendly service and good food. My son, who is a big potato fan enjoyed the potatoes thoroughly. My daughter, the vegetarian, said of her omelette, 'that's a bomb-diggity-omelette'. Husband said the everything skillet was very tasty and shared the last bits with my son who ate it along with the pancakes and bacon he ordered...bottomless pit that he is.

1G7YyQ5TP2LodhmP0LnvIg.text: Love this place!! Every time I come to Vegas I make sure to make a stop here and enjoy the banana nut muffin that tastes like heaven! The staff is always friendly and they place a newspaper style menu for you to look at. If you say it's your first time, most waitresses will bring you complimentary banana muffins for your table. But don't worry if they don't because most breakfast plates either come with toast or muffin..... Please go for the banana nut muffin!!! It's that good! For food I recommend the works skillet or any of their omelettes. They also have Hawaiian style food, which I haven't had the chance to try. The wait can go fast although it might take longer for larger groups. Parking can be a hassle during weekends. This restaurant will beat any overprice buffets on the strip, it's well worth it to go out of the strip for the food. And if you enjoy the muffin as much as I did, they sell banana nut loafs!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Works skillet

mWz8AF222nQwPcHB5O5PLQ.text: I'm a little surprised I didn't write a review for my 1st visit! Oh well...service on this Valentine's day was exceptional! The wait was a short 10 minutes around 10 or so in the morning (good thing because it was 10 times more crowded when we were leaving!) Our waitress was Lilly & she was the sweetest! She was so nice and attentive, with a cheerful disposition even tho she was so busy. And she brought my husband his free muffin even tho he was having trouble with his yelp app to check in. He did eventually but was very happy that she did that, cause that muffin, oh that muffin....I think it's the best banana nut muffin I've had in my life, and I've had my share! Lol...my husband had 3 of the blueberry pancakes w/a side of bacon. He enjoyed his meal but didn't even touch his bacon because the pancakes are a pretty decent size with fresh blueberries in the pancake and on the side was a blueberry jam sauce? It was sweet just as he likes it. I'm not a huge pancake fan so I don't make it much at home so he was happy. I ordered the chile rellenos omelette and I'm so glad I did!  I saw someone's picture of it and thought it looked good!  It was!  The sauce was tasty and everything just worked so well together with the pepper... Mmmmmm and my plate came with potatoes or toast and I chose the potatoes, I could leave that on the plate but my husband enjoyed it :)  and a muffin also came with the plate, BONUS!!  Will be back for more on our next visit!!

_BswR958JxdfUdlMyVD8mA.text: I love breakfast. And this place perfect for it. Cute place fun to come with friends or family and yummy. I go there every once in a while.

N-XU_4B2ZSvje7CwWPUibg.text: Egggggsellant breakfast! Come early....long lines if u out don't come by 9ish. I had the Benny, husband had the biscuits and gravy. He's southern and picky about his gravy. He gave it two thumbs up. Highly recommended this place.

PlArs3Vxw6EXSDinHekGcQ.text: Our first stop as soon as we land!!! Stuff French Toast is delish. You gotta try it!!! Today's server was Amanda, who was so happy, helpful and very personable... Actually everyone there are always happy and helpful!!!

KB21xAbmLsC2u4FcDiTLcA.text: This is an egg-cellent choice for breakfast off the strip. Don't forget to check-in on yelp to get your free banana nut muffin!   There were 5 of us and despite it being busy they seated us in less then 5 minutes. I had the mashed potato omelette which was delicious.
