Little pieces of bacon in the potatoes made the dish complete. Other people at my table were satisfied with their omelettes and loco moco.  They have a sad egg face you can display if you need service immediately, but we didn't have to use it since our waitress Genesis was on the ball.   For 5 people to eat, grab juices and coffee it was under $80, a True bargain compared to our other meals in Vegas.   Eat here and make your belly happy  :-)

TMzhDQQpCm09Ibux83oH-A.text: For the price I paid for the food. It was really inexpensive and the amount of food that I received was great. Great customer service and great environment.

jqooaWHGJyuKZAtyw1zDSA.text: It's a decent place for breakfast or brunch. I've had lots of different things here and none of them are incredible. The potatoes are pretty boring, honestly. The toast is always good. This last time I got the chili with rice instead of pasta. It was ok. I was expecting a small bowl but it was massive and it was covered in cheese. In my opinion, the food here is a 3 but the service is always really good. This last time, Amanda took care of us and didn't miss a beat. Nice job!!

NjfIp3o27l2ARy6Kwr6p6A.text: Seated pretty quickly service was excellent very creative with the egg sign. Ordered the eggs Benedict with veggie, very good! and the country potatoes are fantastic!

UhzcD5wxeQZRWkZozJjwzQ.text: Great food but ambiance was very blah I thought. But, of course I love a really cute ambiance when I go to brunch

SYNqC0OFkhtYirr0Rbfj7A.text: We love the Egg and I every time we eat there. They have an extensive menu and large portions. Today I had something that wasn't even on the menu. My nephew said the stuffed French toast was the best he has had. We had a great server named Carole Ann. She was as accommodating as the servers we have had at the Cracker Barrel, and they have the very best servers.

Qd0Opmyt3SfUMxBlojUirA.text: AMAZING, amazing experience here. The food and service was top notch here. They were able to accommodate our party of 10. Regardless of our party size, they provided amazing service. We gave them a big fat tip. Their banana nut muffins were to die for and possibly the best one I've ever had. I got the spinach benny and it was delicious. The other foods looked good and none of us had any complaints during our meal. I think I will need to visit this place every time I'm in Vegas. It's delicious with amazing service. Can't go wrong!

_S-pI_iYoDwwss8fhqzYsg.text: Must try chicken fried steak and stuffed strawberry cream cheese french toast. Thank you Earl for the excellent service.

94b8iYwGzxfZZq7qhDcQxg.text: Place gets busy quickly so if you can get there by 8-830am. Loco moco was good but the best part is the banana nut muffin. I'll go back there just for the muffin! Service is great. The ladies we encountered are very friendly. Would definitely come back here again.

2b7YT5p91SWrJSjREOnnlQ.text: Fabulous little dive off the strip. Go early for breakfast. There was no wait on the Saturday morning I visited. This breakfast was very well worth the Uber drive. My waitress, Tamara, was awesome. She recommended the Bandito (if you like spicy food!) and was SO right! The house breakfast potatoes are amazing and you must take advantage of the Banana nut muffin offer on Yelp. Even if you are full, take one home! Absolutely a must do when you are ready to escape the lavish buffets of the strip!

nm6qtgopj1Ps-a9eE5nyrA.text: We were seated immediately. Our waitress was very nice and welcoming! She unfortunately pushed the wrong button when she put in my order so when they brought it out, it wasn't the right skillet but she immediately went to the back and put in a new order. My skillet was brought out within 5 minutes and the problem was solved! But the my correct order was missing my toast. The waitress said she'd go get it and never returned with it. By the time I could even address the issue I was done eating. Regardless a small issue like this won't stop me from coming back. The food was delicious.

U8LJd13E87yx49wOcbVaQw.text: The service was fast and friendly and the food was amazing! We had the home made corned beef hash, chicken and chorizo hash and the Mashed potato omelet. Everything was phenomenal but those breakfast potatoes were the best thing on every plate! The portions were huge and the coffee was fresh. Breakfast heaven!

EA2nCbXSRphjOoLxqWqW6g.text: Awesome breakfast! And great service especially for a place this busy with plenty of staff for a timely breakfast.

ObSfrSXztTZ6a2qzZotKyA.text: Great brekkie place.  Its not uber cheap (average $8) but they do give you good portions, and their muffin is great.   The coffee is just ok, but they bring a pot like IHOP and you pour to your heart's content. Lucky there's a Starbucks 1/2 block up the street. :D  Service is egg-selent!  Plenty of parking.  It can get crowded on weekends.

C8wDVCVqvZtT6ysASLjf0w.text: Great locals spot. You can tell by all the Nevada license plates outside. The food is hearty. They specialize in guess what? Eggs! I had the corned beef and hash, expecting the can-type, which I hoped for, but it's good, high quality corned beef with hash. The eggs are cooked well. The scramble was pretty good too. Oh yea, and with the check-in you get to try their infamous banana nut muffin. It's pretty good, the muffin top rivals that of Souplantation. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Muffin top!

cw7a2XiZD2crl4RfzDDENg.text: Waited for almost 2 hours for a party of 10, we were told we would have to wait 30-40 minutes. At this point it wasn't even breakfast anymore. I understand we're a fairly big party but more than double the wait time we were told is unacceptable. It had been almost 2 hours and they had the audacity to ask if we could sit separately after we saw them pass parties after parties. Definitely not worth it.

LS1klEWXpP9hpH1vm4QDPw.text: As good as it gets!  Came here in April to meet up with an old friend.  This place was very cute and spacious. We got seated right away.  The menu is like a newspaper, but not. I thought that was really neat and fun, quite creative if you ask me.  The corn beed hash is very up to par with what I consider a good corn beef hash. Trust me, I'm very nit picky about my hash & how I like them.  I really enjoyed the potatoes as well. Brownie points for endless coffee.  It's all you can drink so that's nice.  DON'T forget the MUFFIN!!! Melt in your mouth good. GET THE MUFFIN!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. corn beef hash

mOxr9IWzByeKzakrPwewsA.text: What an amazing find! We wanted the breakfast buffet at our hotel on the Strip, but found out that the price doubled on the weekend. So on our way out of town to the Grand Canyon, we did a quick Yelp search and found this gem. Being in Vegas, we thought it was funny that there were 777 reviews for this place, averaging 4.5 stars. It lived up to the hype!   Definitely ask for the banana nut muffins, they are amazing. As are the potatoes. As are the omelettes...heck, it was ALL great! I ordered the chile relleno omelette (yes you read that right) and it was dee-lish.   Our server, Alyssa, was friendly and made sure everything was to our liking and topped off. The manager, Gia, stopped by our table to check in on us and ended up giving us some great ideas of places to check out on our road trip.  After the crazy hustle and bustle and Falseness of the Strip, it was great to eat at a down-home style diner. I liked it so much I wanted to buy a T-shirt, but they were out of the tie-dye one that I wanted. Which is probably the only non-five-star thing I can say about this place. We will definitely be back here again the next time we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chile relleno omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sundance veggie omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken breast omelette made with egg whites upon request

cCN5nt8Cs6JrJj9VeT4TaQ.text: We have been to many of the egg restaurants in Nevada - all have great food. The service has always been good as well. This waiter was awesome. He made breakfast all about the grandkids  - awesome is all I can say

anuIO5wWV6iw28S9JQ3JRQ.text: Great family spot, everyone loved it. Great food and even better service! Will always come back for breakfast when visiting Las Vegas!

qdapSVCjfaq8AOniheK1XA.text: The Banana Nut muffin is so good, I'm glad we don't live on that side of town or I'd be there eating the stuff everyday.   It's an awesome place for breakfast. Good food, good service. Just get there a little early because it can get pretty crowded.

ptYA2w8lMjCFWLstHyG9JA.text: When I ordered the blueberry pancakes I had expectations that it would be good, but I was wrong. The blueberry should have had taste, but it didn't. In return I got a blueberry pancake that had no taste and only added to the texture. However the pancake it self was that bad. That is the reason why I give this place 2 stars. In addition I hope Egg & I would see this, and make some improvements.

QljknPXTuz1-nUjM12zJ2A.text: This place is awesom. It's a breakfast place with a southwest twist on the flavor for most dishes. My favorite is the country fried skillet. Price is a bit high but you get a ton of food.   The service is always good. Never an empty cup. Worth the wait if there is one.

JfQ33hq44Csoky4SZjULCg.text: Amazing breakfast place close to the strip. I found this place on Yelp and we decided to make the trip as it was close by. I knew we were at the right place when they were super busy. We didn't have to wait to get seated which was very nice. The food was very good and priced normally. Portions were regular sized. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a breakfast and brunch spot in Vegas.

FW84PEMSulcP_InjS3MhVA.text: Great breakfast spot! Consistent service and the food is delicious. Brad's omelette is my go-to, but if you're feeling courageous, the loco moco or the haole moco are both amazing! The potatoes are always good.

K6m560JOFqQo5TBt3sYWsA.text: Look for KARLA, she made my day she's awesome server.. made me feel I'm in hawaii very friendly staffs and i love to come back see her again... I highly recommend to see this place check out karla.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t forget da island meal
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check out this loco moco
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check out this complimentary muffin, it&#39;s amazing..

ZjXAp4jX5UVl-qw8t6pWZg.text: Just delicious,  worth the wait and uber trip from the strip! Not over priced but busy with justification...

jMlh7-TlGsos6jVC5g7njA.text: Great local family restaurant. Stuffed French toast was delicious. Server was very friendly. I'm glad I left the strip to go here. Short Lyft ride away from strip for better food and a little cheaper even with rides considered.

RB-iTEngVAPGXK5jgX2eOw.text: me and my 2 sisters and mother came and ate here and one ordered biscuits and gravy and was sooooo good and the other got the classic and it was good and simple and the other got french toast sandwich that had eggs and bacon with cheese  and it was deliciousss.... i got the bacon avocado omelet and omg it was just the bestttttt .... there banana muffin is soo good as well as the blue berry muffin .. our server was karla and had 5 yrs of experience and you could tell ..super sweet and gave us her thoughts of everythiny we ordered .. probably the best breakfast restaurant in vegas we got to eat ... better then hash house a go go ...  country cooking

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soooo good .. bacon avocado omelet .

p_Xixuqy9eEEsEhWZgLhGw.text: Pretty decent (not spectacular) omelets and other egg-based dishes.  Somewhat cramped seating area.  No cloth napkins.  Many of the hotels in Las Vegas has better all-day breakfast offerings, with a much nicer  seating area and cloth napkins, at comparable prices.

nJwIg-q4OgsfySuAxM28Dg.text: First, our server, Angel was awesome!  What a delight to have such a pleasant and personable experience.  The food was very good and very filling.  My daughter had the chicken fried steak skillet and loved it, she was stuffed and could not finish all of her order.  I ordered eggs benedict and my only complaint was that the center of the egg whites were still runny.  Kinda grossed me out.  I scraped the runny part out and ate the rest.  It was delicious and very filling.  We frequently eat at the Egg & I in various Colorado locations and are never disappointed in their quality or quanity.  The Sahara location is equally good.

QYxp_LBUMgzh0qmNtc-W5Q.text: A great family owned local business to get great food in Vegas. The free muffin when you check in was surprisingly delicious.   I ordered the blackened rib Benny. It was absolutely delicious and flavorful. Service is very friendly and fast. An A+ off strip dining option.

TIWRl9AIognKPY1r39g1-A.text: Very good spot for breakfast food in Las Vegas!  I ordered the Brad's Scramble: Brad's scramble is diced tomatoes, fresh spinach, sliced mushrooms, and cheddar and jack cheese.  I skip the cheese... I know, I'm weird, but I like the eggs mixed with veggies.  It's not overwhelming.  Also, the banana nut muffin is delicious!  Choose this over toast, 100% of the time.  Most plates come with their diablo potatoes, which I really like as well, they taste like seasoned french fries.  Yum!

eKc3KFd5pZ3hcg8qft1DRw.text: Seemed like a long line when we got there but it moved fast.. Seated, server was helpful and informative and very friendly. She suggested the Santa Cruz Skillet(added grilled jalapenos) and it was perfect. The kids got pancakes and an omelette, both great and the wife had a veggie scramble, which she loved. Will  return next trip to Vegas for sure.

PJuFdhDjqiU6gaOl_bRC5g.text: Awesome service! Delicious food! First time here glad we went. Best banana muffin I've ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa! Fresh orange juice
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and chorizo hash

sfS3Z0uEvvbVyumqCACVWg.text: Best egg &I I ever dine. I recommend the Hawaiian breakfast and banana nut cake. Iam looking forward to go back to Vegas.

VOKZ0X1ubj84it2QOLxf_Q.text: Great breakfast big portions... coffee was good and the service was very kind and quick! Only problem was that you have to pay the bill on the way out and there was a very long line, we were in a hurry and if we wouldve known we could plan our time differantly...

uXLWnI7H2Sf4MXosBF5Ocw.text: Erin, our server, was great! We had the mashed potato omelette and the Strawberry Cream Cheese French Toast.   The omelette was very tasty and the French Toast itself was very good - we'll have to try something later that isn't quite as sweet as the Strawberry Cream Cheese. That was a bit too much sweetness for us, but it was very flavorful.   When you're in town, or if you're local, it's well worth the visit.

Ti6l8O-82__eEBzX6Zpr-g.text: Excellent and very hearty breakfast. This might be the greatest breakfast place ever. I have not one bad thing to say. Food was better than I could have even imagined. Staff was so comforting and friendly. Just the best.

CqmHgnoebepdH03JpD2P1w.text: The place was quick to seat us. Our waiter arrived brought our coffee and water right away. The meal was very large but was also very good. I would highly recommend the Egg and I.

rLUzGZPXF3JgctA2nqnhUw.text: Really nice Food and Very good customer service. Please do NOT feed the birds if you sit outside haha

tUfCusffoHRM7EhPtZhOkA.text: Best banana muffins in town!  Great place for breakfast, brunch, or lunch.   Gets very busy on weekends, so be prepared to wait to be seated.  Or you may place an your order to go, if you know what you really enjoy.

_VWGBo5xyrKuwh9yvbd92g.text: We ended up at this place after not being able to get into a few other breakfast joints on a Sunday morning.  I am sure glad we did.  Their food was amazing and the service was fantastic.  Would definitely hit this place up again.  Best part, it wasn't on the strip so the wait times and prices are pretty doable.

FEk3LE3t2fQJMjGTvI_Tqg.text: On our last day in Vegas we decided to give this place a chance, they had good reviews so we figured, why not.. the coffee was not good.. my eggs were to runny, even when I said over medium.. potatoes were just ok.. service was good.. don't think I would come again.

aHt71LD1kXZB5QYzSZbWmA.text: Awesome breakfast. Skillets great, omelettes were awesome and the potatoes Not enough time on this trip for a return visit, but will be back

NVC8J6hBANch4mZMTXceHg.text: Don't be in a hurry, it's worth the wait. They have a patio where you can take your fur baby for breakfast, or anytime!

Kza2kmM5_nmq8i9yhHdoZw.text: The breakfast here is amazing and the Staff is great! My family and I had Manuela as our server and she was so amazing we came back the next day! Truly great experience! The food is great, the coffee is piping hot and fresh, and the banana muffin is everything!

Gioib07VlH9qt5nfF9gPqQ.text: This is the place to go for a diner/breakfast/lunch in Las Vegas.  It is off the strip but totally worth the manageable drive.  I went after a long Vegas night around 11am for a breakfast/brunch.  We were seated immediately but the place was still relatively full.  I went with a ham and cheese omelette and the person I was with had the pancakes.  We each had a banana nut muffin as well.  All was cooked to perfection and portions were huge.  My omelette came with home fries and all was delicious and perfect for the post Vegas night.  I tried the pancakes and they were great as well.  The banana nut muffin is a must try.  Prices were very reasonable for the quality and the size.  if you have a car or don't mind cabbing it out to this locale, I highly recommend the trip.  Much better than any diner-type option on the strip.

3vwXa-A6QyQWj5qgpt-xNQ.text: Simply Awesome.  Great food and great service (Cheryl was sweet), too bad I'm only passing through town.  On a Saturday morning, this place was packed and lots of folks on the wait list.  However, it was only a 20 min wait to be seated and our food was served within 10-15 min.  Get the free banana nut muffin with coffee, it makes it well worth the wait.

S6Da7UGMabPYADjxSRYtDg.text: This place is just wonderful! If you want to get away from the madness of the strip and sit down for a family meal this is the place. Although, you'll want to come early to beat the morning rush. By the time we left there was at least 10 parties waiting. We ordered the chicken fried steak skillet and the vegetable skillet. I enjoyed the chicken fried steak although there were too many potatoes for me. The flavor, cook, and gravy was spot on. The vegetable skillet had great flavor too but some of the vegetables were a little under done. But over all still a great breakfast place. You get free banana nut muffins (they ate bomb) if you check in. There was something wrong with yelp when I was there so could not check in but they gave me my muffin anyways!

Yr2A0sF8lls_Y2GkIyGM2w.text: Great breakfast stop! The most delicious banana nut muffin I have ever had the pleasure of eating! I have to agree with some of the other reviewers who suggest that when dining here with company it would be wise to split dishes as the portion sizes are very generous! I ordered the Hobo scramble which was a special and not available on the regular menu. I am sucker for a scramble however the superior quality of the muffin has convinced me to sample the sweeter items (waffles) on the menu the next time I visit this place. Lots of people rave about the potatoes and I have to say that they were not what I personally am looking for in a potato. They are covered in seasoning and I just prefer a simpler potato flavor. The coffee was great and I cannot say that about many places! Here it is a good strength with a good flavor and it comes in cute mug with two happy eggs on it! Probably my favorite thing about this place is the little egg sign at your table that you can flip from happy to sad when you are in need of something. It beats having to pay close attention to flag down your waiter whenever they walk by. On our visit we didn't even have to use it because the service was so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Banana nut muffin ever!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hobo Scramble
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas Breakfast

aeSRbz89A4ybfN74oIHNbg.text: Sooo hungover, and new in town, I could only think of this place.  It's cute inside, the waitress was nice, but not very attentive.  The plain waffle was flavorless, the bacon uncrisp and small, the potatoes were extra and toast did not come with the meal.  Once the headache subsided, I thought of two places that served a better breakast for half the price.

o7RXwlxhSs3Ps5r1VwW3Zg.text: My wife and I visit Vegas at least once a year.  Until I found this place (and others) on Yelp, we used to just have breakfast/brunch in the hotel's anonymous coffee shop.  Meh.   Now that Yelp has opened my eyes, we've tried different places.  The Egg & I is one of our favorites for breakfast (actually brunch since we don't leave the hotel until 10 a.m. or so).  We eat here most often because there is a plethora of different items on their menu to choose from and they are ALL GOOD!  Breakfast is my favorite meal to eat when I'm away from home, so this is important to me.  To be honest it is pretty difficult to screw up a basic breakfast centered on eggs and breakfast meat.  However, the Egg & I is head and shoulders above the others with various delicious potato and egg treatments, their muffins, and friendly service staff.  Needless to say, we don't eat in hotel coffee shops anymore.  Not only do you get huge quantities of food at the Egg & I, it all tastes great, and what a variety!  If you're not into eggs, they also have waffles, pancakes and french toast, as well as salads and sandwiches.  Also free wifi so you can catch up on news from home & messages while eating.  If you are like my wife and insist on staying in a big-name Strip resort hotel, do yourself a favor and drive a short distance off the strip to have breakfast and some really tasty food.  Catch a glimpse of what the rest of the City of Las Vegas looks like, and taste real food, not the bland stuff the corporate chains dish out.  You might realize, like I did, that The Strip is not the final destination of your trip to Vegas.  There are fine dinner restaurants off the Strip as well!  Yelp is here for you.

6xmrnZexV0sq8M65RjYw9A.text: Everything positive you hear is True.  Come hungry and ask the hostess to call you a cab before your bill comes so you don't have to wait outside awhile.  Only negative is that its a little off the beaten path.

vqNjyMnYV9YAV0pd75Q1Zg.text: Had the chile relleno omelette and it was amazing. Also had the banana pancakes which were good but probably would have been better if I didn't choose the healthier buckwheat option.

y5bHY7W83ZFawfrG4rsvTw.text: Great food and great service from Chance!  Definitely worth the shirt drive from strip

_WPvv9Lb-aGjj2u6xDeCXQ.text: This has become my common stop right before leaving from Vegas back home. I have been there only 3 times and have had chili skillet every time. Food is great. Even my veggie friends have loved this place. Service is really friendly and attentive. First time I went there I had 3 different servers coming to take my order. I am not complaining. Idea of changing the egg logo to show that you need something is really cool. They might have taken it too far with "EggCeptional" kinda stuff on their T-shirts.  They have LCD TVs so you can watch football games while having breakfast (if you are sober enough). One star less for not having this in San Diego.

f6_qh2bz7b8tMzZdu9j-pw.text: We've been to LV many times and we usually eat breakfast buffet near the strip. But this place is good. Lizete reserved our seats because we called in. Once seated Debra just made us feel special with her service. The muffin is sooooo fresh and tasty. She even accommodated our request to replace the ordered toast with the muffin. I highly recommend for visitors to have your breakfast at Egg and I.

Ew1dxVVwlvA_DIPco7JcuQ.text: The husband and I were in town for the weekend looking for a good spot to have breakfast at. Good thing I looked up on yelp first because it was so good!! I had the chile relleno omelette with the works potatoes on the side and it was very good. The husband had the works omelette and it was tasty as well. If your in town try this place out. We will definitely be coming again when we are back in the area visiting. It was packed but all worth the wait!!

0WXSVqGRz3q28Hr2tD122g.text: Stopped here on our way out of Vegas. We were looking for a tasty breakfast spot and we definitely found it. The portions were generous, the coffee was just right, and the flavors were spot on (with the exception of the potatoes- they were great at first but as the meal went on the saltiness took over. I will say our server was exceptional, she was attentive without being pushy and was genuinely pleasant. I would recommend this place for a good homey meal away from the strip.

EfLO9EnizPKX0UIbSQVoeg.text: What a nice place, great staff my waitress Lindsey was very nice.  Always a treat to get a perfectly cooked sunny side egg, and the hash wasn't too bad either.

vkUbVPLoOyKGv8Jyev7_TQ.text: We were looking for a new breakfast spot and found this one from yelp. We saw all the good review so we decided to try it. We were NOT impressed at all. Maybe they were just having a bad day? I got the basic pancakes with bacon breakfast. How can you go wrong right?? Well let me tell you, the bacon was hard and chewy and the pancakes were like chewing on their old recycled newspaper menus. It was like eating 100 crackers that you were unable to swallow. My BF got the eggs benedict that came with potatoes. The potatoes were like hollow skins with no meat inside and were salted beyond belief. I think we left swollen from all the water retention.. At least we can say that we tried it but we will definately be sticking to The Omlette House or Hash House A Go Go for breakfast when we visit Vegas.

thbnXlkD8-XMHE8xnBRsDA.text: The veggie skillet and ciabatta breakfast sandwich were delicious! Great coffee and great atmosphere! Our server Chance was so nice and personable. Definitely recommend this as a spot to get an amazing breakfast!

Fse5U2EJnQeDoC0V7vYZ6Q.text: My favorite breakfast place to bring out of town guest.  The biscuit and gravy was way too salty today.  The crepe was good.  Too big to finish for one person.  Service was lacking when the place got busy.  Ask for a to go box and had to flag down another server via the smiley face after waited 15 minutes.

UDv8B2dT3bP0jaNtal5FBw.text: Good food, large portions, great service. Awesome place for breakfast!

TwmJy3UM9MT8IAnxz6UyDw.text: Killer breakfast at this place, and I'm not big on breakfast. I definitely enjoyed the giant selection on the menu.  You might not eat the rest of the day though--generous portions!  It's also away from the insanity of the strip--which I found favorable.

nYtW8NMiSVkHAMjB70m28A.text: This place is a winner on all accounts.  The food at the Egg & I tastes great.  The service is spectacular, the people working there really make you feel at home.  Both the hostess and waitress were very friendly and fun to talk to.    As the name would imply there is a pretty good variety of egg dishes.  You get to choose from a good omelet selection, to huevos rancheros.  If you aren't in the mood for eggs they also have the usual sandwiches and burgers.  Get a side of the banana nut muffin its really good.  Vegetarian Rating: 4/5 lots of good veggie options, they even had a vegetarian version of Eggs Benedict.

guAVpZGPwyecCzXHwQE15Q.text: This family oriented restaurant is a great place for brunch.  The menu selection is vast (6 pages!) and offers dishes for both vegetarian and non-vegetarians alike.  I ordered the veggie good omelette.  The yummy omelette (I requested mushroom, spinach, and cheddar on mine) came with well-seasoned potatoes and their infamous banana nut muffin.  You must try their banana nut muffin!  It was probably the best banana nut muffin I've ever had and I'm not exaggerating.  It tasted like there was a slight hint of buttermilk in the muffins but whatever this restaurant did to them made them amazzzingggg.    All the portions sizes are huge and I liked how I could easily substitute items that were orginally in the veggie good omelette to make my order just the way I like it.  Great prices for what you are getting as well.  The atmosphere is also fun and filled with egg puns!  Egg-static!

skqITkT3K7NdS1XVXL26GQ.text: Overall our experience here was probably the best on our trip. The customer service was great...almost to the point where it was annoying.   The banana nut muffins are the best I've ever tasted and I don't even like banana nut muffins!  We got the greek style omelet and eggs benedict florentine. The EB were some of the best I've had. My omelet was good, but I should have ordered the everything omelet as our server suggested. The home potatoes were very good also.  You can tell this is one of the places that Las Vegas locals go too. I'm realizing sometimes the further off the strip you go, the better.  This is now on my top 3 breakfast places...

zdZoj_9PQWphLdPGwHfThQ.text: Best breakfast place i have ever been to! We experienced great service , and good food.Ou waitress was super nice. I love chille rellenos, so i had to try their chille relleno omelet. OMG BOMB lol it was so good. i had to try their banana bread  muffin it was good! i live in cali ,but travel to vegas a lot. Every time we are out in vegas this will be our go to place for breakfast!

hruI9TQXDfvKBf4xa2QHGQ.text: Simply amazing!!! Amazing food and amazing service! Manuela was so friendly and gave great service! The blackened prime rib Benny and veggie Benny were outstanding! And the warm banana nut muffin they gave us when we first got here was to die for! We are from out of town and I wish we had one of these restaurants where we live.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Benny
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib Benny

fesEqiQo5o3Tm8hLza0Ywg.text: Excellent food as always, a new "go to" spot each time I'm in Vegas for sure!  The banana nut muffin is not what you would expect, but totally worth trying...it's incredibly delicious.  The service is top notch, so nice to go to a restaurant that not only has great food, but great service as well.  It's a rarity nowadays.  Looking forward to my next meal at Egg & I!

0FLPkZtcsSyslwJO-IJ77w.text: Very busy place, service was prompt and friendly. Food was decent for diner style. I ordered biscuits and gravy with a side of sausage and it came with Diablo potatoes (kind of like cottage fries) the gravy was delicious and the biscuits were soooo soft and really hit the spot! The potatoes were a little on the salty side but overall the meal matches the pricing.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy and sausage

fItpg3KUs37_tCjRM-GIGQ.text: Large portions, cheap food, a novel of a menu... the perfect place to take a group of people. There's a little of everything for everyone. Family friendly, polite and funny staff. I think our server was Angel... she was the best... honest and funny. She made our experience one that we would never forget.   I would definitely return for their banana nut muffins

zn_yEpykJpB9tbYM8IiqjA.text: This was a weekly staple for us to catch a break of cooking at home and get a good breakfast at Egg & I or one of their sister locations. Lately we have been disappointed every time we go. Eggs undercooked, slow service, burnt toast, rancid avacados...the list actually goes on. We returned a few more times thinking it was circumstantial. After all, we had been going here for years! Sadly, it looks like we will have to be finding a new weekend breakfast spot.

iP2U4CNu2adHOUekYfmDQQ.text: Sometimes it's just about knowing what to order!  The service was fantastic. I snuck in Egg & I just before lunch to get Breakfast right before the rush.  They have a pretty big selection for breakfast and Lunch. I ordered a *Half Order chili omelet and they also allowed me to substitute half of my potatoes for tomatoes.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j3u99pg8zaaRl9XdN6PZRQ.text: I was soooo excited to try this place but it ust did not have anything special for me, I do love breakfast dishes but maybe getting a table in the outside patio in a windy day at 55 degrees without heaters, was not a good idea to enjoy my experience.   We waited for around 40 minutes to get our table and were surprised they did not have heaters.  If they know winters are on the cold side in Las Vegas, not sure why they don't invest some money  get a few of them.  I ordered the Crazy chicken omelette ($11) and it added up to my non enjoyable experience. It was flavorless, and the chicken and mushrooms were inexistent.  Overload of flavorless cheese on top of my omelette.  The habla Diablo fries were pretty good.  The banana muffin was the best part of my . It was warm when it came out and got a second one as I checked in in yelp!   My boyfriend got the Corned beef hash and it was good but again not the best breakfast/brunch I had in my life!  I might come back just to try something else and figure out if it was my meal that wasn't good. However, I don't feel like recommending it to anyone.   Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Benedict!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy chicken omelette... Flavorless, overloaded with flavorless cheese. Almost inexistent chicken and mushrooms!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana muffin, best part to the breakfast! Check in Yelp for a free muffin!

UJ_XjBExx4PApUdjv7LyPg.text: Great service , and I love they stuffed French toast, also the banana muffin is good~

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X29B10R08FpX39k2G9YeJQ.text: I absolutely love this place. Could never go wrong. I had the eggs Benedict. So goooood. Paired with a Bloody Mary. Both were delish. Went with friends yesterday morning, the girl at the front said 55min wait so we waited in the car luckily they send u a txt when u r about to be next. It actually ended up being a 33min wait. The staff is friendly and quick. Our food was out so quick and tasted delicious. Try their Bloody Mary. I like my drinks spicy and theirs is definitely spicy.

F8BM4tTsJroR6Sxgz3o7CA.text: Came here with family and did not regret it. Very good breakfast! Will be coming here again in the future.

9wfjeI_SMf3z4xyRObpYSQ.text: I love the service and the prices at this restaurant. I discovered this hidden gem on yelp and I'm so glad I did! The food is on point and you can't beat the prices!  I totally recommend a try!  There is a wait but it's never longer than 20 minutes. The service is excellent as well.,So worth it the wait!

QF9osSjD7O74Hfj50w2ENg.text: My go to breakfast place. Always great. Never had a bad meal and the service is always fantastic.  I like that I can order half entrees too.  Depending on how hungry I am and it also cuts down on wasted food.

CgJhNy_TiLFDEqxmTOERvA.text: The wait time was about 5 min which was excellent. The entertainment in the room was inviting as well as homing. The waitress attended everyone quite frequently which is good especially when it's busy. If your also looking for food option don't worry they have quite a selection of entrees. The only down side is that I ordered the steak and eggs and to be honest it was over salty. Also, the potatoes I was pretty disappointed because I was expecting hasbrowns or even fresh shredded or something fresh. These tasted and looked like fries I could buy frozen at the store. And there salsa was weak.  But to be fair it's an establishment that has great food options......maybe I just didn't have a good day.

KhY0PP_wzV-wbaai-ejEvg.text: This placed is called, "Egg & I," but their Banana Nut Muffin steals the show!!!!! We came here on a Sunday and the wait outside was intimidating, but also told us that this place was worth the wait. We waited about 20 minutes to get a table. We ordered the eggs Benedict and French toast and took the muffins to go. If you love banana bread you will LOVE these muffins. Long story short, get the BANANA NUT MUFFIN for dessert/snack.

gC1OUUFoo9swMkSsYkgY3w.text: I ordered French toast and biscuit and gravy, sorry but that was the worst food I've ever tried to eat, the French toast looked like it was deep fried on one side I managed to eat one bit, the gravy had so much bacan in it that's all you can taste final decision off are list

ZW3QdqvTy21VlnRQDHL8ZQ.text: Best eggs Benedict I have ever had and people YOU CAN ORDER HALF OF ANYTHING because their orders are pretty large FYI !!

bvaNh3IQSPvre78iVg3AmQ.text: Great food and even better service! Tamara was our waitress and she knew what we needed before we did!

hrwF_b7-z4bI6-Irwl0jbA.text: I love breakfast and am always looking for a unique spot for breakfast. I highly recommend The Egg and I. They have a bustling business.  The place was packed when we were there, but we were seated quickly and the service was exceptional. Their menu boasts 4 pages of egg related dishes (traditional and adventurous) as well as lunch offerings.  My husband said the burger he had was excellent and the breakfast tostada I had was fabulous.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QJNoYfV4ryBC-TUGQHa-lQ.text: Good breakfast spot and portions. Friendly attentive service. Would come back. Avocado was generously portioned in the avocado bacon omelette.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

smvKWyooBL-5UFNfdng4dQ.text: Great place to go for breakfast or brunch.  You can't go wrong with any selection of omelettes or egg skillet items.  The french toast was also very popular and came in very large portions.  We didn't upgrade to the special maple syrup but the house syrup was perfectly fine.  The side of 3 bacon strips made it feel like a real breakfast.  I would recommend as a change of pace from the buffets or fancy restaurants in the casinos.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KGllk4SeOvHgTyB_GL6D5w.text: Food was great. Best place for breakfast I've been to in Vegas. Large selection. Probably not a good place on the weekends as we waited 20 minutes on a Monday morning for a table for two.

7NzNq84tsfm7qzOiqlqMHg.text: This place is great!!!   The Staff is friendly The food portions are perfect The prices are spot on  Must try!!!

bi1y4wtH_-xBYWRdR0IZ7g.text: Yums! This place is delicious!!   Since we had a car this time in Vegas, we decided to get some brunch off the strip. We had a party of 3 and waited about 10-15 minutes before we got seated. My friend ordered the stuffed french toast, which was HUGE! The bf ordered the eggs benedict, which was not bad and good portions. I ended up ordering the egg-crepe, which was simiar to an omelette. Pretty good and not too heavy.   What we loved the most was their banana nut muffin and ranch potatoes. O man, my mouth is watering just thinking about how light and tasty their banana nut muffin was. I could eat like 5 of those in 1 sitting. hahaha. =X We were all raving about how  the ranch potatoes were so flavorful. Plus, each dish had a big portion of it. I definitely wasn't complaining.   Our waitress was very attentive, but not over-bearing. She told us if we needed something, we could just flip the little egg over to get her attention (reminded me of Bubba Gump's).  I will definitely want to come back and try other things on the menu, since I go to Vegas about 3 times a year.

5FWD10b26EoYFC8Lt0DTvg.text: If you can get off the strip, you need to try the breakfast here. Staci was our server and she helped to make this a great dining experience.  She was friendly, helpful and professional. I ordered the pulled pork taquito, served with eggs on the top. Oh my, this was delicious and humongous. It served with a green salsa which I don't normally like but this was good. If you like a little Mexican with your brunch this is a dish worth trying. My partner had the homemade corned beef hash.  Also delicious, big chunks of meat. The meal started with their muffins. So Good, I wish we saved one for later.

9R_3SRMaMtO96LYg4OD79g.text: Menu promised exciting food but once it arrived it was just boring.  The staff was great and Ashley is a must ask for if you chose to dine here.

i3HkSTA_utKCdD1Qf7iMjg.text: What a great atmosphere!  Even though we were in Las Vegas, this could have been a small-town diner anywhere in the US.   We had a great breakfast with banana-nut muffins, of course!  We were going to share a chile relleno omelet, and asked for an extra muffin, when the waitress told us that we could order half orders of just about anything on the menu - the cost was half of the menu price + 50 cents.  We did that instead, order half an omelette and half an order of grilled banana bread french toast. So I said - well, we won't need the other muffin, but the waitress said - no charge! - I'll bring you an extra anyway.  The food was excellent. The breakfast potatoes need some work - they were just hard fried "bits" of potatoes - but everything else was great.  A carafe of coffee was left on our table so that we didn't have to keep asking for refills, and cream/flavored creamers are on the table to make a perfect cup of coffee.  It was delightful - a trip back in time!  Don't miss it if you have a car in LV!

B6cwQ43ZwdvXbgRiYeCI9w.text: We had Ashley. We had an awesome experience. She made sure everything was taken care of in a timely manner.

Ws--JxsCJ-w5n2Ub8z9INg.text: With this review I will say that everything is relative.  When you consider other options in Vegas for a good breakfast for a reasonable price, this is one of the best.  If you have read my other post you know I love chicken fried steak and of course that was my order here.  The steak was seasoned very good and had a lot of flavor.... really good!  I will be back to get it again in the future.  The gravy was good but not great in my opinion.  I really liked their breakfast potatoes as well as they were season with extra season and were better than I expected.  The eggs are eggs and nothing special there.  Also their banana muffin is really good.  It is a bit greasy and not for anyone on a diet but you talking to someone that eats fried meats for breakfast.

oPF2t01TD-Jl4BE4C4TTVw.text: Had brunch with my daughter there on Sunday after church. They were full of customers and was very pleased at how fast we were seated. The food is very good, served hot with large portions. The sever Linnea was prompt and friendly. Great   overall experience !!

H7wX6H_m2vkbTndhprzAJA.text: It's a cab ride off the Strip, but worth it!  I'm in Vegas two of three times a year, and Egg and I has become one of my regular stops. The Kay's Special omelet will change your life.  And the banana nut muffin will have you believing in a higher power, no matter how you've done at the tables.

gerL11Ua5CwUhJU-f9eH6g.text: We found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try. It was super busy but so well worth the wait! Our waitress, Amanda, was really pleasant and quite helpful with recommendations. I opted to go with her suggestion of the Ensanada Burrito. I give it 4 stars. I had promised to share with the husband and after the first bite, I really didn't want to share. The burrito was bursting with carnitas. If you are after a flavorful breakfast burrito, this place is for you.

g6bWKJBgFJaksKxrJ_OkvA.text: This place is great. Omlettes, pancakes stuffed french toast its all great and they have something for everyones taste.  Our server Karla was awesome!  She described everything we asked about with great detail. I also like that they leave the coffee pot on your table so you never have to ask for a refill.

O_FVJngR7xdo8OBxbDQssQ.text: Great breakfast food and excellent service from Rea!  Food came out quickly and was perfect.   We'll be back next time we're on Vegas.

3dWEQsaRQKIeXDFIQ1aCUQ.text: Confirmed: the banana nut bread was AMAZING!  Buttered it up and inhaled it in about 2 seconds flat..........ok a bit of an exaggeration, lets call it 20 seconds.  Had one of their scrambles and it was pretty darn good too.  Would have given 5 stars, but the one thing missing from this place...........is character.  Like alot of other really good breakfast places, it is located in a strip mall.  Food is still great, location not so much.

Mo1WcT1S2kRB_fDW0vq3dA.text: Had a great experience venturing off-Strip for weekend brunch! This place was super popular on Yelp and won so many local awards, we were forced to check it out. Arrived early afternoon, there was pretty much no wait, even though there were some customers lingering near the entrance inside and the place was still full! Service was extremely down-to-earth, friendly, and attentive!  This place has a huge menu (in the form of a "newspaper"...if that gives you some idea). There were so many choices it was really hard to decide on just one =( The variety is vast, but the bulk of the items were simple, straightforward, typical breakfast dishes with unique modifications/twists or add-ons. My husband's chile relleno omelet was such a great idea for an omelet...the juicy chile and the cheese tasted amazing wrapped in egg! My benedict's garden (vegetarian version of egg's benedict) was superb as well. Even though one of the items listed in my dish was guacamole, I was SO pleasantly surprised when it arrived NOT as guacamole, but pretty much a whole avocado sliced up!!! You don't get that often, even in California! +10 points for that! The whole combination of poached eggs, hollandaise sauce, and avocado was such a delicious creamy mix, and perfectly-balanced by the crisp freshness of the tomatoes. I basically devoured it in under 5 minutes...and then had to wait for the husband to finish his plate *rolls eyes.* We both agreed that their seasoned potatoes were freaking AMAZING. We don't know what kind of seasoning they use, but it reminded us of Cajun and it was to die for. I wish they sold it by the bottle!   Wonderful place, with reasonable prices (total with tax came out to be $27) and a great cup of coffee as well. The awesome staff makes it even better!

Wn10MvYVkxjk6jWn7ofbiw.text: Love Egg and I. We needed a pick-me-up after a bad doctors office visit. Took 2 hours for 2 mins of doc attention so we were pretty annoyed. This lifted our spirits, because we both love breakfast foods. We drove a few miles to go to Egg and I simply because I wanted to try it based on the great Yelp reviews. We were not disappointed. Everything was great for my first time ever eating here. We walked in at 1215 and were immediately seated on a Thursday lunch hour. There were plenty of tables inside and out, and since it was a sunny calm day we decided it'd be nice to get out and get a little sun after being stuck in the doc office. I went with the "This Little Piggy" omelet and it was just the way I like it. Lots of egg, lots of cheese, and plenty of meats. It comes with chopped up bacon, chopped up sausage, and chopped up chunks of ham, folded in half and smothered with about a half pound of cheese!!!! Also comes with the country potatoes which I was expecting to be orgasmic based on reviews, but let me down just a little bit. Don't get me wrong they were really good, but maybe my batch just wasn't quite cooked long enough and they were a little softer than I like em. Also I got the banana nut muffin with my meal, (this thing WAS OUT-friggen-STANDING) and she brought it out before the meal, which I thought to be a little strange. But i was really hungry so it was just fine with me. My honey got a breakfast burrito and she said it was really good, looked to me like it had a ton of peppers, which isn't my favorite thing in the world, but she enjoyed it. Had to take half of it home because she couldn't finish it all, this thing was pretty big and also came with the country potatoes. This was a great breakfast experience and can understand how this place can get pretty busy at times. We were very happy with the food and mostly happy with the service, she was just a little slow a couple times and we were only there for about 45 minutes. i.e. forgot to get a sprite, and never really came back to ask us if we needed anything after our food was brought out and if it was cooked ok. After she brought the check we decided to get a refill to go since the sprite was $2.50 and brought late and we waited for a few minutes to see her but never did. In the end it worked out, when we paid we asked the cashier if she could help us in getting the to-go refill and she politely went and took care of that for us with a smile. :) Thanks Egg and I, we will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My ladies breakfast burrito and my &#34;this little piggy&#34; omelet. Delish!

B-6SAHFjmYxQ0dYBFk77UA.text: Eggcellent breakfast. Incredible service by Amanda!  We'll definitely be back.  Ordered the Carrot Cake french toast. Yummy.

diAoAw6AXaUplfoSHgKOVQ.text: Great place for breakfast. The Works Veggie Bennie is absolutely fantastic. Checked in on Yelp and got a Banana Nut Muffin which was excellent as well. I will definitely come back for more when I am in Vegas.

TC0IHB3E15FBcL_zF2Mr1Q.text: We ate breakfast here twice during our stay.  Delicious both times.  French toast, pancakes, waffles, eggs, bacon all awesome.  Service also awesome.  Would highly recommend this place.

bIkGO0W8KcrQDWMPe2wSSQ.text: Really good!  HUGE portions so beware and split if you don't have a huge appetite.  Great biscuits and gravy!  Excellent coffee!!  Service was equally good!

h1wmp9TA0AoBJ2l5BUh0Ig.text: If you're looking for a decent & in-eggspensive (well, at least by Vegas terms) place for breakfast, let me suggest the Egg & I. The service is very friendly and attentive. If you're looking for a nice break from The Strip, this is a good choice.  The food is decent. Not gourmet, but certainly not bad neither. There is a wide array to choose from. I particularly am fond of the omelets, which are quite tasty. The skillets are quite good also.  Oh yeah... don't pass up the Banana Nut Muffins... it's eggscellent.

8wiIwla5u_ivJRxdrohycA.text: I order a half order of the bacon onion skillet, It was very good, and the right amount of food for me, orange juice was fresh, although they forgot my order of toast. Overall a good breakfast experience.

b2hYdehci3kju4hLGnfb-Q.text: Love this place.....! Love my Egg Sandwich......yummmmmmm! I can't wait to come back to Vegas and eat there......

u1Emh0E2e2TWgVP32DSuMQ.text: Yum yum yum!!  Love the muffins!  Waitress was super friendly and seemed happy to be at work.  I love breakfast and this is a great option in our big little city.

UfJJ36puPraIlUntpZ25gA.text: I  Love a good breakfast!!! My BF had read a few great reviews about the Egg and I recently and suggested we try it after sitting in out DR. office appt. for 2 hours; needless to say it made us hungry.  The day was warm and not too windy so we opted to sit outside on the patio.  Nothing impressive but it did just fine.  The newspaper style menu was fun and different.  Right away I saw about 6 items I would like to try.  As did my hungry man.  I finally decided on the breakfast burrito.  And he picked This little piggy omelet.  Our food came very quickly and looked great!! The burrito was huge and looked great.  There was 4 scrambled eggs, cheese, peppers, onions and huge side of   their breakfast potatoes.  There was also a side of salsa that was tasty and not too spicy.  My BF food looked yummy as well, I knew this when he ate it all with few words.   The only thing that could have been better was a more attentive server.  We had to look around for a water and soda refill.  I hate that.  She was however very sweet and seemed a little new.  I will defiantly be going back to try some of the other dishes that made my mouth water.  Overall, the Egg and I is a sure fire great breakfast experience.

4iVpoS81Qxrgb8vZQctnYQ.text: Someone call 911, because I'm in a food coma over the Banana Bread French Toast.   It should be illegal its so good. I'm guessing that batter frying slices of Banana Bread is only legal in Vegas.   Lots of other goodies on the menu. My wife got a savory crepe that was delicious with a side of their seasoned potatoes that you don't want to stop eating.   Escape from the strip and go here for breakfast if you are in town. It was so good, I went twice during our stay.   Service was good. Everyone is attentive and mostly smiling (which is rare to find). They give you your own pot of coffee which is a huge plus in my book.

9Z-LGPYaSWA_W0mS_RbVuQ.text: This is a nice place to take the family to eat the food is nothing special there price range is alright but they seem to always have so many people there and there staff cant handle it they might forget some stuff.

qbjn_rFjP_yOmfycyjaJMA.text: At first it looks just like a local non-special restaurant... It turns that the food was great and fairly priced (I had a pork carnitas ranchero). It was quick and the service was satisfactory.

aWw540IQQ8dVq_VxY6sXkw.text: yelp comes through again, banana bread is awesome service is great oh and don't forget the breakfast

eTT5DUcZWjlM8AcieDWAOg.text: Our server Staci was awesome, and made us feel cared for as guests.  I appreciated that she asked whether we wanted full amount of cheese on the omelette or butter on the toast, as it's nice to be made aware of some healthier changes to the food when dining in Vegas.  I took one star off for the potatoes that were too salty to eat, but otherwise everything else was great.  I had the veggie omelette with added avocado and banana nut muffin.

YTX9uSeDcXYhBEweyyguVw.text: My wife and I had discovered Egg and I 18 months ago when we decided to have breakfast after a late night out away from the Vegas strip. After reading all the good reviews on Yelp..we decided to try this place..and we love it so much that we have breakfast here everytime we come to Vegas from San Francisco - Bay Area.   We have tried several breakfast places on the Vegas strip and it does not even come close to the service, price, and quality of food at Egg and I.    The Banana Nut Muffin is a MUST try!!!

vw11gAmLPL_f9Lkjorq7yA.text: Oh my god breakfast for four. This turned out to be enough for lunch too. I would recommend this place anytime.

pvL_bvLJTIIXxQsNGeGLrA.text: While on a family vaca, we decided to hit a spot off the strip for breakfast, and man this was a jackpot. Great for the kids.  They greeted us with balloons, and where extremely friendly.  I had the Chorizo skillet and it was the bomb!!  Super crispy potatoes.  Grubby mixture of everything else.  Also comes with a very good banana nut muffin on the side.  They leave the carafe of coffee at the table.    Hit the spot and wish they had one near me in So Cal.

vxlmELFYjtcyVLLH0jkQwQ.text: I've been here several times over the years and finally getting the thoughts down on Yelp. On my last visit I was a little peeved when the hostess passed me over when taking names for the waiting list. I know I'm not invisible. Once seated things calmed down and breakfast was on. I had a skillet which are always good but I was looking for a spinach & ground beef omelet with cheese but they don't have that on the menu but I'll ask next time. Not always my first choice for breakfast but its a good place to be.

qWsoty2EH-c8sdy8L3lddg.text: We went searching for a Village Inn after checking out of our hotel. We never found it, but on the way back to the highway, we passed this place and decided to U-turn it back here.   The service (except for the older woman at the register completely not seeing us and helping 2 people after us as we were trying to pay), was good and fast. The food was a little salty, but it was good.   They were pretty busy for a Thursday morning and I'm guessing that's for a reason. Give them a chance if you're nearby! :)

ybcIaswrOibKCJM_mWpmUQ.text: I ordered the corned beef hash with the banana nut muffin. I've been hearing about how great their banana nut muffin and it truly does live up to the hype. It was light and fluffy and the banana flavor was subtle.   The corned beef hash comes with ranch potatoes (think Tommys style fries with that red seasoning only diced up), eggs, and a side of watermelon and pineapple. The hash was served under scrambled eggs in a skillet. The ranch potatoes were crisp and flavorful. I just wish the hash was a bit crispier. Since the hash was made with a mixture of potatoes, the texture remained soft and did not create any contrast with the scrambled eggs. It had good flavor though.   Lastly, the customer service is top notch. All the waitresses were happy to help and near the end of brunch, the owner/manager came over just to chit chat, which I appreciated.

RhsrUpQK1_nPaDkZ02fZqw.text: Found this great breakfast diner. I had the Country Benny. It's like Biscuits and Gravy on Steroids. Layered biscuits, sausage patties, eggs to your liking smothered in sausage gravy. Served with their great Ranch Potatoes. It's a killer meal. Try it out for yourself. You won't be disappointed.

IOpjUl4rPrhM-FKhwqVElA.text: Stopped in on a Sunday morning after reading the other reviews on Yelp. I was not disappointed! As a vegetarian, I had Kay's special which was delicious, and our waitress Karla was delightful!

nrJvO1GQbJZ2Vj6dN007FA.text: This place is fantastic! The food is great and the servers are incredible. Specifically, our server Karla was bright, cheery and spunky. We will definitely come back the next time were in town!

oiPqqM7pf5oNF16GN65nVg.text: This place is amazing for breakfast. We went on a Sunday morning and the line was out the door. Only waited 15 minutes though and we were whisked right in to enjoy a big breakfast. Crazy enough as it is to say, i had eggs benedict for the first time and it was super delicious. It always looked so gross to me cause i thought it was pretty much mayo on top but the waitress was really cool and brought me a sample of the hollandaise sauce to make sure i would like it before i ordered. The service was very good and the waitresses were perfectly attentive. The home fries were awesome that come on the side and breakfast that sunday was all i had hoped and more.

EySr--Ks7N_xfTvK1sgN6Q.text: Great place to eat breakfast or lunch!  Everything is fresh and tasty. Staff is friendly and attentive, especially Carolina. She was extremely friendly, helpful, and very pleasant.

MHU1olJuPfZWEzN9J9Qv8Q.text: Everything is AWESOME. Large portion and great taste. The chicken skillet is DELICIOUS! If you like chicken and eggs, pls do yourself a favor. The muffin is amazing too!! They also have this "Help us help you" sign on the table which is a great idea.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HEGWK24xkP5JT00plpMq1g.text: Great portions delicious flavors great prices!!! What more can you really ask for for breakfast. I may tone my 5 star down a bit but Manuela our server was off the charts and put me over the top. We had a large group and everything came out as ordered and everyone was happy with their meal.  Not that this place needs another review but to share, I had the veggie Bene and was very happy. Now here is where it gets interesting...because I'm on a strict diet, I had one blueberry and one apple pancake (usually I have 3) I would say I was not blown away but happy I could try both.   The wife has the Mexican omelet and OMG it was sensational. I would highly recommend it! There is usually a wait so call ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilli fries
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Bene with the blueberry pancake and apple pancake

KfoiZaOxea19Pf_SxsOraQ.text: Eggstreamly Great Service!!!  Best breakfast place around. Great service, great food.  Portions are filling, and it tastes amazing. There's no doubt about it that I will keep coming back.

6AAdigs9BumZsRfISFGzJg.text: Open only till lunch , different kinds of egg menu to check .. pancakes are available also ... Very busy so be patient , it's wortha try .

cgNaELm9LSrtLrqGrLeSGg.text: The portions are great at this place!  It didn't take long for us to get seated even though it was pretty busy and we were a large party. I would definitely recommend the country fried steak skillet.  The booth seats were a bit uncomfortable considering how low they are compared to the chairs.  The servers were very friendly. I would return to this location.

DG_MLnv0C3R8hiyBZkZGbQ.text: Several people we talked to in Vegas recommended Egg & I, so we had to try it out. My wife and I both really liked the atmosphere. It was busy but they kept things moving. If you need anything, you can flip a cardboard egg on your table from black to yellow, and someone comes within minutes to see what you need. That, plus everyone gets a table-side carafe of coffee, were huge pluses.   Unfortunately the pluses didn't completely overshadow the fact that our waitress messed up both our orders. My wife's veggie omelet, hold the onions, was stuffed with onions. My Cali omelet, the special for the morning, for some reason and as egg whites. I didn't want to wait for another one, so I just ate it. It didn't have much flavor as a result. Nor did the cinnamon raisin toast my wife ordered. I guess just a disappointing breakfast all together.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For some reason this came as egg whites. Not much flavor.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie omelet.

T6l6K8R60z_NWMFoNJwWPQ.text: Found this gem when we were staying at a hotel close by. We came here for breakfast and the food and service was GREAT! We even came back the next morning to have breakfast there again! There are plenty of breakfast options for everyone and the portion is huge without expensive prices. The food feels like comfort food and you won't be disappointed. Both mornings we went and there was a lot of people waiting for tables, but the wait was 15-20mins both days. They have plenty of seating and the wait is worth it! Our waitress was extremely friendly and very attentive (Thank you Ce Ce!!). She wasn't serving our table the second morning, but she even came to our table to greet us and tell us she remembered us!  This will definitely be our breakfast spot in Vegas!!

_SBL4Pdw_3n7LozVOMo5Vw.text: We went here 2 times while we were in Vegas. The food was delicious and the service was amazing. The portions are also huge. We had the biscuits and gravy and some spicy chicken scrambled skillet thing. Sooo yummy and the other time we had a veggie Omlette.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RTEGkDEehsz3tAaiAw6FnA.text: Wasnt really impressed by the food. typical breakfast. didnt feel like it was nothing special. But i will admit those were the best banana nut muffins ive ever tasted!

R5KZKOYmcVc6dqg5ssg19g.text: wowowo hospitality is top notch. I waited 15 minutes before they texted me for a saturday brunch. If it's your first time there, they give you a free warm banana muffin. The portions are ridiculous and will def. get you full. I got whatever they recommended which was the Mexican omelette and my boyfriend got the chicken n gravy skillet. The chicken n gravy skillet was a little salty for me but my boyfriend enjoyed it. The coffee is $3 but they give you a big pitcher of coffee to enjoy. When you're done, you pay in the front.

U8hCGLPU5MOe6n2I5_Cw-A.text: Fantastic brunch. Worth driving to this place. Looked like other American restaurant but taste was different. And good sauce. I'll go back for sure.

b2WAq-cp0K2UF7N8eM62eA.text: Overrated? Probably. This place was honestly lukewarm in taste and service.  Considering the overbearing amount of 5 star reviews this place has, I'm not sure why my experience was so disappointing in comparison.   We ordered the banana nut muffin (free with a check in), the Classic, and the Works skillet. Two tables that were seated after us received their food before we did. We ended up waiting a really long time just for two entrees. But we brushed it off considering there could be many factors at play.  The Classic had three slices of bacon that resembled rubber. They were not crispy at all. I didn't like the seasoning of Hablo Diablo potatoes as I felt the seasoning was overbearingly strong. I felt like there was hardly any meat and a WHOLE lot of potatoes.   We drank all our water and tried to get our waitress's attention. After five minutes or so, I flipped the egg to yellow (meaning we would like attention). Our waitress glanced at our table and proceeded to walk away. Another waitress promptly flipped it back to black and asked what we needed. When I said we needed a refill she said okay and proceeded to chat with the table next to us. She never bothered to grab our waters. Finally, our waitress asked what it was that we needed earlier and finally got us water.   Also guess what? Never got the banana nut muffin.  Sorry, but there are way too many delicious breakfast eats like Babystacks Cafe or Black Bear Diner (with their huge portions) for me to ever come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

416MLHGCHJytOxyIHc7PFw.text: Looking for a good hearty breakfast while in town and found the right spot.   Our waitress Camille was really good and attentive.  It took her a little long to come take our food orders after our coffee, so she brought each of us a banana nut muffin for the wait.  Requested extra cream when ordering our coffee and she surprised us with a saucer of our favorite flavored creamers.  The food was delivered very timely and was very flavorful.  We had an assortment ordered at our table; breakfast scramble, meat omelet, croissant breakfast, and sausage biscuit & gravy breakfast.  Everything was delicious and 3 of us needed to go containers since it was so much food.

U5UQ7kV81sJ2M4_RpS-VUw.text: Incredible selection.  Anything you could want for breakfast, along with soups, salads, and sandwiches.  I tried the bacon maple cream French toast.  This French toast is served with candied walnuts and a kind of whipped cream cheese that was more maple than bacon.  I almost ordered a side of bacon -- next time I will.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Maple Cream French Toast

4cWBnF0cPjgdnklUymLx6g.text: Absolutely amazing! Everything we ordered we loved! Definitely coming back on our next trip to Vegas!! Highly recommend!

Bk_uksHKj9_7p8G9ABc4HQ.text: This is probably my favorite breakfast place to go. They're side dish potatoes are to die for, very flavorful and crispy. It's usually busy and there's a long line waiting, but it's definitely worth the wait. I like to order their omelette with mash potato inside and the Belgium waffles are yummy too! Banana muffins taste like heaven!!!!

rnCTivkQeO8XfeeGMq5kCg.text: Everything about this place is awesome! Amazing brunch, great caring staff and very good price.  Your Vegas trip taste different after this place ;)

1TGnSDCDhHHFVxA4Jwu85Q.text: First the lovely bit of joy known as the  "Banana Nut Muffin" graced me... then they brought out the fluffy eggs, perfect potato crunchiness and the absolutely unmatched Biscuits and Gravy.  Come. To. This. Place!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RmTtvZt0Ka6QDnnGYpRsfw.text: The Egg and I may look like just another run-down, strip mall diner from the outside, but when you step inside, you're greeted with a breakfast oasis in a sea of Vegas locals. This place has just about anything you could think of for hot breakfast, (except oatmeal) and some items you would never dream of.  The newspaper-style menu is a breakfast gazette of headlines - like carrot cake French toast, pork carnitas burritos, and just about every type of omelet and pancake you could ever imagine.  Liza was our fabulous hostess on our dining journey. This woman is the epitome of a multi-tasker, buzzing around and paying attention to every little detail, from the quality of our food to the assurance our glasses remained full... and even the fact that I was rubbing my arms and she instantly picked up that I was cold and turned the air conditioner up a few degrees, without me asking.  This woman is amazing at customer service!   All of our food came out together (for seven people) and it was all piping hot! We were never left unattended and were quite entertained at how Liza perfectly orchestrated her tables (including our own).  Some of the dishes at our table included: * Stuffed French toast - like a deconstructed monte cristo with bacon; delicious! * Vegetarian crepe - filled with veggie goodness.; so fresh and so clean-clean. * The Classic - hot scrambled eggs, toast and ham - American style. * Pork carnitas burrito - mexitastic pork in a verde sauce wrapped in a soft flour tortilla; to die for. * Egg whites and short stack of buckwheat pancakes - both cooked with no oil...  I was trying to watch my caloric intake, and The Egg and I was happy to accommodate me.  It's a bit of a drive from the strip, but so worth it! Bring your clan and ask for Liza!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Store front

vRTLlF9-Eq1VBXDm-lOEgA.text: Defiantly a disappointment, you might as well go to Denny's. Everything is so generic, the potatoes are obviously frozen as they are pre seasoned with high sodium junk!! Don't waste your time!! Please, it's terrible!!!!

XARZq8my1cY-jiwh_J-Kpg.text: First time eating here and I must say I was very impressed with the service and our server Patrick was very nice and attentive.Knowing that it was our first time there he recommended some breakfast items which is alway a plus in my book.Oh and did I mention the portions are huge perfect for a couple to split.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The classic as you can see huge portion couldn&#39;t finish all the potatoes

ly0zOiMX0sRT2CVZ4bed3g.text: I love places like this that specialize in breakfast, so I was especially happy that the lady found out about and suggested (The) Egg & I on our second morning in Vegas.  Got there about 9:00 a.m. on a Tuesday, and although the place was busy, it wasn't packed, so there was no wait for a table.  Started with coffee which was surprisingly good - very mellow with a good flavor.  I even thought about asking what kind of coffee they use, but unfortunately forgot.  I ordered my favorite - corned beef hash and eggs, while the lady ordered country fried steak.  CBH was in a soft patty form.  The corned beef was of the finely-shredded variety probably from a can, so don't expect chunks from a brisket they brined and carved themselves.  I'm not complaining - the stuff was tasty.  The two eggs on top were done a nice over easy.  I wasn't a fan of their Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes, which tasted okay, but were a little too loose for me - like if you tried to scoop them with your fork instead of stabbing them, they would just fall off.  I like hash browns, home fries, etc. that stick together a bit so you can put them on the same bite as the CBH/egg/omelette/etc.  I can't believe it's just me.  Right?  The lady's country fried steak was tender and tasty.  Not out of this world, but certainly better than you'd get at an IHOP.  While I had wheat toast, she chose the banana muffin, which was great - just filling, so with the good portions of the rest of out breakfasts, we couldn't finish it.  Service was friendly, and the prices were reasonable.  I'd definitely come back.

mjgeJqbzOTKoB9dVw9Fu_g.text: I went there today around 11:30am, this was my 2nd time here, had a great experience last time so I had to come back again for some more great food!!  It was pretty packed inside so u can tell this place does a good job satisfying the customers, one of the waitress was able to seat me right away since I was by myself.  I was gonna order the stuffed French toast AND their Ultimate Skillets but the friendly waitress said she could do half portion of each since she said their portions are pretty big, so I agreed and ordered half n half.   The food came and they look amazing!! The skillet was delicious, their potatoes were very flavorful, the stuffed French toast with eggs and syrup was yummy. Maybe I was just hungry, I felt like I could handle the full portion of BOTH next time. My waitress was really friendly, always have the smile on her face. Would definitly be back next time when I m in town.   Want to buy their groovy t shirt but they don't have size Large. Maybe next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half portion of their Ultimate Skillet. They will do half portion if u request them.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast with eggs.

jcjMWjUaXPjL6FcZLD6-3g.text: Very good restaurant. Superb service - make sure you don't miss their muffins - one of the best muffins I ever ate in my life!

mCNdXhHe45HikHNSUtLf5g.text: This restaurant is a great place to grab breakfast. The food is excellent.  But the banana-nut muffins are really the ones to talk about. They're delicious! To me, the thing that makes this restaurant so good are the banana-nut muffins. The food is great, big portions, great potatoes on the side, it's a nice place: but the banana-nut muffins are what makes this restaurant one of my top favorites. Honestly, I'd love to go back there again, just for the muffins.  All in all, this place is amazing! The food was great and there wasn't even a wait. Next time I come back to Vegas, I'm sure I will come back.  Oh, and did I mention that the banana-nut muffins are phenomenal?

62w82UmZRqnuEPKcDhYPmQ.text: This is the 2nd time I've eaten here. The food was incredible and our server was wonderful

9Fp4EpOJ4vPRwdPBAFfrLQ.text: Holy cow I love this place. Amazing food, everything was so fresh and delicious and flavorful. The service is also very friendly and prompt. It's really hard to find a place with great food, great service and great prices. We were on vacation in Las Vegas and ate here 2 days in a row. I have never eaten at the same restaurant two days in a row. I only wish this restaurant we're closer to my house as I would be eating here every week.  I am on a low-carb low-sugar diet. But I broke my diet to have their maple bacon French toast, twice!! It is so delicious it is better than a desert. We also ordered the chicken fried steak and chorizo scramble. Everything was delicious. We ordered their potatoes one morning and their fresh fruit the other. Their fresh fruit is wonderfully cut up slices of watermelon and pineapple and other melons. Not the yucky, cheap, cut up fruit that's been sitting there for days. Their breakfast potatoes are all so delicious. The best way we can describe them is they are  very seasoned bite-size french fries. sooooo goood! I guess it's a blessing in disguise The Egg & I is located in Las Vegas and we live in San Diego. I would definitely be gaining weight if this place were closer. Can't wait to go back to eat here. It's a couple miles from the strip that you will definitely enjoy your meal and save money.

djhLZPX7jdSvTM-5dZFQCQ.text: The staff is very friendly and attentive. There was a nice variety of food and the portions were large. The banana nut muffins are quite delicious and I would recommend them. I ordered the original breakfast burrito and it was pretty good. The salsa that came with it was soooooo good. The potatoes that came with the burrito had good flavor, though they were slightly to salty. Despite the wait, I would recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cS2wuc07EDgYepnQBdRZOw.text: I really feel the last few times I have gone I have waited for slow service and not so great food.  Sorry not interested in the hype.

T0fSTz56O1uSUXR0ANNHJw.text: Very good food. Well worth the drive off the strip. Very big portions. Our server Karla was absolutely wonderful. I wanted everything on the menu. Come early or plan to wait for a table.  The banana muffin that comes with a lot of the meals was amazing!  If it doesn't come with it you should order one. It's warm and moist and perfect.  I got the Santa Cruz bfast burrito. So delicious. The sauce on to was perfect. My wife got the veggie works eggs Benedict. It too was good. There are just so many good options on the menu that it's hard to choose. I would definitely get the burrito again.

W8Xll9dwlLF-ywZ6Z_phDA.text: The food was very nice,  nothing out of the ordinary but huge portions and good. However, the lines were long. We only waited 10 minutes though.    What I did not get was why they did not seat more People outside as there were hardly anyone sitting there..

sIbk2YshipSAbhmjMtNnVA.text: Pretty good place, very busy even on a Wednesday morning, but we were able to get a table within 5 mins.  Veggie skillet was pretty good. You can get half portions which was perfect size for 1 person.  Banana pancake was okay, I'd rather have the banana slices on top instead of smashed into the batter.  You get a Banana nut Muffin with the free check in, but I wasn't a fan of it.  Customer service was a bit slow and forgetful, we had to remind her of a few things more than once.

AI0DrahpJ1Mxa6ikvLqwrg.text: Awesome food. Great potatoes and banana muffins. They are owned by egg works. Different name but same quality of food.

tRaS0MxbXJnODyMA4ibQJg.text: One of the best breakfast places I've been to. The customer service is absolutely fantastic! We had 3 different people helping us throughout our meal and they were all very quick, happy, and extremely nice.   I ordered the Works Veggie Benny which is easily the best eggs benedict that I've had! The portions were huge too! The potatoes are amazing and they even sell the seasonings inside the restaurant, so stock up!   The place is pet friendly on the patio and they have a list of rules to follow so that you, your pet, and the other customers can have an enjoyable meal.   Also, take advantage of the check-in offer!
