Since we were so full, we took our muffins to-go, but don't doubt that they'll stay in their boxes for long!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Works Veggie Benny!

UBv5BvDexuDOiP9D8aalNg.text: Came back again hoping for 4 stars on a Saturday morning but the service ..  how do i put this nicely - it sucked. Our waitress wasn't very attentive. We were seated right away since our party of 5 decided we would sit outside to avoid the wait (TIP!!!!) It was nice for a while until it started getting humid and nasty but we stuck it through.  We had the Eggceptional Omelette (3 stars), Bacon Avocado & Egg (4 stars) - these flavors ALWAYS mesh well together!, The chicken fried steak skillet (5 stars) and the cinnamon raisin french toast (2 stars).  A tip: stay away from the cinnamon raisin french toast. Couldn't taste the cinnamon in it at all and it was kind of soggy. Not the heavenly experience in your mouth you get when you think of french toast ... mmmm. BUT get the chicken fried steak skillet!!! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT. Scrambled eggs on top. So yummy.  And of course, the banana nut muffin is still my favorite of all time here!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken fried steak omelette - YUMMM!!!!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cinnamon raisin french toast &amp; egg-ceptional omelette

C5dhJ8---3l3rTqsPxhX4g.text: This place is great. There were so many people waiting when we arrived but they seated everyone really quickly and we didn't end up waiting more than 15 minutes plus they made it really easy by sending a text when our table was ready. Excellent staff, delicious muffins to tide you over while you wait for your food and everything was tasty

Ex4Ww7CsEt5TlBya_y3TPA.text: Had the prime rib Benedict with the seasoned potatoes and their homemade banana nut muffin.  The service was very quick, and we had our amazing vanilla cappuccinos within minutes of ordering. Definitely coming back

BPEo2ebdm4-Q09MKnemGAQ.text: Great service, big portions, and tasty food. I would definitely come back for breakfast.

Q5mLaXAcr8BhtAJA80jFMQ.text: The best breakfast I've had in a REALLY long time. Everything me and my sister ordered was fantastic! I highly recommend the banana nut muffin by the way! Sooo so so good. Highly, highly, HIGHLY recommended!!!

2j5Kt36SzOhl6p6LVlTrJA.text: My husband and I were looking for a more hometown atmosphere and GOOD food...we found it. Yummy food, the Mexican Omelet was, Muy Sabroso, banana muffin was the BEST, but as CHANCE would have it, she was delightful, beautiful and over all we gave her an A+..... we will be back for MORE!

lB0fajlOwXxWM16CTP_5mg.text: The hype doesn't lie. We were in town for a couple of days and wanted to find a great brunch place. We debated between this place and Hash House A Go Go. I am so glad we came here. Our server, Liza, was top notch and gave us great recommendations and service. We ordered The Classic and Texas French Toast works. The Classic blew me away. The Classic is just potatoes, eggs and your choice of meat. I got the links with it and they were amazing. So simple but bursting with flavor! The free banana nut muffin at check in is probably the most moist, gooey and orgasmic muffin I ever had. Please don't forget to order that to try. Overall, a wonderful and unbeatable brunch experience away from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The classic and Texas french toast works. Banana nut muffin goodness.

EOcNoS3cYkPS-sTyJ239EQ.text: Very good breakfast food. Waitress was very friendly and the food came out quick and hot. I had the bacon and avocado omelette which was great but the best part was that banana nut muffin to go which I ate later in the day and was still melt in your mouth good!

yMIjC9un8fNw1hlG5bUNaQ.text: Really disappointing. Had great reviews on Yelp so I drove here. I had a skillet which was cold and the potatoes were horrible. It gets one extra star because the serving staff were were very good

I4Uo3QjN11kRYP6Bo_6P1A.text: Have no idea what people are talking about or hit it on an extremely awesome day. Disappointing. Ordered the huevos rancheros which was basically chili slopped on a tortilla.

vepozCrGPyek96GZ5tuHJQ.text: The Strawberry Cream Cheese French Toast was SUPER delicious! Also, their breakfast potatoes are really good because of the seasoning. I recommend those two items.

HN8YBaLlWkOzilIGdX-AvA.text: First of all, thanks for the reviews on the stuffed French toast guys, best breakfast decision ever. The biscuits and gravy are delicious also. Secondly, my server, Amanda, was seriously so sweet! She checked on me and made sure I had everything I needed. She had a full section and she was so nice to every single guest. I will absolutely come back again, and again. Thanks for the awesome service, and kick ass breakfast guys!

zcdVHFbrs3jHLz4PXHDVxA.text: This was my second time here and my girlfriend's first. Amanda was our server and she was prompt as well as very helpful. I ordered the chile rellenos omelette and my girlfriend got the country fried steak. The food was absolutely delicious and my girlfriend is excited to come back on our next vegas trip.

79ZYA9L4Uz1r_lMsgusCGg.text: Delicious food in large portions! I got the Mexican omelet and my husband got the stuffed french toast. Both were very filling. Prices are extremely reasonable for the portion you get. Friendly staff also!

ow3-virG9xTEFLZZ0TNWbg.text: Food: We had the fender bender crepe and the strawberry cream french toast. Both were pretty good. I was not too into the bean sprouts in the crepe. We both thought the french toast was too sweet and started to wear on you haha.  Service: Our waitress was awesome. We got a seat outside but it was about 95 degrees outside. I asked if she could move us inside and she did without any issues, and it was pretty busy that day. After that she was all smiles and our coffee was consistently full.

xq61UhrpJKvCMCcPcxZuJQ.text: Wandered into this place for a late breakfast. Food was pretty descent.....i ordered country fried steak with scrambled eggs with cheese.....my server was Jessica.  She was polite and friendly. Im critiquing the food and food only. The country fried steak itself was delicious....well cooked, crispy and seasoned perfectly....the gravy was rich and creamy. The eggs were extremely overcooked and potatoes were ok......the spice on them were a little too overbearing for my liking. Overall flavors were good......steak was the standout.....eggs not exectued well and the price.....a couple dollars higher then id like it to be. Not a bad experience, but there are too many good places in Vegas

XjawnmhvHZxnnMubYp37MQ.text: Fantastic service from Thynara, the Brazilian waitress!  Amazingly delicious food, fast and friendly service.  I love her.  So far the best I've had to date!

RW1F2CfSZGCwMAvtHb6M7g.text: Fabulous place far from the strip's chaos. The works skillet I got was fabulous and the French toast stuffed with bacon and eggs was one of the most delicious breakfast items I have ever had. We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas

kJD-CWK-f1_vrzaNV0qPoQ.text: First timer and what can I say good quick service,friendly wait staff also thanks to Karla for a great experience definitely coming back

-BjIAvOeoCTIfeUmuHd1eA.text: The potatoes are the bomb.com. I love the little eggs on your table that notify the servers if you need anything. I wish it was open all day. I would eat it for dinner if I could. Definitely one of my favorites .

8To4oqyfLwRHqnGLmIjnxw.text: Our server was Tabatha.  She was super friendly and helpful with our order.  The food was great!  We highly recommend this place to Vegas visitors.

4CXx8wj1c74qdXWE4ER1UA.text: I write this review with a very heavy heart. I absolutely love the food here. This used to be my local breakfast spot every time I came to Vegas. Unfortunately I will not be coming back here anymore. I was dining at the restaurant with a friend a month ago. When two white women came into the restaurant and were seated in the table next to us.  They were having a very loud and expletive filled conversation which included the use of the N word several times. People at other tables could hear them too and were just as disgusted as I was. My asked the waitress could she speak to the manager about these 2 women. I thought she would ask the two women to leave considering they had not even placed their orders yet and where disturbing the other patrons. He just looked at me smiled and said do you need anything else. No thank you there are plenty of other breakfast places in Vegas.

o-IA1tl481IbFvsTX1HaqQ.text: Had to wait 15 minutes or so to get in but definitely worth the wait. The food was really good and our waiter (Perry) was excellent. If we go back to Vegas we will visit again

jDmDCJSgm8Eiys4QmfQ-kA.text: My favorite go to breakfast spot in Las Vegas, great food and service! I love the variety of the menu and you can even get a Bloody Mary!

bw1FH5sUWmLCf9x0EGlA7w.text: This is a very homey restaurant, and this is what I imagined a southern hospitality restaurant would look and feel like.  The restaurant is huge! The service is really good, the  food itself is okay, I think is very typical of brunch food, nothing really stood out to me. In addition, I don't like too much egg for breakfast.  The egg benedict that everyone raves about is just okay for because I don't like that they put the crossiant under the bed of egg and cubed rib eye because it made it extremely soggy. Remember to check in for your FREE banana nut muffin

fQEJl3beJbI3B8uMtL8ZXQ.text: This place was recommended from a friend for cheap eats (seeing how Vegas likes to charge you an arm and leg at buffets). We came here for brunch after getting our asses drunk AF the previous morning. #HangoverFTW. It was 100+ degrees come 10:30am and we were waiting outside to be seated, luckily we didn't wait that long and managed to snag a seat at their patio (thank goodness their misters were on). The staff was amazing in accommodating our large party outside and they rocked taking all our orders and getting them out in a timely manner.  I ordered their fresh vegetable (vegetarian) omelette with egg whites sans cheese with a side of potatoes. The omelette was pretty good, although nothing terribly mind-blowing and it came with spinach and mushrooms. The house potatoes were not my favorite, but still eatable. It had way too much seasoning making it very salty.  The food was decent overall, would like to come and try their scrambles the next time I'm in Vegas. :) Can't go wrong with affordable mom and pop restaurants off the Strip.

ySdt2N_3xMpP8r5rnb30uA.text: Lacey gets 5 stars for customer service. Friendly and checked up on us frequently. Food was good not great. Banana muffin was good but not the best I've had. Portuguese sausage n eggs were good. Potatoes were ok. I prefer the fresh grated potato hash browns. Probably won't be back. But Lacey, keep up the awesome customer service!

Fi73BYDuWgLQg05HZFaTAw.text: This was our 1st time here. Wanted breakfast for lunch. Everyone was friendly! We were greeted with a smile! We had great service throughout our meal! The food was delicious! I couldn't stop eating the potatoes with the seasoning....yummmm. And the fresh banana muffin was soooo soft! Highly recommend this spot!

LLa--jZPQ7dPuOQul9PI3g.text: Delicious homemade food and fantastic service! Highly recommend the skillet and chicken fried steak. Leilani was courteous and attentive. Definitely coming back!!

CA1st3A9Xbhj1uniQi2boA.text: First time coming to Eggs and I. The food was delicious and the service was great. Thank you Tamara for the great service.  Would recommend this place to anyone visiting the area.

zQ_O8Dm97W4KLMmyYIne6A.text: Grandma's biscuit n gravy with eggs and bacon and a side of green chili hash!   Yes!   Thanks Karla for help with the menu.   So many choices it is hard to decide what you want.  All looks sooooo good!  Ty!

IcjeRRvQ_JsbncIMCjSM7w.text: This place is by far my favorite breakfast place in all of Las Vegas. Their omelettes are excellent and their Banana muffins are the best I've ever had ANYWHERE. I come to Vegas 8-10 a year and even if I don't have time to make it in for breakfast I'll call in a to go order of the muffins. 5 of 5 stars for sure!

YtHxr0CS1erUZSs1A2BjsA.text: Delicious food! Great service!  No better way to start off your day. I tried the Mexican Omelette and it was amazing! The banana nut muffins are out of this world.  I will definitely be going back soon !!

JCGcMUdWI9XVRofyM1Kmqw.text: My wife and I were looking for a good breakfast restaurant with more selection and better prices than the limited offering at our resort. We were very pleased with The Egg and I. We both ordered breakfast burritos with potatoes and they were delicious and more than we could eat. The prices were reasonable and certainly cheaper than the resort restaurant.   The menu was quite extensive with many options. Also must add that it is located a few miles off the Strip in a safe location in a small shopping center. The restaurant itself is nothing fancy, but if you're looking for delicious food served quickly at a reasonable price, look no further.

2LaXbg04i_o0kcy33Dnwyg.text: This place is amazing! It may not be on the strip but it is totally worth the trip here. I had the original breakfast burrito with the potatoes and it was soooooo good. Everyone at my table throughly enjoyed their food as well. If you're here on a trip to Vegas, you need to come here. You will NOT be disappointed! And Paula our server was great! We will definitely be coming back here again before our trip is over.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Breakfast Burrito

Q1Py7iND6i_SnWXBO0z8Hw.text: Large portions, excellent variety and prices. Karla was an excellent host. Must try this restaurant at least once. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aPhgUnCxT23zTM8wNkytng.text: Breakfast is always very good. Today I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Wrap and it was amazing! Their side fruit is so fresh and delicious. Highly recommend this place!

x6Hus0XH7TvhNxKUVmjbnA.text: Great place to have breakfast. Few minutes from the strip but they take care of you well. Corn beef hash great but mushy. All food was amazing. Serves breakfast until 3pm. Busy but well worth it!

0TTDp9bGiI-s8g7yVBuupw.text: Before everything else, I would like to give five stars to our server. My mom and I were at the restaurant in the morning of Sept 27th. According to the receipt, the server's name is Card, not sure if that's right...She was pregnant and had some tattoos. Very helpful and attentive, especially considering she was carrying a baby around too!  Back to the food, best traditional brunch place I have been in the States. We tried the banana muffin, spinach/avocado/veg omelet, gravy biscuits, pork, and sausage. Excuse me that I don't remember the exact name for the plates. Everything was good, so feel free to order anything that interests you on the menu. But make sure to pay attention to how much you order; the portion is very generous here.

9rlc-gYpx3j-HWqlMKx7ug.text: Wow. Best breakfast in Vegas, hands down. Everything is a winner here, but I am a particular fan of the skillets and the Sunrise Mountain breakfast sandwich. Cincinnati transplants - if you're looking for delicious Cincy Chili, Egg & I is for you. Going to the Egg & I is the highlight of any weekend.  I would like to give a shout out to the amazing server Amanda. Last time I was at Egg & I, I ordered the delicious Cincinnati Chili skillet. My fiance mentioned that I grew up in Cincinnati, and Amanda made sure I got extra chili. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cincy Chili Skillet and the Island Favorite

OQshOJje-9pWSzClafy3iQ.text: Not bad at all. Good portion. Customer service is a little lacking but food portions are good.

Wk1sr2f3kbK2gJedDGwXXw.text: This place is a hidden Vegas gem...pretty sure all the locals know about it, but this place was brought to my attention from my friend..after a long and drunk night out...this is the perfect place to come to drench your hangover lol....the food was so fresh so delicious...and I even ordered freshly squeezed OJ...omg so freaking good...really recommend this place if ever in Sin City! lol

VXUrSRY4NN2mG7fNLlaAIA.text: This place is ALWAYS busy so be prepared for a wait, but it's incredibly worth it. Huge portions and great prices!

_lHWwwcutVglt91-9EbIog.text: If you're in Vegas, you must go here for breakfast!! Everything is good; from the Hablo Diablo potatoes to the French Toast!  But especially the service!  Karla was EGGSallent!! She was friendly and fast and amazing!! We will definitely be back!!

k-k43EI4h3RTe1lSxuMM1A.text: We are from CA and found this place based on YELP responses. We visit this restaurant every time we come to Vegas. Service and food were both great (once again). My aunt and I shared the huevos rancheros while my mom had turkey bacon and eggs. Kudos to Amanda, our waitress for exceptional friendly service and with a smile. Great place to have breakfast.

0CyETbcn0xpjidMtptiNFg.text: It was our first time and we were impressed from the time we walked in, ordered our food and left the premises. We were greeted and seated right away. Sasha our waitress was fabulous. She recommended the ultimate skillet which was delicious. Steak and eggs was great too. You have to try the banana muffin, it is to die for. You can purchase a loaf to go. Fresh squeezed O.J. & their coffee was tasteful and yummy too. This is by far the best breakfast place to go to in Las Vegas. We will definitely go back next time. Great food and great customer service!!! Thx Sasha and The Egg and I staff. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs , pix came out a little dark, but don&#39;t be fooled , delicious :)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate skillet - delicious, ask Sasha for the details

iyX8e-1e0_eX9AXQ3Pfc1g.text: A couple of weeks ago, I made my way back to our semi annual trade show. I got the little free booklet you get from taking shuttle from airport. I flipped through and saw this place called Egg & I and their other location Egg Works. It looked interesting and the reviews sounded good plus had coupon for one meal free with purchase of another meal. Cool..I will take my co-workers there. Big mistake! They know best known for banana nut muffin served warm with butter but it had this weird taste as if they used artificial sweetener or perhaps the blend wasn't right because it tasted like metal or whatever it just tasted awful. It was nice to give all 6 of us free banana nut muffin but my guys wouldn't touch it!   I ordered classic eggs Benedict, my fav breakfast choice. I was excited plus the potatoes versus hash browns. The potatoes had too much of that lawry seasoning...ugh. Then worse, my hollandaise sauce was the worst thing I have ever had! They didn't properly make the sauce and then to make it worse, the whole dish was slathered in it! I literally used a spoon to scoop out the sauce just so I could eat everything else which wasn't much better but I needed to eat. Would never come back even if I was paid to do so plus I read other reviews where this place was actually busy and needed to go early, well we were there Saturday morning around 8am and it was not busy at all!

LoVZ3Hu-I7QOb5jgbO-g5w.text: Great food, recommending the Benny! Only minus is the orange Juice "fresh" is not Tropicana... Will definitely come back!  Thanks Reina for great service!

icBYorM1ZexrcdjdB3dmKw.text: I think it's hard to find a breakfast place that truly stands out, at least a cheap one. This breakfast place, I will remember and even recommend.  I had the banana bread French toast AND it was pretty damn good. Mind you that there were sooooooo many things on the menu I wanted to try.  The other people in my "party" had the:  biscuits and gravy - "this is legit" was the comment from the southern gal Cinnamon raisin French toast - "mmm, this is good" Seasoned potatoes - I kept eating it off my friend's plate.   I actually don't remember what my dad got but he didn't say "junk" so that is a good thing.  Good service. Eh coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You feel like you&#39;re at home with your favorite coffee mug

qGYU6YQeBWsHq-Svg9xSog.text: Great service! I didnt like the waffle and the wattress took it off my check. The seasoned potatoes is a must have!

8jCRSOl3xUT5R3gTRhxO9Q.text: I just love social media! Well after my review the manager Katy contacted me and told me she had my cousin's purse holder. She claim she didn't have my contact info I had left with the employee I spoke with. Since then that employee has been delt with. I'm happy that she reached out to me. I passed on the info to my cousin and she apologized for the whole incident......I'm grateful to say she sent my cousin her purse holder. She said she could tell it was valuable and put it in a safe. She was a woman of her word and I thank her. I glad of the turn out, because the food was good and I would love to dine there again.  Now I will dine there and spread the word. Next time I'm there I would like to meet her and thank her personally. There are some good people in the world.

qv9249DPkghKmXQoH3PnJA.text: My omelet was so good! Make sure to try the hash brown potatoes the seasoning is bomb! Me and my husband found our new favorite breakfast place in Vegas. Our server Patrick was awesome! Thanks for the great service!

drkrCK84UGps9F_AufJkag.text: I came here for the first time with my girlfriend. I ordered the traditional Benny (eggs Benedict) and wow. This place is great! Besides the long wait time ( which was worth it) our servers name was Reina and she was great. If u need anything u just flip the little egg guy on your table and they're there to help you! Great food, great staff. Definitely coming back!

JUCT4x03o31GFk3I2xaffg.text: Great place to have some breakfast!  Banana nut muffins are delicious and service is prompt, courteous and friendly.  We had Oscar as our waiter and he was great to provide recommendations and was super friendly!  A must stop on our next trip back!

8jd48ewQvDil3ooNWfMYYQ.text: I love this place although it was my first time here my friends and I usually go to egg works but it is related and closer to strip so we came here. I had classic breakfast with hash browns that look like McDonald's  hashbrowns they are so good . Wait time runs about 30 min but it's worth it as it goes by pretty fast. I love how they serve the mimosas with its own champagne bottle and juice . Overall our server and food was great. Thank you Liliana for making our experience pleasurable.

3tm298hRfTX-k_BZtlqHVA.text: Service was great. Be prepared for huge portions and an equally robust menu.  We are from Cincinnati so imagine our surprise when we saw Cincinnati chili on the menu. The waitress was kind enough to bring us a sample (it's spicier than skyline) but quite tasty.  The chocolate chip muffins were divine.

8euk-0ZLk-8bnvN7ygozpg.text: Best breakfast spot in town.  You can taste the quality in the food no matter what you order, and the service is never lacking.

3jACcHj8wfBpNkyyUN5u5Q.text: This place is egg-cellent if you are looking for an egg-traordinary breakfast that deals with eggs. Even though I am not much of an egg eater, I found it to have a nice balance between the sides and the main egg dish. A little crowded but hey, if you love eggs then try this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My breakfast I had at the Egg and I.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some &#34;egg&#34; work.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Egg and I menu.

5Tj4a9QIKa59IG6hx8fsDg.text: I love the Egg and I. This is my families favorite breakfast spot. I love the Chile Rellenos Omelette and  my husband always orders the Loco Moco. The ranch potatos are so delicious. We've had the skillets with eggs and meat. Pretty much anything you order from here is going to taste good.   Our server Breeanndra was very nice. She was fast and friendly. Anytime we needed something she was right there ready to help. I love this place it gets PACKED on the weekends in the morning rush so make sure to bring a book or magazine while you wait. Its worth it!

25mTQsxWRkdEkHkvRlinag.text: Ate here unfortunately I chew into a plastic material on my eggs, brought it to my server Alexis attention and also involve the manager. They offered another entree but I declined as I kind of kost my appetite. They gave me a whole banana cake too for the incident. Very nice and generous.

5QuG_4LuHH7OwEz4dn1nBg.text: While on vacation in August 2015, we visited the Egg and I based on Yelp reviews.  So glad we came here!  The menu was extensive with so many choices, all sounding so delish. I had a skillet type breakfast with hash brown type potatoes and pancakes.  Pancakes were big and fluffy, skillet was huge and delicious.  Come here with a big appetite!  You'll be glad you did!

-JoBs0Dc1miGHMUjlCRiMA.text: I called to place a to go order. I took 5 phone calls to finally get someone to take my order. I was transferred to another phone that would ring for over 5 minutes without anyone picking it up. I was transferred over and over even when I would ask not to be put on hold. Very frustrating experience

LMHpb40NKJZ68CyvTY500w.text: Tired of the Strip and hotel fare, we checked Yelp for a breakfast place nearby.  We found great reviews for Egg and I so thought we would give it a try.  We loved it.  It was easy to find and the staff was very welcoming and friendly.  Very professional and efficient. The restaurant was very clean and well cared for.  The food choices were all very tempting and our server, Karla, was very helpful, even recommending an egg breakfast for my husband that included everything he wanted for a better price than what he was going to order.  I had the Southwestern Cobb salad and it was delicious....very fresh and the chicken was hot off the grill! The banana muffin that came with my salad was yummy.  Lots of variety on the menu....but since I am not an egg lover I was glad there were plenty of choices that didn't focus on eggs.  We would highly recommend this place and will definitely come again on our next visit to Vegas.  Karla is the kind of server you love to have...she's friendly, efficient, knows the menu, is really helpful and gives you the perfect amount of attention while dining. Great start to our day all around!

MCNE6kNbtWOF_IiZkOGlNQ.text: Ate here while in LV on business and was blown away. Had time in the morning, so decided to get off the strip, and found this gem. Got the Mexican Eggs Benedict, and it couldn't have been any better. And their potatoes are the best I have ever had.  I wish this place was in Indy!!

7O_xYRWZOdiRdNd0iHNV3A.text: Great brunch, and clearly a locals place. Very friendly service--our waiter gave us free banana muffins because we were first-timers. I got the fiesta skillet with eggs over-easy--terrific, but next time I'd ask for much less cheese. Definitely worth the trip if you're sick of casino food.

zBQm8j-yOW74PFyuOvA4qA.text: You can usually find md here on Sundays. Great food at a decent price. The only thing I would say to the owners and chefs is PLEASE lighten up on that super salty seasoning that you put on the fried potatoes. I definitely suggest this place to anyone who lives near here. I always leave stuffed.

ckxJy5PU0H70cpDlk4mBwg.text: Large portions [especially the "work potatoes"]. We were told ten minute wait and it was about right [Sunday mid-morning].  If you put you name in, ask to see the menu - it is extensive. The eggs are offered up to four (4) per plate, so you'll not go hungry.  Service is about what you'd expect from a busy place.  Can't go higher on the stars for what amounts to a large plate more than half covered with potatoes, and the eggs fixed as you usually get eggs in a restaurant.

hd2LDlXhXdoO8MHJZAGuaA.text: yuck! food was not worth the good service

cdGSS-QlFeIV2RW8_3s4cA.text: Went to Vegas and a cousin Yelped this place, which pulled it up first on her phone. The wait was not long, food was delicious and portions are big. The seasoned potatoes that accomodate the breakfast plates have a nce seasoning to it, and tasty. The banana nut muffin bread was so moist and warm, and we shared it w/everyone at the table just to get a bite; don't be fooled because it might look flat and plain in color!! The Egg Benedict was worth it, because it was the first time I've ever tried it at any restaurant. The waitress are attentive, and helpful. A very packed house, even on a Thursday morning for brunch.

ZdOUr1gNCdHNhCnynVvt-A.text: I just had to add in a 5 star review for this place.  AMAZING food here!  Waaay to much on the plate to eat at once, but wow, your going to get some fresh well made yummy food here. A+

tRfWolSkdfN3FWujU21QiA.text: Our party of 6 only waited about 5-10 minutes before being seated at around 11am.  Service is quick and friendly.  Between Hash House and Egg & I, I'm leaning more towards Egg & I now because the service was more friendly and accommodating while the wait was significantly shorter.  Of course in Vegas you'd think there'd be something special about the eggs... like a dinosaur-size egg over easy... but in the end the eggs are pretty standard eggs... nuttin' too special.  If you mess up eggs, you've got no business serving food.  My 5 stars are for the hash!  Something about that homemade beef hash makes it stand out over all others.

dnk_v4UdXJYTsHJI4UfN4A.text: This quickly became my favorite go to breakfast/brunch spot on my way out of las Vegas. The kays special, banana nut muffin, and the coffee are all fantastic. The waitress tells me the skillets are where its at as well.

FitcOINijx5bi_4vVvb7Ow.text: I had a great dining experience at Egg & I. The server was quite friendly and attentive. This is a great place to have breakfast at an affordable price. I had the vegetarian skillet and added some bacon (I know...crazy). The dish was quite tasty. And it's True what everyone says about the banana muffins. They are to die for!!

LmLsNJhI_aRSSO7a7tkHUA.text: Really good food, super fast service!

MqMufip4Z3YV3GZhWqxvcg.text: Ate here about 2 weeks ago. The name caught my eye and I read a few reviews and decided to go for it.  The omlettes were just OK.. they say they are 4 egg omlettes, but they were on the small side.. looked like 3 egg omlettes.. the omlettes were frikkin caked in CHEESE.. I like cheese but it was too much! The coffee was ok.. they give you a carafe like IHOP. I like that.. you don't have to bug the waitstaff for refills. The potatoes were good.  I also ordered a short stack of pancakes. The pancakes were frikkin delicious and HUGE! I ate half of them..   I'd go back again but it will probably be a little while. I'd get the Pancakes again or try something else like French Toast or a Scramble.  I did leave this place full as if I was leaving a buffet.. ugh!

F6xWsdFg5zv8SEWcYai59Q.text: My husband I had heard of this place and we just had to try it. Very cute interior we went on a Tues afternoon so definitely missed the weekend breakfast rush. Let me tell you this place did not disappoint, food was amazing. I had the wonderful Kay's omelet that had tomato, spinach and feta it was so good. When we are in town again definitely gonna go back!!

sqQkzuL1UlYZyhYAYQhyMA.text: Aloha! Spam and eggs in Las Vegas! Very nice restaurant. Good food and service. Located very near to the strip.

6nshzHax8LW8KCY4PH6ymw.text: Stuffed French toast was great but house potatoes could be better (I prefer a hash potato with peppers and onions rather than a dusting of spices).  Service - thanks Jose - was quick even though the place remained jammed during our entire visit. My husband enjoyed his western burrito

3Dtq0jUD30bOt1gxfyxOKw.text: Nice brunch spot with solid skillets. Coffee is meh, but the food is really good, incl the banana nut muffins.

yDziTomVl90M6dKn7XK8nw.text: If you are looking for a good food and big portions this is the place to be. Don't forget to order the banana nut muffin, it's very good. Service is okay.

OjJiSwlsidZNeS_S6PNbyg.text: Tried this place for the first time this weekend. We had high hopes, but alas, salt did us in. Hub's scramble (prime rib) had some tough meat. My chicken fried steak was ok.  Here's the catch.  It was ALL salted so heavily that we couldn't finish anything.  The potatoes were coated with an orange, seasoned salt, the gravy could have easily floated a ship. My two scrambled eggs, which HAD to actually be four because they covered half the huge place, were browned and chewy. I ate the steak after scraping off the gravy. I've never eaten in a restaurant where the food was uniformly Over Salted. Since I have high blood pressure, this was extra-problematic for me.

xGnAWXWudpo0uPuQwauVEg.text: this place is great. i would give it five stars if they had a tofu scramble or some veggie options but i know vegas isn't big on their vegan.  the portions are enormous. no one in my group finished their food, and we all love to eat. the ranch potatoes are good but a touch salty after a while. the egg salad was very good, the seasonal pancakes were amazing... i had a chicken sandwich with onions and peppers and it was delicious.  the place itself is adorable; there are some really great pig-themed drawings in the lobby that i wish i had in my house! my favorite was "swine on harvest moon" closely seconded by "tammy faye bacon."   the service was great- they have a happy egg/sad egg table alert system so you can put up your egg to signal you need something. brilliant! and the menus were little newspapers, which is really fun.  totally going to remember this place and come back!!

8hNbBUemuByMgt1YMDm8Ag.text: The service was amazing and creative the in side was colorful and gave you a good mood and the food is amazing.

sgCCc8zaVSrtjcgLP_pYYw.text: This place is amazing!!!!  They have a huge menu which I love because know matter what you might be craving, they'll have something to satisfy you. I have been many times, tried many things (egg sandwiches, corn beef hash, pancakes, etc) and it is all good!!!!  I also love the banana nut muffin that comes with many of the dishes. It's huge and sooo goood. Feels like an extra dessert. You can save it for later.   Give this place a try.   Any of the locations will be good! I like this location because they have a big parking lot. Oh and I love the decorations/characters of the entire franchise. So cute!

zO2ZHK85tJVeBgAyFJs-lA.text: Chicken spinach  skillet is awesome.well seasoned  and cooked  to perfection.  My husband also enjoyed the seasoned  potatoes.  Wait time for table on a Friday morning 5 minutes. Great service. Definitely a hidden gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fHp6L-HDDWXN9pZtd0qmVQ.text: It was extremely busy when I visited but that's to be expected with how great their food was! Everything was cooked perfectly and my large table had every need met in a timely manner!

9067Ce6UqLmUsFSojcXTDQ.text: Delicious and worth the trip off the strip. I had the green chili hash, and I highly recommend it.

I0ShUDWLx8Nbk-UD758pog.text: Good place to have breakfast may be a little crowded but is worth it really delicious food

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N7ghezOcpywXh7k-gPcknQ.text: Great food, decent prices and not too far from the strip. The food is surprisingly a notch above most breakfast spots i have been to in vegas. We enjoyed their service who was constantly coming by to fill our coffee and check on us. Will definitely be coming back next time we are in town.

d3eFwdvpSYcIIbFT8IYRyQ.text: This place is normally on point with the service and food. Seated outside without knowing so I was too cold to really eat. The waitress was not effective on the ordering asked what kind of toast I wanted then never brought it. The food was ok wrong skillet so over all I give them 2.5 for today

vOeKZ4BSoQjHghU2yw8QTA.text: This place is dope. Great food for the price. Friendly stuff and nice loacations. i would come again one day and bring my friends.

kGD5KY4XAqIsgMX95qI-Qg.text: Love their breakfast and lunch!   Great prices.   They are always friendly.   We go there often.

gn_hZ74nUDQ7cWbebULlqw.text: Great place to eat breakfast. This place is always busy and crowded. But the food portions are large enough for 2 people. Always recommend coming to this go to spot for breakfast.

6xa8MsDMHYF4mw9RgdEyag.text: perfect little get away meal from the strip

rP8C7o8TkLO6Kg2d2ag5SA.text: Classic greasy spoon spot and I mean that in the best way possible. Biscuts and gravy were great, pancakes were massive (butter milk were so good) and the classic breakfast burrito was everything I hoped it would be.   Expect a wait if you are going at breakfast or brunch time. Pricing is maybe just a touch higher than you would expect. Great spot off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glimpse at the menu

1Jz01PWw05Mcal_npheipg.text: Service was great. We had a girl with braces serving us...she was awesome. The food was also really good. We will come back to this spot for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p__UVQKh7L2-WpCHtZa-WA.text: Got up fairly early on a Saturday and was starving so we sat outside and a young black man waited on us. We had been in with coffee waiting for him to take our order which he eventually did but after two tables were seated in his area both black maybe 10 mins after us and both received their meals before us which was at least 10 mins before us. When he brought my wife's mine wasn't there it was another 7 mins to mine came then we had to ask for the toast and 5 mins later he brought us the wrong kind.  Food was so so nothing great but the service was terrible and I guess we were victims of racial discrimination!  The first table was 5 people and the second was two and they both had their meals at least 10 mins before us!

_nPx1vrBWtI1XPldVZTaRw.text: I'm surprised by the reviews on this place because I can't think of one positive thing. I mean my waitress was nice but that's really it. We went there for brunch on a Sunday. It was super crowded, we waited 30 mins to be seated and that's 30 minutes of my life I will never get back. Finally after waiting in the super tiny, crowded waiting area (it was either that or freeze to death outside) we were finally seated. I ordered a "fresh squeezed orange juice" my boyfriend ordered an iced latte and we both took one sip and sent them back. They were so bitter. After a ridiculously long wait the food finally came and it was terrible. I picked at my pancakes because I was starving but the eggs were hard and tasteless. The potatoes were like the ones from the frozen section. They were not fresh. I definitely don't ever plan on ever visiting again or recommending this place to anyone. I could have had better quality food from a drive through fast food joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pES_kExqUG1g9uebSRJ5CA.text: The best breakfast spot in Las Vegas. Food is delicious and service is always top notch. Our server Lacey was super friendly and provided wonderful service.

-LjJ3QwkHA2woeQgFO_W5A.text: Wow the banana nut muffin is excellent! Moist, soft but has a crutch top. It hit the spot! First bite is like fireworks! Coffee is great with my fav French vanilla creamer.  Definitely will be coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m7ZtEVz95SpV5TNNqgzIAg.text: The banana nut muffin is worth the visit itself. Came on a Tuesday around 10:30 and had a 10 minute wait, this is a good sign. I had the Santa Cruz burrito and a side of bacon, well because, bacon. The burrito was very good, had rice and beans instead of the breakfast potatoes. The rice and beans were okay but nothing special. The wife had the Greek scramble and Hanks diablo potatoes. She said it was very good as well. Great service and really good food. Get off the strip and eat a good breakfast instead of that overpriced crap at the casinos

Nv4wDKjRl1xEC-n_bn8sFg.text: Wonderful food, and the service was great, even on a busy Friday morning. They have a full selection of eggs Benedicts that my friend loved. My Greek omelette was full of savory vegetables. I'd go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks amazing!

hxzsbtO1RNcxklbbHZ0twQ.text: Loved it! Awesome waiter, service and food. Big portions for great price. Yummy food. I got chile relleno omelet. Oh and I got to use a coupon buy one get one free. I got the coupon from this lil book all cabs carry

A5dXJD0Efpc2qdN4L9UcHA.text: A Vegas staple A MUST you have 2 come here 4 Breakfast come early if possible b/c their will be a wait!

rUZYwQzvugu5q5ASniXzVA.text: I don't recommend the steak & eggs.  Tell them it's your first time and they will  give you s free banana bread muffins.  It is so good.

DXGrhHIq7XkDZhkGADdWrA.text: Writing this review makes me feel like an old man because all I am going to do is complain about how salty my meal was.  I had the chicken fried steak skillet.  The dish consisted of eggs over medium over a layer of sliced chicken fried steak on top of a layer of potatoes all smothered with a coat of gravy.   I love greasy and unhealthy foods in general but I am starting to think that my taste buds are slowly changing.  The meat was dry and salty.  I had to continually dip the chicken in the gravy to get some moisture and to mask the salt away.  The potatoes were even worse.  They were doused with a heavy coat of seasoning salt.   I considered wiping each piece of potato with my napkin so that they would be edible.  I drank a lot of water that day.  I do want to mention, however, that service was nice and my wife enjoyed her huevos rancheros.  Ohhhhh... Banana nut muffin was quite good.  It was moist but not very fluffy.    My new old man self suspects that something not too healthy was used to get it that moist.  Sometimes not knowing for sure about something like this is better.

uUpJebNvM8uoHkJ1sk27QQ.text: Me and my girl were in Vegas and as usual Yelp really came through. This place has really good breakfast at a very reasonable price. The potatoes were some of the best I've ever tasted. The seasoning they put on them is the bomb! We also tried the spinach mushroom omelet and the chicken tortilla soup. The only complaint was that the soup was way too salty but the omelet was worth the drive out.

-jcyavG8YNyb6ab1-bzA_A.text: The food here is amazing! Best breakfast spot of our trip. Great service thanks to our server Raul. I will recommend this place to everyone.

UV0rg2ttnrF47gCPYr40cg.text: The only reason they get a 3 star and not 4 is because because i was expecting them to be as good as there counterpart egg works. Unfortunately not so. It was good, better than Ihop but not that stellar amazing flavor Im used to from these chains. Anyway the service was quick and the waitress was very personable so ya if Im in the neighborhood I will go again

wqqpcIAPdvU2LDgWocrJQw.text: Came to Egg  and I For first time. The service provided by Chance was great ! She made wonderful reccomendations and the food was out of this world.

J0dxZ35-OTQ617l9F21NZw.text: We like to go off the strip for breakfast and eat where the locals eat.  The omelets were good, but not spectacular.  Kevin who is a carnivore went for their skillet with prime rib chopped in it and I got Kay's special.  The reason we'll come back though, is their banana nut muffin.  OMG it is soooo good we bought a loaf to take home.  I think we just picked the wrong menu items and next time will go for what everyone else gets.

AgB24LV_HcTbhG8EmMJFyg.text: Come HUNGRY.  Seriously, you will get more food than you can handle.  The place is packed so plan on waiting.  The skillet breakfasts are delish.  I had the chicken, mushroom & broccoli skillet but also tried the country fried steak.  The banana nut muffin that comes with most dishes is also quite very moist and tasty.  No alcohol so one ding for that, but otherwise, a very good place to get your grub on.

zJ5DmxLnX-7_6PNVwDslDA.text: Just had an excellent breakfast here and the service was quick and very friendly.  Our server was Breanna. And we hope she wins the trip for two to disneyland.  She was great.

c6tf5MMywTI53TGrzVEoHQ.text: absolutely delicious and worth the wait. i came here a while back and i remember getting the eggs benedict. i seriously remember it and it was like two years ago. i'm definitely going back here on my next vegas trip.

-6R2wNO_Io3ckOCqFkF3CA.text: Wife and I had an early Friday morning breakfast here and really enjoyed it. Wait staff was extremely nice and attentive, and giving honest and candid suggestions from the menu.  I don't like nuts so did not have the banana nut muffin (wife loved it) and waitress said blueberry one is not homemade so beware - she was right. There are half portions to the large portions, and my wife had the half omelet.  Veggie skillet was great as well. If you need wait staff help, you flip a little egg stand on your table.

5VxeV3KmUti1Lff0PwLujA.text: LOVE this place.  Went for brunch on a Saturday around 11am, only had to wait a couple of minutes while a table was cleaned.  Everyone who works there was terribly nice, and we loved the little egg sign that tells the staff if you need something. You must order the stuffed French toast!!  I'm not normally a French toast eater, but this is not normal French toast!  SO yummy, like the best sweet and hearty sandwich I've ever had - I could only get through half of it.  My friend had the eggs plus, which looked yummy, and a banana nut muffin that everyone raves about - it was awesome.  Their ranch potatoes are also amazing, like eating tiny square-shaped french fries. Everything is so well-priced.  We paid $26 including tip for both of us, and considering I had an orange juice, I'd say that's pretty great.

YEKoRSNOPWKGOFKDctChDA.text: We ended up here only because there was a power outage on the entire block occupied by Hash House A Go-Go.  Boo.  Huge omelets and other specialty egg dishes.  The boyfriend's scramble which was supposed to be topped with a couple eggs looks like it had 4-5 eggs.  He was pretty happy with that.  My chicken fried steak was good, but I couldn't touch the potatoes which were covered in way too much of their salty seasoning...they looked like someone dumped a bottle of Lawry's on them as a joke.  Speaking of jokes, the lady at the register thought it was HILARIOUS when my boyfriend said the food was "eggs-quisite".  DUMB!!

XUC3qhPIH1ltwa3YE1cjbA.text: I'm a proud Egg and I supporter, I own a bright purple Eggeriffic shirt to rep my new local breakfast jam. I wasn't always that way. I'll explain my Egg & I experience.  I wanted to run away when we pulled into the shopping center, located past that road where the palms hotel is. Its like a used car dealership wasteland on this street. That is how I found this place, while doing some car shopping all morning and finally getting so desperate for food we ventured down the road. Not somewhere you think you find a great breakfast place. Or so I thought.  You walk into what feels like a family style diner greeted by a cute older woman who reminded me of my own grandma. Always a plus.  Get seated and scope out the menu,  lots of great options for omelets. We loved Canadian bacon or what my boyfriend likes to call bacon from Canada, ordered that. Preferred the waffles over the pancakes. (Learned that from my first trip there.) Order two orders of skillet potatoes (one for me and one for Adam.) They are literally that good. Each bite is a perfectly seasoned little bite of french fry / hash brown combination. Fruit platter with your choice of three berries. Lots of orange juice because I'm a sucker for pulp and vitamin c to start out my day.   After 5 times here I've realized, it's really great for what it is. A alternative for some Denny's or Ihop because I'd rather support a local business owner. This place has breakfast down and I plan on eating here whenever I'm craving those skillet potatoes. Chya Boy!

q7xBjBjQwewWaIOpEMwpuQ.text: I love breakfast. There's just something good about starting your morning off right. Where else can I get a banana nut muffin that's just fresh and oozing with flavor and goodness. This is the place that will help you get that fresh start right. Nice sit down cafe that makes the best breakfast out in Vegas.   I had my first date with my gf here so this place always has a special place in my heart....

xzUDvkLiOLW40CksHJL7cg.text: Another great meal at The Egg and I. Always great food, fast service & very nice wait staff. Thaynara helped me today and she was fantastic!

os3kzAivSuTxRRxAwR_amg.text: So disappointed....... Haven't eaten at this location in years, usually visit Flamingo. They took my name for 1 and then not only seated everyone before me, but 8 tables that signed in after me. They did it to another single before me too. They said they were waiting for a small table, but kept seating parties of 2 that signed in after me at the small tables..... They finally seated me at a  table for 4, go figure. And I waited all this time for ????? Horrible!!!

gvRPy5PSpMe-elB1LAeibQ.text: Excellent breakfast, excellent service. Veronica was amazing! We come here all the time and are never disappointed.

ecX26A5XlkGY8VFNz4eRuw.text: It was a Thursday morning and our second day in Las Vegas. I have not had any GOOD food yet! (Mad Greek and the Rio Buffet were pretty bad from Day 1).  My husband told me that he used to eat here with his grandparents when they lived in Vegas. It's located in an older plaza and from the outside did not look busy.  We arrived around 9:00AM and it was pretty packed inside, but we were seated at a table right away.  I ordered the Sundance Special (veggie omelette with spinach, mushrooms, artichoke hearts folded with Swiss cheese and a special Works artichoke cheese filling, topped with Feta cheese and fresh tomatoes). I also got potatoes and a banana nut muffin.   Our server was really nice. The food was so good! Honestly, the best veggie omelet I've ever tried. The banana nut muffin was also a delicious treat and so moist.  My husband did good bringing me here to make up for the awful food we had the day before LOL. Thumbs up.  :)  I'd definitely come here again when we are in the area.  105/100 Reviews for 2016

HEsz4O4M_E9mCVxRvEi0DQ.text: We love their Avocado veggie omelet. I am not Vegan yet. but I enjoy their food. Fast service and after couple of years, they deserve a 5 star review from our entire family.

ic9Sb_9JhpIfDlt7YijIXw.text: My husband and I had such a great time this morning! Garrett was our server and he recommended two dishes for us and he did not disappoint! Such great service, in and out quick with great meals! We will definitely come back when we visit Vegas again.

l5gNZlyYgxHJvRQVUSvmTg.text: This is my new favorite Breakfast Restaurant, I do not live in the area  but I will go to this place everytime I visit Vegas and I will definetly refer my friends to go here. The staff here was super helpful and friendly, there was a wait but it moved fast. Portions were huge definetly getting your money's worth, and I can't say enough about the food I took my family here and we all tried something different and we loved everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great choice of restaurants so many choices, love the waitlist texted to you, and the staff is so friendly and helpful.

5hRAnKNaAbaAuVnXAnUBcg.text: This place was amazing ! The manager here made us feel like we were at home she gifted us with a loaf of banana nut bread that gives you that home sweet home warmth ! The food was delicious the staff was amazing and friendly if you're out in Las Vegas take a little drive and check this place out !

OENNTeUf_8mYNfbRGRewtQ.text: My God this hands down is the best. Every time I come to Vegas I stop by here its a must the food is all ways great. Love you egg and I.

Cp7xPejLs2HTGicQafzSNg.text: As I'm currently here during a food coma, I wanted to write a review. This place is amazing. We are on a 3 day getaway and looked on yelp for places to have breakfast. This place came, even tho it was a little further than expected, it's soooo worth it. The service was great, the waitress, Manuela came by a few times to check up on us, she was very sweet! The rest of the staff were very friendly. The food was really good. Oh and the banana nut muffin amazing. I highly recommend this place. Just order an ride share car and come. If I come back to Vegas, I will def be back! Thank you

2BEKsYwCVg3fbo8mcZjglQ.text: We went because of the Yelp reviews. The reviews were not wrong. Great customer service and the food was excellent! The banana nut muffins were a 10!! They had a big variety on the menu. If you are counting calories it may not be the restaurant for you...the portions were huge.

O6qji_shxu4u3iCRlcOCRw.text: The Country Egg Benny is great and really fulfilling.  Lacey, our server, was nice and quick and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s1Uj4DHA5X5kfNUVWXSUow.text: Best food and coffee ever! Great customer, service fast service, and affordable food. I ate here two days straight. The coffee is so good I can hardly explain it! I had 3 cups of it. The food, oh my! Just know that you can't go wrong here and you're gonna get more than enough food. Order the small pancakes because it's more than enough. Go go go! Highly recommend. Oh and those potatoes are the bomb. Okay I'm done. lol

IHUPE9nb83Z-lJQzB-jQ1A.text: Great breakfast. Our server Patrick was amazing, seriously one of the best servers I've ever experienced. He was so attentive and made sure we were all happy. He explained the menu to us which was helpful since the menu is kind of overwhelming. Tons of options. We got free muffins for our first visit, they were pretty yummy. Food was great

9lxl-eSZ_4r9izhQcXzuvQ.text: This place is to die for!!!!! Any time I visit Vegas this is a MUST  come to.  The banana nut muffins are crazy delicious! The strawberry French toast is also a must! I recommend this restaurant to everyone. Customer service is great, the restaurant is on point with cleanliness. Lacy was our waitress she is so sweet and her customer service is phenomenal. We already can't wait to come back and visit Vegas to have our stop in at the egg and I.

LdAI41TtclTq1_ohEWpxVQ.text: Super great experience. Seriously.  It's Monday morning, 11am, and there was a brief 15 minute wait.  Place is packed!!  My carafe of coffee was a perfect start and I admit...I really enjoy just good diner coffee.    (You can ask for flavored creamers if you want them, just FYI.)  We were quickly greeted by Kat and trainee, Mariah, and it was just ideal from start to finish. Kat was personable and accommodating, something that could be easily missed in a place as busy as this.    Our yelp check-in brought the tasty banana muffins and I'm glad they did.  Everything. We. Ordered. Was. Great!  I had the breakfast burrito, hubby had pancakes/bacon/sausage/eggs. Just good ol' fashioned FABULOUS food.
