XqcgAFrxf1bK6EUQKLRefA.text: Looove the egg & i .. One of my favorite breakfast spots.. Never really a wait and if there is then it isnt long at all!! Loove it

iVk7Pt9dUHmr7voNzmIElg.text: This place is the bomb!  We go with small groups or just the two of us.  Always good service at good prices.  You won't be disappointed.

Bkl88lS15MFn1uidvkJR1Q.text: Have the Loco Moco!!! It's amazing. If you have a chance to sit with Manuela you will be lucky indeed.  Every few minutes I could see her pass with a watchful eye. They move through quickly the food comes out hot and it is far off strip to ensure you can park without issue in their lot.   Easy to locate and plenty of seating to make sure your hungry tummy has its needs met.  This is a must stop for breakfast or brunch!

hM9xrjf9f2q_lkmnA69btw.text: So far so good!! They close at 3 and we arrived a little after 2 with no issues. Nice staff and the place wasn't that packed we actually got seated upon arrival. We had a slow start and a couple of forgotten items we ordered, so we were a little disappointed, but the great tasting good made up for that and to top it off we were given a couple of extra delicious muffins which were soo good! Only Tip is tell the waitress you want your muffins after the meal cause if not they bring them out first. All in all not a bad restaurant and we would come here again maybe earlier though. A party of 6 and well accommodating tables. Large portions and so much good you could share a plate! All pancakes sold separate from meals, most meals come with either toast or their signature banana nut muffin! Banana nut muffin is oh soo good especially hot!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ESOay4co_ZgLZkIiUG9ZlA.text: We absolutely loved this place.  Both the food and the service were amazing!  Definitely recommend any of the skillet items as it was perfection.

vduSYzpjUG5aHfMzE1wEgQ.text: Delicious!!!  My husband had the banana pancakes(the best) and small fruit plate and it was super yummy. My 13-year old had grandma's biscuits and gravy combo and wow!!   I had the Sunrise Surprise and oh my goodness!! Their potatoes are the bomb and my son said the chocolate milk was the best he's ever had.  The service was good too with the manager coming over and asking how everything turned out. If u are in Vegas, you must give this quaint breakfast restaurant a try.

oqcWBdvx3emnQAm4AcARJg.text: It's a basic diner, good food, not distinctly different or special. But a good variety. Accommodating for kids and our service was great, but nothing fresh. I'm always looking for a place that can offer some Avocado or fresh breakfast alternatives, but this is your typical breakfast with eggs with a bit of grease to weigh down your gut for the day.

XmnDNFOTJysoXl9R7jep1A.text: Friendly folks, lots of seating, good food and coffee - my only complaint was that the potatoes were very salty.  Other than that, tasty and good - it was great to get away from the Strip on our trip and just be with the locals.  Our server was lovely and it was an overall great breakfast experience.  Would definitely return.

8r9FIDgjFZhMsXFiLf9c_g.text: Our server Linnea was awesome and so patient, she answered all our questions. The corn beef hash is also amazing.

x116aQzbjZ1d4MIrMTjqRA.text: Patio seating is nice, if u dont mind a few flies. Very nice staff so far. I really enjoyed my meal. The home fries are good and so was my veggie and bacon omelette. I will come back next time im in town.

I0Lq7bz3rhp3gczc8Uaohg.text: The works omelette was delicious. Very fresh food and Lindsey was helpful and prompt. Good dining experience, would come back again.

XP78ExRvhhB68XZBcQWL4g.text: As we were leaving our hotel one morning I asked the Valet where the best breakfast spot is OFF the strip.  He immediately said the Egg and I.  He gave us directions and this place did not disappoint.  Its about a 10 minute drive from the strip but well worth it.  The portions are large, the service is outstanding and the food is great!    Prior to arriving, I yelped it and saw all the great reviews.  We ordered the Banana nut muffin which was really good.  It was served warm with whipped butter.  Excellent start.  We ordered the ultimate skillet and a chile relleno omelet with a side of biscuit and gravy.  When the food came out I was amazed by the sheer size of the skillet.  It was was mound of food all served fresh and hot.  My chili relleno omelet was SOOO DELICIOUS.  It was topped off with melted cheese and a enchilada sauce with minced cilantro.  The omelet was one the best I've ever had.  The ranch potato's were crispy and seasoned well.  My biscuit and gravy was good but I was not really wowed by it.    Our service was great.  The kept our beverage cups full and checked on us without being annoying.  The decor is a little cheesy but it works.  There are TVs on every wall so you can watch the news or ESPN.    Definitely will be back the next time in Vegas.  Its a nice break from all hustle and bustle of the strip.

QnZrFJZFTyZqCEmqZoNjNg.text: Despite their glaring lack of proper grammar (Although Egg & Me doesn't really have that ring) I usually try to make it a point to stop by Egg & I...  usually on Sunday mornings nursing the hangover from Saturday's celebrations.  In the four or five times that I've frequented this establishment, I've noticed several things:  1.  Many of the female servers are quite attractive and helpful.  2.  The male servers that I've had have all been invariably incompetent, rude and sometimes a combination of both.  3.  For the price, (Bouchon's $18 version is slightly better) the corned beef hash is the best I've had in any restaurant.  The first time I came here, I tried it, and I don't think I've ever ordered anything else.  Beyond that, the owner/manager lady provides a stalwart presence at the cash register with that unique mix of friendly/surly grandmotherliness that only American women in their 60's can truly evince.

KKKlsvBTM3kDfrdXEaCVTA.text: First time here and what have we been waiting for!?! We were seated quickly and our server Alexa was great. Very helpful with the menu and she even made a point to get the kids' food out first. (Big plus for parents with kids that get bored quickly) the food was great. The classic Eggs Benny was amazing (best Canadian bacon I have had in as long as I can remember). We'll be back... Soon!

IjUMdl18X1BhRKfiY7UW2A.text: This restaurant really does not live up to all of its fabulous reviews. The service was very slow and the waitress with colorful hair  ignored us when we told her we were not satisfied with our food. Our orders did not come with all of their sides and they ignored our complaints about that. Also, the toast was burnt and they tried to hide that by placing the burnt sides on top of each other. I will never come back here. Rude staff and terrible service!!!!!!!!

fg2j8D4s3lS7XW70CWN09Q.text: Wonderful breakfast! Unique offerings! I can't believe I would say this...but the best sour dough toast I've ever had! Excellent fresh fruit too. But you gotta have the eggs! Waitress Alexa did a great job explaining her faves. We will go back tomorrow.

FJW1rAihVTAIurjhogNrVw.text: This place was just ok... over priced for what you get. If you want a really good breakfast spot try coffee pub!!

O8ht8vEMI2paOrJKf3x9RA.text: Cute restaurant. I love the daily specials bc they use fresh ingredients. ABSOLUTELY get the banana nut muffin. Coffee is good. Eggs are the best, duh that's what they are famous for. Pancakes aren't that good, but that my opinion.

hQSV4b4jUyVrP975GmH2fw.text: We did not want to have breakfast at the hotel and we decided to give this place a try. It is a great place . Service is very nice and friendly.we had Darlesia as our server , I give her 5 stars. I highly recommend The eggs & I.

vHgALYB3-6kyahUVUIGu6Q.text: Saw this place on yelp and saw the review and decided to try this place. And guess what, this place is GOOD!! I tried the egg-ception scramble and with fruits and with banana nut muffin! And WOW! the banana nut muffin is so good!! I would definitely come here again!   If you ever gonna come here, you gotta try the banana nut muffin!!

uZdbL0XSND9_P-2BXdBeDQ.text: The waitress was really nice, and even suggested some dives to check out while visiting, and brought each 4 of us one of their banana nut muffins on the house. Not only was it a sweet gesture, the things MELT IN YOUR MOUTH. If this is how they hook you, so be it, they are AMAZING.   Everyone was more than pleased with their order; I had the philly cheese steak, great meat to veggies ratio, very tasty, and their fries are killer. They put a little something special on them, my guess was season salt.   For how expensive Vegas can be, this place offers a refreshing break!

S2GBFjKJ3mGadvqH-qNu8Q.text: Had the veggie benedict and the biscuit and gravy. Perhaps we ordered the wrong this. I was not impressed with the quality of the ingredients or the way they were put together.

Lg_FVk-bfDxHeguQ4GgYYw.text: I'm ready for brunch now. :) The banana nut muffin was amazing though. Especially with butter. mmm...

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut Muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What an awesome menu!

yCH7AnX3uxtc_RSJlp-AOQ.text: Places like this is when I appreciate my iphone and the yelp app the most.  Was in Vegas and wanted some breakfast that doesn't come with the word "Buffet" attached to it. Looked up on Yelp and found this little gem.  It's around a 10minute drive from the Strip, without traffic of course.  I ordered the Crazy Chicken omelet with the muffin. They leave the whole carafe of coffee on your table, saving yourself from waving down a waiter(ess) every time you want a refill.  The omelet itself was very tasty, the muffin, while not as heavenly as some others claim, was indeed very moist and tasty and worth a try. The potato that came was what made my day. The fried squared shaped potato was crispy on the outside, but still mushy on the inside! Such a delight!  If I find myself in Vegas some other day, I'll definitely come back again!  Try to be here before 9am on the weekend, the waiting list was long by the time we arrived at 10am on the Saturday we visited.

i-LcTjmEApILhlOFsf4abA.text: Best breakfast in Vegas! Lindsey was phenomenal! Made awesome recommendations. Service was great. Please open one in loma Linda California!!!

Ya_kW98HzjGsnAS6s_ExSA.text: Food here is excellent and service was ok considering we call and made our reservation.

7t1iQW0r_6F2yBlLaLUZtQ.text: Don't assume because we're Hispanic we won't tip good! Got bad service... Won't be going back

-dez-c6KNKN-fpB7XfrcEw.text: Heard about this place from a local. While you'll need a car to get there (~15 min drive from South Strip) it's worth it. It's got a hometown breakfast diner vibe. Service was great and unpretentious. I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak skillet with scrambled eggs on top and it was everything my Southern Food-craving heart desired.   Would definitely go back!

IC5xDJiNgDjFbk3ejS1iOQ.text: Went there twice while visiting here from NY. Not many places to eat just a simple breakfast that won't break the bank. I like the omelet and the egg skillets. What I wasn't crazy about were the potatoes, which did not seem fresh cut, but rather from a prepackaged bag. The service is excellent, efficient and attentive. When in Vegas this restaurant beats the overpriced buffets and hotel restaurants.

y4uOda12CtsRwWdTpsXxvw.text: This is quite an experience for being off the strip. It's well worth the trip out side of the norm for Vegas. Stay focused and come here. You will never regret it. Check in on yelp and get an amazing muffin to go. We will be back for sure. Whatever you get you can't go wrong.

D7roaUYIquy_o_fFm-EYUg.text: Service was great and the food was delicious! I ordered the corned beef hash and it tasted good. The banana bread muffin was moist and fresh!

5ZqTCvlYVBs7VDo9iiPuvQ.text: Food was cold when we got it, I had steak and eggs, horrible steak, bad service, all around bad experience

shhiOlpOA2teA4xzjgvPqA.text: I gave a 5 because my server " REINA " was on POINT... First time as a family of 5 and the customer service was excellent... Our breakfast was nice and hot and we enjoyed our time here!! Thank you for being super friendly! Atmosphere was great from the time we walked in!!! We will be coming here again!! #vegaswecamehungry #anditwaslegit #thanks

64h9RgJnJylZGpqQ1r31VQ.text: This place has to be related to Egg Works because they are literally exactly the same. From the decor to the menu!  It's a Sunday morning so we came into it assuming we would be waiting at least 30+ minutes. Although it was packed we probably only waited between 15-20 minutes. For breakfast on a Sunday morning that's really not bad.  We got seated on the patio which is what we wanted at the time but honestly we froze to death. If you're eating breakfast before 11AM sit inside or wear like ten sweaters.  We both ordered omelettes. I had the mashed potato Omelette and my friend had the bacon and avocado omelette.  Huge, huge portions! And very tasty! I had half of my omelette left over to take home!  It's a pricier place to eat breakfast you're probably looking at between 11-15 dollars for breakfast and OJ but it is very much worth it!

CVfIx6JWf9NiXg8pIdTzyA.text: Delicious food, excellent atmosphere but a bit crowded. Our server Reina "The Queen", was awesome and very helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T6vmCxLutZGSNL_WxOuPpA.text: I love this place. I stumbled across this place years ago when I first moved out here. There's really not much to say that's not already stated in the reviews. I love the stuffed French toast. It's not overly greasy like a few other place that I have tried. You won't be disappointed. I don't remember our server name but he was wonderful.  This is my go to spot for all of my friends and family who come in town to visit.

0sG0Pk6uRRGqu5WT2gpNWA.text: Arrived worrying about too much salt and MSG (via previous Yelp reviews). But right away I knew I'd be disappointed when I learned that they didn't have real maple syrup for their pancakes. Its regular customer must be some one who likes the artificial sugar syrup they serve at cheap restaurants. It wasn't even an option for an additional charge.  To be fair, my kids didn't care their Mickey Mouse pancakes came with sugar syrup. And the prices for everything were reasonable. While I didn't find their eggs Benedict too salty (I am not salt sensitive), the MSG in the Hollindaise was palpable and the famous Diablo potatoes were "meh" (and I like spicy!). On the plus side, their banana nut muffins were delicious, as advertised.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finished my EB but that was more a Jewish thing about not wasting food than desire.

ypkwA_qCUsvBwJjVrPIp_A.text: Food is phenomenal. Had the California Crepe and the Chile Relleno omelette. Both were great. More importantly, our waiter Oscar was one of the greatest waiters I've ever encountered. Made my breakfast 10x better chatting with him. Highly recommend.

jn63YWz1epYqz03E3tP79g.text: This place is s must for your Morning start.. Today we came on a Monday and it was pleasant not to have to wait a long line..although we would do it any time because it's worth it...

WmI8chJpGpA63GeFvmV8ew.text: Ordered porkchop center cut and it was tender and tasty. Banana nut french toast is the bomb and so is the banana nut muffin. Kudos to Troyce for an excellent service. She even helped cut the food of an elderly customer seated close to us and assured him she would cut his food anytime he comes in. 2 thumbs up to Troyce!

jxX18FKQTQFFUalo5pNsDg.text: Oh what can I say about this place that you haven't already read in other reviews. Great place. Nice ambience. Order anything and it's all good. The hot sauce is amazing and so are the potatoes.

b3FwBk7QUaVAq2sAtmV6Og.text: Yelp 100 Challenge 14' * 6/100  Be sure to arrive early (before 9am) if you want to be seated within 10 minutes because those banana nut muffins are pretty amazing!  Servers are always busy and it can be hard to get their attention with a never-ending inflow of people so what you can do is turn your eye to your table stand. Flip from a black to a yellow egg as an indicator that you're ready and a server would be at your table in no time. I found it unique and utterly adorable.   After taking a while to eye the vast newspaper style menu, I got a huge portion of tender country fried chicken served with over easy eggs, home fries and their iconic banana nut muffin while mommy got the chicken, broccolli and mushroom skillet. It was the best thing that happened that morning.   A point to take note of; the skillet is blanketed with a layer of cheddar cheese (wink to the lactose intolerant). To my fellow mint-lovers, do not miss the caramel peppermint candies available at the cashier. Slip a couple more of em' in your pockets if you can.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Newspaper style menu :)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r7NmxoHDEKz_NVqTeLamVw.text: Just got done with our Breakfast at this place. Man the food is amazing! Everything is so well seasoned, the portion size is big, and the service is fast, which is great for tourists. We ordered Mexican crape and  chicken fried skillet, the crepe was way bigger what have every had. Nice staff is Cherry on the top.

BOxpSRxx4YBLL7N0Vw2_6Q.text: Good size portions at a fair price make this a good go to spot when in the area. If you haven't been here and you are in the area or even close, looking for a good breakfast you can't go wrong with these guys. The home fries have a nice well balanced seasoning, some places try to get fancy and end up overdoing it but these guys found a good blend and stick with it. As far as eggs, I'm pretty particular about them but I have never had a problem here when I ask for my eggs a certain way that is how they come. All in all if you are wondering about this place, stop wondering and give it a try you will be glad you did.

kPT9aLMHjt67rJVT1seZcw.text: Service was great, lots of people waiting but the food comes out fast and the wait was short. Food wasn't greasy but the potatoes were extremely salty and the banana nut muffins were amazing definitely get the muffin.

go-NYQHuFRHeaN8B6MVjRQ.text: Excellent service ask for CeCe she's friendly, knowledgeable. Portions are very generous (I understand you can request 1/2 portion).

Xu2TRXPd-sQmDQKdzXcl4g.text: Amazing restaurant! I definitely recommend it! The food was very good and our waitress Bree was very helpful and kind. I ordered the Country Benny and had the banana muffin. Delicious!

tDwnaRdelX79OBz73IImjg.text: On our 2-day-stay in Las Vegas we had breakfast here the first day. We liked it so much that we also went there for the second day. I loved their rib eggs Benedict! Great service too. Definitely would go there next time I am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10/10

gEcODOc4hQQucUmjD2GQ_Q.text: ..these guys are very good... pricing, food, service (Oscar's great).. ..every seat gets taken for very good reason..  ...and don't be afraid to share..or be prepared to take-home.. ..we live 20 min away in Henderson.. in the area for something else. ..next time, might just come back for them

oYjal8YD6OULoXl4kv-qEw.text: I stopped by here when I was at a conference in Vegas. A friend of mine was also in Vegas and had his car and said he could take me off the strip to eat if I wanted to work of course I took him up on the offer. Browsed through yelp and found this cute joint. The good portions are HUGE and yummy. I also liked that they have the happy egg or sad egg card that you put on a stand to let wait staff know you need something instead of them constantly checking on you. I say if you're in the area or in Vegas with a car this would be a great breakfast stop. Also, if you check in you get free banana bread -- mhmmm.

jGgUf52bDvvkW8n4KLyqnQ.text: We were in Vegas for a day and needed a place to take the family of 7 to breakfast.  Checked Yelp and this place was rated #2 for the area.  So we drove over.  When we arrived, the restaurant was full and there were about 20 people waiting outside.  To me, that was a good sign.  We put in our name and waited only about 15 minutes to get seated.    We were immediately greeted by our server Kat and while we were looking at the huge breakfast menu, she was busy slinging our coffee and juices.  It is really hard to make a selection off of their menu.  Everything sounded really good.  Even Kat (the server) couldn't narrow it down to the "best item."  She said the best she could do was a "top 10."    We all ordered something different.  I had the Blackened Prime Rib Eggs Benedict.  It was really amazing.  The Hollandaise sauce tasted exactly how it was supposed to taste.  The Prime Rib could have been a little more blackened for my taste buds, but it was still very good.  Other members of my group had the Hawaiian breakfast with Portuguese Sausage, eggs and sticky rice.  Also ordered was the Chicken Fried Steak Skillet, the Blueberry Waffles, Blueberry Pancakes and your basic egg, meat and potato dish.  Everything was good.  Everyone at the table was raving at how good the food was and how they were all happy with their choices.  The banana nut muffins were an extra special treat.    One more thing.  The service was amazing.  Kat was great...and the manager even came out and checked on us.  Great service!  And, to top it all...all seven of us and were out the door in under an hour even though it was a packed house.    So if you are visiting Vegas and looking for a place to go, forget those expensive buffets and places on the strip and head over to this place.  I guarantee you that you won't be disappointed!

m1PTHRcIUh_UKg9COMHOIQ.text: This was the best breakfast i had in las vegas. Service was timely and friendly.  I had the eggs Benedict with spinach the seasoned potatoes were awesome.  Definitely worth a drive from the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach eggs Benedict and seasoned potatoes

-zuZQFGSRVzf8NTYDtizTQ.text: Went here when I first move back from Texas! My wife invited me to come eat here I was surprise that they had some local Hawaiian breakfast here. That pretty much made my day well willing to come back there!

Na-a_nEVL_EaEPgQlhT3MA.text: Every time I'm in Vegas I go to the Egg & I. It's a great breakfast place. Clean, open seating and friendly staff. The coffee is good and of course...the food is great. Be prepared for a line of people jockeying for a table.

uv5NaVkVla7ClmCLDIlSmQ.text: The wait is painful.. Food is 4 stars but the wait is really really long in most days

mez2ouOgtxxj_S_brQIKFw.text: Egg and I is a great family friendly place and has amazing food. If you're going out for breakfast, lunch or even brunch, this is the place to go too. Check in and you'll get a free banana bread muffin! I love coming here and so does my family.

fz7fsGNbh3yGF88S9LqDVA.text: Pros: Pretty good breakfast Good service Get a free banana nut muffin with yelp check in  Cons: had to wait but hey that means the place is good the diablo potatoes were really salty....which they replaced with non seasoned potatoes my wife's omelette was really salty...I would have sent it back. I don't get the hype over the banana nut muffin....it is what it is...it's ok  I have read some reviews that the place is salty and I agree it is salty. They need to cut back at least 30% of the salt.

LBo8dqSw73McBrfHbDq9Lg.text: Leave the strip, stop eating at your hotel cafe/restaurant.  Don't look for some big chain breakfast, or go for the celebrity face. A 12.00 uber trip will get you away.   This is great food, served quickly.  Seated directly on a Sunday morning at 8:30.  Coffee, skillet breakfast with French toast.   No vegas kitch, just good food.

kfyIXLgep2r26JQJFLoGbA.text: The only breakfast place I crave when I'm back home. It's a must to have breakfast here when I come out to LV. I love the mashed potato omelette! Haven't tried much else because I love it so much! Everything looks bomb though! Quality food at a fair price.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deliciousness

S9HATF1YdNfD5Dk5_VlbcA.text: This place is fab!!!! Have been here couple of times and its been just Wow! Our server was Alexa and she was so awsome,polite and attentive! Had a great brunch !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #veggieskillet and #mexicanomlette

9mTcd4Bo8MtrJIHy6xgw1g.text: Great food & service. Our waiter Chance was very informative and attentive. We will definitely come back next time we're in Vegas! The banana muffins were incredible. The potatoes had a great flavor. A must try!!

HsUlapw-PTl_q4swpSRCag.text: A great place to stop at for breakfast/lunch coming in or leaving Vegas. Try their Loco Moco or Haole Loco, great twist on a Hawaiian staple.

k4AURv5hGJX8JrjLu7gUiQ.text: The best cure to a hangover and it's Vegas so chances to visit Egg & I are high! It was so tasty that I actually came here two breakfasts in a row. This restaurant will definitely show you the sunny-side of your day. ;)  The servers are really nice, and accommodating to custom orders. The menu is a cute, reminiscent of a newspaper so it give you an old-timey diner feel of reading a paper in the morning. The little black and yellow egg sign was cute too, just flipping it let the server know that you needed their attention, so many eggs everywhere it was a bit on the cheesy  side. The extensive menu did not help my indecisiveness, everything is equally good and largely portioned. I loved the country style potatoes, the seasoning is perfect so I recommend getting that if you can as a side.  Don't forget to bookmark this place or the yolks on you!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasoned center cut pork chops
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scrambled eggs with side of fruit, colorful

CwU1GEhWsupV082Qt6rciQ.text: VERY DESERVING OF 5 STARS!!!  Definitely off the strip, but well worth the visit.  Our waitress was absolutely dynamite! The food was superb and the atmosphere was very nice.   When we got there there were people standing outside to get in... the reviews we saw said they seem to get people in quickly.   Totally True, I thought it was going to take a long while, it may have been 15 mins.  This is a place we would go to again and again.

SQpIu7oTYBi_o8L8oT8BUw.text: We came to this place based on all the good reviews...and I'm glad we did! I ordered the stuffed French toast and substituted the seasoned potatoes for cooked spinach. It was a very filling meal! I think by ordering the spinach I was able to clear my plate. I also had a tea, which came with a plate of lemons and honey containers.   Our server Raul was amazing! He had us laughing and was on top of our orders! We had him split our table into 5 checks, and he did it with a smile. He made our first time visit here that much better! He also have us all free muffins as it was our first visit.  Plenty of parking and there is a large outside patio. The inside is decently large, cozy and homie feeling. Very nice :)  I recommend coming here if you want a filling and good meal. The menu is huge, there are so many options. You're bound to find something you'll enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Change the egg from Happy to Sad if you want the waiter. Our waiter, Raul, came by often, so we were always on the Happy egg :)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I guess I enjoyed my breakfast :D
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Stuffed French Toast without substitutions. It&#39;s natural, tastey form :)

MmIH6KKCGIYlJ13zgrvS0w.text: Wow! This place was really good! It's located off the strip which is nice - you don't get all the traffic and craziness. We were greeted right away and the place was full, we went on Wednesday morning . We were seated right away and the waitress was very nice and attentive . I had the eggs Benedict with spinach and my husband had the eggs and chorizo . We loved it ! Definitely recommending!! Great service - Great Food and good prices .

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict with potatoes and Egg and Chorizo omelette

RDeIwN-bx8MXu0c0RJ5t8Q.text: I came here twice within a week and I regret nothing.  The first time I had the corned beef hash - my first time ever trying it - and it was the most delicious thing I'd had in a while. Because I'd never had it elsewhere, maybe I'm a little biased - but I know good food!  The second time I had the chili omelet. Uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh delicious. They have a meat/no meat option, which is cool. And obviously I opted for the meat option. It was all cooked perfectly.  My favorite item has to be the potatoes though. Perfect little square-cut potatoes that are seasoned with what I can only describe as a mixture of the Red Robin's burger seasoning and tiny little kicks to your mouth. It's spicy but...not, if that makes sense? Probably not. You really just to go in and try.  Some plates come with what they call diabla sauce and it's delicious but beware - they charge $1 for extra.  Another plus: you get a choice of toast or muffins and I think last time I was there I counted six different bread options LOL. Plenty of variety! And the menu is insane. Trust me, it will be hard to choose.

qWMeRTjz1UurH0_MvvKPLA.text: A great place to stop if your hungry for breakfast or lunch. We have had the omelets and  they are really good! We have been here numerous times and we have never had any complaints at all. If your visiting Vegas its a great place to go to get off the strip.

pkI3JmdxLELv2_ubE0wYAA.text: How I'd never heard of Egg&I until last night, I'll never know. I love off-Strip, local establishments where I can get my grub on, and this is definitely on my list now.   I intended to get my butt up at 5 am and be at their door at 6 am when they opened, but my brain determined I needed sleep more than food and I ended up putting my name down at noon-thirty, at the height of brunch/lunch time. I was told the wait was about 15 minutes; I waited a solid 20 (which isn't bad when "15 minutes" usually serves as code for half-an-hour) and was promptly greeted by my wonderful server. I had my food about 10 minutes after I placed my order.  My late uncle was a gourmet chef, and my earliest, fondest memories of Vegas revolve around eating his cooking. Biscuits and gravy were on the usual menu when my family and I made our annual road trip out here, and I have purposely shied away from ever ordering it because nothing could ever come close.  But, for some reason, I ordered it anyway here. Was it as good as my Uncle Ray's?   Does the free show in front TI have anything to do with pirates anymore?  Exactly. But that said, I would probably order it again. I regret not remembering my server's name, but she's one of the best I've had in a LONG time, and as someone that waited tables and bartended her way through school, my standards of service are ridiculously high. She was awesome, and was warmer, more attentive and professional than any server I've had elsewhere in Vegas, even in those pretentious "five-star" restaurants you'll find in abundance in this city.  Keep in mind they're open from 6 am - 3 pm. I was told by a girl at the host desk that the best time to go was 6-8 and after 1:30.  Overall value?  Price: 3.5 Service: 5 Ambiance: 4  = 4.17. But Yelp! doesn't offer a decimal rating. So a solid four stars from me. Worth visiting at least once if you want a tasty meal in a casual atmosphere without the pretentious attitude.

SWX26dRDv75byqvBuevfGA.text: Back again on a Sunday after trying on Saturday but the line went around the building. Today we have a very sweet server / manager Carole Ann and the food tastes even better. People make or break a restaurant and this gal is tops.

ccnmnjs6KBJ5KAfJZojFHw.text: AMAZING. Words can't express how much we loved Egg and I. We had a 30 minute wait for Sunday brunch, but it was well worth it. The food was all absolutely delicious, and Alexa made us feel like we were the only table that mattered despite having a completely full restaurant and extensive line. She even went out of her way to offer substitutions to accommodate my dietary restrictions. Even the coffee was exceptional. Definitely stop in for breakfast -- you won't regret it!

r0Gzvy__Kq85F91GaTuyKg.text: After weeks of passing it up saying "we really need to go there soon", we FINALLY took the plunge and stopped in for breakfast. I have no idea why we waited so long... It was one of the most enjoyable breakfasts I have had in a LONG time.   I sort of built my own eggs Benedict and was pleasantly surprised by the hollandaise sauce that came with it! The hash brown patties were perfectly crisp (side order) and the coffee was quality.   Great "default" breakfast/brunch place! Very casual demeanor and the staff is SO pleasant. Our server was Amanda; she was great! Will definitely be going back soon for breakfast, and will more than likely stop in for lunch!

pOpBI9AProHX2INnIB7Nbw.text: Amazing breakfast with a break away from all the Vegas pricing at other restaurants. Our server was Lisa who was outstanding, always making sure we were well taken care of. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an awesome breakfast for a decent price.

MpvjJ5CDTTVr2bLPr-o5Lw.text: Great food and great service. Portions were large but too good not to eat! Breakfast menu is expansive, hard to choose. Traditional eggs Benedict was awesome, and the chili relleno omelet was spicy, they didn't skimp on the cilantro or the potatoes! Our server Chance was very attentive and efficient!

KuGiA-mS6Tgh93O3GQa09A.text: Generous portions, great service, and the food tasted amazing. A special shout out to Karla who I hope goes to Disney Land soon. She deserves it :)  Also, the banana nut bread is a MUST try.

DiPVN4A_3yO18pdUHpuwIw.text: I always love coming here after a weekend in Vegas. Great food to help the hangover. Our server Brady was excellent and the food came out very quickly. Will definitely be returning.

fWjW4VZOb9IBZti-_J0ghw.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast spots ever! Seating is fast, service is excellent and plenty of options for people of all culinary persuasions! Raul was a great and attentive server!

fGLJn2KSqb_tdUnz4zApGA.text: Yelp pulled thru again! Delicious on all counts. Great service, fast food delivery & everything spot on.  Banana muffin was as promised. Went Fri around 10:30. Only had to wait a few min. Weekend will probably be too busy but we may try to go back.

2_YvSSxtY-uX_3hlE3Mzmw.text: Great stop for breakfast.  The food is good and the mimosas (yes, plural) were awesome. Definitely worth the small wait.  Don't bother going anywhere else.

QomDunPYOQJUI5BJxA0Qbw.text: What an awesome place.   First off, they give you a complementary banana nut muffin when you order your breakfast and it is SO GOOD. It's always warm and always fresh. It's a dream come True for your taste buds. My mouth is watering right now, no joke.   The omlettes are delicious and they are very generously sized. The french fries rock.   The french toast is amazing too!   I've been here a bunch of times and I look forward to going back.

jCX2hslyKp2zWYmysdiqdw.text: The strip has expensive food, and a lot of it is shit. So before leaving we decided to drive out to this gem. The sausage is the best sausage I have ever had. The croissant under the sunrise mountain eggs was buttery and the potatoes were incredible. The French toast was a bit of a miss, but the service was great and the wait was non existent. Our server Lilly was attentive to our needs at all times, and very sweet.

48M0EtyIqLMm1jMzw3RzbQ.text: Wow, do they know how to make their eggs right and potatoes right! How did I know about this place sooner? I'm officially making this place my mandatory go-to place for breakfast on the morning I leave Vegas.  Just right out of the strip, Egg & I is a cute, homey place for a hearty breakfast. The menu is in a newspaper form, so you'll feel like you're reading the morning paper while having a cup of coffee!   EGGS: We ordered the Eggs Benedict Florentine and an Egg Crepe. Both were amazing! The eggs benedict at Egg & I is one of my top favorite!! The Egg Crepe is similar to an omelet but the eggs are cooked crepe style. Both of our dishes came with seasoned potatoes, which were AWESOME!! They were so good that I bought a bottle of their seasoning. They have bottles of the potato seasoning and blackening dust for meats for $6 each.

lnPmdp6cDyTc9o_ZOJJU1Q.text: I had the steak breakfast and it was delicious. Potatoes were amazing alone but on another level good with the Habla Diablo Verde salsa. even ordered the banana nut muffin which was equally awesome. I definitely recommend this place when your in Vegas.

gGavf98QINRBdxDUE9GRzg.text: Maggie was GREAT we come here for our last breakfast before we head home to California everytime we visit Las Vegas.. the banana nut muffins are a thing of beauty

EoP4aXt0E4zTj031Bn44cQ.text: Came down here from Los Angeles for the weekend and we decided to stop here for breakfast. It was probably the best part out of all my trip. The food was great and our waitress was the sweetest friendliest lady we came across. I would definitely come back to Vegas just for this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The idea of putting mashed potatoes in an omelette was genius.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These were just Perfect.

zMXm-n-Q8e14Hxb4PMS9Ag.text: Very good menu and service by Jessica outside.  The the three pigs omelette with wheat toast.

Hsa4CBq1mhu9IpdxS9Menw.text: Some Words of Advice for Egg & I   1. We came in around 10:45-11 and waited for about 15 minutes so I would say any later and you'll probably be waiting 30+ minutes..It started getting pretty busy right after we put our name down.   2. If you are waiting in line, check out their menu cause they have a LOT of choices.   3. Wear a sweater/sweatshirt - I know were in Vegas but the place was blasting the AC. Even our waitress had a sweatshirt on.   4. Order a banana bread muffin, its moist and fresh and a great snack. I ordered one after our meal because I was stuffed from my plate   5. If you know you can't eat a whole plate of food, get the HALF order. Of course our waitress told us AFTER we finished.   6. The pancakes were the best part of my meal - order them! Only complaint was that they served it with that fake syrup. (I'm from the East coast, I'm a little spoiled)  7. My sister didn't really care for the cinnamon toast french toast - they didn't look that great either  It was a solid breakfast for a lazy morning, I think next time I would try one of their egg-dishes since they are called Egg & I   YELP 365: 163/365

TsnIMKe5zwRr9TBDT01HpA.text: The food was fantastic, and Alexa, our server was fantastic as well.  We had a great experience.  The reviews on Yelp led us in the right direction.

HAXxMuVHg0uncRy2WXRRmg.text: My favorite place to eat in Vegas. Not once have I ever been disappointed here. From the food right down to the service it is everything you need after a long night. Ask for Tamara, she is hands down the best server I've ever had. This place is a MUST!

xMIdT4kzAFIZwUhejObhWQ.text: This great breakfast place is across the street from me, so I've eaten there many times. I actually go by there a couple times a month just to pick up their famous banana muffins, which my son devours!  I've ordered their oatmeal, their scrambles, their wonderful blueberry pancakes that they make with multi-grain (or was it whole wheat?). I'm not sure if I ever ordered anything that wasn't good.  Their service has been great so far. They have that nifty system of turning your egg sign on your table if you need service. I'd have to say their wait staff has always been efficient and attentive.  We often frequent Egg Works, Cracked Egg, I'm not sure if it's all owned by the same company. Their menus are slightly different, some serve coffee cakes, some serve muffins. You can't really miss with either one, they are all delicious.  Highly recommend for your family-friendly casual breakfast/brunch. Beware like many great breakfast places, the weekends get pretty busy, especially Sunday during the church rush. Definitely worth it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Till 8pm???

jquaC8jXPz5k-m2miNHjXQ.text: Looking for a hearty meal while in town, EGG and I does not dissapoint. Enjoyed the Bacon omelette w/ potatoes and side of biscuits and gravy. Split the meal with my wife. Omelette was good, potatoes seasoned and crispy and buiscuit was flaky and soft gravy perfect. Everything served hot and quick. Also checked in and got a free bannana muffin served warm and fresh loved every bite. Plenty of seating here come early gets busy on the weekend.

6ncAqz4qeVkzvRCuQw3IbA.text: We ordered Works Skillet, Traditional Benny, and the strawberry stuffed toast. All orders come with a large portion, and the most important is: they are very very yummy! Best Breakfast in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional style Benny. It is very tasty! Love it!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed strawberry toast! Very yummy
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Works skillet! Yummy

bm4KzDQ_ekXOYrfUmp5Tgw.text: What an EGGcellent breakfast we had this morning!!!    We had never been here before but tried it based off all the positive reviews.    We were not disappointed!!    It was a crowded Sunday morning but we only waited about 10 mins.     We had the chicken enchilada omelette and the stuffed French toast.    Both were OMG!!    The omelette had grilled chicken, green chilies, enchilada sauce, cheese  and sour cream.    Came with crunchy potatoes.    Stuffed French toast was filled with sausage, eggs, cheese and topped with powdered sugar.     Unique combination and it all worked.    Waitress was very fast and super friendly!   Thanks for a great meal.

6IUp0SgOs3VzU0_FMRQ4_A.text: This was probably the best spot we hit on a recent trip to vegas.  It's always a good sign when a place is packed midweek.  We were sat immediately and there was no wait to receive drinks and menus.  Our waitress was Chance and quite honestly one of the best servers I've had in a long time. She knew her menu and was open to giving suggestions. She was also VERY attentive and upbeat in general. during a pretty good breakfast rush, mind you! Firstly, as I said before, it's busy. But you never have to flag down a waitress or ask when your order is coming. There's a little sign on the table which lets you flip between a happy egg and a frowny egg. If the frowny egg is showing, the waitress/waiter is supposed to help you right away. I never had to use this sign because the service was so prompt.  First thing I loved was the bottomless cup of coffee. You're given a full thermos pitcher of coffee all for your table and there's plenty of sugar (or substitutes) and cream at hand.  I usually ask for a recommendation on what to order when traveling and Chance was eager to help. She told me about the Chile Relleno Benedict and said that it's not normally on the menu (special days only) but that it really was a must try. Honestly, I'm not huge on chile relleno but hey she seemed enthusiastic and I went ahead and ordered it.  It was amazing. And it SHOULD be an everyday menu item. I'll go into both dishes and what was so awesome about them below.  Chile Relleno Benedict: Wow. The dish was amazing. Benedicts make just about anything better but this was no joke. REALLY well thought out and balanced. First thing I noticed was that the eggs were PERFECTLY poached. The whites were soft but not slimey or runny. There was zero cooked yoke. It was warm and ran smooth just the way god intended.  I don't know what was breaded in the dish but it was either the Chile itself or the thinly sliced (and tender as all hell) chicken breast. The breading was really what made the dish I think. It added just enough saltiness that I didn't need to add salt or pepper to my breakfast. I always add salt and pepper (unless I get chicken fried steak) and that was a pleasant surprise. The chile and the chicken were topped off with the poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. There were home fries on the side which also needed no seasoning beside what was already there but honestly I would have been ok just eating the chile relleno benedict. It was really that good.  My GF ordered the veggie pesto sandwich with Cajun fries. I didn't try the sandwich itself but she said the bread was very tender and the pesto was really tasty. I DID sneak a few fries however and loved them. Thinly cut shoestring style potatoes covered in seasoning. Another instance where salt was not necessary. Really they would have been fine without ketchup.  I fully intend on visiting this place every time I head to Las Vegas and can't say enough good things about it. Thank you Chance for the awesome recommendation and thank you Egg & I for turning out exceptional food and service at a great price!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie pesto sandwich with Cajun fries
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno Benedict

5ne9E5NgBlgg2Dc3jfemuw.text: Everything was delicious and I LOVE that they offer 1/2 portions! Everyone was so nice, especially our server Breannada.  She kept checking on us to make sure everything was ok, or if we needed anything.  She was warm, and had a great smile.  We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas! Oh! Banana muffin was awesome!! We had to take a loaf to go :)

AmMMmP2VqElY74ZPHUxv2Q.text: Every visit to Vegas we have to have breakfast here.  Great food, super nice people and a nice change from the hectic Strip.  Our waitress today, Tabatha, was awesome.  As a mom herself, she understood the needs of our two young children and really helped us out.

eNlLtPIaHCmEbq4WcVyS9w.text: Perfect breakfeast or lunch place.  A little noisy but good service.  Best eggs in town.

tI6q_1-8TAgyUMlpczh86Q.text: First time here and it was delicious.  Reina was super friendly and our food was amazing. Our order came out quick and just the way we wanted. As a server myself I was very pleased with the service we received. We usually go to Babystacks but we drove past this place and we wanted to try it out. Glad we did. Super busy but we didn't wait too long for a table.

NsunaUVefkLYBMjrLvJ-tw.text: Great food!  Great service!  Liliana was also great!  I'd come back with my wife any day!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Benny! YUUUUM!

mJhYKHzfGb2vXJMJILbSVQ.text: In a city full of great breakfast places, the Egg & I is definitely one of them. Seriously, though, it's very good. And relatively cheap. Very unpretentious. And the banana nut muffins are amazing. Our server, Amanda, was the best! Very friendly and attentive and never once rushed us even though we took our sweet time.   If you can make it off the strip, this place is definitely worth it.

eHiW-iXKO2gtD0GWOInCOA.text: Seriously the best avocado bacon omelet in the city and the WORST service, from the get go! I love the omelet but check back say hello look like you care??????

vGC6MiWFl-8Sje17gbGibw.text: Nice place to eat. HUGE brunch menu to choose from. Eggs all different ways and great pancake/waffle/crepe options as well. Service was good and food was good.

EwI2d3Q_Rk-czZ2-V4J50Q.text: Well worth heading away from the strip for an excellent breakfast. About a 30 minute wait for a table on Sunday AM is a sign off somewhere good. Lots of choice from simple eggs and bacon to full on skillet meals. Our omelette where great, as where the great banana nut muffins. Brilliant service from Genesis.

59ozgLknGS4YIkeKlnqLkA.text: I like to visit restaurants off the strip and this was a Gem. I started with a banana nut muffin and it was the best, I followed with the 3 pigs omelet and it had plenty of meats and cheese, it came with plenty of the house home fries (which are good) and another muffin. Service was pretty good but it was crowded so we had to flag server down a couple times. Prices way better then the strip, I'd uber to this place if I had flown to Vegas

H_V7bixGytcy2eUk4OuDPw.text: Awesome breakfast. Just a few minutes away from the strip which is a nice break. Waitresses (Karla was mine) are unbelievable and super friendly and attentive (a relief from the soul-less feel of vegas) and food is bomb (and huge portions). If you don't feel like being a food coma and your appetite is not HUGE, you could easily split a dish between 2 ppl . Highly recommend !

9R4dgfxyzqbB0F-TGrbXYw.text: Absolute treat! OMG! I visited when in las vegas for a quick vacation and their breakfasts were huge and satisfying not to mention delicious. My friends and I made it a point to all order different dishes so that we could sample more and they were all sooo good. Together we tried quite a bit and no to mention, the waffles w fruit were excellent!

fgV6QBxsgkbYbp9_gsWHXQ.text: I'll preface this review with the fact that I am NOT a breakfast person. I don't love anything about it. Except when I visit the Egg & I. And let me tell you ... it became a weekly event after a while.  I can't turn down fresh squeezed OJ. This restaurant has delicious OJ. You should try it at least once. I love their menu. They have interesting combinations, like chicken, pesto, and eggs, and delicious twists on common breakfast dishes, like French toast. I love the scrambles the most, and would  often get the veggie scramble sitting atop ranch potatoes. Slather that mound with hot sauce and call it a day. Expect an exhilerating food coma to follow. The portions are big. I also recommend trying their complimentary banana nut muffin at least once. I don't like muffins or bananas, seriously, but I like theirs. Be adventurous, don't order eggs and a side of bacon. Live it up a little...  Super awesome service. Expect to wait on the weekends for breakfast/brunch, but they have a quick turn-around and great waiters/waitresses. A nice perk to the crowded atmosphere is an egg on the table that you can flip when you require service. On a very busy day it's very helpful to the staff, and don't be afraid to use it! I've always had friendly, impeccable service here ... no complaints. I've brought every out-of-town guest here for breakfast, and we've always left happy. Stop in and give it a try!

pLskQO9JyifKKQXGZIMoLQ.text: Yummmm! Food portion is great! I usually eat all of my food, but needed a to go box. I got the chicken mushroom and spinach skillet and it was delish! Hubby got the sunrise and he loved it so much, he wouldnt give me a bit. And he had leftovers. Oscar waa great and attentive. Will definitely come back when we're in town again.

FmZkU2oA4fHaFnEA-04mxw.text: Was on vacation and decided to eat here for breakfast. I was expecting something more..I ordered the chicken fried steak skillet..it had potatoes, chopped up steak, gravy and eggs throwed on top..it was ok..nothing to brag about. It was just ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak skillet

rpPcMmxdSlRbHSejdJX46Q.text: The food was great. Omelettes were huge and perfect.  Our server, Perry, was on the ball...hard worker and very friendly. Heade pur breakfast extra good!! Thank you Perry!!!!

Dm8OD1Gy0MgLGlO1uMzs8g.text: Best breakfast ever. Service is phenomenal. Thanks Liza! Regarding portions: they are huge. Waffle and pancakes take up almost full plate. Relaxed environment, come early because it gets packed.

zYCqxifu8xRxIi81UHOWJw.text: Our usual bfast joint in Vegas is the place to be! Every meal is a hearty one so you won't leave disappointed. Try their banana nut muffins and their Hablo Diablo Verde salsa with your meal. Yummy-zone. Our waitress, Erin rules!! Thank you!!

K2yabPQsP59CI2Y9kPzF4w.text: First time here with friends from out of town... our server Curtis was amazingly wonderful... we all ordered something different.. everything was perfect.. the only downside was it was very salty...

ySvGcPqMTWYQM8vtAbSnUg.text: Very great "homey" environment, servers were very sweet, and the food was delicious! Glad that my family chose to eat here on our quick trip to Vegas. I was also pleased that they had their sauces for sale!

zXPl_Jc3vOOmVpZnSyZPSA.text: Yelp never steers us wrong! The food was good and service was excellent. Rarely do you find a restaurant with adequate help to move you through quickly AND have very good food. You can't go wrong coming here for good food with lots of choices.

Chu5DuhjU97MOan5Ni1nnA.text: Eggs & I is a popular brunch spot for locals in Las Vegas.  We had to drop by the airport and chose Eggs & I as our go-to food spot afterwards.  The menu consists of a variety of eggs benedict dishes, omelettes, hash, and other breakfast items.  Service is homey and the vibe is definitely casual here.  The menu comes out printed on newspaper stock so perhaps their items change frequently.  We started out with their signature banana nut muffin which accompanies many of their dishes.  Light, soft, fluffy, and not too sweet, the banana nut bread was a hit and a great starter.  Our entrees included a mish-mash of their popular dishes:  Prime Rib Benny (or Benedict) - the highlight dish entree was an Eggs Benedict version made up of prime rib.  It replaces the traditional muffin with a croissant and is definitely a large portion so was plenty to share.  Florentine Benedict - a version made with spinach and ham.  Pretty good.  Chicken Fried steak - I only had a few bites, but I liked it.  It's a calorie killer though.  Kay's Omelette - another signatuer omelette, it had plentiful cheese, ham, and egg.  Kinda plain and not sure why this is so popular.  You could make similar omelettes at home.  Brad's Chili - wasn't sure which chili to order and was recommended this one.  It came out lukewarm, had a bland flavor and was generally forgetabble.   Eggs & I is a decent brunch spot, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.  They take credit cards, including American Express.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut Muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak Skillet

AieyqeRpEMu--EoqMoghzQ.text: This place was slammed but the seating was fast, the service excellent and the food great as always. Just crowded and noisy at times but that is to be expected. I've been to a lot of Egg & I locations and the menu on this one was huge. If you cant find something you like there is something wrong with you

riklENCmOeGfSKJELZztqg.text: Wow. Best place to grab a quick breakfast. They have hospitality down to a science, have awesome breakfast muffins, and are willing to accommodate any diet. I was even able to snag an egg white omelette with a grapefruit side for no extra cost!

1Q7_Nxfz3wvo14ZWpWQweA.text: Great experience all around! The staff was super friendly, and I really enjoyed the "mom 'n pops" atmosphere! The food was delicious and our server Karla was so nice and super attentive. She provided very quick service, getting things immediately after we'd requested them. I really liked the banana nut muffin option! And the home made salsa was great! Definitely coming back during my next visit to Las Vegas and will be recommending this place to my friends back in California!

LNTs991DnbFrGATvgB9U6g.text: 1st time here and it was really good.  Although it looked like there was a lot of people waiting to be seated, the time we waited for a party of 4 was about 10 minutes. The staff was very friendly and very attentive.  The food was good and big portions.  The banana nut muffin was so good.  Got a free one just for checking in with yelp! I would really recommend this place.

RwxsD75fDyGNTCSWmAlt-w.text: Lil busy, a good amount of people. About 15-20 min wait. Crazy big selection if you love eggs. Very filling portions. Food was delicious!! Definitely a must try for brunch!

ZOjr3bM8FoytRp6HRDrfVg.text: Off the strip.  Nice staff, all wearing bunny ears for Easter.  Server: Amanda. She was super sweet and attentive. :)  Cozy and busy.  Got the sunrise mountain & banana nut muffin. Had a bite of the Italian and plain cakes.  HUGE portions! (Share with a homie.)  Fast service.  Everything was DELICIOUS!!!   Will return!

M3Kdc2138WDAERrfupi3KA.text: I'm not too into omelettes and today is our 10 yr anniversary and I didn't want a steak for breakfast and dinner, plus we had plans to go to rise and shine steak and eggs tomorrow....tasted like any other omelette to me, but As I said I shouldn't be considered a critic of such. but the portions are huge! Seasoned potatoes are awesome!!! Banana muffin OH. MY. GOD. Delish! Atmosphere was great and friendly. Our waiter was great (don't remember her name which is probably good due to the fact she gave us two free muffins....don't want her getting in trouble, hehe. She was amazing though! Even tho I heard the muffin was good i settled for toast, and she brought me one anyway! And due to the portions, I couldn't finish it so I asked for a box for the rest of my muffin, she brought me a new one to go...A+++

2XRsjtgLHW37JIwQsY5hvQ.text: You will want to eat everything on the menu here and you can't go wrong. I had the chile rellano omelette and it was amazing. The service also is like a 3 Michelin star restaurant. Very attentive, happy, and fast. Our server Curtis was extremely helpful and attentive and they even gave us free banana muffins without us even mentioning the Yelp deal. I will be back every time I come to Vegas.

eo2nN7Ikrbwyz1iNgPKtZw.text: The food was delicious! Must try the banana nut muffin! Will be back the next time I am in Vegas! The omelets are huge, and all of the ingredients were fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M0XzB1f5lirEUDP2VrsoEg.text: When we first walked in it was a bit overwhelmingly with the noise and it's a wide open space.  They seated us very quickly and got to our drinks right away.  One server Erin came to our table shortly there after to take our order and answer any questions we had.  My wife doesn't eat regular sausage and we were very impressed with the vast ability to substitute. We were here for breakfast, but I peeked at the lunch menu and you can build your own burger with ground beef, chicken breast, turkey, or a vegetable patty.  I had the fiesta green chili skillet and it was amazing.  Perfectly spiced and filling.   My wife had a burrito and substituted turkey sausage and fruit.  We each got one of the banana bread muffins which I highly recommend. Erin was our server and she was very attentive and pleasant.  This was a nice way to start the day.  I highly recommend making this past of your Vegas stay.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b8xR0odAge9I2N5OKvQaxg.text: When waking up at whatever time you wake up( given that it is before 3:00pm lol), you always gravitate toward the need of a good hearty meal. One that will jump start your day with the enjoyable taste you desire.    Egg and I seems to always strive for that in my eyes. I've come here early morning, in their last hour of business, and even with a months in between visits. But one thing that has always stayed consistent.... Has been the A+ service and comfort the staff welcomes you with paired with that perfect execution of any hearty meal you crave for.    The food is highly recommended but the service is what will keep you coming back.   Anything you try, you will be pleased with perfection.

Jxiwi_F-VDRPv7P3SLHEjw.text: Just finished eating our meal here. Wonderful place with a good location. Always a pleasure to come here. This is my favorite breakfast place by far! Spent $80 on breakfast at the trump and it doesn't compare to this $26 dollar masterpiece! Definitely a place to stop at!

pHYky7JNFhJHgvjJxlWXIg.text: This is a great place for brunch!  Excellent food,l and large-generous portions.  I would have given 5-stars however, we didn't get refills on our water and had to ask a couple of times for our half and half for coffee.  Excluding those two minor issues, it was great!

ENS55NU0bikop-EcyN2P2w.text: This place is an "egg cellent" place to have breakfast.  It is a little bit crowded, but I believe it is because it IS such an excellent restaurant. pL8l3wQm-P5hhPU0HYHwbg.text: This place is amazing. Their muffins are the best. I have been here two times and have not left disappointed. Our server was attentive and the food beyond amazing. The first time I got a scramble and it was great. The second time I got the chile relleno omelette. It was amazing a little heavy on the cheese but the flavors were still able to come through. cRhO0fL5V-VAASKFKGYIaA.text: Excellent food and great service. It is very busy all the time, usually about a 20 minute wait , but well worth it.

6rJuG8_v-1wpCkAZnO32KQ.text: Just off the Strip, this place is a great find. Even though there was a line waiting to get it, we were seated very quickly. The food was excellent!! You couldn't go wrong with anything you ordered. And added plus was the service was super., We had a great waitress Chance that always checked on us but didn't make us feel rushed.

FgmBzeIQguMEMuRSVv9aQw.text: Had the classic burrito and banana muffin. Muffin was delicious! Burrito came with a side of potatoes that was yummy. Didn't care much for the sauce that came with the burrito. The service was great!

LvC084C_BZhJ90DY_A-7YA.text: Food had a very home like feel to it. I went with a large party and everyone ordered various dishes. Not ONE particular dish stood out but the banana nut muffin... now that was pretty amazingly delicious!  Very accommodating to large groups on a Saturday brunch. We were seated almost immediately even with the packed house. Only down side was that they forgot one order from our big group and it happened to be our bachelorette. Also, the order was wrong. Double thumbs down!

JdeiI-Fq0WIHNr7ZDyDE0A.text: Not the best breakfast/brunch place I've eaten at.  The pancakes were average and a bit too sweet with the strawberry cream cheese (and I have a huge sweet tooth).  And their famed banana nut muffin was maybe too hyped up, so my expectations were not in line with what I actually tasted.  Not to say that it wasn't good. You do get a lot of food for the money though, considering you're in Vegas, so it's a steal. And the service was very friendly, like being in a diner where everyone knows your name. So if you're looking for a fix of good old fashioned, artery-clogging American breakfast, this would be a good option in Vegas if you don't want to break the bank in a casino establishment.

abectl3HMSWJUVR84JDiOQ.text: At a little before 7am on a Sunday morning, the place was almost deserted.  This was a little worrisome, but we soon realized that this said far more about the Vegas population than it did about the quality of the breakfast.  Here's the best recommendation I can give about the food: I came back for breakfast the next day!  And we would have come back the third morning except that we had to be on the road before they opened at 6am!  We got off to a good start.  When the waitress found out this was our first visit, she brought us a warm banana nut muffin to try.  It's a house special and well worth getting.  When you open up the newspaper-like menu, the first thing you'll notice is the words Habla Diablo in blazing red appearing in the descriptions of at least half the dishes.  My wife wanted the Spinach Benny, but was concerned about the Habla Diablo potatoes because the name sounded spicy and she's a self-proclaimed spice wimp.  The waitress explained that it wasn't spicy at all, that Habla Diablo is the owner's side company and he had just redone the menu to emphasize his products.  My wife went ahead with her spinach benny and I got the loco moco, with an extra side of the Habla Diablo potatoes.  (It turns out that the Habla Diablo seasoning is a lot like Lawry's Seasoned Salt.)  My wife really liked her spinach benny, but didn't care for the potatoes.  (But she's not a big fan of breakfast potatoes to begin with.)  I liked the potatoes and finished most of hers in addition to mine.  Plus the loco moco was the best I've had on the mainland!  The next day, I came back on my own, but with orders to bring back something good to my wife in the hotel.  This time I had the Biscuits & Gravy, which were great.  But, fair warning, they were pretty salty -- well within my tolerance, but if you are sensitive to salt, you might want to steer clear.   Then I picked out the California Crepe for my wife, which the waitress was happy to pack up for me to take back.  I asked to substitute some fruit for the Habla Diablo potatoes, and she packed up a huge container of fresh fruit.  My wife loved the California Crepe, except for one thing -- it was way too big for her to finish!

gMWEWhqQftLmFVM8TeRffw.text: Came on a Friday morning with 8 girls so we did have to wait a little. Karla was our sever and she was amazing!!! Everything tasted great and came out pretty quickly. I'm from Los Angeles and whenever I come to Vegas I always come here for breakfast. I've tried lots of things and everything is great! Will definitely return!

UoC9V9mf650pta_oxrbqXQ.text: Amazing breakfast I had have in a while I appreciate the kindness of the waiters. Fantastic food they have ill definitely be back.

M-8dCAtvBCwf-dtm4bd3Bg.text: Incredible skillet, eggs made just right.  The potatoes were delicious and cheese melted just right. Highly recommended!

wzdJULOjJ3CZZa4ddDVoXA.text: I come to Las Vegas for work and I'm always looking for new restaurants to try. My server was very knowledgeable, friendly, and gave great service. I got one of the skillets and it was delicious! The banana nut bread muffin was very moist and tasty. Yum yum!

MkHE8Fq2mDAiYTzgldalxA.text: In Vegas for vacation and this place came up as a great restaurant.   I can say it didn't disappoint.  One of the best selections of food.  It came to the table fast and it was hot!   The quality and taste was fantastic!!  It is a MUST for anyone looking for a great breakfast on or off the the strip.  The green chile hash was amazing.  And the country fried steak skillet was tender and the gravy was phenomenal.   Don't miss out!!

u4Hsx_rCGhEqB7YMzXGP0A.text: First time at Egg & I and I will definitely be back! Looking at the menu, I couldn't decide what I wanted to try, but ultimately went with the breakfast burrito which was delicious paired with the salsa. Everyone in my party ordered food that they thoroughly enjoyed their meal. We went on a busy Saturday morning, but sat outside on the porch to enjoy the weather and the service was good. Our waitress was polite and kept our drinks refilled. Food seems reasonably priced because every meal seemed to be a decent sized portion! I can't wait to return to try the country fried steak.

eMHY-CDUc3QZcZ25LFOl7Q.text: Every time we come to Vegas we make a point of going to Egg Works. This time we tried the Egg & I we were not disappointed. It is the best breakfast in Vegas! I had the Skillet with Bacon. Jim had the works Skillet. Our waitress Tabatha made sure the eggs were done perfectly she was very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. The muffins are fantastic we get ours to go since you get so much food. If you want a marvelous breakfast at a good price with great service this is the place to go!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best breakfast in Vegas!!!

v21GJyjSo8fs3OJujgF4FA.text: My husband found this spot on TripAdvisor so we checked out out. There were many people waiting outside, so we were a little hesitant about wait time but getting sat took less than 10 minutes.  He ordered The Original Breakfast Burrito. It was very tasty and a good size. About 7" long and 3" diameter. The stuffing was tasty and just the right spice, the sauce on top was delicious.   I ordered the Works Veggie Benny. The vegetables were great, English muffins toasted well but not so much that they hurt your mouth while you're eating. Eggs were perfectly cooked (I am so crappy at cooking eggs that this always amazes me). My only complaint was that I wasn't super happy with the hollandaise which is 75% of why most people order Eggs Benedict (I think).   Both came with habla diablo seasoned potatoes which were very tasty. Both of us finished our plates.   Drinks: Soda and unsweetened iced tea.  Bill: $27

WrTwn2S0926KVzI-wLmV3g.text: I was here a few months back for EDC weekend and I will DEFINITELY be coming back.  We barely waited at all to be seated given that it was a weekend with a lot of traffic, again due to EDC, even though we were a larger group. It was so great! I had the skillet and my husband had one of their burritos and we were full for the rest of the day!  However, the highlight of our meal was the banana nut muffin! Oh my goodness was it the best muffin I've ever had! I love this place and will be back for sure.

aH3NootvaVJof_JeCxyeNQ.text: This place gets crowded come early for breakfast or later like lunchtime. Their freshly baked banana muffin is fantastic! My sister doesn't like bananas but she ate it up. Everything I've ordered has been tasty.

Jc5712m3bbweJ_SReNSFeQ.text: Very good food, excellent attentive staff. Our waiter was very nice.  I am happy I left the hotel to come to this great place with my family. I recommend if in Vegas stop by.

GMPoR5blW5g_nB6JWCGbUg.text: Great service and the food was all pretty good. Everything came out correct. Three stars because the "prime rib" is a joke. Call it something else or take it off the menu. That is not prime rib. More like little cut up pieces of sirloin.

Si_NHLI1W8FYwgR4evgg-Q.text: Wow what a amazing place. Food great big portion and prices are fabulous . Clean /fast. The wait time wasn't that bad , would have waited a hour if it needed to be , it was that good  !!! Get the muffin the best !!everyone is so happy , I would think they are all family , not a sad face around , not one server complained about anyone , we sat right by the kitchen , but they could have a complain spot in the back , lol, that we don't know about .. Our sever Amanda was so helpful , are glass of drinks filled  constantly, food brought out with a smile , very pleasant when taking our orders , Amanda joke with us , and she was busy , took the time to be helpful , thank you !! coming in from AZ , we should have hit this place from the first day , to bad we are leaving .next time here first ,to start our day off right . Head over fast, wish had more stars because that's what they should get 10  of 10

6CVcB1F16BEpB5TmE5IKLw.text: Great local breakfast restaurant. Fantastic service, selection and prices.  Anything from basic steak and eggs to a selection of benedicts to loco moco.  All filling and oh so good.  Next time you are visiting Vegas, take a little drive and get out of the overpriced resort restaurants.

L4NfzSX7FUcoQaBCY_g8Eg.text: I love this place! Preferably because they serve turkey products. This is my second time at this location. I ordered the waffle works (w/ strawberry & cream,eggs and turkey bacon), Habla Diablo season potatoes and cranberry juice. I purchased a Groupon for $13 for $20 worth of food.

pfZI0GQwUzB_V0CVT6TZRg.text: Egg and I, WHY ARE YOU NOT IN CALIFORNIA?  Stopped by here when I was hungry and visiting Vegas. I ordered the stuffed french toast, and let me tell you, it did not dissappoint. Absolutely delicious. Was expecting hashbrowns as potatoes, nope. This place goes above and beyond and gives you some of the most delicious breakfast potatoes you will ever eat. Our server was extremely sweet. Wish I had gotten her name, she reccomended dishes to us and was super helpful. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.

RJHPwX3J1RWNraVDJa1UDw.text: Great service, very delicious foods, a big dishes and very friendly staffs.  Our family loves breakfast and when to so many places in different states, and this place is the one of the best place!  Love "Egg & I". I definitely come again!

fJ2HCb4JPvFQK-JBhgpKHQ.text: When we pulled up we noticed it was mad busy. There was a line out the door.  It still only took about 10 minutes to be seated.  Our waiter was awesome!  He was informative ( it was our first time there), attentive and friendly.  The food was delicious and filling.  The menu was extensive not just plain old breakfast.  I would definitely recommend this to friends. I actually told a couple friends that they need to have breakfast here the next time they are in the area.

SCIidbQ0LZwzhyf1ajRdpA.text: Really cool location, great food and service by Breeannda!  Make sure to bring some waiting time during breakfast rush hour!

rWrXixAOhz7DMTUbhyMhbQ.text: Excellent breakfast! I had the spinach Benny which was really good.  We also ordered the French toast sandwich.  Oscar was an attentive sever.  It had a really extensive menu of egg dishes. Usually you find a menu loaded with pancake plates, but this was at least 3 pages of eggs!

mkNvVtvrtTA6iz46l4nQAA.text: Best customer service ever! Tabatha was our waitress and she was amazing! She anticipated our needs and enhanced our dining experience. The food was great. The service was great!

fl3fFr5qZftBVfsYhBCV9A.text: Is it just me or does the person working the register always have an attitude. went there today (12/31/15)  and the lady was treating the people in front of me rudely. Tried to do the same with me, ridiculous!  Food is very good, waitress was awesome ! But please, for the registers girl ... When someone's check is $26 even and you get money and a "thank you goodbye," for my breakfast .. please don't say "really" as I'm half way out the door! The tip is on the table for my waitress! Not you.

qWc8RPBXDP_Zqd-CGNuM2g.text: We went on a Friday morning during Spring Break around 10:45am. It was just starting to fill up and we only waited about 5 minutes. The food was delicious and Linnea was our server, who was excellent. It's not that far from the strip and totally worth getting away from all of the over priced stuff on the strip.   I ordered the chicken fried steak scramble and added mushrooms and spinach. The rest of my party  had an omelet and blueberry pancakes which were all really good. I highly recommend this place!

HEGtaEzTo35cG8MQJc9l_A.text: When in another city eat like the locals. Don't stay on the strip in Vegas, sometimes the best food is worth driving for! And this place right here is no exception.  Even on a busy morning we were seated quickly. Our waitress was super friendly and quick to come by and see if we needed anything before she took our order.  The food came out and I was pleasantly surprised at the amount and the quality. The scramble I got was basically overflowing from the dish it was served in and the pancake, I shit you not, was spilling over the plate! haha.  Definitely going to be a stop in spot each time in LV.

UzSpBrp-6rVZ4iau9lKRJQ.text: One of the best place to eat breakfast or brunch in Vegas. Foods are great price and taste really good. They have a lot of servers so they don't drag you down. Paula was our server and she gave us great service!!

wdCu40T97Fwc9xYHNC5O5A.text: This place is awesome. I stop by every time I come to Vegas. It's worth the 20 min.  The server was great "Alexis" & manager was took her time to make sure everything was perfect.  I tip my hat to the cooks.  I brought friends here for first time. I'm sure they are coming back.

p_30tfFoazCP_xkKBjhCSg.text: It's ok place to eat! But their Banana bread is delicious! They are basically a regular type of breakfast place. Nothing special.

YUmGgnh73t06nzgm53zGpQ.text: So this morning, I had a sleep study and w decide to do breakfast early and came to one of favorite joints around.   Karla was excellent, she we barely awake and had issue ordering and she was patient and wonderful. szPnAIhvmXwkRDoAzCHAvA.text: This place is definitely amazing this is one of our favorite breakfast spot so we always come here if you come here I would definitely suggest getting the banana nut muffins because they're delicious also the key Largo crepe is really good as well

HzKcdpEGZwUBWjUA1cC54Q.text: The most amazing breakfast we have ever had!  I ordered the key Largo crepe and a french toast to share with the table.  It was amazing! The service was incredible.  Our waitress Liza was extremely attentive and a pleasure to have serve us. One of the runners asked if we needed anything and we asked for more tortillas. Then about 5 min later he came out with the tortillas and a loaf of banana bread as an apology for taking too long.  Which we thought was very nice even though it didn't take long at all.  We will definitely be eating here again. Thank you to our server and the staff!

z_ejfJEFHd5NJdB6foXDQg.text: This has always been my favorite breakfast place. Their works potatoes are the best. Ordered the mashed potato omelette with no bacon and my order came out perfectly and was delicious! Our server tabatha was very fast and friendly! Definitely recommend (:

zaiGiJryH0z8GEPkSssuGA.text: Me and my boyfriend have been here twice so far our first time being last week and while the portions are good overall I'm left with the feeling that he could have been better. Like if they just take it one notch up it could be great. All of there food is mush there is no texture I got the California crepe and idk how they call that a crepe it was way too think but the filling inside was good. While my boyfriend got one of the burritos but he could only eat half because the inside was throwing him off. On the other hand the service is great and I like how they have a lot of different kinds of creamers. It's the little things that count. This time around I got the strawberry cream cheese French toast and my boyfriend got a scramble the one with jalapenos and chorizo I like his more than my own because they used the pre-made strawberry flavored cream cheese so it just tasted like fake strawberries but the strawberry compote that was also on it was delicious. His omelette was very tasted but the chorizo bits were so small I couldn't even taste it. Overall it's a good experience and a nice little cozy breakfast place that's close to home

Ls1NVg_cOzV98pvY1dVfTg.text: It was our first time in Vegas and relied on yelp to find out what might be some great places for breakfast. We came across this cute and delicious spot and didn't regret anything! I ordered the banana walnut french toast and my boyfriend had a skillet. Both were extremely good! Potatoes are a must have. I repeat, YOU MUST HAVE THY POTATOES! Also, I asked for my ham to be warmed up b/c it was cold, but she offered to make me a new one. Minutes go by and turns out they forgot my ham. BUT DON'T FRET!
