ogLgi3weohOlQ-WIbmi0Kg.text: We were heading to Jamm's for breakfast and my wife said, I think we've been there before, so she suggested we try something else.  This place was on the way.  Turns out, we've eaten here before as well.  It's really good, portions are plenty from a guy who likes big portions.  I had the chicken fried steak breakfast and my wife had the stuffed French toast with sausage.  Telling the truth, I was really looking for something that came with pancakes because I like a big breakfast, this place really didn't have many options.  It didn't need it.  You get a mountain of little diced up potatoes that are nuggets of seasoned fried heaven, large main potions that pancakes would put you in food coma.  Coffee is really the only thing that I would say could be better.  Good, but not spectacular.

5KDFb1lxQQA4_-2Wnwhkew.text: Great food with incredibly reasonable prices. Carole Ann was the best with a special order. Off the beaten path but worth it.

ODoFO0Ddizt5o6Dz76jdbw.text: Yes it's good food and the waitresses are nice.

qE9QFB4nKgXlG30-roBZBQ.text: Awesome! Huge selections! Food was delicious. Banana muffins are the best. Stacy was are server and she went above and beyond in service. 5 stars service

rImAqdf1g9zucZ9vXSk0Aw.text: love this place! first ate here a few years ago before Yelp. Got to go last week and it was so good my mom wanted to eat there 2 days in a row! and my mom NEVER eats anywhere 2 days in a row.  highlights: giant portions, strong coffee, FAST SERVICE.  First day I ordered biscuits and gravy with potatoes and eggs. Was a little weirded out by the orange potatoes but when mixed with the gravy they were very good. The biscuits are freshly made and are amazing! Coffee was really good and strong here too.  I was very curious for the Cincy chili and got a side of that but I had to taste it and take it to go. It was AWESOME. Brought it home and ate it on a hot dog! AWESOME.  the service here was VERY fast and it was great but definitely hard for everywhere else we ate in Vegas to live up to.  lets see my other families food choices were all GIANT and everyone was really happy which is very unusual for us.  Second day I ordered the spam, rice and eggs. I think they called it Hawaiian special. Of course it was great. My niece tried the apple cinnamon pancakes but they were seriously big enough for 4 people to split. I think she finished 1 whole pancake. VERY fluffy and good.

wGyIzsAhQDlACpSlTp_soQ.text: The customer service deserves a 5 star +. My order got messed up and the waitress and the manager came out to apologize and I was not charged for my meal. They definitely went above and beyond to fix the problem!

MBr2xzhotPrOT-dWMjwRbA.text: MY FAVORITE BREAKFAST SPOT ON THE PLANET!!! Okay, maybe a little extreme, but you get my drift. I LOVE eating here. The staff is ALWAYS helpful, the food is always great, and the Chile Relleno Omelet is the bomb.com. PLUS --- the coffee is strong - its the perfect place to take visitors to a local Vegas spot, or just for your regular hangover cure - this place will do the trick JUST FINE, trust me, I know from experience lol

ei-rJ1bvcqGt_jBH8YoGWQ.text: Terrible service wait for more than 1 hour, when it was suppouse to be a "15 minutes wait" . I asked if for sure was going to be 15 minutes! They said "yes" no more than 15 for sure!!

971--seXc9kAwMNF09MDnQ.text: It was okay nothing special...pancakes were dry didn't eat it. Got that with bacon eggs and potatoes and toast! The staff was good friendly, it took a while for the food to come out but it was expected for a Sunday. Food wasn't terrible but I wouldn't come back.

s3iu2KXfHlCZcy1747PLTw.text: Love this spot for a nice Sunday Brunch!  ...And I am obviously not the only one in town who feels the same way.  Its always nice to know that a place you love so much is appreciated by others, and thats the feeling you get as you pull into the Egg and I on Sahara. Immediately you will notice a group of people waiting patiently outside of the restaurant for the next available seat. When I go, being a smoker, I usually go out on the patio to enjoy the fresh air and a smoke with my coffee and book. The staff is so welcoming. I am a frequent visitor so they know where I would like to sit, escort me to a table of my choosing, provide an ashtray, and offer the heating lamp if it is cold outside. Always friendly, you are not just communicated with by your server, but others in the staff that notice your presence. Nobody walks around with blinders on. You feel as if they are there to enjoy your breakfast with you.   Speaking of the breakfast; it is the best in town! The wait is never long, and the food is always fresh and hot. Makes one wonder what kind of army is stacked away in the kitchen. Spinning out plate after plate of unique dishes that dont only taste great, but are piled high on your plate, makes me want to walk into the kitchen and give its staff a huge hug. There is something on the menu for everyone's taste, and, unlike many chain breakfast places who will remain unnamed, you actually get fresh ingredients, and flavor without frou frou toppings of berries and whip cream to try and doll it up. I find myself looking at others plates and wondering what they are having with delicious anticipation of trying it the next time. My signature dish is Brads Special, and I almost never stray from a favorite, but the fact that I feel safe to do so at The Egg and I says a lot.  A pleasant "hello how are you" greets you at the door, and a friendly "Thank you, have a nice day" assures a future visit. If The Egg and I added a few floors atop its building, and offered rooms like a Bed and Breakfast, you better believe there would never be an available occupancy.

0I2KCvppo46-czSuc9a7ag.text: My family's FAV breakfast/ lunch place.  Love the servers and could eat the fresh banana nut muffins all day long.  Fav dishes so far are the Tuna melt with avocados and the hubby likes all the skillets.  Extensive menu with lots of variety.  We've been here multiple times and have never ordered anything that wasn't really tasty.  Portions are big so don't be surprised if you have left overs.  Ordering some extra banana muffins to take with you will be worth it! If you're wondering if it's worth the drive since its off the Strip, you should still try it.  We're locals that would love to keep this place a secret, but it's too good to not share.

kyZwhH5eJ3EO5ofbPQcpKA.text: For the hungry, this place serves up the nice sized portion.  For the picky, the food tastes great.  For those who like flexibility, these guys entertain reasonable substitutions!    I just happened by this place on a Saturday morning.  There was a 15-20 minute wait for a table, which can be an annoyance, or it can be an excellent endorsement for patience.  My wife had a four-egg multi-cheese omelette, and tiny as she is, she ate every bit, washing it down with coffee (that was attentively refilled!).  It came with choice of potatoes and a super-delicious muffin.  I had a specialty omelette that was filled with spicy veggies and cheese.  When it came time to kick the spuds to the side, the waitress offered fruit, tomatoes, or fruit and tomatoes!  The fruit was chosen, fresh, sliced, and nicely arranged.  I had the coffee too, and the waitress was never stingy when more creamers were requested.  Such good service.  I can see why this place has people waiting for a seat.  This place has the best egg-dish menu I've ever seen.  The price of most dishes is in the $10.00 or less range.  They have plasma TV's strategically placed on walls, so you can watch sports if the conversation crashes.  It's all good. This is the best non-buffet breakfast I've had in Las Vegas.

VsTPgxk3PGPKiHAjJ21iEw.text: Great breakfast and lunch.  My wife and I had the Cobb salad.  Very fresh ingredients and very tasty. Our server was Kathleen and she was very courteous and friendly.  This was the location at 2490 E Sunset Road in Las Vegas.

xvYZ0HoBxKQn290JYDvxtw.text: Very friendly welcome and service by Thanayra, food excellent: Waffle works & sausage verygood, "half" pancake stack (half is a szrong understatement though...) but pancakes a bit on the heavy side, could be more fluffy, Veggie crepes with avocado fulling excellent, chili omelett really very good well spiced, i particularly liked their "works potatpes"...

Ygy0yKD7PneCM2BoUoOMGg.text: Food was excellent, and large portions.  Menu items can be customized to dietary requirements.  Our server Bree was friendly and efficient, providing excellent service.  We will be back again for sure.

bAwqI_k57U5YcZFsRQtlPQ.text: Let's be honest here: the whole Vegas breakfast buffet phenomenon gets really old really fast.  Yes, it's all you can eat for $9.99, but how much can you really eat?  And how much do you want to eat every single morning?  Don't you want someone to bring you food instead of trying not to spill your bowl of oatmeal on a slow 80-year-old grandma in an "I live to bingo" sweater?  If you do, take a short drive down W. Sahara Ave to Egg and I.  You will not be disappointed.  Inconspicuously located in a nondescript strip mall, Egg and I provides a perfectly casual, hearty and homey breakfast without the pompousness and the hoopla of The Strip.  By now you're probably wondering what "Egg" looks like.  Well, Egg looks kind of like Humpty Dumpty, and "I" looks just like "Egg."  Just look on their website.  Might as well call the whole place "2 Eggs," although it would probably detract from the restaurant's country kitchen charm.    We came in around 9:30 am on Saturday morning, and the place was absolutely packed.  We got a table right away, but every party that came in after 9:45 had to wait a little.  We had just gotten into town, and I was glad they brought us a whole pot of coffee.  You'd better believe I took advantage of the proximity and the unlimited availability of good coffee.  Even the yellow cups with the company logo were cute enough to use at home.  We couldn't quite decide on what to order, and our waitress graciously waited, while offering valuable suggestions along the way.  The menu is extensive and the portions are huge, so....  Also, breakfast is the most important meal of the day, so you don't want to make this decision lightly.  There was nothing light about my breakfast, however.  The Ultimate Skillet is not for the weak...that much I know.  A generous layer of breakfast potatoes had a Cajun flavor to it.  Paprika and something else gave those potatoes a light crunch and a reddish hue - pretty and delicious.  The Ultimate Skillet also featured mounds of sausage, ham and bacon, mixed in with bell peppers, onions and cheese.  The skillet wouldn't be complete with 2 scrambled eggs on top.  WOW.    We also ordered one large pancake to share, but after getting through 3/4 of the skillet, I wasn't hankering for a pancake.  I did try it, and it was fluffy and sweet, but it was just too much.  I was ready to throw in the towel, which almost never happens to me.  On any other day, I can finish any breakfast, and have some of yours, too, but the Ultimate Skillet proved to be a bit much.  Order at your own risk.  That's a LOT of food for $9.95.  Great breakfast in a quaint setting?  I will be sure to make it my regular Vegas breakfast destination.

ck7S7p_LfzqgXWJ_PNchyw.text: The fiesta skillet and strawberry cream french toast are amazing! Check in on foursquare to get a tasty and free banana nut muffin.

9NOtPyVVCcamPKelWH36xQ.text: The best breakfast place I have ever eaten at.  I love the rancho potatos, biscuits and gravy, and the gigantic blueberry pancakes.  Its amazing how fast the service is.  Even when there is a long line your seated in no more then like 20 minutes.  There is also a 35% military discount!!!

g8wM048u34mkvIDQK4zz3g.text: Love the egg & I! Consistently delish breakfast every time we visit. Try the chicken fried steak & fiesta skillets. Lovely service, especially Stacie :)

sN3Hlf-BUaZNuZbHpYzJRg.text: Wonderful breakfast - what a gem of a place! Our server Staci was friendly, the banana nut muffin was to die for, and one of the best omlettes I have ever had!  My new breakfast place whenever I visit Vegas!

8prj3ZTqN_Nc5rfdqWQFCw.text: really good salsa. portions are enormous. Food came out clean (little grease) and was delicious.  Prices are a tad high, but goes along with giant portions.

dSKJn2AAfh9EY57A15oBGA.text: My in-laws came to visit for Father's Day weekend (2016) and on Saturday June the 18th my father-in-law wanted a worthy hefty breakfast badly. We all got halfway through our meals and almost needed to go boxes already so hefty indeed especially with the seasoned potatoes they serve with most of the meals. We decided to give Egg & I a try and we are in awe! MY father-in-law had the Blackened prime rib benny and he automatically fell in love. My husband had the Cordon bleu skillet as he is a huge cordon bleu fan and he now knows exactly where to go to have such a delicious breakfast. I had the Cabo breakfast burrito, the sauce that covered it went extremely well with the burrito. I am a HUGE fan of Banana muffins so of course I got one before our meals came, we all shared it and it came warm and SO soft. When we arrived it was full house WITH a couple families waiting in front of us. Not even 10 minutes and we were seated. Not even an hour and we were on our way out the door fed, bill paid and happy while it was STILL packed, fast service. Only one thing, you guys should get bigger Orange juice cups, it's about half the size of the water cups and it's good juice so it was gone in 2 mins.

vePQffEhHoYUgsbYbSxD0A.text: Such a well crafted chicken country steak, amazeballz. Ashley was key to the deliciousness, loved everything she served, including splitting my bread order in 2. Got the sour dough and rye. Non nom nom

nLQh19wOpvyYmWatBuhkgw.text: We've been waiting for almost 20 minutes and still no one came to our table to take our order. They just walk by and continue to go as if we are not waiting. We flipped to where they said if u need service n still nothing. If you are wanting to eat I suggest going somewhere else. Never again. We ended up leaving not ordering anything

bY9SqhuwlvX6RS8VG69JRQ.text: Great service, food is pretty good. Defiantly get a craft of OJ if you have 2 cups. Potatoes are really good, Eggs Bennie not terrible.

2iXMkqJOHSVmSlnUZjQ4KA.text: I haven't been to an Egg & I/Egg Works since I was in Arizona back in '07.  I love this place!!   It's one of those bfast places where there are mugs on the table and the server brings you a giant pot of coffee and leaves it with you at your disposal.  There were different types of pre-packaged cream and sugars, including hot sauces, ketchup, and a little egg sign which you can flip over if you need servicing.  Not as ingenious as the button at Korean bbq places, but it works!  Most entrees come with a side of toast or homemade banana nut muffin.  I'm not a big fan of banana nut but my god, theirs is just divine. Spongey, soft, moist, slightly sweet and with just the perfect flavor of fresh banana flavor and a little hint of crunch from the nuts.  The nuts aren't bitter either, as some walnuts can be and it was just pure perfection.  BH and I went a little buckwild (as we always do) and we ordered three dishes: eggs benedict florentine, a half order of corned beef hash, and the stuffed french toast with eggs and bacon.  The benedict was awesome and was smothered in creamy hollandaise sauce.  The eggs were soft and runny but the English muffin was still crispy and chewy.  The stuffed french toast was pretty good.  BH gobbled up the entire plate whereas I had just a bite or two.  I thought there was too much egg and not enough bacon, but BH told me it was great with maple syrup.  I like sweet meats and breads, but I haven't gotten accustomed to sweet scrambled eggs yet, so I never tried it dipped in sticky sweet maple. Finally, the corned beef hash was very fresh and I could definitely tell it was homemade and not from a can.  The chunks of potato were creamy and starchy while the chunks of meat were flavorful, salty, and a little reminiscent of dog food (but in a good way).  The over easy egg on top made it even more delectable.  Finally, one of the best parts of the meal, besides the banana nut muffin, were their ranch potatoes.  They are roasted to a perfect crunch and seasoned with some sort of red powder - possibly paprika for a bit of smokiness?  They were so damn good, that even past my stuffing point, I kept stabbing at the potatoes so I could get every last bit in my mouth.  Needless to say, BH  and I were nearly bursting by the time we left Egg & I.  I call that a sign of good breakfast and a good start to a day.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order of Corned Beef Hash
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict Florentine

kZz96GQ2jQ5IDe_J-188qA.text: Egg-Zactly what you want in a breakfast place only 2 miles off the strip.  We got drawn in by the great reviews and the buy one get one free coupon in the current Las Vegas coupon booklets that are in every taxi everywhere so we whipped on over .  What SEPARATES the eggs here from other breakfast joints is the foods we tried were prepared with care and were NOT GREASY , YEAH success! and they offer many things that surprise you that are different that you won't see anyplace else also VERY REASONABLY PRICED .  No yoke we had the chile Relleno omelet  (a whole green chili stuffed with cheese inside your omelet covered with sauce and cheese) and the chorizo skillet eggs  , both were enough for two people each and both were tasty delish! I picked the house made banana muffin over the toast and it was a really GOOD real banana muffin not a mix .  This place cracks me up , they are GOOD eggs!

XZLU6SRl33i1afODN9zeXg.text: In town for a week on vacation, used a Groupon and the service was so good first time I came back again with my buddy.  Chance was our server on 2nd visit and just as excellent as our first visit.  Highly recommend especially sitting on patio.

M7mHmCJktE-GMn_M43frmw.text: Awesome service, Chance rocked it! Get the skillet if you're hungry.  Keep up the good work guys!

HlZH9q9vQKoBUOrMB-lnCQ.text: I love this place! I always get the vege Benny cuz it is soooooo delicious :) and our server Staci was the best!! I would give it 5 stars if it wasn't always so friggin cold in here.

U7lu8e1hrgsdJA1F5gPufg.text: Egg & I, Good food and great service!  I can't ask for more.  I'm not sure if this is a mom & pop store, but it definitely felt like one.  When my party and I got there at 1pm on a Saturday, we didn't have much of a wait.  The portions were big enough to share.  Ambiance is diner style, but neater.  I love the fact that they have a yellow & black egg attention sign on each table so you won't need to wave down a waitress.  I left very satisfied and I intend on going back whenever I am in town again.

8p2KshmApoebUnBZUYozow.text: This place was pretty good.  I know others have given it 5 stars but I only tried it once and had the corn beef and hash it was good, different then I'm use to.  I wouldn't reorder it however.  Its not like its from a can or anything, its shredded ham and the flavor is different then what I believe Hash should taste like  The Banana Nut muffin was pretty good, but again I have had better.  The servers are nice and the place is adorable.    However if you want your Socks knocked of for breakfast go to the Hash House A Go Go, its a little further West up Sahara and on the right.  That place has the best breakfast I have ever had. Overall I must say Egg & I is a good place.  A  decent breakfast, however for egg critiques take a look at the pictures, unless you order an eggs Benny they over cook most of there eggs.

alKt7fgaV4CBcKWR7GoxXg.text: Now my second favorite breakfast in Las Vegas (Hash House is #1). The place doesn't look like much situated in a rundown strip mall several miles off the strip. I am thrilled we picked this place though, they have earned all their outstanding Yelp reviews. Excellent service and excellent food.

l2RRkRz_ci97OA2ypu4XfQ.text: Egg-cellent food & service. I ordered the Loco Moco, a Hawaiian stapled & gravy is the secret. Great job guys. Karla was super friendly & patient w/ our massive group during prime time brunch on sunday. She was soo kind as to anticipate our needs, service was efficient & everything came out hot & correct! Good work guys. Will stop by on our next visit soon!

UwGJp29hG4BLBng8xCNVGw.text: Amazing!!!!! Great service, delicious food. If you are in the area you must try this place out. Skillets, omelette are very good. Fresh baked muffins are delish. We found this place last year and heading out to Vegas this weekend, for sure we will be stoping by.

GLxxQvJoUjvWSkEUpUfVlg.text: Didn't care for the blackened prime rib benny.  The meat was diced & the red peppers made it sour :(

Sn8h619UlxaZqSDV0Oskrg.text: Awesome breakfast. Look forward to coming when I am in town. I always get the key largo crepe. Would love one of these in San Jose. Came on a Sunday once and it was packed so plan to wait. Week days are better.

tqIKs4MLeryl-S8eRrIF5A.text: This place is amazing!  I've been dying to try it ever since driving by once and seeing the line out the door.  We dined on a Friday morning around 11 and there was a wait of about 15 minutes.  The menu is cute and read likes a newspaper.   The portions are huge and we split 3 dishes between the 4 of us.   Catherine's Scramble: chicken, mushrooms, spinach, feta and artichokes.  I was sold on all the ingredients and the dish was amazing and flavorful.  Bacon, avocado and cheese omelette: full of bacon flavor and packed with avocados.  Usually when I get avocado with my omelette it is served sparingly with just a few pieces on top.  They were not stingy with it and filled it completely.  Corned beef hash: the good stuff, not canned corn beef.  Eggs and toast were included.  All the dishes were served with a side of ranch potatoes, which is amazing in itself.  I would eat the potatoes alone!   Priced well with large portions.  I will definitely be back to try other dishes.     .

5lRfbIKjGm0vLWNM_29v9w.text: Great breakfast for lunchtime. Breeannda us a great waitress.  It was worth coming out of the strip for some normal restaurant time.  Turn around is quick. No waiting despite all the people at lunch rush.

meOJHFWtWuEhWKBuny8c1Q.text: LOVE THIS PLACE! I think I have found my new favorite breakfast place. Move over, Hash House!  I've been wanting to go here for a long time and was so happy that my friend's house is only a few blocks away! I got our food to go since we had to start driving back home to LA and it only took 10 minutes.   I ordered the bacon avocado and cheese omelette. Yum! The ranch potatoes on the side were effing awesome. The seasoning had just the right amount of kick to it. I gobbled everything up. You get to choose between toast and the banana nut muffin so of course I got the muffin. Holy moly! Delicious! It was so soft and moist I could have eaten 5 more. I wish I got some to go. I don't even like bananas!  Joe got Kay's special which has spinach, swiss, artichoke. It was pretty good but I liked my ABC better. :)  Get the orange juice. So good! Just the right amount of pulp, sweetness, and tartness.

xoKTwmmjKDn0rHZ-hM1lhg.text: Found this place driving through to Utah. We had a party of 17 and everyone loved their breakfast. The food and service were awesome. This will be our new go to breakfast spot while in Vegas

VwZAPENWxlKVudbbnZRxiA.text: The banana muffin was up there with sex! The most delicious, gooey, beautiful thing I have eaten this trip. The carrot cake French toast was pretty yummy, with a warm sweet apple sauce on top. The noco loco also very  good and surprisingly as I remember eating it in Hawaii. The only thing that could have used some help was the michelada (they use tomato juice instead of Clamato!). The service was excellent, and our server Angel hit the experience out of the ball park with her charm, friendliness, prompt service and suggestions.

fHE5hFJUuof7jANDHR5gEw.text: Great service.  The staff was very accommodating .  Best banana bread muffin.  Definitely exceeded expectations.  Ordered Belgian waffles.  Could have been cooked a little longer.  Not crispy melts in your mouth kind.  Will not order this again.  Will go back but will try egg dishes next time we are in Las Vegas again

iqkZyPmDZfd6R9fMGP3MiA.text: I met a friend for breakfast and let me tell you it was 10a and the place was constantly full, even the patio with it's misters was full until about 11:15a. They seated us very quickly.  The menu has so much to choose from.  My friend ordered the parfait cup with fruits, granola and yogurt.  She said it was quite tasty. I chose the plain French toast w/turkey sausage, maple syrup and apple compote. They were perfectly done. Our waiter was attentive and the noise level was not at all overwhelming.  I will definitely recommend and will come back again. Oh yes, and the banana nut muffin was every bit as good as others had mentioned. It comes warm and soft to the table. Worth the trip all by itself with a glass of juice.  I would definitely recommend to others and will go back either there or one of the other restaurants owned by same Chef in Summerlin.

U7gf65KWuY0hZ3y4yUWLXg.text: Oh cute place and so cozy for breakfast! Waited about 45 minutes as this place was packed!! Good sign right? Right and worth the wait! Had the ham and cheese omelette which was a very generous size and could be easily shared as it comes with a muffin or toast, and potatoes. Yum! My son had the chocolate chip pancakes. Need I say more? Sorry, don't remember what hubby had but I know it was good. Can't go wrong at this place. Prices reasonable considering the portion sizes are HUGE!

Sb5w92euqv3Ro66kV-I54A.text: If you're in Vegas this place is worth the trip! Saturday morning around 9am, the place was packed! Went with the girlfriend before we hiked at Red Rocks Canyon. Waited about 10 minutes and we were seated at a table with a waitress ready to take our order. Started with coffees and they gave a full thermos! A nice touch so we can pour our own refills. The table has a simple system to flip a sign if you need anything and the waitress comes right over. We each got the free muffins with the check in, and they are delicious! Moist, not too sweet, and great with coffee. We both ordered a skillet entree and they were great. Only critique being they come with a lot of sauce on top, so maybe ask for less or on the side. The GF's sauce was a salsa and it over powered the dish. Mine was more of a cream/cheese sauce, and I could've used a touch less. Other than that the meals were delicious, the service was awesome, and the atmosphere is great. They kindly filled up our water bottles so we'd stay hydrated while hiking. On our way out the line was still long, but they're efficient operation is worth the short wait!

v4irTU-n8unWbvh535jfLg.text: After seeing and hearing so much great stuff about this place we decided to try it. We came in on a late Sunday morning for breakfast. We didn't know we should have called ahead to be placed on "the list". So our estimated wait time for amy seating for 2 was 45 minutes. We gave our info and waited for our turn to be seated.  We observed the hostess be informed several times there were multiple open tables for 2, 3, or 4 guests. Yet she didn't send messages to the waiting customers until she was told by multiple people several times about the open tables.  After we were seated our server was good. She gave us enough time to look at the menu and place our orders.  My husband had the chicken fried steak and I had a savory crepe (I don't know the name). Our food came out fairly quickly for how busy the place was. Husband said his food was great. Mine was okay. I was thinking the turkey was going to be cubed not shredded. The guacamole inside the crepe was good. The spicy potato cubes that came on the side were good.  Only real bummer about the service was that the bloody Mary I ordered never came out. Our server realized this about the time I was finishing my food.  Overall this was a cute fun place to go. Totally recommend calling to get on the list if you plan to visit on a weekend. Don't expect to be seated right away even when you get a text your table is ready

GhTamjod-x76xQtB4w0U8Q.text: Always stop in when in town! Soooo delicious!  Banana muffins like none I've ever tasted before.

o2rQw7n3wSdq4UOoFvcCWA.text: This is the place to break the fast while your in Vegas. The casinos don't have jack on this place. Only a 10 minute drive from the strip. Good place for locals and tourist alike. The staff was excellent and the food was some of the best morning grub I had in a while. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone. The omelets are great and healthy serving. Don't skip out on this spot while in town.

J8QZIuFWttOIOsBmLzY34Q.text: So - my bestie who's a local told me and my other bestie to go to this place on our way out of Vegas.  I'm SO happpy she told us about this...  I got the shredded corned beef hash with eggs.  WOW is all I can say. So good, exactly what I wanted.   For the price, the portions are large.  Total deal.  Hazelnut coffee was fabulous.    The menu is huge, so if eggs aren't your thing there is plenty of other things on the menu to pick.  That was probably the hardest thing for us - was to actually pick something off the huge menu.    Clearly this a locals place, it's off the strip in a strip mall.  We missed it when we were driving there.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash, sourdough toast plus a banana nut muffin.

ztZ21r_chVBAGsZlv7nz_Q.text: As far as breakfast goes, this place was the best of the best.  The country fried steak was tender and the gravy was delicious. The eggs are super buttery, which I don't prefer but I know lots of people like it that way.  The potatoes were crisp and delicious, and the seasoning on them was perfect.  I wish I had tried the muffin, I looked around with envy as everyone around us had one!  My husband had the stuffed french toast, and absolutely loved the cook on it. Neither of us could finish our plates, they were very generous portion sizes.

NZ5nlTyn2EN-ZVKRSInLYA.text: Came here a lot for breakfast and it's always been a good one. Also tried their burger steak and gravy and it's really yummy so came back the next day and ordered another one

A2WjRO8Ds7uIcdI16EECug.text: Curtis is the one! He's a really pro service man. Go for it.. everything is superior.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deliciosísimísimo!

39rSR0mNiJZthcjUWbiLow.text: This place had a lot of variety in their menu. One of the best omelette S I've ever had. They have the most amazing banana nut bread. It was my favorite part of the meal, and best part it was free with a Yelp check in!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional eggs Benedict
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids pancakes

RScidaII7ob5vx69Zj2YpQ.text: Pleasant place to grab breakfast.  It's not on the strip.  It was nice to get away from the strip and have breakfast in a place that could be in almost any town I suppose in most of the states.  Service was fine, food was alright.  Not sure the food was that great to make a special trip out to this place, but if you are looking to get some good reasonable breakfast this place was fine.    Had the avocado and bacon omelet, which was good.  Potatoes were a bit dryer than I would have preferred.    Kids had the mouse pancakes, which they liked.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g496Yh5hokAfLm0ta55YzA.text: An early arrival to Vegas gives us an opportunity to go off the strip and enjoy a couple of breakfast eateries. The Egg and I has a cute name and an old cowboy ranch feel to it. The menus are newspapers and the servers are friendly!  Food (4 Stars): I ordered the corned beef hash with over medium eggs and the banana nut muffin. I'm usually not a banana nut fan, but this muffin changed my mind. It was full of spice and flavor, you can definitely taste the banana. The corned beef hash was pretty good with the shredded style corned beef. The seasoned potatos were DELICIOUS and I wish I could've had more.  We ordered the Cinncinati 4 Way plate with onions. It is pretty much spaghetti pasta with chili and onions on top. Our group was intrgued by the ingredients so we ordered it. It was amazing!!! Who knew that chili and spaghetti pasta can go together so well?? Topped with cheese and onions, this is my dish!  We couldn't finish all of our food due to the large portions, so definitely come with an appetite. The food is still good after being reheated.  Service (4 Stars): Our cute server was friendly and humorous. She frequently checked up on us and refilled our cups, she even got us another table because ours was cramped.  Bottom line: Hungover? Hungry? Feeling like stuffinf your face? Egg ans I will satisfy it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mR9FerbH2c2MIVVR2F4JmQ.text: great food as always but really have to work on the waiting period =) but its all good since the food make up the wait =)

2YCH2DgOV1K01CICo_4Ong.text: Was awesome....large portions at a reasonable price...had a little wait..like 5 min...

3K5YiRb2ocW4ncHFGPW0UA.text: Great service & great food! Our waiter was friendly & attentive. We have a child with an egg allergy so most breakfast places are not an option for us. Nice to see they have a full lunch menu to choose from. We ordered 4 meals & their portions were generous. Bookmarked this restaurant & will definitely go back when we're in Vegas.

s5guq9-uyFR_2pN3yVMw5g.text: Worth the wait. Tables turn over fast so the wait was not too long. Good food and good valure.

hXFPWD7B8EmAZUCsq0468Q.text: Ohhh this place is soo good! I've tried the eggs Benedict, ultimate skillet, pancakes and the muffin. Yes, it was a lot of food. Yes, I felt like a heifer after. But it was so worth it.  I also brought my puppy dog bitch and she sat quietly outside with us. I like this place and can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benedict, ultimate skillet and buttermill pancake. Yummieeee

AT4cLQ8oXJlzIrHb1vX5BQ.text: I really like this place.  Casual, cheap and good breakfast.  Most of your breakfast dishes come with a choice of toast or banana muffin.  Get the muffin.  Their are so many choices, it's hard to make a decision.  I've had the Loco Moco, pancakes, omelettes, french toast, country style breakfasts.  Popular place so you will wait for your tables.  Parking is abundant.

0JfJ3eM8p6JjB0tVKMAObg.text: Tucked away in a little strip mall, this little gem packs a powerful punch. I don't think there is a bad thing on the menu, except they have Coke and not Pepsi. Ask to sit in Amanda's section, she took very good care of us.

rZDkv18J-_aatH6mj02qFw.text: Good food, good service!  We had the banana bread French toast, fruit plate, corned beef hash and steak and eggs.  We were all stuffed and satisfied with our yummy meals!  Oscar provided great service, too!

ZD7JeMtqs_UYpuGx4L-Yyw.text: Best breakfast restaurant in Las Vegas that nobody talks about.  It isn't a coincidence that their reviews are so solid.  Great food, great service and great prices.  All the waitresses are good but Carole Ann is the real deal.  Super friendly and easy going!  Do yourself a favor and give this place a try.  You won't be disappointed.

4dF8v6wzIAOOH2HLaVDl_Q.text: Amazing, excellent food, great service, great price. A great find during our vacation in Las Vegas, no wonder it's highly rated. Most definitely will come back.

XdIovo-qQoG8lp0-GrAjPA.text: This is the best. Have not been here in quite some time. Eggcellent service from Raul.

jcMwviX8Mt1WWkzb--y5Kw.text: Ok. Love this chain. Not sure about this location. They seem to always be busy. Saying that....   Hire more help. Train your staff to help each others customers not ignore them.  Once our server Ashley came over things improved. Food came out quick. Tasted great. Score went from a * to a *** only because the ball started rolling.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fiest Skillet

5neXiRNSGHVw7lcRBvhXvw.text: Classic Benny was great. our server Paula was fantastic! This was our first time there. But we did come back for breakfast two days later. Great food, great service. Loved the patio. Recommend for breakfast anytime. Thanks for making our time in Vegas a great one

KgBBHkMqw1WX4e-vIMx2yw.text: Love, Love, Love this place!!! Every time I go its so delicious. Especially the steak and eggs. And the service is fantastic. Thanks Liliana!

opHWmJh3PIHUDyqomd8YfA.text: Great home style food served by a friendly staff. The banana nut muffin is awesome! Debra was a fantastic and friendly face. Great place for vegetarians! Will be back!

3x-Te7bBodBu_R493aHuUg.text: Super great service. The second we walked in we were seated Imeadiatly outside, there was full house but the wait wast not long at all.  Chance was our server and she greeted us so warmly. Chance is the reason I will be coming back!!

9h-lt0EMOS573mzncX_Omg.text: What a great breakfast place! We had about a 20 minute wait on a Saturday at 915am which was expected.  It was our first time there and our fabulous waitress Alexa brought us all these delicious, warm and fresh banana nut muffins for free since it was our first time! The Bloody Mary and coffee were both good! On our table we had huevos rancheros, the biscuits and gravy and the avocado bacon omelette--all were great. Portions were more than fair and the food was fresh and tasted delicious! We will definitely head back here on our next Vegas trip!

oGlu6OBsD0XVD6nTGf9s3g.text: This is a wonderful breakfast spot!!! The customer service is impeccable!! This place is always crowded but worth the wait.

zxrWBUZL1uUeT3WxHN0b0Q.text: The eggsperience was eggsactly what I had hoped for.  I had an eggsempalry server "Genesis" who I would love to see win the Disney trip!  Eggselent service and a great menu!

YsaPibQGznT_htpq0LQHxQ.text: The food here is amazing. It was hard to pick what we wanted because everything here tastes so good! Jessica was an excellent server very friendly quick and efficient. She was awesome ask for Jessica as your server.

3yG30XWqYfIuaY5iAnd-Nw.text: I went for breakfast with my husband at this place during our last visit to Vegas.Their menu is full of delicious breakfast options. And the banana walnut muffins are the best I ve ever ate.

ujZmLyO4YutPuMbQ11PPYA.text: Great service, fresh, generous portions and so cheap! Great locals spot if you want to get off the strip. So glad I found this little gem while visiting Vegas.

dNhvTaEui-4ALgVf6mDKWw.text: Placed was packed and after having breakfast we know why! Eggs Benedict amazing. Even the coffee was good!

E0GBx51LgLNp_fgqKoLhxQ.text: I'm always happy to find a local place in LV to have meals.  Sometimes being on the strip is just too congested and I crave some sense of normalcy... and buffets are just too much food and too expensive.  Hence I visited the Egg & I.  And it was closed.  Computers Down. :(  When I was finally able to return I looked through my newspaper style menu and was torn between the biscuits and gravy or a omelet.  I tried the artichoke omelet and sub'd for some mushrooms.  I love the fetta cheese on top and the fresh tomatoes.  One thing that lacked... I couldn't taste the artichoke... and it could probably use more mushrooms.  It was a great idea however probably would taste better with bacon and mushrooms or ham or something to that effect... Something you can actually taste.  The potatoes were really good, home fries... and more of a fries taste since they had a TON of seasoning on it.  I would prefer less seasoning, and have a bottle to the side if you want more.  Servers were very nice, there was a line of people waiting to be seated.  It was a good experience, I think I like Blueberry Hill more, but I wouldn't be opposed to returning here again.

Sjee4dnlKr-x7T6K8Zd4Aw.text: I am a local and I come here almost everyday to see my favorite people and waitress Karla.  Great place to go everyone won't be disappointed.

Zo9_dxBgzm5E9mHcx0lTwQ.text: We went to this spot on a recommendation from a friend. It didn't disappoint. The food was awesome. The staff was amazing. Definitely in the breakfast rotation for my trips to Vegas. Definitely take the free banana muffin they offer. It's awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili Rellenos Omelette

-J0JWUYqbbrCTvpmxiOkhQ.text: A good way to end the w-"egg"-end is some good brunch!  Food: Chipotle Turkey Benny  Price: $11.75  Ratings: 3.5/5; flavor was there! Definitely tasted the chipotle sauce and they gave a generous amount of turkey. However, I felt that they gave a little too much of the chipotle hollandaise sauce, and I felt that the sauce was a bit watery, which made the English muffin more on the soggier end : / I also tried their Classic Benny, and the sauce was similar! Nonetheless, they give a lot of Hablo Diablo seasoned potatoes, which can be taken to go! HAHAH I also love their banana nut muffin, which is free if you check in! Shout out to our server, she hooked us up with four muffins without checking in! LOL Service was pretty good. There can be a bit of a wait on weekends. There is parking in the lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipotle Turkey Benny: $11.75
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipotle Turkey Benny: $11.75

rqKqgv3oIUHAm7ZNSxuJkA.text: Service here started off very slow.  6 min waiting for just the drink order.  Italian skillet was very tasty half portion was offered and more than enough for me.  Highly recommend this place for breakfast

GxNzQyF7KbOZi4DVssPeHQ.text: Had the Corned Beef Hash and eggs. I ordered the eggs over easy, they were over medium. The Corned Beef Hash looked like someone chewed it and spit it out into the plate! It was like they threw all the ingredients into a food processor and pureed it. I was able to some of it but it looked horrid, so I ate mostly the potatoes and the banana muffin which was very good. The coffee and orange juice were good and fresh. The server was friendly and delivered my order fast. I can't believe that a restaurant that has been around for so long makes the most horrid Corn Beef Hash that I have ever seen! A can of Hormel CB Hash would have been a welcome site compared to what I was served.

8ecAWjskjBnPmjz3yQ-o3w.text: We came on a Friday morning at 10am and waited only about 10 minutes. There is a private parking lot but its not huge so it's tough to find a spot during the busier hours.  Check in to get a complimentary banana nut muffin! We really liked it; it was moist and tasty. They seem to be really popular among locals so make sure you get a taste! Also, shout out to our waitress Karla; she was super attentive and friendly!  A couple tidbits: they have a dog friendly patio, they have an egg-shaped thing on each table that you can flip when you need something from the waiter which is really convenient, you pay your bill at the front of the restaurant, and they sell pre-packaged containers of their seasoning at the front.   Speaking of the seasoning, I ordered the works omelette ($11.99) which was delicious and meaty which is just the way I like it but the star of the show was BY FAR the potatoes. They're so flavorful, addicting, and just seasoned so well. They're cut into small pieces so they're crispy and there's a ton of flavor packed in every bite. I couldn't stop myself from eating them and I constantly found myself thinking, "These are some damn good breakfast potatoes, probably the best I've ever had." Some people might not like how it's seasoned so much, but I loved it.  This is now my go-to breakfast place in Vegas. It's not on the strip and would require a drive but it's worth for those potatoes.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free banana nut muffin when you check in!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works omelette ($11.99)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4ke-qo6U3bRQOSxvi4ct2Q.text: I love starting my day with a solid breakfast, but it's tough for me to justify spending for it. This place has a mom & pop feel to it and they have newspaper menus that offers a wide variety. Tried a couple different things from the omelette to my most recent order: BYOB (build your own burger)   The prices are fair and the quality of the food is a little on the bland side, but decent...definitely not trying to eat here every week, but wouldn't mind if this was how I started my day.   Make sure to check into yelp for a free muffin that's baked fresh! They have a spacious indoor area which can get pretty noisy and an outdoor patio. The service I'm sure is great if you're a regular or a familiar face, but whatever otherwise. If you pick to eat outside, just keep in mind you probably won't get checked on too frequency (could be good or bad depending on you)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BYOB (build your own burger)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free yelp check-in muffin

nJXOmYAYJ8blz6lmiemEGQ.text: Awesome  place to eat I have had biscuits and gravy and the bacon burger. Both were very good and the service was good as well.

Cn-elK6O683gD5ilkyenoA.text: After several days of eating at what the California and Main Street casinos had to offer, it was a relief to find a place that can cater to healthier (mind you, I didn't say healthy) choices when eating out.  It's a little off the beaten path if you're driving back to LA like we were.  You're heading north for about 5 or 6 miles to get brunch at Egg & I.    It's worth it.  Plenty of parking and this place was hopping by the time we left.  It was a Monday morning, too.  Our hostess and waiter were over the top friendly and patient.  I think they were kind of bummed no one wanted to sit out in the patio which would have been too cool if it weren't so cool.  The menu is meant to look like a newspaper, which is cute.  Lots and lots of choices so don't come here if you're indecisive!    They cater to portion as well as nutrition.  You can choose sliced tomatoes or cottage cheese on the side if you don't want to indulge in their signature potatoes, which looked great but we didn't try.  Mom won't eat runny yolks so she had a half portion (2 egg) vegetable omelet with sliced tomatoes and a banana nut muffin.  I had 2 eggs over medium with 2 turkey sausages, sliced tomatoes and dry wheat toast.  Everything was pretty good.  The eggs were cooked just right and the sausages were small but tasty especially when cut up with the tomatoes.  I made it into a sort of mini sandwich using the toast.  Mom's omelet was pleasing to her taste but I thought it was a bit heavy on the vegetables so that you could barely taste any egg!  Prices are way reasonable too.  We'd def hit them up again if we come back to lose money in Sin City.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs over medium with sliced tomatoes and turkey sausages
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 egg (half) veg omelet with sliced tomatoes instead of carbs

K0FmB8pMb7TaMX75EYvNoA.text: Great food! Staff was friendly, there's always a wait but definitely worth it. I've tried a few things from the menu and nothing has disappointed me yet!  My favorite is the stuffed omelette filled with avocado and bacon YUMMYYYYY

WWhAhsioqfEtRhAWc_O9Wg.text: I came to the Egg and I on Friday morning for breakfast. I was hungry and in the area. It made perfect sense to me.  I had been to an Egg Works a couple of times before so it was not a surprise when I found the Hawaiian section of the menu having ordered from there previously. Instead of the plate with rice and Spam like I had eaten in the past I went with loco moco. There are actually two kinds here. A traditional loco moco with brown gravy and their version with country gravy. I went traditional. It was delicious. A little heavy on the salt but it would seem wrong without that. But the beef was perfectly cooked to medium as I requested. The over easy eggs had just enough runny yolk to mix in. I think every bite I took had a bit of everything.  Plates here come with a little side so I got a banana nut muffin. Those are just too good to pass up. And my plate came with a slice of pineapple. I did not leave a crumb. It was all so good. I ate so fast that I had to wait for my waitress to come back with my check. She wasn't expecting me to eat so fast.  Honestly, though, I was not in a hurry to pay for breakfast. At $9.99 the loco moco is one of the cheaper menu items. I was actually kind of surprised at the prices here. You do get a good portion of quality food at The Egg and I, though. Worth it? From time to time, sure.

MTKFzq6eM7s5pFpxDoEk6Q.text: Brunch on a Wednesday and it was hopping!  We got a seat for 2 almost immediately, but every table was full!  We ordered a carafe if orange juice while looking over their huge menu.  My sister and I shared the bacon French toast and let me tell you, it was so yummy that we finished the half order before our entree arrived.  The warm French toast was accompanied with a bacon type butter and whipped cream.  I thought about the diet I was supposed to be on, but only for a nano second.  I ordered a breakfast sandwich on a brioche bun.  It was filled to the max with thinly sliced ham, egg, and American cheese with a side of potato.  Presentation was good, potatoes has their own spice on it and it was delish!!  My sandwich was a little dry so had to ask for some mayo.  My sister had the chili omelette and it also had a side of potatoes.  Her chili was good, and both orders had a large amount of food.  Overall her omelette was good and she also said that the potatoes was very good.  Overall food was good and prices reasonable.  Service from entering the restaurant to serving us to paying the bill was great.  Our waitress was attentive, professional, and checked in on us throughout our meal.  Would definitely come back when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fbTxqBWdIHeAFTyXPpmoZA.text: I LOVE this place. I travel from LA at least once a month for breakfast. Great service, great food, great location!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diablo potatoes

iXJr0pY6ZRpNqbyFlxqNDQ.text: YES!!! Another winner Yelpers! DOG FRIENDLY!! Outside (just bring your jacket no heater but hey this is vegas you only have to worry bout that for 4 months?? Lol) TRY THE BANANA NUT MUFFIN!!! Its the lightest yet moist banana nut muffin.. I was so sold I bought the loaf $7.39 with tax for one ( I bought 4 lol for pasalubong (souvenirs .. ppl bring keychains I bring food ). Use the free banana nut check coupon yelpers!! THE MENU is ridiculous! EGGSTRAVAGANZA (lol yup went there).. so many choices and you still have options to go lighter or low carb. Want to go back to try their Hawaiian Menu (heard their Haole Loco Moco is the one to try) Prime Rib Eggs Benny - yummy diced cut prime rib (not chewy) well seasoned without being salty , I normally like hollandaise on the side but they forgot but I didnt mind as their hollandaise was really good. Eggs cooked perfectly! Sauteed spinach went really well to balanced out all the richness . The croissant was really good but got soggy fast! Cornbeef Hash - was homemade but didnt have the extra to make it standout . Recommend to get the chicken and chorizo hash instead. THE POTATOES!!! - Habla Diablo seasoning which isn't spicy .. basically salt, paprika, garlic seasoning habladiablo.com/product/... SOOOO NICE AND CRUNCHY TOO !! So ONO!!! Coffee was great- medium light (not bitter) they leave your a carafe at the table. SERVICE - Excellent Manuela was great very friendly and kept checking on us. Everyone working there were super friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Rib Eggs Benny (criossants instead of muffin)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular corn beef hash --- Crispy Crispy potatoes with seasoning (not salty!)
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too cute happy egg sign for waiters

TxiMmxkf9mXuDzDwIoUGOg.text: This place was great. There were so many options to choose from their extensive menu. I selected the breakfast burrito and added avacado. It came with a side of their breakfast potatoes. For me at least, they were perfectly cooked and seasoned. Potatoes are my top food because they compliment any meal. They had a homemade salsa which had great flavor and best if all, I had a free banana muffin for checking in on yelp. The service was great. Holly was  super helpful and attentive to our table. Definately with the ten minute drive from the strip. They do have a little wait, but hang In there and you will definitely be pleased.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My breakfast burrito with avacado and perfectly cooked potatoes

IA2zit5WX2yMjMm3fr2IQg.text: The food here was pretty amazing.  The customer service was pretty amazing (forgot our waitress name) even though the place was super crowded and we had like 1000 people before us we ended up getting called pretty fast.It reminded me of a dinner but for some reason the place is ran really well.  We ordered 2 of the items that our waitress recommended. I was torn between getting the veggie Benny and the Mexican omelette. I decided to try the Mexican omelette and had a screwdriver. It was pretty yummy and the portions of food were huge! We also checked in and got a free banana nut muffin which was pretty yummy. No wonder this place has almost 5 stars.

tbJibONn5TZIWkYHRZxSpA.text: Recently ate here server Manuela gave fantastic service food was delicious but would definitely come back and request the same server she went over and beyond to make sure my daughter and I were served properly 5 stars!

eec8UPL7f4bMsusuJbKzmw.text: HALF ORDERS FTW (for the win)  I love this place even more now because I just discovered they let you order HALF SIZE for the fatties that can't decide between two orders! Lol instead of 4 egg omelette a you can request 2 eggs which is what I did with my Mexican Omelette. Soooooo smart!  Mexican omelette: 5/5 Really cheesy and good! Dollop of sour cream on top went good with the red enchilada sauce and jalapenos.   Island dish: 5/5 Hawaiian dish Portuguese Sausage link with two eggs (we got over easy) and scoops of rice. The flavor of the sausage was deliciously salty!  Banana Pancake: 5/5 Wow. The bananas were sweet and the pancakes FLUFFY! Damn good. I got a side of this and it was my perfect dessert.   Banana nut muffin: 5/5 FREE when you check-in on YELP!   Thank you for the delicious food and for the awesome service! 5 star everything!

JGk0VYpMfiROLjmUQ4i_8g.text: We went to Vegas to celebrate our 24th aniversary we decided to give it a try to this restaurant before we head back to L.A the food was good the only reason I giving two stars is because our waitress Cici  brought us the check way to early , I was halfway to finish my breakfast .

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MhCNEJR4VY-KGAK7omVvXg.text: This was the best breakfast I've had in awhile. The staff was amazing and always asking if we were okay. Our server was Manuela and she was just beyond amazing. We did not need anything because she was on top of it. The coffee was great as well as the food. We came to eat here before a busy day and we would definitely be back.

e27d68M-xBLS8hlL_X4TSg.text: Really good spot was in Vegas for the weekend and found it on yelp. Took some of the family there to eat. The food was great and the service was good. Portions are perfect.

OeddldzLmBbfDP6AsL5-FA.text: This place is racist. Went there this morning with Asian and Mexican friends. And we got passed up by 4 groups of white people. Then they want to seat us outside.

6bkcjoM0wUsY8MttDzODaQ.text: Yum! Great place to get some great food! Big portions to fill your belly, good prices, and fast service! Carole Ann was a sweet and efficient waitress.. Thanks!

xUtBjAhlYnYWitvvfZARcg.text: The food was decent, it wasn't anything special. It took awhile for them to bring out the food and even longer to pay, their payment area was 7-8 people long, kind of annoying.

jzlDf1q-ZqWOx2679Bvo4Q.text: Chance was an awesome server!  She had great vegetarian recommendations for me.  I ordered the 1/2 Fresh Veggie Skillet and JM had the Pork Carnitas Ranchero.  The food was great and the service was even better.  Keep up the good work and we'll see you again soon!

0xYhB8jnfVvxPu7UdlAapg.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE Breakfast. Its my favorite meal of the day and i'm glad The Egg and I did not disappoint. Cute name btw.   I ordered the Egg's Benedict Florentine.  As soon as I read fresh spinach, poached eggs and bacon, i was sold. I'm not usually a fan of ham (since i'm sensitive to salt. Anything too salty and i wont like the food) but this canadian bacon was perfect; not too salty. Eggs were nice and runny. Hollandaise sauce was flavorful. Fruit were far and few but I can't complain.   I checked into Foursquare and was treated to their banana nut bread/muffin. OMG it was sooo good. This is the one time i'd have to say Give me MORE muffin tops. Fresh Warm and Delicious!

UdBKnD7hldNDCHhyYJ3dqA.text: The food is good and they have a good variety. but the only problem is that the service is a little slow. and I got a pastrami Reuben  which also came with fries and a deli pickle and they have a good selection of coffee creamers.

mJ4PF875UCVvUo3KgrcCbw.text: Been coming to Egg & I for over 10 years and the food and service is always excellent.   Today, there was an issue with the bill where the server accidentally gave our check to another table. We had to wait a while to get it handled with the manager but it was no big deal - we were in no hurry. The manager ended up comping our meal and all we paid was tip. Wow, thanks so much Egg & I. We will always be back!!

mVV_dqWUDIfwMp_WzIUFVQ.text: Another local find. Lots of regulars. Friendly attentive staff. We ordered the half skillet and french toast. Both were tasty. It is nice to be able to half an order because sometimes you just aren't that hungry so I really appreciated that I was able to finish my plate. Coffee was good as well as the fresh juice. Plan to eat there again and will definitely try their other locations.

Tq7PzBMx8yZactA8_b6vCQ.text: Erin was an exceptional waitress.  Her suggestions on the food were very helpful.  Only downfall is that they don't accept American Express

LiTxpn54G4NXukd1qn4X5w.text: My friends and I had breakfast at Egg & I on our recent trip to Vegas. We wanted to end our trip right by getting a delicious breakfast before heading back home to LA. Egg & I was quite good.  Parking: The parking is easy as it is located in a shopping center with plenty of spaces. Spots near Egg & I were full, but plenty spaces in the lot if you dont mind walking.  Service: The service was excellent! Our server was attentive and very nice. Although all our entrees did not come with the banana muffin, our server brought one for everybody! They even let us bring our Starbucks drinks in!   Food: The food was delicious. The banana muffin was light and fluffy. Super yummy! I also ordered the Chicken, Broccoli and Mushroom skillet (served with eggs, ranch potatoes, and cheese). It was also very good.  Overall good meal. I wouldn't mind coming back again when I'm in Vegas.

yN5MuksqnWWwJnoozd2nZQ.text: Amanda was a great server!!!! The food was excellent.  I had the bacon avocado omelette! The skillet our friend had looked amazing!

lmDeXRrF0tZbmn-Xdk-RrA.text: good food, loved the breakfast selection

VlKpwhQGFy_g1-il207zyA.text: We loved our breakfast.  Bacon avocado omelet and carnitas pork skillet.   Great service by all the staff.   We will be back next time we are in town.

GTPdE3suIMc_slMofVWbmQ.text: This is always a must on trips to Vegas.  Food is amazing, portions are huge and prices are reasonable. Our server, Raul, on this visit was great, and very attentive.  Why waste your time on the strip?

2Z9ewMLo-ytCD2TtE5IyfQ.text: Really great place for breakfast/brunch.   The banana nut muffin is the moistest I have ever had in my life.  I've also tried the corned beef hash here, the loco moco, the chicken fried steak, and all were delicious.  The coffee comes with unlimited refills and is pretty strong. You will get the tremors after a couple cups.

e3ZLAoP4YpWFhqKDwBe9Hg.text: tip: 15 minute wait on a packed morning is super efficient.  breakfast crepes were out of the ordinary.  it's basically an omelet wrapped in a crepe; a must try.  too much home style potatoes.  good coffee.  flip the happy face egg to a sad face egg for prompt service.

pL5hAbwg5NexlKM09lpcTQ.text: Egg and I is awesome, it has great food and prices! I ordered an open faced croissant and it was really good. What I can't get enough of are the Ranch potatoes! They're sooo delicious! I really like he seasoning they use on them, and I think it makes it different than the same ol' potatoes you would get anywhere else.   This is very much like a diner that you would go to back home, and this is off the strip so the prices are reasonable too.   Will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open faced croissant and ranch potatoes

F6TuUBhew-S04U0_6wHwag.text: We had an awesome breakfast! There was a wait but that's what you get when you go to an above average dining experience! Our son was being difficult, and at first did not want to order breakfast. Then when our food arrived he decided he wanted something . The waitress was able to get his food to us so promptly, it definitely provided customer service that we were not expecting! Also just a tip, they have half orders on certain items - unless you're super hungry their food portions are humongous!

ME5bsYrjClpuQ0T07c7Kfg.text: Another wonderful breakfast at my favorite LV breakfast spot. Server Alyssa was delightful. Try the chili omelet. My only complaint: they should make a real dairy product available on the table for coffee instead of your having to ask for it. They serve real butter, so why non-dairy creamer? Spock and I consider this "illogical". Still always 5 stars for me and I've been coming here since the 80's.

1PZCLuH-DOnLT_eS2vLrIQ.text: Seen this place so many times while driving and thought nothing of it.  Today was my first time inside for breakfast at 1:30pm.  So glad I finally stopped in!  All the reviews talk about their bannana nut muffin, but more on that later, first - the eggs...   I ordered the biscuits and gravy which comes with a side of 2 eggs (I chose scrambled) and a side of potatoes (the server allowed me to sub half of the potatoes for fresh fruit.  Everything on my large plate was done perfectly.  The eggs were warm, tasty, and not under or over done.  The biscuits were deliciously moist and puffy (best I've had in as long as i can remember) with a very nice sausage gravy.  The potatoes were original and had a nice texture but the seasoning was a bit much for my taste.  And the fresh fruit was very sweet and well, fresh!  I really don't have a single complaint about the food.  I'd go here regularly for breakfast if it were closer to my house.  For first time goers you get a banana nut muffin on the house.  I don't care if you aren't a big fan of banana nut muffins, I'm really not.  But just eat it!  You won't regret it.  I don't know what they put in this pastry (sprinkled crack maybe?) but it was amazing.  As far as  the employees go, they all seemed happy, smiling, and they were genuinely nice.  There was no wait for me although I heard i just missed a rush.  everyone from the hostess to the servers to the cook did everything just right in my opinion.  Prices are fair for breakfast.  My large plate with an iced tea came to eleven bucks and change.  More than what I'm used to paying for breakfast, but worthy for the quality of the feast, and I'd happily hand it over again.

8aWMJvS29cDa25CkLhFG-Q.text: GREAT attitude,  GREAT service,  lots of attention,  and the food was awesome.  Definitely coming back for the gravy WITH chicken fried steak and the GRANDMAS BISCUITS AND GRAVY.  The place was packed lots of food to pick from the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great attitude Great service,  THANK you
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best

HRV-YvCQ0K_Umr0iUpjUyw.text: Very delicious breakfast and very nice staff. I come here all the time and get the country fried steak and eggs. My favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TPlETmCMxqYjU-0FNcaIWw.text: For years, the Egg & I was our "go-to" spot to take visiting guests for breakfast. But it had been a while since we stopped in. Good to know that when we took two friends to eat there on their recent visit, nothing has changed. Same huge menu; same great service; and same fantastic seasoned potatoes!  I had the bacon and avocado omelet, and my husband had the Cincy chili omelet, both with sides of potatoes (of course!). One of our friends ordered the Country Benny, and the other had an order of potatoes with a side of brown gravy. We all left pleased and sated, and my husband and I had leftovers as well!  Everything on the menu looks fantastic, but I suggest getting an egg dish (seeing how the name of the place is "The Egg & I"!) The "Three Pigs" and the mashed potato omelets are good bets, along with all the other items mentioned above. And definitely get the seasoned potatoes. Although my husband thinks they're overseasoned, I humbly disagree. To me, they're the best in town!

eV4Cg9Zily1LcfOdVSVIjQ.text: If you love a good breakfast, this is the place to try.   I have to say first of all Brady our server was awesome! Personable and very professional, I haven't had this kind of service like this in a long time.It was Brekkie Time and I decided to check out the Sahara location,this place is smoking busy even on a weekday.  First of all if you're the kind of person like me that can't decide on what to eat,you'll be in trouble, huge breakfast menu! The banana nut muffin is must when eating here, it's that good. I ordered the Cordon Bleu Skillet, which has their tasty seasoned potatoes lining the bottom of dish. It was a deceivingly filling and I was very Happy with my dish.  I can see why Egg & I is such a super popular place to eat no matter what time of the day. Excellent attentive friendly service with lots of parking makes this place a great choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Cordon Bleu Skillet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin,awesome!

mHpcRGcwgSbPn1Y2ueyOdg.text: Solid choice for breakfast. Egg Stuffed French Toast, Chili Relleno Omelette, Ceasar Scramble, and Skillet Santa Fe. All good. Too much food.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili Chili Rellenos Omelette!  Delicious!

_f0jMSGQcZga4I_5agFBHA.text: So I had such high expectations for this place. Breakfast is my most favorite meal of the day. Maybe I shouldn't have expected so much?? This place was HYPED to me on a major scale! The service was great, the servers were fast, my food came fast... THE FOOD..... potatoes were stale, no taste. The prime rib was cut into little square chunks and was bland and dry to the taste. it didn't matter that it was covered and smothered in Hollindaise sauce and cheese either. Broke my heart :( lol. maybe I have to come in on a better day? It was quite  busy that Sunday. Waited about 25mins on the dot. they were very particular with the time which was great! They told me wait time was 25 they got me in, in 25. Kudos for the overall customer service, defiinitely! Extra star for that!

zlnesOg_4kLoctackIskfw.text: There is a reason Egg & I has so many reviews and it usually packed.  After an early morning flight from west coast, we stopped here for breakfast.  Food was top notched with a huge menu.  And there spicy potatoes were the bomb!!

1E9r9ctwtx69_Clsdw6S6A.text: Great food even better service Lacy is amazing server and the food is iconic 10/10 Would definitely come back again no doubt about it ! We come from Texas and this food is great Pas Vegas breakfast food!

jtHZoL4kn_u7wYIvlnbudQ.text: Was referred by a friend and was not disappointed! OMG, the Mashed Potato Omelet was soooo good! My husband loved his Chipotle Benni and the muffin is as good as everyone says. We even got our free one for checking in  Our server Penny was very attentive & friendly  Highly recommend!

U-bSjbK_6OCzjIZ2a8Nzkg.text: Place to come for breakfast when in Vegas. Food is amazing. Try the avocado and bacon omelette or the Chile relleno omelet. The banana nut muffins are sooo good. Service is great and although waits seem long they are not and are worth it once you try the food.

MWKg7C8E954bwwjIGcKXZQ.text: Awesome food, fabulous service, decent prices.  If I can I would give them 10 stars. Inside is insanely busy, but totally enjoyed sitting outside in the cool brisk afternoon air.  Rachel is a fantabulous waitress. Thank you so much for an awesome experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xmt3B4MQCshzznKL1RbGzA.text: Egg & I is easily one of the best local brunches in Vegas. The restaurant won't blow you away, but the food might. There's almost always a wait mixed with locals and tourists. Their breakfast potatoes are the best. Don't forget to check in for a free banana nut muffin.

VfdDihWtD4m5eEJf4ekcsA.text: This morning my childhood best friend and I needed a spot to brunch and have a reunion after 2 years without seeing each other. And what better place than Egg and I? The environment and the staff are all very courteous and attentive. One of their employees had a brief conversation with us and he told us about his life and how he has been working for Egg and I for over 18 years. Peculiarly I felt like I never left home while eating breakfast. Spending quality time with BFF and having brunch were the best of both worlds. I cannot wait to come back. This place has the best stuffed French toast in Las Vegas. I will never forget their fast service and the way they made us feel when we were there.  Egg and I is top notch.

KiMZoKV5PMLqlxWjZ18gpA.text: Great breakfast! We tried this restaurant based on other reviews and I'm so glad we did. I had the strawberry stuffed French toast, my daughter had the biscuits and gravy and my husband had one of the scrambles. The food was excellent, and the service was fantastic. I highly recommend giving them a try!

HRHv27F2-xWPdzIpKkMsiA.text: We had a 15 minute wait, but the food was worth it. Ce Ce was a great server! I also love the fact that if you want to bypass the carbs that are served with your entree, you can replace it with an order of protein! A side of bacon with my omelette at no extra charge? I'll take it! My husband ordered a skillet and had no complaints either. Great food!

asuV2g8N1TxJcHcXf2f7DA.text: Very busy place which is a good sign that the food is great! FYI if this is your first time they give everyone a free banana nut muffin; they are warm and delicious! I ordered the Veggie Eggs Benedict since it had spinach and avocado but since I'm a carnivore I asked to add bacon. Over all the service was very friendly and we all enjoyed our food. Plus side was the text to alert you that your table is ready. It was very hot and we waited the 20 minute wait inside the car with AC. There were plenty of people outside just waiting to be seated. It was a nice escape of the strip!

sG2fEPL_hVkS425pYLhzfQ.text: I love this place. Me and my friends went there and we had a great time and the breakfast was awesome we would love to go back anytime

lf-4g-_5bPGTXyBLoByBEA.text: Place was super crowded on Saturday morning but we were seated right away (another group on the waiting list didn't show up). Bloody Mary's are really good. They make their own mix and hot sauce. Waiter was very accommodating to my omelet order with no cheese and egg whites.

RXb_QiUTOwCrI19p-KFrdg.text: Tip: They let you call ahead for reservations as long as you have 6 or more in your party!  I ALWAYS end up eating here at least once every Vegas trip. The prices are reasonable and the portions are huge! The wait to get seated or to receive food is not long and all the waiters are pretty nice. Parking is never an issue since it's a big lot shared with other shops.   Note that for any entree that lists sides .. they let you swap out the sides! As in, you can change out what's listed there on the menu [took me a while to realize I could get fruit/salad/etc.]. I personally am a huge fan of their seasoned potatoes and omelettes.  Don't forget to check in in for a delicious banana nut muffin!

H6Me-rbFRID03YGp6rZ73A.text: Best place to go on a weeken morning when you don't want to bother with making breakfast and the clean up afterwards. Tons of choices. I get something different every time and have yet to be disappointed.

11Zl7atdL9oooUxGVEFeug.text: Great place to have breakfast with friends and family.  Food was delicious and fast and the service was friendly and helpful...we will definitely come back and bring out family with us.

3omSlLc3yOGG0kWKrmd04w.text: Quite possibly the saltiest eggs that have ever entered my mouth :(  The menu selection is overwhelmingly large with many different options but I opted for good ol traditional eggs benny. I'm not sure if they sprinkle their eggs each with individual cartons of salt...wouldn't be surprised cause everything was so salty. The hollandaise sauce also had an overbearing flavor and the ham was so. damn. SALTY. Everyone at my table was commenting on how salty the egg dishes were.  I really wanted to like this place because the servers were all so kind and attentive but my egg dish pretty much ruined it for me. The potatoes on the side however were prepared perfectly. Crispy and perfectly seasoned.   Nevertheless, I did enjoy the free banana nut muffin that came free with yelp check-in. Probably one of the best muffins I've ever had. Warm, toasty on the outside & moist on the inside. Mmmmm.  Had a small portion of friend's stuffed french toast which was pretty good. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, but since this restaurant specializes in "egg works" I was not expecting to be let down by a classic eggs benny dish. I would give 5 stars for service and 3 for food.

Azx3qQ09385H5qOqW7MUpA.text: Our group of 12 ate here today for Father's Day and Perry was our server. He gave exceptional service. The food came out very quick. Anything we needed he had out to us within seconds. He gave amazing service and was so patient with all of us! He made our meal amazing! Thanks Perry! (I think that was his name).

J5sQ6Lv1aXl2kQ_ZzOUO_Q.text: Wow! A place that serve loco-moco (growing up in Hawaii, this is an island favorite). The wait is long but if you're not in a hurry, your wait is worth it.  The workers were friendly and I can't forget to tell you, the wait is long but the service was quick. We got our food less than 15 minutes for party of 12.
