XptFMWqsbRHDau09aHPSNw.text: I was in town for a business trip and looking for a breakfast place and found this gem.  The service is great, the restaurant looked like a local favorite so get to experience the locals.  Menu also had a lot of good choices for breakfast and lunch.  I will def be back when I am back in town.

wliIn_6-ayKu_nmyz2WLMg.text: Super food with large portions. The service is timely, professional and polite. I am proud to take my out of town guest to the Egg and I .

XyhYaMs14tPsMOGihm2Ixg.text: Perfect and delicious every time. Even when it's crazy busy you can count on the service and food being exceptional

FdHqEHnH2R2rtB7Rs4QbUg.text: Today was my first time here and it did not disappoint.  The staff is super friendly the coffee is great.  My friend and I had their complimentary banana nut muffin very delicious.  I had two fried eggs with potatoes toast and sausage links.  My friend had the country friend steak potatoes toast and a side of pancakes.  Everything was delicious I highly recommend this place.

KIPWTdNwjxlXwR8mOaqphw.text: Ok, imagine that you've just left South Orange County (Ladera Ranch to be specific) and you've made this great plan to beat the traffic in the Los Angeles area.  Part of the plan has you delaying breakfast until you get to Las Vegas, and the plan is working pretty well so far.  At Barstow you get out your phone and you begin to review the non casino options in Las Vegas when 'Egg and I' leaps out with these great reviews and a fantastic star rating.  Sold!  That's where we're going to go.  When we check-in on yelp we get a free Banana Nut Muffin, and things seem to be fantastic.  Our server is charismatic, checks in often, provides us with a pitcher of water (its something like 100 degrees outside and rising), and was efficient throughout the meal.  Our omelettes arrive in a timely fashion, and so what is their to complain about.    First, I like cheese, and so having cheese is always a good thing, and for you this may be a big plus, but there was so much cheese it was hard to taste anything else.  I had ordered the chile rellano omelette, and it arrived as advertised, but with just a ton of cheese.    Second, the potatoes looked to be cubed by a machine, frozen, de-frosted, and then lightly seasoned prior to arrival.  They were very disappointing.    Third, my expectations were way too high.  My fellow yelpers love this place, and so I was expecting this amazing breakfast that just didn't live up to my expectations.  In a nutshell, I'd probably go back, but with a whole different set of expectations, knowing that I'd ask for sliced tomatoes instead of the potatoes, and I'd probably not choose an omelette.  Be sure and check in, a free muffin is not a bad thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lPqXy8DYpUQ-ofu2SRw6wg.text: Some seriously good breakfast ! If you are in the strip and spend the night having fun and you are having a bad day next morning , go to this place   The best Bloody Mary I've ever had

wHck9i4equH5PCDsDhDbYg.text: Great family and group place to eat. Always good service with great food. Im happy when we eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Egg And Me. Ha ha.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hSPIRtjpEv3nHeprUpRBrw.text: Fantastic breakfast! (and I'm somewhat of a breakfast food snob..) came on a Sunday morning around 11 while we were visiting Vegas and walked in with a party of 4, no wait. Portions are huge, our waitress gave the table free banana muffins cause it was our first time, and we all were very happy with our dishes! GREAT CHOICE!

YD4q1-INrb-HrWLZn_IzHg.text: Great service.  The blackened Benedict was delicious.  Free Walnut muffin was amazing.  Would go back.

roclW7dlDPAPi9GvVY3nSg.text: This restaurant was really good, this was our first visit but I'm sure we will be back. There is something for everyone and you will not leave hungry. I got the stuffed French toast, my husband got the chili relleno omelet. Both of us were happy with our choices. Will be back and will recommend to family and friends.

a8a3iwHpQvV838b3O5KMTA.text: We came to Vegas to celebrate our friend's bachelorette party weekend, and stopped by here before leaving from our trip back to Cali. We arrived around 11am, and the restaurant was PACKED. However, upon checking in, the lead hostess informed that the wait was surprisingly only 15 minutes... Talk about efficiency!! They got it down here! Amazing customer service!  Of course, Vegas is extremely hot and we were in a rush to eat and leave, so we were flexible with our seating. Outside was fine, and that's where we ended up. The outside patio was hot due to the weather, but they had some machines that automatically blew out cold must which helped a little. OSCAR- (woot woot!) our server, was absolutely AMAZING and provided exceptional customer service, making out group feel very welcome. He was extremely knowledgeable and friendly, and gave us some great suggestions for breakfast and lunch. Our entire party was beyond satisfied with the service, friendliness, and quick arrival of our food. Oscar provided us with the best banana nut muffins, which were served warm with butter. I had the breakfast burger with a fried egg on top, a side of delicious seasoned fries. They also serve stuffed French toast, and you have the option of getting half country potatoes and fruit, instead of full order of one or the other. Food was delicious and we will definitely drop by the next time we visit the Strip. Hands down, this is one of the best breakfast places I have been to!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed french toast with meats, seasoned country potatoes, fruit, and maple syrup
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast ham sandwich with seasoned fries
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh, warm banana nut muffin. To die for!

Bf1S3C5UFBoJ0QLZM0PeGw.text: I loved this place and it was my first and I enjoyed it. The food was good and fresh. The waitress was friendly.

wuUOcvkRof6VguQKZZrxoA.text: Everything was delicious! Our server, Karla, was amazing! And, despite being slammed, we didn't wait an unreasonable amount of time for our food. Oh, those banana muffins people keep mentioning   I'm only giving 4 stars because it was a bit dirty and the creamers on the table were all nasty and sticky.  However, Karla was a sweetheart and brought us a fresh dish of creamer.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegitarian Crepe with whole wheat toast.

v21lcsx_nRHwjMnDZdVn5Q.text: A great place to start your day! Very friendly and quick service. The servers are quick to give recommendations and help if anything is needed. We came here twice and loved the food. On our second visit, half of my food came a little  late but I was okay with it because they were pretty busy and were trying their best to serve customers as efficiently as possible. Great team work! We will surely come back to Eggs & I on our next visit to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Day2

EjykVz4EVBofYxnxyX5cHw.text: Great food  Breakfast delicious We were visiting from Los Angeles. Six of us and everybody loves the food  Customer service is the best  They have little faces for service if you do turn the sad face around service come to your table in second The best breakfast

xy_t-J-dmRrr_VeOnl-8pg.text: Not sure what else to say that hasn't been said in the 1187 reviews! Great spot for breakfast off the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A sorbet favorite in the desert!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let the staff know if your happy ! You can switch it if your not :(

_svBEfdU5JtkgQeKMoipUg.text: I hadn't eaten at Egg and I for a few years. My friend and I needed a restaurant the other day and we were close to Egg and I. The place was very busy - a good sign. We were seated right away and the server, Tamara, was great. The food also turned out to be great. All in all, a great experience. I'm sure I will eat there a few times a month. Highly recommended.

PR4YTwdnN_cvbW77LuGM1A.text: Wow. I have never had banana nut muffins quite like the ones served in The Egg and I. It was freshly made and still hot from the oven. The next time I come I need to make sure to get a box to go!  As for the breakfast plates, my boyfriend got the omelet and I got the usual potatoes ham and eggs. We also decided to get the "short stack" banana pancakes. Let me just tell you that when we asked just how big the short stacked pancakes were, the server made this hand gesture that indicated it was small so we went with that. Guys, the short stack was, STACKED. It was huge! It's bigger than the regular pancakes in Ihop and Denny's! Plus it had REAL bananas in them. Holy smokes!   We were IN LOVE with the potatoes! It had the best seasoning - a somewhat Cajun flavor? The ham was a large chunk and my boyfriend loved his omelet. This place is perfect! Would definitely come back for more!  10/10 would bang (the door) again

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VrOuAtcLLbDYkrwTK0CMlg.text: Excellent quality of food for a very good price with a substantial menu. This is it. You don't need to go to any other breakfast place or diner. Why do Denny's and IHOP even exist with places like this around? Apparently many others share the same sentiment because the place was packed.

886VH0AyBMju4_TSipIRpQ.text: Went to the egg and I for breakfast this morning wow is all I can say I have the stuffed French toast with strawberries and cream Yum also I got the muffin for checking in on yelp that was the best dog on muffin I ever had in my life very light and delicious also got the bacon and eggs along with the very good my server Amanda all I can say is awesome she was the best server ever...whenever you're in Vegas you need to stop at the egg and I just saying.

s_yQHKx50vtEJ6-7BwjdiQ.text: Huge portions of amazing food! Try the Banana Nut Muffin for sure! Our group had an assortment. Crepes, Sausage n Biscuits and Pancakes- all of us had the same expression "this is the best..."

LPpHg1Ip_79cZXiFx1xe-g.text: Apparently this is one of the best breakfast joints in Vegas.  I can't really agree with that but it's pretty darn good.  I ordered the corned beef hash and what came wasn't your standard canned mushed beef stuff. There were real pieces of corned beef in this mixed with potatoes, onions, red, green peepers and topped with 2 eggs of your choice, which should always be over easy eggs with super sloppy running yolks. The flavors were spot on and the side of potatoes were nice.  The banana muffin that is served is awesome too.  It's probably microwaved before getting to your table but it's still very decent.  Prices are a little bit high like $10.95 for the hash and the wait can be long.  The annoying thing about this place is paying at the cashier!  When it's busy, the wait can be 10 minutes to pay your bill... minus a star for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash!

phB5G2ZuyugOUuCPe3bWhg.text: Tamara has made a day. She had gone above and beyond for us. She has this great skill of making the best recommendations and so friendly. Brought everything we asked for and kept checking on us. Thank you Tamara because of you I'll keep coming back to the Egg and I.

CLuTtS3l4SOi4o4Shy3qsQ.text: Paula is a great server- very considerate and helpful. Banana nut muffin is good. Skillet of bacon ham and sausage is filling and satisfying. Good place for brunch!

xgS6NV9sfKaPgrcZTlRaTg.text: My wife and I came here and our server was Karla she was really nice and she didn't rush us to order food like some waitress. I ordered the mash potatoe omelette it was just like a bake potatoe except in an omelette. My wife ordered the chicken tortilla soup and a breakfast tostada . The breakfast tostada had refried beans , scrambled eggs , cheese , potatoes , salsa , olives and sour cream . She enjoyed it !! I recommend this place because the staff is friendly , the food isn't expensive and you get a large portion

_cc5r_T7MEmYVaDtlKmUDQ.text: If you are really hungry for a big breakfast, this place is the spot!  Incredible portions and the banana my muffins....OMG....the banana nut muffins...!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the eggs Benedict and they were eggs-ellent!

qGE9vKOm90x1D2_3W7IL2Q.text: There is a reason why this place has so many good ratings.  The Pork Carnitas Crepe is like nothing you have ever had!!!  Make sure you drown it in the Habla Diablo Verde Salsa, enough said!!! You have to try this taste of heaven.  Atmosphere is old school cafe, so don't expect ambiance, that is not why you go here. But really come for the Carnitas Crepe and you won't be disappointed. If you are lucky enough to have Karla as your server say hello, sweet lady!!

B1MBYH8jksJowJUkmVrGaw.text: Trying out a new place for breakfast. Saw the yelp review so we went.   Typical breakfast place. I has the corned beef hash and I enjoyed  it. Wife not so much. She has biscuit and gravy and she said it  was good   Their muffins were really tasty and a must have.  Servers name was Brady and he was very attentive and a pleasure to have serving us.  Overall I would come back again.

6SCz1zxwULnF9vijegVNzA.text: Breakfast was amazing! Even though it was busy, my party of 2 was seated within 10 minutes...on a Sunday morning!!  The biscuits and gravy were delicious, as was the chicken, mushroom, and spinach skillet.   Karla was a great server. She was attentive and made sure we were taken care of.   As for the banana nut muffin....you NEED to get it.   Only thing: The hostess (forgot her name) wasn't too attentive. While I was trying to put my name in to be seated, she was chatting with her co worker even though I had asked her a question and was waiting for her to help me.   But! I will return on my next Vegas trip!

4eYEGdBzBi_eMbFakuU4ZA.text: Ashley was such a sweet server. The service is great & the place is well kept. They have so many choices here & cater to many different likes even though it is a breakfast joint. The potatoes are greatttttttt. Love it here!

-uylP1KC_D1O5YlGT4gBew.text: I would say that the hype from yelp brings in a lot of the clientele here. I think we beat the mad rush on a Friday morning by coming on the early side around 8AM. By the time we left nearing 10AM, there was a line out the door. Service was friendly and attentive. I was pretty disappointed with the food though. We ordered a veggie eggs benedict and a southwest (chicken/chorizo) hash. At first, the order for the eggs benedict came out wrong with canadian bacon and spinach vs. just all veggie. The waitress brought out extra banana nut muffins to apologize, which was a nice gesture especially since the best thing here was the banana nut muffin.  The hollandaise on the benedict was really watery and had a slight sweet taste to it. Overall, the benedict lacked flavor. On the other hand, the hash and the breakfast potatoes were extremely salty. We got the extremes here in terms of flavor (too salty and too bland). Overall, not bad, not great.

D4qcHBE53_efrcKyR8soyg.text: Best breakfast in Vegas !!!  This is a fun place to eat. That is, it is a fun place to eat if you can get a table as they are oftentimes very-very crowded -- especially in the morning.  On those hot summer Vegas days I see people waiting outside but I don't know... That is just not for me. When you want to go is before the weekend AM crowds have hit or on the off-hours. Then, walking in and getting a table is very easy.   Okay, now that the warnings have bee spelled out, let's get down to the restaurant. Inside, it is very Americana. Plus, the food is very Americana. Basically, what you see is what you get.   Ordering is easy. As the name of the restaurant suggests, it is eggs and things that go along with eggs. Simply as that. Make your choice and you are all good.   The staff is always nice and helpful is you have any questions. And, most of the times the other guest are nice though I have been here a few times when the restaurant was deluged with a rowdy or rude crew, however. But hey, this is Vega, what can you expect?   Eggs & I is attached to a large shared parking lot. I have never found parking to be a problem.   It is located on West Sahara, so finding it is easy.   Overall, very good restaurant. Fun and tasty place to eat.  Recommended!

-SNherfWBRW0xUjBFoc4Dg.text: Super delicious! Spotted this gem as we were driving around looking for a gas station. My mom had been to their other location, so we stopped in.   The food and service were incredible! I had the biscuits and gravy with sausage patties. potatoes and scrambled eggs. It came on a huge platter! The biscuits were soft and fluffy with tons of flavorful gravy. My mom had the sausage patties, eggs and potatoes. The potatoes had a bit too much seasoning salt for my taste, by everything else was amazing.  The service really took things up a notch. They have a stand on the table where you flip the egg over if you need service. Different servers stopped in and refilled our drink while we were eating. Our glasses never got less than half-empty.  Definitely try either location. Every plate we saw being served up looked amazing!

Zv-eK79I6VGebGWzynblVg.text: I come here every time I visit vegas, which is about 8 to 10 times a year.  I love this place,  their food is amazing!  Don't be fooled by the big crowd outside waiting, they are so quick with serving that people are constantly getting seated.  Servers like Dariesia make the restaurant experience fun and enjoyable! Servers should learn from her and Crack a joke once in a while. Haha.  Highly recommended! Just don't come at the same time as me, might have to fight for the banana nut muffins... :)

MZEfVwfGXciSYPUMi7v6iQ.text: Yum. Great food. And really personable staff.  Need creamer? Which kind? All of them? Sure! No problem.  Worth the drive off the strip.

k67L2YNMBAWhNZ4QpLnE9w.text: Service was fast and friendly. Food came out fast and hot. A lot of food. Chance was an excellent server. Complete with suggestions and friendly conversation.

pOdw26EA34ATx9Lp6fCVYQ.text: Man... people freak out over this place, but I'm not really sure why.  It wasn't bad. Just not much different from dozens of other places.  Think Denny's.  There you go.  I will say this, though... great service.  I had the corned beef hash.  They top it off with an egg.  I LOVE CBH, but I wouldn't order this again.  I was with three friends.  They had scrambled eggs, eggs benedict, and a chili cheese omelette.  Scrambled eggs are the same everywhere.  The eggs benedict had WAY too much hollandaise sauce.  The omelette, though, was killer.  In fact, we stopped eating our dishes and ate from her plate.  What?  Now... the banana nut muffin.  I didn't think it was all that.  Good flavor, but mine was kind of hard.  The girls, though... I swear they had an orgasm.

LO3MMIVyqpsd53BW-EOk4Q.text: At the behest of a good friend (who has great taste in food), our group headed out here for breakfast.  Upon entering, I was completely taken to a different place, away from all the lights, sounds of Las Vegas.  I felt like I was almost at home. From the greeters, to the servers, service was awesome.  Served with a smile and genuine people, I was more than happy here.  And the food...oh...so tasty.  I had a prime rib skillet, which was freaking huge. I absolutely enjoyed my meal (the potatoes....SO GOOD), although I have to admit I think my friend's country steak stole the show, and I will be ordering that next time.  And there will be a next time :D

7sM18m8E7COpmcYYPdTNRw.text: This place has a real vibe to it. At first, the goofy murals on the walls seemed a bit overly cheery for me but after perusing the huge menu and talking a bit with our friendly waitress, a delightful pregnant English lass, i really started to get the theme. This place is all about freshness, growth, and fertility. Our waitress mentioned it and i remembered reading a review saying they always seem to have pregnant women working there. I think that's beautiful! Celebrate life, ladies!

6nqhnd8pzkXmmCmRiB64ag.text: Maybe my expectations were high due to all the great yelp reviews, but I found my experience disappointing. The restaurant was very crowded and noisy which isn't conductive to a pleasant experience. Our waitress delivered our food quickly, but my muffin was mostly cold and the food was rather plain. We also agreed the potatoes were way too salty. Overall I wish I had just stayed on the strip.

o4AxGzATMP4Mn-_kzaolGA.text: Our server Brady was great and he was very efficient and nice and always made sure that we were doing alright and wanted us to have a great breakfast. I believe he is the most qualified to have a nice vacation for all the hard work he has went through. He works hard and can still keep a smile on his face, making him deserving of a nice vacation.

UzQjA_hMEdyLTZp0HjCPdg.text: Great breakfast! Had the chili omelette and our server Ulisis was very polite and professional! Send him to Disney, part of an in house promotion for them!

hfO742Zn4boB3ObHayUejw.text: I never expected these kind of breakfast to be any more special than other breakfast shop, but their food is just extraordinarily tasty. I like their egg work newspaper. Very creative and cute, Remember to order their omelet, super awesome!

cbgrOBXwkbn5ffNvCXQJHw.text: This is a fantastic place to go for breakfast, especially if you want to spend a little time off the strip. The omelettes are amazing and loaded with cheese and toppings. One of the unique things they offer here is a fresh baked banana muffin that you can choose as an option over toast for a side. Take the muffin. It was still hot and tasted delicious. Large portions of very good, homemade breakfast food.

hiCfMUzR4lhkbwtlibH7Qg.text: Whut! This place is simply a friendly local's breakfast dive that is incredibly delicious! And the service is superb! Were were served by Thayrana who is getting married soon and was delightful. She gave us great and honest recos along with some complimentary banana nut muffins with her apologies when our food took a little bit longer than expected. Our most favorite dish was the pumpkin pancakes with chocolate chips! Highly recommend this place to all and apparently they have several locales as well!

qA9fvR-cLmRyfg5IvRB3dA.text: This place is about 7 minutes from the Grand Hilton Vacation Resort (the one on Vegas Blvd).  I visited here on Tuesday.  Upon arriving, there was a wait of about 15 minutes.  When i was finally seated, I was giving this big menu of items.  I ordered the southwest omelet & cup of coffee.  Once I received it, coffee was okay & the omelet was great.  Service was okay, but not great.  I guess because they were busy, it took longer for her to check on me especially to bring my check once I was done.  Overall the place has good food, but needs to work on service.

zMSR8eiezozqwKXwkin88g.text: Wanted to find a local place off the strip for a good breakfast! This place was the spot!! Had the country fried steak and it was one of the best I've had! Our server Karla was efficient and friendly our water and coffees were always full. Highly recommend and will def come back next time we are in Vegas! THANKS KARLA!!!

msgaLyBUEKPyV_WTorzTmg.text: This is the best breakfast place I have eaten at in the US. Simply amazing choice and unbelievably fresh and sumptuous food. I had the Mexican omelet and toast . . . they were authentic with just the right amount of spice. Even the orange juice was fantastic.

ZGsHTaag9gHBUCF7fo2bdw.text: Came here for the first time while staying in Vegas because of the great reviews. Our waiter Karen was very friendly and attentive. The food was delicious, but the only reason why I took a star off was because the table we sat in was a bit too small. Other than that it was great!

nj-yrIEELOO-Uw_ptN3oXg.text: If you are interested in big, hearty, country breakfasts, this is your place.  If you are looking for delicate flavors or subtlety, no way jose.   He ordered EGGS BENEDICT.  It was served in a baking dish so I guess the restaurant feel compelled to fill it with sauce.  It was completely drenched in "Hollandaise" if you could even call it that.  It was creamy and yellow, yes.  But there was no butter taste, or lemon.  Moreover, the slice of ham on the benedict was so thick and strong flavored that it was the predominant flavor.    I ordered the HAM AND MUSHROOM SKILLET with TWO EGGS OVER EASY.  It's a baby skillet, with the bottom lined with the restaurant's ubiquitous Ranch Potatoes, mixed with diced ham, sliced mushrooms, topped with a handful of shredded cheese and topped with 2 eggs, any style.  It's all very salty, cheese, filling and pretty good actually.   FYI: the Ranch Potatoes are diced taters completely drenched in Lawry's seasoned salt and they use it anywhere potatoes might be needed.  The result is ..seasoned salt EVERYWHERE!  Stick with basics like pancakes and eggs and these skillet-y things.  Don't get anything where skill might be needed to cook it.

2W8ExXgplxT9K8Fdwbdnyg.text: Food was great! Manuela was nice and attentive. Definitely coming back when I'm in Vegas again.

hQX15k2e5wgoco2CY-vrRw.text: This local hot spot takes pride in scratch made food. Ive been eating here for a decade & am happy to say they have added several new locations. Im addicted to Brad's cincy chili. Its beanless, sweet, smokey, & mouth watering delicious. I always have the 4-way, noodles, chili, cheese & onions. 5-way adds beans. I do not like kidney beans & dont like them forced into my chili. This dish is enormous & inexpensive. This dish is made with love, plain & simple. The entire staff is always welcoming. They know how to treat their regulars & irregulars.They have a prime rib benedict, health conscious items. When i eat there i am far from health conscious. i am down right unconscious & barbareick. They never laugh or stare when i have a couple entrees going at once. What can I say, options are hard cause there are so many good ones.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinncey chili-4way (my favorite), with onion

i8iV4qQk2B1it-i_Vhl41Q.text: There are many breakfast-themed places in town, we were in the area and decided to try this place. Place was full but no wait on a Saturday for 2 adults, a toddler and an infant. We had the Banana Bread French Toast which was good, but had similar texture to the Banana Nut Muffin that came with it (should have gotten some other side dish). But don't get me wrong, both we're good. The muffin was served fresh from oven with steam coming out as you break it. We also got the avocado omelet with cheese and sour cream. This was good but what we really loved were the side of potatoes. Just the right amount of seasoning to keep you interested. Overall very good experience. Service was excellent.

WqOdTsE33vQqUnxpLGb8kA.text: Wednesday morning, breakfast time in Las Vegas - what to do? I Yelped it and decided to try The Egg and I based on the reviews. Great decision! This is an old fashioned, cozy breakfast place with fantastic food and great service. I tried the Eggs Florentine or, in my case, "the usual" - and the hollandaise was just about perfect.  Highly Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cbdtiZbO_Fq4Qmz0B0ELXw.text: Just finished breakfast Amanda are service was fantastic!   We sat outside enjoyed the nice weather and savored out banana nut muffin!!

_9PEVImN0GzitlKuZA9Hzg.text: My best friend and I visited this brunch spot and we fell in love. The banana nut muffins are the best! The food has a lot of calories, but it doesn't matter because it is THAT GOOD.

utHDdWBJGrz80eo0EmkEcA.text: Excelent food and service i wish know where i can buy the habla diablo sauce

6iksNUK0ln7Q7kD9qK8Gpw.text: The food was honestly just okay and bit over hyped in my opinion, especially for the wait. The prices were great though so I really can't complain. Its a short distance away from the strip, so if you want something that feels more normal and less vegas like this is your spot!

Y3Xp4-kGXfeUoWRQtxtiLw.text: The food is nice and hot with large more than you can eat portions.   "The works" omelette is very filling as it is very well packed.  Don't think twice about coming here! Just do it! You won't be disappointed.  Jose was our server, did an excellent job!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works omelette.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast order with a single large pancake in the back.

yEsfvmgoICbCLqpcaJYkMA.text: We had an absolutely amazing breakfast at Egg & I! The portions were generous and delicious, quite a good value. Our server, Karla, was full of energy and helped us have a great start to our day!

uvqwUb-nwCSdypPnxeFmkw.text: We ordered an pork chop hash with two eggs portion, and a chile relleno omelette. The portions are VERY BIG! Everything was good. I loved my omelette. Maybe next time we will try something else more spectacular! I definitely recommend the banana muffins, they were the best muffins I've ever had in my whole life!!

154osABSBCeuiMfx7bmVZQ.text: The BEST breakfast I had in vegas so far and I will come here every AM I'm in town.. I had the skillet works! It was amazing and you get PLENTY of great quality ingredients inside! First time there You also get a tasty banana muffin.. Tabitha was awesome and explained the items on the menu I had questions about. I'm so happy to have found this place! I wish there was one in Los Angeles but only in Las Vegas areas for now...They closed at 3pm so get there early and get your eat on! I came here on a Tuesday morning and it wasn't as busy as people say here.. Fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The works Skillet! AWESOME!!!

kSUPf5aT8qp0W8QAAW2BQA.text: I went here one morning with a girlfriend while I was visiting. The place was crowded. But we were seated in less than 30 minutes, potatoes are amazing. Everything else that I had was good also but those potatoes really stood out lol

A0hTIclF8-tNEB6aP0P14A.text: Awesome and well worth the wait.  Egg's Benedict was wonderful and so were the home fries!

3SbKDLKNrQrvzTttTMNeLg.text: Eggcellent customer service.  Food was delicious! Really big servings! Seasoned potatoes and sausage patties were my favorite.

_p3Rp2SgkqNjxfroXRk5yQ.text: Just finished another excellent meal here. Come to think of it my family and I have never had a bad one here either. If you're in the mood for breakfast, brunch or lunch stop in , my family and I have had just about everything on this menu here and have never been disappointed today my wife and I had a Mexican omelette and a Santa Cruz skillet, just fantastic meals and wonderful energy, especially from our server Perry. Thanks again for another wonderful brunch and we'll see you next time!!

2IVUIbvURmcFrLImNoM8uQ.text: Reina, Reina, Reina I hope that gets her three steps closer to Mickey Mouse !! Food was eggselent. Place was busy which means the food is worth the wait.

xCxagxRaoYlKop8H2vZz0A.text: Love this place. Great diner-style breakfasts along with some Mexican-inspired section. Also lots of veggie-heavy options, which are delish. Really excellent service too. Despite crowds and lines most days, I have never had to wait more than 15 minutes. Highly recommend for a great off-the-strip breakfast!

Nk8nIIuIJP537fSp9BrKgg.text: This unassuming place is rated so high for a reason! Everyone is so sweet and cheerful and Lisa, our server was an absolute doll. Don't forget to mention its your first time there, you get a free banana muffin.. warm and delicious!  I got the Sunrise Mountain.. Four scrambled eggs on a buttery croissant with sausage and cheese... SO GOOD. Definitely stop by if you're going to Vegas.

8GKaDpWWWtnDu4wrrFFmFg.text: I know "what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas" but this place is too damn good not to mention !  So, what so "EGGsellent" about this place??  - Friendly Service - Large portions  - Big Menu - Free parking - Quick service  The list can go on and on cuz this place is so "Egg-mazing!!!" However, let me tell you one thing you must order is the "Banana Nut Muffin". Order one or a dozen to go, TRUST ME!  Though the place is a bit off the strip but it is totally worth the drive, TOTALLY!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daily special : Patty Benedict (Eggsellent) !!!!

oDvvKrKgaplOd7g-5eNj4A.text: Breakfast joint, hard to screw up but went based on reviews. I'm from jersey so menu was like a typical diner breakfast menu. Got the eggs and sausage, which was very good. Muffin was good but not sure I've had too many bad muffins. Easy to park, prices very reasonable, friendly attentive service. Good off the strip option

Gb4fgHAV7W1lpa5IHx__Hg.text: Usually a very busy place.  But food and coffee always hits the spot and is really good, ask for half potatoes and fruit.  If you don't you will get a lot of potatoes.  Great coffee and great service!

Dk_NLD0eDh6yyXE-EIExvQ.text: Lobby was full upon arrival, but still only waited less than 5 minutes. Very attentive with service, even though they were crazy busy. Food was great!! Hot, delicious and filling!! HIGHLY recommend the banana nut muffin....AMAZING!!

825VMohqasiMqUE0EoRazw.text: Vegas. Two girls. Hungover. We had a long drive ahead but needed time to collect ourselves. In our dysfunctional state of mind, we decided we wanted brunch. Off to Egg & I we went. The place turned out to be a local favorite. It was fairly packed, but we got seated right away. Extensive breakfast menu. Options! And loved how it was printed on newspaper! Chicken Omelet (yelp.com/biz_photos/3kdS...): I can't remember its name, but I do remember that it was absolutely tasty! Chicken, cheese, avocado with sour cream on top. Moist chicken. Fluffy omelet. Yum! Ranch Potatoes: Came with omelet. Addicting! Even though they were overly seasoned for my taste buds, I couldn't stop eating them. Banana Nut Muffin (yelp.com/biz_photos/3kdS...): Came with omelet. Gigantic homemade muffin. Chewy top. Soft inside with bits of banana and nuts. So good! Eggs Florentine (yelp.com/biz_photos/3kdS...): I didn't try it. But judging by its looks, I would imagine it to be delicious! Coffee: Great quality coffee. It was unlimited refill and I had the whole carafe to myself. They have their own line of coffee. Huge portions! We both packed half of our food to go. Great service! Friendly and attentive. And best of all, great prices! 2 breakfast entrees, 1 orange juice, 1 coffee, plus tax and tips all for $30! =D

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. banana nut muffin
