U0C3TycrMfapMCYswjbkxQ.text: Had the western omelette and pancakes. Pretty crowded for a Tuesday. This place is off the strip. My main dish was 4 star but t honesty the pancakes were not that great. I liked the papitas.   Wife's review:   The potato fries were salty and the service was mediocre.

YwD8dUUEVSVbkuBmLyKKuA.text: This is probably one of the best breakfasts out I've had in recent times. Everything's was good and fresh. One of the best things was the banana bread/muffin. I had the pumpkin pancakes (which are not on the menu, so ask) which were so delicious that I didn't even need syrup.   My wife, who I love so much (just in case she reads this), is a finicky eater, and she wanted to come back the next day before we left (which we did). She got the skillet breakfast both times. Word to the wise, get a half order if you're not a big eater.  One last thing, went with friends so I tried the biscuit and gravy, stuffed french toast and two different skillet breakfasts. I would have been happy with any of these other orders.   Ok, I lied, this is the last thing, try the Habla Diablo verde on your food, it is very tasty. So much so, we bought a bottle to take with us.

PGoIsK8HaJtL8LHQGj7XQA.text: Our server was so excited about his job- a rarity in servers. His energy was contagious!  The food was pretty good, and much more affordable than breakfast on the strip. I highly recommend this spot for tourists looking for a quality, affordable breakfast!

KBkvOCRBM2SWHdORi5hSwA.text: This is the second time I've eaten at Egg & I and this place is soo good for breakfast. I forgot what I got the first time I've been here. The last time I've been here I got a cold turkey sandwich with french fries. The sandwich was really simple with turkey, guacomole, tomatoe and etc. Just the usually stuff but it was good. Their french fries was a bit different, it is small and crispy...not like McDonald's or Burger King fries.  I love love love their banana nut muffin!! It is so freaking good! Everyone gotta try their banana nut muffin!  I would definitely come back here again.

wqLIGbO85dyHjONUQEQdEA.text: I like coming here for the breakfast, and the service is always good::  Food is usually average, I just don't like Luke warm stuff but it's breakfast so I can't complain:: I'm usually to tired too  ( one eye open) ..  I drink my 50 cups of coffee cause they give me a pot! It's usually so so:: but drinkable-- I guess I really just have to complain about the most simplest thing which is :: H2O::  Man does it taste like metal or is it just me?? It's horrifying water man:: beware::  If anyone is awake enough and feels the same would probably give you props if you say something::  Over all a good in the hood place for some morning grub::

o5r6HnBaLiIzeXtrscCIFg.text: We were in the area early in the AM and decided to get some breakfast and decided to try the EGG ASND I. We had never been. Breakfast is my fav meal of the day and I really like to get or make a seriously good one.  Wow, this one turned out to be great..  First, we had this great server... Thaynara... She was sweet, understanding, and smart! She has patience while we figured out what we wanted to eat, so many choices!  YOU HAVE TO SEND HER TO SEE MICKEY!!!!!!! Since we were 3, two of us decided to split the Works Veggie Benny... and Pumpkin Pancakes.. and the third party got the Chili Rellenos.  Everything was really good.. I always hesitate to get poached eggs since so many restaurants make them in advance and have them sitting in a water bath, so in the end either you get a medium to hard yolk or a watery mess.. these were perfect, the minute you cut into them the yolk spread everywhere, the spinach and avocado were raw not cooked to death and I just can't believe the potatoes.. They were spiced and hot and really good, and we had a  choice of potatoes or fruit and since we couldn't decided Thay suggested 1/2 and 1/2.. Perfect.  The pumpkin pancakes were moist (which I didn't expect, usually they are dry dry dry) but they were really good, like a good pumpkin cake (not pie)..  And the Rellenos were really good, not too much cheese (which I don't like) and he really enjoyed them. All in all a really good meal!  It's 3PM and I'm still not hungry.. Oh, and we tried the Banana Muffins.. we gobbled them up!  Even the coffee was OK..  Definitely, will be heading back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Benny, 1/2 portion! Big portions, so we shared!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili Rellenos! Really Good

ntlkb3UTiyAN0TNq0t6-ig.text: Excellent food and service !!!  Had the beef burito and veggie skillet with eggs on top !!!   And got chicken ceaser egg -   Highly recommended - highly generous portion !!

CXIWlP3RBi42sb_-hU_ngA.text: Love this restaurant! They are usually quick about seating folks. They are attentive and I love the egg on the table that you can switch to yellow if you need something! It's great not trying to have to chase your waiter/waitress down when you need something! My favorite dish is the huevos rancheros and eggs Benedict. My husband usually goes healthier and gets the yogurt parfait and Brad's very special omelette. My husband never orders coffee there. He says it's too weak.

AQzf4vIUfG-B1l9uuYDNDg.text: Amanda was our server.  Her smile is congatious and her service is exceptional.   Food is fantastic too.  Great way to start the day!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delious!!!

VdwZR_HdyrpMWzJ0p-90EA.text: Didn't even eat there. Waited for 20 minutes when a person parked there car in the front as we waited and and left 2 dogs with the windows up in the hot sun. I went in to talk to the hostess and asked her to make a brief announcement to the restaurant and she responded to me "that's not my problem. You call someone if you want." Our party of 6 immediately left, I will never return.

FgWnyGKKI8cVV8-fqWhvvg.text: Just moved to Vegas and heard great things about this place. Went for the first time and they offered a delicious banana nut muffin, complimentary, since it was our first time! It was great.  Our food, however, was not. The server said our potatoes were fresh, but they didn't taste nor look fresh. They put wayyyy too much cheese on everything and it completely covered up the taste of everything else. So we decided to give it another try. Came back on a Saturday morning, had the banana nut muffin that tasted stale, again, way too much cheese and our food took forever! I don't know why I thought this place would use fresher ingredients... Definitely disappointing.

Yq4KmhPIsDmFR490N19zXg.text: Stopped by this morning and had a great breakfast, the portions are large, and the staff way helpful and friendly. The country fried steak skillet is excellent! The parking lot is large but shared and can get crowded. Everything was very clean and turn around was quick.

zK7oH4MENmYgNn2inTQcGA.text: Great food, large servings and if your lucky, Dariesia will serve you.... If your lucky.  :)  A return trip is required.

TYviXpEXuIfM5AVJQ3KKVQ.text: great food family environment. They serve big portion , kinna unhappy with their coffee,  coffee should be real hot coffee not cold. Customer service is AAA , lucky we hvae Patrick our waiter.he's very attentive and  took care of our needs like a special guest.The sauce is also good. taste like real home made salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_cMznxlsNHhmrKR4dcmnWg.text: Reyna was awesome from start to finish she made me feel very welcomed and best of all very friendly.. Service in general was one of the best and speaking about breakfast food best I had in vegas so far. I would recommend eating the stuffed french toast. :)

VqWg7tJHapAKMzlP-Al2Ig.text: This restaurant had the best service on our trip. They made sure we were okay throughout the morning. Their menu was awesome with so many choices. I had the Huevos Rancheros with chorizo and it was great. I also loved their potatoes. They actually give a lot of food.  We sat outside on the patio and the weather was great and the experience was even better for our breakfast.  I would go here again or try their other locations hoping it's very similar!

22jENMjP31M5TvIb_W_LPA.text: Amanda has a very infectious smile.  What a great start to our day having her serve us breakfast.  The coffee is particularly good and I appreciate the flavored creamers.  If appreciate an almond or soy milk option and a Stevia option but a boy can dream.  The omelettes are huge and our coffee pot was always kept at the right levels for a perfect breakfast experience.  Thank you!

nYYPkyP2U1vnM7oju40Nlw.text: Loved the food here! We came for the first time today and all of the food was delicious. Good price for the amount of food they give. The banana nut muffin was amazing. I will definitely be coming back when in Vegas agains

OZ6jNM9NNUUeffG5er8tdQ.text: The food here is really good. The skillets have a ton of food with all great flavors. Biscuits and gravy are a generous portion that come with sausage and the great seasoned potatoes. Only tree stars here because of our terrible seating situation. Wait wasn't too bad but we elected to sit on the patio on a nice morning but wrong choice. He flies on the patio are terrible. Constantly all over us and our food the whole meal. Nasty pigeons roaming around going under the table too. Other than that...the service and food was great.

1h86d_W_XYSg5N8LnsU45g.text: The family and I make it a point to eat breakfast here during our Las Vegas visits. Friendly staff!  Amazingly delicious food!  Banana muffin!  Waffles!  Everything is delicious!

t96cRTNmOahcYt7G_iOrzQ.text: Sin City is the playground for to-be-brides, burned-out college students, and exotic dancers galore.  But with the bright lights and a full schedule of gambling, shopping, and drinking you definitely need to start your day right with the most important meal of the day--breakfast. Egg & I is a local favorite and contrary to the restaurant's name they do serve entrees san eggs. *gasp*   The offering: *Reuben Sandwich w/ Fries: The meat was perfectly seasoned between two toasted slices of bread. mmMmmm... Oh and they gave an extremely generous offering of french fries. yum yum!  *Fender Blender: Some type of egg and crepe contraction which was light fluffy and all around delicious. It came with an asian-inspired sauce which complimented the main course perfectly. Oh and the potatoes were spot-on!    *Florentine Omlette (Daily Special): Ironically the daily special was not special at all . Instead it was a complete epic fail in my party.  Way too cheesy as the produce was drowning in the gooey sea.     The food is great, the price is right ($8 average entree), and I'm definitely coming back!

ZYXlqKRIdL7m_JNxPzTjsg.text: Went here twice in the same week and it was delicious! Gets really busy on weekends but the line moves pretty fast.  Service was awesome.  We got free muffins because the waitress thought the food was taking too long.  We ended up taking muffins home with us because they were so good.  Love this place for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin!

ugJU2oLSL4W_7IjySHKCAQ.text: All I can say is yummy!! Food was delicious and the Hanna nut muffin was to die for. Super banana-ey! Carole Ann, our server, was great! If you're staying on the strip, it's so worth the 10 minute drive!

57s7GLl0Q8IvABZc4A2q5Q.text: My family loves this place! Everything we have had is absolutely delicious. I am always surprised at the speed of their food even when the restaurant is packed! The banana nut muffins are fantastic. Alexa was our waitress this morning and was friendly and made us feel welcome, while being super attentive and speedy. Thanks for a delicious and delightful experience! We dined at the West Sahara location

P6xcEkRwq10jgivIf52lAQ.text: Best Bfast in town, especially after a rough night in Vegas.  Very well worth the 4mile drive from the strip.

tbb9GuT2vPo96H0drbTNVg.text: Good food, great service. They were recommended by a local family member and will likely visit again when visiting LAS in the future. My husband thought omelette was good, but skimpy (not very full) with potatoes, which he and 6 ,y/o thought were really good. I had pancakes, scrambled eggs and bacon.

swS8v1k8oYFcOIul9vHfFw.text: As long as you like eggs, this is great! They have few non egg choices, but a plethora of egg creations!  I had their breakfast burrito (scraped out of its tortilla -no gluten for me ). It was very good. In retrospect I would just get a skillet but I was starving and not thinking clearly with all the choices!   I went on a Saturday morning and even though it was crowded, it felt like the wait was fine. The staff is friendly and was obviously working very hard to be quick yet still friendly. I enjoyed this place.

r4ZrPddqWgD5XJYO1L6B0A.text: I've been to some of the other egg works locations in vegas and have enjoyed them all. I got the Santa Cruz skillet and it was very tasty. I've had some better dishes at other locations (carnitas skillet!) but this was pretty darn good. The service was great and very accommodating even though they were busy, and by checking in on Yelp we got free banana nut muffins - a must try! Won't hesitate to go back next time I'm in vegas.

C4ODEl01anGQrenoxgl2qA.text: We had a great time at Eggs & I! A country, "at home" feel inside with lots of happy chatter and flavorful food. We had Patrick, who was very kind, attentive and patient with our indecisiveness on what to order. We had the Cincy Chili omelette with fruit, Cincy Chili spaghetti, and Banana Nut Muffin. Filled us up perfectly - next time we're in Vegas, we'll certainly be back for another positive experience!

eO8yL3o158YN8tkP08QPAw.text: Such a great place! We ate the haole loco which was sticky rice, ground beef patty that was juicy and big with an over easy egg with gravy! We also had a delicious Banana French toast! Our server Carole Ann was sweet and funny!!

JWt0msBvBuIBHtVPoKDlmw.text: Great place! I "Yelped" breakfast places on the strip because I had already eaten at the Hash House. This place came up so we stopped by it before we headed home. I am so glad we did. When we pulled in there was a line of people outside waiting. Despite the line we only waited 10-15 minutes to be seated. The menu was bigger than I thought. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs. I didn't take a picture of it normally because I was 3 or 4 bites deep before I realized I didn't take a picture. The portions were large and the food came out fast. The wifey said she loved the banana muffin. I didn't get it. I can't give an honest opinion about the muffin because I don't enjoy muffins. Back to the portions, they were so huge this chubby boy couldn't finish it. The potatoes were seasoned just right and not overly covered in seasoning. I am picky about my gravy and it compares well with my aunts gravy. This place is a no fluff breakfast joint. Highly recommended!

tkbbi_aylg8QnOaaUVJekQ.text: I have one word: Karla!! This was my first time visiting and it will now become a staple when in Vegas!  The food was GREAT (the banana nut muffins!!) And Karla took the cake!

EJZ6Bl3hir6g3AFxv79WTA.text: Had an AWESOME  experience with Karla!  She was extremely courteous and SUPER energetic!

BCJorQs2yN6KFovRQ4mZgw.text: Since my sister first introduced me to this place last year, every time I come to Vegas I HAVE to stop by and have myself some breakfast before leaving back to L.A.  The Banana Nut Muffin is so delish! They bring it out to you nice and warm! They also sell them in a loaf for $6.99 and I always buy a loaf home. And they wrap it in clear color papers that makes it look very nice and presentable. The Brad's Very Special is good. It comes with a side of potatoes and eggs that are scrambled together with spinach, mushroom, tomatoes, and cheese melt together.   I definitely recommend this place to anyone that visits Vegas.

faoNG7YZ4CPQx-tq1Hi2rg.text: Delicious. Loved the staff and the decorations. Four egg omelette! We did not even eat lunch. The chile rellino omelette tastes exactly like an enchilada. The mash potato omelette is very filling and my sister who loved mashed potatoes absolutely love it! I ordered the feta, mushroom, and tomato omelette which was good as well! Warm banana nut muffin delicious and you can get a free one! The side signature potatoes are delicious I loved the seasoning and not greasy! Would recommend this restaurant to anyone and the 15 minute drive from the strip is well worth it! Best food for your money value.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mash potato monster omelette

mAO6Wpp1BKunHWmP90I9WA.text: The food was really good! My wife's tortilla shell was stale but other than that I have nothing but good to say. I have to say that Genesis our server was really sweet and was an absolute wonderful as our waitress.

Zfnbr6grQ-nduH9lIQk4bA.text: Great casual breakfast place. Huge menu and great food. Service is excellent and fast

30rvUmfCZm9rAPm_TuWVeQ.text: This place was awesome. Only issue was the wait but that's what u get when the food is great!

BVJUJrCWAtwkrWzIzpST7g.text: Second time here, and I have to say it's average. The previous visit, we went and it wasnt crowded.   This time we went on a Saturday, around 10ish and the wait wasnt too long maybe 10-15 minutes.  Previously, the service was very attentive, but this time service was was very mediocre at best.  I ordered the Taco Rancheros again.  I feel like this time around something was missing,  it tasted kinda blah, or in comparison something that I would find at Dennys.  Tho, the ranch potatoes still were quite tasty!    Next time if we come back, I'm going to try something different. Sigh.

VskDbXlJkO04B-DQ4N4MMw.text: So, what isn't GREAT about the food here? I came with 2 friends and we shared Huevos Rancheros, The Blackened Benny, and the Avocado Omelet. All of them excellent! I forgot to mention the blueberry pancakes? Our server Liliana was AMAZING and attentive and gave great recommendations. The place is a couple miles off of the strip but completely worth it.

yOmJQh-cIs4Aa9vZDC_ZYQ.text: Service was excellent! Thanks Amanda for the wonderful experience. The food was also delicious. Chicken fry steak it up!

SvYG_3I_dUQ7Gu5dOLBILA.text: So good! Last day of a business trip and we ate here it was incredible food. Had burrito, banana muffin, pancakes. Only complaint is you can't get just one pancake. Anyways, highly recommended.

g9p2RseJBiN_sG-aM6nqJQ.text: Best breakfast AND service in town.  Standard breakfast items are very good, but the variations are even better.  The Benny, the Hawaiian dishes like loco moco, and the banana-in-anything you want are awesome.    Lots of free and easy parking.  Restaurant is super clean and nice.  Special shout out to Cheryl for the excellent service and great suggestions!

axpQq4UWiD6bD5GcD_ooUg.text: Always love coming here. This place rocks! Great service and even better food! Even went on a double date for Valentines here!  I can honestly say that the steggs(steak and egg) is better here compared to babystax. They don't have red velvet pancakes though, don't come here for that and be disappointed. Egg works bennys are farrrrr more tastier and better than babystax. It has much better flavoring. The potatoes on the side is seasoned really well. Can even preach that their potatoes fries taste better than babystax potatoes fries. The price here is cheaper than babystax. The only downside is the pancakes. Their pancakes and banana nut muffin was not good at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib benny. Has a strong pepper scent.

NNBIInSd6DXdlsHliyTKFQ.text: Tamara is such a sweet waitress! Very helpful and nice. I like how you get to put a sign when you need a waitress to help you. It made it very easy to get help.   I loved the food here. I got the enchilada omlette which was good but I wish it tasted more like tomato sauce rather than chili. The banana muffins are soooo good! That is a must.

q1iRbeUuh-t94r4HALV4wA.text: Visiting Las Vegas, after a long night we needed a great breakfast, according to yelp Egg and I was one with the highest ratings, we decided to give it a shot, even do it was about 7 miles away from our hotel, I can tell you that this place is different, every single thing we ordered was great, everything was really fresh and tasty, I would definitely recommend this place, not a fancy place but serving amazing breakfast items!!!!!

MBZHgZ7X5dYS4lghX4fQZA.text: Looking for a place to eat? Breakfast Off the strip? I say try this place out. I must say their banana nut muffin is really good! The staff here are friendly and attentive. The food here is good! I've tried their Original Breakfast burrito, the Ensenada burrito, and homemade corn beef hash skillet. They all come with a side of country style seasoned potatoes. My hubs and I love them potatoes! Order yourself a lemonade (free refills) and chow down! I've only been here 3 times this year but every time that I've eaten here, I'd leave satisfied!   Texas style French toast wasn't really a home run for us. We should have stuck with pancakes/waffles instead. There's always a wait especially on the weekends. They have a dog friendly patio.

RTIrTds15Eu-u_gMVyjv-Q.text: Yummy.   Classic diner with friendly staff. The portions are pretty good so be ready to have left overs if you aren't sharing!   The food came out quickly and was pretty yummy. I'm definitely coming back to try out some more stuff on the menu

E8U2enV8KIdj0tZKYCBKJg.text: Love love this place!!!!!! Super delicious breakfast!!! Came with my girls and I ate the biscuits and gravy and they were the best! I also had the blueberry pancakes and they did not disappoint! Karla was our waitress and she was awesome! She was very attentive and kind! Thanks Karla for making our breakfast that much better!  I recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry pancakes

FOBi1faFKrZzly7Z4Nc59Q.text: Any of these in town are great. Staff is always friendly and attentive and the food is top notch. Great for brunch when you're not getting boozy, and they have a little bit of everything for everyone.

geJ8HieT4GMbnA7_pHyncQ.text: This place gets busy because it is a popular breakfast restaurant. We waited 10min to be seated at a table for two. The wall decor is pretty awesome. We ordered pancakes which were okay, but have had better at other restaurants like Patty's Eggnest. The potatoes were amazing! I've heard other items on the menu are delicious, so just check the reviews before ordering.

Q6bcKB3th6eKuJBNKlAlPw.text: Came across this place using Yelp before coming to Vegas. Immediately I knew I wanted to come here right off the bat looking at the pictures. Came here without any reservations but the place was spacious enough that we didn't have to wait. Three of us went and we ordered an omelette plate, pancakes, a skillet plate and a side of toast. Oj was a must! Annnnd we got muffins for free for checking in! The orders were hugeeee and all the plates came with a side of home fries! My chicken fried skillet plate was amazing! Definitely not what I expected. The fried chicken was covered with gravy and then topped with two Sunnyside eggs. I thought the fried chicken would be too crunchy or crispy and wouldn't blend well with the home fries tucked underneath and especially for breakfast but I was worrying for now reason! The chicken was covered with the gravy making them soft and moist yet still a bit crispy! This plate is definitely a must try!!!! The pancakes were great, one order came with two large pancakes that were soft and moist! The omelette was awesome as well. The omelette was filled with tomatoes, mushrooms and spinach! If you're able to drive out from the strip stop by here for some bomb breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried skillet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-ovAFVUhoVHM0nbwztURQQ.text: This place is the best! Karla was awesome, she has such a postive friendly attitude and took care of us fast and great!!! The food is the absolute best

DHqn4VEaVv8H0E3eDfsCZw.text: This is the one place I come for breakfast while in Las Vegas! There are so many choices on the menu, it is all delicious. The portions are big, service is great. This place is always packed though. They now take your name and text you when your table is ready though. Just be prepared for about a 15-25 min wait. It is very worth it though. I love the waffles. They don't need any syrup, because they are sweet on their own. I leave very satisfied everytime. We chose first available seating and had to sit outside today though. It was quite chilly. They need heaters in the winter/spring out there!

XBh2uQqHulIGTK82i9G6dw.text: It is ok for the money but there is nothing memorable here. If you want something better than Denny's this does it. Perhaps the omelettes are best thing on the menu.

1cbUVeL0azxw0yEmwuwaVQ.text: If you're looking for the best place in the world for breakfast, this is the place, hands down. This is a must place for all of our Vegas trips. It's that good, enough said :-)

7ydu8VkoOpcCRttADVH6_w.text: Great service, good food and very generous portions. Would highly recommend for breakfast food lovers.

efKlfvRoPLREQ_DAtr25PQ.text: Hubby and I love brunch/breakfast and came on yelp to help us find a place to eat. Eggs and I food is AMAZING! We went 2 days in a row, I would definitely recommend their skillets, it was the best breakfast Hubby and I ever had. We went on a weekday but their service was fast! Definitely try it out!

Ya6l_tZ_YFOLKT8HQwS9eQ.text: My boyfriend and I went in to have breakfast for the first time at the egg & I. We were greeted very kindly by Corey. He didn't even worry about asking how many because he had seen it was just the two of us. As we followed him to our seats he turned to make conversation with us asking how our day has been and was very nice and smiling the whole time! When we got to the table he pulled out my chair and then my boyfriends. His customer service was what I'd compare to fine dining service! Thank you so much Corey! Then we were sitting for less than a minute and our waitress Manuela was already over with two waters. She was very friendly when she greeted us and gave us the perfect amount of time to decide on our meal. We also were very interested In trying the banana nut muffin so she had that come out before our food! It was warm and soft! Definitely a must try. When our food came out Manuela came by to check on us and make sure everything was meeting our standards. I ordered the morning mountain breakfast and it was eggs, cheese, and ham over a croissant. My boyfriend ordered the biscuits and gravy which he was really pleased with! Everything was very good and Manuela was very attentive to us (even though it was obviously busy inside and out). She made sure our drinks were always full and we were doing good. I give it 5 stars not only for the service but the food as well. We will be back again!

Veu9ehl2ijWfkwB1KQRpUQ.text: BEST PLACE EVER!!! I love eggs and I love breakfast foods and I love banana nut muffins. This place can do almost anything (and more) with eggs and their banana nut muffins are to die for. They warm it up for you and taste amazing with or without butter. Service is great! The staff is super friendly check in on you without hovering. There are so many delicious options on their menu and sadly I was only in LV for a few days but I would definitely go back just to eat here again!   Side note: I fell so in love with their muffins that I went back the day before my flight back home to get 3 to eat on the way back - AND THEY THREW IN A FOURTH MUFFIN FOR FREE!!

mLrK8L5UaFCbf_HvxYFQew.text: I was going to give this restaurant four stars but it deserves 5, because not only is the food delicious, the customer service is outstanding.  There was a small group of us and we all had something different abd we all loved our choices. We all had the banana nut bread muffin; which was nice and warm and moist. I then moved on to my Blackened Prime Rib Benny. I was in heaven and did I mention the seasoned potatoes? They were a perfect accompaniment to the dish.  Portions are generous, so come hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened Prime Rib Benny. Not your ordinary Eggs Benedict; this one comes on a split croissant and a sprinkle of their Diablo seasoning.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary Banana Nut Bread Muffin. Warm, moist and delicious.

-K8IZyO-qZARSS-T9N1K3w.text: My favorite Sunday Brunch location. This location is always busy, so make sure you are willing to wait 10-15 mins to get your seats.   Banana nut muffin is one thing you shouldn't miss, it blowed my mind the first time I tried it. It's not over-sweet and the aroma of banana smell so damn good.

E-8V-64sRl7GQh5ZK0cMmQ.text: WOWWWWWWWIIIIEEEEEEEEE!  that's what I felt when I put the stuffed french toast in my mouth! and this is what I looked like O.O  I came here once before and got a healthy omelette. I wasn't thoroughly impressed with this place, but let's be real, how yummy can anything healthy get? But I decided to give it another chance and decided to try one of their signature dishes. THE stuffed french toast: french toast stuffed with egg, sausage and cheese topped with powdered sugar. It's a heavenly mix of savory and sweet, especially dipped in maple syrup.  Most of their entrees come with their homemade potatoes. They're lightly fried to give a french fry crisp and cajun-flavored that makes it taste like Lay's BBQ chips!!  This place is better than the all time popular Hash House A-go-go!! It's as good as breakfast can get!!

Kt-wEQgGqe7z3EKQgclq_w.text: Always a brunch favorite. Eggs over easy with a waffle and chocolate milk!! Yumm. Looking forward to my next visit.

xiF8l9qAhxMlT0R_UPIcFQ.text: Great breakfast in Vegas, tons of egg choices. We have made this a regular spot each time we visit

6I2IaJN0XEv_lbzCU5hQaA.text: We had the Chile Relleno Omelette and the Chicken Fried Steak. Both were amazing. We live in CA and I've never had a better Chile Relleno. The house made banana nut muffin was soft and delicious. Our hostess Chance was sweet and awesome.

irI77e0-L5tF2igj4kMfuA.text: Amazing for breakfast/brunch. Staff were very friendly and portions are huge! I did not run out of food. The banana nut muffin was the best I've ever had. Shame I live in the U.K and this will be the last time I visit it

LXY1GV7MBVkQE5-lazRpnw.text: Yummy. I loved everything i got the flapper  with French toast.... YUMMY   My boyfriend got the flapper with pancakes. He liked everything except  the pancakes were gummy.   The fresh squeezed oj was delicious   REASONABLE PRICES!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The flapper with French toast , eggs scrambled, and ham.... Another flapper with pancakes, bacon, and eggs

JwpzsSeeaRqVXm_yhJVcWQ.text: Perfect breakfast place! Our server Oscar was awesome! I had the bacon and avocado omelette and my fiance had the bacon ham and sausage skillet, so delish! Definitely check this place out of you're looking for a hearty breakfast after a fun night out in Vegas!

Z5ZumgZooRIXwVyh5bzJjw.text: This place is eggcellent and I will definitely return!   Ulises was my waiter and he was courteous, helpful and quick.  I got the corned beef hash meal and the homemade corned beef hash was awesome and the eggs were well prepared. The banana nut muffin was good, I liked the fact that it wasnt as oily as many muffins. The toast and coffee were just ok, but I'm not complaining, this is a fantastic restaurant and anyone would be lucky to be nearby.

GrKincW6hKJfc5DJk1y0Pg.text: Food was delicious!! Portions were huge, could have easily shared one plate! I had the stuffed French toast which is basically an omelette between two large pieces of French toast, yummy. The potatoes were crunchy, the only way to have breakfast potatoes. The banana but muffin was heaven on a plate, a must try for sure. Amanda was our server and she was not only efficient but friendly and made our visit perfect! We will be back and hope she is there when we are.

Adaf8k4ZshVHdGHHCIf5Ag.text: Every time I come to Vegas this place is a must. The servers are very sweet (shout out to Jessica, our amazing server, who told us to go for the waffle with strawberries and cream - it was amazing and fluffy and warm and oh man. Miss it already. Sigh) and their little egg notification for need something/satisfied) is adorable. Go. You won't regret it.  Get the skillet. Their potatoes are SO GOOD.   Check in for their free banana nut muffin. It's also SO GOOD.   What are you waiting for? Go!!!

45SEItA0lQZI08CGoZqthQ.text: This restaurant was the bomb. Amazing customer service on top of speedy and delicious food.

AWZ8ZHhEv1t5EXs-qlubVg.text: Average greasy spoon that would make you not hungry, but not worth the trip from the strip.  Service: Excellent Food: Average to below average Price: Fair for what you get, but with added costs of having to uber it there and back, it isn't worth it.   Preliminary: We went on a Monday morning and there was no line and service was great. Other than that, the restaurant was lacking and not worth the trip from the strip. Just FYI, these Egg & I restaurants are independent from one another as I heard the staff tell another customer.  My wife and I went on a Monday morning. The reviews said their would be lines, but we encountered none.   We got a variety of food. She got coffee, pancakes, scrambled eggs, and turkey ham.  I got OJ, hot tea, biscuits and gravy, potatoes, and turkey sausage (they only have patties in turkey sausage).    She said her coffee was good, the eggs were as expected, but nothing spectacular, and she liked the turkey ham. The pancakes were not cooked all the way through. She ate about 1/3 before she got to the middle to discover the undercooking. The restaurant offered to toss them back on the griddle, but she declined as she wanted to eat my potatoes (which were very good).  They brought out a chocolate muffin to make up for it. It hasn't been eaten yet, but I suspect it's pretty decent.   As for my food, the potatoes were really good! Like really good.  Well seasoned and smaller and crispy, the way I prefer them to be. My wife liked them as well.  My turkey sausage was  undercooked and cold when served.  If you like hot tea like me, savor your first tea bag, because that's all you'll be getting for the $2.50 it costs to get hot tea. And perhaps it was my mistake for ordering biscuits and gravy; as a southern man, maybe my standards are too high. The meal was reminiscent of what you get at a Holiday Inn continental breakfast in the south. Seriously, no joke, and I feel bad about saying it like that, but it's True. The biscuits were hard and as if they were precooked and then microwaved when the dish was ordered. The gravy was ok, but nothing special.   Overall, with the cost of breakfast, plus the uber there and back, it would have been just as cheap to do the Bellagio buffet and gotten better food and more options.

1K1LGp4_omc_o5VBPMBRkg.text: We're from Los Angeles - on vacation. The wait wasn't as long as we had expected - but a much longer wait would've been worth it! Liza was super attentive, friendly, & warm. We highly recommend this place to anyone in Las Vegas area. We had Mimosas, stuffed French Toast, & the Works Chili Skillet; simply the best!!!

Tn7wZxoBPDDr1phZF639kA.text: Great breakfast, reasonable price, great service and we were able to watch the football games.

LCP6BGid_WfotmN5m8axmA.text: This was my first time and I absolutely loved the food and the service. The food was delicious and the servers were very nice. The portion size definitely matches the price. The banana nut muffin and the potatoes were the highlight for me, it was so bomb. Although the wait was long (20 minutes), it was definitely worth the wait!

4xd9l-qs6JFqmJmT36URRg.text: So glad I ate here... Our server was excellent! She must've had like 12 tables and still treated us like we were the only ppl in the restaurant. I had the French toast... OMG! TO DIE FOR! Search no more. You don't need to go to the strip for breakfast. The egg and I nailed it!

UcdTUqegttKOtzWz7EckFQ.text: I made a reservation for 12. My family got here first and they refused to seat us before the entire 12 people were here. They were extremely rude and I was told that the reservation will be canceled if the group didn't show up in 5 mins. I felt disrespected.

nahFu_XJ4frY9xBTLcbC_Q.text: I haven't had breakfast in here in a while, not since we first move here around 8-9 years ago.  No one here this morning, our family finally left for home after a nice long visit, so we were up early going to the airport to drop off.  With plenty of time, we decided to stop in and give this place a try.  Good breakfast place. Size is generous, choices are plenty, and prices are average. Service was great.  I would recommend it.

pCpBsISHyigBQS7M5xPnDg.text: We ordered some kind of Mexican dish that comes with tortillas, and asked waitress for the corn tortillas,  because I'm gluten free, and we got flour tortilla inside, we asked again and second time they brought us flour tortilla, after we spoke with manager she proposed us to get extra muffin. Seems like she doesn't know what gluten free means

YOD7oKjcaRdCEYidAgqZQg.text: Always a pleasure to visit when im town. Nice variety of egg breakfast meals to satisfy anyone!

6gsbUY3CspTK4Gipb5J9dw.text: Must come here. Brady is one of the best waiter here. Attentive and friendly. Makes you feel at home. Food is GREAT here. Had the Western omelette and the muffin was delicious.

6lXXh9YEo0ich0ebzHa-GA.text: Egg and I offers an awesome array of breakfast choices and the food preparation and quality did not disappoint our party of five.  Arriving about 9 AM on a Wednesday morning, the restaurant was busy, but not unduly crowded.  We were seated promptly and quickly supplied with coffee by the attentive waitress.  Various breakfast dishes were selected and delivered with no undue delay.  Everything was cooked to our complete satisfaction.  Overall a very satisfactory breakfast with no problems whatsoever.

N6j9wXudDYwJCX2rGKwOEQ.text: Breakfast this morning was very good both in size and cost. We were immediately seated and our waiter, Ulitis, was very good. We will come again.

AyE-S4gF76j31YogxCMfzw.text: Are you tired of waiting in lines that look like you're at Disney just to eat buffet food?  Then do I have an off the strip place that you'll will like.  My cousin told me about the Egg & I.  Boy am I glad that he did.  The food was really good.  There was a 10-15 minute wait but did not compare to those monstrous lines in the casino hotels.    After glancing through their newspaper styled menu, I decided to have a four egg omelette.  Which was more than delicious when it arrived.  Accompanying this wonderful omelette was their famous ranch potatoes.  These bad boys were orgasmic good.  They were seasoned with some spices that gave it a lil bit of a kick.  But if you aren't into spicy then I advise you put some ketchup on them to dull the fire.  All in all the meal was delicious.  The service was pretty good as well.  They have a system where there is a napkin holder and on top are two pictures of eggs.  If you need some assistance then you just flip the egg to yellow.  Now I may be butchering the explanation of this process but long story short the wait staff is very attentive and helpful.  So give it a shot if you are tired of long buffet lines.  It also gives you a chance to see the other parts of Vegas.

1a3RVC3R6VzNn09fKtIlEw.text: That is one de-lic-ious breakfast. I happily took my banana muffin with me to-go and made it my perfect snack a couple hours later. Service is spot-on, food is EGGsellent.  I had the California crepe which was the perfect mix of omelet insides, and crepe outside.

mF0PgUCeJLv_E1b2CXEIwA.text: First I think most of the bad time was due to our waitress Ashley. She had a bad attitude from the start and was more than slow. I tried to order a mimosa which I was then told that even though it's on the menu they don't have them. Ashley took offense to that as well. It took a while to get our sodas, she never came back for refills. After a bit she came to take our order and didn't get that right either. My sister ordered a burger with a muffin as an appetizer,  the muffin never came. I ordered a pesto veggie sandwich (came out without pesto) but Ashley didn't know that because she never checked on our food once it cane out. My mom asked 3 people for mustard, by the time she got it her burger was cold. Overall less than happy with the experience. Cheers, hope yours is better than ours.

DbmfrzO3DvciiFfHSiZwIA.text: Terrible Takeout! Do not go! I called in my order, simple two omelet, with some fruit and tomatoes on the side. Nothing crazy. So I got thought the extended diatribe on the phone clarifying and identify I understand the extra charges for a side of tomatoes, the cashier says 10 minutes. I get to the restaurant about 6 minutes later only to sit and wait another 20 or so, the price of which had never been disclosed to me. $11 per 4-egg omelet. I was a little shocked, but then my order was also wrong, they missed my extras and wanted to charge me even more for simple stuff like an ounce of tomatoes. I'm trying to grin and bare it, when the cashier dashes off without a word to get her manager, because she doesn't actually know the cost of said side of tomatoes. The manager comes out with a half -ass-ed apology and an offer to "take care of me" the NEXT time I choose to suffer through this establishment's shotty service. So now that I've arrived at my office a whole 3 minute drive away, My fruit cup was leaking all over the bag of food. Each meal was luke warm, the ranch potatoes nearly broke a tong of my plastic fork, which we received one less than requested. My crazy chicken  omelet, which is described as "Loaded with julienned chicken breast, fresh mushrooms and guacamole. Topped with muenster cheese and sour cream." on the website, had flavorless dark meat chicken, and mushy old guacamole that was terrible. Don't trouble yourself with this establishment, food should be a delight, not a stressful experience.

gE9EAqNJahpnVw_ayIogag.text: Great Vegas breakfast place.  The food is great, the service is great, and the whole place has personality.  If you're looking to eat breakfast somewhere off of the strip, Egg & I has you covered.

PZMMeAQj94voIKQj_6jGew.text: Great hearty breakfast if you are not wanting the all-u-can-eat buffet.  The only thing this place is not drunk-walkable in am, it is a drive away - towards the "giant souviener shop" direction away from the strip.  Good service and good food. Every seat was taken in the restaurant. The hostess and waiters are all super nice saying "morning sweetie" and "how are you honey" seem to really enjoy working there.  All the food portions were HUGE! our table tried a little bit of everything: blueberry pancakes, choc chip pancakes, moco loco, breakfast burrito, omlettes.  their potatoes were really good - seasoned and fried!  Wish it was walkable from the strip - that would make it 5 stars!

AxbVWoFmmepXDMBae0jTrQ.text: Paid a recent visit after probably ten years since my last meal here. Just as good as I remember. Skillet breakfasts always satisfy. Good coffee. Friendly and prompt service.

pEwbV4QmXBCsghpKfB0ejA.text: Recently ate breakfast here on a Sunday morning in mid Oct '13.  Wait : 20 mins for 2 patrons at 10:30am. : 3 stars Dining room : simplistic but acceptable appointments (furniture, wall decor) : 3 stars Menu choices:  plenty of options, and menu was easy to read : 4 stars  Food : my party ordered : breakfast burrito - 5 stars,  pancakes - 5 stars,  scrambled eggs - 4 stars,  bacon - 3 stars,  'work' potatoes - 4 stars,  fruit plate - 4 stars  Value : reasonable prices for quality of food, good prices for quantity of food  Summary : I enjoyed my visit and would visit again.

puRY1Pgbnct--G42exvnAg.text: I read all the great reviews on Yelp for this place and recommended it to the group I was with.   Long story short we went twice in 4 days, its that good.  I want to know where they get their sausages, outstanding flavor....service great...we waited less than 10 minutes the first time and walked in the second.  I will definitely be going to this place again...The only thing I could recommend would be that they fix the latch in the restroom.  Also they really need to put a Rooster for the Men's room and a bunch of chickens for the Ladies Hen house...;)

oFQ56nhAIk7KbjxYccjEgw.text: Egg & I is always a favorite and is most always the first breakfast spot we hit during our ventures to LV.  I can't seem to get myself to order anything but the Egg Crepes, I guess it's just because it's that good, not to mention, I can't order anything like it from anywhere else!  I forget which one I usually order, I think it's called the "Collision" or something?  It has mushrooms and bacon in it.  The Ranch Potatoes are like like Potato Chips, you can't help but pop one after the other, after the other, in your mouth.  But, it's not like I can finish it anyways, because of that damn freakin most delicious Banana Nut Muffin I have in the beginning.  Oh my gosh, slap a little butter on it, hell, slap a lot of butter on that warm muffin and it's freakin heaven.  I'll need to ask the next time I'm around if I can actually order some muffins to go.  Egg & I is definitely worth it and I'll keep coming back every time I'm in town.

JhVKQp50yd3QStYoMaPKfw.text: I had the Chile rellenos burrito and my boyfriend had the eggs benedict. Both were delicious! The service was great! My boyfriend made the comment hope he wished his meal came with one of the banana nut near muffins, so our waitress brought one out for him too, since it was our first time visiting the restaurant. Great food. Great service. Great experience.

2Uf0yXBIqKOYWgOoNE5y3A.text: We love having breakfast here every time we're in Vegas. I love the Asian breakfast selection that they have on a separate sheet. I always get the spam and eggs. It comes with white sticky rice. Yum! Reminds me of home. I have had the Brad's Very Special but it's not my favorite. My hubby and brother in law always get either the Mexican Omelette or the Francisco's Scramble. We love this place. It gets very busy during peak hours  so get there before 9am. But, it's a pretty big place and it has a huge patio. So, we never have a long wait. If you want a great breakfast head over here. This is also our favorite location. They have really good service here. The Egg Works is not as good as this location.

XWlxQa4j--x19vhmIEGnmw.text: Great service n food! Thanks Ulises!! I will definitely come back when in town thank you

7yzzMkzzwAJXKYFE4bJY2w.text: I'm not really a breakfast person but this place was suggested by someone and my friend and I decided to check it out. It's such a cute little place, with delicious food. The environment was super cozy. It's a must if you go to Vegas for a little vacation.

4UeTGsCywUdXHvfRuNi4Zw.text: Great food with big portions! Very friendly stuff, Amanda was amazing! Just perfect, we loved it!!!

WKvIRFmooO2_IQGMePaXEg.text: There's a reason this place has great reviews! This place is awesome!! Our server Amanda was so friendly and pleasant!! This now one of our must haves when we come to Vegas.

5OeMxWdhgET2APV5XlN4VA.text: Great service from our waitress Tamara. Wonderful suggestions which shows knowledgeable staff. Banana nut muffins are off the hook!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-rTfYu5oFQx8y1PpCQJ0Og.text: The banana nut muffin is where it's at, comes at you fresh and hot.  The breakfast burrito was alright, it could have been a bit more moist, like some pico or something.  The stuff french toast egg, that's where it's at.  Nice and fluffy egg layers inside french toast.  The potatoes are pretty good as well.  The oj doesn't seem fresh squeezed.

dvFg9M9j-WL0eCv5Qvjayw.text: Great brunch place! Place was packed when we got there but waited only a bout 15min. Their coffee comes with your personal jug! I also loved the various 'healthy options they had' which included substituting for egg whites / fruit / etc. Bunch of different types of omelettes on the menu too. Eggcellent, 5stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uARsfQvg9qNmf1ocp6RoiA.text: Great place for breakfast and brunch off the strip! I've been to Vegas so many times that I'm just a fan of eating local and I will not from now on have it any other way! The waitress was so friendly and attentive! The ambience was Casual and I would definitely go again! Loved it!

FD8seH6rfWx2p3rgYjo0xA.text: My fiance loves Egg & I. Food is good for the most part. However, the habla diabla potatoes are way to salty.

MBuQJrnQSM9rUbefetTC2g.text: I cannot say enough about this restaurant! We have spent  an incredible 8 days in Vegas and have gone to The Egg & I 3 times for breakfast. They cater to every taste and desire. Most of us in our group are vegetarians and all left more than satisfied! Their hollandaise sauce is super delicious! The variety in the menu is huge and everything we ordered was outstanding. What made the experience so much better two out of the three times we went there though was our waitress. Manuela was the best. So cheerful, attentive and super down to earth. It's great to be served by someone who seems to enjoy what they do. Wish we could uproot The Egg & I and take it to California with us along with Manuela.

UlkphLe3Ojd-mkci4MYTFQ.text: Great service, free banana nut muffin, and pretty good food.  What makes this place shine though has to be the service. Super friendly staff that focuses on the small things like offering coffee to go, asking if we need a cup holder, and being consistently friendly.  Something about the rye bread with butter made it better than bread at other places.  Maybe it was the swirls in the middle.    While the food isn't they best in the wolrd, the whole package of atmosphere, service, and speed the food came out made this place a winner.  Plus they know how to utilize Reciprocity Principle by giving away free muffins: smart folks! Most likely coming back next time I'm in Vegas.

gLLPU_Isqe-f0DH_AGltuw.text: One of the reasons we love coming to Vegas is for amazing dining experiences. This place was highly rated and had thousands of reviews so we decided to give it a try. With all the hype we found ourselves disappointed. You can tell Yelp has made this a popular choice, but we thought it was just mediocre. The only thing I can rave about is the banana bread French toast... bomb! The first time my meal came out the French toast was barely warm. I let our server, CeCe, know and asked her if it was possible to warm it up. Instead she offered to bring out a whole other fresh order. CeCe was absolutely great. I would give her 5 stars, but not the whole establishment. The pictures of the outside of the restaurant almost swayed me from going but decided to give it a shot. There are so many other restaurants in Vegas that have a nice ambience or view, but their food sucks. We decided we would rather have great food in a lesser desirable atmosphere, but didn't get that after all. Maybe it was an off morning for them, though we did go on a Monday morning at 9:30 and the place wasn't too packed. I would hate to see how they perform on a Sunday morning if this is how it is on a weekday morning.  I would give them another chance only for that banana bread French toast. Without it I would give them a 2 stars at most.

98FfmnXPlsSagjL0epSzXw.text: We enjoyed a lovely brunch here! The choices were varied, portions huge and the foid very flavourful. The best thing, it was almost half the cost of eating on the strip! If you have a car go where the locals are, treat yourself to an awesome brunch and enjoy discovering new addictions!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmo
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A must share option. Their maple creamcheese pecan french toast!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas

qbuFdye_6EMN7J2jF670Iw.text: Have you been to an Egg & I? If not, then run (don't walk) or drive to this location right away!   I am a Las Vegas local who brings all her guests her. My mom, who is 72, said this is the best omelet she has ever had in her life. And she has had a lot of omelets. Traditional and unique breakfast foods.  The staff is always helpful and friendly.

Ut4PlZBNPM2vVKiHKsadZQ.text: The food here is so fresh and yummy. Came here for my first time and service was awesome. Our waitress Carolina was sweet. Always came to our table to make sure we had everything we need or need refills. They did a slight boo boo on my omelette but Carolina went and told her manager and in return they gave me a free banana loaf and carrot cake loaf  I would take that anytime. I would definitely come back here when traveling out this way and I would definitely recommend this place to everyone!!

cwxwQuB4FszCUz-T9qPmpw.text: Breakfast is king here.  Ours was good, nothing spectacular or note-worthy, just good regular food and good service.  It's a neighborhood spot on a busy street, frequented more by locals than tourists...a good thing.

A2x2qaUCsmrvQeWkuBN1TQ.text: Amazing brunches, I tried mashed potato omelette and it was great!! Their muffins are also really tasty!!

-1OuAWGO6Dx_-FvXyNux6Q.text: Grandma's Biscuits & Gravy were awesome. Biscuits were fluffy and the gravy had a nice saltyness to it with bits of sausage. I got mine with the eggs and bacon. My over easy eggs were delicious with the yolks popped over the potatoes. Potatoes had a nice crunch to them.   My wifre ordered the corned beef hash, she said it was just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9rCR2Io_JTANX1jhgGQqpA.text: Came here for the first time on a Friday at noon after reading all the positive Yelp reviews and surprisingly the wait wasn't too bad. The banana nut muffin is to die for and I don't even like muffins like that. I got the veggie skillet and the portions were huge. Also, I'm not sure what they season their potatoes with, but they were amazing. I would come here and get a muffin and potatoes everyday if I could. Parking wasn't a problem because it's located in a big shopping complex with other stores.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie skillet. Portions are huge.

w1Ht151bNYmN8bPu8q-wCA.text: Stopped  in here for breakfast on the way home from Las Vegas. It was a great little place! Big portions, many choices and 2 wonderful items- banana muffins from scratch and the low prices!! Wish it was in OC!! And better than any place on the strip! The staff were all very sweet and friendly too!

PDfLKyiH5cDzkJeLdR1RGg.text: I am from Florida and every time we come to Vegas, we eat here! Best hot sauces EVER!!!! I strongly suggest making this place a tradition as my family has

T3khZyHDMjBENgofZt8SKQ.text: Delicious foods, great services... worth the time waiting!  Will visit again next time in town at LV!

2O91qp8JtfTd_JMWM3ML-g.text: You will get what you see on these multiple pictures  posted here on Yelp. No more and not definitely less. Portions are huge. You will not leave hungry. My pancakes were good. I could not finish them all because they were VERY LARGE.  Service was very friendly. We did not wait at all but of course we came in the middle of the week. They had a lot of people dining but there was no line and no wait.  If you like this type of food i think you will not be disappointed. My husband told me that this restaurant was for vegans but i think he was joking.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RoKjPvdWzeihAXUpgy8CQQ.text: The food here is always great! One thing you must know..... This place closes at 3pm so,  get here early! You can make your reservation when you get here and they will text you when you can be seated.  Service is usually great, and food is mostly perfect. I suggest waffles,  but the menu is so big,  your choices are endless!

8KqKZmcqzC86mEOyPbHffw.text: Pretty darn good...a lot of food.  We all liked the Maple Tree better though.

Hb22FU4X2PYpLvkhjC-kNA.text: This place was awesome for a city , packed at 10am, but we got in rather quickly.  I got the Green Chile Breakfast Burrito, and it arrived on my table before I finished my coffee. Great burrito, Huge and tasty! The staff was top notch, and friendly! If I am in Vegas again, I would defiantly do eats here again!

JsoJBa7ONlpLSFXaRaIAsQ.text: Egg-celent food! :)  it's definitely an old fashion restaurant and setting. We had 4 diners in our party and everyone was very happy with their meal and the service. We will definitely go back again the next time we visit vegas!

SXEMlCc_L-iT32PKVcaZ_Q.text: Okay, went to this place on a friend's recommendation, who grew up in LV.  Easy location just west of the strip. Went on a Wednesday morning, got seated right away.  IMHO, nothing special. Got an egg white veggie omelet.  Pretty plain, though I saved it with ketchup!  Was going to get the stuffed  French Toast, but I love a good omelet.  Just okay here.  Home-style potatoes were good, though they tasted like they had been sitting in the warmer instead of freshly made. Not really large portions.  I did enjoy the banana nut muffin and got one to go.  A friend had huevos rancheros and he really liked it.  Would I go back?  I doubt it.  Too many places in Vegas that have better service and better food.  Maybe the lunch is better. Maybe if I were a meat eater.  Maybe it was just a bad day.  Oh well.  But for me, if you want a place that has better ambience, HUGE portions and a menu that is like a book, go to Hash Hash A Go-Go.

9wGrq70IJtGoFBvKsiPHbQ.text: best breakfast in vegas, screw the fat ho bag buffets, this place was delicious, the tri-tip benedict, got handled! fresh, friendly, and tasty!

hINmegI3V6dDmfhpkozDUQ.text: Never in my life have I polished clean an entire breakfast of steak, eggs, 4 pieces of toast, and hash browns!  The food here is absolutely delicious.  The service is extremely friendly.  Our coffee was lukewarm and they immediately brought out a fresh pot and continued to apologize when I didn't think it was a big deal.  No charge for substituting hash brown patties for potatoes.  Perfectly cooked sunny side up eggs.  delicious, buttery toast.  I have no complaints about this place!  It's just awesome!

ilaFsYHXPfErzK1Hm-mJFw.text: We use Yelp to find this place... my family and I all had breakfast one morning and none of us could finish our meal... I would not recommend this place at all!!!.. do your self a favor and go to the Black Bear Cafe instead.

0tEuIq25I6XVMsyjOow6RA.text: This place is over rated, looks like mostly locals go there but I see coupons that mostly target tourist around Vegas. We ordered pancakes and banana bread french toast. I was disappointed when I got the banana bread french toast, it's just banana bread coated with eggs....what else does someone expect, right? I guess after seeing the 4 stars, made my eggspection higher. For the price I could just get any whole loaf of ordinary banana bread. It came out greasy and you just can't enjoy and finish the whole plate.  My friend ordered the pancakes and we agreed that it was the worst pancake we have ever tasted.  Well, it;s an egg place but considering it being a breakfast place, we eggspect better.  I look around and see people not finishing their plate, no wonder why.  Maybe we ordered the wrong items?and should try the omelettes but definitely, it's a 1 time experience and will not go back to try other stuff.  I will not recommend this place.  Service was okay, just average, no bad experience.

gHVxGM1DtJSDHPYp-wNj1w.text: Good service. Small pancakes were ginormous!  Little egg signs on the table to notify the server.

DCzGsRu3Yo3MqrudO_tBYw.text: Solid, solid food!  Omelets are nice and fluffy, the muffins are all top, and the coffee pot is brought directly to the table in a big pot.  If you have a car in Vegas make your way out here instead of the touristy strip food to get in with the locals and save some dough for your budget.

-Y8TcGM3gL5ToTV4jwcF4A.text: The bacon avacado omlete was delicious. The food came out quick and hot. Great service too.

-V_jItUSr6kw3vyni90_mg.text: We arrived for breakfast on a weekday morning. We were greeted by the hostess and sat near the back, near where the kitchen is. Our waitress was Carol Anne. She was as good as it gets. I asked her what was the best dishes and she suggested the chile relleno omelette. I was glad to hear that as I love green chile and don't get very good ones in Florida. My spouse has the collision which was a cross between a crepe and an omelette. We both ordered potatoes with our entre and a banana muffin. I had seen the muffin delivered to another table. The omelette was awesome the green chile had so much flavor. The collision my spouse had was very good. The banana muffin was the best banana bread or muffin I have ever had. I would go back just for the muffin. Carol Anne was a great server and kept checking with us and took care of us through the whole meal. I noticed on her name tag she had worked there for 4 years and it showed. She knew everything about the restaurant. I would highly recommend this place for breakfast or lunch. I will go back anytime I am in Vegas and of course I will look to sit in Carol Anne's section.

IQoB9Bw1rc0E0H6ebfdktA.text: The reviews on this place really set the bar high for me.   I was slightly disappointed.  The food is good diner food, but the reviews set me up for something else.  The service was fine and the best part of my meal was the thermos of coffee placed on the table next to me.  Low maintenance food that probably tastes great after a night out on the town...

LySKpqrf-7ydiwsYs3SgCQ.text: Yummm!! this is a great breakfast place. I always go for the waffles, but you pretty much cant find a bad meal here.

FquarlU6KorjUBWHzKXIew.text: Nice breakfast!! Veggie Omelet was soft and great with cheese, Stuffed French toast with egg, cheese and ham--great idea and turns out a good match!! Steak and eggs---so tender and well cooked!! Good place with family and friends, nice choice for a fulfilling brunch. Would like to go back again.

wr80QY7upkagkMSrm1sdHw.text: Looking for a decent place for Breakfast?  Clean joint, good service, breakfast items.  Then the Egg & I it is.   This is not "blow my socks off" or "I have to return" type of a place.  Its a place that serves a good breakfast.  Having read all of the reviews, I tried the Egg & I during a recent trip to Las Vegas.  Well, it was OK.  The potatoes on the breakfast plate were good.  The reset are the same that I could have gotten elsewhere.  Good for breakfast, but don't make a special trip.

JOo14IwUudDUCnzGLxawkA.text: Hard to "pile on" with the good reviews, but we're really happy we stopped here. It was on Mother's Day, and I expected a line out the door, but we were seated within 15 minutes, and had very attentive service.  The boys had huge plates while the Mrs and I split one (which was plenty). Beverages ($2.50/each) tend to tip the bill over the top, so be cautious of that, but the food and service are terrific.

sf8gAV2DSsL-4CYOqtGS3w.text: Best Breakfast in town. Had their Chicken Fried Steak Skillet, was to die for! Their awesome potatoes on the bottom, next cut up chicken fried steak, then smothered in the most flavorful country gravy I have ever eaten, then topped off with your choice of eggs and a side of toast or banana muffin. I went with the Banana muffin, which was absolutely delicious.  I ended up revisiting for the country fried steak skillet before I left Vegas to go home.    I give 2 thumbs up all the way and would recommend this to any and everybody.

n9L6rdPBKD-4cKsR-k5-Ug.text: Best breakfast joint in Vegas, hands down.  I will never visit vegas without going here at least once (more likely twice).  I even bought one of their mugs as a souvenir, and I rarely do that.

bY54vz-LHmGLwkBPHZFX5g.text: Divine. This place is pure delicious breakfast magic. I came here upon the suggestions of fellow yelpers for breakfast and had one of the best meals in my life.  I had a banana nut muffin and the the egg crepe (the one with bacon and guacamole). Everything was spot on. The muffin was moist and flavorful. The crepe was a party of flavor, and the good salsa on the side was a surprising accompaniment for a breakfast place  Though the real star was the people. Service was what sort of thing you would watch in an instructional video. Everyone was nice. Waitresses chatted with customers kids, and you know you're home when you hear, "How are you doing sweetie". This place could easily turn into a must every time I get to Vegas.

IOp1t8jz5rmwpIhCajF51g.text: This place is fabulous!   Curtis, our waiter was awesome. Very attentive service. He constantly made sure we had everything we needed throughout the entire meal.  Highly recommend the Chili Relleno omelette.  Very good and great flavor. The potato's are delicious, very well seasoned.   Banana Nut Muffin is amazing! Moist and delicious.   Bloody Mary's are wonderful!! Flavorful and perfectly made.   No need to ask for coffee refills because they leave a pot of coffee on each table.  Yay!!    Picture of Bloody Mary and Chili Relleno omelette.

mOu6iV6UANn-nIrLxpxW4w.text: Loved this place ! Highly recommend it for those touring Las Vegas ! A great brunch spot!!!

pDCPQsWsNwf5mfxuQVuDBA.text: So amazing! I got the cinnamon raisin french toast and my boyfriend got the eggs Benedict and HOLY SHIT WERE THEY GOOD. Especially after a night of drinking in Vegas.  We'll definitely be coming back on our next trip out here.

W-fbFPuBi5oGxuIGj3y9UQ.text: It was my first time at egg and I and I didn't know what to expect but as soon as we were seated the nicest service named tamara came to are table I have gone to alottttt of restaurant and no one has ever been as sweet as she has and this will be my new breakfast spot anytime I come back to Vegas thank you for the wonderful service :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8L4rjm4C8TRjLE3enwm8Ig.text: THE BEST.   Food excellent Service Excellent Evelyn.   Fresh ingredients  I ate every bit of my skillet and I am picky.  I said no to bread only because I am gluten free and the waitress offered fruit.  When ever we come back to Vegas we WILL only eat breakfast here.

yF58t3HO4v3iwWieL2M4Ng.text: Off the strip but worth the drive for breakfast. A lot of options and the food is tasty. My friends had egg Benedict and I had steak and eggs and we were very pleased. The waitress was nice and friendly.

kI1ry2RJ4JCJB75n47ySXg.text: Mother may I have a nut you say? That translate to - Mother, may I have another banana nut muffin?   Omgosh, if you have never had one - you need to. It will change your life. If you are going through the blues, pick one of these banana nut muffins up - you won't gaf what's going on!   The world in which you thought you knew....no longer exist. I'm serious. Try it. Then write me and tell me about it. Hell leave a comment here.

k1f6N7-Ca7WTlwtfLE-OZA.text: This place is great  I'm from Los Angeles and truly this is some of the best breakfast I have ever had the food just had so much taste its incredible how delicious the food was. I definitely will be going to eat breakfast here after a long night of partying.

bTQvVYvQziUKxictB1lwrA.text: Good breakfast/brunch place! We came a little after 8am and it was already pretty busy. Luckily, we didn't have to wait to be seated. The service was great. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. When we told her that it was our first time at Egg & I, she said that all newcomers get a banana nut muffin on the house (even without a Yelp Check-in). The muffins were delicious - sweet and moist. The menu was pretty long and had a lot of options. We decided to try the Bacon and Sliced Avocado Omelette, which was good. It came with a side of potatoes, which had a crispy exterior. Though a bit salty, they were really tasty. We also enjoyed the Traditional Benny, which was an English muffin topped with Canadian Bacon and poached eggs. I liked the hollandaise sauce it came with. The portion sizes were good - we were able to split one dish for two people.  Will come back if I'm in the area again!
