Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and sliced avocado omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin

MDj6W9UHSKGbSeW9D1svsQ.text: They have good food I have order there before what I was disappointed about was that I got it for to go and I literally picked up within 10 Minute and 2 min to my work from there and it was already cold the food . The Benedict and the potato's

LAhb_WLTuxWMVKWHsD0NBA.text: Love this place. We eat here almost every time we come in town. The banana muffins are absolutely amazing. From the omelets and potatoes to the carrot cake French toast. Seriously can't think of anything we have had that wasn't great. Expect a long wait for breakfast, the place is packed every day, not just weekends

pKP3mH215-oGIDDTj4rBoA.text: We went here to eat off strip. It was really busy but moved pretty fast. The food was great and the service was friendly. I got the skillet with ham. bell peppers, eggs and cheese. Hubby got eggs Benedict. Both dishes were perfect.

RMlmppX2bGIx7TAeT-aziA.text: Our server Hailey was very sweet & helpful. Food did not disappoint. The reviews were the reason we came here & they did not mislead us! It's my first time in Vegas & this is the best place I've eaten at so far

eWVn9EPhub0-Xes4eNubXg.text: Food was great and full of flavor . Great price for portion .  The regular French toast was soso

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6kR3UBLzCrqTTP6X_dVyJg.text: We stopped by for a quick breakfast before heading to the airport on Saturday morning. Our last experience here, we had to wait over an hour for the food to come out. It was so bad our waiter had comped our food. So needless to say, we were hesitant coming back here because had to catch our flight. We were pleasantly surprised to come and get seated right away. It was not very crowded and the service was quick!  Breakfast Burrito - This was pretty big and smothered with sauce. I personally do not like my burritos to have sauce on the outside soaking into the tortilla. The ingredients inside were not too bad though.   Oatmeal - I went super plain Jane because we had eaten really late the night before and I wasn't into something heavy. You can't really mess up oatmeal so this was fine.   Overall, it was a quick breakfast and the service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P_Obqc4nrQuPVI890WhHrg.text: I've never seen a greater disparity between Yelp stars and food quality. Everything was a congealed mess of varying ingredients. Tostada? Congealed mass of eggs, cheese and olives (Olives? Tostada? What? No.). Biscuits and gravy? I watched it congeal before my second bite, at which point the flavor was so overwhelmingly bad that I had to stop.  I guess if all you want is scrambled eggs and coffee you'll be okay, but don't waste your time here. Even a Denny's or IHOP would be a better place to eat.  4.5 stars here. I just don't know. I don't know if we had a singularly bad meal or everyone is just too hung over to realize they're eating dog food when they leave a review.

jcF5CO6bxLcU8Yl_4k2mnw.text: If you're of the mentality that the best food in Las Vegas only lives on the strip, you're going to miss a healthy dose of delicious, inexpensive food. The Egg & I is largely an antithesis to what "Vegas" stands for. It is low key, low on panache, and reasonably priced.  I've been here now a couple of times, all in the winter and early spring months, which means I'm always on the patio, because for me 70 + degrees is perfect patio weather. The inside does seem a little bit packed for my taste, regardless of what time they're open. On the weekends, you'd be hard pressed to find a time when it's not poppin here. But that's okay, I assure you it's worth the wait.  The menu is expansive. I'm talking, there is something for everyone. Hashes, Omelettes, Scrambles, Sweets, Benedict, even some rogue brunch items which are surprisingly good in their own right. But by and large, breakfast here is the way to go. Anything with their namesake, eggs, is an automatic winner. Portions are on the larger side, but not obscenely so. You're going to walk away full, but not sickly so, which is the perfect storm breakfast in my eyes. If you're a coffee fan like myself, it flows freely here and is pretty damn good. Overall, I really like this place and would recommend it for locals and tourists alike.  Other benefits include: parking situation is easy to navigate, food itself is reasonably priced.   *Takes all major credit cards, except American Express.

CXDOts-qo8hahWnfUcciWQ.text: Believe the hype! Their food is generous in proportions & they offer "healthier" ways to have your meal prepared (like using cooking spray vs oil or substituting egg wholes for egg whites only).   All the times I've come here, the service here is great and the wait is never too long! When I came, I was worried that we were going to wait for a while because there were many people waiting but we got seated within 20 minutes.   I ordered a ham, cheese, avocado, spinach, & mushroom omelette with potatoes and a banana nut muffin. I love that they have Cholula as an option for hot sauce haha!   Tamara, my server, was great! I definitely recommend eating here for breakfast!   PS. When seated outside, if it is a hot day, they have the mist going outside so sitting outside did not feel uncomfortable or annoying at all.   Don't forget to check-in to get your free banana nut muffin!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham, Cheese, Avocado, Spinach, Mushroom Omelette

_yv-LHmDFUnZehhZrghSfQ.text: I really like coming here for breakfast once in awhile. The service is always great and the food comes out amazing as always. It gets pretty packed here all the time but it's definitely worth the wait if you are waiting awhile. The variety of different breakfast, brunch & lunch options are all amazing. I love getting the biscuits and gravy as a meal. They offer great health substitutes like turkey options versus your standard pork sausages. The turkey ham is delicious! I love it because it's not too salty. We tried the chicken fried steak & the chili relleno omelette before and it was delicious! They come with a generous amount of their amazing potatoes. If you order coffee, they leave a full pitcher of it for you on the table to refill when you need it. I definitely need to try other things on the menu and explore my taste buds. Happy eating my fellow Yelpers!

uI7lt-3-ShYwZKPKzq8Wmg.text: Damn!!! I really wanted this place to be good. People were lined up to get in door. I ordered the spinach eggs benidect, my favorite breakfast meal. So disappointed. All the food was food service purchased, potatoes were frozen, hollandaise sauce was powdered with water, the spinach was not even cooked. I sent it all back and just drank my coffee and ice tea, which by the way is very good!!!! Still hungry, need to go somewhere else to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bcjeNuUPclVKKHwQQ2F12A.text: best breakfast place ever from service to quality wish i had one on the east coast. can't wait to get back to vegas for this again.

F6HooBJKNsUVYF24m7r_oA.text: Very friendly and attentive wait staff! Got the chile relleno omelette which was ok. Generous portions.  I wasn't crazy about their potato rub/spice.... Too salty.  Definitely get the banana muffin. It doesn't look great, but it's awesome!

km5yLVVh7HzIZnhCXYtISQ.text: I was introduced to this joint during my recent trip to Vegas. A friend who resided in Sin City decided to take me and my girlfriends here after a long night & morning of partying/clubbing/gambling. I told him I want a place with bomb breakfast & local flavor. Egg & I delivered just that!   I had a slight hangover and the hustle & bustle of the busy atmosphere did not aid in it going away. However, I was cured after I had some OJ, Egg Crepe & superr delicious potatoes! I do not know what type of seasoning is doused over those cut up potatoes they servve but it sure did hit the spot! I even joked with our waitress asking if they sell the seasoning (which unfortunately, they don't). The portions are pretty huge so if you don't eat a whole lot like myself, think of sharing with a friend.  I couldn't let my food go to waste so I got a to-go box which definitely came in handy during the road trip back to Long Beach.

JnhkNyj2gtNUunGusd-TYQ.text: What a great little breakfast spot!  I got the crepes... yummy.  Mom got the veggie bene, also yummy.  I liked that the juice was nice and big.  Not a little shot glass like some other places.  The service was really friendly.  We appreciated the little egg face at the table to attract the attention of the very busy servers.    While we were in the Venetian, we picked up one of the tiny tourist magazines.  There was a coupon in it for BOGO entrees.  If you are planning to come here, see if you can snag one.  It makes it an even better deal!

5Z0cfshEs9oSiUkTP9XYAg.text: Found this place on yelp and it was great!! The reviews about the Banana Nut Muffins are True. Amazing. I got a breakfast skillet that was great. My friend got the key largo crepe and it was great too!!  Lily was our waitress and was very attentive and sweet!  Reasonable prices and delicious. We went on a Saturday morn and beat the crowd by getting there around 10.

iwmUoM9o87tL96Wbdm-zsQ.text: Total breakfast fan here and this is one of the few in Las Vegas that truly does breakfast right.  Prices are pretty good and there are always coupons to be had.  Love the Pumpkin banana pancakes and Carrot Cake french toast in the fall!

JBXaPoGomdYjzUmgtJu-Lw.text: We had Chase as our waitress. She was very on point with everything, very friendly & always checked on us to make sure everything was okay. Definitely coming back here again & my nephew loved her!!! Thank you so much Chase!!!! =)

WeHmE-6cTfh72CYY6fTS7w.text: The food and service were very good. Paula was very helpful and cheerful. It was a nice way to end our trip in Vegas

qAQilJBcedNVEy-vRmftGw.text: Really great breakfast. The Mexican omelette and the bacon avocado omelette was the Bom!!! Banana nut muffins were delicious.

9Bl6wZBTMqFR8IivMV_tbQ.text: The food was excellent and service was great. Brady was a fantastic server and started our day off right!

6Epm71F656Ds-4Er6RfT1Q.text: The food here is excellent.  Out of town and found this gem using reviews from yelp.  Our waiter on the second day named raul ended up bringing out a different plate from what I had ordered.  It took a few extra minutes for my original ordered plate to come out, but it was so fresh tasting I really enjoyed it.  He felt bad about the whole situation that he gave us a complimentary fresh baked banana bread.  That extra effort to ensure great customer service made my morning.

KVXGWmRz0TqZU8Y6a0ut0Q.text: Today we had the pleasure of being waited on by Liza... She was amazing. Her personality and customer service was 5 stars. The food here is always great! She made the experience that much better!

0q3ppHWrLFtXnEvOLBljRg.text: HATE Nothing.  DISLIKE The location (not a great view). My waitress barely checked on me. Too much butter on each piece of toast (and I didn't even ask for butter).  LIKE The location (aimed at locals) and diner vibe. The fruit selection with your plate. Decent prices.  LOVE The Crazy Chicken omelet. Diverse breakfast menu items such as spam with sticky rice and cincy chili (chili over spaghetti).

605bwIqQ_Ykrl3wqJnCImg.text: Wow, what a great meal. I had the spinach Benny and shared a short stack of pumpkin pancakes (not on the menu). OMG the pancakes were out of this world. This place is definitely our new stop before we head home!

ntPUvptDMXlsxu5o7JQhZw.text: Fast & friendly service.  Good selection for kid meals that include a drink.  I got fruit instead of potatoes and it was worth it.  Fresh slices of orange, pineapple, watermelon, honeydew and cantaloupe.  Very delicious!

sf9E2kZGtj1art8cgZ_FFg.text: Thank you Yelp!  We were looking for a place to have a good breakfast before heading out on the road back to Phoenix.  We had been in Vegas for four nights and were looking for something other than the options around our hotel.  I found the Egg & I using my awesome Yelp iPhone app.  Everyone agreed to give it a shot and we were all singing praises to both Egg & I and to Yelp at the end of the meal.  The special of the day was the Prime Rib Skillet, Prime Rib over breakfast potatoes, cheese, and eggs any way you want em.  Two people at our table of six went for the special.  Other meals included a Brad's Scramble, two Chicken Fried Steak Skillets, and mine was the Kay's Omelette (Four egg spinach omelette stuffed with a blend of artichoke hearts, swiss cheese, parmesan, garlic and cream cheese. Topped with fresh tomatoes and feta cheese.)  Everyone was raving about their breakfast, except for one.  One friend does not like mushrooms and did not realize they were in her skillet.  She started to pick them out and when the waitress same to check on us, she noticed the pile of mushrooms and offered to have them remake the dish.  Very nice customer service.  My friend didn't want to wait, so she declined, but it was still very nice of the server to notice and offer a new dish.  The standout of the meal was the breakfast potatoes with their special seasoning.  These are the best breakfast potatoes that I have ever had, and I love breakfast potatoes!  The seasoning had a really good flavor and the potatoes were in the perfect bite-sized chunks.  There are plenty of great reviews for this place, so I don't need to go on and on.  Just one more final thought.  When I am coming home from a trip I always like to look back and think about what I learned during the trip.  On this trip, I learned a few things . . .  1 - Don't hold your new cell phone over a pint of Guinness, chances are it may fall in. 2 - Cash out at roulette once you have doubled your original bet.  Even if you just walk right back and put down the original bet again. 3 - Add the Egg & I to the "must-have" list anytime I'm in Vegas!

paw4HAkRLMgDiUnxSv-LWA.text: Dariesia is a great server!! We loved her!! Food is amazing!! My husband and I both had The Classic- sausage and eggs with potatoes and toast. This place is highly recommended and we will be back!!

O9c2Pnnq8U3zBeixSz2H9A.text: Overrated. Corned beef hash had very little hash and too much beef. Usually, the opposite would be the issue. The problem is that the corned beef was EXTREMELY salty. Fried potatoes that come with many entrees are mediocre. Biscuits and Gravy are good. Mashed potato omelette is exactly what it sounds like. Ironically, I was expecting something different or creative. It was okay. Pancakes were really good. Service was great! Establishment is not that bad, but a little ronchy due to all the green...just weird.

EMk11_4a0O0p5X28PuLWWg.text: The best thing in this place was Raul our waiter. Nice, adaptive and always checking.

SN4FRjctwWn-LgPFE0f_cw.text: Tired of all the Vegas buffets, I decided to use my Smartphone and search for a breakfast place outside the strip.  I was directed to "Egg & I".  Loved the name and read some reviews which were positive.  This was my birthday breakfast so I had high expectations.  I am pleased to report that they surpassed them.  Unlimited breakfast options and very attentive staff.  I ordered an omelette and the hubby ordered strawberry waffles with tons of whip and bananas.  YUMMY!!!!!!  A must- go- to place when in Vegas.

0y06vyx-fwymmvtWnwYHTw.text: Whether you go to Egg Works or come to Egg & I you'll probably have to wait a bit if it's a prime breakfast hour.   There are so many great sounding items on the menu deciding what to get can be difficult, but the good news is, you really can't go wrong with anything you choose. The wait staff is always really nice and accomodating. I almost always order the same thing the bacon, cheddar and avocado omlette with egg whites and sour cream.  I was introduced to these breakfast spots my aunt who lived in Vegas for over 20 years and for the most part the customers are all locals so if you're in town and wanna get away from the tourists, check out these breakfast spots.

rXmQobXrvI0RnuPguOpPig.text: This place was a big letdown. I guess b/c I had such a great experience with EGG WORKS their sister place I had put this place on such a high pedestal and they fell off... and no all the kings horses and all the kings men couldnt put this bk together again.   ENTREE: my bf got the franciscan scramble. sounded really good and he's a professional order-er. Its amazing to watch him work. Everything he orders always comes out spectacular and the best tasting dish at the table. not me.  I had a the tostada last time and I had really wanted the cobb salad but was torn. So this time cobb salad was my only request.  disguisting.   COBB: I love cobb salads. This was just plain GROSS. they probably gave me 3-4 lbs of ICEBURG LETTUCE. really? iceburg? gross.  the croutons were the 99 cent croutons with the green specks on it. They gave me 1/4 of an egg... at a a place with the word EGG in it.. i was very disappointed. You'd think theyere 'd be at least a full egg? maybe 2. no. on top of my salad was a lil bit of shredded cheese, and some deli sliced sandwich meat turkey and ham (not even cubes) and the box of sprouts sittong on top of my salad. i ordered blue cheese dressing, they brought me ranch. anything that could go wrong did. 2nd worst meal i've had in las vegas since I've lived here.   Maybe its my fault? my fault for ordering anything that wasnt scrambled so early in the morning. I take some responsibility in that I guess. my bf's omelet was delicious. the potatoes were good.. so was his banana nut muffin.. (while my bran muffin was gross) it was just the perfect yin/yang of good vs. evil... , er mavs vs the heat, the cowboys vs the 49ers, egg works vs egg & I... and yes good food vs. bad food.   The only reason I gave them 2stars was b/c of the bfs food was 4 stars cancelled out by my zero stars.. to equal 2. :)  Here's hoping you gleam something from my review... please do not order a salad at egg & I.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb salad with bran muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Franciscan scramble

afZpd8DMNePfre2P0ib7MQ.text: I had the Sundance Omelette! This is what i always get every time i visit this place. For me, it's so delicious!

YMAEmfKebIVRYCg7lRtBDQ.text: One of the best breakfast places I've ever tried in my life, the menu is different so you won't get your average eggs breakfast (which is good) if you're in Vegas this place is a must when in Vegas.

WzHfZ8P94Fe6FQdrTkLuMA.text: I've been to the Egg & I several times, and each time breakfast has been great.  Went once with my wife and I and sat outside and enjoyed one of their excellent scrambles and a delicious benedict, both of which we really enjoyed.    The second visit was this past weekend with my parents and brother and sister in law.  Food and service were both fantastic.  I had the chicken and chorizo breakfast burrito, while others enjoyed the cordon bleu skillet, a chorizo skillet, a french dip sandwich with cajun fries and an eggs benedict.  Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their food, which was brought very quickly given how packed the place was - talk about an efficient kitchen.  Our cups (water and coffee) never ran dry and the waiter struck the perfect balance between leaving us be to enjoy our meals and making sure we got what we need.  Will definitely be back in the future to this outstanding place.  Love it!

cs_YAWm5qnmglTx6AZlv1Q.text: Oh, that was some great corned beef hash! I am use to eating corned beef out of a can where the meat is more like ground beef compared to this place where the meat is shredded, and oh man that was awesome. So as you can read, I ordered the corned beef hash which does come with 2 eggs made whatever way you'd like, some pretty good, crispy, special seasoned cut potatoes, and a choice of a banana nut muffin or toast of choice. The waitress was nice enough to pass out free muffins for everyone, the muffin sounded good and everyone at other tables had them, but in actuallity it was only ok. I probably should have went for the toast, but looking at my friend's toast, I will say that they put a lot of butter on it, so if you don't want that shit, make sure to tell them, because I don't think they'll tell you. Oh also forgot to mention that the order also comes with two random slices of fruit.  I actually felt a tad overwhelmed, not by the meat, but the potatoes, while great, it was just so much starch to digest, but non the less, it was still satisfactory and the flavorings in each bite were awesome.   Service was awesome but paying at the end seemed to drag because we had to wait in line to pay at the register....but regardless, I would definitely go here for breakfast if I ever wake up in time during my Vegas trips.

7lfDszk-kdTaQNvoQlZGkA.text: Amanda was fantastic!  Cheerful, pleasant, smiling! Could not ask for better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table...

14L7-ZCFq9ZBE6ahwslRbg.text: This is my favorite breakfast place i've been coming here since the day they opened the food is always good and the service is just as good, my waitress today Tamara remembered my order just the way I like it and everybtime  friendly no better breakfast place in town.

uIKBaXJuCMn0XokH0CbUpQ.text: Banana muffin was awesome. We split the corned beef hash, which was very tasty. Food was hot when it hit the table.

Y_IpSZ_rB15yFq8IM3eo4Q.text: Best breakfast diner experience! Karla was very sweet and polite. She helped me order my eggs perfectly to perfection. We had the banana nut muffin...AMAZING! Added some butter, even more yummy! I'm cheating on my Mom's homemade banana nut bread..shhhh don't tell her! What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas! Anyways my husband had the bacon avacado omelet and he added sausage.Very yummy!  I had country fried steak with eggs (medium over medium) pefect when I cut into the egg the yellow runneth gold over. It was amazing. I had the country fried steak it was good and gravy was definitely homemade, yummy. My only compliant is the gravy was a tad bit too salty for my tastebuds, and I love salty. ...other than that it was perfect. It was already buttered to perfection!  Attention to detail. At home I love my toast buttered immediately so it has time to melt. And they did that. This place is a must go!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon Avacado Omelet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut Muffin

cynAKHTLYOEuIA8Zs1lmYw.text: This morning we were looking for a breakfast spot before heading back home when we ended up in Egg and I, the wait wasn't long for my husband and I. Our food came out fast and our server (Manuela I believe was her name) gave us great customer service!! Definitely coming back here next time we are in Vegas!

VBYpPzGFR-PXdDJKIgsOLw.text: The Veggie Skillet! A meal for 3! Everything made to perfection! Meal hot, cooked to your liking, eggs over easy!  Expect a wait, but we walked up the street to Starbucks, walked back & were called to sit down. Lots of parking!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Was a yummy as it looks!

NFfjBe75dg1em3vHnJXi7w.text: This was a very quaint breakfast place with excellent service. They have this cute little idea where if you need to contact the waitress, you flip a card shaped like an egg on the table to a sad face to request service. I got biscuits and gravy with potatoes, eggs and bacon. The potatoes and bacon were very good, but the biscuits were a bit too salty for my taste. The coffee is also pretty good quality. My parents got similar food; the only problem was that the food is a bit more pricey than our standards, but compared to some restaurants on the strip the price was not bad. Overall, I would come back again when I come back to Vegas for vacation.

YtTjMjObmBOX7ivlY-dv4w.text: Saw this place on top places to eat BF in Las Vegas . Called and asked if there was wait time they said no when actually it was 25 minutes but totally worth it ! Service was GREAT Paula did an amazing job order was messed up they fixed it faster than anyone ever has ! Food was superb! Fresh squeezed OJ! Also I have  active 1 year old and Paula handled it well thanks Paula

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Benedict yummy!

5j-puoZ5SoYkSLyZ85rwhA.text: I woke up with a massive hangover and needed breakfast food STAT! Buffet wasn't going to cut it... I needed comfort food. We came here on a whim and now it's on my list of must go to spots in Vegas. It's your typical breakfast joint... no more than a 20 min wait even when the  masses are outside the front entrance. There's a plethora of breakfast dishes... american style, mexican style and even islander style! Oh yes... LOCO MOCO. I know Aloha Kitchen is just right there... but when hubs wants Hawaiian and I want Mexican... well then, you gotta find some way to compromise. Egg & I did not fall short with their Loco Moco... it definitely hit the spot... and so did that side of spam!

FXxDSBv3bpm9ozDcMz6EvQ.text: Great breakfast and a good sized portion. Quick and friendly service. Food was great. The banana nut muffin is a must. It's also free when you check in through yelp!!

BtVxrz2d7H8LHbLj1rfwsQ.text: Me and my Woman were by the neighborhood wanted to try it , best breakfast ever omelettes here are amazing! The server she was really amazing her name was Donna, she's just amazing best experience ever

fH4obvqEMMzZKccVOCoqCA.text: Oscar was amazing, food was amazing, nothing but good things to say about this place...will come back Everytime we visit and share with everyone we can!!!

FhTaqa3o9LHe_ZF3aO_a9g.text: Best potatoes EVER. I wasn't a fan of the wait to be seated, which took a half hour. But it was still the morning, so I assume it was just the normal breakfast rush. No real biggie. The food was great. My only real complaint was that I was supposed to get a muffin, which never came. Sad face. But everything else was awesome. Thanks!!

EqRx6_jp9zRv7DpMDfjwwQ.text: Awesome breakfast spot. Everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked really good. I had the country fried steak breakfast with eggs and banana nut muffin. The CFS is excellent and rivals some of the places I go to.  Our waitress, Reina, is very friendly and took care of us. She even apologized to my friend about the football game loss last night. This shows she likes to interact with the customers. She also was attentive and came by to ask how things were or if we needed anything. The service in general is excellent as we always had a rotating staff to help with clearing the table.   I'll definitely be coming back to try other dishes.

xCg2ARZKjXtDs9MVQnnsyA.text: The Banana Nut Muffin deserves 5 stars on its own.  Its soft, it melts in your mouth and it goes so well with my morning coffee.  Besides the muffin, egg & I is a wonderful breakfast spot because their extensive menu has something for everyone including someone like me who frowns at eggs.  I had their breakfast sundae which is basically some yogurt with granola and fruit and it was just fine.  The wait can be long but it goes fast and the staff is trained to get you in and out of their place in record time.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sunday

RyVktO2slgqb7l7aXSZXjA.text: I eat here on a regular basis! Everything thing I've ever had here is so yummy!! The staff are very professional and polite. I love all the different tasty hot sauces are a great accompaniment to scrambled eggs or any one of the many omelettes! I always get a mimosa to go with and they are so yummy! I love the fact that they bring your orange juice separate from your personal sized bottle of champagne leaving you to pour  your own trouble!!!

lywhX_AcTP3Iwon6h0WM-Q.text: Amazing food and service. Probably the best I've tried. A True all timer.  Earl, hope you get to meet Mickey Mouse soon. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchilada with Diablo fries

JpZBW9Naaphqk4lu3cmC8g.text: Our server Patrick was exceptional and the food delicious.  I had the chili rellano omelette and it was a flavor explosion!  The Diablo potatoes that come with it are amazing.  Couldn't stop eating them!Yummy! You get a free banana nut muffin for checking in on Yelp.  It was warm and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili rellano omelette w/ Diablo potatoes

qz0GYZzRjxCmuFD9k6Nsjg.text: The best place for breakfast god it's so good and the muffins are served piping hot with butter huge portions.

nUixDI8szjRNi3f9bIxtyg.text: Great place with amazing breakfast! Unique food and great selection. Their hot sauce tastes so different and good.

5ZkIZjGEsWFzWkoSsQGz7w.text: You have to stop by here while your in Vegas it's definitely a must. The food is fire and please check in to try that amazing moist and fluffy banana muffin.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s about to go down chicken enchilada omelet and stuffed Fred chicken toast and a nice short stack
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smashed that made my husband check in so I could get another one

d7yvj_Y9AGqo7QJ6ho5OYQ.text: The service was good and friendly and the eggs were fine, but they did not have espresso which means no breakfast latte and the pork burrito i had was excessively salty and dry.

fjD5sJd8AJrou3ZtBIGfJA.text: I called to reserve for a party of 6 and was accomodated easily on a holiday and rush hour (11am). No leftovers after eating because its that good. A must try is the country fried steak and the stuffed french toast(like monte cristo). Dont forget to check in at yelp it to get the banana nut muffin. Will definitely come back.

BHq2qtoKEmi6jfeuEcBflg.text: This place is so amazingly good. Their food, service    And everything. Our server, Tamara is so friendly and attentive; makes us feel right at home. We have been coming to egg and I  ever since we found out about it a couple years ago. We are from Los Angeles and as far as I'm aware of, there is nothing like this place in LA. So whenever we travel to Vegas, we have to come here for brunch. In fact, we have visited the restaurant 2 days straight this time. Love love the veggie skillet with their exceptionally delicious seasoned potatoes! Expecting the next visit already!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sensational food!

kyjnMqk7bv-5ttaPSu9pQw.text: We went there with a group of four. The service was amazing as we had Mabel for a waitress. Also, they have an egg system that you can turnover if you need anything and its all hands on board as all servers help out. We each ordered something different then passed it around, All were good some better than others. Their menu is quite extensive. you can oder anything you like. The Bloody Mary's were excellent as well. We would go back as the price is fair as well

5uV7u8JSoli7VdOvc4Xk-A.text: Yummers!!!  I loved this restaurant.  We only had to wait 15 minutes on a Sunday morning and were kindly seated.  The restaurant is a good size and was cutely decorated.  It's a really good family and brunch place.    I ordered an omelette and enjoyed it a lot.  The portions are generous here.  The best part of this place is the service.  Our server (older Hispanic lady) was very funny and recommended different things for us.  I was being picky and she let me.  Thanks, ma'am!  The roasted potatoes here are really good.  I like hashed browns a lot and never really like home potatoes, but for once the potatoes trumped the hashed browns.  They were crispy and lightly seasoned.  I tried the chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes and the tasted absolutely AMAZING!  I couldn't stop eating them even though I was full.  I also had a bite of someone's French toast sandwich, and oh my gosh, did that taste like heaven in my mouth!!!!!  If you're ok with a heart attack on a plate, this is it.  It was a huge portion of eggs, bacon, ham, and sausage goodness.  This was probably the tastiest thing on the menu, and I had only a bite.  Definitely something you can share if you're not too hungry.  Great service and good value for the dollar!  Egg & I, I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed french toast with the work potatoes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The work omelette with fruit
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy eggs

c0kTT7bLLBVf8n1ytZAPjQ.text: Well let's start with the service. Tamara was our server and we would like to give her 10 stars. The biscuits and eggs were also a 10. They have so many people working everything is do smooth. Packed house but a short wait. Best breakfast place in Vegas. We will be back!

ggsEyTgRhgsyDTWACPGmxg.text: My food was really good although they messed up on my friends food and got their orders mixed up the manager took great care of us and made sure to have it remade and even gave us a discount . I definitely suggest you get the sunrise mountain it was bomb !!!

kjPlgVHG6IJp6jDfJvJXEQ.text: Omg!! Their Fresh Banana muffin was to die for!! I had to order a glass of milk to go with it. YUM!

V5BSqKpDjM-9EcAM-pKktQ.text: You must come an ask for Emily best in the West love my good got n ready to eat perfick I got the chili relleno Solvang

jTitZSwZgHRY3JvN0TkiEA.text: Great food, friendly serving staff.  Huge portions (if you are eating out with another person consider sharing) and a bit pricey but tasty none the less.

Lmdf9TDloCsT9iq79MoC0Q.text: Another great breakfast from the Egg & I. Karla took great care of us and her southern hospitality shined. We live in Southern California and crave the Egg & I so much we make trips to Vegas just for the breakfast. My wife and I shared the biscuits and gravy and meat skillet. The gravy was the best gravy we have ever had and the biscuit was perfect. However the best part of the meal was the banana muffin. This muffin will keep you coming back. And when you check in on Yelp, you get a free muffin. This place is a must when in Vegas!

XKZF-oaIuIzvYWTVYDi4hw.text: The family and I tried this place for the first time and it was all worth coming here for the first time. The service  (hostess) was friendly. The waitress (Tammy) was super friendly and professional, our food arrived in a timely manner and was correct. The food servings were phenomenal and delicious. Tammy was very attentive and provided great service from the beginning to the end. We highly recommend the restaurant and the waitress.

N4SJfehcD1vmqcqz5uK2Xg.text: My hubby and I are huge breakfast people! Has the eggs benny and juevos ranchero with carnitas at the suggestion of our server Manuela. She gave us fantastic service and was amazing! Would definitely come back next time we're in town.

0eSdybYsWYrw2sMWsgBGQg.text: Food was excellent and large portion. Tabitha was excellent. Attentive, genuinely friendly. Highly recommend.

bMEy9eH6kGBh-RMHjvwEVA.text: My boyfriend was right, this place was egg-cellent! I really enjoyed my breakfast at the Egg & I. Perhaps because all over the restaurant, there were little cute drawings of eggs being all happy and that the menu was made of newspaper material with happy eggs all over it  :D.  I ordered two pancakes, scrambled eggs and bacon. The pancakes were really nice and fluffy, the eggs were light and fluffy too and the bacon...I gave to my boyfriend haha!  Good price, good food, fast service and friendly staff.

Tzb49y_4si-g6T-_pDjrXA.text: Great place for breakfast - served any time!  The omelets are just the right size.  Get the fresh fruit on the side; very good.

kwduoeFSDkkN-iwqGQM6eg.text: 5 stars does not even come close to how amazing this food is!  I highly recommend ordering their pork carnitas rancheros with a side of work potatoes!  It is consistently busy,  but service is very fast and efficient!  Also, for your sweet tooth cravings try one of their homemade banana nut muffin!  It's just heavenly!

yU6MJ2NOn5HEo_CA3SyN8Q.text: Wonderful place to get breakfast!  Bree, our server, was attentive and friendly.  She had great suggestions on the menu and was always refilling drinks and making sure we were satisfied.  The stuffed French toast and works skillet were awesome!!

cP9cmkP73-ZFA5TsqRDBIQ.text: This was our first time in the Vegas area and we found this place on Yelp. The portions are generous, the food is delicious, the prices are low, and the people are awesome ! Manuela was our server and she was so sweet! Would definitely recommend this spot to anyone in the area.

IjZ-EL7FqWl1HYtmRYalIw.text: Who knew that making over easy eggs was an artform?  This place has mastered the art of making eggs.  I was visiting Vegas with family and actually craving pancakes, but I couldn't eat at a place called "The Egg & I" and not have eggs.  So I ordered a simple breakfast the Eggs Plus (over easy eggs, grits, toast, and bacon).  I had never seen such a perfectly cooked over easy egg, and it definitely tasted that way.  The white of the egg was so airy!  My mom was willing to share a bite of her eggs benedit, and they were soooo good!  I felt I had to commemorate the visit, so I bought my mom an "Egg & I" coffee mug.  :)  Oh, and the staff was very friendly.

vRxjj7qXoigjxU3IiUxo4Q.text: My server Alyssa was amazing. Very kind, always had a smile on her face and made sure everything was good with us. Also her manager Marc was amazing and making sure we enjoyed our service. I will definitely be returning and telling my friends about the wonderful service and food.

DyIUmDeGbMvKyS9waqNEdg.text: Fast service and good food. Their country  potatoes are a little too salty but are tasty with some ketchup. I had the California crepe and it was so good. My son had the chicken strips and fries. He said the fries were too salty to eat so he didn't eat them. I'm giving them a 4 due to the salty items.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California crepe with potatoes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids mouse pancake.

SN-Ssl_9r8LpskL3cT912g.text: Large portions, chocolate chip pancakes were huge & delicious. Chicken fried steak skillet was great & filling. Stuffed French toast & potatoes was good.  Staff was very friendly & quick service.

CUnOk8916_ExEYchJZ1F7w.text: GREAT breakfast in Vegas.... eggs, muffins, skillets... you cant go wrong!  Worth leaving the strip for this gem.  Be sure to try their verde sauce.

iPP7V3TTTK-gFGY5a_sLdg.text: Took my sister and nephews for the first time they loved it. Great service great food our server Alyssa was excellent. We will be coming back every time I visit Vegas.

eCjl8HAgfFXe8pVpaiKpGw.text: When I was skipped over in line for a table someone immediately took care of the over sight. The food and service was excellent. Definitely will be back next time in Nevada

VXNH9wNwwkuhfpw2S1jTdg.text: Very nice settings and workers there. The food was awesome my wife had  a Beeny that was very delicious the eggs were poached perfectly. I had a skillet that was absolutely fantastic. The coffee was spot on not to strong or weak. Definitely going to go back it not prices high either, which i throughly thought was going to be more expensive. Very happy to spend my morning eating there. GREAT JOB!!!

f3wXhPllavFCEmdaU12daQ.text: Best breakfast ever!!!!!! Banana but muffin!! Eggs Benedict!!! Blueberry cashew pancakes!!!! Everything's awesome here!!!!

6YUp3V1DgJPleGz4oCN6FQ.text: Our server Alexa definitely deserves a trip to Disneyland! The food was amazing as always! It usually is a bit of a wait but that's because everything is so good!

holTWM2aW3_eRNNwGdfYAA.text: My husband got the Lag Egg Crepe, and I got the chicken fried steak.   My chicken fried steak was too salty and the country gravy itself was too salty too. I felt that I got overdosed with the salt after I've finished only one third of the chicken fried steak. I had my egg scrambled, and the egg didn't taste good, seems like they put white pepper in it and I don't like white pepper. So I was done with the egg with only one bite.  My husband said the egg crepe was interesting enough that he liked it, while it was also too heavy for him as it's made with 4 eggs.  The meal was okay, could be better though. We can get better chicken fried steak (with the right saltiness) at the other diner in town, so probably won't order chicken fried steak ever again at Egg & I.   I think the best item of the meal was the banana nut muffin, which was only a side that came with the entree.  Our server was very nice though.  We don't know if we would come back again........just because we are not attracted to other menu items so much while we know we are not gonna order chicken fried steak here again.

EKg1MbUh-iOHBqAWHt372w.text: This place use to be one of the best places for breakfast, but while in Vegas decided to take my husband and he wasn't really impressed by the food and neither was i. In the past the food was hot and good, instead we got warm potatoes that had way to much seasoning salt on them cold sausage and banana nut muffin that tasted like cardboard. So my question is what has happen to this place.......SMH

YS-JmHMIiBXS8JzpmC_-WA.text: Honestly the place was busy, clean, and expedient. Our server Alexa checked in frequently but not so much that I would be irritated. She always showed up with a smile and I love that in a waitress... the only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is I wasn't the biggest fan of the food seemed a lil over seasoned.

Da7syXsXKTOxooZW5eB3fw.text: The banana nut muffin looks like a mushroom.  The muffin top is so big it just falls right over!  But that being said it's moist and warm and delicious.    I was brought here because I wanted breakfast food at 12PM and the omelettes were mouthwatering and the those homefries were something else!  I've never had homefries that were so crispy before....they probably deep fry them.  But deep fried anything is great usually.    Service is great too.  They have a system similar to what you would find at Bubba Gump's where you flip the egg to get the wait staff's attention.

najpG1if4mV2UzWvOQ8GRg.text: Wife is pretty picky about her breakfast so I was a little worried if she would like this new place. She loved it! She had a spinach omelette which was huge and country potatoes. Made with 4 eggs. I had a hamburger and fries. It was good too! We'll be back.

gAiPQXl_zryrisIw1Ua-9w.text: best breakfast spot must we always get the spinach benny and prime rib benny its so delicious plus the banna nut muffin is to die for

MmpuIe3YTPQpPSAsmz_EZg.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat breakfast in LV. The food here is very simple but the taste is amazing. The one thing you must, must have is the banana nut muffin. It's the best! It's warm and amazing with coffee.   I usually like to eat the Hawaiian food here. My favorite is the island favorite. It's just eggs, portuguese sausage (linguica), and sticky rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast with Apple compote.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moco loco and the Island Favorite. One of my favorite dishes here.

ktZJijjzCJXYsrYBfMIP4A.text: Had it on a past sunday on the way out of vegas. Waited about 30 minutes for a group of 4 around 11:30 am. Definitely worth the wait.   Got hooked up on banana nut muffins with the check in. Deliciously moist and flavorful.   So when deciding to order my buddy and i couldnt decide between the chile relleno omlete and the a south west type of omlete.. so we decided to order both and split it. Ya i know l, totally adorable.  Must say the chile relleno is soooooo good. Definitely filling and hit all the right marks. Not many places can make a good chile relleno entre, alertos is the only place in oc, imo, but eggs and i got it right.  The south west type was also a good omlete. Definitely tasted the different components but it was not as awe strucking as the chile relleno omlete.  Other things ordered at the table was a "1/2" order of maple bacon french toast had a special type of syrup as well. This plate was a good addition to the overall meal.   The gf ordered a carrot cake french toast. She said it was ok in comparison to the chile relleno omlete *cough cough*. But i need to be hoenst besides loving chile rellenos.. i love carrot cake! It was moist, similar texture as the banan nut muffin and with bits of carrots enough for texture. Definitely a fan.   Besides great service with the food, out waitress was just as diligent with our questions in regards to this establishment's history.  Will be back next vegas trip and ill recommend it to everyone i talk to.

M0X_F9MgTdQerlZfdN8Mjw.text: Not my first time to this Las Vegas staple.  Service was amazing, and Tabatha was great!  She was super attentive and was wonderful at helping us navigate their large menu.  The food was excellent, I had their traditional Benedict. Poached eggs we're done wonderfully and the sauce is great.  The portions are huge and their French toast is no exception. I think it's probably a service size for at least two people.  Bottom line, check this place out. It's off the strip and two peoples breakfast with a pitcher of orange juice was under $30. How can you lose?! One of the best bets to make in Vegas by far!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original eggs Benedict
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast

xmJtCMnFdq7qmvgcaVkBHA.text: Loved this place!! The food was great and portions were huge. Our server was Curtis and he did a great job making sure we had everything we needed. Very attentive but not oppressive. 10/10 recommend

X8NySTFDXyOx-Q9xjZYOcw.text: We're big egg works fans so when i found this gem which is closer to us I was so happy! Great service and the food is exactly the same. Great service I will be back for sure! If you're looking for a fancy bfast spot this isn't your place. But if you're looking for good food you won't be disappointed.

ODLAVetIEQPyvLW7KOKjbg.text: I'm from San Diego and I was visiting and we decided to look through yelp to help us decide what we wanted to eat. We ended up here and I'm excited have never received such amazing customer service from someone like I did today from Oscar. The attention and time he spent helping me decide what to eat and giving me all the options and taking time to listen to what I want was beyond amazing! Very satisfied with my food & service I received here. It was busy and the food and service was still amazing. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order of my own made up omelette with egg, ham, bacon, avocado, onion, and bell peppers, it was soooo good!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order of Banana Bread French Toast

r4PbRltVxJMgriIMjgJBZQ.text: Love the skillets and the Loco Moco.  The muffins are freakin' amazing!!  The breakfast potatoes are good too.  Long wait on a Saturday morning, about an hour.  This place is worth it to drive off the strip for brunch.  Friendly service.  Overall, i definitely recommend this place.

jX3FSrtXGfS7EC-qpW0cDQ.text: Had sundance omelette for $11.25 and includes alot of potatoes. It was delicious but pricey though. Potatoes were seasoned nicely not too salty and same for the omelette. Would be better if they have organic as well.

xI9PYn8EGQl1uoqK2jOyRQ.text: Delicious! I had the stuffed French toast which was amazing! Once you're able to pick it up and eat it as a sandwich... wow! Maple syrup to top it off to perfection.  I will def return on my next trip to Vegas, it is well worth the detour off the strip.

falIm_YGEHRlit6rxxH_hQ.text: Food was so good and the service was amazing! It does get a little over crowded but the waits aren't more than 10-15 min Definitely recommend this place

SJhd9UI97M5BPDQlVWqsng.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast places in town! Even though they are always crowded they get you in and out fast with a smileI never feel rushed and I can always get what I want. They care about how your day is going and I always leave feeling better about how my day is going to go. I have had breakfast and lunch and both were awesome! The Carlsbad club is to die for along with their muffins!

e41lNsEI5rV5_c-FAgjJZw.text: Service was fast, it looked like the wait was going to be long but it wasn't. The food was also fast we ordered and within 15 mins our meal was on our table. Large portions and fast service also break breakfast easy.

QVS3muJXyolGL6YQqwkdYA.text: Great portions and a perfect eggs & bacon. Their crepe was just a big omelette, thick and chewy. However the muffin tops are to die for. The crepe brought the rating down but overall they are better than average.

Tk3_t5VY4460ceFUX6hgLw.text: No wonder why this place is #1 on Yelp. Service was awesome; Carole Ann the server provided an excellent service. Checked - in on Yelp and got a free banana muffin and it was delicious. I would recommend people to order their banana muffin. Ordered prime rib benedict and it was delicious; meat was tender, good combination of veggies in the mix with the sauce and crossant. Oh, and the potatoes that came with it was nicely season and tasted fresh unlike some breakfast places, potatoes are soggy and no flavor. I would definitely go back whenever I'm in vegas. I left a happy customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib egg benedict

xMiIv_SdKTjFByCC9FJDMQ.text: Great service, and the banana nut muffins were amazing.  I would've preferred fewer options and smaller serving sizes, but other than that not a bad brunch stop. It was busy on a Saturday morning!

A7D7LpGGD1ij5WSI8gHhjQ.text: The standard to which all "breakfast joints" should be held to. A Las Vegas off strip classic. A locals spot before we had the term "locals spot". I've been here many times growing up in Las Vegas, and about the only thing in Las Vegas that has stayed the same is: Egg & I.   It's just so consistent. You know what you're going to get and you know it's going to be good. Change is good, but in this case changing the already good thing they have going on would be a terrible idea.   The ONLY downside is the sometimes insane wait times for a table. But hey, we can't punish a restaurant too much for its own success can we?   I've had the eggs Benedict and the eggs here so much growing up I subconsciously judge every egg I have anywhere in the world based on the Egg & I's standard.   Give it a go! Especially if you're from out of town: Experience a local Vegas staple.

GjqcZOstYIXNvXmJbodfmg.text: I was recently in Las Vegas with a friend who prefers to eat off the strip. We were looking around on yelp for somewhere to grab a bite to eat before we went out for the day & she remembered she had eaten at Egg & I on a previous trip. From the outside, this place wasn't incredibly impressive but it was clean and well located. We only waited about 10 minutes, and when we were seated I was excited to see the menu was quite diverse. I went for a traditional bacon & cheese omelet with toast & potatoes and I was quite pleased. I am a total breakfast enthusiast and I believe anyone can cook breakfast, but not anyone can do it well. I will keep this place in mind for future Vegas trips.

vV8XblpkbfldBwm0yVHoPQ.text: Reina was our server and we had a great experience being that it was my first time at Egg & I.  We came on a Saturday and yes it was crowded but we got seated in about 20 minutes. The potatoes and orange juice was a highlight for me. I definitely would come back here again when I come to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wKqmv8YdHSgsql-YZgQzZA.text: Came here w pops for some breakfast!!! I have to say hands down everything was GREAT!! Service, food and the look!!! Their portions are huge and the taste OMG... im n a food coma that's outstanding.  Thank you so much!!!  PS: ILL BE BACK

xu8k4DJMlZJ100FsrTutXQ.text: Their muffins are amazing!! Egg based meals were pretty good, but I would say they really excel with baked goods. When I went they gave you a free muffin for a check in so make sure to do that. It is not in downtown vegas but takes ten to fifteen minutes from the strip. There's a bit of line on weekends but worth the wait.Dog friendly

z2J2tKPjTZoPzyflcjfJwg.text: Great breakfast place. My husband and I spilt the Chicken Fried Steak, Excellent. The service was excellent as well.

KBlbZI_7BupYd0-bJpgZ0Q.text: Solid breakfast foods, what else can I say. Nice enviornment, attentive servers. Get here early on the weekends, this place gets busy....

KAaBoM4B7vS-e6KBN-90_Q.text: Ohh my gosh, this place is amazing . I always get the large fruit platter and it was by far the BEST fruit I've had from a breakfast spot . Literally EVERYTHING here is delicious. You could throw a dart on the menu and be satisfied no matter what it is .   Sometimes there is a wait, but well worth the wait . If you're visiting Vegas or living there , you HAVE to come here at least once..or a few several times .

Dtj5GdRbo7Jkwu3puOXXpA.text: Oh my goodness, yelpers you did it again! This place is amazing! My boyfriend and  I chowed down on Banana Pancakes, Country fried steak and eggs, and "the works" omelette. The gravy on the country fried steak was sooo good it makes you wanna slap your grandma...The banana pancakes were sweet, fluffy and delish, the omelette was pure deliciousness , ham, bacon, sausage, bell peppers, onions and tomato with lots of cheese in between and on the outside of the omelette, the sour cream added more bang to the already incredible omelette. Didnt try their famous stuffed french toast, but I am sure that whatever you order here will be so delicious. The potatoes on the side are meh, nothing to write home and tell your mother about...the coffee wasn't strong either, it was more on the watery side. The service was attentive, however, mid way through our meal the server left the check on the table. This is something my boyfriend and i always hate. Like bih!! You see all this food in front of me, fork in my mouth, does it look like im ready for the check!???!!!I get it you are packed up the a$$ but damn lemme get through at least 3/4 of my meal, before you come and make me feel rushed to leave!  Give this place a try, get off the strip and be a little adventurous. Don't be afraid of the crowds outside, we were seated within 25-30 mins of checking in. Make sure you check-in to get that delicious banana nut muffin pure deliciousness!

CcIALF40N_48bH5Rr6wz8A.text: Service was awesome Tabitha did a awesome job, the food was great, good value for price, highly recommend. I used the yelp coupon got a free muffin was very good had the pork chops and eggs was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gKQrx0Xv-YJ0JGGUU84oBw.text: Was looking for best places to eat breakfast in Vegas.   Found this place.   Took the family.   Was very very good.

ESSZ-u7Pya5javDX7BgWeA.text: Can't go wrong here. Always come here from LA when we visit. So many options. Just come in and ask Lacy she is awesome!!

2a_2DC5sImX1Z8boc11LBw.text: This is a lovely little home town feel of a restaurant-On Sahara. The waitresses really do a good job recommending things and refilling the coffee. yay! The banana nut muffin side option is yummy. The portions are big and satisfying. It is nice to go off the strip. Give it a try.

AcXf9GzS5_KduTj9BggrAg.text: Worth the wait! Waited about 20-25 minutes to get a table for 4 and our server Cici was great. Very interactive with my 6 year old and great service. Food was warm, and had a great taste to it. Def recommend this breakfast brunch spot.

lCxoHAdAOuqNzUntLkYVIA.text: You can't go wrong with Egg and I on Sahara, it's good hearty food that will stick to your ribs.   My favorite is the chicken fried steak with the potatoes. Is it chocked full of calories? You betcha! Do the potatoes tip the sodium scale into the red zone? No doubt!  This is the weekend family restaurant we all grew up with, even if you didn't grow up in Vegas, it just fits into that category.   Service is always great and so is the iced tea, WiFi is ok as well.   Good place for meetings too, as long as it's not on a busy weekend.

awn9_jC-o6LhlTbLAEfmOw.text: I'm a frequent visitor to Las Vegas driving out from Southern California and I must say after coming here today I will probably come back EVERY single time I return to LV. BREAKFAST WAS PHENOMENAL! The skillets and omelettes are covered in cheese and toppings!  Very generous with portions. Also French toast is so good. Bomb bloody Mary's and I'm sure there's a lot more amazing things on that menu.  Great service as well, can't wait to come back!

XmGMxpUTcbikHVTl1z1qeA.text: Good place to eat, eggs are their specialty

BA4WeWFEBInrgutznZXcDw.text: My favorite place for brunch or breakfast! They have amazing pancakes, veggie options, and they have mimosas!! lol definitely recommend this to anyone!

IMn5s8oQry_9MBIEI5isQw.text: We were seated quickly for a table of 6 on a Sunday morning during the breakfast rush. I ordered the taco skillet that was delicious, but not something I would order all the time. A little too greasy for me (the reason why I wouldn't give it 5 stars).The corned beef hash was delicious. The potatoes in the skillet and corned beef hash were seasoned perfectly. They don't take American Express just FYI.

57JGVFRZ8z6F-8uMqkET0A.text: Our breakfast was great! A egg lovers dream and a great breakfast menu. The breakfast tostada, waffle with fruit toppings and chili cheese omelette was amazing

YUn9AsArnwOHlHtrXeBsCA.text: After an extensive search for a bomb breakfast I stumbled upon this gem.  When I tell you the food was delicious... *moment of silence* It was damn good.  I ordered the Corned Beef Hash. Along with the muffin & a side of avocado.  My BFF made their own omelette which came out looking amazing.  We chose to take our remaining food to go because we already KNEW this food would bring us back to life after the pool party.  The service was also really great. Tamara was attentive, sweet & seems genuine which I find rare out here.   Bomb.  If you're considering coming...just do it.  It'll give you life.

SRUOKSmDnn8aCS4WESwEXw.text: I went and I was seated quickly but from the very beginning I do not like the atmosphere is not really a place you go to get comfortable it is more like a place you just go to eat chairs are not comfortable And the tables are small pact in My servers shirt was covered in hair from some kind of maybe white cat on her black shirt One of my pet peeve's my food looks great and so did my companies although the corn beef hash was not my tasting but the thing that really got me at the endWas my breakfast company found a hair on their plate became very upset and disgusted still paid but was not happy

FBFIQonhnhCWFk96ae5s8w.text: great breakfast! portions are a bit more than the average breakfast spot. the hashbrowns are the highlight in their food selection! perfectly cooked and seasoned just right! above everything else the service was superb. very homey feeling as soon as you walk in the door. not sure if it's family owned but sure feels that way. waitress was very attentive and made sure to check on us but also did not over do it and bug us. overall great spot. will definitely return on our next trip to vegas!

leHmt3X8wl1K8OKoV8T7pg.text: An amazing gem. We discovered this during our trip to Vegas. My BF is a picky eater and he enjoyed the skillet with season fries, banana muffin, and even straight down to their coffee. It is truly a service with a smile as we had a wonderful server, Karla. It's so good BF wanted to go back again before we left and he usually doesn't request unless it's good. Fo those of you who like bloody marys, it's a must. Even I liked the taste not being a big fan of it. The best part of our vegas dining experience.

arFNVgDdKFWy8XcxSPnNYg.text: Good customer service and great food. The chili relleno omelette was amazing. Inexpensive and a great way to start your day.

FP6hO5UiKCAzxLMp18I2pw.text: Bree was so attentive and we loved our Breakfast; delicious seasonal fruit bowl and endless carafe of awesome coffee!

CM5N747cCpHrT9O-laO-KA.text: Good food. Great service. Our server Chance was the best. The banana bread is a must. Also the chicken fried steak

w5K1ciaxI5qBRnDi1UfQCg.text: The Strawberry Stuffed French Toast is amazing! We got seated right away even during the lunch rush. And the service from Alexa was great.

8c5JTKGBkKiaLatYRDeyvw.text: This restaurant never disappoints .. second time coming here.. our server Tamara was very attentive and the food was delicious .. I had the original breakfast burrito with the diablo potatoes and the chicken enchilada soup, everything was tasty...their banana nut muffins are a must try .. we always come here when we come down to vegas

oewcSkILxhQnIBjZHvATeg.text: I was glad that I only ordered a half serving of Ultimate Skillet - because the serving was GENEROUS!!!!! Ultimate Skillet was definitely a classic and very satisfying - A flavorful combination of sausage, ham, bacon, mushroom, onions, tomatoes, spinach and bell pepper, topped with a perfectly poached egg. Ohhh.... and that's not the end of it! All order came with a banana nut muffin that was moist and soft.......  Yummmmmmmmmm...... definitely worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (half serving of) Ultimate Skillet!

HABI-G-j8UgxxxY58ft-ag.text: This was my first time here and I have to say th he food is awesome. The service was great Tamara made us feel right at home. She answered all of our questions and had the patience of Job when it came to my young ones ordering.

yUSLN4h2ijcs4BD-6yJcnQ.text: I absolutely LOVED this place and would recommend it to anyone staying in Vegas! We had a group of 6 and the wait was fairly short. The food was amazing and our server Tamara was great! Our drinks stayed full and she made some great recommendations! We will definitely making this place a part of our Vegas tradition!

Jp_psVNDNJOfKO-4En5XVA.text: Food: Visited The Egg and I yesterday and had the Sundance Special, which is their veggie omelette. Spinach, mushroom and artichoke make this omelette absolutely delicious, even for the carnivores out there.  Decor: The restaurant itself is located near a strip mall. The interior seems kind of dated, but it's a trivial concern as the food more than makes up for that.  Service: Alyssa was our server, and she was very professional and attentive. Our food came out in a timely manner, and right the first time. My water cup was never empty and my girlfriend's coffee was never low. Great service.

QxXFobsAmHXH1ZBXrcjiww.text: The service wasn't bad and the food came out super fast. However, I didn't like how the food was cooked. The banana muffin came out steaming hot as if they put it in a microwave. When I tried to eat it, it was so tough that a knife couldn't even cut through it. I asked for another one and asked that it not be heated in a microwave. They claimed it wasn't. I don't understand how it was steaming hot and so tough and hard around the edges. Then, when I got their potato scramble, the cheese all over the top was hard and not the soft, melted type of cheese. So if you ate your potatoes, you could pick up a whole layer of cheese. Again, it was overcooked. It's too bad because the flavors were there in both the potatoes and the muffin. The biscuits and gravy were good.

UN-EmPG1rS9OP-O5RC5SIQ.text: This place always amazed me! Amazing food and amazing service. Liliana once again delivered an exceptional experience.  I recommend you to try the breakfast tostada, it is delicious!!! Viva the THE EGG & I..

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge Breakfast tostada!

FcwW8BaXZdRWWUjkUJNNUw.text: The breakfast was great.  Even though it was a sunday and extremely busy we had very little wait time.  Our waitress was fast and stopped by the table often enough we didn't have to try to chase her down.

s6yLFzst2QwV--NzSFpDVQ.text: While on vacation in Vegas, my friends had been going to the casino breakfasts, pricey and not all that. So we decided to give this place a whirl.  Clean, friendly, great service. WOW! What a great idea! Now it's not on "the strip", it's about 10 mins away by car, but oh so worth it! Got the Santa Cruz Burrito- NICE! Filling was scrambled eggs, chicken, and other 'yummy-ness', tasty, great home-fries. Only $10 with lots of coffee. Great portions, excellent flavor. Good comfort food. Everything that my friends ordered looked great. They loved theirs as well.  Do yourself a favor, skip the breakfast buffets and casinos for breakfast. Go here!!!!!

zXWBLbEYW-85q5JN1x6D7A.text: Great potatoes an great omelette , they actually use four eggs for their omelettes that's a lot of eggs!! I don't know if it is by luck or chance but we actually saw a bodybuilder named Dexter Jackson and also Jim manion. Must b the portions ! Would come back again . Sitting in the patio when it's great weather is so nice. I would recommend waiting for a patio seat.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum. Omelettes

Wm68bMi1yxdXqWh4ZIYfnQ.text: Thanks to Tamara! She was an amazing server! She made us feel welcome as we walked in. Way to go gurl!

J7Lrw9Ll-5c1atoGnAzf9Q.text: Good breakfast joint, the menu is huge there's a very large selection. It's not really expensive. The only downside is that sometimes there can be a long wait especially on the weekend during brunch hours. The food taste really fresh... Those seasoned potatoes are so good. Are used to always order the waffle and loaded up with fruit and whipped cream... It was huge. And I ordered the Eggs Benedict a lot.    Most places give you a really tiny pathetic overPriced portion when you upgrade or add a side of fresh fruit... But they give you a really large side of fruit for a small up charge here

0Qq7IzrAfDFh7suNMm4ShQ.text: I stopped here before my long drive home after a weekend in Vegas. It was pretty busy, but for a good reason! The line moved extremely fast and we were seated within no time. The service is phenomenal, the portions are massive, and the quality of food is great.

0z4Ot2oOCApvI2mFVszDhQ.text: This place is a must try! They have a HUGE menu, maybe even too large. Anything you can think of they have and all at a reasonable price. They make their own hot sauce and some of it came with the breakfast burrito I ordered. It and my meal were delicious and packed with flavor. The wait to get a table was about 45 minutes but you know why once you try it. It is worth the wait. Don't think twice about going just do it! You will thank me later.

N94ftAjalEbyW49VnJ0dOQ.text: OMG best burgers ever! It was so delicious so much flavor. My friend had breakfast and she said it was the bomb.com. Tamara was great. Her customer service was on point.

EsO5GVR1PCkLnnk4rLxS6w.text: This place has been a "must stop" for us when in Vegas. Get here early or expect longer waits. It is definitely worth the wait. Hardest part for us each time is deciding on what to order. We have tried different Benny, omelet, burrito, muffin...all delicious! Large portions, you won't go hungry but will crave for it very soon

2eCNPBo7FCdklK6hIcMnVg.text: This place is worth the wait! Came in on a weekday around noon and waited a good ten minutes. I would even wait 30 for how great it is. First off, their menu is huge but I suggest looking through the whole thing, especially if you can't decide on breakfast or lunch food. They have a huge variety of options including meat lovers and vegetarians. I also love how they have gluten free options for toast, waffles, pancakes, and French toast! It's an extra $2 charge but so worth it. If you don't have a severe allergy, you can turn any of the regular waffles or pancakes into GF (some of them have vanilla which contains a small amount). I ordered the bacon maple creme French toast and it was delectable. Also got the bacon & onion skillet which was amazing! Potatoes were cooked perfectly and everything combined tasted great. It was a little too salty for my liking but not even complaining. When I come back to Vegas I'll come back here for sure.

bcVQYLmD8MAD-39-Upa_aA.text: Great food.  Awesome banana nut muffin and carrot cake.  Extremely friendly environment. (Lacey is the best!)  First time and here will always come back from here on out.  The wait for our seating kind if sucks but  that's usually normal for great food.  Country Benny was delicious. The habla Diablo potatoes was good.  Fresh Veggies omelette did NOT feel like it was lacking anything. I am very happy with this place.  Even if you don't care for a hearty American breakfast.  Just go for the Muffin. You will not be disappointed.

dca5bg4SPihHwRfZ9flGWQ.text: Great breakfast spot while in Vegas. Price is great, service is superb, and the Food is delicious. Try the biscuits and gravy or one of the many huge breakfast skillets. You really can't go wrong with anything on their huge menu.

_KGXbgC7xBc3icS58RxQlg.text: Edit [12/29]   I don't usually edit reviews, but I will make an exception in this case. After our original review, Caitlin the manager reached out directly and offered to compensate us should we try his resturant a second time. We were not able to take him up on his offer as we were heading out of town. That being said, it meant a lot that he recognized the issue and took steps to address it.  [Original post]  Unfortunately, we can't post a review based on the actual food. We were staying in Vegas for a couple of days and wanted to get away from the Strip for breakfast. Reviews for this place were great, so we thought why not.   We showed up, it was crowded and we thought that was a good sign. Asked the lady working up front how long the wait might be. She gave us an ugly, why are you bothering me look. Not sure what her deal was. She told us, "at least 35 min, got it?" I remarked to my wife that she wasn't the most friendly person we had met. After which, the lady's attitude became downright aggressive.   I get it that she was busy, that's a good thing. We were very polite and friendly until she came at us with a "fu" attitude. Hope the owners realize that one negative employee can kill the deal quick.

abVjvYPDmV9n17iATcxKDw.text: This is the best breakfast spot in Las Vegas the food is amazing the staff is always friendly and nice they really care about their customers definitely up ...

3XKA8xA79kPodGv42ojG1w.text: Best biscuits and gravy I've ever had in my LIFE! And my 3 year old was super happy that her pancake was shaped like Mickey Mouse.

Let me tell you  I was not disappointed! Since it was our first time there they gave us banana muffins on the house. And they where soooo good !! The coffee is great taste! And the food feels like it's made with love honestly! And the portion size  for the food is great!  would recommend to everyone have been telling everyone since I went!

3BtemPPey0EChVdyMkzAXg.text: OMG, what an Amazing experience for my taste buds! This was our first visit, my son found this place from an Instagram account he follows. This restaurant had both inside and outside seating, those who had outside seating had water mists to help keep cool during the heat. I ordered the Chicken, Mushroom and Spinach skillet. Its layered with cubed potatoes, next is chicken, then mushrooms followed by spinach, they melted Jack and cheddar cheese ontop and you got to pick how you like your two eggs which topped off the layers and your choice of toast or their banana nut bread. To drink we had a Michelada which was delicious as well. I would 10000% recommend this establishment to anyone who plans on visiting Vegas, totally worth the visit!

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food Menu

FNZsS_6GwXRVHCiU_meFKA.text: I must say this is the place for a delicious breakfast or brunch! The service is excellent! The waiters are very attentive. The food was excellent and delicious! This location is centrally located which was great for us since we were going from appointment to appointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rwiOVeSk6AfEUDBko21dew.text: Any time I come to Vegas, I make this place my must to stop for breakfast. Be warned, this place get's busy so don't think you can just walk up in the morning and get seated. There will be a wait. We got lucky this time around and only had to wait 30 minutes around 10:30 the day after Thanksgiving.   Great food and we had a fantastic waitress. If I could give the Egg and I more than 5 stars I would. The problem I had was deciding what I wanted to eat-- so not a bad problem to have I'd say.

OSoI1LIJskAeBcp2eiTs1w.text: This little breakfast diner in town is just like the small town one in the rom coms we see. The best part about this restaurant that you won't find anywhere else (usually) they have indicators on their tables that you can show if you need some service (a happy egg/or a sad egg) and their very prompt on service in that regard.  The food was good! Run of the mill spam and eggs for me-can't go wrong here! The eggs were perfect and the spam was on point with a little  on the side of pineapple! PLUS A FREE BANANA NUT MUFFIN   If I'm on this side of town again I'll be heading here

mLo76sRd27HHv3XdYITzHA.text: Great breakfast food everything is fresh including the fresh squeezed OJ. You need to get their early or you will have to wait a bit They take real good care of you here

Db5niwr5faM4nMzwRbJG_Q.text: This is our annual stop when we go to EDC Vegas.  Craving for those potatoes.  I like to order the fried steak.

iihzeZ0aqiryv3x_e2LRVA.text: I fell in looooove with this place, food was soo good and sooo cheap! It was just refreshing to have those options on paper, I usually feel annoying when i ask for all those changes on my food. Wish I lived closer, I'd come weekly.   DO TRY THEIR CARROT CAKE LOAF AND BANANA NUT MUFFIN!! To die for!!!!

R9S7K_dFBsIIg-lzsvEuuw.text: Service by Miranda was topnotch. I dont usually note great service because thats a standard but this place did a fantastic job. The food came out in a timely fashion, the value was astonishing and it was really tasty. A few tips: they do serve alcohol and look for a groupon for eggworks or egg and I as they accept both and lastly they can split most of the items. I couldnt imagine eating twice the amount I was served. I cant wait to go back.

cRQTV8MGSmGDMJ0JuzSDVQ.text: 4 1/2 out of 5. This is our fourth visit to this place. We keep coming back because of the succulent four egg Chili Omelet and the wonderful Banana Nut Muffins. The omelet is so large, my wife and I always split it and still have a hard time finishing. The muffins and potatoes accompanying the omelet are also really good. CAUTION/HAZARD/WARNING: When ordering the chili for your omelet, do not order the Cincy Chili unless you really like cinnamon. We made this mistake once and were spewing cinnamon from our ears for days. Don't get me wrong, I like cinnamon... in moderation... on buns... in apple pie... on desserts... in eggnog... but please, not in my eggs!  Another note: We have stopped at a few Egg & I's in other cities and they do not offer the Banana Nut Muffins and the Chili Omelets.

She was super busy n even tho this guy was rude she still held a smile n offered a solution. Great job Monica!

My GF got the stuffed French toast which was good as well. Each dish was very generous. One order could easily be split between 2 people.   We were told afterwards that you could order half size portions for each order. Would've been nice to know that in the beginning.   Overall, staff and food quality was great. Other nice thing I liked was that you could pay the check at your table. They had a tablet payment machine on your table. So you can pay via credit card, apple pay, Samsung pay, or android pay. Makes it alot  easier.

D0dz9RylzR9GJqqzPdLbbA.text: Real American Breakfast  What is "American Breakfast" you might ask? Lets define it as two eggs (fried or poached), sliced bacon or sausages, sliced bread or toast with jam/jelly/butter, pancakes with syrup, cornflakes or other cereal, coffee/tea, orange/grapefruit juice. With that in mind if American Breakfast is what you desire, Egg & I can serve you one mean tummy fillin' meal.  When I was there I ordered a Bacon & Slices Avocado Omelette and some coffee to wash it down. The omelette was delicious, coffee was good, but I would have preferred a more traditional home fries.   I sat outside and my server who was a young lady was very good at her job. I got good food, great service and walked out happier and most likely heavier than when I walked in!
