OJPZB842huLyIMTXz9BCYw.text: This was a very impressive breakfast restaurant!  I came here with 4 of my other friends while we were in Vegas and all of us had a positive experience.  Both the food and the service were "egg-cellent."    Anyhow, I try to be a little bit pun-ny at times and this is one of them.  First off, the SERVICE was great.  We came in around noon time and the restaurant was mostly crowded but our group of 5 was seated as soon as we walked in the door.  We were greeted by the hostess with a big smile and much enthusiasm.  What's interesting is that their menu is in the form of a newspaper, which is very creative and something I've never seen before.  Our waitress, Amanda, was very energetic and did a wonderful job.  She was very helpful with her recommendations, very quick, and very genuinely friendly.  I love it when the people at a restaurant enjoy what they do.    As for the FOOD, my friends and I ordered different dishes but everyone enjoyed their meal.  I ordered a hawaiian dish that came with rice, eggs, and spam.  You could also have your choice of sausage.  Now, I know it sounds plain from the description but it was probably the best breakfast of those items I"ve ever had.  Everything was prepared perfectly and also presented well.  I had two eggs that were made over-well, hot and juicy sausage that was perfectly seasoned and two mounds of perfectly scooped rice.  Also, before our dishes were served, we were given complimentary appetizers in the form of a banana nut muffin.  It was the best banana nut muffin I've ever tasted because it came out warm and seemed to be freshly made.  My other friends ordered the country fried chicken breast skillet as well as a turkey sandwich that they happily shared with me.  I got to try it and it was just as excellent tasting as my dish.  The portion sizes were generous and all of us were stuffed by the end of the meal.  What I found interesting was that they had a little sign in the shape of an egg that had two sides.  It was used to signal our waitress if we were in need of some help.  One side of the sign had a smiling egg and another had an egg with a sad face.  Apparently you are supposed to flip it to the sad facing egg side if you needed service.  Anyhow, the last part might not make sense until you actually go there...but it beats any breakfast place on the strip that I've been too!  Lastly, the PRICE is extremely affordable.  An entire meal for one person was about $9-$10 before tax and tip.  I sort of wish they had one in Orange County but I'll definitely come back here with friends the next time I visit vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RFI1OQPXlxDdPH6lV8OOjw.text: This local Nevada chain offers a wide range of specialities from Hawaiian local dishes to the standard breakfast foods. The food here is focused on wholesome, comfort food that appeals to the masses. The Egg and I is a great spot for families, brunch dates, and even pet-friendly. Customer satisfaction is a number one priority, which doesn't offset how great the food tastes. You need to try this place when visiting Las Vegas, which is only 10 min off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Haole Loco

yqmey7sRGmIzqW5tD9Czgw.text: Great food and portions! Above all, phenomenal customer service. My wife has a gluten intolerance and our server, Patrick, was extremely knowledgeable in what items were safe for her to order. It was a breathe of fresh air to be in a great down-to-earth atmosphere, away from the strip. Highly recommend this place.

BP4l2e4tgKE67Ng2TqhjxQ.text: Great start to my vacation! The food here is excellent. This is definitely the best eggs benedict I've ever had.  Fantastic service from our waitress Tabatha! I hope the other places I visit have wonderful staff members like her.

rdUIxzQPGy_GU9oHUN37nA.text: An amazing place with great coffee and great breakfast. I had the grilled chicken omelet and it was good. Although I liked the Mexican chorizo omelet better- it was spicy, flavorful and so good! The banana nut muffin is delicious!

WbJXjfHX4i--7Ke2eQa38w.text: Very good food , this is my favorite breakfast restaurant of all time right here I really love the omelets and the hash browns but do you guys have grits I don't think you do

kO-noVaqkJ3_Jy6mDu11sg.text: My wife and I were in Vegas recently. We're dying for some breakfast food. We googled and yelp and we keep coming across Egg & I. We checked trip adviser and finally we decided to go ahead a try it. Boy oh boy, it was worth is everything was amazing! The service, the atmosphere and the food. We are planning a big family trip and Egg and I will definitely be a major stop on the trip. See you 2018!!!

ha2uWLeIrQ3TuOaxKVJmPw.text: This is my go to brunch when I go to Las Vegas. The banana muffin is moist, great food, good portion for a reasonable price.

qRhmQj9Q7viHhOsVmNgt5g.text: After a long drive from Southern Cali this morning for a quick weekend getaway We decided to stop here because the reviews were good.   First off, the location is really crappy looking.It almost made me want to find something near the hotel we were staying at. Second,  the food is not that great. It's just big slabs of cheese basically on the omelettes, and there was no flavor. Where's the flavor?! I had a bacon and avocado omelete. It had little bacon bits cooked into the egg, and it was hardly noticeable. The avocado was in a big chunk in the middle. Then it was covered in cheese and had some sour cream on top. Maybe strips of bacon would be better. Then maybe it could be tasted.  the potatoes are way too salty and taste weird. they definitely seemed like they were frozen. My husband was not impressed with his omelete neither.   With all the reviews we thought this place would be better. The atmosphere was drab, and the attitudes of the workers was somethin else. Even the manager seemed real fake.

ZqJpKomGRfyV7rRMY6nn7A.text: This is a very busy restaurant. Expect to wait at least half an hour for brunch. That being said the food was appreciable but it took forever to come because it was so packed. I get the appeal with their specialty items and delicious egg dishes. But there are probably other places just as good. I recommend going at an off time so you don't have to wait.

_QaQqNlXUvEVTIdU0DHzww.text: I know it was rather late in the day, around 2pm. The place only had a few customers. Waitresses were busy setting up for the next day.  I was seated promptly, order taken quickly, and everything delivered on time.  The results? Blueberry pecan pancakes were large, yet a bit chewy. Ice tea here was horrible. My server Lindsay was wonderful, but sadly the food wasn't up to my expectations. 2 1/2 stars maybe today.

G3trgrrpyuAQpGcQHEJzvg.text: Definitely a local hangout which I  like because I will try to avoid the Strip for food when I visit.  The Egg Crepe was good, but I like their potatoes.  I  didn't try the banana nut muffin,  but am kicking myself for not doing it.   There's always a next time!

kdeAzyxx6HChta08ILv9EQ.text: My good friend Keith and I yelped for best place to eat breakfast in Vegas.  The Egg and I came up on the radar and we took a 10 min 2 mile ride to check it out. From start to finish the service and atmosphere were five star non pretentious par excellent or as they might say Eggs Cellent.   Our sever Lacey made excellent recommended dishes and her personal favorite. We shared two plates to get the best foodie experience we could in one trip. . Breakdown. The Mexican omelette was awesome. Plenty of distinct flavors and great size plate. Cheesy and little bit of a bite of spice  We had the home potatoes which were made to perfection with hot insides and crispy outside. This was accomplished by making the potatoes very small bites almost hash size.they offered all the condiments at our table with great hot sauces. The second dish wasn't my favorite but my friend loved which was the Stuffed French toast. All the ingredients we're good and the French toast itself was very good but for me it was too much in each Bite the flavors just were not distinct enough for me. We choose the fruit substitute on this plate and was surprised how much fresh fruit they gave on one plate.  Now the best part of this place. Reviews plenty. Write ups plenty as well. But.  The best part aside from the food was the people. Lacey was phenomenal came by like 10 times. Lino the other service person at our table was the best came by and verified with us like 10 times as well and that wasn't where it stopped. The other support staff also asked us a few times if we needed anything.  Hard to find that kind of service anywhere and they all did it with a smile.   Side note.  Coffee was left in carafe at table so no need to waive anyone down though you probably wouldn't need to with the service as good as it was here.  Last I highly recommend this place. The price was too good to be True for this food and service combo. Thanks Lacey and Lino and the whole staff there at Egg and I. ( Aka also known as Egg Works their other five locations)  Gary C Walmer

jWmA4fgYqbHSw4-0YyjmWg.text: It was worth the over 30 minute wait....great breakfast. It was nice to get away from the strip :)

gkULaMo5f1x9mC1sCs0tDw.text: Great place for breakfast and the price is just right.  Plenty of parking since it is away from the strip.  Dining area is immaculate and bright.  Servers are always hanging smile on their face.  They are friendly and attentive, always give you suggestion if you have a hard time to choose your breakfast.  Food serve hot and they are very home-made.  Portion is good and they are not too greasy for my taste.  Their menu is printed on a newspaper, very creative and interesting.

The potatoes that come with the Benny are soooo good; crispy and well-seasoned. Perry and the other staff were very attentive and friendly. :) I recommend if you have a larger group, call ahead and make a reservation  And don't forget to check in and get a free, warm banana nut muffin!

I was disappointed to find it only had avacado.  The banana nut muffin that came with the omelet was steaming hot! The "free muffin" that we hot when checking in with Yelp was not hot. Insist on the hot muffin if you like your butter to melt!  We did get the carrot cake loaf to go. We are in town until Saturday!

_F4RXQ6RaFVQiVHJPVDX_w.text: Such a hot spot. This little dive lives up to its reputation. Best omelette I have ever had. The texture of my omelette was perfection. Being on a low carb diet, I opted out of the banana muffin and potatoes, but they both looked delicious. The wait for brunch was about 20 minutes for peak Saturday time, but so worth it. Our server, Liza was very personable and prompt with service. We got our meals hot, fresh and quick with the epitomy of service with a smile. Well off the strip so our meal for four of us was $55, which was what my husband I spent yesterday,  splitting a breakfast omelette yesterday at a breakfast spot on the strip.

rLvQaGrxlH2sDcW0qwtkeg.text: Summary: Every time, and I do mean EVERY TIME I'm in Vegas, I HAVE to stop by Egg & I for breakfast. I mean, I was offered free breakfast at Wicked on my last day there and yet I decline because I MUST go here. The wait at time is long especially on the weekend but if you are willing to be seated in the patio, the wait time is cut in half. I couldn't have ask for a better service from all their staff.  Food: Waffle, Scramble Eggs, Omelets, Work Potato, etc etc etc You just can't go wrong with whatever you pick. Well, you might but I haven't. No matter what you order, make sure you try their work potato, it's like country potato but crunchier with more flavor.   Overall: Hate their parking lot, at times we have to park at the end of the plaza and walk over but it is so worth it.

F6BtlZvrsRgK7cgbIGCt8g.text: First time here and best breakfast I've had in Vegas! Period. Yes, the food was delicious - I had the green chile hash - but on top of this, the service was second to none. Thanks Karla for everything. I would highly recommend eating here. Worth the drive from the strip....

f95lgvSsR9aODB3whGvMaw.text: My first time visiting. I enjoyed my food. The staff was very friendly. I recommend this place for family and couples. The bathroom was no so clean. But overall the experience was nice.

DYDoOhtp1CzcjmIwf2Ozow.text: First things first, WOW! The service was amazing our waiter was Raul. He was a very friendly waiter very quick and was checking on us frequently and quickly got a lot of food for four people and it was only $60. I highly recommend it

k-UzJAuNU_F7c3EmJnumZw.text: I tried the mashed potato omelette and California crepe . Both was awesome and given in quite big portion. Worth for those eggs lover. YuQD0vsGWsk9boBFX6EIzQ.text: The place was full. The waiting line was out of the door but even as we we're told the waiting was going to be 20-25min long we didn't wait that much. At first we were greeted by Carlos who brought our coffee which was hot and delicious. Then our waitress, Paula went over the menu with us and recommended some dishes. We ended up with Sundance omelette that was delicious. My sister had the corned beef hash that was freshly made and tasty. The banana nut muffin was also good so you should totally get it. I got toast but it was just standard store bought sliced bread so definitely go with the muffin. Overall was a great breakfast. We will come back next time we are in Las Vegas.

wGDBAW7eWINwPFnL8rE_tw.text: Service here is great. They have this little egg sign on the table that you flip to black if you need service and its really like magic the way they appear when you try to change the sign.  I had: Iced water- I had to write that their water tastes like they got it from the restroom sink. Its so bad i had to order a coke.  Banana nut muffin- didn't see what the hype was about. I thought it was OK.  Eggs Florentine with seasoned potatoes- good with Cholula. the potatoes are really good!  I would say everything was good/average.

YKCeeQI5GrVWnzYRKgg1cQ.text: Very good service and great food.  I've had wonderful servers every time i had breakfast or lunch here. Chance helped me out and was delightful through it all. Raul is also has a great personality and was sure that everything went through smoothly. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast or lunch.

J-uJJ5fY4IOYzFpMvfTyzg.text: Our server Arlene was eggceptional!! And my haole loco moco was so so good. Reminded me of Oahu!  Thank you for a great experience!

K07TC66h3M7yAgPb_jonuA.text: Four stars because there isn't enough seating, and the seating they do have is kind of awkward. However, as for the food, yum, yum, yum, yum, yum; did I say, YUM?

scVvYaQbNgcvQxeev8t7FQ.text: This place was so good and totally unexpected! They have gluten free options and are aware of how to prevent cross contamination which is ALWAYS so helpful! I had their chili relleno omelette and my fiance had the stuffed French toast. The only bummer was that they did not serve mimosas and bloody Mary's.

Yp-OxuSyEITp8DyahAphmA.text: This place is awesome. The food and service are great. Whatever you do,  pick the banana nut muffin.  It's incredible!!!

_wPJMXrVFJFDS8-rf20KSg.text: Excellent place for breakfast. We found it by chance. Huge portions and the ranch potatoes were awesome. Service was perfect and the wait time was 10-15 minutes. I would highly recommend.

vrgSpgq3iIEyTjLvycBWQA.text: Good breakfast spot! Our waitress was Stacie and she was awesome!! Definitely try the banana nut french toast and the egg-cellent omelet... sooooooooo worth it and it'll feed 2 people no problem!

m3A6S7MdaHOqvDpCYgwWbQ.text: Good food and good service. Erin was very attentive to us. Will be back the next time we are in town.

zSmvvbaL5ashb6xlG_Bjxw.text: Great breakfast place. It's not on the strip but if you can, make the trip out. I had the Loco Moco and it was great. The banana nut muffin came with the meal and it was the best banana nut muffin I've ever had. It actually may be the best any muffin I've ever had. The staff was friendly with prompt/quick service with reasonable prices. The potatoes that come with most breakfast entrees were really good as well.

E7WfH11rkW_nRRcMZSPu0A.text: The staff are friendly, food are good. I just wish they can change the way of cooking hashbrown. Not all in that chili powder style. Also, if the cashier can speed up during the check out would be nice.

v9Qp9lFQSmxvk795t1J3Qg.text: So today after a long days of work, my coworker and I stopped by the Egg and I. We were seated promptly and our waitress Reina greeted us and took our drink orders. In less than 30 seconds our server brought us our drinks. She talked to us as if we were friends and made us feel at home!!! Will be back specifically to this location just because of her service! Thank you Reina. If they don't send you Disney I will!!!!!

WFEeFBEzBW4r2yK050-_UA.text: Didn't really want to patronize the usual breakfast buffets in the hotels, so my husband and I set out to find a local breakfast spot that we'd really enjoy.  Boy did we find it!!!!!!The banana nut muffin was probably the best I've ever had!!!!!  Everything on the menu looked good so we really had a difficult time placing an order.  However,  I ended up with the enchilada omlette which was devine and my husband had a chili omlette and he loved his as well.  We were stuffed by the time we were done and promised ourselves we would return once again before we ended our vacation.

8YZM_RDw4NJ5dnlWHUaYtQ.text: OH goodness this place rocks!!!!! Ask for Chance, she is an awesome server.  Thanks for the directions.  The banana nut muffin is the best I have ever had

1Y_laenKZN6lRxQfq3mT5w.text: I always enjoy coming here. Thaynara was very pleasant and quick to my table. I had a great western omelet. This is one of my favorite breakfast places in town.

FQuj-meQYXhOEmj7P7pklg.text: Found another bomb breakfast place in Vegas!! this place is on the Zagat list so that's why it gets a lot of ppl there every morning!! we ordered the steak benedict n the corned beef. Let me tell u this... the steak benedict was sooo good lots of steak in it so I was really full after! but the corned beef was even better!! My gf ordered that one wanna swtich with her hahah kinda far from the strip but its worth the drive tho!!

afnyzob_AnIhmlOO1JYZMw.text: I ordered the Turkey Cheese, Avocado, Crepe with a banana muffin and a coffee. The service was quick, loud and friendly. A home town feel for breakfast to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. The menu was on a newspaper style paper which was neat.   First the Banana Muffin came out and was moist and great!. I would want that muffin at the casino buffets. Then the food came out and it was huge. The potatoes were seasoned with some sort of lawry's seasoning flavor, pretty good, didn't need much ketchup, i didn't use any. The crepe was huge, it too up half teh dish, but was more like an omlet than a crepe. Still tasty and filling.   I like breakfast and I usually get a chicken fried steak for breakfast, but that crepe was definitely a head turner walking in to our seats... I'm sold on Eggs and I.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NHXwRF3CMZITOtQCczgpfA.text: Better than the first time.  We scored a free entree coupon so we made the trek over to this location from the strip.  There was a bit of a wait but nothing too bad... The banana muffin is legit, served warm with butter.  This time around I ordered the huevos rancheros and they were good, very filling, cheesy and tasty.  This is a great place for breakfast.  Looks like they have also won a best cheeseburger award too.  Don't let the line of people outside scare you they turnover the tables quick.

3J9M-1vsFV1PakOLpvDsjA.text: This place is AMAZING the food is great so many options and the banana nut muffin is perfect taste like no other the service is great our server Carlos came by as soon as we were seated took care of our drinks and was very friendly we will definitely be coming back

GhK6PtHq5JcfFgxCHv3Jow.text: Had the Chicken Cordon Bleu skillet. Was a great breakfast. Jessica the server was awesome. She was her attentive and was always there when we need something. If your in the area stop by for an eggredible breakfast.

QQuGhmhxPkY24ZMY846H6Q.text: If you want some pretty awesome breakfast food with great portions and a friendly staff, then this spot is just for you.  I ordered the Prime Rib Benny and was more than satisfied at how generous the portion was along with how delicious it tasted!  Now I know a Prime Rib Benny isn't something that sounds all too familiar to anyone who hasn't been to this restaurant, so picture this:  juicy and flavorful pieces of blackened prime rib chopped up with poached eggs crowning an open faced buttery croissant, which is then drizzled with a rich and creamy hollandaise sauce.  It's like what traditional egg benedicts dream to be some day basically.  Regular eggs benedict is Carlton Banks, Prime Rib Benny is Will Smith.  You get the picture.  Besides the entree itself, my order of OJ was fresh squeezed and just right.  Their lemonade was great too, which is a definite plus in my book.  I also had a taste of their French fries and Portuguese sausage, which my cousins ordered and both were very tasty, too!  The fries were thin, crispy and flavorful.  While the Portuguese sausage was not overly oily and fatty and was cooked just right.  Service was verygood, as our waiter was attentive, friendly and always available.  They have this nifty little feature on your table where there's a sign of a sad face and on the other side of it, a sign of a happy face.  When you want your server's attention, you just flip the sign to show the sad face and you'll be helped right away.  I found this to be a very memorable and smart way of the restaurant going the extra mile to offer as much quality service to its patrons.

hi9SL1XZ0j5O9ChCYpfuQg.text: Good Breakfast spot in Las Vegas!  We enjoyed it over the Thanksgiving Holiday.

QQNB_C_IUY2IwEF8840txw.text: The best breakfast or lunch in Las Vegas.  Alexa is an outstanding server.  She get orders correct, makes sure got drinks are always filled. Don't leave without trying their banana nut bread.  It is to die for!!!  You won't be disappointed!!!

KpJl8ZQAw_KAcutkgCbA6A.text: My sister and I had been pretty excited about coming here after reading all about it on Yelp.  It seemed to be really busy with lots of people waiting outside (on a Sunday afternoon), but we luckily only had to wait about 10 minutes before we were seated.    Our server was super nice.  She really helped elevate the entire experience.  When we asked for banana nut muffins to go with our entrees, she asked if it was our first time there.  We told her yes and she said the muffins were free for first timers!  Hope that's True and I'm not getting anyone in trouble by posting that info here.    I ordered the Eggs Benedict Florentine & it came with those little (obviously frozen) and highly seasoned potatoes.  Overall I enjoyed the dish, but there was so much Hollandaise sauce that the English muffin got pretty soggy and the ham was really quite bad.  It was cut in thick slices and was very rubbery.  It almost tasted canned or something.  I took the ham off and it was much better that way.  However, the whole thing was a runny, saucy mess.  The poached eggs were cooked perfectly though.  My sister unfortunately didn't enjoy her blueberry pancakes too much.  This might sound strange, but they were way too fluffy for both of us & just didn't taste that great.  We both loved the muffins though.  That very well may have been the best part of the whole meal.    Despite the rubbery ham, I'd definitely come back.  The service was excellent and I feel confident that we'll both be able to find other dishes on the menu that suit us better.  Plus.... those banana nut muffins!  You'd be a fool not to try one.

-Z7ElM2eKCGTI34L2mJO0A.text: Food is oily and covered with seasoning. Toast is burnt. What's non dairy creamer? However the service from Samantha is completely awesome and makes up for everything. Samantha gave me some real milk to go with my coffee.

tkpqX95pDx_n3b0X_6Uqtg.text: My husband and I are visiting Vegas for our honeymoon and wanted search out the best breakfast in town -- we found it! Our server, Carol Anne, was almost as sweet as the waffles! If we ever visit Vegas again,  we'll be back to Egg and I.

zGQcGpyYtYr6JYohPNgNRQ.text: We went here earlier this month not realizing that we'd been to their other Southeastern location in April 2010.  We were thrillled because we loved the food!  The coffee is so good and strong and love anywhere like this that leaves the urn on the table so you don't have wait for refills (I hate that!). I had the Taco Rancheros which was a flour torilla covered with scrambled eggs, seasoned ground beef, refried beans, cheese, sour cream and salsa. I put the fried potatoes on top of it and it was awesome!  My boyfriend had the Reuben Sandwich and he loved it. This is one of those places where you get so much food that you don't need to eat again until dinner!

nK9-V-iI3R1KazKnjGgaPw.text: Absolutely perfect. Made for a great start to the day. Food was cooked to perfection (even with very specific requests) and our server, Jose was wonderful. Pleasant and attentive with just the right amount of humor. Wonderful! ( Guess we liked it a lot, huh?) Thanks.

PATe1t-rqXQjgp1safYUQg.text: A group of 15 girls arrived here on a HOT Saturday morning. Half of us were hungover, half of us were starving and all of us were in a rush. We had bachelorette duties to attend to in oh about 1.5-2 hours. The place was really busy and didn't seem possible to get a large party seated and fed within our time frame. Surprisingly enough, we got seated in about 20 minutes. We got right down to ordering and in about 20 more minutes, our food was in front of us ready to be devoured. We ordered the Chicken Fried Steak, Eggs Benedict Florentine, Ultimate Skillet, French Toast and of course the Banana Nut Muffin. The portions were huge and the food was tasty. The best part of the brunch was the service. It was very friendly and fast. We got out of there with satisfied tummies and within good time. This place is definitely worth the trip off the strip.

c5BQzXUOIqTVO04gaToe4g.text: I'm not sure what the fuss is with this restaurant.  Whatever you do, DON'T order the hash browns (vs their Diabla potatoes) .  I was served the exact same hash brown patty that McDonalds serves.  The food was good but average at best (including the free banana nut muffin).  Sorry I can't go with the masses with this review

1KvKmd0Uf0kvp80KOL4kiQ.text: Went here this morning with my husband. Very nice and chill place to have breakfast. First off, our server Arlene was awesome. She did not miss a thing. We asked her what she recommended and she gave us an example from each section (omelette's, benedicts, skillets, etc.), not just 1 or 2 items. She also kept coming back frequently to check on us. Gave us a good idea on what was good. Secondly the food! Delicious! Banana bread was nice, moist and flavorful. I had the Corn beef hash and loved it! My husband had chicken fried steak and loved it! Thank you Arlene! Thank you Egg & I! Yes we will come back!

vL0SEfEIMKqLW-nxYBVfxw.text: i absolutely *heart* this place!  i think its the cute egg mascots ;-)  been here serveral times.  one of my best friends moved to vegas years ago, and ever since she's been my vegas local guide to food.  its good to be in the know ;-)  we go here for breakfast almost every time i visit!  here's why....  service is always friendly.  the food is creative, homey, filling, and just a great homemade american breakfast/brunch menu.  there are heavy soul filling and hangover killing dishes like meaty hashes, great benedicts, all sorts of omelettes, and then there are lighter versions like the egg crepes and even the fresh berry parfait.    its PACKED for weekend brunch, mostly with locals, but the wait isn't tooo bad, usually not over 20 min or so.  if u happen to be here on a weekday, or get up earlier than the rest of ur friends and wanna get off the strip, this is perfect place to sit by urself with the paper, coffee, and  a good breakfast.  not what u would think of when u think of vegas, in a very good way =D  p.s. must get the muffins!

VJtn-28bs9CoFaPrr5_Xyw.text: This place is simply delicious! Nice size portions for a decent price. There can be a bit of a wait , but its well worth the wait. Just thinking about it makes me all tingly on the inside. LOL.   a nice hidden jewel away from the strip, but for us locals who drive by on our way to work or church...we know what kind of gemstone it really is@   Most importantly, it is kid friendly. For people who have two young ones and who also has friends who has two young ones...its a good fit for us.   yummmie...

vjAXQDTHH_GGJwYJRD4KKg.text: Food was fantastic. The portiins are VERY filling. Amanda was our server and she was so sweet and helpful. We were a large party including 2 crabby seniors and a fussy baby and she made sure that everyone was well taken care of.

qpd8YZGNx8r8ne0CCqofVQ.text: Good food, great selection, excellent prices and phenomenal customer service.   Our server Bree was charming, helpful and attentive.   Girlfriend got breakfast, I had lunch.   Huge portions.   The Only reason I can't give five stars is they didn't serve real 100% maple syrup. Nobody gets five stars for breakfast with "table syrup"  But we will definitely be back.  My syrup snob GF will just have to bring her own.

Sx8fzINA3YN14rNJcyJHWw.text: it was an so-so place. Greasy food and ok service. i wasn't expecting much. Diner food. The potatoes were seasoned far too much with seasoning salt. And my skillet was ok. I can't say it would be worth the trip here. Unless u are tired of the buffets. pancakes were nothing special. It was...meh...so i don't know how it got such high ratings.

F55QqsTV5Hnx6a4WJbepGQ.text: My family and I decided to go into Egg and I after it was greatly recommended by a good friend. Everything was great! There was a descent line at the door when we entered but we were still sat within 5 minutes. Our server was Gloria and she was such a delight and extremely helpful. The food was some of the best breakfast food you can try for the price. On our way out we got to meet Sarah the manager and she was more than kind and professional as she thanked us for coming in and asked how everything was. We will definitely be back!

lxuO9QDtcewwz3GBaxHVLA.text: I love this place. The food is outstanding. Our server was so sweet and kept checking on us.  I made sure before my daughter left Vegas I would bring her here to have a great meal. Ask for Linnea area and you will be impress with her as well. We'll done!!!!!!

9dCV4C4yzzLM1EXW6BmWBQ.text: The breakfast was very good. Mist dishes were delicious.  Don't order the buckwheat pancakes. They were very dry and blend. My yogurt with fruit and granola was yummy. So were all the homemade muffins. The skillets were very good if you don't watch your cholesterol or count the calories. I would definitely come back

u9MwV5UPnPK76Q2osJMV8A.text: Three of us came here after a night of partying in Vegas.  One of my friends found Egg & I on yelp, so we tried it out.  I had the chicken fried steak. My gf had a stuffed French toast with ham and my friend had an omelette.  Everything tasted perfect!  I would highly recommend this place, and we will definitely come back, the next time we are in Vegas!

oX7gpKJGBpM0UD-moypuZQ.text: One of our favorites places to visit when we come to Vegas !! Food is always extraordinary, my husband decides his first breakfast on the place! The staff is amazing but today Alyssa was beyond our expectations!!!

k6-4wVFoukwwHV3MYiD3aQ.text: Wow that's a lot of reviews . I guess I came on an off day because the only thing that was good was the muffin . Service is very fast so fast that they forgot part of our order . We asked the waitress for our toast she said your order doesn't come with toast we said we ordered toast she then looked all around our table and looked at us like we were hiding the toast in order to get free toast. She said I will go look for it . When it arrived it was at the end of our meal . The house potatoes are heavily seasoned with what I guess is season salt way to salty to enjoy . The carnitas were cold . It wasn't very good over all.

_mvEc6G0-R664EWaoTLLYQ.text: My girlfriend and I come to the egg and I every once and while, the food is always great. Today, our server was Paula and she was great, we didn't have to ask for anything, she was on top of everything. Highly recommend!

MY9J7vw_xhPbXpCtTYJNPQ.text: Delicious!   Veggie skillet had seasoned potatoes on bottom, then veggies, topped with cheese and egg. I would've used red onions instead of white but still delicious.   The banana nut muffin was great too.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

geI7gNQ1XiGfl3Vo-HQz1Q.text: Awesome breakfast!!!!!! Yummy potatoes. My husband had the Sunrise Mountain. We were full and the food was tasty. Well worth the trip off the strip. Perry was our waiter and he was AWESOME! Go get breakfast and ask for Perry!

3BKIKm82UmOd7q8xAiOUxQ.text: The woman at the front counter welcomed us with a smile & a good morning. We were seated immediately. The service was REALLY fast & perfect. They even have a little black egg you leave out when you don't need anything & you flip it to yellow so the waiters know when you need anything! I think that's a great concept & they should start something like that at all the restaraunts, ever. But anyhoo. I had 'the works.' 2 eggs, their country potatoes(they have a specific name, but it's escaping me right now), your choice of meat and toast. I opted for scrambled with cheese(my go-to), ham steak & cinnamon raisin toast. Everything was perfect! Wonderful after a long night of Vegas drinking. The prices are so affordable too. I will definitely be back, this place is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;The works&#34;
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute vodka drinks with breakfast

qq08hhRGVXP2elSEk2uBqw.text: Hands down some of the BEST breakfast I have ever had the opportunity to eat. It was totally obvious that several of the people eating there were EDC attendees, because the dining room was full of kandi wearing partiers. There wasn't much of a wait since we were immediately seated. Our server was awesome and totally encouraged us to customize our meals. I got one of the massive scramble and country potato dishes with a side of biscuits and gravy. The food is amazingly delicious, fresh, and a great value. If you're looking for an epic breakfast joint away from the strip then definitely come to this place to escape the overpriced food on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate skillet substitute all the meat for chorizo

Uw7fGTZG1-pIbj19Vw2EFQ.text: I don't know why I waited so long to leave a review because this is one of my favorite breakfast places that always aims to please! Victoria will make sure that if your coffee is not strong enough, she'll get you a part that is! I love this place.... vanilla creamer and all :)

ur9DvMQnrEgVTSnQf4MPRQ.text: Eggsellent service! Get it? Get it?!!? This place is very popular, and there was a 20 minute wait when we arrived. It's in a small strip mall off Sahara Ave, and it is definitely worth going. They have a choice of various toasts or their famous banana nut muffins to start. They keep the bottomless coffee cup tradition going. To top it off, their eggs are all perfectly cooked! I got the hashbrown skillet, and it was fantastic. The potatoes were a little dry, but they had a nice seasoning. The prices are very reasonable, and the portion sizes are a bit on the large size.

gm3BXOgS9XnsMNKTFOyoGg.text: So, so close to Five Stars, but given the fact that the coffee is weak and flavorless, I have to take it down to four.  Otherwise:  - STELLAR breakfast food - Some of the best omelettes I've ever had in my entire life (the standouts for us were the chile relleno and the avocado/bacon) - Biscuits and gravy are LEGIT  Prices are low, service is great.

KDWOfh9UKrAly7u-pmxefA.text: Great service. Staff did great job on Sat. morning w/a crowd. Egg flag on table to ask for service is nice idea.

N9ZtsN9BhgcRnnSX3gNQLw.text: Great friendly staff. I got here at 6am on a Sunday and was going to meet a friend. Friend was delayed by a lot but the server kept coming by and checking up on me and offering to bring me little treats and keep me company :) The food here is top notch! I had the scramble which turned out to be an amazing choice. The food was not greasy and I felt comfortably full afterwards.  Keep up the good work!

FhQM12mHk_79ajjlo-n2-Q.text: All I can say is thank you Yelpers!  Hubby and I go to Vegas at least once a year and always try new places to eat each time. We always rent a car and love to explore. The service was great, and the food was delicious!  I had the biscuits and sausage with gravy (can't remember the name of the dish) and my hubby had one of the skillet breakfasts. Yummo!  It was a lot of food and neither of us finished our meals, although I wanted to!!  If you are looking to venture out from the strip I highly recommend. Also, the price is right!

9iffr5ORqwvYAm_y18pqxA.text: Good American breakfast. Order the banana nut muffin. Big portions

1-lqUKVHsC0QiKGhqtq6vA.text: Great place to go after fun night!  Servers were respectful and fun. Got eggs Benedict and had a second breath.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Benedict w/ side of fruits and potatoes

MqU23732to80vsx0rW_9WA.text: After a long night out in vegas lights, the Egg & I is just the right place to go afterwards. While the wait is bit long, its all worth it for the food and service they provide. Shout out to our host Earl, who took care of us perfectly! Those with  spicy pallet, the food is perfect for you. Combination of mexican spices and english twist on the spinach Benedict is finger licking good. Highly recommended #VeggieAbroad

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spinach Benedict with house potatoes

zn4bjZRjn5-s1TOg9BwwnA.text: Our first breakfast in Las Vegas! It was good. The eggs with cheddar were delicious and the waffle was very well done. My bf had an eggs benny and he really liked it. Overall, it was the best breakfast we had in Vegas and I would recommend it. Kept us full for the majority of the day.

xyCxGj09_0KwQsC1azxEXw.text: What a great find! I ordered the eggs benedict that comes with the works potato and it's amazing! The plate could easily feed two!   Our waitress was super friendly and knew  what we needed without having us call her!  I'm a little sad i didn't get a chance to use the eggy help flag (there's a flip egg stand on each table that you flip over if you need anything). But at the end of the meal,  I don't care, food was great and the service was exceptional because our waitress, Carole Anne, was awesome!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IuuYW-Plf5rBUajqGZAwFw.text: This the probably the best brunch/breakfast place in Vegas! Absolutely loved the food! I would give them more than 5 stars if possible. The skillets are amazing!! And the pesto sandwich was great!! Would definitely recommend this place !!

HGWkAMB5uYCkTj8aGbdZhw.text: 1st visit, good choice Yelpers! Sausage & biscuits were good, short on sausage in the gravy so they brought out a complimentary plate of sausage to take care of that, very thoughtful & much appreciated. Our waitress Amanda was very sweet & intent on making sure we were enjoying our breakfast. Fiesta skillet was perfect, great flavors, not too spicy w a lot of cheese, green chiles, & perfectly cooked eggs. All those raving about the banana walnut muffin were right, it is delicious, dark brown (molasses added?), moist and perfectly cooked. Almost glad my wife is allergic to walnuts so I could eat it all! Very large portions, we ate a little more than 1/2 of each of our meals & were more than full.  Way better than the casinos & a lot better value. Enjoy!!

NN6_3ZdIOWB1UYNnPdkXFQ.text: There are many locations from the same parent restaurant across Las Vegas and I am sure they are equally good.   Egg & I does what any breakfast diner should do the best! They have great food at good prices with large portion sizes. All of their food is fresh and made without any apologies to clogging arteries or expanding waist lines. This is a perfect place to go for brunch in Las Vegas to get over some of the dieting and dehydration that had happened the night before or coming up that night. Also a great stop before heading towards one of the great national parks.   You will not regret coming here as long as you are looking for what they have on the menu!!

eb9ONSGENq-A_RKd3egn0w.text: I never been here before, so it was my first time. It exceeded my expectations! Theyre all reallly sweet; the waitresses.

qOPOCcMrMzdqEeZ1hzP-0w.text: Our server was Lilliana, she provided excellent service, and the food was also excellent!! Highly recommend you try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!

xvHys4L1COylj1DMKqxF7g.text: Wow what a great meal.We came here twice because the first experience was so good.Omelette's were great and Prime Rib Benny was outstanding.Service was equally superb as well. Reina our waitress was great both days !!!

iyfXo9MO7mcXDFlVXp10Ng.text: I went for lunch. I got a pesto scramble and I have to say this was one of the best flavor combinations I've had in a while. There were eggs, pesto, whole spinach leaves, cheese, and I think some tomatoes scrabbled to fluffy perfection.  My fiance got the western omelette and he said it was the best he's ever had.   We bought a groupon at $24 for $40 worth of food so it was a good deal too, but I am definitely coming back in the future.

rU4ZxHReEI1uh6sC6APONA.text: Wish you were so much closer to me! Better yet no I don't I would totally gain 20 pds by you lol! Love this home fashioned yet unique breakfast joint! I will make a stop here everytime for at least one breakfast if in the area.  Here is what I ordered:  MEXICAN OMELETTE Chorizo* sausage, green chilies, diced onion, and melted cheeses. Covered with salsa and sour cream. About 10 bucks and two biscuits on the side.  I don't know what they put in their seasonings but Y-U-M-M-Y!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I usually never finish a plate that has such huge portions but I gobbled this one all the way! And yup they have MILITARY Discount!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Their menu is full of things I am just dying to try in the future! We got here about 11:30 and only waited about 5 minutes before seating. Breakfast is served until 3:00 for all the late nighters! MMM..MMM.....Good!

SXIOacFRahuPPwCTXDnfwQ.text: Went here expecting a typical breakfast but was pleasantly surprised! Our server Patrick was extremely helpful and gave us an amazing service. I ordered the waffle works which turned out delicious. Patrick recommended trying the Habla potatoes which were awesome, they were seasoned perfectly! With the great prices, amazing service, this is one of the top breakfast joints I've found here in Las Vegas!

yLzLPcrKNS5v1nDheRY32Q.text: Everything was perfect! Banana nut French toast and the eggs Florentine with a side of corned beef hash was all amazing! Carla was very helpful and attentive to our needs!  My dad came to Vegas years ago on a business trip and while I was on my vacation now he strongly recomended my coming here. Fantastic and great!!

pVsDhrJX5MzPAIB5O8drhw.text: Great service, and the food was AMAZING! I had the Santa Fe skillet and it was delicious!

iBJNCfvid5MKl08NRbuzOw.text: This place is overrated. We got bennidits, which were all right, nothing special. Potatoes were too salty.   Their ice tea was terrible, you can taste they used tap water to make it, which was disgusting!!!  We will not come back for sure

w7bBchwrCJcBq6cCzEcm9w.text: Come in hungry, you'll starve by the time you get your table but once you do...you'll wish your momma made the eggs as good!

3_BXl3tkNiJPgnSPV5a-zQ.text: Truly exceptional service! Came in for a Crazy Chicken Omlete, and it was truly a great experience even though it was simply take-out. Will definitely be bringing the nephews, the sister in laws, brothers, siblings, friends, my entire family and even my dog to enjoy Egg and I. (If thats allowable)  Two thumbs up!

FxK262JPUsCkog8HkML1SA.text: Very popular breakfast place in Las Vegas! So it's gonna be crowded there. I always get excellent service here. I usually come here with some real health nuts who have to have some seriously customized orders and they always get it right. They have one manager that even looked at our bill and showed us how we can order things a certain way and save some money.

CtC2fsYUbfqThpzxfNpduw.text: Egg and I is one of or favorite places to eat. Not only is the food fantastic but the service matches the food. Today we again encountered the service we have grown accustomed to. Although it was packs, Curtis continued to check in with us. My measurement of good service is I never have to go out of my way to look for the server. Our drinks were always full and he continued to check in. We were eating with a 4 and 2 year old, he understood the urgency. Curtis is fantastic!

Zu6FSfGzJL8tYhlwmT5fGw.text: LOVE IT!  Curtis was amazing!  Thank you! Chili relleno omelette is killer along with the muffin. A must try!

OdCRFs4mmpJ-tW7ZLBb_WQ.text: I'm from out of state and this was my first time at this restaurant and id have to say i was not disappointed. My sisters and I found this restaurant online and decided to check it out for the breakfast. I had the country fried steak and it was one of the best country fried steaks I've had. The banana nut muffin was actually the best I've ever had. Our server Tamara was very sweet, she took very good care of us. We will definitely be coming back upon our next visit to Vegas. If you haven't already been sold on this place you need to just go. Great food and amazing service.

thzW00B-wKJmgvxw2cue_A.text: A great location for breakfast. They handle substitutions well and don't care if you order big or small. They roll with the punches and just bring what you've asked for. The Diablo potatoes are particularly good and they are happy to substitute cottage cheese of tomatoes if you are watching you weight. My wife order the Eggs Benedict and she got it with American Bacon instead of Canadian without a problem. Good show. A nice restaurant.

7sc01MZQ7WlEFx8_TeLDKg.text: Great place for breakfast! Will be going back for sure.

DK2V76h-4JbiL6S_zAHlwg.text: The best eggs Benedict  around.  Also, great service....Karla is the best!  You might have to wait for a table on weekends but it's worth it.

xwp5T5SabEXJxgnB167UmQ.text: Love the four egg omelet and the marbled rye toast. They leave the pot of coffee with you so you never run out. More food than I could eat. Service is fast and friendly. Love this place.

6rGcTFHkpInbf-IsZEcBng.text: This place was so good. They have a wide variety of options, but went for breakfast based off the name alone. I got the Eggs Benedict Florentine. It comes with the crispest seasoned potatoes.  FYI. The portions are really big. I wish I knew that before I went here. I left so full but happy !

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict Florentine

BVy5MmXUHqwi-unFKcz0qg.text: Amazing breakfast and even more amazing was the service! Amanda was sweet, friendly, and most of all genuinely happy to help. The potatoes are out of this world and so are the banana muffins!

TbQzNy-GPQ0Mf8I8msy5Yg.text: Went in during a pretty busy Sunday morning yesterday, and can I say how amazed I was at the staff and getting us our table in exactly how log the estimated. Everyone was very kind and helpful. Our server Oscar was awesome. I never had an empty drink I never had to look around and ask for anything because he was always a step ahead. I will definitely be going back to dine again soon!

FsVHiVkoO5wkpKq9n6lqJA.text: Coming from Ohio, we had no idea where to go for brunch until my brother suggested The Egg & I. The food was awesome! Oscar, our waiter gave us the best service possible! The other staff members were so nice as well. We waited, but not long considering it was Sunday morning! The banana nut muffin is delicious and the portions we received were huge! Great place to go if you're looking for a breakfast/lunch idea!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YB1Ua-EDAH4XkH91TV2uqQ.text: Short wait but worth it.  Lelani was great and attentive.  The chicken fried steak was amazing with biscuits and gravy as good if not better than hash house.  There are a lot of things to try so we will be back for sure.  Fifty bucks out the door with a great bloody mary,  screwdriver and free banana muffin which was awesome.  If you wanna venture off strip give it a go and you will not be disappointed.

ifyhP6ZssjLcXOHqXkgv0g.text: Had the stuffed French Toast. A new twist to French toast. Absolutely delicious . Loved the seasoned country potatoes. I would definitely come back and recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast! Yum.

JaIyu17-oD2SIsJMtamaEA.text: Went here with some friends last weekend after we Yelped the best spots for breakfast.  None of us were disappointed!  The portions are enormous, the drinks delicious, and the service wonderful.    All of us loved our food.  Highly recommended for a change of pace if you're in Vegas and really sick of doing buffets, chain restaurants, etc.

iHVNH5KPEFsRH7kSXL5FTQ.text: This is one of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. The variety of the menu is mind boggling with some great twists on classic American breakfast items. Everything we ordered was incredible- especially the banana nut muffin!  Our server (Manuela) was really hospitable, checking up on us often and making sure everything was ok. If you're in vegas GO TO THIS PLACE.

XrbbfBQ_XHGz41PM5hyIyA.text: Ive lived in Las Vegas about 3 months now and drive by here often and have always wanted to stop and try it.  Especially, after seeing all the amazing yelp reviews.  Unfortunately i wasn't very impressed.  There were a ton of people (as i expected) and my son and i only had to wait about 5 min., the entrance is horrible.  Seems like such a fire hazard to me....way to many people in and out and standing in the door way.    The seating was way too cramped for me.  But the waiter was right there and got our drinks right away.  Our food was brought out in great time.    Iam on a very strict diet, so i ordered whole wheat banana pancakes.  They were HUGE !!! but tasted like something i could have very well made at home.  My son had Mickey Mouse shaped pancakes with a fruit face and bacon mouth.  He loved that part but that was about it.  All in all it was 'ok'.....i may or may not go back....im reading about all the yummy stuff that my diet doesn't aloud perhaps on my next cheat day ill try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids Mickey shaped pancakes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whole wheat banana pancakes

djy3SLD9uQNqo18TGtFm_A.text: We were in vegas for the weekend heading to Mt Charleston looking for breakfast. This had great reviews and was crowded so we proceeded. They have great service but i am not a fan of tex-mex or southwestern food so i could not rate it higher.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lMyA6Y_dik6AWF_Tz9wL0w.text: BEST BREAKFAST EVER.  So good the wife and I went two days in a row during a recent visit to Vegas.   4 Star Breakdown from two days:  WAIT TIME: 4* Day 1 : Long ( We were told 15min , and it ended up being over 30min wait.)  Day 2 : Quick ( seated in about 5- 10 min. )  Food: AMAZING!!!! 5*  Service: 4* ( They have clever yellow / black eggs as signs that you need help)  Day 1 : Had a server by the name of Amanda, who ROCKED!!! She was the perfect      host, and made the experience great. (she gets 5 *+ )  Day 2: Never got the servers name( skinny preggo chick), she never came buy often, and when she did, she would completely forget about stuff we asked for. The guy next to us sat there for a good 20min before she took his drink order, and even longer to get him his meal. I had asked for a refill of water, and she seemed to bring water to everyone around us, except for me. The she abruptly brought us our bill that we had not asked for , while we were still eating, and didn't even ask if we wanted anything else. Oh yeah I still hadn't gotten my water, so I asked her again and finally as we were getting up to leave, she brought water.   Overall, This is a MUST when I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We left full and satisfied for not much money.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak scramble.  Best I&#39;ve ever had.

6Ze1M--t0wnu_8tCEWcTbw.text: This is definitely the place for breakfast or brunch in Las Vegas. Everything about it was spot on, starting with our server Karla. She was friendly and made us feel welcome. Her menu suggestions were teriffic! As everyone has already noted you must start with a banana nut muffin. They are moist and delicious. The coffee was rich and bold. They even leave the pot on the table for you so hot coffee is always at your fingertips. We shared the Carnitas breakfast burrito and the chicken fried steak skillet. Both were delicious! I don't think future trips to Vegas will ever be complete without stopping at The Egg and I.

_Bxp4-VrdshdF92AGEtYWQ.text: We absolutely ADORED this place! Everything was delicious. There was no wait & our server was on top of her game. We had a party of 5 & enjoyed corned beef hash, tostada bowl, omelettes, French toast & a few carafes of coffee. Their muffins are hot, moist and delicious & their salsa is amazing! I'm not sure what they do their potatoes, but best we ever had! Such a gem! We will be back as soon as we touch down in Vegas again.

JFVwJqFmbcmBX6nLjXKBrA.text: This was the ideal breakfast spot off the strip! We ordered the breakfast combo with pancakes, eggs, and sausage and the southwest skillet with chicken, chorizo, eggs and potatoes. They were delicious and the skillet was so filling I could not finish it! Reasonably priced for good breakfast food, and the staff was friendly. Will make this a go to breakfast place anytime we visit Vegas!

zZnKzQDHqg-RtX5V9aOtmw.text: The young waiter with the arm tattoo who looked like a young Art Garfunkel was awesome.   Good food. Exceptional service. We'll be back.

BUv9YHsfTm5tUYum1L7zKQ.text: For those who are super hungry and craving for eggs, this would be a good place.  This restaurant is packed even on a Monday morning. It sells every breakfast dish that has to do with eggs. We ordered Grandma's Biscuits & Gravy and Stuffed French Toast. Both tasted good and homemade.  Service was excellent (thanks Jessica!), portions are humongous, and price was reasonable.  Will definitely return if in the area again.

SYpSDF3hmmdT45DN2isT8A.text: rise and shine 702!  Thanks for all the wonderful yelp reviews~ I finally had my first experience at Egg & I this past Thursday.  My gf & I had breakfast around 11am. It was really crowded but there was only a 10 minute wait.  We ordered the croissant sandwich, I had mines with turkey sausage and fruits and she had hers with bacon and potatoes.   Service was great, food came out fast. Casual dining, indoor/outdoor seating, private lot. meal for 2 cost around $26.   I'll be back for more.  Egg & I makes my breakfast in 702 list! If you're looking to get your morning fix, stop by Egg & I!   -Miss Yelp 2011

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AqoB3gNbzvWy6MFLPl-gig.text: It took me a few trips to Egg & I over the years for the place to grow on me. I can finally say I'm officially a fan of this place after discovering their breakfast crepes. Can you say yum  The service is just all right and I always end up with a weirdly small fork compared to the rest of my party, haha.   All in all, a great little place for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brad&#39;s very special
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg crepe
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2qd2e3pn_EmDWmEfdxwjyA.text: Excellent biscuits & gravy (just ask for an extra side if you like it real saucy).  Fast & friendly service.  Definitely get the free muffin offer....very good as well.

jETV-QpAWGQXrCaOi8O0ZA.text: Food was so good! It's owned by the same people that run Egg Works around town. Food came out pretty quick. Had an omelet with potatoes and a banana nut muffin. All were really tasty. They have a dog friendly patio and it was a nice atmosphere out there.

b4TpEAfxRYGYMcV0w9mBQg.text: This place is not to be missed if you're looking for breakfast/brunch/lunch in Vegas. I had the Country Benedict, was good, gravy could've been thicker, but still good. My wife had the Gumbolaya, great!!! House potatoes had amazing flavor and the banana nut muffins were delicious. Wish there was one of these by me!! This will be on my must visit list from now on.

vF1kE4KldONC9JugV3tSmw.text: Karla, was our server and she is top notch!!!  As busy as the place is (Mothers Day) she is frequently checking on us to be sure we are happy. Everything is delicious and we'll all definitely be returning!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry...I couldn&#39;t wait.  I had to try it before taking this pic, it looked so good.

-t-znRi6WL4Tg9kxIUMZ-Q.text: Ok, This place is amazing. The muffins, no lie, the best. I couldn't put it down! (Actually ordered some to go) service was fast and friendly . Would definitely come back on my next visit to vegas!

UcVW5N4H3u0_QcoYqMebBw.text: Amazing and great food!!!!!! Stuffed French Toast a MUST!!!!!!!!! Wow came here from Hawaii this morning and an amazing way to start my Vegas trip!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin !!!!! #boom

GOjeZR3bQLdTQQSpjolnEg.text: This is the feed I've had on my month long trip around the country, fresh products, great service and it's cheap. Would definitely recommend.

5Rhz_ZzR39jrvNmIG3uDVA.text: Our server Oscar was awesome! Outstanding service & food! Our breakfast was delicious & portions generous.

tJJ3q711iiTmybWFlOy1qg.text: My new fave breakfast/brunch spot in vegas. Not on the strip but still not too far. Kind of a locals spot. They have really good omelettes and pancakes. Everything I tried was tasty. The servers are also quite courteous. Will go back whenever I'm in Vegas.

JKVJ3iBQ0kaX6UeMgar6XQ.text: First things first, I have to recognize our server, Amanda. She was, by far, the best server I've ever had. I'll be asking for her section next time we come here. My husband and I decided to come here, last minute, after seeing a picture of their Grandma's Biscuits and Gravy on google. While neither of us ordered that specific dish, we did order some delicious meals. My husband ordered the Original Breakfast Burrito which was absolutely amazing. I ordered the Chicken Enchilada Skillet. Oh my goodness... SO GOOD! I already can't wait for our next visit to Egg & I!!!

ywTNlFZOhO6awoHlLynLtA.text: Great food but best of all is Server Tabatha! Fantastic happy friendly service and spit on recommendations!

2SlVjWANSAP2YbadBZ1vdw.text: I am a breakfast fan and this place is great. Very busy during peak hours but the service is amazing even in the busy times. I highly recommend the omelet with mashed potatoes or the enchilada omelet. Great food!

1EDl589-GZmJBAXi0o_KGg.text: Tamara is the best! She is really helpful& energetic! She knows how to make her customers feel like they are getting taken care of! She also is really friendly!

lAP59HpFxoDcFSp0mtp-XQ.text: Excellent food!!!  Great price!!  HUGE portions!!  Thanks Carole Ann for the great service!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Page 2 of the menu!!

Y-FwKHLQ_ra-nMKfK5Bgpg.text: Banana nut muffin is probably the only thing I'd come back for. Service was great as well, but the breakfast was nothing that spectacular or out of the ordinary. I would definitely come again for the muffin though!

GaQDDdF1YVl9BjCBPgbv_w.text: Horrible food.   I ordered a veggie ommelet it was ok, the potatoes are nasty. they poured the whole bottle of seasoning all over and it was disgusting.  The service is not good either.  Don't waste your money there.

OoCxpp0lUSmbBWTFLzYwZw.text: Best breakfast place, best banana nut muffins and habla Diablo muffins. Tabatha gave the best customer service. Definitely coming back next time we're in Vegas.

9o7PtYSgtWXapK7DjsKGxA.text: Cute little restaurant!  The food was wonderful!! I highly recommend the cinnamon raisin French toast or the harvest pancakes!!

bVkstr2zb8MK07Frw0yMCQ.text: Good breakfast and service.  Our waitress was helpful and you can turn the egg card around when you need service as opposed to waving some waitress down.  Smart.  Meals were large and they immediate provide you with coffee and banana bread before your meal.  Don't get full on that though since their meals are very large and if you are tourist, you don't take leftovers.  It can get very crowded so go during off times.

RQBirDduFEBmVMNoVC8XdA.text: This place was amazing. We were greeted and sat outside within seconds. Service was excellent and included great recommendations by our server, Patrick. We will be back next time in Vegas.

06auYrbvZcNz1spDOo8qkA.text: Eggs and I just like Egg Works doesn't disappoint. The food is great and at a fair price. It is much better than having breakfast at a casino. Their portions are big so keep that in mind in case you want to share. Their staff is very friendly, especially our server Jessica. She was attentive and professional the entire time I was there.

BXOoRvRx1i7_Kj8mcWzlZg.text: I'm so happy I stopped in for brunch today.  I came in with a group of 7.  We were seated quickly  & our waitress, Bree, was awesome!  It was obvious that she loves her job.  Her friendly attitude had a big impact on our experience.  We felt very taken care of the whole time & the food was delicious all around.

9bU4MFptW_itbXHpFQsOHg.text: Prime rib Benny! beeeeeennnnnyy... benny and the jets... ha...  ok, for reals tho -   the GRUB: - check out my pics, my wife got the stuffed french toast with eggs and bacon, french toast, powdered sugar, and maple syrup - like the kitchen sink of breakfasts all in one bite... pretty good. - also pictured, i got the Prime Rib Benny - ala the meaty blackened spice prime rib, poached eggs, holandaise sauce, on top of an open faced buttered croissant like a traditional eggs benedict - but kicked upped... super filling and super delicious - fresh squeezed OJ and hot cups of Joe  the JOINT: - typical vegas locals crowd, a little bit of everyone - old school decor on the inside (like a country kitchen) - outside patio seating if not a scorcher of a desert day - they had an LCD with local sports and AC too  the SQUEEZE: - breakfasts are always too expensive to me, so im a little jaded... but anyways, those 2 dishes and fresh squeezed OJ = approx $50 after tax and tip - friendly wait staff and hostess - plenty of parking in the strip mall - vegas blvd (the strip) close  FINAL SAY: pretty good change up for breakfast, if youre starting to get tired of those casino buffet champagne brunches/breakfasts...

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib Benny. Yum.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French toast.

72KGoeR9zgwhGz4GYvdoAA.text: Great service! People are very friendly! And food is delicious!!!! The banana bread muffin is soooooo good!

i3tAmUCNh68QcqKGLlZoow.text: I love this place. You have amazing selection of eggs, i recommend eggs-plus. The muffins are terrific!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greatest breakfast for egg lovers. Ordered Eggs-Plus and did not regret it!

ziaQkNQdcl6Q6zrzWKwJ-g.text: Having read the reviews on Yelp, I just had to see for myself what all the fuss was about. Well, I'm a big breakfast guy, and this place more than lived up to its reputation. I went with the country fried steak, which had the perfect combination of crispy and tender. I'm more of a hash brown fan, but their cubed breakfast potatoes were very tasty. And I have to pay tribute to the banana nut muffin; I don't even like bananas, but this was fantastic. To top it all off, my server Staci was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. Highly recommended.

z0Hi5YoC1fjz8jysBJcRow.text: excellent customer service. very fast and friendly. staff here knows how to make customers happy: get them seated quickly, take orders right away, bring their checks early, and let them pay at the front when they're ready to go. no extraneous wait time so you can just sit, eat, and leave. food wasn't overly spectacular though. simple tasty meals with eggs utilized in creative ways, but nothing that really wow'd me

O9rLS8bEGixl9Z1dbZ64FQ.text: Great place for breakfast, the waiting list goes real fast, the food is awesome and my server Brady was always there when I needed something

0_22DoycTt-tBeCbJYl21A.text: I had the country Benny and it was awesome. Hubby had the piggy skillet and he said "lets add this place to our list of good breakfast." We will be back. We didn't realize they closed at 3p and got in about 2:50. They were nice and didn't rush us even through we were obviously keeping them open. I'm so glad we found this place.

YT4uYQcWZsDEfSc2Be7Xbg.text: I would say this place was pretty good! We waited about 10 minutes for any service once seated at our table. The place was packed and it was 1 p.m. on a Monday!  The average breakfast is about 10 bucks and 3 more for coffee. I would say sharing is a must!!! The omelets were super cheesy but tasty. The Cajun potatoes are awkwardly addicting. At first bite they taste over seasoned with cajun powder but by the end of it you will wish you had more. The banana nut muffin comes with your entree or free check in on foursquare. It's definitely not the best muffin int he world like others claim, but it is tasty. However, eat it hot or it might taste dry. And eat it with the butter then its perfection. Overall with sharing, free extra muffin, and two iced coffees and tip it was 23 dollars. Don't know if I will be back as there is too many other places to try.

cRZUyVg6UzOjOGDb51uAAQ.text: Great breakfast! I always struggle to find a breakfast meal that is healthy and not drowning in cooking oil like most omelette/egg restaurants. I had the veggie Benedict and it was delicious! Fresh spinach, sliced tomato and a perfectly ripe avocado..Jessica our server was great and I hope she wins the trip to Disney!

DXvOXohTZBWW5JJuhgPRAw.text: Had a coupon so we broke from our usual habit of hitting our neighborhood Omelet House and tried this place.  It's a winner!  Comfortable restaurant, friendly staff and great service.  And, oh, the food is really really good.  Prices a bit high but quality and portions are excellent.  My wife had the cheddar cheese omelet....it looked so pretty you almost didn't want to eat it.   Light, cheesy and oh so good.  Banana nut muffin equally good.  I had the piggy skillet....layered with potatos, ham, sausage, bacon and cheese, with a couple eggs on top.  Delicious.

xxEjRZYm3X5PUPRGBTaNzQ.text: Great egg, mushroom and cheese scramble.  Banana muffin yummy. Waitress, Janeen very bubbly!

LP10-2ah8plxI6MD9nyrJg.text: The stuffed French toast was amazing! 2 massive pieces with 4 eggs in each one. Big portion at a good price. Banana Nut muffins to die for. Came after breakfast so there was no wait.

jG63q_fNYiB0iui715VYRQ.text: Everything is great but for some reason I just don't care for their coffee. HUGE servings that I usually had to save for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast

F8KJvFKjQr2xDV1QrLTlvA.text: As always "Breakfast for Champions" with Karla the amazing, attentive & vivacious waitress!!!

Q-RXFMG1biLnadUAajzBvw.text: I tried the Banana bread french toast because I like banana bread but it didn't do it for me. The bread tasted good all by itself but the french toast didn't make it. Wish I had ordered breakfast burrito my friend had ,now that was good. Took a small bite. I will give four stars because all my friend's food was very good. Yes  I sampled lil bit. service was good and the place was clean. good to go I will be back.

TDue1A-xOKo0fxQbPNoIrg.text: Carole Ann did a great job!! Love me the eggs Benedict.. She served me with a smile and attention. What a perfect way to start my Monday!

I1g5_ep9e9lEjud-TfitRg.text: Eggcellent food, had the chicken enchilada omelette, delicious!  Ask for Darla to be your server, she provides Excellent customer service, keeps you updated , is very warm and friendly, makes you feel very much at home amid the busyness of the place. I would definitely patronize this establishment again when in Vegas.

Hph3ws_881XwlpxnYoCbww.text: Literally the best breakfast ever!! Raul brought us a to die for muffins for being first time customers.. He also had excellent customer service.. AGAIN BEST BREAKFAST EVER.

LCe6w5cYicsV8UvE9IURmg.text: Server's name was Ulises. I wish you luck in winning your Disneyland trip for 2. I love the idea of flipping a sign from happy face to sad face and your server will come over. Very creative. Portions were large. Price was reasonable. I got a veggie skillet with two eggs. BF got the French toast stuffed with Omelette. The banana muffin was yummy too.

m0IDtqxtai7KZPSf1Bn0ng.text: Just for reference, I don't write 5 star reviews unless they're very well deserved.  But this place consistently rates high with us.  This was out third visit.  We recently visited Egg & I for breakfast with a group of six.  We arrived about 10:30 in the morning.  There was a considerable waiting line.  However, the hostess was very sweet and efficient. The estimated 20 minutes wait was actually more like 10 minutes.  Our waitress (sadly I didn't get her name) was incredible, attentive without being overbearing, quick and efficient.  Once our orders were taken, the food arrived fairly quickly, no mistakes or wrong items.  We pretty much all ordered something different.  I had the house made (not canned) corn beef hash and eggs.  Excellent.  Can't remember what everybody had but all raved about their food. Avoid the strip with it's lines and cheesy buffets and overpriced breakfasts and check this place out.  Just a short drive from the strip.  Mostly locals and a few visitors.  A gem!

tetjIB8lpsczZoyAJYid-Q.text: Yum! Great food, homey atmosphere, pleasant service, good price for large portion... definitely coming back here. The banana muffin was super... and my omlete-crepe love child... who knew!

YyjctvmrlObCTGJSB5DEWg.text: Eggs Benedict was delicious! Loved the banana nut muffin... Must get if you eat here!

7OALJ-poM_E8MXFqzvr7Qg.text: Great breakfast food for your typical breakfast joint. Awesome service and a lot of options. You can even get the potatoes gluten free, which was nice when with somebody who has gluten allergies. Very accommodating and nice. Highly recommend!!! We had Tamara as our waitress. It was her first day at this location and we were blown away with how great she was.

OzZD-f0STYGN-nmu4BiHzA.text: 5 Stars for service!  Especially Amanda who is so sweet!    For the food, I give it 3 stars, for good not great.   However I did order something unusual and perhaps the other dishes are better.  I ordered a Hawaiian dish that was supposed to have sticky white rice, but it was just ordinary white rice.  The pancakes were a little under cooked.

CEdGni_PJbpXKeqyMAaGDQ.text: Highlights: Their banana nut muffins and kay's special omelette were excellent!  full of flavor and large portions. The prices were reasonable, expect $8-$13 for most dishers.  Coffee was bleh, but my friends enjoyed their O.J. with pulp.  While the service crew were very friendly and helpful, I did see some flaws: When coffee was served, we weren't given creamer or teaspoons.  We had to wait about 30 minutes for our food after ordering.  Plus, I witnessed one of the waiters spill ice cold water on a customer. Yikes!  Food: 4 Service: 3

n4qoSq9hx1BETT_qQQ-Ytg.text: Great service, fast food, great taste and atmosphere is great....(the restaurant is a pokestop which i love) Liza, our server, definitely made my vacation start off beyond great.  I would definitely recommend

oBL_46rvOAAolrYeIVrC8A.text: Amazing place, really busy on Sunday's but there really quick on getting people in.  Our server Breeannda, was super attentive.  Great food and great service!!!  Will defiantly be back.

OeMNMfZargqrNS1UV9S9Ag.text: This place is a a a amazing I had there omelet and muffin omgeee the muffin were the best thing going. Bomb.com loved it I will Def recommend.

TXXj40O7kL7GYV7OeodUjA.text: Wandering over to this side of Las Vegas,  I finally found a place in town that serves Cincinnati chili. Weird that it is a place known for a great breakfast!  Liza really made us feel welcome, and she was cheerful and efficient,  a rare combination in Vegas. We also ordered the chili relleno omelet, which was fantastic. Definitely worth a visit.

zqPv4zeTnqpvjD1NiaRLyg.text: This place is by far the best breakfast/lunch restaurant in Vegas...great quality food and service was amazing! The staffs works as a team to make sure you have everything you need! Highly recommend!!

FyET6BJP7QYwEIQv4FCJWQ.text: I Love the Egg and I!!! Everything I have tried is delicious but I love the fender benders part of menu also Karla is pretty awesome!!!

RkgL_Z2MNu8ZBigtXDbTFQ.text: Food was crazy good and service was exceptional. Our server Amanda was extremely helpful. Her smile seriously made everyone's day.

315m6uMO6EKMjeK-1WL1EQ.text: Came here for the first time today. Our server Carole Ann was in a word awesome.  My wife got the Cabo burrito and it was huge and quite delicious. The ranch potatoes were heavenly, and superbly seasoned.  I got the plain buttermilk pancakes, and they brought out not one but 3 pancakes the size of a dinner plate.  I'm a big guy, and was no match for the giant fluffy elliptical yummyness.  All in all a great place to eat.

EpH-DZya85V_1DhED7GfnA.text: My friends and I were in Vegas and looking for a great breakfast spot. I ended up finding this place and must say, AMAZING!! Great service and yummy yummy food... Well worth it.

oZwYD7vlk6VVhdcHpWRGqQ.text: We are on vacation here and just tried out this place. This is amazing !! The avocado omelette was ridiculously good. Our server Karla was the nicest ! I would definitely recommend checking this place out if anyone needs a great breakfast spot :)

tvdKwy6YVoZ3z-aLbnr5FA.text: I really enjoyed this place! Great food and service! I ordered the fiesta skillet with chorizo, amazing!

8NzhzpRjNv8gBBZmCG46BA.text: Bacon and avocado!! This place is fantastic.  WARNING: It is usually busy. While the staff does a great job of managing their tables and seating, expect to wait. It is just that popular.

4nfKi9nFa1g_erEl8D3dsw.text: Great place for Sunday brunch.  Good food, fast service. The banana nut bread is delicious. It's busy but they move quickly so the wait isn't that long.

I_BAFHvMl_ViBIcuOQeQ2w.text: Great place to get a hot fresh breakfast! You get a lot of food for your money! I will be coming back here, every time that I visit Las Vegas! "MUST TRY"

FgiGQgz48sbunBYkgLn1ZA.text: Used to be my favorite place, now i'll never return :(. The service was fine but there was a hair in my skillet and I got food poisining as well. So disappointed as I used to love this spot but I have no tolerance for a dirty restaurant.

KZCN3zf8loPf5rNRYHkk4Q.text: Erin was an awesome server. She helped my husband pick his new favorite meal. We love eating here. My daughter had a waffle

3EuojpcQqlWGYPgAbrfpsQ.text: LOVE this place! My friend turned me on to this "off-strip" gem on my bday.  Great menu, fast service and fairly cheap prices. LARGE portions so maybe split your breakfasts!

3TgjbKtFJ7o-G1Ny4V7fPw.text: Yummy with a dog friendly patio, friendly service and great value! Hubby didn't like the omelette he selected (the Mexican omelette) but the carb free option for sides saved the meal. We always measure how good a place is based on our return to the establishment - we will be back!!!

-QG2C83lcUtASbsdKLRIMg.text: Great restaurant. Consistently good food.  Especially wonderful service by Rachael. ;^)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonderful Rachael at Egg &amp; I. Smiles and caring. Great waitress. ;^)

zGhIvqKspawdN683ERjl4w.text: Paula is absolutely the Best customer service professional I have ever run into. Having recently myself joined the customer service industry it is extremely Refreshing to see people that care about their employees. This place is highly recommended and I can see why. I ordered the works veggie Benny while there and it came out perfectly cooked as it should. The veggies looked fresh and the plates were extremely clean with ample size of food. I tend to like my eggs a little more on the medium done so I politely asked Paula if they could just put my plate in the microwave just to cook it a little bit because I didn't necessarily want a new order. In an attempt to maintain the perfect service that this place is known for, Paula listened intently to my concern and did something I did not expect she offered to have them prepare a new half Benedict which is what I had remaining versus simply warming up what I had. I was extremely touched by this. Thank you so much Paula for making my experience in Vegas a great one. She also agreed to take a photo of me while I was at the restaurant having my breakfast. She is truly a model of what great customer service should be and I applaud this lady for her natural caring skills. Bravo Paula and kuddos to you Eggs & I for not just great food in great portions but great staff as well. I will definitely be back!

WgDVKmG5ijh4DEgjYKqGZQ.text: Delish!!!! Our server Oscar went out of his way (or maybe that's just his daily excellent service) to make sure we were satisfied with our orders. The Yelp reviews did not disappoint. The food was delicious, and we returned the next morning again before leaving Las Vegas. Soooo much better than the hotel buffets. We were lucky there no was wait, and the menu was varied. Did I already say delicious? We'll be back, totally recommend The Egg & I for a great meal.
