Jk8elXJPJM9dS4HzMHoW4w.text: Everything is good here. Go here everytime im at vegas because it's cheap and delicious.  I've had the avocado sour cream omelette and the country fried steak skillet. Both are amazing  service is good as well

aWL7GTtVvbB_7gBEf0Fv3Q.text: Seriously the best breakfast in Las Vegas! Patrick is the best server he made us feel like family. I wish we had a restaurant Iike this in California.

VZvbD0rjx0ufCotBFWnN5g.text: Food is exceptionally delicious, friendly service and a warm welcoming. I'd recommend to anyone and everyone!

0hkcHvTVEcpZtt-35W19DA.text: Awesome food! You get note than enough for the price. Also Kyle was our server and not only was he great and attentive, but easy on the eyes too.  we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u9p8P3jpOzvKvlbNGcY1Vw.text: My husband and I visit Las Vegas pretty regularly and wanted to try a restaurant the locals patronize for a change. It was really busy when we arrived but the wait wasn't too terrible. We were seated inside, and it was really bustling.  With our Yelp check-in, we each received a free banana nut muffin, which was REALLY tasty. I ordered the Vegetarian Benedict (with bacon) and my husband ordered the Biscuits and Gravy and Blueberry Pancakes. My Benedict was really, really good, but I will say their hollandaise is seriously lacking in lemon juice. It didn't seem like an authentic hollandaise at all, but it tasted good. They know how to poach an egg beautifully, which made up for the sauce. The breakfast potatoes that come with every entree are very flavorful and crispy. My husband really liked his biscuits & gravy (he said the biscuits were very light and fluffy), but the pancakes were a huge bust for both of us. They were way too dense - the texture was pretty awful. I'm assuming that's how all their pancake batter is, so I'd hard pass on pancakes there.  It was fun to venture off the Strip, but we'll probably stick with breakfast elsewhere in the future. HOWEVER, they offer an extremely generous military discount of 30%, which we appreciated. We didn't even ask for it, but when I opened my wallet, she noticed my military ID and offered it up.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits &amp; Gravy, Blueberry Pancakes, Vegetarian Benedict (I had bacon added)

vusZaWqRjUC9FkkSVMeb8g.text: We came to Vegas for Spring Break and for a Basketball Tournament.  Looking to escape the casino for breakfast I Googled "the best breakfast in Vegas". The Egg and I came up a winner!    Place was busy for a Tuesday morning.  Service was prompt with only a short wait to be seated.  I had a two egg chile relleno omelette. It was delish!  I chose to get fruit instead of potatoes.  My husband got potatoes with his chicken fried steak and eggs.  The potatoes were yummy and perfectly spiced.  The fruit I had was all fresh sliced pineapple, grapefruit, honeydew and cantaloupe. The fruit combination was a perfect complement.    Kids ate mouse pancakes, one with chocolate chips the other without.  Both kids said they were better than my homemade!    Coffee comes in a carafe to the table.  Took what was left in a to go cup.  :-)  Service was very good.  Our server was "Karen." She was super friendly, patient/understanding with kids ordering, and very attentive.

NiMBkiT7giySLyR35aHtTA.text: Had time for breakfast before leaving Vegas and decided to give this place a try!  The food alone I would rate a 4 but the overall experience was easily a 5.  We had the beef hash, eggs Benedict florentine, New York steak, and veggie omelette. Nothing really to note on each item, all were satisfying and enough to fill us up.  We were seated immediately upon arrival. Our waitress took our drink orders and came back quickly to take the rest.  Food was prompt and I was asked right before the food was brought out if I would like Tabasco or any other sauces with my food. I did.  Oh. And they gave us an extra banana nut muffin because only 3 of our meals came with one. (Party of 4)  Great experience! Will return

8x3XTf6mi7SIKdC3S8HZog.text: Comfort food away from the pricey options on the strip.  Everything was delicious except the Mexican omelette we ordered was kind of a mess because it was a bit over cooked.  Other than that, it was a great breakfast and I'll come back to try some of the other items on their huge menu.

PBTlHlYIWmMaLqOBhG5s9A.text: Karla came through quickly. Was friendly and upbeat. Made great suggestions. Love the atmosphere, music, and food.  The banana nut muffin is to die for.  Will definitely make this my go to spot when in Vegas.

9NsniRAQgXXjvqVQebrqDw.text: Love this place!  Old school all day breakfast spot and more.   Emily was a delightful server.  Had my usual Hawaiian breakfast and my hubby his gravy covered yumminess...  Their banana  muffins are soooooooo good.  They'd be 5  were it that the butter not frozen & all the outside seats were covered. Don't go if your in a rush... But,  if you've the time try them  yum yum yum it up!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum Hawaiian  style... Mahalo!

6Smdm93Xzs9LJwCTOgX0nw.text: I love eggs. I love egg jokes. And I also love a great Eggs Benedict.   They delivered! I ordered the Florentine out of desire for something a little more healthy. The food was great as expected, but the food alone didn't make the experience!   Our waitress was amazing. She anticipated our needs before we even noticed something was missing (sauces even before the food came out), and even offered me a free muffin because the rest of the party had received one with their meals whereas I had not. (The banana nut muffin is amazing)   I left feeling eggcellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Benny!

nU6nA8dabUrQHSopMzfkHg.text: Get ready for an eggcellent time (sorry, I couldn't help myself). The menu is extensive, especially for first timers. Egg & I has perfected its mastery of anything egg, and we are thankful. The side of potatoes that usually comes with dishes is no less of a star, as is the delicious banana bread muffin. Service is wonderful and everyone who works there hustles with joy. If you're a local, make this your local.

5fOZtePqQxt1CkuSUv3w1Q.text: we come here once a month for breakfast w the family. food and service is always good. price is reasonable and so are the portions.

xS8gI0buznIZr2aooBMD_Q.text: Excellent breakfast! Not being from here we asked for a recommendation for breakfast that was not in a casino. Will definitely comeback on our next visit!!

Qpv6mlk14RmboUnUotGxIA.text: So glad to have found this gem! The wait wasn't too long on a Friday afternoon. Everyone was friendly from the host to our server. I can't remember his name, but he gave excellent recommendations on the food. We had the Crazy Chicken omelette, Hawaiian French toast, and the Traditional Benny. ALL WERE DELICIOUS! I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We had the Crazy Chicken omelette, Hawaiian French toast, and the Traditional Benny. ALL WERE DELICIOUS!

rOmV88uSE6VesJX-luZ9nQ.text: Solid place for breakfast favorites. Got the corned beef hash which was ok. Not the best. The breakfast potatoes were solid though and the service was top notch!

1OQFyiosX0-UcDECaNGwPg.text: The Egg & I is off the strip but the drive took less than 15 minutes. It was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and enjoy a fantastic breakfast! We got to the restaurant around 8:30 AM on a Sunday and didn't have to wait for a table. The place started filling up soon after and we looked to be the only non-locals there.  We ordered the Three Pigs Omelette and Works Veggie Benny to share. Both come with a huge helping of their Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes. I love fried potatoes so I inhaled all of mine, which was a nice little accomplishment because the plates was huge and the potatoes took up half the plate! If you order an omelette, you also get a choice of toast or their famous homemade banana nut muffin. We read reviews and perused photos beforehand so of course we chose the muffin. You also get a free muffin with Yelp check-in so be sure to do so!  The banana nut muffins here are everything you could ever want in a muffin. Moist, fluffy, flavorful, and warm--they blow all other muffins I have ever had way out of the water. My mouth is watering as I write because they are THAT good.   The Three Pigs Omelette was stuffed with diced ham, bacon, and sausage and topped with cheddar and jack cheese. It was good but we should have ordered something more exciting. The menu here is extensive but our waitress kind of rushed us to order. I am guessing she's used to local patrons who order quickly. The Works Veggie Benny was incredibly satisfying. The hollandaise sauce was as egg-ceptional as the menu claims and the combination of the sauce with the fresh spinach, grilled tomatoes, sliced avocado, and perfectly poached eggs was spot-on!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut Muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Three Pigs omelette
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Works Veggie Benny

2EKPNzGrEy6mvTdB02MzwA.text: Finally a breakfast place in Las Vegas, that feels like a hometown restaurant! Service was outstanding, the atmosphere, although busy, was comfortable. They have a model train that scoots all around the ceiling of the restaurant, pretty cool for anyone to see. The menu is exactly what you want for breakfast for sure. The eggs Benedict I had was amazing and the hollandaise was made from scratch. It is off the beaten path, so worth taking an Uber or Lyft to. We walked back to the strip from the restaurant. It is definitely a walk in the heat, but there are other casinos  on the way back.

3FgG8rpBJqqA7rPzN1mrsA.text: Well, apparently the locals really like this breakfast spot. None of us in our party really got the hype. The hubby ordered French toast. He wanted it on regular old white bread, which they accommodated.  It looked normal on one side, but the other side was really different looking. Like a solid dark brown.  The hubby also ordered biscuits and gravy.  The gravy was really dark and very sausage-y.  I ordered the breakfast burrito with fruit. It was OK.  My grandson had a cute little kids pancake. The place stayed busy while we were there...we just didn't think the food was that good. We had a friendly server who was attentive, as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Both sides of the French toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids pancake
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito and fruit

G6ONnVV7ewp6FzI-4KRQrw.text: We got the steak benedict, pokchops, crepes and the french toast.The banana nut muffin is a really nice touch. Food is hearty and good, and Lacey took care of us really well! We'll definitely come back next time we're in town. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iY8hJ6M-jjaZbHgrxmI8Dg.text: During our visit to Vegas we wanted to do breakfast off the strip.  My brother in law found this good spot that the locals go to. We arrived around 9am.   They have outdoor seating available so we opted to get a table on their outdoor patio. We were seated right away with no waiting time.   The menus offered a variety of breakfast options.  Upon first checking in on yelp, I got a free banana nut muffin offer. The waitress went ahead and honored my free muffin but she also brought one out for everyone one else to try since it was our first time there.   Dave and I ordered the country fried steak, 2 eggs and home fries. We also ordered a side of pancakes.   Overall food and service was good.  Check out the pics.  Nice little breakfast place.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak and eggs were good
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes were good but thicker than Dave typically prefers.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin was nice and moist.

La6Tv2XWdalMrY8qvMRtOg.text: Worst breakfast restaurant we've been to. Seriously. Amazingly busy tho! 2 stars for the train that runs around atop the restaurant. And the electronic way to pay.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bland food. Doesn&#39;t even look appetizing.

X4GnKXEvfQN12d3JTXziCA.text: This place is clean and the staff are outstanding! I didn't like the food, the way they prepared my omelette, they finely chopped the ingredients of the omelette in the egg cooked solid and then folded over. If not for the abundance of salt (way too much) it wouldn't have any taste. (Think Salty Cardboard) The biscuit and gravy looked great, again so salty, literally made it inedible. Sorry for the bad review but your food is not good, please get a new cook.

XrKPgO6FmtiW-kqCI0Dr_w.text: I've been here twice to sit down and eat and this last time, we ordered some food to go and still were not disappointed. We were first introduced to Egg & I a few years ago when we were just about to depart Las Vegas to head home to California. We saw the many positive reviews and were very impressed! This establishment has the homey feel with servers who are friendly to customers like family. The unfortunate thing is that sometimes there will be a long wait especially during rush breakfast/brunch hours.  Parking: Located in a huge parking lot with other establishments. I don't remember it to be very difficult at all.  We ordered the Santa Cruz Burrito that includes a side of the Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes ($11.75). We liked this burrito, but unfortunately at that time, it wasn't something we were in the mood for. I think we wanted something like a bacon burrito, which is what we will order next time. However, we thoroughly enjoyed the Eggworks Breakfast Sandwich with bacon ($10.99) that also included the Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes. This sandwich was exactly what we were craving! I think we would definitely want to order this again in the future. In addition, the Habla Diablo potatoes hit the spot... they were cut up into small squares and perfectly crunchy and spicy. I would want to get another side of these potatoes just because!

6PsG6lvoFia5hAQxfWKufA.text: Very popular breakfast stop amongst locals, I am a little confused as to why visiting for the very first time.  Items ordered were the Crazy chicken and the Island Favorite. The Crazy Chicken has shredded chicken, guacamole, mushrooms, and a ridiculous amount of Meunster cheese and sour cream. I could not finish it all. The chicken was under seasoned and guacamole tasteless... It was a cheese show for sure. Not that I have anything against cheese, but what should have been the star of the show was the under study in this dish.  The Island Favorite is all the Hawaiian goodies, Portuguese sausage, a Ham steak, pineapple, rice, and eggs served to order. The sausage seems to always be the barometer in these dishes as to being authentic and what brands of sausage are popular in Hawaii. The taste was consistent with this and also was grilled well and crispy.  I am not opposed to going back, but I won't be rushing.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Chicken omelette. Need more chicken less Muenster cheese!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian breakfast. Portuguese sausage on point!

-kBELhp8KcZKh-LaOz93Tg.text: Ahh who doesnt love breakfast!!! Came here to this spot while in Vegas and left so fulll and satisfied like an animal! I recommend checking in thru yelp and get that banana nut muffin. Blueberry pancakes were sooo good and everything was perfect from the service to the quality. I will be back whenever im in vegas. Got some sides of toast avocado bacon ahh left this spot satisfied and thicccccc

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Pancakes Sliced Avocado Side of Toast the list goes on
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nut Muffin mmhmmmmm use that yelp check in

iPifgBWNdvaRAr_758RoTw.text: Best breakfast place EVER! Kelli was such a great waitress and very attentive throughout our meal. She really topped off our first experience here. The price was very reasonable! I highly recommend and would come again. I loved the food and the service was great, I left stuffed and happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEAUTIFUL

B6Nqyd7ZKgBLoNQCaWEXEA.text: Food: they give their first visit customers a free banana nuts muffin ( which is really delicious)  Also the food in general was great.   Place: it's a bit crowded and noisy with a lot of kids but I mean it's a place for breakfast no one is going there for a romantic dinner so for me it was ok.   Service: I forgot her name but she was an old lady with smile on her face the whole time  And she was really nice and makes jokes and laugh a lot, which made our day more cheerful.   Price: prices are fair compared to the quality and service.   Would recommend the place

LUnRuIlJmz3gZe8tjN9o4A.text: Went here to grab a quick brunch before starting off the day in Vegas! There were a lot of positive reviews on Yelp, plus who doesn't love cute eggs! The parking lot had a lot of space, so finding a spot is nothing to worry about.   Upon entering, the place was EXTREMELY packed. We had to wait quite a bit, but this wasn't a problem at all. Although I do wish there were more chairs indoors so other people could sit down while waiting in the front area of the restaurant. After being seated we were given menus which were creatively in newspaper form, so it was like we were reading our morning newspaper while waiting for breakfast!   Everyone at the table ordered some freshly squeeze orange juice after being questioned by the waiter. In addition, I ordered a crepe and a strawberry french toast. The orange juice and crepe was nothing special, but the sauce definitely was delicious and spiced up the meal 1000%. However, THE BANANA MUFFIN was something else. It was soft, warm and delicious (probably the best part of the meal).   Overall the food and service was pretty good, this place is a very cute breakfast place and definitely worth a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe and potatoes! The sauce was delicious

Jxq5dZWeqLs_iSBsHJtJKQ.text: This place is so good. Honestly, you can't go wrong. I could eat here all the time. I went with a group of 4 and everyone loved their food.   If you check in, you get a free banana muffin.   only downside, if you have a vegan friend, they definitely can't eat here with you unless they feel like eating a side of avocado.

PYKGYOrLuc3eXobcFm0nhQ.text: We visited the Egg &I for breakfast there was a decent crowd, we were seated and served quickly.       Dishes we ordered were the stuffed French Toast which was great and the best presentation I've ever seen for French Toast and the egg/carnitas breakfast burrito. Both entrees were  well prepared and flavorful! They were accompanied by small fried potatoes which were just ok.  The service was good, the place was clean,  the entree's were fabulous- I would visit Egg & I again and recommend it for couples or small groups!

lT9yMEOhIxofw3L4CSvK4A.text: What can I say? We were in the mood for breakfast and this place delivered. The coffee was great and so was the service! I ordered the spinach eggs Benedict with the sauce on the side and let me tell you the hollandaise sauce is so good! The Ham in the Benedict was a little too salty for my taste. Everything was good. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut muffin
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of eggs &amp; turkey sausage
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach eggs Benedict

6NNQbkSYOqQ_aSXQZS63JA.text: Best diner in town, this place is top notch in their structure is very professional and organized.   Honestly the best local spot in town. Would recommend it to all passerby's who want a local flavor. Their pricing is much better than the strip. Happy eating!

9OXd2OSDKDZxo1RQOm4qNw.text: Something wrong with an egg place that can't cook a simple over medium egg and brings it to you runny during a time when they were not busy or pancakes that were not cooked through. The potatoes are deep fried and so laden with seasoned salt they were inedible. I'm not all that picky but this breakfast was horrible. The only reason they got more than one star is the waiter was nice and polite. I would not recommend this place.

EDxDl7_CGSyC8VoGwLkV5Q.text: Food here is good, if you're looking for a True american breakfast this is the place to go, but beware if you are really hungry the wait for a table can be long, of course has to do with the fact that food has great taste.   I ordered the veggie omelet with cheese on top and a side of potatoes, it was a delicious breakfast, portions are big, but quality of food tastes great.   The reason of my rating is service, may be was because it was at a busy hour, but everything took longer than usual, we were sitting for like 15 min when finally a waitress came to hour table, I had to ask for a fork 3 times (didn't have the usual silverware with a napkin when I arrived).   But other than that food is good! I would recommend this place for breakfast I think is worth the wait if you're not that hungry and have time.  Great for everyone!   -Spanish:  Si estas en busca de un tradicional desayuno americano, esta es una gran opcion para probar, pero si tienes mucha hambre fijate bien cuales son las horas ocupadas por que para una mesa podras esperar un buen rato, claro todo esto debido a que la comida tiene un gran sabor!   Mi orden fue un omelet vegetariano con queso arriba y una guarnicion de papas. Las porciones son bastas y el sabor delicioso.   La razon de mis 4 estrellas se debio al servicio de mi experiencia. Todo tardaba mucho desde que nos sentamos la mesera tomo 15 min para apenas a cercarse a preguntar que queriamos de beber, cuando por fin llego la comida, tuve que pedir 3 veces cubiertos ya que al llegar no estaban como normalmente los cubiertos envueltos en una servilleta, y la mesera olvidaba. Tal vez esto paso debido a que era una hora ocupada.   Pero en resumen la comida es buena, si recomiendo este lugar para desayuno! y como tip solamente pregunten que horas son las ocupadas, pero si tienes tiempo y tu apetito puede esperar entonces cualquier hora es buena!  Perfecto para toda la familia!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YVApjCkeBQt-T_W6c4yQMA.text: The food is always good here and the service is awesome as well. We had Lacey as our server today and she was on top of it! Come here for awesome food, bonus points if you end up with Lacey as your server like we did!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back again. Yum!

ctJNvFO6_kTSpOIIIQdWyw.text: Great breakfast, reasonably priced, wait staff was super nice. Definitely would recommend

EaQaWEN9TOF2AOyinvRPCA.text: The food was good down-home cooking and we enjoyed every bite.  Beware, the portions are HUGE when you order a breakfast skillet ... big enough for two to share.  Our server Alexa was super friendly and she made us feel right at home!

TVtPZ0RblJwE_lFLqgiJJQ.text: I love brunch and there are wonderful savory and sweet options!  This place gets packed and for very good reason! The line is always out the door. But, the line moves quickly and is worth the wait.  Tip: Not conveniently on the strip, but I would head there on the way to Vegas or when you are heading back home.  Everything we tried was really good, so I don't feel like you can go wrong! Perhaps share entrees so you can try more of all the goods.

ZJZoV8wF7OA8QNnzKhrS9Q.text: Great food. Had the orig. breakfast burrito with sour cream and salsa. Great! Got it out fast too and it was busy!

wRe4gK8pLJPAIcr-X9VePA.text: Emily, our server was excellent from start to finish. Offering drinks as soon as we walked in. Took our order promptly once we were ready and checked on us a fair amount of time to make sure everything was good. On top of that, her personality and kindness was a plus. Thanks Emily for the service and thank you Eggs & I for the good breakfast.

MWAZuJ68wLugNOnF6EhrpA.text: The one thing I love about this place is the fact that it's off the strip, and it serves up the classic homey style feel, rather than the over-glamorized you would expect in Vegas. Yeah you come this city hoping to escape into another reality, but it's nice to come down from the clouds once in a while.  The one thing I have to admire is there amazing variety of amazing egg selections. I Decided on going with their Chile Relleno Omelette, which was on the money, but their Banana Nut Muffin is THE thing to get.   Listen, if you feel like wondering off the strip for some good home eatin', why not here??

FDrceDZ3f9QD8CduAIGVEA.text: This was the best breakfast food I've ever had before. I ordered the biscuits and gravy and the taste was phenomenal.  They gave me more potatoes than I needed (which is good). THEY TASTED SO GOOD. My whole family had clear plates. Also the service was excellent! Happy egg/Sad egg was a brilliant idea. Great restaurant.

dOTIgCjvO78t9N8hqmGmKg.text: Banana Nut muffin was the best. Had Traditional Bennett as really good. Our server Maggie was great. When in Vegas will be in again.

l4FwE0Ys62ULWi1Rdq0QVQ.text: Visiting Las Vegas for the weekend and saw that this place had some pretty great reviews. People weren't kidding, it's FANTASTIC. Our server was Liza and she was SO attentive, kind, and helpful. True definition of a great waitress. Everyone's plate was clean at the end of breakfast. I was very impressed with this place and will definitely seek it out again when I'm back in Vegas.

Xv5j6feyM-MbIxmN7pVWRg.text: Great food and our server Linnea was really nice and helpful! I ordered the chicken cordon bleu scramble and it was delicious! We will be back.

DykSotMaSCuRthWWy7CKcQ.text: I was surprised at the businesses business. I must say the banana nut muffins are very delivious! Theyre service was pretty good! The potatoes seasoning was great too an not the most exspensive spot. Its a must try!

BD_4wM7JNhiZtfDKJ_Gv6w.text: Best omelette I've ever had in my life, and the free banana nut muffin for checking in is amazing as well. Thank you guys for the outstanding food, and service. I'll always come here for breakfast whenever I'm in Las Vegas.

nT-LkDOZxSMXwrEBmb7nUg.text: This place was just OK.  If I am going to give a breakfast place more than three stars,  I should be wowed.  Everyone looking for a solid Breakfast should still go here, but if you are looking to be knocked off your feet: this is not the place.

sgZpP7GEKgVeJrGTydEwmQ.text: Thank you so much Alexa for your service you did an amazing job on serving us and being concerned on our order we hope to come back and have you as our server again.

GsGfj9F8OHdR95p9wHSPyw.text: Food was great while the service was so-so. I had the French toast with blue berries and bananas while my friend had the strawberry filled French toast. Both were extremely delicious and we cleaned our plates without hesitation. By checking in on Yelp we were also provides a banana flavored muffin which was a great appetizer to our meals. Definitely recommended to those looking for a good breakfast after a long night in Vegas!

3Wmv4L2jLkqwB4ga-DDU_A.text: A must stop at egg and I when I'm in Vegas! Best banana nut muffin, pumpkin pancakes and any skillet you get. Also the burgers here are amazing. Great service .

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best pumpkin pancakes ever! Melt in your mouth like  butter

CnRWAfB3D6xEduUHJ8B-NQ.text: Exceptional!! From the minute we walked in until the minute we left. Amanda was our server and I would have to put her in out top 5 best experiences with a server. She was very sweet but very quick, efficient, and attentive. Definitely a great asset to the company. I don't normally post reviews but it is people like her that deserve recognition so I promised the general manager that I would do this. Great job Amanda!

z8WulFY-HxSH2Or-KbXM_A.text: Sat outside, but the misters and shade made it all work.  I had the Country Benny, which was really biscuits, sausage patty, eggs and gravy in a boat, with their Diablo potatoes.  In our group, loco moco, chile relleno omelette and country fried steak were popular.  Service was nice and efficient.

vdMvKSxCZ1aGxf8DEQnUNg.text: This is one of the restaurants we do breakfast at every other Sunday after church. Always pleasant, food is always fresh and hot, and our coffee. Endless just how we love it!!

u5sjoChIcTjps0lYKp30mQ.text: I guess you wouldn't come here if you were looking for something healthy. Everything here is pretty heavy. I'm usually quick with my selection because I know what I want, but it was the opposite this time and now I know it's because I was hungover. I opt for a chilli omelette because I wanted more protein and it was decent for under $10, came out exactly how I expected a chili omelette to be. I'm not a fan of potatoes but the house potatoes were nice and crispy! We had a big group of 10+ and they quickly sat us outside in the patio! It was a relaxing breakfast : )

tDJhzgZCRCPM5xoj7MXrRQ.text: I would eat here a thousand times again! The wait to be seated wasn't too bad for a busy Sunday morning. The menu is huge, it was so hard to choose from and the food came out freakishly fast. Everything was so fresh and deliciously seasoned and we got the free banana nut muffin and it was TO. DIE. FOR. idk how they did it, I ended up ordering another muffin to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huuuuuge menu!! So excited

Tr3PwfXoYyVSKuOaOuFTFw.text: Last day in Vegas I pulled this little gem up on Yelp, I was very pleased!  Our server Kelly was totally awesome, her attitude was wonderful, very upbeat and attentive.   There were four of us, so we all ordered something different and each dish was delish!  I love veges, so I selected the Sundance omelette and added the chicken... OMG The mashed potato omelette was interestingly good as well as the egg benny with pulled pork (don't remember the name).   I was pleased that the blueberry pancakes had real juicy plump berries and were huge!  I am definitely making this place my breakfast go to when in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farewell Vegas brunch
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sundance omelette, hella good!

ASGnx-Q-zv-nX8XDdnHAMQ.text: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day. This is one of the place for breakfast! You can really choose what you want to it from the menu. You must really try this!

AFKXq2EizrES1zse5hStRQ.text: The wait is worth it !! If you're in Vegas and looking for great food off the strip then make your way here ! Good food and dedication to excellent service !

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8JqAFziJCfmrAnx7dZ-91A.text: First timer today! I got the Traditional Benny with their highly raved about "Habla Diablo" potatoes. The potatoes are like crispy fries tossed with seasoning salt. The eggs Benedict was good but not the best. The eggs were egg-cellently runny though. My friend got the prime rib Benny and he shared the same sentiment as me. It was "good" but we wouldn't go out of our way to eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b1xnCvUd3o95xKQ-QPrAJg.text: Been my favorite staple here in Vegas. They are consistent on all levels, their food and service is excellent.  All of their omelets have always been great and plentiful.  I always go back to my favorite despite all the choices in town.

bFrAy1Hey52rgDYGcdMXiA.text: I had breakfast at the Egg & I for the first time and found the server and workers to be so pleasant and helpful. I had a waffle and bacon and it was delicious!  I will certainly return on my next trip to Vegas.

ztjjw8LUnAXYSxg6pFv0Fw.text: This is my "Go-to" breakfast spot when in Vegas!  It's close to where I stay. The service is always quick and efficient and the food is always fantastic.  There are still a few more items on the menu they I need to try but I recommend the hash, potatoes, and their homemade muffins!    Yesterday I had the veggie benedict and will have difficulty trying other items b/c it was delicious.

s8_5COM4hpJk8sbCSC4G2w.text: Service is great. Waiters are friendly and prompt. Family friendly. Not dirty but could be cleaner. Food is ok but portions are big. Price is good. We had soups, bread, and 2 full meals with coffee for $35. I would come back just for the great service, good prices, and banana bread which was phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s like reading the Newspaper

QaLUku-hr8F7Z1UyfZXyOA.text: First time here and was looking for a place off the beaten path. The staff was amazing and so was the food. A shoot out to CeCe who made our experience awesome. I had the eggs Benny and the muffin was oh so good. My husband had an the chili omelette. We would go back in a heartbeat. Place was hoping and wait worth it. They said 15 minutes but more like 5. The concept was fun, great locals place and fit for all. Never rushed, service great.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flip the egg if you need service....great concept.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iw4EygeZqwURnfVmXlHG0Q.text: We were in town for the weekend and didn't quite know what to expect. Considering the amount of people waiting the wait wasn't so bad, once we got seated we got greeted by our server and was very smooth the whole way. I ordered the French toast with the bacon butter and it was delicious, wife ordered a scramble  and was also very impressed. Will definitely   Visit next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast with bacon and walnut butter on the center.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Service needed

NBsz6K95nJef3wgSjaa4UA.text: Love this place! Every time I come to LV, it's a must to come eat breakfast here. I wish they had one in Los Angeles..

LvSde_5vH0RKoXQhMP7H1A.text: The food here is sooo delicious and great. The  people are so kind and respectful. The portions is generous. 13/10 overall, I love it!

lgxf9pk-zSjl3NY9HmYoVQ.text: This place is amazing! Get off the strip and try this place out. Big menu, great prices and delicious food!

6G_YmqXXTCV9dNGHulF3EA.text: Why offer seating outside in mid 50's weather and not have heat lamps?  Service is usually awesome. But today it just sucked. The waitress outside acted as if she didn't give a damn. I ordered a side of blackened prime rib, it looked and taste like dog food. I was so disappointed today.

ICm1ZuD60O6HSbTfW61VNQ.text: The food was delicious and the portions were large for your money. I would honestly go back just for their banana nut muffins everyday if I could.(Our waitress was kind enough to let us try them on the house) I swear those things are like cake. The atmosphere was extremely busy as there were so many servers and bussers rushing around. I would recommend calling ahead and taking your food to go if you want to avoid waiting to be seated

NQZyF6U_4hw4wTJLnhpEVw.text: The service was great. Everyone was super nice and in great spirits. The food was also a home run! It came out fast.

VN35PH_4HMouQSCrQLEOLA.text: Exceptional and friendly service. Quick delivery.    Corned Beef Hash: not what I expected.  I want to call this dish, smashed corned beef. The consistency was of baby food, smashed and smeared into a patty. Kind of reminded me of dog food.  The flavor wasn't the best; small bites of potatoes and peppers.  The egg was cooked perfectly.  Highly not recommend this dish.    Veggie Benedict: creamy with bursting flavors.  The potatoes were bursting with flavor and crisp to the eat! Veggies were fresh and delightful.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Benedict
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mash corned beef
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mt0bgG_zTrOcz6JsWq0gQw.text: Absolutely delicious! The portions are huge, the side of fruit are huge cuts of fresh melons, pineapple, oranges and grapefruit! Not your typical sad thimble side bowl of a few grapes and cantaloupe. The potatoes and the BEST. And they give you a personal urn for coffee so you can keep your cup full through breakfast. Eggcellent service.  Great place for families. Kid friendly. Awesome.

rNy-wG29skKtdwdHLsdcpQ.text: Been coming to this establishment for 8 yrs now! I love everything about it not to mention the friendly inviting service! Had a bad experience today for the 1st time with the UNPROFESSIONAL manager on shift CeCe. We were having a conversation with our lovely waitress (as we always do being that were regulars there twice a week) When CeCe rudely walks by totally interrupting our conversation saying" I need to talk to you" being the the service industry I've never seen a manager approach in that manner,taking the server leaving My husband && I completely surprised how rude && UNPROFESSIONAL that action was being that the restaurant was completely dead around 1:30 PM!. She definitely needs to be retrained. Giving this review 5 stars in consideration of how embarrassed our server looked at that moment && because this is our favorite place in Vegas!

MrUrCA2PeQ-UoMpFZBb3RA.text: The food was mediocre. I got the Ensenada burrito. The presentation was appealing but the flavor lacked. The coffee was weak, just tinted water. If wasn't for there muffin this place wood be a fail for me. I would go back to pick up a muffin only.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute pic

rYwPYfxLsDPJOoT2-G98yA.text: My must-go in Las Vegas! Love the homemade potatoes Soooo Muuuuuuch! And love every Benedict.

HjxPNdTQoNEwnxDYrAb9mw.text: As we headed out of Las Vegas, we stopped at this great find. On A Sunday morning, we had to wait about 20-25 minutes for a table... Place was bustling, all good energy. Hubby ordered the mashed potato omelet and I ordered the chile relleno omelet. Delicious! The potatoes were awesome, too! The sourdough toast was perfect! I did the yep check in for the banana but muffin and it was good but we were saving our appetite for the breakfast we ordered. Would definitely come back!

lfekjIX5ZX8FGqlgzFCwdw.text: I guess I came here with too high of an expectation.  All the food was mediocre, nothing special that stood out.    I got the vegetable omelette, good amount of 4 eggs, had spinach, mushroom, bell pepper and probably onion.  Nothing fragrant that stood out, but it did the trick.  The meal came with plateful of mini squared potatoes.  At first glance, you can see all the seasoning and it taste over seasoned. My only gripe, was they had MSG sprinkled all over it.  I didn't realize it until my thirst level started to slowly creep up.  I took another close look and felt sick to my stomach.  Why, do you need MSG in fried potatoes? Why?  To end on a good note, I really enjoyed my slice of grapefruit and honeydew and opted not to order the muffin or toast.   I should have stuck with good old Blueberry Hills Family.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benedict
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable omelette, fruit in the side

gpPWwpKBy3YWIgg7dodgmQ.text: Very nice place and the food amazing , Lacey  take care of us very well definitely we come back !!!

NDFPvkWnW5H6DKydqc9XLA.text: First timers get a free banana nut muffin!! Yay, I like free, substitutions are possible, waiter Chance was very friendly and informative, letting us know that we could get half an order of the omelettes because they're so big. Came at 9am on a weekday, it was stilled crowded but the wait wasn't long at all, about 3 minutes food was delicious, prices very reasonable, all in all a very good  experience.  Will come here everytime I'm in town definitely

tT_NCPHHBE8lgegm3xy4uQ.text: Favorite breakfast/brunch place when in Vegas. But, you need a mode of transportation because it's not on the strip.  TIP: If you check in through Yelp, you get free of the delicious, moist Banana Nut Muffin. (Do it! It's worth it.)  Be prepared to wait in line before seated, ALWAYS busy. So don't come here starving because you'll end up hAngry.   FOOD: I love everything I ordered from this place. Oh, if you eat like a bird, share The food with someone because they serve big portions. (My son and BF always finish their plates though.)  They also have rice plates, 3 choices, Hawaiin style. YUM!  DRINkS: Mimosa is not unlimited. But soft drinks and coffee are. Also if you order juice, they'd give you a carafe.  PRICE: decent price. They accept Amex. Pay at the cashier once you receive your receipt.   RESTROOM: small but clean.   SPACE: big space, good for groups. They also have outdoor seating.  SERVICE: fast (once seated) and efficient friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TtI09fPRLwGTDTUQWsvX8A.text: I don't understand why it's 4.5 stars The corn beef hash was the worst I've ever had! Everything else is plain Jane.

De5drJqol78DDAbSerdqkw.text: Always a wait but you can call ahead. Food never disappoints. I had the fiesta skillet with chorizo and a banana nut muffin with a coffee which were all delicious. They keep your water and coffee refilled even though they are busy. Overall, delicious food, friendly and attentive staff makes the trip worth the wait for me. But definitely call ahead if you can.

EgZNSZDPF0lJhzgF9_Jv8A.text: First time here and it was amazing! The food was delicious and the service was great! The waitress (with the raider shirt) was very kind and friendly.

yjEN03rVw7Ip-2oOYhHAHg.text: The food was really good (even if the potatoes were a little overseasoned), but the service was incredible. I ordered the prime rib bennie. They were out of croissants, so I asked for a biscuit, but got an english muffin. Then the eggs were overpoached. The server asked how things were, and I told her without complaint. It tasted good, so I was going to eat it. The manager was over a minute later, comped my dish, brought me a properly cooked egg, and handed us a free loaf of their delicious banana oat bread.   That's more than I would ever expect from a place like this. My fiance really liked her meal (so did I, from what I tasted), so I would definitely give them another chance.

6h6s1waTmulKbIwZtuEesQ.text: Where do I start? We enjoyed our dining experience as soon as we walked in the door! Our waitress was the best! She recommended a couple of dishes that we decided to order. The banana nut muffin they start you off with is AMAZING! I had the chicken fried steak. It was seasoned perfectly, and so were the potatoes. My husband had the Santa Cruz skillet which was delicious as well. This is a MUST when you're in Vegas. Not too far from the strip. But be prepared to wait, from what I hear. We went a little later in the morning and only had to wait 5 minutes... We will definitely be back!

rBpyptcnWd_b09zkyWUFlw.text: Some of the best breakfast I've ever had. Great family restaurant or (more importantly) an amazing place for hangover food after too much fun the night before. The staff was amazing and the atmosphere was great. Would definitely recommend any of the eggs benedicts for sure

7th3wor86tWsZVLWZ19lvg.text: Paula was our waitress and the service here was beyond excellent.  Food was just regular american breakfast, but it's nice to know what the local's favorite is like.  Plenty of parking, decent prices, A LOT of food for you to start your day.  The shocking number of reviews is because the customers are incentivized to post a review on Yelp / Tripadvisor to help their waiter / waitress go to Disneyland.  Apparently, whoever gets their name mentioned most gets to go to Disneyland, but it seems like an unfair popularity contest.  What if I was a waiter and I had tons of Facebook friends to help me out.  Easy free Disneyland trip.  Management, it's a smart business move, but this is a bit unfair.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Newspaper looking menu

6vsJK6LhPdZpku_syAevfQ.text: We stopped here on our way out of Vegas heading towards Zion NP. The reviews were rather good and I can see why! This place is a nice little quaint area in a strip mall. Doesn't look like much but it's definitely worth entering.   Definitely get the homemade banana nut muffin-it's moist, not too sweet but sweet enough with the right amount of flavor between banana and nut. They offer this with most of their breakfast items. I ordered the veggie omelet with slices of avocado-delish! Bacon was crispy and done-I don't like wet partially done bacon. Coffee was ok, not great but not bad so it worked.   Service-ok. No smiles, just business as usual. And we sometimes had trouble getting the waitress to notice we needed more coffee and water. This is why I'm only giving this place four stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable omelet- split it with friend.

p8jwHneYGuWI3n7VfEdqxA.text: This place was a great spot to grab breakfast while visiting Vegas with friends. They had plenty of options to choose from (which all sounded good) and the food tasted great. Our waiter was attentive and gave great service. If I lived in the area, I'd make this a regular breakfast spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie eggs benedict. So freakin good!

PcmK5A0AOEpuVG2kkI3LfQ.text: We had breakfast here because my friend wanted one of their Hawaiian dishes. The Haole Moco was the chosen dish which is white sticky rice topped with a hamburger patty, gravy, and two eggs any style. It was good and very filling. I ordered the carrot cake French toast with a side of bacon, but didn't like it. It was dense and had a strange flavor. I sent it back, and had the Works omelette which is loaded with bacon, ham, sausage, onions, tomatoes, green bell peppers, mushrooms, and cheddar and jack cheeses. This omelette is huge and has the nerve to come with Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes and choice of toast or banana nut muffin. I chose the toast because we got the free muffin for checking in on Yelp. That muffin is also delicious. The meal was rounded out with a tasty cup of vanilla cappuccino.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle topped with lots of whipped cream
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with gravy, seasoned potatoes, and scrambled eggs
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla cappuccino

IjMIy2BejYyUnV4gFMYHlQ.text: This was a nice, solid spot for breakfast/brunch food.  The place is fairly big and when we went on a Monday morning at 9:30am, the place was packed.  I had the biscuits with gravy with eggs and it was a decadent and savory dish...perfect to start the day.  I had a banana nut muffin, which was also good.  The menu is HUGE, so take your time in figuring out what appeals most...there's definitely something for everyone.

udTes-YOwBn1l4vTBhQYNg.text: my mom and i were passing through vegas and decided to drop by for some breakfast. there was a 30 minute wait (we arrived at 10AM on a sunday, so not super surprising as it's a popular place) but we ended up getting a table earlier than anticipated. i got the cesar's scramble (subbed chicken for bacon) with the diablo potatoes on the side, and my mom got the bacon and avocado omelette. the food was flavored well and definitely makes for great leftovers because the portions are truly massive. the potatoes tasted like fries rolled in bbq chip dust (yesssssss!) and worry not if you can't handle spice, the scramble has chilies in it but there's barely any heat from them, just a green smoky flavor. the waitstaff was kind and helpful and accommodating, and the banana nut muffins were delightful.

B9nuX5QKfTjZQAWvNBpOEA.text: Great breakfast place.  Ate here twice while visiting Vegas.   Great eggs Benedict, omelettes, breakfast burrito.   Fantastic banana bread - we got the whole loaf to go and really loved it.  Service is very good, fast and efficient  Prices are very reasonable.   Would highly recommend this place and would return anytime.

crro__3AdK8wT53v8boDBg.text: Delicious food! We're from Orange County, Cali and every time we come to Vegas we stop by the Egg & I. The food is great and it's always busy definitely worth the wait. Our waitress Carole Ann was so sweet and very attentive. She made us feel welcomed and comfortable right away. I would definitely recommend asking for Carole, she'll make your dining experience great. Thank you for the wonderful service and kindness Carole! We ordered the original breakfast burrito and pancakes both were soooo good! I added spinach to the breakfast burrito and it seriously looked like work of art when it came out, you could see the layers of bacon, cheese, eggs, spinach and potatoes. The salsa that came with the burrito was the best salsa I've had in a while and of course the Diablo potatoes are addicting. The pancakes were moist and fluffy. So much yummmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original breakfast burrito with spinach added! The photo doesn&#39;t even do this work of art justice.

er2_4WF9QeOmnZl-eaHMfg.text: She flipped my egg back to happy when I put it on sad but that's okay. The classic is pretty good but I wouldn't get the meat since 2$ for bacon isn't really worth it.

0v8FuWtNIeQ1lmjj2HLwXw.text: The service is good as is the food.  This place is a solid 4 in the breakfast world of LV.  I wish the coffee was a little higher quality and would prefer to have an option of regular hash brows over the seasoned potatoes.

d7l6k_Uw_B0OgdCufvMuOw.text: We were out of town and stopped by. Breakfast was good! I got the biscuits and gravy and my boyfriend got the spinach Benny the potatoes on the side were delicious and the coffee was good. Customer service was outstanding as well our waitress was on top of everything.

_zdgVW_U-Tsfmxn2ePauSw.text: Eggsellent banana muffin!!  Carole Ann waited on us and was very sweet. Portion sizes are big, shared the classic with turkey bacon and a side order of eggs between two people.

_XFzHPOW7FL9BPaegNDNBg.text: Excellent food. Our server, Patrick was very friendly & went above & beyond to be sure we were happy.  Highly recommend.

nnDHZ0ccj62l3gpaI6A1-w.text: Our server Chance was awesome!  She was very attentive and catered to our needs. Highly recommend her and Egg and I!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SXY7qnVu7oaOGlpF_0Ytog.text: By far the best best banana nut muffins I have ever had in my life. They're addicting. Get a lot of them! The servers were extremely helpful and tended to us often. Everyone seemed to be in a really good mood & happy to help serve us. I really like the sad egg/ happy egg sign at the table, that was my first time seeing that type of system but I really liked it. I ordered the CFS skillet and it was good but it was just a little too salty for me. That would be my only "complaint," but other than that, it was an absolutely enjoyable experience!

z2kUKfnnQCffm2Qt6u_PBg.text: Best breakfast place in Las Vegas. I ordered the works skillet which was really good & the banana muffin is a must.

2E-nrRgn5idxt_JVhTiqqA.text: My experience here was perfect, Karla was an amazing waitress and I look forward to coming back. LA all day !

nys7Bh65Qy1NHC1FfRj9-w.text: I love Egg and I and Egg Works. Great food, plenty of choices, nice presentation, moderately priced. Very friendly servers and nice ambience. Great tasting Traditional Benny! Would be a 5 star if not for a long wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional Benny

7Bg9rI3q9tuedvJLrnxMEQ.text: Outstanding breakfast with eggcellent service! Liza is a terrific waitress who will take great care of you!

iEpcHzvt-kqdVr8AJ_v30w.text: I went to this place with my boyfriend right after we arrived at the airport. What I loved about this place was the service. Our waitress Tabatha was attentive and friendly. Her service was top-notch but not overbearing. Their muffin was okay in my opinion. I didn't think it wow me. I like their potatoes cubes which were fresh and well seasoned. I also like their sourdough bread and coffee. The crazy chicken was okay. Nothing spectacular on the main dish. I'd return next time when I was in town again.

Z1M3cIwf7KCm1wP0A_3bkg.text: PHENOMENAL BREAKFAST. And we got the gumbolaya which was pretty spot on and even had two people ask what it was because it looked so good. Make sure to check in for their free muffin, it's so tasty and moist I get one to go too. Don't go if you need to eat immediately as there is always at least a 1/2 hour wait. It is worth it though!

I5HjVonbnc0bNw9zyBn5Pg.text: The spinach Benny +avocado..Delish! And our waitress Chance was very cool and her  menu recommendation was spot on. Great breakfast place off the strip

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The spinach Benny +avocado..Delish! And our waitress Chance was very cool and her  menu recommendation was spot on.

zeSFuMFYCgA3aGGpCTC7NA.text: Graf place great food but we had a waitress named Amanda and she was outstanding made our body there fantastic

zrjRSP04pkvWfgTmrSkVTw.text: Came in today, 7/20/16 and had the absolute best experience. The food was excellent, atmosphere was great, and everything was really decently priced but what really put this experience above and beyond was our sweet and personable server Tamra. She was kind, quick, had perfect recommendations and maintained several tables with this level of excellency. I saw her make each of her tables laugh, and made my friend and I feel at ease even though we had kind of obnoxious and high-maintenance orders. I would return if I lived here just to be served by Tamra. I am impressed on all levels!

ewhb4chIaPKalmVfbjcS9g.text: Heard about this place thru a friend and then saw reviews on Yelp. Our visit started a lil rocky as we were sat outside, it got really cold but their heaters were not functioning. Won't go into the details, but we were accommodated inside quickly, took a bit longer to place our order.....but the food was definitely worth the wait.   Our party order the following: Country Biscuits N Gravy, Country Benny, and an assortment of Skillets. I also ordered the Strawberry Cream Cheese French Toast. Ahhhhhh-mazing!!   We all devoured our food. Everything was delicious. Great portion sizes too.   Service was quick and friendly. Our server Lily was great. General Manager Marc even gave us a bread loaf as a parting gift. We are definitely coming back the next time we are in Vegas!

3CukHi-tcVZIbwknHoGq1A.text: Everything I've read about this place was True. Incredible food and Great Server "Card" was wonderful! I can't wait to go back!

wmND9h3vz7RA3B8kOrnHsw.text: By far the best food I have tasted in my entire life. Every time I come to Vegas I HAVE to eat here if not everyday of my stay then every other day. I can't leave without paying a visit. Staff is amazing and service is quick. I recommend it to anyone and everyone.

GSI8cMOrj1GcW72zEtPAQQ.text: Our waitress Karla was amazing she was fast, efficient and very attentive. The food was great ,but her personality and service made our visit worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sj7VpikLtsIfH8YAgqqRJA.text: Needed a nice meal before my mini plays a volleyball tournament today. This place reminded me of a place in temecula we go to. The service was great and food was yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili rellano omlete
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The classic with fruit instead of potatoes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. When your happy

zS03VyWAeWBWjF0HyYt02w.text: Eggs & I has become our regular "leaving Las Vegas" breakfast spot.   Food is always good,  fast prompt service,  and the banana nut muffins are awesome!   Highly recommended!

YlqL-hHQbLYMjxmLSEEIvA.text: I have been a fan of this place for ever.  It is one of the best places to go for breakfast in Las Vegas in my opinion.  The food is made hot and fresh.  They have daily specials and they even make there own banana nut muffins in house.  The works potatoes are amazing a man could survive on these alone.   My favorite items on the menu are the omelettes, skillets and also the biscuts and gravy.  I have not tasted any thing I have not liked at Egg & I.  This is a must try place in the city.  Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free muffin with check in. Mmmmm hot and fresh.

oQUfmGeU0BLDwHFNRbCR2Q.text: All hype? We waited a good 15-20 minutes for a table of 4 on a Saturday, and were all less than blown away by each of our meals. Darn.  The traditional eggs benedict was simply drowning in a very creamy and underwhelming hollandaise sauce and tasted like a somewhat soggy mess. Unappetizing.  The sunrise mountain, which was a croissant underneath scrambled eggs with bacon and cheese, didn't taste too spectacular either and can probably be easily duplicated at home. It looked better than it tasted.  The potatoes, on the other hand, were seasoned well and tasty. Probably the highlight of our dishes.  Service was very friendly and attentive, and once you get your check, you can go up to the front register to pay and split checks as you please.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise mountain. Croissant, eggs, cheese, turkey bacon, potatoes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional eggs benedict. Too much hollandaise

lxRZ0h9OD3AcAiucWm0RaQ.text: Don't miss this awesome breakfast spot! Their strawberry cream cheese stuffed french toast was amazing! As was the bacon and maple french toast. Just ask them if you can half and half so you can experience both of these taste sensations! Also the corned beef hash egg dish was fabulous! Great Great service too! We will definitely come back! Note: The Egg Works and The Egg and I (all owned by same family) are 5 STAR!

pFdsHbpq2raB-XEJinrRUg.text: This place was extra packed and the wait time was kind of long. But it was well worth the wait! I ordered the Prime Rib Benny and it was Awesome! And if you checked in on Yelp you'll get a free banana nut muffin. The muffin its self was creamy and buttery, just like it was home made. The service was also great and very attentive.

ZLKYE04ZYWOt3GM0P-otRA.text: Stayed in Vegas for 6 days and this was THE BEST place we ate!! Super friendly staff, huge portions and great prices! I would highly recommend you make the short trip if you are staying on the strip because it will be well worth it!

lXHBuDZhZ4jGNKQOOo56uA.text: As we were preparing to leave Vegas, we googled best breakfast places and wound up here. We were seated promptly by the hostess podium, strike 1, tell me who wants to sit where you can hear the conversations between the girls as they seat people.  The server was pleasant and why I give this a 2 Star rating but the food was mediocre. My waffle was cold and not crunchy, the butter couldn't melt on a cold waffle so I had to use syrup. The ham and eggs were cold too, overall, not impressed, strike 2.  My friend had the bacon, egg & potato skillet and was also disappointed bc it was too salty and warm, not hot, strike 3.  I'm out, not on our list when we return to Vegas, sad really because I had high hopes after reading the reviews.

KQsUhIBtnv2j5wadG9gTww.text: Great service Banana nut muffin (really really good) Chile relleno omelette (a little on the salty side) Chicken fried steak skillet (good but not as good as Ellis Island chicken fried steak) Strawberry cream cheese french toast (too sweet, bread was very moist though)  not a fan of their seasoned potatoes

EeDry-JywRM_QjHf6ss6cw.text: Cute menu in newspaper style. Reminds of people in the old days perhaps that they wake up in the morning with breakfast and newspaper in hand.   I ordered Blacked Prime Rib Benedict, my bf ordered stuff french toast and we got banana muffins for free. Both of our dishes came with home potatoes, just mine was too salty, his was fine.  I have had better egg Benedict at Bill's cafe in our bay area, the prime rib was salty for me, but the stuffed french toast was very unique and tasty. Also the banana muffins are really good.  Overall a nice place to eat breakfast off the strip with very reasonable prices and friendly service (Thank you, Paula!)

E9BWeRhJuNprsnEBTuOjBg.text: My husband and I came here for the yelp reviews and they did not disappoint, this place is delicious! My husband got the blueberry waffle...he loved how buttery the waffle was and I got the works skillet (two thumbs up). Service was wonderful everyone works together and are very friendly. PLUS...u get a free muffin when u checkin :)

9hk45r9yMOaH5q3f-4K4aQ.text: It was a good breakfast place but nothing spectacular.  The menu was extensive and our waitress very attentive but the food was just ok.

JFNmFd3X2PhjEnGBZ-i1ZQ.text: Best service ever. Answered our questions before we asked. Attentive without being overbearing. Thanks Alexa!  Everything we had was great,  and had something special about it. Cinnamon French Toast had an apple chutney that was fantastic.  The Italian scramble was great and made to order (light cheese,  egg whites). The Sundance special omlette was delicious.  Rustic,  clean setting. Interesting,  large menu.  Huge portions. Great value. College football on the three large TVs  Short wait,  and things moved quickly.  Great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zj-gk9q91OzxR3bauSGJMw.text: Am not sure how I feel about this place the food had no flavor am not sure what the hype is all about or why they have so many reviews but I guess I know what good food taste like and am not sure they earn more stars staff was nice.

mHWLOf2q9WvQwG4x2W7dPg.text: Found this place a couple of visits ago, and we now have it on our must-hit list when we visit LV.  It is off-strip, but still gets somewhat busy at times, so be prepared to wait.  Highly recommend this place for breakfast - Very reasonable prices for quality & portions.  ($23-24 total for Eggs Benedict & Biscuits & Gravy)  The eggs benedict are our favorite here (totally smothered with Hollandaise).  FYI - They serve their "Diablo Potatoes", but change to Hash Browns or unseasoned potatoes if ordering for kids or watching sodium (The Diablo version appears to be just a ton of seasoned salt added.)  Excellent & friendly service!  NOTE:  Not a fan of giving up a cell number so they can text you when your table's ready.  We didn't - We're kinda paranoid about giving out any info as it can become part of a unsolicited marketing email spam.  (Not saying that's what they do, but we just don't do it.)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUMMY! Eggs Benedict w/(salty!) Diablo Potatoes Biscuits &amp; Gravy w/ Unseasoned Potatoes

C7sHSmfYwR01h43OY0tgQA.text: Great service. Big portions. My friend had the stuffed French toast and I had the mash potato omelette. They're home fries are so good. Seasoned well. And muffin was so moist. Can't go wrong. I went on a Thursday around noon so no wait time.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GlvlDpmAW8v0AsFk5Y7rtA.text: I was in Las Vegas last week and we headed here for our first breakfast, and were sorely disappointed. Definitely, the best thing was the muffins- delicious and fresh. The hash was mushy, the hot cocoa was definitely from a packet- not top quality. We were OK though with everything- staff was nice, etc. However, when my Mom ordered her hash she specifically asked for the egg whites to be cooked through in her eggs. When she got through some of the eggs, however, she raised a bite that had completely raw egg hanging from it- not just undercooked, but raw. When we informed the waiter he asked would she like a replacement or price adjustment, and she requested the latter. When we got the check, $2.25 had been reduced on the check. We went to talk to the manager, who then confirmed multiple times that they refunded the price of the two eggs on top (even though they were not ordered a la carte), and that was their policy- even though they served my Mom not food she just didn't want, but food that was unsafe. Incredibly disappointing seeing as I work in food service myself.

Y1h6ITJdPt3lT6sjc7QbzA.text: 4 starts for the AMAZING banana homemade muffins. SO soft, flavorful and not too sweet. The food was not bad I had the hot cakes which were great they only offer high fructose syrup :/... Service was quick and well oriented given how popular this breakfast/lunch spot is they developed a system where you are notified through text when your table is ready. I should note the wait is about 34 minutes (we were here on Easter Sunday which plays a big factor). All in all if you are looking for an American breakfast give this place a try.

3OItxhNz7wjllxGqLGMjUg.text: I am definitely a fan. Great, quick service, home - like warm ambience, and a hearty breakfast all make for a beautiful dining experience.  We had the Fiesta Skillet, Vegetarian Crepe, and Waffle Works with whip cream and strawberries. Traditional/Deliciously cooked eggs and food made to order. It has a loyal following so try to get there early if you can. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DWD5IbaBn8meoH5stT29Zw.text: Consistently the best breakfast in Vegas!  Best service and the menu has a huge variety of items.  You could go everyday and get something different every time, but I definitely recommend the Mexican omelet!

39ZEiRiPqkOOiyl7_JgY8w.text: Great choice for breakfast when visiting LV since it is clearly a favorite of the locals. The food and service are very good and the portions substantial.

w5ia7GQL2NoaDN6ARJIo1Q.text: Service was average at best. Taste and food quality about the same. I had to wait to be seated though so they are popular.

aItPJojNosSP_-NA4q5bjQ.text: This is the best breakfast spot I've ever been to in Vegas!  They are very accommodating with small changes, fast and generous with their portions.  The restaurant is clean and there is ample parking.    If you're staying in Vegas and have access to a car - then for sure - get off the strip because you won't find anything that beats Egg & I.

0MS5TOGR9pk7XD9mnmAd7A.text: Egggxellent... Liza was our waitress...it was our first time there and she gave us great suggestions on the most popular dishes...we tried the loco Moco, steak and eggs and the eggs Benedict.  Food was homemade,fresh and lots of flavor.  If you are Hawaiian, you'll love the local food and the aloha shoyu and sticky white rice...so on.

Wwm8TxD_D321WRHC7q_z9A.text: Came to vegas for a week and decided to eat off the strip and found this place through yelp.  I was excited to see they served spam, egg and rice.  Came on Monday, June 9th for breakfast and from the time we walked in to the time we walked out we had exceptional customer service by Gia the manager and our waitress, Carole Ann.   They were both very personable.  We we're seated promptly in the back next to the kitchen by Gia.  Carole Ann came by to acknowledge us but would be right back because she had to sing happy birthday at a table.  No biggie as we were on vacation and wasn't in a rush to go anywhere.    Gia came by and apologized but no need to apologize for the delay.  She came out with two banana muffins for us while we waited and took our drink orders and came out with it.  Those muffins were delicious.  Carole Ann came back and took our order.  I ordered the spam and egg over rice.  That came with a muffin or toast and since we already got the muffin I thought that was it.  But she offered me toast or another muffin to take home, but I declined.   My other half ordered a chorizo skillet.    The food and service was great and I would have def gone back but my intentions while I was in Vegas was to visit a different restaurant everyday.    They don't take American Express, not sure if it's just at this location.   Thank you Carole Ann for great customer service, keep it up and I hope you get to meet Mickey Mouse!!!

Gt6s0tPZEdTVfJWcCKyhqg.text: Loved the prime rib benny and banana bread French toast minus powdered sugar. Service was great.

l7LDPWiI2VLpIGDLL8T1cw.text: I'm a big fan of this place. They have wonderful service and amazing breakfast food. Try the Carnitas with the Salsa Verde and egg. Coffee was HOT and Abundant.

RT36jsAS2-j0VfnWJoLAEQ.text: Great selection of traditional and creative new dishes for breakfast. Service was fast and friendly. We sat down ordered and had our food within 5 minutes. I ordered the Kay special it was super cheesy and tasty along with their seasoned fries.. My friend had the stuffed French toast which according To her was amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kay speciAl

LdVmztQvvpQ0mFujVhLp6g.text: Very impressive Egg menu. I'm from the south where breakfast is an all day food item and this place would do well in the south. Worth the drive off the strip for breakfast. Excellent service thanks to Liza.

50BEUOh3xdDcSx4bNSAP-w.text: Very good breakfast spot.  Karla our waitress was sweet and attentive.  She brought out a sample of both of the chili for my friend to try.  Now that's good service. Friendly staff!

eAUrMXFN1oPifHg4V4iP4g.text: Breakfast here was great. Eggs over easy cooked just right and the biscuits and gravy were tasety. Chance, our waitress was funny and attentive.

M-yih5VAtSfTqCnW91zzQg.text: This may be the best breakfast in the world. If I could rate it 6 stars I would. The banana nut muffin is awesome. I usually get the egg sandwich with a side of potatoes, the egg sandwich is solid and whatever the seasoning they put on the potatoes is like crack I can never have enough.   On top of this, the service is great. The servers are attentive but not over attentive.

h-4GMIoWTfSBebP_bTQ-8w.text: Amazing Amanda at the East Sahara ...This place scores 5 stars on every count and Amanda deserves 100!

d7R0yWZM7fiBdQM0i65eGg.text: The Works skillet was simply amazing! Yummy homemade salsa and the homemade muffin finished everything off nicely. Biscuits and gravy was too too

5wagdfYYvjQPAuQXhOW_Bw.text: Came here to try some new breakfast/ brunch place. This place has a lot of variety an is pretty decent pricing compared to hash house a go go.  Had the plain waffle in my meal and is was light and airy. The syrup is the exact amount of sweet, you not to sweet where it feels like you are drinking straight from the bottle but not so light you think it's a diabetic sugar supplement. The service was great! The only knock on this place is its a little cramped considered how popular it is and how many people are there.

7yCkXMSzB-UZtdV5eSCGWw.text: The food was good and the service was great!  Amanda was our server and was flawless! It's rare to get perfect service, being friendly, attentive, and timely all at the same time, but she did it. She was genuine and deserves a vacation for working so hard ;) Thank you for a great eggsperience!

ye7euikF-UHqmSY81yL25w.text: Egg & I is officially my favorite breakfast restaurant.  Great food, huge menu and excellent service.  Worth the drive from the Strip.

zFnv7sDf0cE7wPu08KB5qw.text: Short wait at 9 on a Wed.  Great fresh fruit plate.  Chicken enchilada omelet was a hit.  Kids got chocolate chip pancakes and it was a big portion.  A great stop 10 miles off the strip.

Vn460iT9tmmE0elz3WgDFA.text: The place is okay. The potatoes are way over-seasoned...ruined them. Guess I should be glad, saved me calories.

jCeTyZqLhyGg7s1wZ7ToTg.text: we decided to have a fantastic breakfast/brunch while on vacay in Vegas and we thought we give egg and I a shot.  Oh man, I knew I was in for a special treat because clearly this is popular breakfast spot in vegas with all the wonderful reviews here on yelp and zagat reviews.  we both went with the egg white western omelette's, ham, green peppers, onions and mushrooms. we both were given a complimentary banana nut muffin since it was our first visit..and the husband loved it and i thought it was OK.  the breakfast arrived and everything tasted wonderful and was prepared the way we requested (we asked our omelette's to be cooked with pam spray vs butter-and they were happy to oblige). service was great and fast.  I would definitely return to try some other breakfast items.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T2u-A0gaGatOrQpKJcz4Yw.text: Bacon Avocado Omelet hearty and delicious. Habla diablo potatoes are yummy. Portions are large, prepare to eat! Karla, our waitress, was attentive and very pleasant. Definite go to breakfast place off the strip. Bonus is the free banana nut muffin with the Yelp check in. Super yummy!!

iXFZB8jfgVnkopEuo7xLCQ.text: Honestly the BEST breakfast spot in Vegas! Every time we go to Vegas we make it a point to go here! The potatoes are on point here, WAY better than any potatoes you can get at chain breakfast joints. I highly recommend the blackened prime rib Benny

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Benny with a very hearty helping of Habla potatoes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened prime rib Benny with Habla Diablo potatoes

snBLA4p41jT3On0dOez7jg.text: I would not recommend u eat here... I ate their on sunday and ended up with food poisoning... The coffee was nasty and the veggie omelets was greasy... Never had such a horrible meal in my life...

ysiP_wSsO8A90MtBx_9Tzg.text: Long line to wait...not good if you're so hungry already...But the food is good...Qould recommend coming here on a weekday and not on a Sunday morning...

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SXUq_Lw8QKWvs0vn9OtOAw.text: Awesome place! Have to try the Banana nut muffin. It is quite a gem.

-PX1pxYFauMHMUTUMyEIVA.text: Great service, awesome food. I asked our server Erin for a side of rice and she asked if I wanted soy sauce on it... how did she know? I thought I was in Hawaii again.  Erin was very friendly.  It was an excellent breakfast/brunch experience!

KFNi5woSITgD75Q0hVgpXw.text: Stellar muffins,great service, excellent "country benny", lots of fresh coffee. Wait time is worth it.

DOVwYmXTR98pXQGbrFVCgQ.text: Came here due to their great review but the food was just too salty. Staffs are great but food is ehhhhh

Bj98IWJx2hp2W3HDsAOBoQ.text: What a delicious treat! We waited about 15 minutes at 11am on a Saturday. Our server Karla was pleasant and attentive. We ordered the works scramble and the carrot cake French toast. Oh my goodness! The French toast tsa a decadent treat, but not overwhelmingly sweet. So moist syrup isn't necessary. The omelette was cooked to perfection as were the potatoes. My mimosa was a great compliment to my delicious meal. We'll definitely be back!

ggoYxip9tpbjiwa4FoUwrw.text: Great food absolutely enjoyed the hell out of the garlic mashed potato omelet it was fucking delicious. The staff was kind and courteous I enjoyed myself at this restaurant.....

XjeEyATgQxHYiYTCoveQaw.text: It was Easter Brunch with a car full of 4 girls starving and ready to eat....after visiting Hash House A Go-Go down the street and being told the wait was about 45 min- 1 hour we used yelp to find another breakfast spot was we drove on over to Egg & I.   The wait wasn't as long as Hash House...it was only about 15 minute for an outside table. The menu is huge and appealing that none of us could make up our minds on what to order. Eventually we did, 2 friends got the eggs Benedict and pancakes, another got the steak and eggs with rice and I got the spinach and avocado omelet with fruits and I shared the strawberry creme french toast with a friend. The ambiance is like any ordinary breakfast joint with that "home" and "granny's house" feeling.   Everyone loved their foods, but it was so much that they couldn't finish it except for my friend who got the steak and eggs. I for one cold not even eat half of my food, regardless of how delicious it is....and I can eat a whole lot. I loved that my omelet was full of fresh huge slices of avocado and spinach inside my omelet. The fruits were fairly fresh and sweet. My whole plate cost me about $118 with tip so not bad considering I had a yummy Easter omelet, fruits and a huge delicious stack of french toast. Sadly, none of us took our food to go because we were on the road doing errands that day.   Next time I hit up Vegas, I'll be sure to come here for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry French toast
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado, cheese, sour cream and mushroom omelette with fresh fruits and toast

MhdD5bTb87cZBoRoO0DPSg.text: Finally after months of wanting to try this place, I got the opportunity when I was in town for EDC.   My friends and I walked in on a Friday afternoon and were seated immediately. The host and servers both gave us a warm welcome. My favorite part of the table set up was their egg signal at the top of their center piece. It was a photo of an egg that you could flip to indicate to servers that you needed something. No one waving your hand to try to get the servers attention, they got a system down!  Next, the food, I ordered corned beef hash and eggs, while my friend customized her scramble with chorizo plus biscuits and gravy.. The bf got some avocado omelette. All were delicious and the portions were huge! It looked like I barley made a dent in my food, but I was stuffed. The biscuits and gravy were probably some of the best I've had... And their banana nut muffins are worth a try for muffin fiends. Straight out of the oven to your table.  Good service, good food, and great company.. All for a reasonable price. I think this place is going to become a must stop for all my Vegas trips from now on! Thank you Egg & I!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash and eggs!

_uuT2KAKV2tqP6c50WwJAg.text: There were 4 of us.  We each ordered something different.  They adapted for smaller appetites--2 egg omelets and fruit instead of potatoes.   Highly recommend.

o7E0YuHR5PXGyYoAJ-32IQ.text: Arrived on Wednesday at about 10 am and was seated immediately. Eggs and bacon were cooked just right  (I like my bacon really crispy.)
