Cinnamon French toast was delicious. Our server, Oscar, was "eggceptional". They offer so many choices and Oscar made some useful recommendations.  He was very pleasant. You can count on great service along with great egg dishes here.  BTW we got 2 free banana nut muffins just for checking in on Yelp!  Thanks!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RTABFYA669s9DhVdnxSBnw.text: Based on the general consensus, here on Yelp, I tried the country fried steak.  I've had a many country fried steak in my life...and this is one of the better one's!  We were warned by the server, but it was indeed salty, but not extremely (albeit I prefer more sodium than most).  To me, flavor was great, consistency of the gravy was perfect (not too thick or thin), country fried steak was moist and very crispy, eggs were prepared perfectly and the potatoes were very crispy (potatoes were moist and seasoned well - but also salty in a good way!).    More over...the nut muffin, as others ranted about, was very fluffy, moist and flavorful!  This dish was spot-on for breakfast.

BYje9XAWMdgRtYLlq5EEDw.text: Such a wonderful establishment! Great service, prices and food. If you are in the mood for a nice, hearty breakfast while visiting Vegas then I highly recommend making a stop to this restaurant. You will not be disappointed.

I2t9OYWzwJvfZ5RSs2XNUw.text: I looked up this place while driving on our way to Utah definitely well worth the stop. This place deserves a 10  the banana muffins are on the house for first timers everything on the menu is delish Tam as our waitress was "FANTASTIC" definitely recommend Egg & I.................

vgZcWAPPoOjJw_EHmpCn5A.text: What an off-strip gem!  Hubby and I stopped in here after a couple of days on the strip and it was just what the doctor ordered.   Him: Corned beef hash with two eggs over medium and Hablo Diabla "works" potatoes. So freaking delish.  Me: Breakfast burrito sub turkey sausage for bacon (because I'm watching my waist line... *crickets*). Heaven.   Although everything we had was delicious, what really made a mark was the homemade salsa they served and the Hablo Diabla seasoning they use. So delicious and one of a kind. One of a kind is hard to find these days with so many restaurants out there in competition but these guys really do have something special.  Service was prompt and cheery.   As we drove away to head back to SD, we promised that the Egg-and-I will be a ritual breakfast spot when we're in town.

Wi9rmyBqypVFMcmz4Y9FYA.text: Everything was so tasty and the portions are huge. Say yes to the banana nut muffin. Sunrise mountain was the best meal at the table. Worth the wait!

2xZIHhSu8elf_hN8L4IVQw.text: AMBIANCE: 4 - It was okay inside, kind of a cross between homey restaurant, diner and cafeteria. It was bright inside, lots of families, and it felt nice in there..like when you went out for breakfast in the 90s on a bright Sunday morning.  SERVICE: 4 - I thought that the service was good. The servers are always smiling and genuinely kind. They are constantly concerned about your food and if everything is tasting good.   FOOD: 3 - My disclaimer: I really only came here to eat eggs. I did not want any meat other than bacon. I strictly came here for really, really plain ol' breakfast food, and not anything else.  I got a really boring item called "The Classic", but I really wanted just eggs and bacon, so that's what I went with. My over easy eggs were cooked perfectly. I mean, they were absolutely perfect. Some cooks leave the yolk barely runny on the inside, but they are experts at eggs here..and I have no complaints.   The banana nut muffin was soft and moist, but I just didn't like the taste of it. I think I'm just picky, but the banana in the muffin tasted a little ripe. The potatoes were good, but they weren't great. The bacon was a little overcooked and a little too hard for me.   I totally forgot to check Yelp before ordering, but next time, I'll order a healthy omelet and see how that goes!!

vGQs5uoakYQv1r3uyOJDFg.text: Ive been in vegas for 3 days and wanted to eat a good breakfast place off the strip. I  looked on yelp and was immediately attracted to the amount of reviews. Upon arrival at 7am there was nobody there so make sure you come early if you don't want to wait. I checked in for the delicious free banana nut muffin. The menu was pretty big and after scoping for a minute I decided on the blackened prime rib benny. The benedict was perfectly constructed . Tender prime rib, poached eggs, and some gravy was served on a crossaint, the flavor was also on point! 30 minutes later I'm headed out the door! Mission breakfast accomplished.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened prime rib benny

WyWgCM07R9arGn4yj5H4pg.text: Our server Karla was great! Friendly and very attentive! I started off with the Banana Nut Muffin and coffee. Oh yum! You MUST try this at least once although I'm sure it won't just be once! I also ordered the Stuffed French Toast and eliminated the meat. Before I can ask what are my other options Karla recommended veggies! Stuffed French toast with scrambled eggs, spinach and mushrooms. It also came with deliciously seasoned potatoes. I can't wait to go back to Vegas, so I can come back to this place for breakfast!   I'm saying good-bye to brunch at the buffets and saying hello to Egg & I! I found my Vegas breakfast spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian Stuffed French Toast and potatoes
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You taste so good!

ru_wrI6IBAsnz6SiPa3Aqw.text: We were very impressed with the fast and friendly service. There is an 'egg indicator' at each table and any of the staff will stop by if you need something. The manager was also hustling, checking how people were doing, and clearing tables. We had a Loco Moco that tasted as good as in Hawaii. The yummy banana nut muffins taste like something grandma made. The potatoes were crispy, not greasy, and well-seasoned. The eggs benedict had fresh spinach and the hollandaise was delicious. We'll definitely come back when we're in town.

nV7UZ0HTRmYeAY55LBjeuQ.text: This breakfast joint is a must have for anyone visiting Vegas. When I go on trips that involve Vegas, I've started planning the itinerary to let me go to Eggs & I for breakfast. It is a slight trek from the strip, but totally worth it.  For my most recent visit I got the Ensenada Burrito and my wife got the Banana Bread French Toast. The Ensenada Burrito was a recommendation from my server Amanda and I'm so glad I listened to her. The burrito was delicious. Tasty meat and eggs in the burrito and topped with a healthy amount of cheese. Plus, it came with a side of their potatoes (what they call habla diablo seasoned potatoes) which are some of my favorite breakfast potatoes. So good. My wife's french toast was sweet and delicious. The service was top notch. Amanda (our server) was cheerful and seemed genuinely excited to help us figure out what to eat.  Oh, and they have this black/yellow egg heads on each table to notify the staff if you need help (Black smiley face = you're ok, Yellow frowny face = need assistant). The staff watches this like hawks. Each time we flipped it, a staff member (not just your server) is right there to help. We were in a rush and needed the check... flipped it... 5 seconds later a staff member was there... 30 seconds later our server gave us our check. It was awesome.  Overall, I can't say enough about this place. It is one of the best breakfast places in Vegas (if not THE best). The wait is quick, the service is great, and the food is top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of the Ensenada Burrito. Simply delicious.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ensenada Burrito - sour cream in a cup. Side of seasoned potatoes (habla diablo seasoned potatoes).

O6RB71IsXveBEQWwZ8ZwLw.text: Monday morning breakfast of steak and eggs. Options included egg preparation, toast type, meat temperature, and potatoes. I ordered over easy, sourdough, medium rare and potatoes diablo.  Of course I had to have coffee as well. Coffee and water arrived first.  The coffee was in a hot pot with at least a quart of delicious coffee.  Water was reverse osmosis and highly drinkable. My steak was cooked to order, but cold.  The waitress rescued me and soon a nice hot steak and eggs order was in front of me. I enjoyed it for the duration of everything on the plate except I could not finish the potatoes! Assorted jellies included a rarity: mixed fruit.  Nice! Good Breakfast stop!

yWS3n-lb0bi8ewePAgx_gA.text: Everytime I come to Vegas, this is a definite must-go. The service is fast and the place is always packed. But they have a lot of tables and the food comes out relatively fast, so you don't wait hours and hours. If you check in, you get a free muffin- which is amazing to munch on before your meal comes or after on your drive back home :P  I only eat from the breakfast menu and the selection is immense! You need to just commit and order.  This is where we come to de-brief on what happened during our Vegas trip lol.

867bMZXqqeCc38m6tOowsg.text: Stopped in yesterday for breakfast! Everything was amazing! I got the breakfast burrito and I even checked in to get my free banana muffin which was great! The service was fast and out waitress was perfect! I highly recommend to anyone in or around the Vegas area.

RBzDmCSsO5_aigky8OtDbA.text: Super awesome brunch spot. Wasn't too crowded for a weekend. We got great service by Caroline, she was very sweet and on top of our needs.   I had the Sundance omelette and I have no complaints. Wow it was tasty! I will be back.

XiCwYq3ww82bPoecK0Iwzg.text: Breakfast here was amazing and the portions are huge! Friendly staff made the experience just that much better. Loved it! Sad I didn't get the banana nut muffin but hopefully I'll visit when I go back and try it.

Ag_NecCJqYXKMnwGZgawsg.text: My wife and I have eaten breakfast here 3 days of our 7 day honeymoon so far. For a great reason, its only about ten minutes off of the strip and its only around 10-13 dollars a person depending on your order. They leave a good pot of hot coffee on the table if you order coffee. The food is incredible, I would make a recommendation but everything my wife and I have ordered so far has been delicious, I don't think you can go wrong with any menu item. And those banana nut muffins are stellar!!!!!!

xU23Bu3gHKinCP0MpfnSOg.text: Food was EGG-ceptional!! Customer service was also great . I had the sunrise and that shit was bomb af

k0PNbzjY_cgZAGi61pMh9w.text: I usually don't write reviews but made the exception all because of our server Patrick! He was amazing! I hope Egg & I knows how lucky they are to have him. Very friendly, attentive & gives the best customer service so thank you Patrick for making our experience so great! :)

5aAykPhOjnqBXHKe9uGH6A.text: It was just ok,  the banana nut muffin was the only thing that really good. The potatoes that came with my corned beef hash was too salty for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham, sausage, bacon skillet
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham, sausage, bacon skillet

n34kAQkEfuoxLGErSh5wfA.text: Just another ordinary breakfast place.  I didn't think this place was anything special.  The restaurant is located inside a plaza.  We went on a Saturday and we got seated right away, no wait.  But as we left, there was a line and that was around 1:00pm. I love corn beef hash and so I had to try their corn beef hash.  It came with eggs and toast (can choose muffin instead of toast) and if you check in on yelp you get a free banana muffin.  Our waitress forgot ours but we didn't make a big deal about it.  Corn beef hash was shredded style and I thought it was below par.  Not the best corn beef.  The place reminded me of another Dennys. Dennys being better. The restaurant also sells merchandise and sauces at the entrance.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash with eggs and toast

7CNKE-vqypWRMUD5jJ-YXQ.text: This was an average breakfast restaurant.   Descent food.  Buttermilk biscuits yummy.   Service very good.  short wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L71-Y4pga7uZ1CbLPCnZZg.text: This is my go to spot every time I am in Vegas! I even bought myself a coffee cup!   Bacon avocado omelet with sour cream, little chunks of bacon in the egg and slices of fresh avocados inside the omelet with cheese and topped with a nice helping of sour cream.   Banana nut muffin x 2 please, I take one to go.  Every bite has a crunch of nut, they serve it warm, which is the best way to eat it!  My unlimited amount of coffee refills!   The breakfast here is awesome and the portions are huge. I usually end up taking half of everything home, yes back to LA!

pQ860x6R3IJ83ij3kVoCoQ.text: This place went beyond my expectations! Food was great and the portion was large. Keep that in mind because I ordered too much haha. The service was wonderful as well, I definitely recommend! I got the sunrise mountain and it was so yummy--however there was so much cheese stacked on top that it was overpowering but if you like cheese this would be a great dish. Would come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise mountain, pancakes, and banana nut muffin! So yummy.

1J8h4tBiDQk65z2k1L_omg.text: The food is good. It can get very crowded at times. They have a statue egg on every table, so when you need something you can flip it to show an unhappy egg face. Pretty cute. Over all we enjoy coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R3N5BDVAR7JdcvgUAr9CNw.text: What a find. Came here yesterday for our first time. Saw the line and thought there would be a long wait. To my surprise, it was only 15 minutes. Had the center cut pork chops. Cooked to perfection. Our waitress was Tamara and she was very friendly and attentive. Came back today for another visit and still packed, but seated quickly. Oscar was our waiter this time. Suggested the Bloody Mary's. Very tasty. Nice suggestion. Oscar was very attentive as well. Staff is great. Having the Country Fried Chicken Steak today. Kudos to the ownership. Man, what a goldmine. Great food and great service equals great success, but they already figured that out !!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs. The bomb!!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chops and eggs...Yummy

mZNCuH3h-p4v9y0oejviqw.text: Skillet potatoes are amazing.  Always quick and good service. French toast and pancakes were much better than the waffle

QsZtcmIVanoCf_DXUnUVBw.text: We were leaving our hotel one morning, (Caesars) and the valet asked if we needed directions anywhere. We asked if there was a great place to eat breakfast off the strip but not too far away. She said "Egg & I, its where all the locals eat." IT WAS SO GOOD! It was about a 10 min. car trip from Caesars but TOTALLY WORTH IT! I had THE BEST Home fries ever! I dont know what seasoning they use, and would LOVE to find out, but they were amazing! My son had pancakes and they were so soft and fluffy! The coffee is left in a urn on your table so you don't have to wait for refills. They have french vanilla creamers too. The service was wonderful! The place is so cute and I can guarantee I WILL GO BACK on my next vacation to Vegas. It is well worth the trip! Great prices! Great service! Just downright YUMMY! LARGE Portions too! Be warned..you wont be hungry the rest of the day! Coffee is really good too and I DONT Drink folgers!

OY_1yRonCKB5vQfClXFQKA.text: Two days into a five day stay in Vegas, we were looking for someplace other than the always overrated hotel buffet for breakfast.  Our parking valet saw our perplexed looks and asked what we needed.  When replied "breakfast" he immediately suggested "The Egg & I".  We plugged it into our GPS and boy, were we glad we did!  This place is the best.  Since we were there during the week, there was no wait but busy.  The menu was so extensive my husband and I took at least 10-15 minutes just to read and decide.  We wanted EVERYTHING!  I went for the Piggy Skillet and was absolutely overwhelmed.  It was fabulous.  My husband and I were so pleased with the food and service, we made sure this was the last place we ate before leaving town.  And I took a banana nut muffin on the plane home. I wanted to buy a whole loaf but my husband gave me a dirty look.  I gained four pounds while I was in Vegas and I am sure three of them were courtesy of The Egg & I!

fHplXOIa_PhIF4zq0quTUg.text: My wife and I found this place via Yelp and with the help of the turn by turn navigation, discovered the BEST breakfast we ever had!!  The banana nut muffin comes before the meal and it is SUPERB!!  Everything we ordered was FANTASTIC!!  The eggs (over-easy), the bacon, the link sausages, the pancakes, and of course the waffle (loaded with strawberries and whipped cream) could not get any better.  We visit Las Vegas at least 3 times a year and this time we were celebrating our 7th year anniversary.  We've done the hotel dining thing at most of the 4 & 5 star rated places and they don't even come close to being as good as the Egg & I.  We do have to thank Denny's for being so awful the morning before and that is what led us to the BEST BREAKFAST in fabulous Las Vegas.  Being from Hawaii, it was a pleasant surprise to see a "hawaiian" section in the menu.  A lot of Hawaii people visit the 9th island and we will definitely be telling our friends about this wonderful eatery on West Sahara.

OalH6ov3vyXUZii5Ofd1VA.text: Never, ever disappointed!  Good service.  great food!  I have TOO many favorites from the banana nut muffins to the seasoned French fries, from the Prime Rib eggs Benedict to my current love, a chile rellanos omelet!     when I let my family pick a place to meet for breakfast or lunch, the consistently pick TheEgg and I. . .or their "sister restaurant" The Egg Works!

8CFTNmgB8VReieNCdHKujg.text: The Egg & I has the freshest eggs you can get at a breakfast restaurant! My scrambled egg whites were fluffy, light, and delicious! Their homemade banana muffins were yummy and their fruit was fresh! The restaurant itself is quaint and adorable. And you can't beat the price (especially if you've spent the weekend shelling out tons of money for food on The Strip!) This place is definitely worth going out of your way for if you're visiting Vegas!

RbD2pkqUbAG-k8yTfO680Q.text: I was sort of skeptical about eating here because it just looked another midwestern chain breakfast place.  I had the eggs benedict.  Really good and the eggs were perfect (not overdone).  My fiance happily shared the banana muffin which was really tasty.

tWLF8s3vDlTptktZFR4caw.text: This was the best find in Vegas! Not only was the food delicious and very resonable, but the staff was remarkable. Our server and the manager went out of the way to make our dining experience most memorable. I highly recommend Egg and I to everyone!

FmyuLEzXDCKPBP-wpbteCw.text: if i'm gonna talk about finding great breakfast spots in SF, i have to give all something to compare. a real LV gem with one of the largest and most diverse breakfast and lunch menus i've ever witnessed. the  "homey" feel is exponentialized by the great service (a rarity in SF). and for those midwestern transplants searching for a little bit of home, check out the Cincy chili (served every way you can imagine, with the real deal stuff shipped straight from Ohio). god, i'm salivating like a damned Pavlovian puppy!

Jk0HhoheCO7DXivjHRWRRw.text: I went here for breakfast on a recommendation and I will be back every time I'm in Vegas, period. Portion size and price mean very little if the food is not worth talking about. This was breakfast heaven. The wait staff was outstanding (ask for Sam if she's there), the service was prompt, the portions were plentiful, the price was appropriate for the size of the portions and the food was absolutely phenomenal. Get the banana nut muffin whether it's included or not. It was so good, it tasted like a dessert. To add butter or anything else to it would be a crime, it was perfect the way it was. My wife had waffles with strawberries and whipped cream. Typically, she does not eat large portion meals without sliding some of it across the table to me. She polished off the whole thing. I had some kind of special that came with four scrambled eggs mixed with bacon, spinach, mushrooms and loads of cheese and some kind of side of potatoes that was eye-rolling awesome. I've been on this planet for over half a century and I honestly don't remember the last time I had a breakfast that tasted this good from start to finish. According to Sam, everything on the menu can be modified or customized to taste and size. This place is almost a reason to go to Vegas if for no other reason. I highly recommend it.

xdxBH_JGRiaVvE3FtXMBEQ.text: Terrible.  Stick to the excellent egg kitchens on the strip rather than venture out to this strip mall outpost.

8WrET3l1Nx4V1dEc2Pev1g.text: Cute family diner. I had a great experience at Egg and I. We came here around 12 which was to my benefit because I cannot stomach anything during the morning time. It was so hard to choose something from the menu...everything sounded so good! They have something for everyone. I had the the "Egg-Ceptional Omelette" with a side of country potatoes and my, was it exceptional! The omelet was loaded with sausage, diced ham, onions, tomatoes, sliced mushrooms, bacon, and cheese...and topped with sour cream. yummm! My husband had our usual...eggs benedict...and that was very delicious as well. The portions are huge! My husband eats like a beast...and I, like a man...and we still couldn't finish our food. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. She came back periodically to tend to us with a huge smile on her face. Also, the food came out very fast! My tasty and fulfilling brunch definitely prepared me for a long and crazy day-night on the strip.

4FNRE0xo_NAEwaIDW1wYwQ.text: The food was great. Good customer service! The food came out fast and hot. Great experience in VA. Thank you!

IzE8sUU0NDf8rwzCzvoL3g.text: Visited this location when I was in Las Vegas for a convention. We drove off the strip to take care of some business and glad we chose Egg & I for our breakfast. They were packed but the wait for indoor seating for only a little over 5 minutes. They offer Hispanic style breakfast and their potatoes are AMAZING. My sister got the Mexican Omelette that came with 6 different kinds of fruits; grapefruit, watermelon, pineapple, orange, cantaloupe, and honeydew. They were all impressively fresh and sweet! I ordered the "Works" egg skillet with poached eggs (you can get eggs any way you like) and the portion is so large that I was only able to eat half of it. Make sure to go for their homemade banana muffins because these are the best I've had. I also received a free one at the time of this review from checking in on Yelp! BE WARE OF THE ZIOSK TABLETS on the table! I just clicked on a couple of things to check the options out and was unknowing charged $1.99 for game play. Mind you, I didn't even play the game! I am usually very careful and read all the fine prints and I can assure you that the price was not mentioned! I was under the impression that it was all free. I'm sure it's a problem for families as children gravitate to these tablets while waiting for the food. Other than that, service was fast and friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best banana muffins ever!

C_FUDcm1qLipAyDqlHh4Hg.text: After desperately trying to get a good breakfast amongst the Las  Vegas  casinos we decided to get away from the strip and try a local favorite. The largest breakfast menu I have ever seen. Country fried steak was awesome ! And the eggs Benedict were amazing as well!

7javl5eJ4xC_eYx1srTExQ.text: Food tasted awesome.. Banana Nut Muffin nice and warm...  The Pigs Omelet very cheese and full of meat....

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UHs2DdAYnwtlcuN7LxZ3Aw.text: EGGCELENT!   Really this is a 4.5 .   First time there and I can't wait to go back. I love Mexican food. I love omelets. Put them together and I'm in heaven. I didn't know if I should order the chili rellano omelet the Mexican... I went with .....  The chicken enchilada omelet was delish! I had reservations because I normally eat green enchilada sauce. This was smothered in a homemade enchilada sauce which was very good.  The potatoes surprised me too. I didn't expect to like them because there was no onion or bell pepper, just some red seasoning. But they were good also.   A variety of smuckers jellies ready for your toast and they even have a variety of flavored coffee creamers. My only complaint was that the carafe coffee is on the weak side. That's the reason they couldn't get that 5th star.    So I can not wait to go back and try something else.   Oh, did I mention the staff? They are great!! Very attentive and caring. They have the cutest way to signal that you need attention.  I'm not going to tell you. You'll have to go and see for yourself.

b6BU4evc7WmMj26luDSXZg.text: Big menu executed well great coffee great service. Clean Healthy opinions, smaller portions appreciated Nice to get real off the strip

lju0Zcw43_XFEfBkY17UBA.text: Came here for an afternoon lunch and ordered the ham, bacon, and sausage skillet with scrambled eggs on top. Also, I checked in on yelp for a free banana nut bread. The portion size was huge. I only ate 1/4 of it. The food was just okay. Just your average American breakfast and lunch items. The service was okay but the server didn't mention anything about paying on the touch screen pad that was on the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ham, bacon, and sausage skillet with scrambled eggs on top.

MxH-2c30h3sVbNob8AcwFA.text: Another great breakfast here. The Santa Cruz chicken skillet was spicy and plentiful. Chicken is sliced slivers along with chorizo and green chilies it really hits the spot.    Thanks kitchen staff and Tamara.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ml8Jh1hHZrh9QCVVCTqN3A.text: Delish! Loco Moco and chicken fried steak was eggtastic!  Banana bread was so fluffy and yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yfM-FVXRJ0py1nR8UFTazg.text: Good service.  Lots of breakfast options.  Good selection of kids breakfast meals.  Reasonable pricing.  Fast service.  Professional waiters.

Is8UOf6srTBaVWmfAHYlQA.text: Buzzing restaurant! We arrived at about 8.45 am on the last Sunday. Parking was no issue at all. All the tables were taken so we put our name on the wait list and were quoted 20-30 minute wait time. About 20 minutes in we received a text message, that our table was ready to be seated. The had 2 hosts, one was seating, one was just adding to the waitlist. The entrance area was extremely crowded due to many guests waited for their table. We were seated and our server immediately greeted us and asked for our beverage order. We ordered coffee, apple juice, waters and placed our order for the famous cinnamon roll. We received out drinks within few minutes. Our server asked if we were ready for our order and we were as we previously studied the menu. We ordered corn beef hash served with breakfast potatoes and 2 slices of wheat toast, blueberry pancakes with eggs and bacon. Right after we were served the cinnamon roll and OMG, please order one if you like cinnamon rolls. The icing was melting into the dough which was so warm, fresh, and fluffy. We just looked at each other and agreed how delicious it was. The cinnamon roll was eaten quickly. We received our order about 8 minutes after. The Corn Beef Hash is served in a skillet with eggs on top and a generous portion fried breakfast potatoes that were well seasoned. The blueberry pancakes were nice and fluffy and my girl only was able to finish one of the two due to the size.  All the food was very delicious and the service was quick and friendly.  We will certainly return on our next LV visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon roll

Jm5a12rUntNMWn0onmeeuw.text: So dope! You gotta get here. Bargain and delicious! Great service. I'm stuffed but feeling fat and wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This sas a mashed potato omelet filled with bacony goodness! Skip the fried potatoes and add fruit next time. #foodcoma #worthit
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy Sweet Mother of G-d! This was the bomb.com!!! Waffles with strawberries and cream!
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is amazing!!

yv6-gkNs5Lk-N4KsVnPfpw.text: My favorite breakfast place of all time I go their very often the food is amazing the people are nice and the prices are not ridiculous I would recommend this over any other breakfast place

S-qdkTsuPhz-NZVJBsdXFA.text: This is my 2nd time here. Good breakfast spot off the strip. The breakfast potatoes can have lots of seasoning and salt so if you don't want too much ask for lite seasoning.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1MlUnnAxu39bG3Pm7dCZCA.text: I found this and bookmarked it prior to our trip.  Food was great and if you check in you get a banana nut muffin - my hubs and I split it prior to our meal arriving.  Very delicious.  Staff was extremely friendly.  Food was great - they only do pancakes in 2 so usually my husband substitutes the toast for one pancake.  They don't do that here.  He enjoyed the pancakes and also enjoyed his Chicken fried steak order.  Portions are very large I could have split with him.  I ordered a ham, bacon, sausage skillet it was super yummy and a glass of OJ.   The OJ arrived late - however being pregnant I wasn't sure if I had really ordered it.  My husband didn't hear me order it so I thought I didn't so that is why I didn't ask the waitress.    Everything was very enjoyable and I will be back next time I am in Vegas. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nNBClLpOnXCPIMdw-H1Ytw.text: I saw this place on Yelp and while it is a fair distance from the strip in a Lyft, we figured that the good reviews might make it worth it (also likely less pricy than brunch on the strip)  The wait was only about 10 mins. They do pride themselves on service and our waitress was a doll.   You get a free banana muffin with Yelp Check in. But the portions are so huge we didn't really need it - INSIDER TIP - after we were all done, the waitress told us you could get Half orders of almost anything. (wish we had known)  I had the corned beef hash, which was okay. My man had the chili relleno omelet (he loved it) and my friend had the huevos with carnitas, (and green sauce) - IT WAS OUTSTANDING)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili relleno omelet.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was amazing. Huevos rancheros with carnitas. Added the guac.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash. Just okay.

Ir5dCspNc1kB4sj1I3L6Ig.text: Great place to eat! Environment was family friendly. The staff was great. Service was fast and the food was amazing! Definitely will be coming back when we are in the area!

igUFxZSlPzCM43CSpWPRFw.text: Service is excellent, we had Penny as our server. Food was good not amazing but good. Perhaps our selection wasn't as popular as some of the other diners. I would say the menu is quite large, good for large parties! Not sure I would want to leave the strip to eat here but heck it's an expensive experience (cab ride to and from). Overall left stuffed and breakfast leftovers for tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGEEEE PORTIONS
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RKKTxA4ewzGYBdBGRtDTkQ.text: There was about a 30 minute wait but it was well worth it. The wait staff was nice and food was hot and fast.  The prices were great for the amount of food you get! The Best breakfast place we have found since moving here in September. We will be back and probably often.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8zdKtjbotI6Agtd9pUzQEw.text: Finally tried this place out after hearing from my friends that this is one of the best breakfast spots and I was underwhelmed. When you arrive you put your name on the list and they will text you when your table is ready which is nice if you wanna stand outside since the inside is super crowded. We went on a Wednesday morning around 10:30 AM and there was about a 20-minute wait. They have some benches inside to sit but that also serves as a storage unit so people were always asking us to move to get to the supplies under the benches which was kinda annoying.   Once we were seated we waited for about 10 minutes for our server. Another server noticed we were waiting and she kindly stepped in and took our drink order. Our actual server was not as friendly and did not seem apologetic for the wait and just asked us "what do you want" which was slightly off-putting...  For food, we ordered the Prime Rib Benedict which was too salty and the meat was way overcooked so we ended up not even eating the meat. We also ordered the corned beef which was just okay. The best part was the banana nut muffin so definitely try that out! The portions of the food were decent so if I go back I would order something else.

l7Gun0SsBTCbVbhQUPw9Gg.text: They have everything you could possibly want for breakfast.  4 of came here, each of us ordered something different and all enjoyed it.  Pancakes, skillets, steaks and chicken fried steak where all winners with us. Those ranch potatoes are perfect with eggs.  This place definitely has breakfast right with something for everyone.  Definitely worth leaving your hotel and driving a short distance from the strip.

KO_yLe7JuqGi8_NOe0hRyQ.text: I enjoy eating here they never disappoint although the service at this location is a bit slow at times

jBSMZjP6g8gme-VIYkDWUg.text: This is the best hangover breakfast spot in all of Vega$$!   The following reasons will state "how come:"  BIG MENU HUGE PORTIONS DELICIOUSLY GREASY PORK PRODUCTS FRIENDLY STAFF EXTREMELY INEXPENSIVE CLOSE TO FREEWAY  Just go already!

POVdyOIj6YLBMy8p1H0gAQ.text: The food at Egg and I is good if you order the right thing. I had the scramble and it was just ok. However, the turkey sausage, French toast Diablo potatoes are great. The homemade banana nut muffins are to die for. I was most impressed with the muffins and our server Roman left nothing unattended.  He's one of the best I've had in any restaurant.  Great customer service all the way around.  If I'm back in Vegas I'll come back.

fiSYlkH5t12kogSaDYI8pw.text: While the food is good this place has the worst service.  We walked in to the 2 hostesses who seemed annoyed we came and then waited until after they finally finished their conversation to seat us.  Needless to say they had no other customers besides us.  The server came over and when I asked if I could get the Works Scramble as a Works Skillet he rolled his eyes and said they already had one and it was the same.  However, it is not the same.  It has 2-3 of the same ingredients and all the rest were completely different.  After we got our check and went to the front there were 3 ladies up there, who again, completely ignored us until their conversations were over.  THE WORST SERVICE.

XTq0KgbPChnsrhVI2Byj1w.text: Food was great. Service was not so good. Got my food well after everyone else at my table. I would def go back tho for the breakfast

D9C1Mx6VFhDGrzW8suGmfw.text: Husband and I came here for a quick bite the day we left Las Vegas heading to the airport. The parking lot was packed to the brim, but we only waited maybe 15 minutes at most. Service was fast, waitresses were kind and quick. Husband ordered the hash skillet it was amazing, like, mouthgasm amazing. When it came to the table it didn't look like it was going to be that good, but wow. I ordered a chicken fried steak breakfast with over easy eggs, gravy was portioned well, not overly done, steak fried perfectly, not greasy, but crispy even with the layer of gravy. Their potatoes are pretty interesting diced/cubed with like a season salt, have a nice crunch to them. The portion sizes here are absurdly large, I think we could've easily shared one of these breakfasts plates and been satisfied. We both weren't able to finish either plate. They also come with a side of toast or a muffin. Only downside I'd say is the coffee price is a bit on the steep side, but they do leave you a jug, at your table so you don't need to flag someone down and you're supplied with all your needs at your table.

JApKSsLHDpMyf6Clp_fRtg.text: Massive portions drowned with pots of decent coffee. Service is prompt and cheery. Great for groups

7GUy0i0dRyvv1IseE_Lnsg.text: Biggest portions ever!!! Very reasonable pricing and husband loves this place. Lines can be very long sometimes but it's worth the wait. The banana nut muffin is really good and the potatoes are really sprinkled with crack. No lie. Haha.

QyQVT8WvYmtOJub7m2GH9g.text: Huge portions at reasonable prices.  Friendly staff and clean facilities.

UhUIliH-DhAbvfO8x-t-nA.text: Every time I come to Las Vegas I hit up the Egg and I for it's yummy food. This trip was no different and once again it delivered. I love the potatoes and my banana nut muffin was quite tasty. In addition to the great food, the service was also amazing. Our waitress Amanda was so nice and friendly. Hope to get her as my waitress next time I visit!

BOaPixpVxDg300AIZn-9aQ.text: Cute spot. Has their own touch. Nothing special, but still good. They used very nice fruit, too. I'd eat here again for sure.

RGGeBs0fX2Fd-UF4RFc6CQ.text: This place is PACKED and for good reason - everything on the menu is delish! Crisp bacon, Rueben sandwiches on homemade rye bread, banana nut bread muffins dripping with butter, and oh by the way - the staff is exceptional! I would take a cab from The Strip for breakfast again at this place!

gCHcw5SUQletzmKvCY1NAA.text: A must stop in Vegas! Love the banana nut muffin. All food is great here!

H9NzvHFw-YqM1uSSdqyPQA.text: On our way out of Vegas I decided to try this place. I love eggs for breakfast and found this place on yelp. Thx fellow yelpers. You didn't disappoint. It's not too fat from the freeway and easy to find  The banana muffin was awesome. I inhaled mine so fast. I had the Brad's special with the yummy ranch potatoes. The price was great too. I'm definitely coming back here when I'm in Vegas.

rvccCzXVVGzDq_VPTAEzTQ.text: I went here with a friend on Saturday AM. We arrived at 10 and it was packaged. Easy 30 minute wait which I find kinda baffling as the food and place is O-So- Average. However it seems like a popular stop for lots of locals. I ordered the Sicilian Skillet, and was not impressed. It was really bla and nothing to write home about for sure. The food was okay but not really anything you cant get at a Denny's IHOP, or countless other places like, that.

APFWzmT3iRNU__Crpz4bRQ.text: Great service, great food, great price; this place is THE place for breakfast...   Only comment is that the potatoes were a bit salty for my taste, but substitutions were readily available.  We went three of the five days in Vegas, will definitely go again.

bEgKIAETJbwzyuITd2yLDQ.text: Had a great breakfast there yesterday morning. Service was great; Samantha did a great job. Food order was taken promptly and food brought to our table in a timely manner.  My wife had the breakfast burrito; which she loved and I had the Portuguese sausage and eggs with the banana nut muffin (a must). Overall very please with the food, service and will return again.

VfVdVmK4p6YyLWXGBrSLIQ.text: First, no cream for my coffee. They didn't ask or bring. Checked menu on line before we went, but this location did not have the crabcake benny. My daughter ordered a coke, they brought diet. Yuck! Food came but no forks to eat it with. I got the veggie Benny. Too much lemon in the hollandaise. Probably would have been great with the crabcakes. My daughter got the buttermilk pancakes. Chewy?  And they said that can happen when you add syrup. Really? Doesn't happen at I HOP. The manager was very concerned we didn't like our meal and took off the pancakes since they weren't eaten. The only reason I gave 2 stars. We did have 2 servers, and the 2nd was better,  but I won't be back.

tRBQia1vzJgKiHo39f1FSA.text: stopped by sunday 8am crowded but no wait yet waitress friendly/attentive food spectacular banana muffin was tasty

9U40r9b15s_4251cOCx_-Q.text: Best breakfast anywhere.  I lived the skillet.   And make sure you get the muffin.

R1WYOgUXUlFRaHBdIh-O8g.text: Probably one of the best breakfast places I've ever had in Las Vegas! My husband and I ate here on a Friday morning but thought we would have to wait awhile because it was full, however, we got seated right away and our food came out fast. I ordered the classic and it was very good. Our server Chance was very nice and made us feel welcome. Their bus boys are very efficient as well, as soon as people left they cleaned the tables in no time so that people who were waiting didn't have to wait long. Overall, very happy experience :)

91ALBOJ8JLI92pd8tWmGPQ.text: There was a 2 hour wait for our first choice restaurant, so we went down the street to Egg and I, and I'm so glad we did. They were able to sit our huge party (16 people) in only 20 minutes on a busy Sunday morning. The service was excellent, they were there to refill waters, coffees, and juices before we even realized they were empty. They have a helpful little sign where you can flip it to yellow if you need assistance at your table - we never had to use it once.   The food was also amaaazing. I am a huge breakfast fan and have been to tons of breakfast places. They had the best chicken fried steak I've ever had, and there was so much of it I had the leftovers for lunch and was full all over again. Definitely worth the price. They give you so, so much food! And it tastes great. Everyone at the table loved their food. Whenever I visit Vegas in the future, I will be SURE to stop by again, because I was blown away!

brGX-2elHJw-kOPMKadRCQ.text: I normally hate buttermilk pancakes everywhere but the pancakes here are stellar honestly! Everyone should eat here, super affordable and delicious. Send Paula to Disneyland she's awesome

Qf3WOJqJa_2pdeT_IbaHBA.text: My friends who frequent Las Vegas highly recommended this place to me! Thank you Maria M. and Dave O.!!  This breakfast joint is cute, welcoming and homey. It gets pretty packed during the weekends, especially with big parties, so be prepared to wait! But if anything, the food is worth the wait.  The selection of different types of dishes included dozens of omelettes done all kinds of ways, eggs benedict, eggs florentine, egg crepes, skillets, and i could go on and on because they also have sandwiches, french toast, and seriously I can go on..   I got the ham and mushrooms skillet with blue berry muffin. The muffin was moist and fresh! The skillet was their infamous ranch potatoes topped with ham and mushrooms with a layer of melted cheeses and two eggs done however you liked. Honestly, it looked super huge and I thought I would not finish it, but it was so good I annihilated that sucker!  My friend tried the ultimate skillet which had ham, bacon,  sausage and other goodies, but he said that it was waaaay too many things going on in one dish. So unless you like something super hearty and packed, try the ultimate skillet, if not, choose one or two ingredients to put into it.  Service was super friendly and kind. On the table there are these flip cards with a happy and sad face. Put up your happy face is your party is doing fine, but if you need anything put up the sad face and a server will attend to you quickly.  When I come back to vegas, this is a definite visit, especially after a big hangover!

zIOTjfomOjOGdnfryihaUA.text: The food was very good and our waitress, Jessica, was absolutely amazing and kept up with our orders!

2TKtrekTDKWniL4Y0Q4d3Q.text: Was a Fan of this place until recently. Stopped in real quick to pick up one of their delicious "homemade" blueberry muffins. Was quite disappointed when I was handed a Sara lee muffin still in the wrapper and sent on my way. They charged me $2.50 for this muffin I could have gotten at any gas station for 50 cents. Extremely underwhelmed today.

PIZUbMCAVY_Y4m14qYPFRg.text: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME food!  A normal trip to Vegas for me and my girlfriend tends to be limited to the strip, but having driven out from San Diego, we decided to venture away from the concrete jungle for breakfast.  I looked on yelp, found this place and we started driving.  Here's all you need to know:  1. There were a lot of people waiting outside, and we almost just left.  For a two-top, we waited 20 minutes (which seemed more than reasonable for a Saturday morning). 2. The food came WICKED-FAST.  Like, 5 minutes MAX.  2 orders of eggs bene and a plate of pancakes.  CRAZY FAST. 3. I am an eggs benedict officianado, and theirs was MAGNIFICENT.  The eggs benedict was probably the best I've ever had, and the "ranch-style" potatoes that accompanied it were fantastic as well. 4. The prices were very reasonable.  100% Guaranteed that I will come back to this place next time I'm in Vegas.  RANDOM NOTE:  After picking up our pup from a doggy hotel near the airport, we considered driving way back to this place for breakfast one more time.  By PURE LUCK, we saw a sign for "Egg Works", stumbled in and discovered that it was the SAME COMPANY.  1 in a million chance and a very happy ending for our trip.  The food was equally as good as The Egg and I.

eiswuirymL55SJUmyn_AcQ.text: Excellent service and food this afternoon.  Ate on the patio with my neighbor and my little dog.    I love this restaurant.  The staff always goes the extra distance to be sure you are having a great experience.

Sm0As6uviowioDALI8DYGQ.text: I got the chicken fried steak, it was good but I've had better. The coffee was awesome!  We also got the blueberry pancakes and they were great!  My husband tried the prime rib skillet. It was really good. The only real complaint we had were that the potatoes were awful. Boring an way too salty!!!!

LHFJEWMVWbtBZUdxRIRkVA.text: always a great place to visit for breakfast :-D I highly recommend ranch potatoes! small, bite-size, seasoned potatoes are sooooo good!   I also love their banana nut bread. it comes with a lot of the entrees and it's so moist and delicious!   they have a similar service style like bumba gump (where if u needed assistance, u would turn your sign to "stop forest, stop!"). they have a happy egg face and sad egg face if u need service

6HlybgQ8mvOgl_mT396fsg.text: Went to this place today after seeing that this place had over 1000 reviews in yelp...was not disappointed. The ambience of this restaurant is very good..staff is friendly... The freshly made banana nut muffin was awesome!!!!. The waitress at my table was Chance and had provided excellent service...i did not find any reason to give this business less than 5 stars.

9uXyT0PmeiVAlgFXJyG19g.text: Food is pretty average. Service is spotty at best.   There are 2 girls working the front counter. One blond who was really stand-offish and borderline rude when I approached the front...I was standing there for nearly 1 minute wondering how to get on the list, when the other one, the brunette came by and asked the blond to put my name on the list. All this time, the blond was just standing around, twirling her hair. The brunette was friendly and made sure my name was on the list. The rude blond really did not care...wonder how many potential customers she has driven away already.   So, I wont visit again, just due to the rude way in which I was treated at the beginning

oo2Gb0sB4cQ4yN5fGE_kdQ.text: If someone were to ask me where do you want to go to breakfast, I would always pick this place. The famous Habla Diablo potatoes are amazing. I always ask for food server Genesis. She is very polite, super attentive and has a great personality. They have an egg face on you table and if you need anything just flip it to a frown face and any one of the staff will come help you. I haven't had to use it because Genesis is always checking on us. I highly recommend this as a breakfast hot spot.

i38QoEJMAE0TorI1-hfbuw.text: The place has a "cute" charm to it right down to the animated and creatively named food menu. Choices that could easily satisfy the appetites of any family. Service was excellent from the hostess to our waitress Chance! She helped us make the perfect selections and checked in with us frequently.  My 13 year old said we need to come back tomorrow to try all the yummy sounding dishes.

CarIiA3JobjOP8KWygfjPw.text: Had breakfast yesterday, 20 minute wait, this place is always busy on Saturday mornings and it was no different on this visit.  Prompt beverage order and delivery. Had the Cincy chili omelet, was good again. The Banana Nut muffin is the best-hands down. We had one issue with an omelet and this was quickly resolved by our server.

etjFgOIUHx6TkhPrVpmfRA.text: Friendly staff. Great service. Super delicious banana nut french toast. Yummy seasoned potatoes. Great value for the portion. I will definitely eat here again when I come back to Vegas.

cQr2XSRyuWjT2sF4H439Mw.text: Eggcellent! We've been twice and enjoyed every bit of this great breakfast place! The place is packed and there is always a wait, but 15 minutes of my time is fine by me as long as I am going to enjoy the food. If you know my reviewing you will see that service, and location are not heavy factors in my rating. I am a total foody, so what is most important is the taste, the quality, and selection of foods offered. What I ordered this time was the Bandito omelette, I enjoyed it. The last time I ordered the Chile relleno omelette, it was delicious! I liked it more than the Bandito. it came with a banana but muffin, which I finished even I told myself to fight the temptation. my kids ordered the strawberry stuffed French toast, I forget the name of it but it was stuffed with cream cheese and strawberries. they wanted to lick the plate. When we go to Vegas we won't have to think twice about it, we will be there.

0q7HNEYyQadBE1pAv2yLig.text: The best restaurant meal I have ever eaten was at The Egg and I in Las Vegas  I thought about this long and hard to make sure I am not exaggerating. The best meal I have ever eaten was the breakfast I ate on my trip to Las Vegas t at The Egg and I on West Sahara. This is a locals eatery.  I ate the standard, eggs, sausage, bacon, toast, and hash browns. On the menu it is called "Eggs - Plus". I added the sausage a la carte. As I was eating, the taste of the meal brought a smile to my face.   The eggs were very good. Not greasy or salty. Very tasty.   The bacon was the best I ever had. Not too salty, not soggy, and not overcooked.   The turkey sausage was the best I ever had. Not greasy or salty. Tasty.   The hash browns were the best I have ever had. These were the square pieces of potato type of hash browns. Usually this type of hash browns is greasy, heavy, and dense. These were light, airy, and had some type of paprika seasoning.   The toast was the best I ever had. Light and fluffy whole wheat bread. Not dense.   The oj was great as well.  It is located about 10-15 minutes from South Las Vegas Boulevard. Well worth the trip!

LeqZ9apk0Eqs5ogFlQQtfA.text: Our waitress DONNA was amazing. Genuine restaurant and server. All the food was fantastic and the only thing better than the food was the marketing for a cafe style restaurant. Very impressed

EZCeQllB69t6AgzcMNMA-A.text: Absolutely fantastic breakfast. Its worth the wait, as it seems (most of the time) that the turnover is quick for such a confined space. I think the longest we waited was maybe 15 minutes?   Everything on the menu is good. The portion size is great. Service is great. We frequent this location at least once a month.   Get there early if you want to beat the crowd!

1VHfG9XbnPxR0FYI77YXTQ.text: Dope local spot. Don't let the outside talk about the food. All the food has love and you can taste it.

-BWzXCUGM6SO3mFS7445HQ.text: Wonderful! The muffins, you MUST eat the muffin!! The menu is huge so be ready.  My party & I enjoyed the food. Good portions. I'll visit again in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting to sit down and eat!!!  Yummmm!

X4Pkn_R6lP_ZzjZJMrwg3w.text: So good! Great food, awesome service!  Really great family feel with homemade cooking! Glad we looked at the Yelp reviews!

3piuKeB500LY_8Q5OZDYag.text: Lacy did an amazing job serving us and making sure we were taken care of. Food was delicious and portions were pretty large. Highly recommended.

4LSI8ZItZPi4YsBINM-CLQ.text: This is hands down the best breakfast in Las Vegas. Eat with locals!  It is off the strip just enough to shake loose the stoopid tourists!  Our waitress Cece was very attentive and service was great.

1IC9m2BwVRt--lFWDw4IWg.text: Will probably come back whenever I'm in Vegas! When my best friend and I went, the line wasn't too bad for a Sunday morning. Waited for 15 min.   It was totally worth it. We shared the Hawaiian French toast works (which is like the waffle works but with French toast, secret menu). The portions here are huge so I'm happy we shared. It was yummy and I really like the compote that it came with.   Don't forget to check in for the free banana nut muffin! We were so stuffed that we took those bad boys to go!

zdEPzBDrmiRAUAO5xUP63A.text: I was looking for something a little off the hustle and bustle of the strip. They were a little busy when we went, so there was a shirt wait. There is and option to sit outside. Luckily for us, the weather was nice and cool, so outside was just fine. You can also bring your pet with you on the outside, but you need to make sure it's well behaved. I ended up getting the eggs-taliano and a side of the chipotle hollandaise sauce. Both were very good. Since it was a little cooler outside, probably around mid 60s, I ordered some tea. It came with a couple wedges of lemon and honey. The hot water was in a thermos kettle which didn't pour that fast, so I look inside to see why and noticed that there was a bit of grime or something near the spout. Needless to say, I didn't drink the tea after that. Other than that, taste of the food and the service made up a little for that.

36QlDMyyBlQxm5-ibXzB4g.text: I use to go every Friday to this place Until now.. 8 minuets we was waiting to the server just to come and ask for the drinks.. After the drinks another 10 minuets to take our food order.. I order NY steak and eggs I asked for M and the steak was completely dry.. My girl order blueberry pancakes and got banana pancakes we asked to change it to blueberry and they say ok the problem is that for 2 pcs of pancakes took 20 minuets.. I was waiting for my girlfriend food to come buy the time the food came my food becomes cold.. I got very bad experience this time...

O1y6IccN8hmteFgrZjvwFg.text: I am not a breakfast person but this place is something I can agree to go to.    The loco moco was yummy.  The waffles was crisp and so good With the bacon.  This place gets busy so if you have a big party go early.    Service is hit and miss overall they do refill your coffee.

tDt3hDKUMifSkVgDsLq0OQ.text: We had breakfast and it was delicious. Their muffins was delicious. The hash and the omelettes were very good.

CIJCkDnMlju6u36qbVUCcg.text: We always eat here when visiting Vegas. The food and service is always excellent. Today was no exception. Manuella our waitress was very nice, prompt and helpful with a smile. Always great portions and fresh food with a laid back ambiance. Banana nut muffins are awesome. You won't regret this one.

8QZLS0FcqWEDqnXWLfTNYw.text: Very confused about the high reviews of this place. Yelp steered me wrong! Is steered a word?  We had a half an hour wait for an outside table on Saturday morning. The place was packed. I wouldn't say that the food was worth the wait. The food is similar to a greasy spoon diner but add a little spice. I feel like you could get the same quality basically anywhere? I got the omelet and it was only memorable because it was very greasy. The service wasn't particularly noteworthy, although I have no complaints. I won't be back here. This wasn't worth the trip.

JOgf3UFl7WvIdCHBdGMuSg.text: One of the best brunch places in Vegas. There were so many options on the menu that I wanted to try. Normally you go to a place an they have a couple of menu items that you want to order. This place was packed. Also they do everything with eggs down to the little thing. For example - the menu has a story on it with eggs and how the restaurant came to be and it looks like a newspaper.

EZWnEhWyJIKxDiuZG5Y3wg.text: This place always make me happy! Service and food always on point! And the potato's are excellent! Brought some of they're seasoning to bring back home!

utXfgpDSuFTPRU3AYKLETw.text: I ordered the breakfast special and it was much more than I expected. they also serve this sandwich I forgot what it was called but it had turkey in it and it was so Delicious

tVRCxXtp7tRACDHjmvDo0Q.text: Very bad customer service. Long wait queue(we had a waiting time of 45 mins) and the waitress took more time to take up the order. The food was okish.

HXacm3wq-nsfLPyFo8VBug.text: Delicious little spot in the middle of Vegas. The eggs Benedict was delicious and the French toast wow. The only minor negative detail is the way you pay. You have to go to the front and pay and sometimes there's a lot of people making a line to pay.

gfKIAc9qOTqGBO7Qqurhqw.text: First of all if you like service that alone will make you want to like this place.  After being served by Karla you will love this place.  She was very attentive And was there in a jiffy. I do love me some good service. I had the Santa a Cruz scramble which did not disappoint. For the big eaters it's big enough to split you can have your choice of Toast or their famous Banana Nut Muffin. By the way Yelp check in gets you a free Muffin. Love me some rewards. My Skillet was delicious. Very fresh with all the fixings. This place will definitely be in my Vegas rotation. Parking can be an issue it seems, but the area seems busy. Not to mention several out of town license plates which equates to people trying to get their directions straight. At any rate don't be denied. This place is worth the off the strip adventure.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QZxaskFPm7vI6c5Xy8YlKA.text: Stopped here on our way through Vegas from Utah early on a Sunday morning. The atmosphere was good, the food was fantastic and the service was quick and professional.  I recommend it, and look forward to our next visit!

U34MygEwDlfrEBb1WSSMyg.text: Visiting Vegas and saw this restaurant on Yelp and we had to go and try it! Delicious! Portions are great!  Alexa was our kind server! Great customer service and good food! Will came back when we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili replenish omelette and blackened prime rib Benny!

wI8wHlP1bR5R70EwtrsqEA.text: This is the best breakfast in town. Be prepared to wait on the weekend but they are efficient at getting people in !  It's worth the wait. Always good food and good service !

FLncW4LyTiy6hLHqSKWphA.text: Service is good nothing to write home about, seems like the kind of place you go for your first serving job. place is always packed hard to get into typical breakfast spot in Vegas. food is OK but their sausage gravy oh my God it is so good from what I can see the best thing on the menu everything else is just normal breakfast food maybe I'm just biased because I'm not a big breakfast guy. but the chicken fried steak with that gravy is the best in town. Definitely makes this place worth it.

IiwQJssjTujpQsGjD4UM_A.text: We Ubered from our hotel because we wanted a good breakfast place outside the standard Vegas strip and our hotel.  It was good drive there, BUT WORTH IT!  Great portions!  I had loco moco, not your standard breakfast but oh so yummy!  Also ordered a bloody Mary and it was awesome!    Service was friendly and fast!  Waiter had lots of recommendations, so you couldn't go wrong.  We had a table of 7 and everyone LOVED their choices for breakfast.    Good value, good portions, great service!  It's a definite return when we come back!

KpQ7YgC9kg19fGuqL22PUg.text: Very nice neat and clean sometimes there is a wait time by the door but highly recommended great food and great staff

TKaToVzgoHBatH6Yz2-WVQ.text: Very nice staff. Good food. The banana nut muffin was good and fulfilling. Def. Would go back. Super busy on a Sunday but they rock.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My bacon avacado omelette. So good.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile relleno omelette with potatoes and sour dough toast. My husband loved it.

GhcftxrB_FdKRlxOj2xoEA.text: Excellent food and equally great service. It's well worth the 10min journey from the strip and the prices are very reasonable. Would definitely recommend this joint.
