0Z0DP0ML7b1IA_YXZf4tlA.text: The best breakfast hands down! Even their service was amazing! Curtis was so helpful and made our first time experience great. Great food and great service! Their homemade muffins are out of this world. Whenever in Vegas, visit the Egg & I and you will not regret it.

2ovGeXmIUTiOrOlWlQotgQ.text: We were here the first week of January, two thing were very disappointed.... First, I can't believe they charged us $3.00 freaking dollars for a jag of hot water which I only ask for a cup so I can set up baby formula for my baby.  On top of that, no one tell us that we have to pay for hot water!  If I knew, I would've order hot tea instead of ice water... at least I got tea at the end!  Second, we tried their chili.....it was horrible!  We only had couple bites, I was kinda tired and busy taking care of the baby...otherwise I'll ask them to cancel the or exchange to something else, in the same time ask them to give me a tea bag for that $3.00 hot water cost!    We have been here few times before but this time probably will be the last!

Y4Nnk2nuemIXpTga1F0gaw.text: This place is delicious. Thank you Patric for being such an awesome waiter.  You were willing to take back my food when you found out the order was wrong. However the food was good I didn't mind.  Great food. Great service. Than you. Will be back for sure

PITtep81PJOS43rkK3OVEA.text: Great service and even better food. I had a sausage and cheese omelette. I chose the muffin and potatoes as the sides. Everything was SO GOOD. It was my second time eating here and plan on returning.

L1Xg4C76y0NnZE-1_dGDgQ.text: Bottomless Coffee. Amazing breakfast . Packeddd. Literally 50 people in line waiting at 9am . Worth the 30 min wait . Small joint but so friendly .

vvEgXb5gb5XNleV2yddAvQ.text: We had a fantastic meal here!  Great service too!!  Shared the short stack of pancakes and had an omelette!  I also ordered a Bloody Mary and it was yummy!!!

NF32pj2xwbjJafxJttTCMQ.text: Absolutely love this place.. the potatoes are amazing. Service is always great.. just learned their outside is pet friendly.. bringing our dog next time!

LMXl_aPh5NMGIkkki-aONg.text: If only all brunch spots were as good as this one. First of all, their service is amazing. We called ahead to see our wait time and they offered to put our name down, so by the time we arrived half an hour later, our tables was all ready for a group of 15 --perfect! Our server was also super sweet and constantly checked on us while even offering everyone in the table a free banana nut muffin. I did claim the Yelp check-in for the free muffin, but she was kind enough to just give everyone in our table one. What was even more wonderful was that one of our party members is allergic to nuts, so they gave her a blueberry muffin in replacement.  For food, I ordered the Chicken, Mushroom, and Spinach Skillet with sourdough toast ($10.25). I also shared with the boyfriend as he got the Stuffed French Toast ($9.75). When you're ordering here, I know your eyes are going to speak louder than your stomach, but I can guarantee that you'll be stuffed by the end of the meal. I highly recommend the Stuffed French Toast. It was the perfect blend of savory and sweet with a sausage, cheese and egg mixture folded between french toast. The syrup it comes with is lightly sweet and simply tastes amazing altogether. Of course, you'll end up a little sticky but it's worth the battle. Their potatoes are no ordinary potatoes either. They give you a plate full of potatoes covered with cajun seasoning --so delicious! Not to forget the skillet I ordered, because that was very tasty as well. They melted so much cheese over my potatoes, which was my favorite part. I only had 1/4 of the skillet and was too full to continue.  When paying, we always struggle with a huge group. They have you pay up front and were very patient to help us easily sort each order and pay efficiently. The service and food is seriously on par here, love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed French Toast.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken, Mushroom, and Spinach Skillet with Sourdough Toast.

Zgbxiq3u-2mLKR81k5vvsw.text: This location is in dire need of a remodel. Everything from the decor to the dishware and 80s style coffee mugs. The menu is quite large and takes some time to go through and decide on a choice. The service staff offered a muffin upon our arrival, which was warm,moist, and very pleasing, but deterred us from ordering it again with our meal (the muffin is offered with every meal choice). The drinks were served in plastic cups that reminded me of those my mother used in the 70s. The food was delivered warm and filled the plate. The seasoned country potatoes were well cooked and plentiful. Our server was communicative and attentive. They offer an outside dining area which is not enclosed so nasty pigeons were walking about and patrons with their dogs were seating there also. Definitely has a local following, but nothing overtly special about Egg & I.

hh3vkbVXAAKXvxfbXPP4zg.text: Food was delicious.  Service was great.  The best waitress- Liza...   one of the best places for breakfast.  They open till 3pm .  Definitely will be back ...

JbhEJrBg3UUd3FJyF08Vxw.text: I have several friends in Yelp Vegas and quite often bookmark a place that gets good reviews from them. Being a party of one I got seated quickly but many people were waiting over 30 minutes to be seated on a weekday morning because of all the folks up from Cali on Christmas break. That crowd further presented it's weight when I found out they were out of corned beef at 8:30 AM, ON A WEEKDAY! Not to fear, the diced chicken fried steak skillet thingy was great and more than I could finish. Packed as it was, service was still good.

2pzLbI9HlSt3pCS1BkTsGg.text: First time here. Visiting Vegas. Hungry.  stop in becauseI liked the sign. The food is awesome. The service was great. Thanks OSCAR. I will be back I had the "spinach Benny" it was marvelous...

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach Benny was awesome. It&#39;s the hollandaise sauce that is wonderful and so good I was dipping my potato&#39;s in it.
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just got to Vegas, Hungry, seen the sign thought it was cool. I&#39;m so glad I stopped in. Awesome service thanks Oscar. The food was Awesome.

0vwZ7RPBxAVhgPiHkJ-KQQ.text: Great service. Very large food portions. Great prices . Very large menu. Wonderful service.

gVZbCVf_uk1LYlfxsjdg6g.text: Cents here for breakfast due to a coupon we got for buy 1 get 1. My wife and daughter shared a waffle and egg meal. I had the chile relleno omelet.   We left feeling full and the meals kept us going all day long. We never needed or wanted lunch.  The food was very good. The potatoes were a little salty, but not overly so. The hot sauces they provide added just the right flavor to the omelet.   The waffle looked huge and was crisp despite being topped with strawberries and cream.   Very good value for the money. Well be back next time we're in town.

p9z7HCIUdgj-X4wrmE0CZg.text: Tamara was really awesome, great service and attitude. Really helpful and meticulous!

e8hLh1LBlhS9LftDxLqK9A.text: So I saw this place on Man VS. Food and I just had to come here when I was in Vegas. This place closed a little early (around 3pm) so make sure you get there before it closes. Eggg-citing! The decor inside is absolutely adorable. There's little dancing eggs everywhere, which was egg-cellent. (excuse the puns please) The people here are really nice and its nice being somewhere in Las Vegas where not everyone there is a tourist.   So I had the eggs florentine which was really good. My motto is the more fattening the better. The hollandaise sauce was creamy, buttery and probably loaded with saturated fat, which is completely fine with me. The eggs were poached just right, where it's firm on the outside but soft inside. The side of potatoes are really good too. This place is a must when visiting Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. eggs florentine

4aMZj7c44drk7-X8pu7owQ.text: The food was amazing!!!!! Raul is honestly the best server I have had. He was very funny and charming. He got our order right and had great recommendations for us. Awesome place to go

O52WD_mVoYkjHAeweYY2Fg.text: So I'm from Cali and found this spot on yelp. . My experience was good, I enjoy the food very much. I had the skillet, the works.. with avocado on the side. I got to say that plate was very good. Well portioned, extra avocado was not a little but a lot;), service was ok. The only thing I dislike was I set outside on the patio and there are some ugly birds that come around to eat what you drop. Kind of a distraction from enjoying my breakfast.. Positive side was it is a lot quieter then inside. Also might not be a good idea if it hot out tho. My visit on the day was just right to sit out.

I6d5Sli3Nqte_SaeW5aKdQ.text: Awesome food. The banana nut muffins are great. Have not had a bad meal here yet. Highly recommended.

S4EJCPcK05HRHTG8LMRWpA.text: It's a lot of food if you're not used to a traditional american breakfast, but it all tastes good. Carole Ann served us with a nice smile the whole time, which actually made the food even better. Whenever in Vegas, I'll stop by again.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Las Vegas

fF70nKWYQZ0SvavuZLQGkA.text: This is a new discovery by my husband.  What a wonderful new place for breakfast or brunch!  I found the price very reasonable for the amount of food they give you.  I will make sure to come here every year for my 'annual visit' to Las Vegas.  The food was great and the service was superior.  Make sure you give it a try!!

S4omMSi18I3E2eqbSJpnog.text: Best breakfast place in vegas. I'm a local and I always recommend this place to any of my friends coming from out of town. Their skillets are my absolute favorite but I have tried their omelette and it is also tasty. Service is great if you need something just flip the egg to a sad face and anyone around will come see what you need.

lTIFkV4ejmPq3S1hgFhHBg.text: The Spinach Eggs Benny and the cream cheese stuffed toast were so delicious.  Definitely a great place.  Not only the best breakfast place in Las Vegas, but the best I have been to in a while anywhere.  Hopefully you get a sweet lady named Karla.  She is a fantastic server.

J1E-jen4b0DcR2624S35Bg.text: I visited Egg and I before heading home on a Vegas trip. Hands down the best food I had the whole trip. Maybe because breakfast is my favorite? I had The Classic with bacon- two eggs over medium, bacon, potatoes, and a banana muffin. Everything was great, but the potatoes stole the show! So super crispy and seasoned marvelously! Seriously, so good. Now I have to figure out how they made the potatoes so crispy! Definitely will visit on any future Vegas trips. The service was also top-notch. My waitress was very friendly and attentive.

ch8MGah9fc2-28QId7kEmA.text: Breakfast served by Karla. Crazy Chicken Omelette and  Huevos Rancheros with carnitas. Very good! The carnitas could stand on their own in taste, but nicely accompanied by an egg and, of course, their signature seasoned potatoes. Mmm, mmm! The Crazy Chicken is good for protein lovers, with a devilish addition of guacamole and cheese. Very good in a less spicy way. Exactly what I was in the mood for! Karla, our server always came with a smile and warm attitude. This is our go-to place and the food and service once again didn't disappoint.

GsnfYeSR-8m4MPmakE6f3w.text: Great service, eggceptional food.  I wish we had such a breakfast place in Salt Lake City. Carla too amazing care of us, and our meals were prepared perfectly, even though the portions were too big.     It was my second or possibly third visit here, and it is consistently great.

bKV2SryuLUEtZWDMVvbdXQ.text: It can be a long wait but it is definitely worth it!  I've been here twice on Saturday's and usually wait between 15-30 minutes and that was for 2 people.  Can't remember what I got the first time but I know I enjoyed it because I came back for seconds. The service is great, and they even have these placards on the table to let your server know you need service instead of being that person to flag them down. Very useful. Highly recommended!

WVyqBThDJnpIG5_WYg7ZDA.text: Just had our usually great experience here with one HUGE exception - our server, Stacie, was Fabulous!! Helpful - telling us things we never knew - beyond friendly and welcoming.  It truly made our Sunday morning breakfast egg-ceptional!  And, of you are not aware (we were not), EW (Egg Works) makes terrific hot sauces - we bought the chipotle!  Gotta try them!

fdxcta8Zf0ragWEjwFSMjA.text: Great place, free banana nut muffin with breakfast for first timers! I got the western and wife got the stuffed French toast! Yum! Staff was very down to earth and welcoming!

Lf5Pf4Lg5r7RnvmBOYVaOg.text: The food is amazing, & out standing service! The banana muffins are the BEST in town!  Server:Karla

-w6Q05ejN4jwa6z3p4-t5Q.text: O-M-G!! Get yourself the banana nut muffin here! It was so freakin good, I ordered a banana nut bread to go! Yes, they sell a loaf, if you want to take it home and savor it. The banana nut muffin comes with some of the meals, but if it doesn't order it. It comes to you very warm and moist and it was one of the best things I ever ate! I swear you not.   Anyways, enough of the muff fin because the food was good and service excellent. I ordered the stuffed french toast which included scramble eggs & ham stuffed between 2 thick toast. Man of man, it was alot of food cuz I think they used 4 eggs and then u top it off with syrup. They also had the alot of ranch potatoes that came with it. YUMMY!   My friend ordered the chicken fried steak skillet. I tasted some of it and it was delicious. The gravy that came with it was just really tasty. I was hearty and I would order it next time...=)   The service was great with a egg-sign on the table if you wanted a server to come by if you needed anything. You flip it and any of the server who sees it will come to you. NICE!   This was a great place for brunch and I will be back for the banana nut muffin alone!  A much better brunch place that Hash a go go.

4wi0zNkDv7jpUA7hFc-Adg.text: Great food! I recommend the traditional eggs Benedict.  The home fries are spectacular.  We had great food and excellent service, thank you Linnea for providing us with great suggestions and great service!

phuENLSKHutbnNWzT22DAw.text: Yelp! Comes through again.  This amazing, down home excellent good restaurant is a must-stop when you're in Vegas.  Our server, Karla, was amazing and helped to fine tune our culinary needs and desires as well as help us with our order.  The food is excellent and generous.  We ordered half omelettes and had plenty left over!  I highly recommend the Egg & I and ask for Karla, you won't be disappointed.

vGNo2eWJ7VW7tUduTWUvCg.text: This was our first time coming here, and let me tell you it won't be our last! This hidden gem is off the strip, but well worth the time. It's located in a strip mall and it's obviously a local favorite. I saw a massive line, and thought is it gonna be worth the wait?? It's not a fancy place, it's homy and comfortable with lots of tables, staff and commotion of the morning rush. We were a party of 9, and expected a wait, 25 was all we waited! Our waitress was awesome! She was very attentive, and offered us a FREE banana muffins that were bomb! She took our order, and offered us some wonderful suggestions! The time of truth, the food was awesome, fresh and hot! The portions were huge! I loved this place and will definitely come back each and every time am in Vegas!!

hIE47D8lGgjqQ8s049fsQg.text: We had breakfast here by chance (stopped as we drove past) and am glad we did! Huge portions of delicious food, served up by smiling friendly people. The breakfast wrap was HUGE, tasty and oh so filling - I couldnt come close to finishing it, and was barely hungry for a late lunch. My husband loved the little crunchy home fries (think small, seasoned steak fries cut into cute little squares) as well as his omelet.  The Egg & I is on the short list of places to eat breakfast in Vegas.

GhFwld14zWqSZFkLnEMDAA.text: Yay Egg! Glad I asked Mary W. for breakfast recommendations before the trip. When I got here there was already a line but the wait wasn't too bad, perhaps about 15-20 minutes. They have a cute menu that looks like a newspaper and a huge menu to choose from. We ordered a corn beef hash and eggs benedict. Do me a favor and order yourself a corn beef hash if you go there, it's pretty darn delicious. The eggs benedict was alright, way too much hollandaise sauce, I wish they'd go easy on that. I do love the breakfast potatoes. Our waitress didn't take care of us too well but the other staff were nice and helpful. Serving was so big we didn't eat lunch that day.

bTD9IistbaptWw9tKNJbNA.text: This place was awesome for breakfast.  I'd go back to this restaurant.  Service was eggscellent!!!  Food awesome.

V45zJO0Q8SfM05_EsCVP6A.text: Egg and I is a popular breakfast / brunch spot in Vegas. Using my trusty yelp app I found this joint when looking for a hearty breakfast off of the strip where locals go. When driving into the strip mall I noticed the abundance of cars and line outside right away. We didn't have to wait too long, about 20 minutes and the staff was friendly, and the coffee was really good.... I don't know what they put in it, but it was waay better than the average coffee.   My boyfriend had the pancakes and they were fluffy and flavorful, I was somewhat disappointed in my artichoke frittata...The feta cheese was overpowering and seemed like an afterthought dumped on top and I ended up scraping most of it off. It was a daily special item, so it wasn't on the main menu. I would definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas and try one of the basic menu items such as pancakes or omelets, all of the other dishes being brought out looked great... they had good intentions with the frittata but it was less than desirable....  ** The banana muffin everyone writes about lived up to its expectations.

xPzoAbz1Ayew99F43LmqaA.text: Found this on Yelp after deciding we wanted to venture off the strip for a last-days breakfast. Stuffed French toast was awesome! And the prime rib Benedict was amazing as well, it was the perfect balance of rich and savory with fresh spinach and peppers brighten it up. Our server Linnea was prompt, friendly and knowledgable! Will be back next time in Vegas.

DK2Ep8DNvFNcxEaCVDjjEA.text: Eggcellent food, had the breakfast tostada and it was fantastic! DH had a skillet with corned beef hash. He liked it very much. Most of all the service was top notch! Raul was great! Friendly, funny and personable. This is a busy place, we are out of towners and this place treats you like family. Must visit while in town. Will return.

GYb0i-Jdnh3vQU4u6qWh1A.text: Wow, the food is amazing. Most importantly, the service could not be any better, extremely friendly. Amanda who help us is the sweetest person. Thank you.

sM92doMbvhYXvYXBQK_cwQ.text: Found this place thanks to yelp! Super friendly staff and the patio is dog friendly! Amanda our server was great! She was really attentive nice and always smiling! The food and coffee was awesome too! I definitely recommended it! You will love this place from the moment you walk in!

8l6omjle9dAS4TZe0AcjhA.text: Best local breakfast place in vegas, I love the small time mom and pop atmosphere, the food is five star, their seasoned potato square cut are amazing with the breakfast

VgHOCmJcoEXT5fQM6fsBEw.text: My BF found this place on Yelp after our first night in Vegas and I agreed to give it a shot based on all the great reviews. I had the mashed potato omelet and my BF had the country Benedict. Both were delish and a LOT of food. We also got a homemade banana muffin for free for checking in, and they gave us both one which was nice. They were delish too and so was the coffee! Our server was very attentive and friendly. Only con: we saw a few people who came in after us be seated before us but the hostess acknowledged the wait time and apologized.

wXDomspJ4IKk_YLgL8smkQ.text: Big portion of food and it's delicious.  Great service!

pCZ_XnPjiEyhLPdwdQA9mw.text: DEFINITELY WORTH THE DRIVE We found our way here by accident last year and made a point of going back this year. Everything is delicious that we have ordered. Pork carnitas skillet was perfection. Apple cinnamon pancakes were delicious as was the often-mentioned banana nut muffin. Come hungry or share...they are generous with their portions.

FN5HnC_o9MCVEwU9bjBRrA.text: Corner breakfast shop with a family atmosphere and very welcoming staff. Our server was always attentive and made the experience exceptional! Will come back again:)

e_fcL1fnZI5KZo_9b_z3Aw.text: I hate to do it, but i need to knock this down just one star. Every time I'm here, while the service is great and friendly, the place is just packed and I find the breakfast to be lackluster, compared to Egg Works.  The seating is pretty crammed, even when you get there early. We're often bumped by servers and patrons as they're making their way to tables.  I also don't love how they *only* have those season-salty potatoes and not fresh hashbrowns. They have them, but only those frozen hashbrown patties. Meh. I like homestyle potatoes, but these really seem like they're dumped out of an Ore-Ida bag.  The last time we went, I asked for my poached eggs well in my eggs benedict and they came back *very* runny both times. I can handle a little runny, but these were like, runny to the point of being almost chilly inside the yolk.  It's a texture thing and it skeeves me. I know I'm not the only one.   They were really great when I sent it back the first time, but the second time, I felt like a total pain in the ass and was embarrassed having to ask them to redo it, even though it wasn't my fault. They were gracious and took it off our bill and the 2nd time they made it, the eggs were cooked well enough. (Yes, we tipped on the full cost of the bill.)   I also am not wild about how they completely drown their eggs benedict in hollandaise to the point you can't even see the bottom and the english muffin gets really soggy.   My boyfriend's blueberry pancakes weren't that awesome either.  Kind of spongey and flavorless.  For the hype this location gets, it wouldn't be my first choice. But I know it's popular and beloved, so if someone else wanted to go, I'd go, but otherwise, I'd recommend one of their other locations.

IL-rRBOFPjKflRNZ4VkSig.text: Potato omelette. ..delish! Eggs, garlic mashed potatoes and bacon...topped with cheese and sour cream! Oh yeah...get the banana muffin instead of toast! The service was SPOT on awesome! Our server Elizabeth was the greatest ever!  Definitely coming back next time we're in town!

WoFHpnPXzpbKi-7EcARB8w.text: Love this restaurant! Excellent service, and the food was amazing! We recommend the avocado and bacon omelet. Their muffins are fabulous! Our server's name was Claudia, she was lovely! We highly recommend this restaurant!

SvSGoO0L8cazE1d6tvE4bA.text: This used to be our go-to place for breakfast when we hit Las Vegas.  For some reason, we started eating more on the strip.  But this morning we happen to be passing and decided to renew acquaintances.  Why did we ever stop going there for breakfast?  All menu items are well prepared.  The omelettes are huge.  My wife orders the toast and I the muffin, then we share.  Good coffee and plenty of it.    You always leave with the warm glow of a great breakfast and the entire bill is less than a normal tip  for a Strip breakfast.

tlrA8B5l3MoyIDSoIKqIqQ.text: This is my 2nd time here as I work out here twice a month. The food is incredible. Customer service is excellent too as the waitresses treat you like family. My waitress today, Chance (wicked cool name) got on her knees to fix my wobbily table with a screw driver. That To me is going over and above just shoving sugar packets under the problem.

-9KxcsexxcqQYXWxiwBE2A.text: The food here is amazing! I had the tuna melt and felt like I was chewing on heaven! Our server, Lindsay was so sweet and personable. I really liked her! Great service and great food!!

FQln7HNEuV5nDGUGyoGqXw.text: This is definitely the best place for breakfast.  Lots of locals here so you know it's good.   Very good prices,  and great food,  but the best service of anyplace in Vegas.   Tried the bloody Mary, excellent! !!

hTruC6kqDzhxeqDmDOxFrQ.text: Had a late breakfast here with friends during Wizard World Las Vegas in April 2015, and left a very full and happy man. Everyone at our table, from the carnivorous 12 year-old with his eggs-and-bacon with a side of bacon to my health-conscious friend with her fruit and egg whites to my own delightful blueberry pancakes was very happy and satisfied with our food. I only wish they had one of these in my hometown - I'd breakfast there often.  Big thanks to our server, Carole Ann (I believe I have the name right). She was friendly, served with a big smile, gave us some good Vegas tips, and made sure our coffee/tea was always full. You can't ask for much more.

sQ1tU-2QJtcLfbzIN0S-NA.text: Egg works on flamingo and Durango is way better. Same owners from what I know but this location was wayyyy too greasy, taste not the same at all from the muffin, to the eggs to the potatoes. I'll stick to the flamingo location.

mjzQrwT_-AeqDCDypgCvNA.text: It was my First time in. ThGreat service was great, the food awesome the egg and I review well it's definitely worth the five star review!

57MI6G1BJ9y-p48Vh2m7pQ.text: Great breakfast at a reasonable price. The staff is excellent and very courteous.  Will definitely cone again.

lEQB_7MDzkYTts0kdoCjhw.text: Emily was a great waiter, and I was very happy with the banana moffin free for doing check in, it was as delicious as the one I make, but, I did not like my food, chicken enchiladas has to much flavor, it make you thirsty, the rice was good, the fried beans more less, my husband husbandhad a Bandito Scramble, he liked it but said it was nothing amazing. The coffee was good. The restroom is awful pretty small.

Q0O9bbuTUUWf5RqzBP6L1A.text: Place was good my eggs were scrambled and I got a,free banana muffin per yelp which was nice had an overall great experience

388sMiYSDvpYoxtNVEnqGg.text: The wait wasn't too long even though it was prime breakfast time. The customer service was excellent! It seems that they're very service oriented. The banana muffins were delicious and good equality coffee. I ordered the chocolate chip pancakes because of my dire sweet tooth and I can say, it was a good choice. They were very rich I couldn't finish my food. I had some Portuguese sausage and it was a great balance. Nice and juicy. I'm coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate pancakes coffee and oj. Yum!!

bwgQlNxmu9UwbL29xeI2yQ.text: This is place gets two sunny side thumbs up from me!  It's in a crappy shopping center on the wrong side of the tracks.  No worries just walk in get yourself a great breakfast, you forget you're in North Las Vegas.  The food is great, omelettes are full of flavor, home potatoes are decent (3 stars), French toast yummy goodness, large portions, great service.  I got the crazy chicken omelette, it's one of the tastiest omelettes I've ever had, a definite must! Their home made banana nut muffin, delicious!!!  Btw, Kelsey our waitress was awesome!    Just keepin' it real eggy The Real Foodie

ELOqoAKhJp67_1JW4nWwYw.text: This place is awesome! Anyone who had bad reviews obviously didn't get the right food or listen to the recommendations from the server. The skillets are amazing! I got the works skillet with everything minus peppers add spinach. it was delicious! If you mention you are a first timmer you get a complementary banana nut muffin. Let me tell you that is one good muffin! This place is great for the price. One breakfast was 11. The food is enough to where you can share without having to get any additional items. Although the hash house is equally delicious, the price of this food compared to the hash house I would come back to egg and I before hash house. My only complaint I have is the size of the orange juice for the price. Your better off going to 711 and drinking an orange juice before you go to breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Works Skillet: bacon, ham, sausage, onions, tomatoes, spinach, cheese and their delicious potatoes. Topped with an egg

TvgJ3yOG6D4I8co0ggIskg.text: Bacon Maple Cream French Toast! Yum.  Also tried the Mexican omelette.  Omelette was ok, the hash browns were delicious.  Coffee....not great, decent.  Omelette came with the banana muffin, which was very good.  There are not to many good breakfast places near the Vegas strip, but I would return for the Bacon Maple Cream French Toast!!!!!

-VYg-E9n5v84Duu37ii-eg.text: We found this place on yelp and thought it sounded perfect.  We were right!  The menu is huge and we had a really difficult time making a decision.  We finally decided on the Country Benny and the Sunrise Mountain.  We asked about the Works potatoes.  They're diced potatoes that are heavily seasoned and then deep fried.  So in other words, heaven in your mouth.  We both loved our meals and the service was excellent.  Breeannda was friendly and took great care of us.  We are visiting from California, but we'll definitely make breakfast here a part of every Vegas experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise Mountain

3HTanlkhHEqmvLpdY-mLOw.text: The entire staff was super nice. Tamara was our server. She constantly Chechen in on us and was patient with is considering we took a little longer than usual to order since it was our first time there. The food was fresh and it was clean. It was cooked quickly and perfectly. Even the turkey bacon wasn't dry, which is usually my issue with other breakfast restaurants. Definitely recommend and will come back.

uAowNVRMVkqE55JgBxwF6A.text: Pretty good, but not enough for more visits.  No matter how creative you are, eggs are still eggs.  We ordered all dishes recommended by the waitress.  Beautiful, delicious-looking but in the end... the impression doesn't last.  We party of 5 (who eat out quite a lot) all agree that we won't come back.   Excellent service.

wcAFsrt8xl4LzO7Htw4oMA.text: Hearty breakfast where locals go. It's got a country-side vibe. Relatively cheap and large portions. Service was really quick, in and out in 30 mins. Great place to go if you're in Vegas and on a budget or if you don't wanna wait 1.5 hours for a trendy brunch place.  Recommend: omelettes are okay, get a skillet. Crappy OJ is $3.25!

HjgcMNrA99SmixvWrzaXQg.text: The Carnivore is in lovely Las Vegas again, to celebrate the anniversary of his nuptials to Mrs. Carnivore.  Breakfast number one was to be hosted by The Egg and I.  The carnivore loves this place for breakfast!!!  The Carnivore had eggs, bacon, hash browns, and pancakes.  This is his preferred restaurant breakfast.  There were no weak points.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, the maple cured bacon was bacony delicious, of course.  Hash browns were in patty form, but tasted lovely, and the pancakes were of the sort that I just plain love.    This is honest food, cooked presumably with grease and butter, and is just plain good.    The menus look like they are styled a bit after a newspaper, which is new and lovely.  This establishment has something The carnivore has never seen before.  Each table has a device on it that shows an egg with a happy face, or an egg with a sad face.  One is yellow, the other is black, and this means that your server can tell at a glance whether you need her for anything.  Every restaurant should employ a similar device.    Amanda was our waitress.  Yes, the Carnivore still uses the words waitress and waiter.  He also will not apologize for this, or stop doing it.  In any case, Any case, Amanda was on point for our whole visit.  All questions were answered promptly, food came out superfast, drinks were topped off without any wait, and she had an infectious smile.  She either loves her job, or should move to Hollywood.  Mrs. Carnivore and I would be delighted to have her wait on is at any establishment.  This level of service is truly rare in today's world.

HMhtZ0zguj4c350l0DNBuQ.text: If you love breakfast, you will love this place! Closes early of course. Their dishes are great! Diner style. No pretense.

ru8j0PP3eMl1zghGOyD0yg.text: We had the very best breakfast experience ever here! Our waiter Oscar was patient (my husband never knows what to order!) and helped us decide on the perfect dishes. He was friendly and attentive and the rest of the staff was amazing too. Our meals were exceptional (Country Benny and the Huevos Rancheros). We will make sure to come here EVERY time we come to Vegas

FKvNVbWQuiIpu9QGqTCWxA.text: Almost without exception when I'm traveling I will use yelp to guide me to the best restaurants. You would think this restaurant with over 2300 reviews would be a slamdunk, but unfortunately it wasn't. My girlfriend and I drove off the strip several miles to a very unimpressive strip mall, waited in line for 20 minutes only to be thoroughly disappointed. I had the spinach eggs Benedict which was very bland (hollandaise sauce was mediocre), and my girlfriend had the works omelette. Both came with Diablo potatoes which are nothing more than fried, cubed potatoes with some seasoning salt on them. The coffee was good and the banana nut muffin was excellent. Everything else I give two stars for in setting my expectations so high and delivering so little.

l1Vc72yEQN6b3BOP4UlFRw.text: This is as good as it gets! I ordered the steak and eggs with a banana nut muffin. The muffin was excellent, made in the restaurant. The steak was properly prepared as were the eggs. The potatoes were well prepared and not greasy.   The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and clearly happy to be employed by this establishment. The waitress was patient and friendly outgoing and concerned about the service she provided us. The other patrons in the restaurant were professionals and a delight to be around.   The restaurant was clean. The service was great!  If you come to Las Vegas you should check this place out. I am going to return before I leave.

9-OJlcuQewu7bRZMlBE8mw.text: This place is so tasty and delicious. I got the bacon and advocacy omelette with the seasoned potatoes, a small stack of chocolate chip pancakes and a banana nut muffin.  The omelette was soft and had a dallop of sour cream which made it taste amazing. The pancakes were good as well, not too overbearing with the chocolate! Our server Liza, was super nice, and very attentive to us and recommend a choice of combos for us.  My group and I went twice because of how good it was. Everyone was very pleasant and I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas!

ZBS_Rd4KtmOudNiiZ863Ow.text: This is the perfect breakfast and brunch place! The service is great. They have this happy egg and sad egg system. If you turn the egg at you table sad in a second a waiter or waitress will come and make your egg happy. The omelettes are too die for and the coffee is great. The servings are huge and the potatoes are very tasty. I wish they had one of these back home. It was a great expierence.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend and I ate breakfast

MPWN4YvE7AOzsv0aetBMPA.text: Eggceptional! If you're visiting Vegas, get off the strip and try this one. I wasn't a huge fan of the prime rib Benny but not because of how it was prepared. Just isn't my taste. The country Benny was great, as was the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib Benny

qF2nQYjidg_Pt29HtBFj4Q.text: This has to be one of my favorite places to come for breakfast. Our server was Manuela she was fabulous and attentive! If we come back we want her again. Of course we couldnt leave without the muffin either!

gr6679uLnnwGUbmRiVGLWA.text: Great service. Busy restaurant. The food was pretty good. If they had more variety of hot sauce it would have been perfect!

a8EwYmc8o0hnpjdiT1N7qw.text: This place was "ok" the service was friendly enough. I had the French toast sandwich and a side of their special potatoes. The sandwich was very good. Good portion size. The potatoes were bad. Instead of like "country potatoes" which go better with bfast, these were more like French fries. They were super dry and just too crunchy for bfast. I guess it's a matter of preference but I didn't care for them at all. Had I been eating a burger tho, I probably would have liked them more.  I don't think I'll go out of my way to go back though.

FaOOIgmGdrLLBSNnfzwu7Q.text: So delicious! Eggs were creamy, cheesy, and delightful. Banana nut main doesn't look like much but it was pretty good! Plus, yelp gives us a free muffin. Service was fast and friendly. Nice family environment. Would go here again.

Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Kt-1_AaVqbiRvigmBJTeoA.text: We found this hidden gem before leaving Vegas. Saw it had a lot of stars so we thought we'd check it out. Our waitress Amanda was super nice. Be sure to check it out when ur Vegas. Definitely better than the generic places inside the hotels.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These potatoes are amazing!

lRJxlF441BDtIPkByGINNQ.text: The food and service here are amazing! Even though it looks like it may be a long wait--it isn't! The place is large and worth the wait anyway! Their muffins are fresh baked and their food is delicious! Also, I love their happy egg/sad egg to get the server's attention--genius! And did I mention wonderful service? Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-AXxh2648IH1EDC-tx0nUA.text: Just a regular breakfast spot. Nothing special or out of this world. The service was excellent though. That's y I gave it 3 stars

Gom0gAffa_PwEorSFPQzZQ.text: I'll make this quick and simple.  Me and my girl came here for breakfast during our visit to Vegas and being the type of people that check yelp for everything, we had to come try this place for ourselves. My opinion ? Amazing! We both had the skillet and it was perfectly balanced with seasoning mixed with all the meats, eggs, and potatoes.  It's probably other places that are good out in Vegas as well but this was awesome! Thank you to our waiter Reyna for making our visit enjoyable.

kpytpLaduZTjA2_iJD7ISw.text: VERY MISLED by Yelpers here. No accounting for taste....  We had the tuna melt, the Sundance Special, and the flavored coffee (partner's idea). The Sundance Special, a veggie omelet with thought behind it, was actually pretty yummy (artichoke, feta, spinach...great flavors), but the potatoes that come with were pretty yucky. Just cubed potatoes that are overly seasoned and taste previously frozen, not that fresh.  The tuna melt was the WORST I'VE HAD IN MY LIFE. SOOOOO BAD! The "cheese" looked like a non-melting version of Velveeta. I'm not sure it was real. I had to scrape it off; it was disgusting. Also the tuna salad part was the worst tuna salad ever. It was a mushy, wet, flavorless glob of mayonnaise mess. The Parmesan bread it comes on is super-salty. The matchstick fries it comes with don't taste that fresh and are overly spiced.  I picked the sandwich to pieces, and most pieces remained on my plate. I ate my partner's Sundance Special, because Vegas portion sizes allow for that. The server didn't even bother to ask how our food was, just slapped the check down and didn't comment that I had barely touched my plate.  The flavored coffee (hazelnut) is really gross. Bad idea to order it, but it tastes like the bad idea it is--overly sweet with its sweetness covering up that burnt taste that most diner coffee has.  This is the kind of place that automatically brings straws with water and gives you styrofoam for your leftovers.

roYgP52IpmSL0EJH6iJB5Q.text: Our server Tamara gets 5 stars but the potatoes that came on the side of my veggie Benny were salty so 4 stars for that. Tamara was attentive and very sweet. I substituted the English muffin with croissant and it was good! It costs extra but that's fine. Our wait was about 15 min, not too bad on a Sunday morning. The eggs on the dish were poached perfectly and the hollandaise was delicious!

QC0V8wk0sbprU5_7vW0X5w.text: Came here at 11am to see a lot of people waiting outside, however the wait wasn't that bad as it was only like 25 minutes. The chicken enchilada omelet was good. Our server Karla was very attentive and super friendly. She needs to win the Disneyland contest that the restaurant is having for their employees because Karla is amazing.

X38h4Aq0WwMYRhjN-tfdjA.text: As expected five stars. I'd heard of the Egg & I prior to this trip to Vegas and was anxiously awaiting a delicious breakfast. The food was superlative and the service...well what can I say? Packed house and we were offered immediate seating outdoors or wait. I chose to wait and my group was seated within 5 minutes. Totally unexpected. Karla was our server and she was friendly and attentive. She really made us feel at home! Karla didn't even blink when I asked for my free banana nut muffin with my Yelp check in. That banana nut muffin! You have to try it. Best I've had. As a side note, even the man who brought out our food (he had a family first tattoo on his arm) was really cheerful and made us feel welcome. The price ia unbelievable. Very affordable. I'm coming back tomorrow! Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s packed but we got our seat in 5 minutes

dN_ISt1eXe2OIK6Q6A6u8g.text: We were very impressed. A friend recommended it and the reviews were great. We weren't crazy about banana nut muffins but once we tried them, we understood: omg. So rich and moist. Our waiter was Perry and he was fantastic and accommodating to us and it being our first time. I had the Sundance omelette with artichoke and cheese. The potatoes were also amazing. We were all very pleased.

glbCqPBbte6Aahc7FYXEww.text: I love this place.  Today our server Alexa was excellent and super attentive.  I always have the same thing either the concoct chili omelette or the Chili Relleno omelette.  Both are awesome.

YkWOemijWbh-iytw5iI8ZA.text: I would just like to write a review about Amanda!!! She is seriously the best server I've ever had! She was so sweet and went above and beyond for my family even though it was brunch time and a little busy! Thank you Amanda for everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet of eggs potatoes sausage Ham and cheese

fJe-8wN2A1_iQsHyeLUbtA.text: We always come here and recommend all of our friends even when we are not in town. Our server BREEANDA was very attentive and helpful. Thanks for your great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg & I - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My daughter made Breeanda a custom my little pony called Sunny side up :)

9exZcqhQnUeaIb3n0ZJD7Q.text: Kat was a doll and the food was incredible. Must try! I recommend trying the stuff French toast with strawberry and cream. Delicious!!!!

_ql_lVQZ9bmYQudrHX096A.text: I love, love, love the Egg & I. I could live on the Works Ranch Potatoes for the rest of my life.  Today I wanted a salad. I looked at the menu online and decided I was going to order the Twin Salad. When we got to the Egg & I, the salad was not on the menu. I told our waitress, Karla, that I saw the Twin Salad on the internet but not on the menu. She said it was still available and that it is one of her favorites. Thank goodness I asked! The tuna salad never disappoints and the chicken salad was terrific too. Karla made sure there were no sprouts on my salad and was super attentive. I accidentally left my banana muffin on the table and she called me back. If I could give Karla more than 5 stars, I would. I will always ask for her.

VHyHy4LC_2APc69Tf4Fo6g.text: The BF and I were looking for a good place to get breakfast/lunch in Vegas before the drive back home. This place is off strip, but was pretty awesome! Great food, and probably the best service in Vegas. Our waitress was very friendly. I love how they have a little stand with a happy egg on one side and a sad egg on the other. Flip to the sad egg if you need anything from the wait staff, and they'll be at your table in a jiffy!

UciiQvHkOhb2-XPiOHnU5A.text: I would definitely come back here the next time I am in Vegas! The breakfast was great and our server Amanda was just as great! Nothing better then good food and service.  I am not a big muffin person but the banana nut muffin is a must try!

vhlrF04YI3aJz8_nsQ5Otg.text: Everything about this place is perfect! Mashed potatoe omelet is lit! Seriously if you come to Vegas you have to try it. The muffin is also essential to life. Please do yourself a favor and come here! egg&i for president!

1iMDXNFb3o7bPZN5EZ2hsA.text: Love the food here. Great service. Our waiter was Karla. She was sweet, friendly and helpful. Every time I'm in Vegas this is the best place to stop for breakfast. Hangover or not u need to try this place out! U will have an awesome time!

5qMA79cS_2gRXfD3eLj8mA.text: Outstanding Chili relleno omelette!!  The potatoes were perfect!!  Thanks, Jennifer, for being so efficient!!

AnD9HMB8hnTcBRCCEat3VA.text: I loVe this place! My go to breakfast is an eggwhite omelet with veggies of sorts. I ordered one with spinach, mushroom&avocado...it was divine! I think they put at least 1 entire fresh avacado or more inside of it. Im talking stuffed fat with fresh slices of avocado. If you have a love for avocado, you will love this  egg dish. Their banana nut muffins are scrumptious & worth the carbohydrates, fresh, warm& so flavorful. This breakfast was so good, I could seriously enjoy eating here a few times per week.

0hR0V1PcKhHsuvBOnYVyew.text: Food was great split a skillet and stuffed French toast with my wife. Carole Anne provided great service. This will be a spot to always come back to when in Vegas.

675kWuRs68793BXp3-kwtA.text: Most amazing breakfast restaurant. My boyfriend and I are in Vegas for a much needed vacation and this restaurant was awesome. We love going to local hole-in-the-wall breakfast places when traveling and this was the best we have ever had. This was due in no small part to the service. Roman is an excellent waiter who can anticipate guests needs. Awesome food did not hurt either! The potatoes are incredible! Looking forward to trying the banana nut muffins.

FFPXww9VJFE8Hz3MnOcoxA.text: Our server Maggie was awesome as so was the food. This is one of our favorite places to eat.

MnxDvhwatOV1Vp9ApnAPmw.text: We had breakfast there several days ago.  Excellent food and service!  Their banana nut muffins are also wonderful.  Our server Juan was terrific!  Although, he had only been there a week (?) he was very friendly, helpful, and pleasant, all the qualities you would like when trying someplace new!  We visit 3 times a year, and will make the Egg & I, one of our standard stops.  Nice to see a place with no slot machines!

Ss-uSSDMc1qqqeE3nGO3uQ.text: Great breakfast and service. Very friendly staff, especially our waitress, Liza. We'll be back!

NmIXE_GFhn6N7mrwBbugfA.text: A great place to bring the family for breakfast. They gave great servings for my plate, I got the waffle works with extra banana and it has a big piece of ham, great amount of eggs and a enormous waffle topped with whipped cream and bananas.

EdM2v0j4ynzS8BnFl9slqQ.text: Great little gem in Vegas! Whenever I'm in town I always make a stop here for a quality breakfast. This time, our server Karla, was great. She brought our drinks and food out quickly. She didn't was attentive and did not rush us. My boyfriend left his sunglasses at the table and when we went up to pay she brought them right up to him. This place is a must when your in town or looking for great food with a decent price.

Z8PDFTR-9jQL2NV2qw7gtA.text: I really love breakfast/ brunch places! I like the seasoning on the potatoes and fries! Sometimes it is nice to eat at a place that is off the strip

K02yc5_RZNxULt5VqAzUGw.text: Searching for a breakfast joint, we took these reviews to heart and checked out Egg & I.  We were ANYthing but disappointed.  The coffee/toast/butter aroma wafting throughout the restaurant was inviting in itself.  Our terrific server, Lindsey, volunteered I could have a 1/2 order of anything, as I was not up to 4 eggs.  I chose the chili rellenos omelette - PERFECT - and a 1/2 order was more than I could handle!  My husband had the bandit scramble - DELICIOUS.  Loved that a carafe of coffee was left on my table, so I could serve myself when I wanted more.  Loved that the cost was less than a hotel buffet -- and I didn't have to serve myself!  It is now our FAVE.

cU7Dy-1UMWkQQkNVMDKDaQ.text: I normally like this place, but I was just a little disappointed with my last visit. I came here with Don, but I really wasn't very hungry, so I just ordered a cream cheese danish. Don ordered some sort of potato soup and a tuna salad sandwich. His meal was pretty good, especially the very hearty soup. However, my danish was very floppy and seemed kind of soggy. I could completely fold it taco style because it had no "crisp" to it at all (s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com...). I'd normally give this place 4 stars, but I have to dock off a star because of the danish. I would think a danish would be pretty simple. Everywhere I go, they're all the same, but Egg & I managed to make a pretty bad one.

NggS-Lkzzmio-LGun7jiUg.text: Stacie is the best.  Great service, amazing muffins!  Tons of muffins, great for the trip home.  The pricing is beyond fair especially for the portions.  Killer eggs Benedict!

bYZCPJwIz0X97p4jUWfFgA.text: Great service and the food was amazing!!! Portion sizes big enough to share between two people.

nHe6m4c4p-tRP3NPn1uDIQ.text: I love this place. We come every time we visit Vegas. The muffins are yummy, the coffee free flowing and the staff is nice. Alexa was great.
